Obviously, they appeal to the corporate clientele on an expense account. If you do go to El Conquistador, eat your meals in Fajardo - El Estacion was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pinetamare
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights over February school vacation. We brought our two teenage sons ages 17 and 13. We rented a car and drove from the airport which took about an hour. We have visited Puerto Rico before and stayed at the Rio Mar. I liked this resort better, it felt more friendly and the location was fantastic. The resort has the most beautiful views, it is sited on a large cliff with multiple buildings layered down the hill. We stayed at the bottom at the Marina location in a unit which was right on the water with views of Palomino Island which is where you ferry to the beach. The lobby is on the top of the hill/cliff where most of the restaurants, shops and entertainment venues are. The ferry to the beach at Palomino Island is right at the Marina location which is where we stayed. If you stay in the upper level buildings you have to take the funicular (tram) down to get to the ferry. It could take up to 20 minutes if there are people waiting in line. We really liked the location because we could jump right on the ferry (which leaves every 1/2 hr or so) to get to the beach. Also, the water park is right at the Marina. Our boys loved the water park and spent a lot of time on the slides there. You have to pay extra for the park but it provided major entertainment. We ate at the Marina restaurant several times and it was a decent place to get a burger or salad. We bought breakfast food and snacks at the nearby grocery to keep in our room because we didn't want to take the time to sit at breakfast nor pay the high prices. We also purchased wine so we could have a drink in the room. We snorkeled off the other side of Palomino Island using the boat company that picks up right at the Marina. I didn't think it was worth the $60 because the snorkeling off the beach at Palomino was better. I have read on this site that some people feel the property is in need of repairs. Really, the only thing that I noticed was a few cracks in the concrete and other than that I didn't see anything else. The rooms were comfortable and clean. They felt like a room at an island resort, not antiseptic and perfect like a high end NYC hotel. I loved the room, it was spacious and has a small fridge, coffee maker and a nice large bathroom. People also wrote that the trek back and forth from lobby to marina was a hassle. I could see that if you were staying on the upper levels and were excited about getting to the beach and had to wait for the elevator, tram etc. it could get annoying especially if you had little kids with you. If you want to avoid that, stay on the Marina and you will only have to wait for the tram etc.. when you are going up to the lobby. There is a small coffee shop/restaurant at the Marina so you don't have to go to the lobby to get food or drink. Just a side note, we noticed a lot of small kids (under 10) and not that many teens. At any rate, there was lots to do to keep teens busy and entertained between trips up to the lobby, water park, beach and off site trips. We didn't see everything in the four nights we stayed. Take a chance on this place regardless of the negative reviews. It is really a beautiful place and has a very friendly vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing-Not What I Had Hoped”
Reviews.Author: toddindc
Reviews.Content: When I booked this, I booked it because it was a "Waldorf Astoria Resort". It was more like a "Sandals" or "Beaches" resort. If this is what you are looking for, then this may not be a disappointment like it was for me. When someone says "Waldorf Astoria", I suppose I have a different mental picture that wasn't lived up too. Property is definitely in a state of decline. Could use a good over haul. Staff isn't very friendly. Food is expensive. Out of the way if you want to explore anything. Private island, in concept, is a good idea, but not something you just wander out and take part of. Constant stream of conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Huge property!!”
Reviews.Author: gmjj5
Reviews.Content: Husband had business trip here so all expenses paid! That being said, we enjoyed our stay and felt the hotel was fine. 5 star?? Maybe not, but clean and comfortable all the same. We stayed in the marina area which is at the bottom of the cliff. Yes, we had to ride the funicular every time we had to go to dinner functions, etc, but the walk was always a nice chance to see the amazing views around the property. Our room was very spacious including the bathroom. Did not like the fact that we had to boat out to the island, but it wasn't that bad. Beach could use a cleaning, but was told that Disney may be buying the island? Not sure if true, but I'm sure they would make some big improvements! Must say that everyone we encountered i.e. bellboys, maids, etc were all very nice and helpful! Would we return if we were paying? Probably not as we prefer all inclusive resorts with easy beach access!! However, Peurto Rico is a beautiful country and the rain forest is a must see! Be aware that the resort is about an hour from the San Juan airport. Security line going out was long so make sure you arrive well before your flight!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sabes74
Reviews.Content: This resort is NOT a 5 star nor a 3 star in my opinion. And can not believe Hiltons name is on it! As diamond members we have stayed in several wonderful Hilton hotels. I was very excited about this trip and looks so pretty. Yes the views are great but come at a price. And the beach is private and very nice however is a 8 min ride there and the ferry only goes till 330 pm over and a 5 pm return. So there are no late walks on the beach and if you wanted to run to the room for something forget it. Also the resort is very large and takes you a five min.walk And a fun ride on the funicular to either a pool or ferry depending on where your room is located. Which brings me to the next point. There are only 2 of these funiculars and one was not working for 2 days people waited in lines for 15 min or better. Not fun and when you are wanting to get the the ferry that leaves ever 30 min. Good luck! The room was old and had mildew on the walls and on vinyl head board. The views were beautiful but again at a price and not worth it! The concierge was awful to say the least. Not at all helpful. And when we had her book our spa day she totally screwed it up. The one thing we had her do and she couldn't even get that right after telling her twice. We finally used our iPad on the deck because you can not get Internet in your room, to book other things. The restraints and bars were all horrible no one can make a drink right or consistent. And when we complained we we told there is nothing they can do because the restraints bars etc. Were rented spaces and that they are not linked to the Hilton hotel. To me Hilton should hold a standard that all must meet to "rent" a space. This hotel is far from anything and are stuck eating there. Prices a resort prices and would gladly pay IF it was resort standards. Did visit the spa and salon to get pedis and massages. The pedis were not that great and cost 3xs I could have paid at the mall for a much better one. The people at the spa were not that welcoming and felt rushed. Again not what you want on vacation and paying a lot for these services. The breakfast was pretty good and had a wide selection however, this was complimentary due to having a diamond status. Otherwise it was $25 a pice. And not worth it in my opinion. Overall I was not happy with this hotel and will be writing the Hilton hotels as well. Very expensive and not worth it. Go stay at the sister hotel in San Juan el San jaun I think... The Casino pit boss told us to go there and check it out so we did ($100 cab ride there and $100 back) but wish we had been able to stay seemed to be a friendlier staff and better location.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - just ok”
Reviews.Author: ChefMairaIsabel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the el Conquistador many times and its a shame every time it gets worse. Its hard for me to say (as we are from Puerto Rico and even live in the Island ourselves) this but its the unfortunate truth. This time, the room was not cold at all. We figured it will get colder through the night, but it never did. Second night we called and the hotel sent someone to fix it in less than 5 minutes (great and very impressive!!!!) but still it was just better. Also I have a baby girl with a stroller, wouldn't be nice for the front office person to give us the option of a room where we could get to using an elevator??? Well after 30 minutes which took to find the room, when we finally get there it was on a second floor where only stairs were the way to get to. We were so frustrated, tired and dying to finally get to the room, that we didn't even complained. Im sure they could have switched us to another room but it was a long way to go back to the hotel lobby (we were given a room in the marina where you have to take a train to get to). Also, all the bars close early (at the most by 10:00pm) which is quite crazy. There should be somewhere to go (other than the Casino) to get a drink. Again, I don't like to complain about anything but the hotel is really loosing it. On the good side, the Coqui Water Park was great! My baby (6 month old) had a blast and I could see how much fun they had. So it is what it is... Really hope they get their act back together. Its a huge place with amazing views and I really hope they go back to being what they were

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stone46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge. Great view. The room was confrontable. But we were disappointed About the restaurants. Visit Passion por Fogon, probably one of the best rest of Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Such a relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Abigail S
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip here, friends had recommended it. We arrived late at night and I was turned off at first because I couldn't really see what was actually surrounding me. The grounds of the property are absolutely beautiful and since it's built into the side of the mountain, the views are amazing. When I first was told that you had to take a boat over to the resort's own private island to go to the beach, I was a little turned off, but actually it turned out to be one of my favorite aspects of this resort. It was so relaxing hopping on the boat for the short (8-10 minutes) ride over to the beautiful private beach the resort has. I also loved the fact that each section of the hotel has their own pool, for crowding reasons this was nice. There was never too many people at my own pool and the pool was just a short walk from my hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TripWillow
Reviews.Content: In fairness to those who stay at Waldorfs and the like regularly, I am a relative newbie to the "Lux" scene. With that in mind...when I walked into this hotel at sunset it actually took my breath away for a second. The hotel is perched on a hillside overlooking the Caribbean sea and it is, well, breathtaking. The hotel was supposedly booked while we were there, yet it felt half-empty. The grounds are so expansive with so many different pools and gardens and balconies and dining options that we had tons of privacy including several hot tub dips just the two of us. The food at La Piccola Fontana was excellent. The other food was overpriced and left a bit to be desired, but I am a foodie and pretty tough to please in these matters (lived in the East and then West Village...very spoiled). The room service, however was excellent. We were in a corner room with a large balcony at the pier right on the water, and whenever we requested anything (toothpaste, razor, water bottles, etc.), it arrived within 3-5 minutes. The two potential drawbacks of this resort: The tram and the boat. So, the Tram was definitely a detractor given that we were staying down by the water and had to make it up to the main resort for the complimentary breakfast every day. If not for that, we would have just eaten at the coffee shop or restaurant at the pier for breakfast and the tram would have been less annoying. But it really was a 12 minute endeavor to get from our room to the front desk. The boat, on the other hand, we loved. We felt so relaxed on the Palomino Island beach (which was also expansive and not the least bit crowded). There was something nice about knowing we were committed to relaxing there and wouldn't be heading up to the room to make work calls/check email/get that extra wrap, etc. We took kayaks out for a small fee to another little island and there were only about 5 people on the whole island. It was a romantic and special beach day. I also got a Swedish massage at the spa--one of the best Massages I've ever had. My quads were pretty tight going in and she loosened everything up. The gym is worth the twenty bucks (we got it free for being Diamond Rewards, but it would be worth it). There are private jacuzzis and a tea room and it is very serene. The gym is weak, none of the latest cardio equiptment, adequate weights and cables. The grounds and the beach and the service are really the sellers here. Just walking around the property made us so happy, and they helped us arrange our visit to the Rainforest and with everything else we needed. Being on such a high cliff over the ocean all alone (and you really can be all alone at this resort) was just what the doctor ordered. On a whole, this was a fantastic experience, and I highly recommend it. We also stayed at the W Viequez which was wholly different, and I will write a review of that as well.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best spots in PR!”
Reviews.Author: axenrodr
Reviews.Content: Let me begin this review by way of my background of PR. Iâ€™ve been vacationing in PR for over 25 years (as a kid with my family and now as a parent with my wife and kids) and have stayed (at one time or another) at every one of PRâ€™s luxury resorts across the island, as well as neighboring Vieques. Weâ€™ve stayed at the El Conquistador several times before, but it seems to get better with each stay. First, letâ€™s focus on the groundsâ€¦ They donâ€™t get much more unique! Most of the PR (or for that matter, Caribbean) resorts are built around a golf course. The El Con has a spectacular golf course, but thatâ€™s not the thing that sets it apart. The hotel is built into the side of a cliff overlooking the sea, so views from just about anywhere in the hotel are spectacular (nothing but blue water for as far as you can see). The hotel itself is big and spread out, which generally Iâ€™m not a fan of. But in the case of the El Con, I didnâ€™t get the usual convention center feel. I attribute this to two main factors â€“ the room (or area of the hotel we stayed in) and the staff. On the room or area, we stayed in the Marina area, with an incredible ocean front room. The view was spectacular and we literally found all that we needed down at the Marina â€“ breakfast for the kids, evening cocktails before dinner. The room itself was incredible. Large, modern, clean, good sized bathroom with closet/dressing area inside, great water pressure in the shower, and an enormous patio area. Oh, almost forgot, and a bed and pillows as comfortable as homeâ€¦ The room was steps from the Ferry to the beach (El Con has a private beach that is accessed by 10 min boat ride from the Marina) and the Water Park (which my kids are in love with). The couple of things that you are lacking down at the Marina is nightlife (other than one outdoor bar and Sting Rayâ€™s restaurant) and regular pool. We preferred the water park pool, which is great for adults too, but if thatâ€™s not your thing, you need to go up to the main hotel pool up top, which we did one day. The second thing that in my opinion sets the El Con apart is the staff. Itâ€™s easy for a hotel of this size (capable of hosting conventions of 1000+ attendees), with the amount of staff that they have to train and maintain, to feel a bit impersonal, but we did not find that to be the case at all. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with a warm welcome by Areliz at the Front Desk. As an aside, Areliz was also the person that checked us out at the end of our stay, and without me saying a word when I walked up to the front desk, she recalled the rooms we were staying in and greeted me by name. Mind you, I had not seen her since we checked in 4 days earlier â€“ just one anecdotal example of the personalized feel of the service. Other members of staff that I want to recognize are Jose Gonzalez, the bellman that helped with our luggage and made sure our car was always cooled and ready when we needed; Lisandra and Alexandra checking us in each day at the water park; the housekeeping staff, the room service staff, beach staff, the ferry staff, the bartender at Ballyhoo Bar and the Matreâ€™d at Sting Rayâ€™s. All in my opinion went above and beyond to make our stay incredible. But above all, I want to recognize Mr. Melendez the hotel assistant manager, whom I had opportunity to meet during my stay. I am a firm believer that in all organizations, but particularly a service focused, hospitality organization, the tone of the staff and the service that they provide is set by the management, and in my humble opinion he is the source of this incredible guest focused service. My family and I are big fans of the El Conquistador and will be back again within the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jm_castr021
Reviews.Content: Check in: I arrived early around 1PM and my room was not ready since check in was at 4PM; Front desk agent took my phone number and assured me she will call. We explored around and head to the pool; came back at 5PM; still not ready. We decided to head back to the pools and relax. Around 5:30PM we really needed to get ready for dinner so we head back to the desk. Room was ready they just didn't call even though there was no one waiting at the front desk and more than 3 agents. After check in our room view was amazing so I forgot about the wait. We were located at the main building; you can not beat this location same floor as the main pool so no stairs no elevators needed. Also not that close to the "funicular"; still you can hear it at night. (nothing to worry) Rooms - T.V. is a joke in this hotel... you have a huge room and a small T.V. I can say was no more than 22"; After the casino, the pools you want to relax and watch some T.V.; I used my Ipad since the T.V. was really small. (my only complaint about the room) Housekeeping did a great job; extra towels, extra amenities, fridge in room, coffee all the amenities you expect from a Waldorf. I must recognize Juanita from housekeeping since I had a small problem with the bathtub and the bathroom door. She immediately called engineering and when I came back everything was fixed. When I saw her in the hallway she mention to me was fixed already. I was really impressed since she took that extra second to showed me she really cared. Palomino Island was amazing. You must be ready to spent some money in the island since you are going to be hungry and thirsty. Water sports, beach sports, horseback riding... so many things to do and so little time... Water park - is perfect for all ages! However, if you are traveling with small kids go after 1:30PM & if you are traveling without go after 4PM; even though park close at 5:30PM 1 hour for adults jumping around is plenty of time. My two children had a blast including me! Pools - So many to choose from; I love Olas second level... private and secluded if traveling without children! Wi-Fi - "free", worked fine; part of the resort tariff tax... almost all hotels in Puerto Rico charged it! Breakfast - Noel from Brisas did an amazing job! We had the buffet the first morning, then we tried the restaurant in front of the casino...service was O.K. not compared to Brisas... Restaurants are expensive; however you are in a resort!.... still I do not understand why people complaint about paying for food. If you want cheap food go outside the hotel so many great options. I worked for the hotel industry and El conquistador had a lot to offer... they have the beautiful grounds, the pools, the spa, the facilities... However, the only department I can recognize going the extra mile, that "wow" factor I was looking for is the Bellman Services... every time I walked by the lobby, hallways, funicular they were attentive a simple "good morning" can make a difference... a lot of the employees I encounter looked a the floor; kind of "do not asked me anything"; that really took me for surprise... Front desk needs a lot to improvement in this aspect; they are submerged in paperwork; they only looked at the computer, no eye contact and barely interacted with you and if you ask a few questions, a few of them looked angry or "non-approachable" at times. Check in and check out was kind of difficult... a lot of time (remember people big hotel a lot of rooms)... Recommendation for hotel management... send the copies of the check out folios under the door; have an express check out box somewhere around the lobby or desk... that will help you with the lines. I really did not needed to stop at the desk, but needed to check the charges before going home. If you are planning to leave the resort to explore around rent a car. Almost all hotels in Puerto Rico charge parking so be ready to paid and do not complaint about fee. I highly recommend this hotel. My family is already planning a trip back in July!

Reviews.Title: “My honest review of the El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: geezertb
Reviews.Content: I am not going to nit-pick the resort. The resort is very nice and clean. The service was very good. Overall the staff was very helpful and very friendly. The concierge was not outstanding. You can get more assistance if you use the internet. (the wifi works well) The landscaping is good, the building and grounds are due for a freshening. Other people may not notice that. I am sure the economy is hurting them as well. Still it is very nice. The view is outstanding. The food is good to very good, but expensive as expected. Having to use the funicular is a little inconveinent. When both are running, there is no problem. Several times during our 5 day stay, only one worked for a while but it still was not a huge problem. Our room was the mid level Las Olas section and was very clean and the veiw of the ocean and Palamino Island was nice. If you go to the beach/island every day, staying down there or at the marina would be a plus as you wouldn't have to wait for the funicular. Even though having to use the funicular is a small inconvience, staying up high gives you a breathtaking view you will not get by staying at ocean level. So I think it is a good compromise. The ferries that take you to Palamino Island seem to run often. The trip runs about 10 minutes each way. The resort is about an hour from San Juan airport by bus. Things to do: El Yunque rain forest. The travel desk at the resort hooked us up with Frank Torres, tour guy. Frank was very knowledgable and helpful. I will ask for him next time, too. Bio Luminescent tour. We used Bio Island electric boat. We don't kayak. We will return to the El Conquistador. This was our first trip to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “May not be a 5 star hotel but definitely a great time with the family.”
Reviews.Author: psylocke737
Reviews.Content: Stayed at El Conquistador Resort from March 7th to March 10th before we embarked on a cruise. Resort is about 1 hour from San Juan airport in Fajardo. Resort is on a beautiful piece of land, overlooking a cliff. We stayed in the Las Brisas wing of the hotel. Room was nice, definitely not a 5 star room, but large enough for our family of four with a large bathroom and walk in closet. The big selling point of this hotel is really the private island beach and the facilities. I was concerned based on the reviews of the funicular as well as whether the resort would be busy but did not have issues with either. The private island beach is beautiful, a short boat ride away with plenty of seats. The waterpark was okay, the price is fairly steep for the water park although they offer discounts for 1/2 day after 1:30pm and is $5 after 4pm (it closed at 5:30) The food was very pricey, we ate one night at the cafe ($20 for fried chicken?), the italian restaurant was pricey but the food was excellent, the chinese restaurant was terrible and pricey. Overall we were happy with the resort, the kids had a great time although we found the room rate quite high but will probably visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RussJ35
Reviews.Content: we spent the day at el conquistador and it was great. we really enjoyed the private beach that the hotel offers. the only downside for us is the hotel is too far from the airport. it's great place for kids and adults to relax and enjoy their vacation

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Tram and Average of Selection of Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LOIWY
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week at this resort. Stayed at Las Casitas at previous stayed and thanks god I have chosen this compared Las Casitas. It is cheaper and better services. Again this is business trip, I would not pay for it for my personal trip as too expensive and not a value for money. My only comments for this resort are; 1) the tram is super noisy if your room near to it. Do hope the management or the maintenance team can look into it. It is bad at middle of the night. 2) the choice of food for breakfast is very limited and bad if I would says for a resort rating. The hotel should have tapped on the Japanese and Chinese restaurant to offer some international choice of food in breakfast. Tap on the existing resources available from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Back again for second time!”
Reviews.Author: SmilesDb8
Reviews.Content: I just got back from vacation at this resort! Once again had a great time! Was there in October and again in march. Ironically I booked my hotel reservation on their website. The hotel found out and called me to ofer me a package I couldn't resist with discounts and free upgrade. Weather was amazing everyday. Hotel was at full occupancy but you would never know it-lots of conventions. I felt like I had the pool, spa and beach to myself. They take pride in you the guest from housekeeping to maintenance to the front desk and room service. The hotel is clean and the landscaping is beautiful. What more can I say. Looking forward to my next visit. If you go to the spa I have favorites for massages: claire and Elizabeth. Norma for scrubs and facials...

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Tananda
Reviews.Content: The resort is nice, don't get me wrong. However, I expected it to be greener and more lush. The tram is noisy, and even though I had a room that overlooked the water, the noise made it much less enjoyable, especially at night. For the price per night, I thought the hotel would have been quieter and nicer. I am glad this was a company paid trip.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving vacation”
Reviews.Author: LDB L
Reviews.Content: Having traveled all across the carribean , we had never been to Puerto Rico but wanted a quick turnkey holiday trip. What a nice surprise! The people were very very friendly, the service was excellent. We stayed in the Las Casitas villas which I would highly recommend, though they are a bit of a walk from the main hotel. We essentially had a private pool and made daily trips to Palomino island via the hotel ferry, make sure you kayak to the smaller sister island next door to palomino. Ivan runs the island and he, and his staff, did a great job with seeing we had everything we needed. The kids loved the water park as well . Make sure you do the night illumination kayak and the rainforest trip. It was a great trip for our family: 14/12/10 yr olds

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation fabulous”
Reviews.Content: Our family rent 2 rooms. We went with our son and our parents. This was the more amazine vacation ever. Palomino Island and all the amenities there, were enjoy for our family. But i need tp mention on rhe front desk, MARISOL BOSQUE, which without her help we dont know all the facilities , restaurants, and amenities inside the hotel and Fajardo. Definitly we recommed the Conquitador hotel. Again, thank to Marisol Bosque

Reviews.Title: “excelent vacation”
Reviews.Author: luis h
Reviews.Content: we went to the Conquistador hotel by march 3, 2012. Our schedule was to stay this day only. but, we found in the front desk, Marisol BOSQUE, which she explained all the facilities that we can enjoy. So we decided to stay in the Conquistador, THANK to her. We enjoy the Palomino, we enjoyed the hobie cat, which our daughter is a sailor. also rent a yet sky . we went to the fosforesent bay,Coqui waterpark, so our weekend was excelent!, . I highly recommed this Hotel this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Queenie B
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed! We have been to this hotel twice. The first time my husband and I had an incredible couples getaway. We loved it so much we returned with our three boys (19,14,12) and my mother. I can tell you the resort is one of the most beautiful resorts I have ever stayed at and very similar looking to the Ritz (which we stay often). However, it can be very pricey like the Ritz if you are taking a family:) Every morning we would take the 15 min ferry to Palimino Island and loved it! The spa and waterpark are fantastic! I highly recommend this hotel! You will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid La Piccola Fontana restaurant”
Reviews.Author: adartist
Reviews.Content: On March 9, 2012, four of us went to El Conquistador Restaurant for dinner at La Piccola Fontana Restaurant, the premier Italian restaurant in the hotel. The decor was very inviting and certainly we had hoped for food to match the ambiance. We were very disappointed. The chicken with capers arrived luke warm and the veal lasagna was cold and absolutely inedible. The osso buco was passable. We tried to eat the lasagna but gave up. We told the waiter and he said he never would have suggested that meal. Had we only known! They did not charge us for the lasagna but the dinner was ruined. The food is pricey for Italian food but we don't mind paying for quality. This was anything but.

Reviews.Title: “Not Nearly as Bad as Expected”
Reviews.Author: jenme
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of previous reviews, I was pretty dubious about this hotel. We were invited to go here, all expenses paid, by my husband's company. So I certainly wasn't going to turn up my nose at the opportunity. Had I been in charge of selecting hotels for a trip to Puerto Rico, I am fairly certain this would not have made the cut based on the reviews. But I was pleasantly surprised. The Good: - Our room looked out over the golf course/tennis courts and, further off in the distance, the ocean. We typically like ocean facing rooms but again, I wasn't in charge of the room selection for this trip. In any case, it was lovely. The view was gorgeous, the rooms were quiet and peaceful, the decor was perfectly comfortable and tasteful, the maid service was prompt and efficient...we never had to call for extra towels or to remind them to clean the room, etc. We were located near the main lobby and far from the elevators. No complaints at all. Falling asleep to the gentle chirping of the coqui frogs was sheer bliss. - Palomino Island was fantastic. I was concerned about this aspect of the hotel since I didn't like the idea of being stuck at a beach all day without the convenience of having the room nearby for rests and what not. If we'd traveled with our kids, likely this would not have been as great a situation. But since it was just my husband and I, we were totally cool with the whole set up. The ferry ride to and from the island was nice and relaxing, the island itself was great for folks who want to explore, swim, snorkel, or just chill on the beach. Someone here said the snorkeling wasn't that great...allow me to differ. You just need to know where and when to go (after 2:00pm on the less calm side of the island, snorkeling was great...go about 100 yards straight out towards the small island and turn left...follow the reefs with the deeper water to the right of you and you will see hundreds of fish, some conches, even a few turtles). The food at Iguanas was perfectly decent, drinks were just ok (pina coladas were basically coconut-pineapple slurpies with rum in them...ick), toilets were well-maintained, the little stores on the island supply all sorts of things from tampons to swim wear, and there were a lot of activities available. It wasn't crowded at all...very peaceful experience and relatively easy to find a spot whether you need shade of full sun. - Water park seemed perfect for kids. We only visited briefly but I liked that it wasn't packed and it was tastefully set up with ample activities for kids and adults. I know my three and five-year old would have had a blast. - Pool was lovely. We didn't spend much time there, preferring the island, but a few folks in our party did and said they had a great time. - Bioluminesence tour. Great experience...but be prepared for a lot of rowing IF you choose the kayak option. It's about three miles of rowing in the dark, there and back. Not appropriate for the very young or the very old. Kayaks seat two folks per boat. The bioluminesence part of the tour was, to me, the least exciting part of the entire trip. It was cool and interesting...but more exciting for me was rowing through the mangroves and the lovely view of the stars at night. Be sure to wear bug repellent or wear a long-sleeve shirt/rash guard, especially if you opt to do the 6:00pm/6:30pm tour. Also, be prepared to get wet. Yes, you are in a boat but you are low in the water and you will have a wet bottom and legs by the end of the trip. Also, allow me to suggest you only do the kayak trip with someone you are close to...I heard a lot of couples/twosomes arguing incessantly about when to row, where to row, how fast to row, etc. : ) - Wireless was always available in the room...no trouble there at all. The Not-So-Good - The food at El Conquistador was sub-par. The drinks were pretty good and most of the higher end restaurants had lovely decor/ambiance. But for the most part, the food just wasn't cutting it for us. And the cost of the food vs. the taste and the service just didn't match up. Having said this, some folks in our group were perfectly find with the food at Stingrays and the steak place, etc...but it just wasn't that exciting for us. Also, when I go on vacation, I like to eat local dishes and locally caught/grown food. I was a bit put off when we went to the Italian place (forgot the name) and I asked which of the fish selections were local and was told by the table captain "none." Here's the thing...I am not remotely interested in Maine lobster and salmon when I am in the Caribbean. Conch, Caribbean lobster, and local fish like snapper? Sure! But keep me away from any fish that had to get here via an airplane. Anyway, we had breakfast at Starbucks most mornings (oatmeal or breakfast sandwiches), lunch on the island (not bad), and dinner out (Pasion and Estacion were yummy...but very, very different styles). - The overall resort does need some updating. While our room was absolutely fine...the lobby and various parts of the hotel seemed dated and a bit run down. Granted, big properties have a tough time staying perfectly maintained, especially in tropical climates where the sun, wind, rain, and sea water can make even the fanciest place look worn after a few months. But I think this place really needs an update and better use of some of the indoor space (bring more light in, for starters, and maybe some live entertainment (guitar duo?) in the evenings). - In one part of the indoor area not far from the lobby, there is a section with three cages that house tropical birds including a rare blue macaw (the kids will immediately say "Rio!" when they see it). While the birds don't appear to be mistreated in any way, I felt more could be done with their cages, especially the macaw. I'm not a fan of keeping birds in confinement unless they are in a specialized zoo environment where they have expert care. And I felt these birds were not in the greatest place... - It's virtually impossible to go out for a stroll beyond the hotel grounds (no sidewalks, not very well lit in the evenings, lots of hilly terrain) and the taxis are NOT cheap. Also, non-family groups are charged per individual rather than per ride. At roughly $15 for a five to ten minute cab ride, one way, this can get very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: traveler10173
Reviews.Content: I loved it!! the grounds were gorgeous, the rooms were huge, and the food was good. I had an oceanview room, and the view was spectacular. I actually got a tear in my eye when I first saw the view. The bed was very comfortable, and it was so quiet. I didn't hear any noise from other rooms. The private island was awesome but the water was a little choppy on the way out there.. so beware if you get seasick. Luckily it's a pretty sort ride though. The only negative I can say is what some of the other reviewers have said.. the place needs a little TLC. It was very clean but just certain things need to be fixed like broken tiles or grout that looked like it needed to be replaced, or the faucet in the bathroom had a bit of rust on it. But overall I would still stay there again. And i'm a bit of a hotel snob.

Reviews.Title: “Aging Dowager”
Reviews.Author: Charlie P
Reviews.Content: Spectacular setting 30+ miles from San Juan. Expansive grounds, varied amenities (including private island beach reached by catamaran). Standout staff. Unusual combination of family-friendly with convention hotel. That's the good news. On the other hand, infrastructure in this 50-year-old property is showing its age and needs major rehabilitation--elevators, hot water, air handling, etc. Like many isolated resorts, food and drink--though varied--are over-priced and the white tablecloth restaurants (with minimal or no local fare) have a four-night run before the choices repeat themselves. Limited evening entertainment options (aside from in-room TV); some tweens and teens may find their interest waning after 48 hours. Overall, currently, worth considering; with required major investment in upgrades, would be a strong "recommend".

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: ScenicWanderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Conquistador from March 2nd thru the 7th. We were upgraded to a Ocean View King Suite due to my husband's Diamond status with Hilton. We had the most spectacular view of the ocean, the hotel's marina and Palomino Island. The staff was very courteous; there were numerous restaurants to choose from and they even had a casino for night time fun. The catamaran to Palomino was an extra treat and it left the hotel every hour on the hour. We loved this place and swear that within the next year, we shall return. I recommend renting a car to tour the Yunque Rainforest, catching the ferry in Fajardo to Cubelera Island and visiting beautiful Flamenco Beach (supposedly the 2nd most lovely beach in the world). A new grocery store in Fajardo (Ralph's) is equipped with an excellent and affordably priced wine selection which we enjoyed on the balcony at night. We had a great time and loved this gem in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: xrgator
Reviews.Content: A destination in itself. Very nice without being snooty. Restaurants within the resort are a bit pricey, but lots of food options close by. Nothing but positive comments for this place.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkbutterflyteacher
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous resort with breathtaking views! The massage in the spa was amazing. Enjoyed our stay here. Simply beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, funicular”
Reviews.Author: jjac2007
Reviews.Content: I was the plus-one for a friend's work conference at this hotel, so my experience may be more biased as a result. On the one hand, I may have been more enamored had I had to pay for this vacation. On the other hand, I went on this trip gratis and so feel a bit more objective as a result. Room: We stayed in one of the suites located at the bottom of the hotel property. While I think these rooms have some very pretty views, are in easy access to the ferry that will take you to the private island across from the hotel, and in range of some overpriced shops, I found them to be sort of inconvenient. The hotel does not have a beach on-site, so if one does not venture to the island, you will be spending most of your time at one of the pools and most every restaurant that is located above this section. Initially, no one cared-it's beautiful and sort of fun taking the funicular. But a couple of days in, and if you ever forgot something in the room, etc., it was sort of annoying to have to go up and down, wait for the funicular to arrive, etc. The room was pretty-very bright, very white, with colorful accents. The internet worked well, the bathroom was modern, and the A/C worked well. We also had a lovely little patio balcony off the room, which was nice because we sometimes left the doors open while we slept. Pools: It seemed like most visitors preferred the first pool, the one closest to the top of the property which had plenty of chairs, nice views as well, and great poolside drink and snack service. Private island: On a few days, we chose to go to the island and I was so glad that we did! If you have them, bring your snorkeling mask and fins, as there are some pretty fish to see (but this was not the best snorkeling I have ever had). There is a restaurant there that serves drinks and ok food, as well as a couple of shops. But what you really headed there to do is layout, and enjoy the sun and warm waters-so pretty. Note that there were a TON of sea urchin in the coral and so, in addition to fins, you may want to bring some snorkel/surf shoes. Food: We ate at the steakhouse which was very good; however, I wish this hotel offered something more authentic. Coming from Chicago, a great steak town, I have no real interest in eating steak when the local culture affords much more interesting and authentic options. So, after a few days of typical Hilton food, we took the advice of a local and walked along the hotel's outskirts to a small fishing village where we ate some delicious, Puerto Rican food. Had we found this area sooner, I would have asked my friend to head there more. Spa: In a word, luxurious. And that is what you should expect from the Golden Door. We both had an hour-long massage which provided us with day-long access to the hot tub, relaxation room, showers, etc. We definitely enjoyed this and tried to take advantage of it! All in all, we had a fun time and enjoyed this property. Had I not just attended my own conference a couple of months before in San Juan, I would have been sort of bummed about staying at this hotel, as it is far enough away from the city center to make it pretty inconvenient to head there. Puerto Rico is beautiful as are its cities and so I would recommend folks take the time to see more of the island. To not do so would make me question why you would bother to travel to Puerto Rico in the first place when you could just stay on the mainland, in another Hilton, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PrincetonMom13
Reviews.Content: Just returned from El Conquistador for a 3 night stay. I was a little nervous after reading the mixed reviews so I was really unsure of what to expect. My worries were unfounded-we had a great time at El Conquistador! (Full disclosure-this trip was with my husband's company so we were just responsible for our meals. I will try to be as honest as possible with my review given the fact that most people would have a great trip to just about anywhere if the majority of the expensives were covered) The property is breathtakingly beautiful! Expansive and lovely I felt like we were on a stationary cruise ship! Even breakfast at Las Brisas mimmicks a cruise ship with its curved windows looking out onto the Caribbean sea. Palomino Beach (the resort's private island) was absolutely gorgeous! Take the trek around the island for more privacy. Fun things for kids-(among the no additional cost options) life size chess board/pieces, soccer goals, basketball, corn hole, miniature golf. We stayed in the Los Olas section of the resort. Private QUIET pool in this section. A down side was that there isn't bar or food service at this pool. You always have the choice of heading up to the main pool if you're looking for swim up bar or food service. The peacefulness of this pool was worth the sacrifice of bar service to us. We bought alcohol at the deli and packed the ice bucket and brought it down to the pool. (did the same with water bottles to have in the room) With such a large (and I mean LARGE resort) something has to give and in my opinion it was probably the lack of updating, however, the rooms were CLEAN and I felt completely comfortable. I consider myself picky with accommodations and I slept like a rock, no worries of dirty linens or critters. We had a room air conditioning issue and it was resolved immediately. The maintenance department was at our door in 5 minutes flat! Food and beverages were EXPENSIVE but good. Example: Lunch of 2 paninis, 1 beer and 1 frozen mudslide drink $52 (before tip) Another lunch: 1 burger w/fries, 1 cuban sandwich, 2 beers 1 frozen drink $64 (before tip) Breakfast buffet at Las Brisas fantastic but again pricey: $24 per person (ours was included with our room-try that option if possible. We ate heartily at breakfast to try to stretch our food dollars) We didn't have a rental car so we couldn't venture off of the property to try local restaurants. Staff was fantastic! Front desk and Concierge couldn't have been more pleasant and accommodating! Unfortunately we had to utilize the services of the resort Doctor. Fantastic option of phone consult or visit from the Doctor at a very reasonable rate. The resort even offers service to the local CVS to pick up your prescription for you and deliver back to you at the resort. The only touch of rudeness I encountered was the staff at the Deli-convenience store off of the lobby. Guests seemed to be a bit of a nuisance to them, to the point of feeling like you were part of the Seinfeld episode where Elaine was convinced they were talking about her in another language. We would love to bring the kids back with us for the water park and to do more exploring but will look for ways to make the most of every dollar as it can be pricey. San Juan is about an hour away so if you have limited time and are without a car rental you might not fit everything in you'd like. Highly recommend El Conquistador!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking view!”
Reviews.Author: ParinShah
Reviews.Content: With its own Spa, Golf course (18-hole!), tennis courts, convention halls, Casino, private island (Palamino), pools (incl. a water park), multiple restaurant as well as its own Starbucks Cafe, and a host of various indoor and outdoor optional activities, one cannot have enough...no matter how long you stay! And oh, not to forget mention of the stunning view of the ocean that greets you all day long!!! The staff was pretty courteous and came forward to assist us. A little improvement on the choice of vegetarian food would have made it "the most unforgettable experience" for me, my wife and many of my veggie friends who had been there to attend our company's annual rewards ceremony! All-in-all a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation We've Ever Taken”
Reviews.Author: Phil W
Reviews.Content: My wife, my two daughters (ages 5 and 8) and I only had 4 days at the El Con, but wish we would have been able to stay longer. The views were breathtaking, the food and accomodations wonderful and the activities were unparalleled. We loved being able to eat at the Ballyhoo Bar & Grill one night on the water with the ocean breeze and then dress up to eat the Stingray Cafe the next. We enjoyed breakfast at Las Brisas - with an amazing view of the ocean over the cliffs below - and a quick dinner at Cafe Caribe. The little shops (surprisingly numerous) were great for collectibles, souveniers and anything else you might ever need while traveling. We also took a day (but needed more time) to visit El Yunque National Rainforest and Old San Juan which were both stunning. The driving between the airport and El Con can get a bit hairy at times (make sure you have GPS), and if you are a fan of Burger King, I think there are about 16 of them (not kidding) along the way. I had read some comments that the El Coqui Waterpark and Palomino Island were crowded, but we found them to be quiet with plenty of space to relax and play. Palomino Island had so much more to offer than we realized. We will definitely take advantage of the horseback riding on our next trip and will try to check out the other beach areas (but not the clothing optional ones :)). At the end of our stay, we asked our girls, who are big Disney fans, if they would rather go to Disney or come back to the El Con in Puerto Rico and they both jumped at the opportunity to return to Puerto Rico. My wife and I both agree.

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with caution.”
Reviews.Author: Nina A
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the way the front desk staff treated us, we enjoyed our stay here. The property is absolutely beautiful. The views are breathtaking, and the staff, with the exception of the front desk, is cheerful and accommodating. Palomino Island is great. If you go to this resort, expect a LOT of children. Breakfast at the restaurant sounds like a fourth grade cafeteria. The pool and beach is loud. It's not a huge deal, but it's important to know before you go. There were definitely problems. The front desk is pretty clueless and there's lack of communication between the front desk and other departments. One night when looking for a late night dinner, we were sent to closed restaurants, then given a room service menu that was apparently "outdated" so we couldn't order anything on it. We'd put the "do not disturb" sign on the door only to have the maid service our room when we were trying to shower. Upon arrival the phone in our room didn't work. Our curtains broke. The kicker came on the last day of our stay. It was the morning we were checking out, and our shower stopped working. As in, there was no water coming out of the faucet. We had a plane to catch and didn't have a lot of time. The front desk seemed pretty unconcerned about our problem. After waiting 30 minutes we were told we could shower at the spa (which was across the hotel) if we wanted to. Thanks a lot. By then, we had to go. Keep in mind that the Hotel Manager (who we spotted in the back) didn't make an appearance once during this ordeal. Disgusted, we went back to our room to finish packing. I tried the shower to see if maybe it was now working. It was! But it was spitting out brown water. I uploaded a picture of it. We left immediately. Also - expect a $50 resort fee and around $46 to be added to your nightly rate on your final bill.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Wow! Wow!”
Reviews.Author: z2u
Reviews.Content: I can't express how many times I said "Wow!!!" The views were just unbelievable! The ocean is dark, light, blue, green and dotted with sailboats and small islands in the distance. Our room was in the Las Olas bldg, which doesn't have an elevator, and was on the 3rd floor. The bldg felt like a Days Inn--run down and cheap. The rooms have been redone and the decor is beach modern with platform beds. The bathroom was renovated, but they left the old tub!!! There are 2 funiculars, but only 1 goes to the Olas bldg. After one night we switched to Brisas, because I woke up feeling horrible--I think there's mold or mildew there. The Brisas bldg was so much better. Felt cleaner, no mold and much better location. The view from the room is indescribable and the room was very bright and sunny. This bldg is right next to the main lobby, has an elevator and is just a short walk to the main pool. Same decor in the room as Olas--very pretty, but they left the old tubs here too. To get to the island, we took the funicular down. The hotel was not full, and we never waited more than 10 minutes to get on. The ride up/down is easy--it's an outdoor elevator, mostly all glass and takes about two minutes. We were awe-struck every time at the experience and the view. Then we waited for a ferry that comes every 45 minutes. The marina area has a few stores and a coffee/snack shop, and is quiet, lovely, and a nice place to just read a book while waiting for the boat. Took a 15 minute boat ride to get to the island, and on a windy day it was bumpy and fun! On the island, there's a basketball court, volleyball court, wave runners, kayaks, snorkel equip. to rent and one restaurant with really good, fresh fish dishes, among others. There's also food/drink service to the beach. There are tons of chairs, but few palapas and a charge for umbrellas. Beautiful views of mountains and colorful towns in the distance, waves, bright green water, and a this-is-so-cool feeling--in a gilligan's island kind of way. Back at the hotel, there are several stores, restaurants, and a golden door spa. All employees were kind and helpful. Good service everywhere. We had a wonderful meal at the Italian restaurant, and the desserts at the pizza bar were over the top (cuatro leches). Some negatives: The main pool is not heated. First time I've been on a vacation and not gone in the pool--it was that cold. Chinese restaurant was the worst possible quality Chinese--worse than any take out we have at home. The breakfast buffet food is similar to Denny's. There's a Starbucks with better options. The tubs are original! Just couldn't believe they left those old, chipped tubs in! The lobby and main areas are in need of some work. It's a fabulous place, just could use some modernizing and upkeep. Most slots at the casino are penny slots and there are only a few game tables. The casino is very small. All in all, El Con is a unique and special place that everyone should visit at least once. Maybe the bldgs are not 5 star, but the experience of vacationing there is. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ailen_PR
Reviews.Content: The Hotel are very good to stay with your family. Very good facilties and good services.

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador Hotel on a Cliff”
Reviews.Author: oibarra3
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic property with tons of acreage serving as golf courts, tennis courts, sweeping green lawns, and unbelievable views of the Caribbean. The main hotel has mostly oceanfront view rooms and there are private cabins right across a small boat ride to Palomino Island. Great getaway location wit spectacular food, art work all around the property, neat boutiques and nightlife casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Really not the best”
Reviews.Author: BeckyandMike
Reviews.Content: This place is grand and beautiful but we didn't have a great experience. My sister and her family stayed here several months ago and they loved it. Our experience was less positive: Even with a bellman's help, getting our luggage to our room was a really big deal. We had to walk through what seemed like an entire mall, past a casino and then board this tram thing that took us down the side of a cliff to our room. There were a bunch of other people waiting to get on the tram so it was just a pain. Our room was dark and on the musty side, right near the waterpark. We had dinner at Ballyhoo Bar and Grill and the service was REALLY bad. You shouldn't have to ask three times for a glass of water and then they brought our appetizer and entrees at the same time after we had waited 45 minutes. The food was average at best and extremely expensive. We were happy that we had brought Cheerios for breakfast -- it was lots cheaper and hassle-free. The pool was on the chilly side. Finally, this hotel is in a really strange location. You drive through a depressing residential area before coming upon it and it's not easy to find -- more street signs would definitely have come in handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great views”
Reviews.Author: Abbeyny
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic holiday vacation for families. The views are beautiful. There is so much to do. Unfortunately the food wasn't that great and very expensive. Otherwise very good.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Awesome Destination Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mitch C
Reviews.Content: We arrived early around 12am and we had a room ready when we got there which was great since we were traveling with 3 children. We were in the Marina which in my mind is the best location. It is a tiny walk to the ferry to go to the beach and right next to the water park. It is also very quiet and serene with a great view. As far as the restaurants go, we feel that all the premium dining spots were excellent. Strip House being our favorite. We took the carribean dining plan which was a great value. We have been to the El Con more than once and will be going back over Christmas Vacation 2012. We love this place and being out of the hustle and bustle of San Juan is what really attracted us there. A special mention must be given to Manny Melendez, he really went above and beyond to make my family comfortable. He was always around the property and remembered our names and always asked if we were ok. He is a very important part of the entire experience there and look forward to seeing him again over the Christmas break.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Waldorf - you can do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: TravellinTw0s0me
Reviews.Content: The main thing this hotel had going for it was the location. Situated up on a hill overlooking the ocean and across from Palomino Island, the hotel was near the bioluminescent bay in Fajardo, a quick drive to El Yunque and close to a few good restaurants. The hotel itself needs quite a bit of work. It opened in the 60s and seems like little has been done since. Upon checking in, we were told that we had been given adjoining rooms (we were 4 adults and had booked two rooms) and despite booking two King rooms, we were offered one King and one with two Queens - not what we wanted. So, after convincing the check-in agent that we didn't want what he gave us (he seemed like he couldn't understand why) and waiting several minutes, we were accommodated with rooms near each other, both Kings. Both rooms had nice ocean views, and although I am a Diamond member, we were offered no upgrade (one of three benefits supposedly available to Diamond members at this property). The rooms are what you expect in the Caribbean, but there was a big hairball thing on the floor of ours when we arrived, the refrigerator wasn't really very cold (and had no temperature adjustment on it) and the fan in the room above ours was so loud one night that it woke us from a sound sleep. We saw several more of these "hairballs" around the property as well. The service needs improvement across the board though. The breakfast buffet (included for Diamonds, thankfully - it was worth nowhere near the $24 per person they wanted for it) was average, but you had to ask for water constantly, despite the breakfast servers standing around (it was a buffet - drinks were really their only job) and frequently they wouldn't grab your plate if you went up for more. The bar upstairs across from the Italian restaurant was the same - even though there were was barely anyone there, a couple of pretty straightforward cocktails took 10 minutes to make. The Italian restaurant was a bright spot, though - we had a nice meal there on our first night. The ferry to Palomino Island was quick and prompt and the island itself was very nice. We snagged a few lounge chairs in the shade and enjoyed a relaxing afternoon there. One of my biggest beefs was with the parking. At a resort like this, I really don't expect to be nickel-and-dimed for something like parking, especially self parking. The lot was a little ways down a hill (which is fine) and was $15 a day to park there, I believe. Each time you entered you got a ticket which you then had to have validated before you left again. Something we just put on our dash for the duration of our stay would have been much easier. There was also a van lurking in the parking lot operated by a third party (Charlie) who wanted to shuttle you back up to the hotel, surely in exchange for a tip. He also shooed me out of a perfectly good parking spot one time, claiming I was blocking the route he took through the parking lot to scoop up unsuspecting people who might not have been able to walk back up the hill. This is really something the hotel should provide, or not at all. I would not stay here again, certainly not at the rate we paid, without some significant changes to the property. The entire place needs a coat of paint. The service needs to feel more like a Waldorf Astoria resort and less like a gang of people just trying to scoop up the tips on the overpriced and under-liquored drinks. The bottles of water in the room should be complimentary, not $3.50 per bottle. Also, beware that there is a "water park" onsite which caters to kids as well as a kids club. There were tons of them during our stay and while most were generally well-behaved, some certainly were not. If this isn't your thing, go elsewhere. I suspect that this is a popular point redemption for business travelers with their families.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Tips and Tricks On Your Trip”
Reviews.Author: MyaOl
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (8am), the hotel let us use their spa to refreshen up and leave our bags with the bell service.. This saved us on an extra night to pay for the hotel. Ate out of the hotel (hotel food was pricey), Ate at Metropol for Dinner, Casa Mia for lunch (Empanadas n such across for local beach) and Mezon for breakfast. All great prices and food. Went to Yunque for a day; when heading, in keep straight and up the hill, if you go through the tourist entrance its $4 per person for the same experience. Took the ferry into La Culebra, Flameco beach (a must do, rated top one of 10 beaches) $9 round trip for two, taxi to the beach about $5. Hotel charges 14% rate per night (beware). Also charges $15 a day to self park. Requested for a mini fridge (free), kept drinks and snacks there. Supermarket sells Liquor the cheapest in town. Overall, Hotel service was awesome, clean and a definite place we will return to.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo_Yoship
Reviews.Content: Great views and settings. Property is a quite large, be prepared as takes a little time if your room on the outer edges. Room & facilitites in general a little tired, needs some upgrading. Service generally good, food quality very good. Lots of activities for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: jasmine5454
Reviews.Content: Pro's: Beautiful views, surroundings Excellent Staff Safe Tons to do for kids; very kid-friendly Feels like a luxury vacation Palomino Island; an 8 minute ferry to a beautiful private island Rooms are great, beds very comfortable Many restaurants, shops on site Waterpark Close to many PR attractions like rainforest, etc. if you have car Con's: The extras are expensive! $20 per day to park car, and all food & activities are pricey! Plan to spend twice as much for these extras, but worth it if you want to stay on the resort and do everything there without ever having to leave. A lot of the day to day food is mediocre but great for kids who like chicken fingers and such! Although there are a few restaurants we did not try, to be fair. Since there's so many kids, don't expect it to be quiet in the a.m., by the pool or on the beach. (which on the other hand is perfect if you have kids!) Overall: I would definitely recommend El Conquistador to families, since it's heaven for kids/teens and adults can enjoy the luxury at the same time. (SPA, etc.) The staff were all so nice. I would try to get as many extras with your package as possible, such as brunch included, or any other meals or activities, as they ADD UP very easily. For example If you're planning on spending $1500 to stay, plan on another $1500 for extras. That said, it's worth it so that you don't have to stress out and drag the kids around. We had a wonderful February vacation and my daughter was thrilled.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful winter break!”
Reviews.Author: pippam77
Reviews.Content: We returned for our second visit to El Conquistador over President's weekend. Once again we thoroughly enjoyed the first class accommodation and overall service. There is so much for kids to do that we wished we could have stayed for several days more. The view from our hotel room was spectacular and the room itself very clean, spacious and well appointed. My son is autistic and the hotel was extremely accommodating to his needs, which helped to make our whole family's experience so much easier. We love the boat ride over to the private island beach. It offers great views and for us is all part of the vacation experience. We found all of the hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful. We look forward to returning again next year for our third visit!

Reviews.Title: “Better Impossible!”
Reviews.Author: ChevinArgueta
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at El Conquistador Resort the first week of February and my time there could not have been better! From the moment we arrived we were greeted by Norman the bell service supervisor and from then on one of the best vacations of my life started. Coming from New York City my wife and I needed a nice relaxing vacation. Ana Jessica at the front desk gave us an amazing beach front room near the Marina with a balcony. The property is really beautiful, set on a cliff overlooking the Caribbean. It is definitely a 5 star resort from the restaurants to the amenities within the Hotel. Taking the boat to Palomino Island everyday and riding the funicular were exciting treats. But the best part was the service, that is what differentiates a good hotel from a great hotel. I will definitely return to El Conquistador and recommend it to anybody who is looking for a great vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: marchmich
Reviews.Content: Perfect family vacation if you have kids. We took our 2 yr old and 3 1/2 yr old to the El Conquistador and couldn't have chosen a better spot. Kids were always entertained between the water park, pools, & beach. The beach is great because you take a beautiful boat ride to get there which is an activity in itself for the kids, and once you are on the island, there is mini golf, soccer field, basketball courts, volleyball court, and lots of things to do. There is a big game room and movies shown at night which the kids loved. We used one of the hotel's babysitters a couple of nights and she was great. The kids really liked her and we had no issues. We felt very comfortable leaving the kids with her. We travelled with some other families so we all got a cabana by the pool during the day which was key for the little kids. We had our own private area they would run around, nap, play, etc. The resort's view and grounds are absolutely beautiful, however the rooms and resort need a little TLC. Food was expensive but very good. If you are not in the mood for a fancy meal, there are a few other casual options. Staff was always very friendly, however a little slow and forgetful. If you are used to upscale vacations, then this is the place go with kids. If you are looking for a couples or adults only trip, this is not the place for you (unless you want to be surrounded by other people's kids). I would definitely return again with my family for another GREAT vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: V8hunter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and the staff was very gracious. My wife and I enjoyed our honeymoon getting a massage, swimming in one of the many pools and gambling in the casino. The restaurants were fantastic and the views are unbelievable. We'll be back this fall.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great resort but rooms are subpar”
Reviews.Author: DjCocoNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed from January 12-19 had lots of confusion with room until I had the pleasure of dealing with the front desk manager Noel. He fixed in 1 hour what others could not fix in weeks. Once we got our room we were not happy with the mold in the bathroom but it was quickly taken care of they gave us the option of moving rooms or having them just take care of it, we chose to stay in the room because it was very close to the wedding we were attending and had the most beautiful view. The hotel staff was very helpful and kind though the resorts restaurants staff all seemed to be rood and unhappy. All and all we had wonderful time at the resort and water park. The property and pools are second to none. And the water park kept the kids happy all day, the private beach is the most beautiful beach I have ever seen in person or on tv. Price is costly especially if you are dinning on property. Would love to visit again. Oh did I mention the casino. Best vacation I have ever taken. Good time with family and friends!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views, All Amenities at East End PR Resort”
Reviews.Author: RH12571
Reviews.Content: WOndeful golf resort w/fantastic views and amenities for a large east end resort in PR. Away from the crowds in San Juan and dramatic views and property if you love lots of activities and golf. We were here for wk on business and it was fine. THis is not our type for vacation/resort. But it's a grand lovely resort. Staff were warm and helpful and room was spotless. We dont play golf and when we go to the Caribbean or islands,we prefer to be beachfront. We don't want to have to drive or take ferries or walk 5 minutes to a beach. This resort is NOT beachfront property. It is beautifullly laid out on a cliff. So everyone has great views. To get to their private beach,you have to take the 'lifts' all the way down to water level ( as most guests stay higher up and NOT on the marina level) to take a catamaran to "their private island/beach". ( 15 mins ride away from hotel) The beach is uninteresting and crowded with the guests as this is a small beach/island just for their guests. All the water toys are available as is the chairs etc. But the beach is mediocre and swimming with 25 people near me all with beach toys is not my idea of nice beach/vacation. But my husband and I may not be typical. We prefer beacvhes such as those on St Johns USVI, BVI, Eleuthera, Turks......remote low key truly PRIVATE EMPTY, BEACHES with great snorkeling. This "private beach/islnd " for El Conquistador " guests is small and limited and offers nothing except swmming a bit and bumping into others and then sitting on boring beach fille w/people next to you............NO SNORKELING here. Because we feel strongly about being on a beach when you are on an island ( Caribbean. Hawaii) vacation we would not return to this resort and we would not recommend this to anyone who prefers to be beachfront. This resort is great for golfers and those who just loves views of the sea from hotel room/terrace.

Reviews.Title: “A True Tast of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Paradise0912
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador is beautiful resort with enchanting views. I enjoyed almost everything from Palomino Island to Coqui Water Park. The only thing that was very disappointing is that the last ferry to Palomino Island departed at 3 PM. It's a shame that I was not able to spend more time there soaking up the sun. We took advantage of the daily complementary breakfast at the Las Brisas Restaurant, which saved us a few bucks through out the trip. Food is very pricey in the premises but delicious. We went to Blossoms, Chinese Restaurant, to our surprise the food and the service was just spectacular and worth every penny. Oh yes, before I forget to mention. Take the valet parking even though it costs an extra $5 per day because it's really worth it. El Con is huge and it involves a lot of walking so save yourself the trouble. Also, if you plan to zip line in PR just make sure you book in advance because the adventure tours start very early in the morning like about 7 AM. If you want to enjoy Puerto Rico, you must stay at El Con! El Con is a beauty in itself that allows you to have that serene vacation you always wanted!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Views”
Reviews.Author: TravelNow2012
Reviews.Content: The views are incredible! The staff was friendly and efficient. The food was pricey but delicious. We enjoyed relaxing on the beach and by the pool. There are a lot of maintenance issues to address. I will say however that we saw progress being made each day of our 6 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable if this is your thing”
Reviews.Author: jma24
Reviews.Content: I think this is a bit of a "marmite" hotel - you will love it or hate it. Good things: - Massive grounds, very safe for children, everything you need under one roof - Beautiful private island with its own ferry - Good restaurants and a disco, etc. - Great service culture and helpful staff - Cool stuff like a funicular railway to take you to your oceanside room - Great quality free wireless internet, comfy rooms, big bathrooms and TVs - Tons of amenities - anything you could want. From water sports, to water park, to golf, tennis, anything. Things to watch out for: - Hard to leave the resort, everything is a long way - 15 mins from reception to the room. - Everything is extra. Breakfast. Self-parking is $15 a day. Bottled water $3.50 for 500ml. Cayak $38 an hour. - Restaurants are expensive. Easily $45 for some main courses/entrees. So if you don't mind those things to watch out for, you will love it. We worked around a few of them by stopping at Econo supermarket and buying a ton of water and fruit, which suits us well for breakfast. Plus having a car so we could drive to San Juan a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieWaits09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Conquistador for a wedding in January. The grounds were gorgeous. Especially the private beach and pool areas. The restaurants were delicious but none authentically Puerto Rican, which was disappointing. But, the pizza place/restaurant by the pool had great, big salads. The only negatives worth mentioning are: 1) they really nickel and dime you for everything. Between the taxes, resort fees and gratuities the room charge got 30% higher; and 2) the drinks were WEAK and expensive. They measured what seemed to be watered down alcohol for each pour. Stick with beer, wine or straight liquor if you want to get any type of buzz and have any money to spend at the casino.

Reviews.Title: “A nickle and dime you to poverty establishment.”
Reviews.Author: jason s
Reviews.Content: Charge to park even as a guest. Charge for towels. Waterpark extra charge. The worst of all was the shops inside the Hotel. Tropical Footprints was the absolute worst. After buying two pairs of nice pricey sandals, I bought my wife some thing. The lady who checked me out said if she didn't like them just bring them back - No Problem. Guess what there was a huge problem. She didn't like the Items, and Tropical Footprints, with the direction of the owner over the phone would absolutely not refund my money. After a huge annoying debate over return they would only allow an exchange. We were forced to find new items we did not want in a huge rush and almost missed our plane dealing with these people. I would not recommend shopping here. A no refund policy is a terrible customer relations policy. This owner Sue Gribble has no interest in making anyone happy, she just wants your money. She is a horrible reflection on the El Conquistador Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Mbarnd
Reviews.Content: The views are incredible. The staff amazing. And there is a great local village down the shore to walk for some authentic mofongo.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HermanG
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, but if you are looking for authentic Puerto Rican cuisine, you need to go off the premises to local restaurants in the area. Ask the local cab drivers, and they will give great places to go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! Rooms? Not so clean!”
Reviews.Author: GoldsmithV
Reviews.Content: Huge property and looks fabulous! Very nice location and lobby. Until you get into a room. I think the person in charge of housekeeping needs to be fired! Moldy and dirty bathrooms! First of all the finishing inside is not so good and to add to this the cleanliness by the hotel staff is worse! The closet is inside the bathroom and there is no ventilation (no window and no fan). On the first day, we called housekeeping because the tub would not drain, which they fixed right away. Also told them that the bathrooms were dirty, so they came with a spray and left pretty much the same as before.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: trailfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a work conference. From a ways away this facility is beautiful. When you get up close, the hotel needs some TLC. There were a lot of cosmetic issues. There was a lot of dirt on the outside of the buildings. There is a lot of caulk and grout that needs to be replaced. We stayed 5 nights and there was a dirty towel on our balcony the entire time. It was never removed by the housekeeper. Our bathroom and our sheets were dirty when we checked into the room. We had 8:30 reservations at the Strip House steakhouse and we still didn't have our meal at 10:00. We even had a limited menu for our group. I have never stayed at a Waldorf Astoria before, but my thoughts were that they were an elite hotel chain, but I wouldn't say that after staying here. Overall though, they did a nice job of accompanying our group of 800 people. I would say that the convention space is very nice, but the hotel needs some attention to detail. The beach on the island was very nice and so were the pool areas. The golf course was very beautiful also. All in all, I would probably say that for a vacation, people have nicer choices, but when it comes to having a large convention or conference, this place would be a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings.... but beware:”
Reviews.Author: vacationerII
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews for this resort. We're pretty self-sufficient so we thought we'd give it a try. Hilton's website describes Waldorf-Astoria Resorts this way: "Over 20 destinations globally, each with its own story. Experience unparalleled service that creates unforgettable moments and defines the idea of the luxury hotel." This is not even close to the level of service here. We stayed for 5 nights, we were never asked how things were or if any services could be provided. As a matter of fact, we rented a car and paid $15.00 per day to self park.
