The lot is a good distance away but we don't mind the walk (except when it was raining). They have a shuttle between the lot and the hotel but never offered to provide a ride nor asked if we wanted one. We ate at two property restaurants, both were extremely overpriced and the food was tasteless. At one restaurant, we (50+ year old couple) were seated only to have the table next to us seated with young family of four with screaming and table pounding kids. There were many empty tables in the restaurant as it was later in the evening. So, if your looking for a quiet retreat, be aware. We couldn't wait to pay and get out of there. The free breakfast buffet was more than adequate and the service was fine. If we would have paid the $26.00 per person regular rate for the buffet, we might have felt differently. We did find an excellent restaurant nearby, La Estacion locally owned, fresh food, great service and a very reasonable price. Definitely worth a try or three! Also nearby, Calizo seafood restaurant has good food but with spotty service. Worth a try but La Estacion much fresher and far better service. Both however, were far better than the resort food. We are very active and planned many activities. We organized them all ourselves and they went off without a hitch. We did ask the concierge to book one trip for us only to have the included transportation not being provided and we ended up nearly being stranded in an unfamiliar place. ---Lesson: Make your own plans! The care-less customer service attitude is obviously instilled by resort management. The hotel is located in a beautiful area but the building itself is not up to any luxury standard. Hacked up woodwork in need of paint, weeds growing from cracks in sidewalks, dimly lit walkways to parking area just to name a few. We've seen much better maintained facilities at Hampton Inn. The housekeeping service was excellent. At least someone there took pride in their work. We used the spa ($200.00 per person), the massage was great but again, the facility was small, dated and in need of a good cleaning and modernization. Not at all a luxury facility. As mentioned, the view and the area was breathtaking. If you can get a good deal, this place is worth consideration. Just don't expect luxury or service. Worth your time: La Estacion restaurant Yunke Zipline Adventures Spread Eagle II catamaran/snorkle

Reviews.Title: “Amenities galore, quality of actual hotel, not so great.”
Reviews.Author: SEGMN
Reviews.Content: I have to say that after reading the reviews of this hotel regarding this resort not being of Waldorf quality, I would have to say that I agree 100%. The resort has pros and cons but I agree with the previous reviewer that this property would be better received if it changed it's name to Hilton instead of WA because the expectations of guests are higher than the resort can fulfill. I was teetering between giving the property 3 or 4 stars for a rating because I would say the amenities are 4-5 stars but the quality of the property is no more than 3. The El Con is about 1.5 hours to/from the San Juan airport. There is a shuttle that will take guests directly to the hotel for $74 roundtrip or $37 each way. This charge is directed right on to your incidentals bill for convenience. My first impression of the service was great, the bell staff was very warm, friendly and helpful. Check-in was the same. My first impression of the property was ok, the grounds are beautiful and well-kept but the building itself reminded me of a 3* Mexico all-inclusive rather than an upscale resort. Regardless, it was nice to have a beautiful view of the ocean from the lobby after a long day of travel. I was a little underwhelmed with my room in the Vista. The view was of the driveway to the resort which was disappointing, and the room looked worn and dated. There were little hairs in my shower, in misc areas of the bathroom, in the coffee mug! Yuck! The carpet was faded and tattered and the room just didn't feel very fresh. I stayed for 5 days in this room and asked for an upgrade to an ocean view for my final 5 days which I was actually given. The new room had an incredible view of the ocean (also in vista tower) but the room itself was again very run down and the lock on the door was broken. On the day I was to change rooms, I was asked to check out by 11am which I did. My new room wasn't ready until 6pm (2 hrs after check in time!). This was frustrating for me! Of course I did not spend the entire trip in my room, I utilized the amenities. I was very impressed with the amenities at this property! There are 3 main pools and 2 additional in the Las Olas and Casitas wings. There are a number of jacuzzies, my favorite being the "infinity jacuzzi" overlooking the sea. There was a server bringing drinks and food to guests at the pool also. There are a number of shops located throughout the resort for snacks, liquor, souvenirs, toiletries, etc. The property is massive so I definitely would not recommend it for anyone who had difficulty getting around. I liked the size because I didn't feel like I was looking at the same thing day after day. I have read many complaints regarding the funicular and I personally did not have any issues with it. However, my co-worker did get stuck waiting for almost an hour at one point when one of the two was not in service and a large group of people were also trying to get on it. The restaurants were hit or miss, we had terrible service and below-average food at Ballyhoo in the Marina but an excellent meal at La Piccola. I felt that the staff throughout the resort spent most of their time standing around in groups socializing rather than working. At first I was thinking, "Wow, these people have a lot of meetings!" Then I realized they were just socialzing because the "meetings" never broke up! Palomino island was a very nice little place and the only area that was really laid-back and relaxed on the resort (this is a busy place!). There were a number of water sports and rental equipment, a few bars and a restuarant, beautiful beaches to walk along or relax on as well as mini-golf, bag toss and nets for sports. I really liked the island, it was just a hassle from my room so I actually only made it out there twice. Overall, I can't say I had a bad experience here but I just wasn't impressed with many of the facillities resulting in the average rating i have given the El Con. If there were some updates, and a little more pep from most of the staff, I think the property has incredible potential!

Reviews.Title: “change the name”
Reviews.Author: Justtravels988
Reviews.Content: I'm a HH Diamond Member. First trip to PR and wanted to check out the WA El Con. It was over Christmas. Overall, this is a three star property that does not live up to the hype or the luxury that comes with the name "Waldorf Astoria." If this was called the "Hilton El Conquistador" i think it would clear up a lot of people's problems (including mine). Here are the issues which are obvious to why this should be classified as a 3 star Hilton Resort: * The place is old and its obvious. Broken elevators (even over Christmas), dingy furniture, stained carpets...even though the rooms were modernized- they are still cheap looking and pretty beat up (and I assume I was upgraded since I'm a diamond member. Nothing luxury about the rooms or facility). * The food is horrific and the restaurants are gathered together like a food court where you take escalators to the "Restaurant Level" from the main lobby. Breakfast is probably the worst part. Its in a humid, cafeteria style dining room where its really family oriented. When you think WA- you think of similar luxury resorts- Four Seasons, Ritz...this breakfast is on par with what you'd expect at the Hilton Disney World...not the WA. * The service is poor. Check-in at the Diamond Desk took over 20 minutes and there wasn't even a line! The process takes forever and this resonated everywhere....spa, dining (see above), bellman....everyone works at their own pace...nice and slow. Again, not WA where you expect ppl to be jumping around, always available to help. * Here's my favorite part. Had a dinner reservation at Strip House (yes, a chain at a resort- weird) and looked in the in room directory and it said there was a Cigar Bar. So we went to the Cigar Bar which is now a pool hall (nice work updating the in room directories hotel staff). We sat down upon arrival. Of course the 2 girls behind the bar let us sit there for 10 mintues so I went over and asked if we could order cigars. Yes, we could purchase them and sit on the patio. So I buy 2 cigars and 2 glasses of wine (she sets the wine on the counter for me to take over to the table- no service but a tip line on the reciept) and hands me the cigars in their wrappers. I kind of roll my eyes and ask for a cutter and matches. She says, "No, sorry." I said, 'haha, can i pls have a cutter and matches (thinking she was joking)." "I said we don't have them," she replies. "you don't have a cutter or matches at a cigar bar...i mean, a pool hall where you sell cigars" I asked? "Yeah, thats what i said." UNBELIEVABLE. So off to the gift shop I went to get gauged for a lighter after blowing $50 bucks at the pool hall. Then dinner at Strip...it was typical, fine. We were laughing about the crazy cigar incident/ horrific service and attitude and the overall hotel at dinner and the couple next to us perked up, leaned over and said..."we couldn't help but laughing at your story...we've been laughing all day at how terrible this place is and the joke WA is......in fact, we're checking into the St Regis tomorrow and are debating leaving right now!!!!'' What else do you need to know about the service as this place? I have to say the setting is really beautiful, but the whole place is a joke as a WA. Just rename it a hilton and everyone will be fine bc the expecation from the guest will be different.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Milin124
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Fajardo, about a 70 minute drive from the San Juan International airport. The hotel staff was very amendable. Our room was nicely furnished with a very comfortable bed and first class amenities. The view from our balcony was spectacular and most importantly, the room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. A quick ferry ride to Palomino Island brings you to a beautiful beach. We enjoyed our stay and often dream about our return visit someday.

Reviews.Title: “Really Bad MANAGEMENT attitude.”
Reviews.Author: Achelo
Reviews.Content: I am from Puerto Rico and have stayed in this hotel many times in the last ten years. At least, the last three times I have had problems that the Hotel Administration didn't WANTED to solve adequately (giving different rooms than the ones requested, different areas than the ones requested, long waits for Check In Processes, even surprising reservation cancellations, etc). This hotel it is located in Fajardo, Puerto Rico, in a place where you will appreciate a spectacular view and lot of facilities and activities to do. You will find it a little bit expensive, if you consider all the fees they add to your account. There's even a Resort Fee (whatever that means) where they charge you for pool towels, pool chairs, transportation, etc. Because of the price you pay, you should expect to receive a good treatment from the hotel management in case you have a problem. If you are concern about this, this is not the place you want to go. Hotel MANAGEMENT simply treat you like if you are staying free. No interest in giving alternatives or solving a problem. Apparently they want you to solve your problems yourself!!! Too Bad, because it's a really pretty place to stay. And too bad that the Managers didn't came to talk to me (even though I requested so), didn't answered my messages nor my e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “So much to do!!!”
Reviews.Author: viajero02011
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel, not near the metropolitan area but has many amenities!! Golf course, tennis, water park, nice pool,casino, good restaurants and one of the world's most beautiful beaches!! A paradise!!!

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf experience at less than a typical Waldorf price.”
Reviews.Author: TomD65
Reviews.Content: This resort is great value - reasonably priced for a Waldorf, likely based on the fact that the rooms are getting tired. That said the food, service, and amenities are all Waldorf and very good. My observations: - rooms are tired but well cleaned and stocked, including fluffy rolled towels, comfy beds with lots of pillows, and flat screen TVs. That said if a very modern, new, or fancy room is what you're looking for you're likely to be disappointed. - there are two large and beautiful pools, one with a swim up bar, with a view of the ocean and palm trees. We never had a problem finding a lounger by the pool with or without shade. They also have private cabanas for rent although didn't do it so can't comment on the quality or value. - six restaurants for every taste. I ate I'm most and the food quality was either excellent or exceptional at all. They are not cheap as you would expect at a Waldorf. I was a particular fan of the Italian and the casual bar down in the Marina. I didn't eat at the steak house but a colleague said the food was fantastic. - there are a ton of active sports options. A full 18 hole course that is both challenging and beautiful. Approx. a half dozen tennis courts in reasonable condition and we had no problem getting one in the morning, although they got busy after 10am. There are two well equipped gyms but I recommend the one in the spa as its better equipped and more aesthetically appealing. And finally at the island there are any number of water sport options ranging from snorkeling to beach volley ball. Golf and water sports cost extra, the rest are included. - the hotel owns an island which houses the beach, a restaurant, and bar. It also has a compliamentary shuttle every 30 mins or so free for guests. It's a great place to spend a hot afternoon. - the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. - we took a number of excursions and would suggest a late night kayak to the nearby illumine cent bay is a must do. The trip is magical as your paddle, kayak, and even your hands cause the water to emit a bright green light. It's like pixey dust running through your fingers. Sign up at the marina. All in great value for the price and works for couples as well as families (oh yeah, there's even a water park).

Reviews.Title: “I could just live there and never come home!”
Reviews.Author: Southernese
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice and I think I'd live here if I could! It is one of the most beautiful places I've ever been. The views from the cliff are beyond compare if you are one who loves a tropical view and the ocean. The employees are polite, helpful, friendly, and seem genuinely interested in my welfare (except one surly bartender at one of the outside bars but that can happen anywhere.) The food is fantastic, I ate in the Italian restaurant and in the "Stingray Cafe" for nicer meals as well as some of the outdoor more casual restaurants. The rooms are beautiful with views of the ocean. They are very clean. They have coffee pots in the rooms, as well as refrigerators. The Spa is wonderful, where you are pampered beyond your expectation and I expected a lot. Do not expect cheap however. This is not a cheap resort. It is a beautiful peaceful tropical wonderland, but you do have to pay for such a place. I love the fact that it's over an hour from the airport and I love the area around the resort but I don't recommend going out on your own. There are some local places around but you'll need transportation to leave the resort to get to them. I'd go back any time, as often as I could.

Reviews.Title: “Average Resort at best”
Reviews.Author: Shan143
Reviews.Content: This resort needs updates...badly. Really surprised that this is a Waldorf Astoria property. The rooms are outdated and some of tiles were missing in my bathroom. I was on the marina (bottom) and so bugs got in my room...not good! Property is so spreadout that walking between your room and main property is a hike and painful....tram up and down rom your room. Also, no beach runs....you have to take a 10 minute boat ride to a beach.

Reviews.Title: “The view is beautiful.......service is not the "Ritz"”
Reviews.Author: monabell1122
Reviews.Content: Trip to hotel......ugh....too long. Puerto traffic stinks. If they moved any slower they would be going backwards. This was my second time visiting the El Conquistador in Fajardo with my husband for one of his business trips. It is situated on top of a cliff over looking the beautiful turquoise waters where the atlantic ocean and Caribbean sea meets. Nothing really has changed since 2004, my last visit. While I learned that it had been acquired by Waldorf Astoria I thought before I got there, oh good, its a quality hotel, 5 star service etc. My room was very nice, clean, great view. The Waldorf needs to up date its workers on service. My complaint with house keeping is that they never replaced our coffee cups. Now I know this seems trivial but, we like our afternoon coffee. So they never replace the first cup that was there, and the one that was there was definitely not clean..........its like they wiped it out with a towel because there was coffee residue clearly on the bottom of the mug. GROSS. Only makes me wonder what else they didn't clean. They were also late on cleaning the room. Sorry but by 2:00pm when I come back from the beach, I need the room clean and fresh towels. Especially at those prices. The staff while pleasant always seemed like they didn't know what the heck you were talking about. The wait staff, really had no interest in making any money. It took forever for someone to come by and wait on you during the day pool or beach side. And they could have made great tips with the crowd I was with! Many times it was as if I was being an inconvenience as they always seemed to be preoccupied with personal stuff, i.e. (IPODS!!) SERIOUSLY. Those should not be bought to work. Dinning-We ate in a few different restaurants on the property and I have to say the food was pretty good. No complaints there. And they have a nice variety of restaurants. Night life-they could have done better. The night club was taken over by another group for their meeting. Bad call, because there really was no where to hang out and listen to a DJ or dance. And their sad attempt to have music in the lobby expecting people to hang out was poorly planned. They do have a casino. Its ok. My favorite part is Palomino Island. You have to take a ferry boat over to the beach if you want to go to the beach. This is where they filmed Pirates of the Caribbean. Very cute, things to do. Two bars. Nice little place for lunch. And a great beach. All in all it was better than being in the northeast cold that week. I took the good with the bad and the good wins.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Unbelievable hotel with absolutely stunning views!!! A must stay.”
Reviews.Author: JG1001
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 days at El Con. A full service gem with stunning vistas and a great private island to relax and enjoy the beach. The casino, while a little small, provided great night time atmosphere and games for all skill level. Blossoms restaurant was impeccable and we tried both the Chinese and Japanese sides of the restaurant. We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: ewarrington
Reviews.Content: This place is simply spectacular. The views are breathtaking, and the hotel in general is well taken care of. A little expensive but it totally worths it. Would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the caribbean”
Reviews.Author: snickerjam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Only 45 min from San Juan. Close to the El Yunque, Las Croabas, Fajardo ferries, bio bay, and Seven Seas beach. Hotel is located on a cliff with beautiful views. There is no beach but you take a short ferry ride from the hotel to Palomino ( private island ). Rooms are clean. Service is excellent. There are great restaurants outside the hotel. Passion is one of the best restaurants in the area. Food is very expensive in the hotel. This resort and area are one of the best in Puerto Rico. Your overall experience will be adventurous and luxurious at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: ayjthoma
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this resort. The scenery was amazing. The food was great. We felt safe and the room was quite. Friendly staff. My only complaint is that the room was alittle dated. No fan in the bathroom. I love this place and will come back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but be Prepared to Spend $$$”
Reviews.Author: ComeTravelWithMe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most amazing views!!! I recently attended my friend's wedding at this hotel and it was a dream for her. In order to go to the beach you take a nice 10 minute boat ride to their private island. The island was so nice - like paradise. I think that was the best part for me. Here are some additional details to consider as you are planning your trip - The hotel is quite a drive from the airport (90 minutes from SJU). The hotel offers transport but it is expensive. - I am used to all inclusive resorts so to go somewhere where dinner each night for 2 people is $150+ takes getting used to. Don't get me wrong the food was good but expensive. Also, you really can't leave the resort to eat unless you have rented a car. So overall, it is a great place that you are sure to pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate O
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Las Casitas Village with some friends. Our villa was beautiful, clean and had wonderful views. Unfortunately, the staff, with very few exceptions, was horrible. No one was friendly and the wait staff at all the restaurants and bars we went to seemed annoyed when we ordered from them. The food was average at best and very expensive. Also, review your bill very carefully, because they tried to charge us for breakfast (which they told us several times was included) and they also tried to charge us for round trip transportation to the airport when we only used it one way. The infinity pool was wonderful, but once again, service was bad. The beach was ok, but it took over an hour to get there. For the price, we really expected better service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Scenery, and lots to do”
Reviews.Author: AJ A
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a beautiful room in the La Casitas area of the hotel. I did a quick walkthrough of the room/view and posted it here: http://youtu.be/61AdWV-bK5A Overall it was a great experience. Here were my takeaways: Pros: *Great, spacious and scenic room- We were able to get a huge room in the Las Casitas that came with a full kitchen, 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. It has an extremely large deck and there really isn't a bad view from anywhere in this resort. * Palomino Island- This resort comes with its own private island. They have a ferry that runs consistently throughout the day to take you to an island with hundreds of chairs, a couple of bars, a restaurant and also lots of activities (i.e. jet skis, kayaks, basketball court, horseshoes, corn hole, etc.) The ferry runs until 5:30 and is really the place I wanted to spend most of my time. * Lots to do- There was plenty to do on this resort from golfing, to a casino, to shopping, to dancing, and plenty of eating. Also pools everywhere, a large water park and a fun marina area. Some of the areas do die down at night, so as a 27 year old, it was at times hard to find a good variety in nightlife on week days. *Steak Restaurant: This place had excellent service and tasty food. I had a very nice steak and split a giant peice of chocolate cake with my family. (Yes one piece was more than enough. We didn't even finish it) *Tours- We took a great tour to the Rainforest through the hotel. They were able to run the trip with a minimum of 6 people and they handled accomodations to take us our and provided an excellent tour guide. Cons: *Casitas is tad far from the main hotel: If you stay at the casitas, it is a little far for people to walk, especially in the dark or if it is raining. At the front they do offer either a golf cart/shuttle to the main hotel, and it comes on request. *Asian food restaurant: Overall the food was good, but in terms of quality per price I did not enjoy the asian restaurant. Entree family style dishes ranged from $20-$40 and were very basic and even bland dishes. Service was great though. *Lines for the Funicular: To get down to the ferry or marina area you need to take a funicular. It offers an incredible view and is pretty quick. Unfortunately they are somewhat small so when a ferry lets off, you usually will have to wait in line. Overall I didn't mind, but we did try to plan ahead to avoid lines if we could. *Not much local experience: The second part of our vacation took place in Old San Juan and I must say if you visit the El Conquistador, in order to really get a cultural experience you must take some of the tours or move into the cities. Beyond talking to the staff there isn't much you will get from the resort if you are looking to learn about Puerto Rican Culture.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for room but be careful about everything else!”
Reviews.Author: dave123md
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to this hotel during the summer of 2010. We managed to get a good deal on our room, which I would recommend only booking this hotel if you are getting some kind of a deal. We rented a car in San Juan and drove to Farjado (which I highly recommend doing!). You have to understand that the hotel is massive, beautiful, but essentially its own little compound. If you are stranded there you will be paying the ridiculous fees for simple items like water and food. The taxis are not cheap either, and I promise you will more than make up for the cost of the rental car by what you save. We ended up driving to a local grocery (5 min) away and stocking up on bottled water, soda, fruit juice and a bottle of rum for less than you would pay in the US. Similarily the restaurants in the hotel are ridiculously expensive for moderately good "American" food. Amazingly the hotel did not even have any local flavor restaurants (although maybe they have changed this now). However, just down the road there was a wonderful little restaurant serving local fish dishes at a good price (of course I forget the name but it is located just outside the hotel gates -turn right onto the road when leaving the hotel through the gates). On the plus side, the room was clean and the views are amazing. Palamino island is a fantastic little get away (although one of the staff was arrested by DEA while we were on the island). PROS: - Cheap room if get a deal (make sure you know what the deal includes) - Rental cars are cheap, parking is relatively inexpensive and local restaurants and grocery are nearby and cheap - Views, pool, palamino island - El Yunque park definitely worth a half day CONS: - Ridiculously expensive for anything "extra" at the hotel - No local flavor to this location - Being an accessible Carribean location at a relatively low to moderate price (room only), this place attracts a lot of people that do not necessarily have any sort of regard for the people around them and I would not recommend this place if you are hoping for a peaceful quiet time - The hotel check in check out was so amazingly slow it will blow your mind. Seriously I had heard complaints about this before I arrived, and I was still stunned at how inefficient the front desk is set up.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny week in Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Jay_and_Greg
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fantastic with many amenities, but if you're looking for a cheaper vacation, the food can be very expensive. We found that the drink menu prices did not match up with the cost when we received our bill. For authentic Puerto Rican cuisine, we suggest leaving the resort. Take the funicular down to the marina, turn left and follow the road out of the resort for a 10 minute walk, into Las Croabas. We highly recommend the baked potato at Dino's for $6 a person. (Note to travellers, do _not_ use the bathroom in the main park.) The city is otherwise very safe and kid friendly. We recommend a day trip into El Yunque rainforest, but organize it through the hotel not an independent tour company, because many of them leave from San Juan. The Spa is a great experience, remember to bring a bathing suit with you. Palomino island is a nice day at the beach, the selection of beer there is very limited and expensive. Las Brisas restaurant is the best place for breakfast, but the buffet is $24 per person, so you probably won't want to eat there everyday. Try CafÃ© Caribe as a cheaper alternative. If you want cheap lunches, grab a sandwich out of the Cozy Market or even out of Starbucks. The shuttle from the airport is booked ahead, returning to the airport has to be booked at the Hotel through the concierge. $74 a person round trip. The free rum on the shuttle heading to the Hotel is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel with added luxuries”
Reviews.Author: DeeP23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our third visit and absolutely LOVE it. As with any upscale hotel, you can expect prices to be a little higher, but it's not outrageously priced. One of the reasons we can stay here is the hotel's private island nearby...it's a beautiful beach. Staff was very nice. The breakfast buffet is very good and with many many choices of food.

Reviews.Title: “Palomino Island was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: melazina
Reviews.Content: Alot of activities, golf course fantastic, Palomino island was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Arodh87
Reviews.Content: What amazed me the most about the hotel was how all the employees always were greeting me with a smile on their face. The service was excellent, I had no problem during my weekend stay. The trip to Palomino island was super nice, the only thing is that you have to buy all the food and drinks over there because they check your bags before riding the ferry, but aside from that all perfect. The hotel is very big, i didn't get to see the whole place in my 2 night stay. For dinner cant tell u about the hotel but I can recommend Lolitas(mexican) a 5 min ride from the hotel and Pasion por el Fogon (puerto rican food) 2 min ride.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views”
Reviews.Author: Marina R
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at El Con with 2 friends. The views were unbelievable. When we arrived, we were upgraded from a garden view room to an oceanview room in Las Casitas. The room was beautiful, had a full kitchen (fridge stocked with bottled waters) and a balcony overlooking the ocean. There were perks to staying on the Las Casitas part of the resort. First, this is where the infinity pool and hot tub are. Second, the gym on the Casitas side is much nicer than the gym in the main area. We spent most days at the Palomino Island which also had really nice views, lots of water sports, and pretty good food at the Iguana Cafe. The sand on the beach was kinda grainy, however, and there were lots of coral pieces in the water which made it difficult to walk. If you have water shoes, bring them. We also had a good time at the water park which is only $5 after 4pm. Keep your eyes peeled for the 3 foot iguana that lives in the bushes. The restaurants on the resort serve mostly american food, dinner ranges from $20-50 a dish. Nothing exciting. We ventured into Fajardo for 2 dinners and had a great time. I highly recommend Tasca Oleleiolai and Pasion. We attempted to go to La Estacion but when we got there, we were informed that the restaurant was out of food and closing despite the fact that we had called 20 minutes before our arrival. Very poor service at La Estacion. Also, if you don't have a rental car, the resort has a taxi service which is very reliable, but kinda pricey. We paid $10-20 per ride and only went about 5 minutes down the road. We thought it was worth it to try local cuisine which was delicious and far less expensive than the resort. I also highly recommend the biobay tour through Pure Adventures - an amazing, once in a lifetime experience. One of the funiculars did break on our last day, but the resort wasn't very busy so it wasn't a problem. It would probably be very frustrating if staying in the Las Olas section. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: KBHTX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel for a few days on the beach after spending 2 nights in Old San Juan. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms were large and well appointed. The private beach was nice, taking a boat was interesting but for a long trip I think it would have gotten old. The resort is HUGE so getting places can be a real nightmare, getting our car from valet took forever and man are food and drinks pricey. I think it would make people happier to pay a bit more for the room and bring down the drink and food prices. The hotel was beautiful but I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Dafera
Reviews.Content: The hotel features a wide variety of activities and breath taking views. Truly unique experiences such as kayak to a pool where bio-illuminence pool of algea provides the entertainment. The property offers tennis, golf, multiple pools, snorkling, a ferry to a local island, and multiple other activities. The restaurants were very good from the high end Strip Steakhouse to pizza at the pool side bar, there are enough options available at a variety of prices. The rooms were clean and beds comfortable. The hotel also offers a variety stores to keep you comfortable and provide an option to purchasing from the restaurants. The prices were surprising reasonable. A terrific getaway. A co-worker did extremely well in the casino as an added benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Adventure”
Reviews.Author: 1MissV1
Reviews.Content: El Con was a beautiful trip. I've been to PR plenty of times, but this was the first time to Fajardo. Although Fajardo is underdeveloped in comparison to San Juan, it is still rich in culture and beauty. There isn't much to do IN town, but El Con solves that issue with creating a whole community within the resort. A ton of restaurants to try, cafes, boutique shops, ice cream parlor, and not to mention great pools. My favorite part of El Con was the private beach that they take you to. I never had to wait very long to board the very fun speedboat over to the island...and that island was paradise. VERY private & the island had it's own beach shop and food cabana. The food on the actual beach is highly priced, but what I did was ate the buffet breakfast, brought some snacks to the beach for the day and came back when I was hungry. I went with my boyfriend, and it was very romantic. My family has also gone & enjoyed themselves as well. One issue I had: Upon arrival at midnight (long day of delayed flights!), we got to our room and relaxed and unpacked. My bf went to take a shower and there was an issue where the shower was not coming out of the shower head & there was a huge leak. Upon calling reception, they told us that someone would be up to fix it rather than move us to accommodate us. We waited for quite some time for them to conclude that it was not fixable (the repair man was very nice and attentive). Finally, we got to our other room and no issues there.

Reviews.Title: “Some place we would happily return to!”
Reviews.Author: Cam_I_Am24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved pretty much everything! The rooms down in La Marina Village are gorgeous, with beautiful views of Palomino Island and St. Thomas (on clearer days). The rooms were nicely furnished with a good sized balcony. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. We originally booked this resort because of how central it was to the activities we wanted to do such as hiking in El Yunque, snorkeling and the bioluminescent bay (Laguna Grande). Not only did we have all of this at our disposal, we also had a beautiful private island we could relax on! The pools are very large and weren't overly crowded. Pros: gorgeous views, comfortable rooms, relaxing pools, beautiful private island, quiet and secluded location. Cons: fridge = large cooler (not very cold), have to use funicular to get from main building to other areas, food is very expensive on the resort. Beware of mosquitos and sand fleas, but they kind of come with the location. Also, this is both a family resort and a hot spot for business conventions. If you do stay here, rent a car (rental desk in the main lobby) to get to the rainforest. It's cheaper and gives you more time to really enjoy the beautiful surroundings. If you do rent a car, stop at the local grocery store for snacks if you don't want to spend a ton at the resort. Also, visit La Estacion right outside the main gate for an affordable meal

Reviews.Title: “A lavish paradise”
Reviews.Author: thelexusgirl
Reviews.Content: We went away to the El Conquistador for a New Years getaway. We enjoyed the many amenities that the resort offered but really loved going over to Palomino Island, the resorts private island, to spend a day on the beautiful beach, there was a great live band that really set the mood for the day. At night you can go kayaking in the nearby bioluminescent bay, however we couldnt go because we heard the mosquitos can get fierce and being six months pregnant didnt want to risk it. The resort itself has lots of great little shops, lots of bars (one with a pool table), a casino (we had good luck at the tables!), three pools and a water park. Although it was just us as a couple the resort is also very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: AnnieW2011
Reviews.Content: I just returned from El Conquistador after a fantastic stay. The resort is built in to the side of a mountain overlooking the ocean, so there are views from every level of the resort. We stayed in Las Olas at the bottom of the hill and loved being so close to the waterpark and ferry to Palamino Island. The only downside to staying at the bottom of the hill is that there is only one way up and down...the Fernicular. there are two but one was broken while we were there, so there could be a bit of a wait to go up to the main hotel, or back to our room. But when we could just stare at the beautiful views it was hard to worry about a wait.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, fun, with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynCouple718
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an overall positive experience at El Conquistador. But you should temper your expectations. We booked VERY last minute, arrived on New Year's Eve, watched the fireworks from our ocean-view balcony. The good- The grounds are stunning, the beach on the private island is fabulous. The ferry ride over is short and pleasant. You can go to the busy area and do boating, kayaking, jetskis etc, or go the other direction and have a slice of white sand and calm turquoise water to yourself. The water park is really fun, even for grown-ups. The staff is friendly & accommodating. We asked for and got an upgrade to an ocean-view room& woke up to the sunrise and ocean each day. We had an absolute blast all together. Things to do for sure: biofluorescent bay tour (you can walk to the local companies and do it for half the price of booking through the hotel), the lazy river, the beach, the half-day snorkel tour. We tried 3 of the resort's "fine dining" restaurants. The steak house was good food and service and nice atmosphere. The fish restaurant at the marina was great service, we sat outside, great view, great atmosphere, but the food was mediocre and VERY expensive. And the italian fine dining place was average food and literally about $35 for a bowl of pasta. The bad- Generally speaking there is nothing "Waldorf" about this resort. It doesn't have the modern luxuries you'd expect from a Waldorf. There are no frills to the rooms or the architecture or the public areas at all. The interior of the main building has little shops and a Starbucks, which all came in very handy, but it feels a bit tacky & outdated. There are a LOT of VERY LARGE people and generally speaking it is not a 5- or even 4-star crowd. It seems that the Casitas, which are more expensive and have some private castitas-only areas, are more upscale all around, so if you are looking for any element of luxury, maybe stay there. The design of the resort is such that you HAVE to take the funiculaire between areas at the top and bottom of the cliff. There is NO option to walk, no staircase, nothing. And one or the other funiculaire was ALWAYS BROKEN throughout our whole week-long stay, and, from what the locals tell me, that is usually the case. What that means is that when you take the last ferry back from the beach, you can expect to wait sometimes over an HOUR to get up the hill to the main building. They are very aware that this is an issue. We casually spoke to a manager about it, and just for giving her our feedback, she credited us a free night. As I said, the service if very friendly and accommodating! Overall, this is a beautiful property with lots of activities, proximity to local restaurant options, good service, spectacular weather, nice beach, and a really fun trip all around. It is quite expensive, and the rooms and building interiors could use an overhaul. I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Siouxtrois
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a two night stay at the hotel and I had to write because I just want to go back already! Before arriving we got an email giving us the option of requesting an ocean view for a small fee if available at the time of check-in and it was very well worth every penny, since we got a room in building 1 just facing the Marina, best view ever! When we arrived we were greeted by every single person from Security at the entrance gate to the bellmen, valet parking and every single person we met on the way. The hotel wasn't very crowded, so unlike previous reviewers we never had to wait more than 1 minute to use the funicular to get to our room or never had to wait for the ferry to Palomino! Same story with the Coqui Water Park, everything was just perfect!! Definitely the best time to go! We had lunch at Iguana's and breakfast at Las Brisas and both were excellent as was the service!! Overall, a great experience, especially when I work at a hotel as well and know how things work, everyone has done a great job! The only complain is that Housekeeping came by almost at 6pm when we were relaxing from a long day at the beach and the pool, and so we had to refuse, but with a hotel this huge I do understand there is a LOT of work for the maids.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: Masca
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lovely, large spaces painted a cooling white. The balcony is also a good size & offers great views. But it's easy to get lost just in the main building and the signage isn't the best. And don't ask staff in the restaurants and shops about how to get to your section of rooms - they haven't a clue. They obviously never wander beyond their work place. Had an excellent facial in the spa topped by a nude dip in their huge hot tub. The only drawback are two flights of stairs above their lobby. And be prepared for mosquitos or some biting insect in their private island.

Reviews.Title: “5th trip and still loving it!!”
Reviews.Author: jechlou3
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th year in a row staying at the El Con having another awesome time. This year we stayed through Thanksgiving for the first time and could not have had a better experience. We experienced a Puerto Rican Thanksgiving which was very enjoyable. Sheryl Toko the hotel GM is one of the nicest ladies we have met in this industry. She was very available and took the time to make suggestions for our activities. We would especially like to thank several of the employees who made our stay very enjoyable. Many thanks to; Jesus, Manny, (Maria, Shorty, and Diana from Palomino island), Arianna from the poolside restaurant, Omar, Joel, Ortiz, (Enid and Rita from Golden Door Spa), and many more folks whose names escape me.....we can not wait to come back for our 6th year in a row!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for spring break!”
Reviews.Author: krinoodles
Reviews.Content: it was so fun!food was really good,too. The water park was ok but i think it needed a little more slides ;). room was clean,funicular was not a problem, the breakfast was good. They have 3 resturants up in the top floor of the lobby; one chinese,one italian,one steakhouse. all over the resort there's little bars and pizza places scattered about;though. i'm a kid,and from the kids point of view:everything was so fun! PS: Palomino island has alot of coral. i recommend you bring water shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to escape to if you want to disappear”
Reviews.Author: CocoRee
Reviews.Content: This is the resort you go to if you are planning on staying at the resort and do not plan on venturing out too much. It even has its own island!!! Everything is at this resort so that you do not have to leave (they even have restaurants, a waterpark, and a Starbucks). You definitely feel spoiled with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property.....Great Time”
Reviews.Author: CrabappleJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the El Con with my wife and eleven year old daughter from Dec. 29th to January 4th. We traveled with the Holcombs (a/k/a "Holcons" to the Las Casitas staff....LOL)....please see David's review below. This is a beautiful property with stunning views of the Carribean. I read a good many TripAdvisor reviews before going and was a little apprehensive based on a considerable number of negative reviews. We were offered an "upgrade" to a Marina room but, thankfully, declined due to the number of reviews citing broken down funiculars and long wait times to get back up to the main hotel area. This was a good decision as one of the trams was broken down most of the time we were there. On three occassions, we had to take a shuttle bus back up to the main hotel (twice in an old yellow school bus!). This kinda takes away from the whole resort experience. We had two different rooms in the Las Brisas wing of the hotel. The first looked toward the light house and the Atlantic Ocean and it was quite a nice view. We changed to the other side of Las Brisas which overlooks the marina area with nice views out to the private island, Palomino. I highly recommend the rooms on this side of Las Brisas. Particularly, if you are traveling with kids, stay up at the main resort where most of the restaurants and activities are. Otherwise you will spend a great deal of time going back and forth on the funicular (if they are working). The resort management simply must solve this funicular problem or suffer continued negative reviews. Palomino Island is the highlight of this resort with two motorized catamarans going back and forth constantly to the island (about 8-10 minutes). The trip over and back is fun in itself. The island has a nice grassy area for kids and teens to frolic and play: soccer, putt-putt, large chess set, horseshoes. You can rent floats, snorkel gear, sailboats and jets skis. My daughter and I went snorkeling for about an hour off Palomino.....not great snorkeling if you've been to the black rock in Maui or Isles Mujeres, etc......but we saw enough fish to keep us entertained and had a good "bonding" experience. I think this resort is great for parents traveling with kids in the 5-15 age range. The waterpark is also quite nice with three good "rides" and the extra special treat of heated water, unlike the other pools. Hopefully, the resort will ultimately drop the charge for hotel guests. Special tip: we went to the waterpark after 4:00 and they only charged me and my daughter $5 each to get in. The "Holcons" had rented a large SUV so we all went to the El Yunque rain forest one day. A nice 5-6 hour field trip with hikes up to the Briton tower and El Mina waterfall. Really no need to go on a guided tour for El Yunque. The grounds of El Con are beautiful and the staff were all quite friendly and accomodating. The restaurants were good and not particularly overpriced for a resort.....we did not eat at the high end steak house and Italian restaurant since we constantly have to look for places with chicken fingers and grilled cheese sandwichs. Even on Palomino Island the drinks were not over-priced for a resort ($8-$9) I would recommend this resort....particularly with folks traveling with kids in the 5-15 age range. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Experience for Waldorf-Astoria Prices”
Reviews.Author: Ammaio
Reviews.Content: Having just gotten back from a week-long stay at El Conquistador, I had to go back through these reviews to remind myself what made us stay here... This place really is divisive and unfortunately I'm on the "avoid this hotel" side. Before arriving, we were aware that it is a massive resort and does require a lot of walking - we tried to overcome this by staying in the Las Olas village, which has its own funicular and is close to the marina. Lo and behold, the local service funicular wasn't working, which added at least 15 minutes to every journey in and out of Las Olas. This is especially annoying in the morning, where the lines to get up or down look like Disney World. Our rooms were rundown and tired, the fridge didn't work and I found I was sharing the space with some unpleasant insects. There were two days when the housekeeping service didn't even come to my room. The doors slam, loud and hard, so when people are coming back late at night, you hear them. The walls are so thin that if your neighbor sneezes, you hear them. The best part about this resort is the Palomino Island. We planned our week and tours around visits there. However, we were disappointed (furious?) to find out that on our last day the Island was closed for a private event. We had no notice, save for a few signs they put up on the day. As with a mega-resort experience, there are a lot of different types of people - unfortunately this place has attracted some really bad types. Considering the price you're paying at their average-quality restaurants, you don't want to be sitting next to a man in overalls and a wife beater (you can't make this up!) or families still in their bathing suits and pool clothes at 9pm. The overriding feeling is that this place is ripping you off. Waldorf-Astoria ?! Get out of here. Maybe it's owned by two guys who happened to be named Waldorf and Astoria, but the real W&A has no business attaching themselves to this place. You'll pay out the ear for the same experience you'd get at a La Quinta Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, but frustrating property!”
Reviews.Author: hajarpa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to PR, where we stayed at a property in San Juan/Isla Verde area for 3 days then 3 days at El Conquistador. Overall, our stay was fine but had some issues that put a damper on what otherwise was a fantastic vacation. Our check-in process was smooth... at some point we went to retrieve our luggage from the bell man and realized they never gave us luggage tags -- and our bags were unattended outside on a cart! I noticed a small sign saying that Palomino island would be closed on the second day of our stay -- we were not told about this by front desk staff at our check-in, NOR was this information provided when we booked our rooms (which was less than 2 weeks before our arrival). This was VERY disappointing, because the point of us coming to this resort was to use the private island/beach (and the only beach available is at the island -- as the hotel is on a cliff). The communication regarding this issue was very unprofessional. Our room was clean with a great view of the Ocean -- furniture was a platform bed with comfortable mattresses on top. Unfortunately, the edges of the platform were very sharp, so our daughter kept hitting herself against the edges. Major downside of the room layout was a large closet/bathroom combination with a sliding door. That basically meant you couldn't access your clothes, refrigerator, coffee maker if someone was in the bathroom -- and the bathroom door didn't lock! Our first day we had a wonderful day at Palomino island. I agree with prior posts stating how difficult it is to get started in the morning. Long lines at any restaurant/coffee shop. Lines at the funicular. Lines at the ferry. By the time you get there, you are hot, sweaty, and very frustrated. Honestly I am not staying at a "Waldorf" property to feel that much frustration on my winter getaway! Given how (in agreement with previous posters) that you felt like they had their "hands in your pockets" -- one does expect a higher level of service and standards. The following day was the day the beaches were closed for a 'private function." We had contacted the concierge several times to ask about going to Culebra on this day. We were told that getting there involved the ferry and to get there early to get tickets. We were told not to bother with flying, since it had to be done in advance (again, didn't know about the island being closed when we arranged our trip otherwise could have booked puddle-jumper flight in advance). We woke up very early and got to the ferry more than an hour prior to 9am ferry departure. ALl tickets already sold out. Nothing to do for the day (didn't want to go to the pool -- water chilly and we came to PR for beaches). Googled some airline numbers and found out that they have flights out of nearby airports that are available --went to airport but flight was too far time-wise for us to wait. Wandered around for a while then went to a beach in Luquillo -- not as nice but stayed for an hour or so and headed back to hotel. Pools open 24 hours, but no towels available after 6pm... Later, we found out that there are NUMEROUS snorkel trips, private boat charters, other airlines, water taxis, and multiple other ways to have gotten to this island that the concierge did NOT inform us of. They were basically incorrect about many things they told us about -- and generally wasted our entire day with their lack of information or downright WRONG information. We did address these concerns with management. They tried to find us a water taxi to another island but the weather turned ugly by the time this could be set up and so nothing came of it. They did leave a voicemail stating that, to offset the inconveniences, they were willing to credit us $100. When we checked out, I reviewed the charges to our account and was about to sign it and then decided to ask about our credit. The agent said, there is note on your account that management tried to set up a water taxi for you but you did not go. I stated that the weather conditions did not permit travel, which is why we didn't take them up on that offer. I did ask about the credit, and ONLY AT THIS POINT, did the agent snobbishly acknowledge that yes, this was indeed noted on the account and that she would NOW apply it! It was stunning -- that she had been standing looking at the account the entire time without applying this credit until I brought it up! The hotel was just generally TOO big (akin to a Vegas casino), with too much going on, and therefore had uncaring staff who were not accountable at all. You felt that you were just a number (and this was magnified by the presence of a very large private event that overwhelmed the hotel's resources). Prior to arriving here, we had a lovely stay at a 4.5 star property in San Juan that was very personal, friendly, and warm compared to El Conquistador. The location of the hotel is amazing, but the level of customer service, rooms, and staff are absolutely not up to Waldorf standards (though, if you have stayed at THE Waldorf=Astoria recently, you may realize that this doesn't mean much anymore). If you come here with low expectations and have a long vacation (5-7 days), then you will actually find this property stunning and feel like it is a gem. However, if you are used to staying in true five star properties (Four Seasons, etc) this place will be a real disappointment! If you decide to stay here, make sure you try restaurants outside the hotel (food was mediocre on site -- we tried Pasion down the road and it was excellent). Also, do your own online research about any potential day trips you may want to explore. Additionally, make sure you CALL the hotel and confirm that the amenities you are interested in will be available!

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: BERNICE77
Reviews.Content: All in all the vacation experience was not all that bad. Rooms and Beds were clean and comfortable. The staff were accomodating and did their best to make your stay a good one. Loved the Beauty of it all. The grounds were beautiful. Make reservations at the Spa Early, because of the many weddings even doing the week. I was with a business group, so I got a discounted rate, but would not be able to stay there on my own. The funicular down to the pool was a problem. Too long a wait in all that heat. Only one was working in November 2011. They did shuttle you back to the hotel by bus, that went the long long way and took a good 10 - 15 min. I felt there should have been more entertainment in the evening. Besides the Casino and one club, there was not much to do. Rented a Car and went to Old San Juan and had a great time there. Would definately recommend that and going to the private island for a day.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love with Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisCoqui
Reviews.Content: This is a first class property. Everything was absolutely beautiful. Very clean. The staff was so very gracious. No complaints at all!!!!! I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: ggsjillydad
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from th El Conquistador Resort in Puerto Rico and we had a great time. I read many reviews about the broken Funicular and transportation issues and the dated property... and yes one funicular was constantly broken but we were on vacation and we still were able to get to the boat to Palomino Island no problem. I think some people simply think too much of themselves. We stayed in the Las Caistas section and had a great room with ocean views and good breakfast buffet. Is it the Ritz no but all you have to do is look around and take a breath and enjoy where you are. The golf course was absolutley stunning and the tennis courts were always busy. We have two kids that loved the property Palomino Island was wonderful as was the nightly serenade of the coqui frogs but I am sure some people would complain about that as well. was it cheap no but it was New Years and it was 85 degrees so stay home and freeze if you are worried about money..

Reviews.Title: “Not to "Waldorf" standards.”
Reviews.Author: lilio74
Reviews.Content: While this property is nice and sits high atop a private bluff and golf course, there are things lacking that take away from the typical "Waldorf" experience. Retrieving your car during what they called "rush hour" can take well over 30 minutes. Riding the funicular down to the pool at this hour is a breeze. However! Beware of trying to get back up to the hotel. Only one funicular was working, and so we waited in line for well over an hour! We were eventually shuttled by a hotel van back to the top. This ride took over 15 minutes (after waiting in line for an hour) and took us through bumps and potholes and an uncomfortable ride through town. It seems perhaps the resort needs to plan more appropriately for these busy times.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Fleecing”
Reviews.Author: mktman
Reviews.Content: There isn't much good to say about this hotel. The rates were ridiculously high but we wanted to try it for New Years. What they don't tell you is about the $20.00 self-parking, The double room tax and the "resort fee" whatever that is. Our $360 room came to $490.00 per night just to stay and park. And, at that... the rooms were just so-so. TV didn't work... A/C was not contollable (we were hot or freezing). Valet parking is $30.00 more so you can avoid the painful process of self parking. The restaurants were so over-priced at least double what they should be that all the talk was about what restaurant outside the facility was good to eat at. We ended up with lunch everyday at the Panda Express. The hotel is huge and is designed to charge you at every turn. To get from room to lobby to pool to beach is an hour event. New years was OK... good band but the bar, of course, was serving $11.00 drinks making the evening pretty restrictive. It's a real trek to get to Fajardo from San Juan and customers deserve to be treated well. The entire time I felt that they had their hand in my pocket... is it really a Waldorf Astoria Hotel.... they should be embarrassed.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Travel2livewell
Reviews.Content: My husband an I spent the week after Christmas at the El Con. We had a great time relaxing at the private island. We liked the island food and bar drinks. The chairs and facilities were great. We have traveled pretty extensively and agree that it is not as luxurious as one envisions for a Waldorf. However, we were very happy and had everything we needed. We ate hilton diamond and were upgraded to ocean view and the room was comfortable. We had no problem at all with the self parking, check in, the ferry to the island, or the size of the resort. The funicular was only a wait when we took the last ferry of the day from the island and they took one of the funiculars out of service on new years eve. We didn't play golf but thought the course looked great. We ate breakfast at Starbucks which meant long lines. The food at the Japanese hibachi was very good but pricey. The sushi was also good. Our dinner at the seafood restaurant was just ok and pricey. Overall we thought the location was beautiful and palomino island was perfect. We truly enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Aging Gracefully, but needs a major facelift”
Reviews.Author: mjackson9548
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the EL Conquistador Resort (ECR), Monday, December 26th, thru Jan 1, 2012. The location of the ECR is fabulous with grand views of the Ocean, Rain Forest, Palomino island. The natural beauty of the surrounding areas is gorgeous! The service staff at the resort is willing but woefully understaffed and not able to keep pace with the needs and demands of the Resort guests. The tram/trolly cars (there are two) that travel from the Resort level to the Marina level were in constant repair mode and out of service for much of the time, resulting in long lines for use of the single car in service. The cars took turns breaking down, so it was never the same car out of order. We had an issue with our room as well and after the first night we changed to a different room due to the must and mildew issue. The highlight of the stay was a trip to the El Yunque Rain forrest for a three hour hike. The casino is adequate and some of the BlackJack dealers were fun to interact with while others never cracked a smile. I dined at all three of the upscale restaurants while at the ECR, with the Strip House (steaks)being my favorite and the Chinese/Japanese being good as well. The Italian restaurant suffers from major Service issues starting with the front desk, Servers, on down the line. As long as you understand up front the resort is basically in Cash Cow mode, meaning the owners are trying to maximize profit maybe with the intentions of investing in uplift of the property then go ahead and stay at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing vacation but could use some upgrades...”
Reviews.Author: homremdies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 daughters (12 and 15) just got back from Christmas week at the Conquistador and had an absolutely amazing time! Our trip started off on the right foot thanks to Noel, the hotel manager. Unhappy with our initial room, Noel worked with us until midnight to help get us settled. He was absolutely wonderful! The location and amenities at the Conquistador are quite impressive. The hotel is built into the mountain and the views from almost any location are spectacular. We spent almost every day at the beach and loved the 7 minute boatride to and from Palomino Island. There are tons of activities there to keep everyone happy but the menu doesn't change so we did get tired of the same lunch everyday. The waterpark is also nice for families but we only went once. While our vacation was top notch, there is definitely room for improvements (big and small): 1. The rooms are desperately in need of renovation. Although we LOVED the location and view of our room in the Marina, the carpeting is old, bathrooms a little mildewy, the decor needs to be updated etc. This was the case in all three rooms we saw and our friends who were at the resort felt the same. 2. NOTHING is included! The resort charges extra for everything--entry to the water park, menu sharing charges, water bottles, entry to the disco, etc. None of the bars at the hotel put out snack mix to munch on. They have an all inclusive option (which we didn't take advantage of) but I noticed that most of the restaurants charged a $5 pp fee for meal plan guests. On our last day at the resort I noticed they had marshmallows and chocolate in the lobby at 3pm but most people are at the pool, waterpark and/or beach at that time. 3. There's NO entertainment. Most Caribbean resorts offer shows at night. The only show at the resort was a magic show one night and the hotel charged a fee to see it. Overall, food and location are excellent. But this is a pricey resort once you get there.

Reviews.Title: “this aint no waldorf”
Reviews.Author: art3344
Reviews.Content: been here several times with kids but its keeps getting worse....our last visit for sure good facilities ...pools, water park etc on site restaurants 2x overpriced with poor offerings compared to local off site restaurants ie estacion and calizo etc...use the concierge desk dive facility only ok for beginners room not only not ready when we arrived @ 6pm but was dirty when we got into it @ 7 pm 2 finiculars which literally pulls the facility together are down for certain sections >50% of time...great inconvenience as they bus you on a '5min' -20 min trip DO NOT STAY IN THE LAS OLAS SECTION OF RESORT ITS AN AFTERTHOUGHT AREA in room wirelees works 40% of time ( excuse = our ATT service doesnt support windows 7 but sometimes it does ??? ) friendly, assured but really mostly uninformed staff decaf coffee in coffee shop = $3.50 but its instant...this is a Waldorf?

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a family holiday trip”
Reviews.Author: SSCCardinal
Reviews.Content: I agree pretty much with everything treepalm stated. We (11 people, from 16 to 80, in four rooms) just returned from a six night stay at El Conquistador. My wife and I had visited previously; everyone else was a first-timer. Our entire group enjoyed the resort and thought it was the perfect place for our first "destination Xmas." Is ElCon perfect? Absolutely not. Most complaints, however, can be attributed to its size (large) and to its location (Caribbean, where one must accept that things are just ... different). I find it part of the charm. If you want everything perfect and two minutes ago, go somewhere else. I found the staff extremely friendly and guest-oriented. I had an internet problem, and the hotel's internet guy (thanks Bernie!!!) literally spent hours with me over two days in an effort to fix it. The resort was sold out between Xmas and New Years, and that in turn stressed the on-site restaurants. I saw many restaurant employees literally running in order to provide service. We found ourselves without a reservation one night, approached one casual place, and watched waiters set up a new table for us. The hotel is large and a bit spread out, not only horizontally but vertically. Most of the resort rooms are up on a cliff with the main building, the golf and spa, and all the meeting rooms. Some of the rooms, two restaurants, and the modest water park are down on the water level, where one catches the ferry over to ElCon's private island beach. One rides one of the two funiculars to change levels. Our group never had trouble with either the ferries or the funiculars. The layout of the resort actually can be an advantage: It offers guests several options for how close one wants to be to the main building, the water park, the golf, the spa, the shuttle service to the private beach island, etc. Our room was large enough, nicely if sparsely furnished, and well equipped. The bathroom was fine. the golf course is difficult, well designed (Arthur Hills, for those who know architects), and fairly well maintained. I would discourage you from renting a car on your first visit, because you really do not need to leave the premises for entertainment or recreation. There are a couple of good restaurants nearby, and you can take a taxi there. You also can rent a car at the resort for a day trip to the rain forest (a bit of a tough drive, experience and views worthwhile). I encourage you to try ElCon. It's a nice place, with nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Too big”
Reviews.Author: JoeSMichigan
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel, due to the reviews I have seen. But, once I got here, I immediately felt like I had made a mistake. It took 20 minutes to check in, and we were the only ones in line! The front desk mentioned that we should "keep this explanation of the meal plan to show to the wait staffs, so there are no problems". I didn't really understand what she meant until later. The place is so big, it seems as though the staff is not aware of the policies of their own hotel. Each meal was an adventure as to what would he covered. The hotel is so big that it typically takes 15 to 20 minutes just to get to the breakfast restaurant that is part of our meal plan. It actually takes 15 to 20 to get anywhere. 3 elevators and a funicular. God forbid, you forget something in your room! The final straw was when we wanted to go to the pool for a quick dip (usually 15 minutes), the funicular was broken! They were shuttling people in busses, which had long lines to get on. The beach is nice, but it takes about 30 mins to get there, plus waiting for boat, waiting for towels, finding spot etc., it adds up... I would not return here, I suggest you do not come here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - do not use Integrity Charters and Captain George”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkcty
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, Palomino Island was fun. Only downside was Captain George and Integrity Charters - he was dishonest, grossly overpriced, served lousy food, conducted business the entire trip, and barely took the boat away from the marina - the worst in the Caribbean!

Reviews.Title: “All Is Well at the El Conq”
Reviews.Author: Treepalm
Reviews.Content: Our family first visited the El Cong 2.5 years ago and had a wonderful time. Returned this Christmas for five nights and had another great time. As was the case before our first trip, we were a bit concerned about all the negative reviews but again walked away feeling very pleased with the place. I think that many people may end being disappointed with this hotel because it is branded as a Waldorf hotel and expect a five star type of resort ad service. This is not a 5 star hotel in terms of both quality and service. It is more like a 4 star hotel with service that tends to be on par with what people can find in this part of the world. If you are coming here expecting the Ritz or the Four Seasons you will likely be very disappointed. The hotel is also huge with something like 900 rooms (?), made primarily of concrete and therefore feels very much like an all-inclusive. Having said that it is also considerably less expensive than a 5 star resort and we actually found it to be very good value for the time of year. Many people seem disappointed by the additional fees but we booked the hotel directly on-line at their web site where it was made clear that there was a 14% resort fee and 11% tax on top of the room price. Yes, if you need/want a car the $15 self parking fee is a bit steep but I recently paid $10 to self park my car at a Westin hotel outside Toronto. We even found the food prices to be fair for a resort and were impressed to see that most of the restaurants had reasonably priced kids menus. We also rented a car and had dinner nearby off-site which we would recommend. We enjoyed staying up at the Las Vista building and not having to go up and down the funicular too often. It is also close to the main pools and parking lot. Our room was modern looking with high ceilings and clean. Bathroom was large but the tub/shower had been re-furbished and was fine. We all enjoyed taking the ferry over to their private island but I can see how some people would find this a bit of a drag. We found the beach itself was very nice but a bit of sheels and small coral in ocean so could to have those slip on water shoes (they sell there). My brother in law did not have them and he was fine playing ball with us in the water. They had a basketball court there and we had fun shooting hoops; a free putting green; some kids size soccer nets and balls to shoot around with; volleyball net. Kayaks and jet skis to rent. My sister went on a short hike around to a cove which she said was beautiful. At main pools we had no issues with towels or finding chairs. Pool temps a bit chilly but this is also par for the course in the caribbean where you rarely find a heated pool. We did enjoy the heated jacuzzi. Played ping pong. Tennis was free as was nice gym at Golden Door spa. Free wi-fi. Mini fridge in room and lots of space as no mini bar. Waterpark was fun but this is no Wet n Wild - 1 body slide, 1 tube slide, 1 speed slide and a lazy river. Go after 1:30 as 40% off and quieter. We did not go to the Casino but this is no Las Vegas. All in all we had a great time and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: Nalakcaj
Reviews.Content: We arrived at noon and weren't able to get into our room until 4:30. But, understanding that check in wasn't until 4:00 and looking out over the spectacular view of the ocean and palomino island and being upgraded to an ocean view room made the wait bearable. The view from our room was incredible. Awakening to the sunrise each morning at 7:00 started the day. The rooms are clean and large. Food is very expensive at the hotel (think NYC dinner prices) but good. We opted to pay a driver take us to the market to buy snacks and soda to save some $$. (There aren't fridges in the rooms, but there is ice available). Palomino island is beautiful. There is coral just before entering the water, but once you are in the ocean the sand is smooth and the water turquoise crystal clear. We took a ride up the mountain on the horses available. The guides were great especially to our ten year old son. The ride up was very steep but once at the top the views were breath taking. It is worth the price. If you are able take the early boat over as the island gets vey crowded by 11:00. We opted to get a private tour of the rain forest instead of going on the hotel tour. Alex and Miguel at Platinum Luxury Transportation (ptslimo.com) were the perfect choice. Alex drove us to the entrance of the forest so we could view the introductory film. He then drove us to La Coca Falls. He caught a small lizard and showed our son how to open it's mouth and hang it from his ear lobe! Our son said it didn't even hurt! We then went on to see the Yokahu Tower and then hiked from Palo Colorado to La Mina Falls. It was an amazing experience. We didn't see any wildlife but the trees and ferns were beautiful as were the falls (bring a bathing suit)! Alex's suburban was well equipped and new. Definitely take this tour instead of the hotel's tour. My husband played golf and although expensive the course was challenging and beautiful. The only downside was the expense of the food and how crowded it was over Christmas break.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, great sights, great quadriceps workout!”
Reviews.Author: dittoheadadt
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the place is built on a cliff. Accept that. It ain't gonna change, save an act of God. The views are plentiful, and spectacular. The facility is equally spectacular, whether you're at the hotel or at Las Casitas. The ocean view rooms are spacious and comfortable and in great locations. The food? Don't know; we "brown-bagged" it because of our experience at Gran Melia the week before (uber expensive). Yes, we realize it's a resort and all that that implies, but just because I can afford unreasonable food prices doesn't mean I'll do so. That may be my only complaint, and admittedly it's not a biggie. There are ways around it, or you can just suck it up for a few days and pay it. Pools are everywhere. Palomino Island was a big hit with those of us who went there. The driving range is terrific (didn't have time for golf, so I can't weigh in on the course), as are the pro shop personnel. In fact, hotel personnel to a man/woman were splendid and helpful, ready with an eager smile and a helping hand. Plenty of shops available on-site, so you can fill your bags with a variety of good (or tacky) souvenirs. All in all it's a good value at a great resort. We'll return again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...but not a great place for those seeking local flavor”
Reviews.Author: oaksm
Reviews.Content: My preference when traveling is to stay at a bed and breakfast or local boutique hotel - somewhere that had lots of character, is run by local folks and allows for an off the beaten path. The El Conquistador is admittedly as grandiose as all other reviews have noted, with beautiful vistas, a funicular that takes you up and down the cliff side, a relaxing marina and pools at most levels. Staff are eager to help and will engage you in pleasant conversation. The restaurants at the resort, however, are memorable for there high prices and lack of innovation. Who wants to eat Italian, Chinese food, or steak while in Puerto Rico? I had to go outside the resort to get real Puerto Rican food. The place is also sprawling, with walks from the lower rooms to the lobby taking 15 to 20 minutes...not good for this gal who was there for a conference and had to be at the conference rooms by 830. But, if I were here on a honeymoon, I would really enjoy the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Picturesque !!”
Reviews.Author: Bades54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2011. Nice resort with elevated views (300' cliff) overlooking the private marina and rugged coastline. Food was excellent, grounds were impeccable. The golf course is one of the nicest in the Caribbean, with a great Pro Shop. One of the nicest features of this resort, is the private island (Palomino Island), which boasts beautiful sand beaches and has a beach bar/restaurant as well as a souvenir shop. The hotel offers free water taxi service every hour to hotel guests - and is well worth the experience.
