Due to its' location on a cliffside, there a two self directed trolley cars running 24/7 from the main building down to the waterfront, where you will also find quaint little shops and a great Oceanside tavern right at the marina. This resort has a convention center which is second to none. Although my wife & I were here on business, we felt like we were on vacation, due to the casual atmosphere and tropical setting of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Seriously surprised at just how good this one was”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: I am not writing this b/c I was woo'ed by the staff to do so. This is a retreat. The rooms are set in the side of a cliff and you take motorized lifts to and from the main part of the hotel. There is a private island with all the amenities and you can canoe to a luminescence bay and see a ridiculous oddity of nature in that these tiny organisms give off light if they come into contact with anything, such as your hand or canoe paddle. There is much more but just trust that the place should charge 3-4 times what they do

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Corporate Golf Outing !!”
Reviews.Author: Ralph1954
Reviews.Content: Great Golf and Service on the course. Private Beach. Water Park for the Kids! Private Marina and great Restaurants. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 20th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: m4squad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the villa section. Spent 4 days at the resort and it was one of the best experiences of my life. Golf course was fun and different. Spa was top notch. Service was fantastic. Water park and private island provided great times. The only downside was the price and quality of the meals at the resort restaurants. We went to a local spot one night and for a third of the price we got a much better meal. Hope to return for my 25th with the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but it is a resort”
Reviews.Author: Audja
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a top floor Las Brisas oceanfront room. View was great, room and bed were nice but I would have designed the bathroom/dressing room/closet area differently. I'm not a big fan of the closet being in the same area as the bathroom. No big deal--I can adapt--it's only my home for a couple of nights! The beach at Palomino Island was the highlight of our stay at El Conq. It was busy during our week before Xmas, but was not crowded at all and had plenty of chairs and space. The water waves and temp were mild but I prefer stronger waves and deeper water. My only complaint is that we could have been staying anywhere. There is very little sense of being in Puerto Rico other than the large caged birds in the lobby. Most of the restaurants are generic, although there are one or two PR specialties available. I am glad that we came here after having spent a few days in San Juan and driving around the island.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but...”
Reviews.Author: VoyageFromNYC
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador was decent overall, but needs to improve. The activities work well for the kids, especially the waterpark. Good pools and beach. It was crowded with what seemed like daytrippers on the weekend, but calmed down a bit during the week. The facilities are a bit run down and the cleanliness was a bit questionable, but the room was relatively clean. The hotel run restaurants leave a lot to be desired, and should be improved. One funicular was out of service during our stay, which made it tough to get around with the kids. Also got stuck in it one day and it broke down another day leaving no operating funicular at all. Service was good and the people at the hotel were great, a real saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, romantic and incredible vacations”
Reviews.Author: Carla J
Reviews.Content: I hadnt have so much fun in a hotel resort since I was a kid! This place has everything and for all ages! Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but expensive food!”
Reviews.Author: Johanna1d
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the property especially because it was very kid friendly. We loved the pools and the waterpark. Our children especially enjoyed the private island. The spa was great, too (had a massage) However, the workout area within the hotel was not as well- equipped at the Golden Door Spa workout area. The food was very expensive, and not many authentic dishes. Our favorite spot was the Marina restaurant -- loved the Ballyhoo quesadillas (pork based). The drinks were expensive but excellent, especially the mojitos. I celebrated my birthday there and they treated me to a dessert from their sister restaurant. great servers! We did visit La Estacion (a restaurant near the resort which was still expensive but well worth it). Overall,we enjoyed our stay but wish the food prices were less and that the restaurants served more local fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great view...all else????”
Reviews.Author: rslukas
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds/great view. The hotel/rooms are dated and WORN. Lets see....one elevator was broken down, one escalator was broken, one of the two funicula was not working, sliding glass door was off the track, an electrical panel cover on the ceiling came crashing down in the middle of the night, could not get out of the self parking lot with my "paid" ticket, dried stale rolls for our sandwiches at one restaurant, pools not heated. The front desk and concierge/bellman and housekeeping staff were all very friendly. Would not return...not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed ourselves at beach and on the golf course.”
Reviews.Author: Retiree2007
Reviews.Content: Expansive Resort. The hotel buildings need some further refurb/updating. We enjoyed a pricey round of morning golf at a great course with slope in excess of 135. We had some good meals at the Resort "dinner only" option restaurants, but found the "cafes" to be the better values. The registration process was very efficient and we were allowed an early checkin. The "complementary" water taxi (catamaran) to the Resort Palamino Island beach property (service every 20 minutes) was quick but sometimes rough depending on wind speed. We went to the Resort's Coqui Water Park, daily/half day fee, and were allowed to see the Park without fee to determine if we wanted to use it at a later time. The Palamino Island beach property is well maintained and managed, and water activities available for an additional fee were extensive - certainly a day outting during our stay. The Resort has many exceptional activities but does require additional fees for some above the Resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Views”
Reviews.Author: Vidal A
Reviews.Content: I am a firm believer that the experiences that we have are directly correlated with our own attitude. That said, I must say that this resort may not be the best or most â€œfancyâ€�; however, my family and I had an outstanding time. The experience began excellently at the front desk when Luis M upgraded our room to an ocean view because I decided to ask just to see if I can get lucky. Next, our luggage guy, Efrain, made us feel like just another of his family members and gave all the ins and outs of the resort and the Fajardo area. These two set the stage for the rest of the stay and made the very few little issues meaningless. Overall, it may be considered a bit overpriced; although, the available activities, such as their beautiful private Palomino Island, make the experience very special.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Place But Could Use an Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: LuvTraveling143
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, although a little run down. The little "elevator" from the levels along the cliff - there are two and one was broke (and had been broke for a month when we got there). One night the other one broke and it took us an hour to get to our rooms because they had to bus us around. It had a lot to do and some great restaurants. Water park was nice and the service was very friendly. Drinks are EXPENSIVE!! Buy your own mixing ingredients and make your own. Don't eat anything friend at the little cafe down by the marina - gave me the worst food poisoning ever on the second day of the trip...wasn't myself for the rest of it. Oceanview rooms are just as nice...extra money for Las Olas may not have been worth it. Palomino Island was the best. Although don't swim out too far - jelly fish (they won't sting though). Blossoms restaurant was not the best.... But all in all....I would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Smartflyer
Reviews.Content: What a great property. Got an upgrade to an Ocean view room in building three. Outstanding panoramic view of the sea and the hotel island. The resort fee includes a free boat ride to the hotel's private island which has a beach, restaurant, Volleyball, etc. Self parking is 15 dollars and a short walk away from the hotel but just walking around this gorgeous property (say to the Gym which was pretty good, or to the parking which also has a shuttle bus ) you are surrounded by amazing views. Didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants but got coffee from the Resort Starbucks. I am glad I didn't stay at San Juan which is ok but nowhere near as beautiful as the vast resort. Definitely a great place and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We were Wowed by the Views!”
Reviews.Author: mountainmama79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for one night pre-cruise. Although it is about an hour drive from San Juan, we found it to be well worth the time and effort. The property is gorgeous! The staff was friendly and helpful from the time we pulled up to the lobby. Our room had a french balcony overlooking the pools and an ocean view. We spent the morning just walking the property. The scenery is breathtaking from the ocean to the mountains. Very convenient to El Yunque rainforest. Be aware there is a charge to park and the restaurants can be pricey. There is a Walmart on the drive in for anything you want to pick up. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: tonytronic
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a special so we got our rooms for a very reasonable price. The facilities are beautiful and the rooms are nice, have large bathrooms and beautiful views throughout. Also, there is a complimentary boat shuttle to the resorts private island and rent includes admission to the waterpark. The only downside is that the prices in the resort (e.g., $10 for a tuna sandwich, $5.50 for a 10oz can of beer) are a bit exorbitant, but there are some stores nearby and people were also ordering in pizza. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: slattmando
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Conquistador for a company event and it was awesome! The room was clean and nicely decorated and the spa was over the top! Palomino island was great but it did get to be mildly irritating having to ride the funicular up and down to the ferry. All of the restaurants were very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Love the beach property”
Reviews.Author: maggie44113
Reviews.Content: While this sprawling resort has a lot to offer, unfortunately the hotel buildings need a lot of updating/repairs. I enjoyed two rather pricey yet luxurious spa treatments in the lovely Golden Door Spa and had some excellent meals at the resort restaurants yet I hesitated to give this a 4 star due in part to some preparedness issues. When we arrived, the check in line was very long so we went outside to enjoy the patio bar - however, they did not have any cold beer! So we went to the pool bar where they did not have any limes! While the staff was apologetic and attentive, for the prices charged, I would expect far better. While we waited for the ferry/shuttle to the beach property one morning [they only were providing service once per hour] we wanted to go to the pool down by the Marina but were told that we had to pay an entrance fee to Coqui Park, the slide park which adjoins the pool. It should be available to all guests of the resort at no charge, especially since we did not want to use the slide park, only wait poolside for the next ferry. The beach property is very nicely maintained and managed - the beach service somewhat sporadic but the water and wonderful weather we had more than made up for that. All in all, the property has some exceptional features yet needs attention and updating.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning visually, warm hospitality, a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: gringoron
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Generally excellent staff. Rooms are dated. Resort food mediocre: get a car and try local panaderias for breakfast and Calizo, La Estacion and Metropol for lunch/dinner. A real find: Racar's Seafood in Las Croabas. Mix own drinks with local DonQ rum if you want to save $. Driving own car: watch for potholes and erratic drivers, drive defensively, consider prayer. Consider visiting Humacao, 45 minutes to south, if you seek a local retirement resort. For Old Town, consider parking on outskirts to avoid extremely narrow streets and use free trolley inside Old Town. El Yunque: arrive early to avoid rain/mosquitos and carry water on trails. Seek help of Conceirge to avoid bad areas, especially at night. Self-parking is adequate, so no need to use valet service. Palomino Island: nice, but bring repellent if bugs are a concern.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: vicky s
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Conquistador with my family over Thanksgiving break. I had an amazing time over the few days that we stayed at the hotel. The rooms were great, the service excellent, and the beach was like sitting in paradise. The hotel manager, Dermot, was extremely helpful to our family needs on numerous occasions. The hotel is perfect for people of all ages, from the water park to several pools, to a private beach and small casino (although I would not suggest planning a trip to the hotel just for gambling). Overall, I thought the food was great. The prices were a little high, but well worth it. This was my third time at the El Conquistador and I hope to go many more times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: jerry1844
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. The rooms could use some updating but that was happening while we were there so I'm sure it will be taken care of soon. The water park was great for both kids and adults. The private island had gorgeous beaches great food and perfect clear water. The staff was super friendly and went out of their way to take care of families and kids which seems to be rare in a resort of this caliber! The only real complaint I have is that the food was outrageously priced. It seems like they know that there really in't anywhere off resort property for you to go eat if you don't have a car so they think they can charge whatever they want. My wife and I (our kids are both under 2 so don't eat much) spent over $500 on food and drinks (we are not heavy drinkers) in 3 days! We only ate at one of the nice restaraunts one night and split that meal. As long as you are prepared for that or have a car it's not a big deal though.

Reviews.Title: “Once In A Lifetime, A Hotel and experience to remember”
Reviews.Author: trendy2
Reviews.Content: Thanksgiving 2011 our family of 6 adults and 2 children went to Fajardo, Puerto Rico to see 3 extended family members and we stayed at this marvelous hotel. It was an experience of a lifetime. It also owns an island which you go to on their ferries. On this island you are provided towels and beach chairs. You can buy your drinks and food there at their open bar. The adults and children loved this experience. This Hilton Hotel has a huge central hallway with 2 parrot cages, shops, a casino, restaurants...just about everything you want so one has fun browsing. You fly to San Juan, rent a car for it takes an hour to get there. Look it up on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and friendly, but deceptive billing and some noise”
Reviews.Author: CYLau
Reviews.Content: The grounds and rooms are gorgeous. Staff is friendly. And Palomino island (accessed by hotel ferry) is a wonderful retreat with numerous nice lizards. We enjoyed relaxing here after several days of being in the mountains. On the downside, our room was across from a party room where hooting and hollering went late into the first night of our stay. The hotel is unable to provide earplugs, but is cheerful about assuring you the noise will end soon (though it does not). Also, we were told that our rate included free local calls. We sought to confirm this in the hotel manual. But the phone info section had been removed. The concierge advised us that local calls included those throughout PR, but we found out this was not true when we recieved our bill. Despite the hotel admitting that it advised us all PR calls were included, they refused to remove them from the bill. Although I did enjoy my stay until I saw the calls on the bill, I would be very hesitant to return due to the deceptive practices of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bar Iguana at Palomino island”
Reviews.Author: Wilfredovr
Reviews.Content: I was yesterday at Palomino island and bartenders Diana and Betzaida are excellent. They provided good service and always with a smile! A+

Reviews.Title: “Sprawling, Clean, Well Appointed, A good Choice.”
Reviews.Author: ExoticDave
Reviews.Content: I have looked over several of the reviews by other people who have stayed at this property. Some of them are rather scathing. My experience found the property properly priced (you're in a resort btw, not McDonalds), clean, friendly, and the proper escape that I needed. Firstly, the place does charge for parking. You are somewhat at their mercy because you are in the middle of nowhere (almost). So you need to be ready to pay a premium for such a location. Next, the place is sprawling across the top (and bottom) of a bluff overlooking the sea. With that, you will have some walking to do to get to your room. Once there, the room (2321) was nicely positioned with our own (semi-private) pool. The pool was clean, the hot tub was hot, but their was no bar at this level of the resort. No problem. I procured drinks from the Main pool, them made my way using the cable car elevators back to "my" pool. The room was HUGE. It had a coffee maker featuring Puerto Rican yaucono coffee, wonderful products, a large comfy bed, plenty of pillows, a patio with chairs, plenty of lighting, a tub, and TV. Give this place a chance. I had a wonderful time here, especially when I went to one of their "special" beaches on their private island. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, did I say beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: Valerie K
Reviews.Content: The previous two days we had spent at the Ritz in San Juan with no ability to open the windows, so staying here was amazing. The ocean view room is the only way to go. I sat for many hours sipping a cocktail and just watching the incline and activity at the marina. We stayed at 4 different resorts during our visit and liked this the best. We ate at the Italian restaurant and found the food decent, service average for Puerto Rico. I will definately go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Memory thanks to a great staff....”
Reviews.Author: Yunquemarsita
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting this property since I was younger with my family, and this was absoluetly the best time I have ever had. Although the property has not changed physically, the location and amenities are very worth it (lot's of pools to choose from, Private Island with a great beach, lots of restaurants to choose from, close to El Yunque, golf, tennis, etc). When you go on a trip whether local tourist or not, you want to take a memory back with you and that is what my husband and I got thanks to the excellent service of the staff. Smiles, good Morning's, helpful attitudes all contributed to our trip. I have to mention Betzaida at Iguana's was awesome, Luis G at front desk very accomodating, Diane and Gian at Stingray's on our 2nd night made up for our only complaint (unprofessional service at the Strip House on the night of our Anniversary) with there very warm and professional approach, Richard and Elizabeth (best therapists at the Spa), and especially Grace and Tati from the Spa that before we arrived already made us feel welcome and motivated us to go back a 2nd time during our mini-vaca. I would say that the restaurant prices are a little on the too high side, but Overall would always highly recommend and can't wait to go back!!!! If you can only eat one nice elegant dinner, Stingrays was great in food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this property”
Reviews.Author: buho66
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a stay at El Conquistador....the only thing "conquering" about this property is the "high cost" of everything. One gets the impression from the moment you set foot in the lobby is that "something is amiss"...You don't get that sense of "happiness"..."real vacation feel"...Perhaps it's because the hotel staff suffers from a lack of direction and leadership with a singular goal: make the visitor feel welcome and want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: LaurenBlauvelt
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for a conference the week of November 6th. Overall the resort is very pretty and well maintained, showing some slight signs of wear in the bathrooms and around the property. Our room was very spacious but the lighting was so poor, with only 1 light in the entire room. We ate at the Strip House (very risque pictures...don't bring the kids), Las Brisa, Iguanas and two other grills. All the meals were good, and the prices were a little high...but not unexpected from a resort. The pools were very nice, and there were many areas available with lounge chairs and shade to relax outside. Although you have to take elevators down to one level, and then a sort of mountain monorail down to the marina to catch a boat to the beach, we never waited that long nor minded the journey. The boats are large and quite nice, and very timely. We enjoyed Palamino Island very much, shopped there, had drinks and lunch -- quite enjoyable. I did not pay for the room...so am unsure of the cost, but the experience was very pleasant and I would go there again if I had the chance. Also keep in mind you are an hour from San Juan. I traveled to the rain forest which was great...and out to dinner one night outside the resort. It was easy to get to both places, as the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: JeffSmargiassi
Reviews.Content: The resort is excellent.Their private island is very nice.Their staff was great.Everybody had a smile and made us feel very welcomed.The rooms were spacious and clean.At check-in we were told there would be a $950.00 "hold "($150.00/day) on our credit card to offset resort charges during our stay.Since we don't use credit cards, this was a problem.We worked out a cash deposit with the Desk Manager.This hold charge was never mentioned prior to our arrival.Our trip was paid in full so this was an unpleasant surprize.There is no entertainment at night and the fine dining restaurants were way over priced.Being in the restaurant business,we felt the restaurants were not worth the value.A few people said the restaurants were just ok but not worth what they were charging.That being said, the resort itself was very nice and you couldn't ask for a better staff.Everybody went out of their way to make us feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Really Loved this Place”
Reviews.Author: KS5959
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this wonderful resort last week. It is beautiful. Yes you can nitpick over tiny things but in the overall picture, it was awesome. The views are amazing, the staff was excellent.polite and quick follow up, If something was not working, it was fixed right away. It's a great place for kids. The water park is very cool. The day I left it was raining and they were playing a movie for kids and they had games set out everywhere.Pools are great, never a problem finding a chair. I found the food great, the steak house especially. Their island is so peaceful. No it is not brand new but it has lots of charm and class unlike the cookie cutter resorts I have been too. Don't listen to the stupid gripes people have made on here. So petty !

Reviews.Title: “The Blaxstone Report - Driving a Beauty into the Ground”
Reviews.Author: ARK_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Quick take: Great Property however Management issues & Nickle-&-Diming. The private island beach was slightly littered with trash and looked like a hurricane had recently destroyed it (but alas there was no recent hurricane in March 2011!). This hotel is really beautiful. It reminds one of the Greek island of Santorini with a classy resort at the top, and steep cliffs that descend to the sea. The scenery is quite breathtaking, and worth at least a drive-by visit. The hotel itself is a very large. It has two cable cars the connect the upper and lower portions of the resort. The Casitas, at least from the outside, don't appear to be worth the extra cost as most vacationers would come over to the regular hotel. The hotel is really geared for families, not couples or romantics. Positives: + Overall a great property with beautiful seascapes and layout + Really nice lobby + Nice pool area with several options + Resort has a Starbucks on-site in addition to several other stores Negatives: - Beach looked like it had been destroyed by severe weather in certain areas - Water was littered with rocks and very hard to walk into on the private island - Drinks were weak and small - The main breakfast buffet area had quite a spread but the area smelled really disgusting - like the room was cleaned with dirty water because the staff didn't want to use soap - Most rooms are dated and really old - Tried to charge me for parking my rental car, which I had rented on-site - Clientele at the hotel wasn't great - lots of people lacking manners which can be expected at a mega-resort anyway. - Jacuzzi: some people would get in, then turn it off. - Hotel had a leak next to the elevators, and instead of fixing it, used a giant fan to try to dry it up. (you can't make this stuff up!!!) I got the impression that because the Conquistador is now run by a financial company instead of a hotelier, they are specifically running it with minimum cash. When the financial company bought the Conquistador and related hotels, they purchased it on debt. With the state of the economy and financial markets, they are sparing no dime on the upkeep of the property. Personally, the hotel could have been nice (and probably was super elegant at one time), however I probably won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good trip.”
Reviews.Author: Localsonly421
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading prevoius reviews. Overall this resort was just ok. The only real problem I had occured upon arival and check in. Our family requested two rooms connecting. They mixed up our reservation and could not provide the request. We were very upset and after an hour the desk clerk finally was able to accomidate us but then tried to charge us for an "upgrade." We made it to the room and my room key does not work. No supprise here. Dinner at Stingrays was ok. Pools were a little dirty. Palomino Island was about the best thing going for this place. Water park was kind of a let down. It is open to the public and on the Saturday we decided to go it was packed with locals and there not enough inner tubes available and we has to wait for a while to get one for the slides. The gym was outdated but all equipment functioned. I was treated well by the staff. We did rent a car and travel around a little. The beautiful views and the private island would bring me back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, tasteful and wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: dewong07
Reviews.Content: I've traveled the caribbean a lot (I mean a lot, since I was 2) and this place has it down with the customer service, and providing a quality stay value. Yes, as some have griped here the food is pricey but it's of decent quality and you're at a resort and that's always the expectation. Yes there is some nickeling and long walks but you're not staying at HoJos people. It's 4-5 star and they work hard to keep get there where the majority are posers or overdo it and you pay even more. You simply can't beat the service at this place. We stayed in on the Ocean View side of the main building Las Brisas, and with minor issues they were there in minutes on almost every issue and had great follow through. This was from the hotel services to the bars to the restaurants. Everyone has been trained great and really knows what it means to provide good service. Palomino Island ferry service and the island itself and the pools, as well as all the activities for every flavor and the kids was amazing. My daughter loved the water park which is a total value after 1:30p or 3p. Totally would stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Captive Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lori1352
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort with magnificent views. However, we felt as though we were being held captive on the property for several reasons. The surrounding area is impoverished to say the least with the appearance of high crime (bars on windows and chain link barbed wire fences) and we were uncomfortable venturing off of the resort. We would have liked to visit Old San Juan however it was cost prohibitive. The resort does not offer reasonable shuttle services. They require a minimum number of 6 people. A taxi would have cost in excess of $200.00. If you plan on visiting El Conquistador we would suggest that you look for a good deal on a rental car prior to arrival and take your GPS.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special...Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Trippingman
Reviews.Content: I was there on business. I stayed in the main area of the resort. I found the food to be of food service quality. The room was run of the mill. Certainly not luxurious. Getting to the beach was a major pain in the rear. Why? Because getting to the beach requires a ride down the funicular plus a boat ride. If you forget something in your room you'll have a long trip back. I don't recommend this resort to families with small children because of the size of the property and the difficulties associated with even the most mundane tasks. I don't happen to think this property offers a very good value for the cost. For a property with the Waldorf Astoria name associated with it, it leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Never again this property”
Reviews.Author: Travelondollar
Reviews.Content: WHY NOT EL CONQUISTADOR: - It is an impersonal resort with the least customer centric staff - If you have booked through priceline, you will stay in the left most wing which is their oldest or most inferior - They believe in servicing mass booking groups like corporates. If you are a family and above all booked via priceline and stay in the left most wing, you will be invisible - It is a sea of people, mostly corporates and the feel it lends to the place is quite noisy, business like and not a restful easy vacation stay. - Our tub backed up twice during our 4 day stay and they were not able to resolve the issue. - Insects/ roaches keep crawling on the floor - The carpets/ rugs feel over used and not clean - Housekeeping staff makes more noise than all guests put together - IT DOES NOT FEEL LIKE WALDORF. - My best closest comparison is a candle wood suite I would never stay here again!! I would be happier booking myself at San Juan. It is more charming and has many options in terms of things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it for any price”
Reviews.Author: Madeleinne Z
Reviews.Content: Every problem other reviewers mentioned are not exaggerations. Let's list, refrigerator -which I called about beforehand and was told by hotel was a frig, was not. Rather a "cooler"- really? I had baby bottles to keep cold. Las olas the part of the resort we stayed in was renovated, but had a very large cockroach in the closet - yuck. Also, the only way to get to our hotel room -I kid you not is by 2 elevators, one of which was broken for 7 out of our nine days and then waiting for a funicular which also had one of two broken. Much of our vacation was wasted waiting, waiting for funiculars to come (make sure you press the button a lot- I can't tell you how many times it passed our stop (there are only 2 for goodness sake!) and we now added 10 minutes to our travel time to get to the lobby. Did I mention it rained one day, no big deal except there is no way to get from the funicular with 4 small children & an elderly mother without being outside a least a few minutes? There is no shelter, we were tired, wet and still had to climb 2fkights of stairs because las olas has no elevators either. The staff is nice enough but indifferent, making not much more than a nominal effort in everything. The bright point in out trip was the rainforest and a restaurant that the hotel seems to go out of it's way to not recommend, Ole LeLoLai. Lousy front desk, unhelpful concierge, why are you still reading , cancel now! Consider yourself warned. Oh, lots of hidden fees, like resort fee which upon checking I specifically asked and was told no, it was included, until it wasn't at checkout. I am so disgusted I am writing my first review while I am still in this place!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here - Not Even for a Deal!”
Reviews.Author: DCbeachlover0250
Reviews.Content: I emailed the general manager (Dermot Connolly) on 11/16 and still have yet to receive any response, or apology for the detailed problems I sent him about our stay. I echo a previous reviewers note that this place is an expensive hassle. During our 9 day stay we experienced terrible service (at several of the hotel restaurants, the concierge desk - worst concierge service I've ever seen and all we were trying to do was get a cab to the airport and book one tour, lounge service), the hotel was unequipped to handle the number of guests - it takes anywhere from 45 to 90 minutes to get to their private island from your room (they only have one operating funicular car because their other one is broken, and while their ferry seems large not everyone fits on the weekends), AC problems in our room, the fitness center included with your stay (not the one at the spa available for a daily charge) only has 50% of machines that are operational. If you want to go anywhere, rent a car. While there are cabs in fajardo, it will take you 10 minutes to find someone to ask for a cab, and another 20 minutes for a cab to come there (the hotel does not have cabs waiting nearby). On two occassions, we had waited past 30 minutes so we just gave up and ate at one of the restaurants on site. The icing on the cake was when we went to check out and were told someone would call us to walk through the final bill and email us a copy because their system was down. I've called the hotel and keep getting the run around to get a copy of my bill - but they had no problem charging my credit card 2 days after we left depsite no call and no copy of the bill. We got a decent deal to stay there, but all the inconveniences were not worth the vacation days from work. I commuted twice as long per day to go anywhere on their funicular and ferry than I do to work in a large city everyday. Waste of time off - waste of your money. Still cannot believe the hotel manager has not emailed me back - what a disappointment - service here sucks all around.

Reviews.Title: “Restful Trip”
Reviews.Author: tripsavvy
Reviews.Content: I did read some of the comments prior to booking this trip and here are mine. Our stay was for 4 days, and booked thru Costco Travel, its our first time dealing with them. I mention them because it's plays a part in our trip. Our trip was to just relax enjoy the beach Our package came with full breakfast buffet each day (the buffet was a wide selection of items to choose from, the only thing that was an add'l cost was omelets) we decided not to pay for any extra items since the buffet was hugh. Our room was booked with a garden view and 2 double beds when we arrived that wasn't available so they did offer to upgrade us to a ocean view (no charge). OMG what a view of the ocean can't say enough about the view, (the rooom was average, clean sheets and towels, the beds slept well, that are platform beds with pillow top mattress, its NOT the Waldorf from N.,Y standards) The property of this hotel is beautiful but massive would takes days to discover every feature of this property, and a little scooter or golf cart wouldn't hurt. If your handicapped you need a wheelchair or scooter to get around on the property a lot of walking to get to the elevators, the trolly train they have that takes you to each level in the property. You certainly couldn't walk to get out of the property and eat the local food its too far to walk. The prices are definitly high for simple items, burgers, chicken sandiwiches, flatbread pizzas. The drinks are over priced but tasty. They have their own personal beach but it's on a private island from the grounds which isn't far and they supple the boat to take you over to it, no fee for this service. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they suggested the local restaurants to eat at in the area, but you definitley need a car to get to them or walk thru the back ally to reach them off the premises, don't try that at night cause there are no lights in the back to see where to go, this is a deterrent from keeping the tourists from leaving the grounds and staying on the premises to eat and drink over priced foods. We were surprised that they didn't offer any native food of PR in the restaurants that was disappointing, we didn't want to eat american food but something different. finally to get back to Costco Travel our package also included a 100.00 tour credit. Nothing in the documents stating that if you don't have at least 4/6 people for a tour you DONT GO ON THE TOUR. The tour company 'Elegant Steering' doesnt tell you this until you call and setup a tour, nor does Costco travel tell you this either. Everyone seems to be in the 'LIGHT' but the customer, nothing is said at time of booking the trip or calling the tour company they continued to put us off saying that would try to find people to go on the tour with us, THAT DIDNT HAPPEN EITHER. Frustrated with the tour company and Costco, we rented a car (expensive) and with map in hands went to Old San Juan !! that was the only really disappointing thing about our visit to San Juan. Having said all this I still would return and do a few things differently. Elegance Steering wouldnt do business with them and Costco Travel not sure I would book any future trips with them. One last thing, the weather was Hot, Humid, rainy but only a few minutes every other day then sunny...bring plenty of sun screen, shorts, T-shirts, sneekers and hats....EnJOY.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views, but needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: ambassadortm
Reviews.Content: The Conquistador is a mixed bag. On the one hand you are in for very scenic views. On the other it is a resort that needs more investment, marketing, and better ways to connect it to the rest of Puerto Rico and San Juan. So it is up to this hotel to make it compelling enough for the traveler to choose this place over others in Puerto Rico beyond price alone or a golf course. This is a huge facility that needs a lot of upkeep and large volumes of traffic to make it profitable. I was attending a conference there and found: Rooms: Need renovation and improvements. Also many rooming areas are located at quite a distance from the front desk. Make sure you ask where your room is located and how long it takes to get to the entrance/front desk area. Look at the resort map to find the area of the Conquistador you want to stay at. My room was OK. Bathrooms: Good shower and hot water. Sink in my room had crack in it though. Again renovations needed. Internet: Currently provided by ATT Wireless but broadband signal could be stronger - some room for improvement needed here. A plus though - no extra charge for internet. I hate that annoying $12-$15 upcharge many hotels in Puerto Rico apply for internet access. Lobby and Area restaurants and bars: Good. Food quality and variety good. Casablanca night club is busy on weekends. Also a two pairs of live parrots both green amazon and blue hyacinth macaws, and a single white cockatoo (who loves to say "hola") add life and pleasant moments for bird lovers and families visiting the hotel. Casino: No craps tables or baccarat. Conference facilities: Ample, good lighting and acoustics in meeting rooms. Hotel Airport Bus transportation: Excellent. Best value to go back and forth to the hotel otherwise you are in for a very expensive taxi ride roundtrip. Car rental also a smart bet if you want to move around and not feel limited. Location: Hotel is about a one hour drive from San Juan. Plan activities accordingly. Customer Service: I did not have the same negative experience as others expressed here. However, I was not amazed by the customer service either. My experience was average. I had one issue where housekeeping did not get to my room until the late afternoon and only after I called to ask why my room had not been made up. However, the housekeeping staff were friendly and do a nice job.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Average”
Reviews.Author: bayberrie
Reviews.Content: After hearing so much about this property for many years, and knowing that it was quite a ride away from the airport and downtown San Juan, my expectations were high. And then to learn that its a Waldorf Astoria property, the brand image had me very excitied. After staying there for 4 days, I must say I was very disappointed. While the venue, the property and the views are spectacular, the building infrastructure itself is in BAD need of total renovation. This Grande Dame is definetly showing her age. Cracked plaster, dirty carpets, tired and dingy furniture throughout. A fitness center you'd expect to see at a Hampton Inn (no offense, but this is a "waldorf astoria resort" for heavens sake!). Cheesy casino... But the worst is the quality and appeal of the food. Awful. Really bad. Couldnt find fresh anything - fish, vegetables, fruit or a decent glass of wine to save my life. Even the burgers were hurtin''. The only saving grace is the onsite Starbucks. The pool and the private beach areas are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Closer to a Super 8 than a Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Lemarph81
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was an expensive hassle! Customer service was terrible. It took an hr to check in. The staff acted as though it was a chore to take excessive amounts of your money to provide you with mediocre service! There was an army of people working there but none were actually working. Doing anything at this resort consisted of a LONG wait. A wait for a cable car to get to the marina, then another wait for a boat that only comes hourly to get to the beach. All this only to get treated very rudely by the staff. They charge you to park you car daily and if I did take their shuttles then I would've had to deal w/ an openly DRUNK bus driver. When I say that I mean a half full bottle of rum in the cup holder! The food was cafeteria quality at Ruth Chris prices. I actually ate over 75% of my meals off the resort. I was at this resort in 1998 and had an awesome time. It was nothing like I remembered and went completely downhill. The resort itself was dirty and run down. I would never go back, even if it was free. I left there feeling like my pockets were picked.

Reviews.Title: “Can't figure out exactly why we disliked it but we did.”
Reviews.Author: Bloomington_INFolly
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, the staff seemed well trained but we found it boring and expensive. One could go to a Club Med for less and not have to decide if a $12 dollar pina colada was worth the bother. The water park was great for kids of all ages. The necessity of taking a boat to get to the beach (waiting in line in the heat and humidity sucked) or waiting similarly to take the funicular between the top and bottom was really a bother. We went there for destination wedding in the family. We don't golf or gamble. We felt like captives and spent most of our time eating very expensive food that wasn't all that great and drinking way overpriced drinks and otherwise sitting around watching the tropics decay. The place is immense and initially one is dependant on the staff to find anything. We took their coach from the airport at $74 each RT. They commandeered our bags and we had to use a bellman to get to our room ($20 extra fee we didn't find out about until we checked out). There is a $3 extra fee for making up the room every day. It's not all that much but it left the impression that they were going to gouge us at every opportunity. We wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Resort”
Reviews.Author: sceneMT
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to have gotten a room at El conquistador through Hotwire, however I think this little fact made them treat us as 2nd class guests ~ which is never a good idea (important people hotwire too, but more importantly ANY guest should be treated as well as the next~ regardless of price paid). I will give a real review of our experience: We had spend our morning on Isla de Viequez and after a great morning of snorkelying and an afternoon in the southern part of El Yunque, we finally arrived at El conquistador worn out and tired. Parking was the first issue I found. We simply wanted to check in and they make that a pain in the tushie. Once we were issued our room tickets we had to quickly get back to our parked car to avoid a charge ~ yeah, a charge to park your car up front while you check in. To park your car you can either valet or park yourself, I was annoyed by this point and parked myself to avoid giving them anything extra after how I was treated when I first arrived. Parking does cost which I found completely ridiculous. I know resorts have to make their money, but 20 a day for parking? Really? Ok, so finally get up to our room which is nice enough but for a waldorf at this price? Not worth it. Refrigerator is really an ice box with no place to put the ice and our phone didn't work which took them about a day to fix. Bird droppings ALL OVER the little porch we had. Room itself was just ok, nice 20 years ago I bet. I would have been HEATED had we paid the original price and not lucked out on hotwire. Coming from a small villa on Isla de Vieques I was surprised to be dissapointed. I will say, Palamino Island is worth the stay. I would maybe come back simply for that. The pools were also very nice with a great view. The food was pricey and not that great where we ate at (sting rays). But the pizza place by the pool is where we ended up doing almost every meal. Pizza's are reasonable. We also found a place to buy our own alcohol on sight which was nice (it's at the ice cream place on your way down to the 'tram'). One thing I thought they were majorly lacking was anything to do at night. For some reason I expected some sort of night club or bar. All we found was a dance and no bar~ mosly teens there I think. All in all, it is a beautiful property but they are lacking on their customer service and organization in general. Oh, and checking out was more of a nightmare than checking in.

Reviews.Title: “I HAVE TO SAY "SERVICE, WHAT SERVICE"”
Reviews.Author: agoliveras
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Property the the SERVICE does not match. This was my 3rd stay at this hotel... i've always raved about it, until now. You park your car, where they have a shuttle to the lobby, the driver needed people skills, didn't even bother say good afternoon, good evening, didn't even bother getting out and helping with the luggage, not to mention there is an additional $16.83 per day parking charge. You go to the front desk where the waiting line was endless, and because you have already paid for your room through a 3rd party agent ( i.e. priceline, expedia...) they place a $150 dollar per night HOLD on your credit card for expenses that you might accrue at the property during your stay. The person at the front desk gave me a deal she said instead of $150 per night, she would only charge us $100 per night hold on my card, We opted to give them cash and was told i'd get cash back in return, which they did. If not, they hold $150 per night on your credit card and are not quite sure when they would return the cash to you after your departure. I get up to my room and it's quite warm, no problem... turn on the A/C and have a leak on the outside of my front door... still no problem... after all i am a New Yorker. House keeping comes in at whatever time they like, no set schedule then again what for. Food, you can have better food for way less money off the resort. The resort has extremely high food prices and SERVICE leaving you wanting service. We rented a car and traveled everyday and ate the local food. Marvelous island, great food, lots of eco tours to be had but El Conquistador has had my last dollar. Another charge upon check out.... first you have to guess.... of course another endless line, lobby was extremely warm, you also receive a TWENTY DOLLAR A DAY RESORT FEE for booking through a third party, such as price line, or expedia.... upon inquire i was told it was made up of three different taxes. I didn't even bother asking what they were, just wanted to RUN!

Reviews.Title: “Queenly Accomodations on a paupers salary !”
Reviews.Author: sandiphoto
Reviews.Content: Found a fantastic deal on this hotel on Expedia and best of all it was availalble on several different weeks . I did my research on Trip Advisor as usual before booking and found some great tips. Here is mine revised-yes become a member of the Hiltons reward program as suggested takes a second and sure enough we were upgraded to a lnewly renovated ,lovely ocean view ,great balcony and a bathroom I could move into.The sprawling swimming pools are amazing and everytime is breathtaking as you look at the views of the ocean over the cliff.The catamaran ride to thier private island is spectacular as is the island itself !Lots of chairs ,quiet spots to be away from other guests and take the hike up the hill to the other beaches(clothing optional ,but we werent interested in that ) -no one was there ! Some snorkeling but dont get too excited. Bring some watersocks or Tevas to go into water as yes there are some rocks but not in all spots , in late October the water was incredably warm !The restaurants are each unique in decor and are style of food and well worth the price -not over the top price so dont be frightened by what you read.One word of caution is we went during the week Tue-Sat and it was perfectly quiet and yet had enough people to make it comfortable but Friday evening is when the masses bring their entire families ,rambunkish children and all. So if you want to escape from children go during the week.The Golden Door spa was very nice and they have several relaxation rooms and steam,cool,hot tub.Went into the little town area just outside the gates of the marina below and the locals were very friendly and welcoming as we walked to otherside of bay area and had a beer in village close to gates.This is a luxury vacation open for those on a budget who can catch the deal when it comes up !We opted for the ride from the resort and it was sooooo worth it as both ways we had the little limo bus to ourselves and they serve you rum and mix on the trip (takes an hour)!

Reviews.Title: “Worst place if youre looking for a beach”
Reviews.Author: Mauralevit
Reviews.Content: The tram to get down to the marina is broken. If you want to get to any sort of beach time, you must wake up at 8 so you make the first trip down to the marina at 9. The boat to and from the island takes forever My family and I waited for 1 hr each way. AND to make things more inefficient, there is no other way to get up or down from the marina other than this tram that takes forever. Also when I was visiting, the hotel was hosting a convention of 800 of the worst/most disgusting people I have ever seen. I cannot believe the hotel would agree to depreciate it's value ad reputation with this type of crowd. I would only recommend this hotel after they fix their beach transportation problem and if you are traveling at a time when there is no huge convention going on. Overall this is the most inefficient place ever

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Raquel T
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the service, food, views (the hotel is nested on a cliff overlooking the ocean), pools and Palomino Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities”
Reviews.Author: kt-22pounder
Reviews.Content: A little dated, but the grounds were immaculate. Really enjoyed our dinner and service @ The Strip Club, great value on the pre fix meals!!! Make sure to visit Palomino Island, this a private island for resort guests only. If staying anywhere else @ Puerto Rico an Island excursion will cost you plenty, what a great amenity!!

Reviews.Title: “Off season is your best bet!”
Reviews.Author: sgtsbud
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this place. Nestled on a 300 foot cliff over looking the Caribbean, or if you are lucky like me and get a room near the marina, either way this place is breathe taking. There are plenty of activities to do, or if you prefer head over to the island and relax in the sun. I could see where waiting for the elevators to take you up and down the cliff could be get old in the busy season, but it comes quickly and worth the wait, after all vacation should mean taking it slow and enjoying every minute. The food is amazing and while some reviews complained about the prices, need I remind you, you are at a top quality resort, and if you want McDonalds I am sure there is a Motel 6 you could book elsewhere. The staff was great and the place was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Has some highs and lows, but definitely worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Trojan55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "El Con" for two nights a couple weeks ago. After driving from San Juan, and through a not-that-nice strip mall covered Fajardo, driving up to the El Con through their golf course felt like we had warped into another universe. When you enter the hotel through a large outdoor area, looking out across several pools, palm trees, their harbor, to the open ocean... it's definitely something special. They are in a great spot. Very unique. First, the bad... large swaths of the property were closed to maintenance, making the trip to/from our room a bit of an adventure since some elevators and stairwells were off limits. The funicular, which is cool and fast enough, only had one side running, and even that side broke down one day (I get the feeling this happens often) so we had to take a long bumpy van ride back and forth to the harbor one day. We ate a Blossoms on site, and maybe it's just because we were are from SoCal where there is a ton of good Asian food, but the food there was expensive and really just average (but the service was really amazing.) Also, we had some minor problems with our room (ceiling fan not working, bathroom sink caulk not dried and making a big mess. We had some creeps staying next to us the first night that kept slamming their door and yelling at each other at 1am, as well... but I was too tired to complain. Now, the good... our room was in the v-shaped main building at the top of the cliff to the left as you enter, facing the ocean side (some rooms face the light house in Laguna Grande.) I thought the room was just great. Sparkling white, tasteful art, killer bathroom with walk-in closet, an iHome (which we used extensively), and a bed large enough to fit a little league baseball team. Our deck looked out on the harbor, and I spent a lot of time out there drinking Medalla beers. Bliss. The funicular made a bit of noise, but that tapered down at night as people stopped using it. The pools were also very nice, featuring a swim-up bar and great views. We had some nice drinks, waded in the pool, enjoyed a hot tub at sunset... all very relaxing. Some other pluses are the on-site Starbucks, and the little sandwich shop/grocery store that has lots of reasonably (for a resort) priced snacks, drinks, and food. The sandwiches there were perfect to bring out to the island... which gets us to the BEST part of El Con, Palamino Island. They have a catamaran that leaves every hour, free for guests, and takes you on a 10 minute ride out to their little island getaway. We were lucky enough to be "off" season and midweek, so there were only a few people on the boat, and maybe 30 people on the island. There are hundreds of beach chair, lots of palm huts and trees for shade. A restaurant, equestrian activities, mini-golf, great snorkeling (if you get outside of the tourist-battered reefs near the beach.) It was heaven, and maybe the highlight of our trip, to sit out at the end of this island, under our own palm trees, and just relax all day. We decided to extend our stay at El Con just so we could do this a second whole day, and did not regret the decision. Just awesome, even though it was a little windy. We felt like celebrities. In conclusion, when you stay at the El Con you can tell it has gone through a lot of "lives" and is in some transition. It's not quite the Ritz Carlton, but it has these little glimmers of awesome here and there, and the island experience is a game-changer. Ask to see your room, bring some snacks with you to the island, check the recommendations here for what restaurants (there are several) and food is good, and you'll enjoy your stay. Unless you are hardcore into golfing or tennis, I don't see why you'd need to be here more than 3 or 4 nights. It's a good base to go see El Yunque, if you wanted to stay an extra day for that. I must mention that Keyla from VIP services there was VERY nice to us, delivering chocolate covered strawberries and wine to our room, that we enjoyed on our balcony ti celebrate our honeymoon. THANK YOU! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay at El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: positanobabe
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the El Conquistador. We flew in early a.m. and the hotel staff accommodated an early check-in. They upgraded us to an ocean view room. The rooms are nice, large bathroom, but I think they will need to do some refurbishing soon. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful--several pools overlooking the ocean and the private island beach was great. If you are a golfer you need to play their course. It's a challenging course with all the hills; it was a lot of fun and enjoyed the beautiful scenery. The restaurants on property are pricey. We ate at the hotel once and the food was OK. We rented a car because we like to experience the local foods, etc. and found plenty of options for dining. We were unable to find a local restaurant closeby to the hotel for breakfast; we purchased breakfast foods at a local grocery. There is a refrigerator in the hotel room so that worked out well for waters, etc. If staying at the El Conquistador I would recommend renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Joe P
Reviews.Content: The property is spectacular and perfectly maintained. The rooms are spacious, and the bed extremely comfortable. Spent 4 days in 2010 and wanted to go back immediately. The multiple restaurants are excellent. Service A+. Can not complain at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great service by Nydia at Front Desk / Upscale and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: VVCLAS
Reviews.Content: Nydia our front desk attendant was just exceptional....she took care of my group of 4 people checking in despite the language barrier (French from Guadeloupe, French West Indies) and went well beyond expected customer service. It was a WOW moment! Thanks Nydia and congratulations to her Millie in Management! Regards from Guadeloupe!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: daske17
Reviews.Content: Pros: The rooms are really beautiful. We had the option of having a garden view room in the upper area of the resort or a ocean view on the marina with no upcharge. We took the ocean view even though it had two queen beds instead of one king. Bathrooms were clean and everything worked great. Palomino Island: Gorgeous and peaceful. Seats on the beach were plentiful, and the further you go from the dock, the more peaceful it becomes. I went snorkeling and was impressed with the sea life so close to the shore. I may have scraped my knee on some coral, but that was my fault. Large iguanas hang around the restaurant waiting for scraps, so if you're not a lizard person, beware. Casino: Good number of penny slots and low-stakes blackjack tables. Made a little money. Cons: Food: It's a resort and you should expect some level of price gouging, but man did it get ugly. Try and find an online deal that includes complimentary daily brunch. You can fill up on breakfast and grab some fresh fruit for snacking throughout the day. Dinners are really over-priced and not that great. My wife and I splurged one night for their beni-hana style restaurant. It was good, just not worth what we paid for it. Snack shops similarly will leave your wallet lighter. Bio-luminescence tour: unless you're any good at kayaking, don't bother. My wife and I overestimated our abilities and it made for a miserable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: Scorpiobehr
Reviews.Content: Ok I am probably going to get some flack for this review but overall dollar for dollar this hotel still delivers some of the best value in the Cariibean.The pro's for this property are its got multiple flights going into nearby San Juan, plenty of room categories , 21 restaurants onsite plus a world class spa and a decent casino, plenty of kids programs avaialble, a waterpark on site, some of the best views you can wish for and and an amazing white sand beach on a private island. The grounds are very well done and the vistas to the ocean and the mountains are excellent The prices for comparable resorts in term of amenities are usually double for what you pay at the El Conquistador. The cons are the property is in need of an update,there is quite a bit of deffered maintenace and the level of quailty in the rooms isnt on par with a Ritz or a Four Seasons, and the service is somewhat spotty. Guests expecting 5 star quailty will get about 3 and half but in terms of price to value this property still delivers. This was my second stay here and we stayed in an oceanview Las Brisas room. The room was impecably clean and we had great meals and service with the exception of one restaurant..If the property puts some money into an update of the rooms and resolves the maintenance issues this could be the perfect property.The pools were fantastic, my visit to the Golden Door spa was excellent and our party had a very memorable stay. Even though we traveled without kids, the property had plenty of options for the young ones, and there many options closeby to keep everyone entertained. Horseback riding on the private island was avaialble as well as motorized and non motorized sports, scuba, and mutiple tours were available from the hotel into nearby Yunque Rainforest, The Bacardi plant in nearby San Juan and the amazing bioluminescent lagoon at the base of the hotel. You really didnt need a car as everything was there at the hotel but we still had one so we could go into nearby San Juan. Yes it was only 35 miles and the traffic was bad but so what we had time to kill and were up for the challenge. Based on 2 very saitisfactory visits and very reasonable package prices I will be back for more!

Reviews.Title: “Not a big resort fan, but this has changed my perception.”
Reviews.Author: DStubbins
Reviews.Content: We spent around 5 days working at the El Con towards the end of November 2010. The weather was outstanding, almost too hot to work but we got by! The views you have from a large portion of the rooms are stunning. Beautiful scenic views of small islands and an endless ocean. Other rooms look out over large hotel gardens, the golf course, tennis courts and the pool area, all very nice. A large selection of the rooms (that I saw) are very spacious and comfortable. Everything you need is in there. I was lucky enough to see a few of the suites on offer which too, as you would expect, are full on luxury accommodation. There are so many things to do for families, couples and groups. The Coqui Water Park has plenty of space for everyone to enjoy themselves in the water, on slides, or just sit in the sun. The golf course is superb, spreading over a vast area of the resort. There are 3 very good restaurants that form part of the complex. Another couple of average all day, fast food places that are good for light snacks. The hotel was lacking a good selection of bars. The one main bar is very nice, but not very lively and was quiet by around 10 o'clock. It's well worth taking the trip out to the private island. You have the option of many water sports, horse riding or just chilling on the large beach. It also has a few restaurants and bars so no need to take anything from the mainland. The Golden Door spa was as to be expected. Beautiful and very well presented with great staff. The staff throughout the hotel were all fantastic and very helpful. There is a very large and (at the time) newly refurbished business centre. It did mean that the hotel had quite a large amount of business guests there during our stay, but that wasn't a negative experience by any means. Overall, it's a great hotel for business or pleasure no matter who your travelling with.

Reviews.Title: “Business, not as Usual”
Reviews.Author: rmamani
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, they recognize the importance of rewarding loyalty (I am a Gold Member of their Loyalty program). They upgarde me and treated me accordingly. in room wifi made my business trip a pleasure :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Time by People Who Avoid Big Resorts”
Reviews.Author: TwoNamesTacoma
Reviews.Content: While traveling on business to Puerto Rico this last August, we extended our stay with a package at El Conquistador. And, we're glad we did. Typically, we avoid large resorts, because they feel to confining (without a car). While we experienced some of that, there was plenty to keep us busy. Our spacious room had a spectacular view of the Atlantic and Carribean. The food, while a bit overpriced, was above average. We thoroughly enjoyed the island with it's good snorkeling and we had a great bio bay excursion (don't buy it from the hotel. Go online - it will be about half the price). Be sure to check out Las Croabas and its bundle of small, casual outdoor eateries for less expensive fare than at the hotel. Lastly, my husband had a medical emergency while riding the funicular (yes, it all turned out fine in the end). The staff did an outstanding job of handling the situation. They even sent an interpretor to the hospital with us. They went way beyond the call and we can't thank them enough.

Reviews.Title: “Need TLC”
Reviews.Author: Latui
Reviews.Content: Needs TLC We stayed at the hotel for a convention. Our room was at Las Brisas and when we arrive the tv doesn't work, there were a missing bulb at the night stand, there were leaves at the floor. We call to the front desk and the lady who was very courteous, send inmmediatly a technician to fix it. Then I proceed to take a shower and Surprise.. The sink floaded..... Next day we discover that the iron board was broken, so we have to iron our clothes in the bed, in a "5 star" hotel. Next day the Â elevator wasn't working so we have to take the stairs and in the hall, the air conditioner was broken and never being repaired . The staff are EXCELLENT, everybody exceed our expectations!!!! The employees makes the difference in this hotel.Â  The issues in my review and others reviews about the facilities and the conditions of the rooms aren't new to the management, they have the same issues for years!!! in all administrations...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoricuaPR543
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel last year and enjoyed it very much so we returned again this year and brought some family along that live in PR. Everyone was in awe of the hotel. Beautiful grounds, very tropical atmosphere and absolutely breathtaking views. This is not a new property so don't expect it to be in pristine condition. Many reviews on this site are very negative due to the bad experiences people have but ours was not the case. Our check-in process was fine, it took a little while because I had 3 rooms and a total of 10 people so that is to be expected. The desk person was helpful and very friendly. We were able to check-in early and by 3pm we were at the pool. Our rooms were spacious and clean with garden view. We didn't spend much time in the rooms so no need to spend extra on ocean views. They were clean but the wear is noticeable but that was not a big deal. We had breakfast at the hotel every morning. It was very good and our server Yahaira was very nice. She took care of us every day (at our request). The pools were great, Palomino island was also very nice and the Coqui water park was awesome. All in all we had a wonderful time with our family. This may not be the 4/5 stars people expect but we will definitely return. Oh, and Fernando at the bar in the outside grill/restaurant is super nice. He remembered us from last year.

Reviews.Title: “Posh Restaurant in Beautiful Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: orishok
Reviews.Content: Celebrated our 20-th wedding anniversary at El Conquistador, which came highly recommended by friends. What a gorgeous resort - complete with new rooms (ours overlooked the golf course), plentiful high-end restaurants, a casino and a private island for swimming and snorkeling. You can't go wrong with anything that's available to you at this resort. We booked directly through their website and got the best deal - better than through expedia or AAA. Highly recommend this resort to anyone - couples, families, friends. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: sds1220
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is amazing, private island beach only 7 mins away by the hotel ferry, private marina, and friendly services ( now friendly does not mean effective) Pros, the room we had was clean and organized, clean sheets and covers, never had a problem with bedbugs or mold as described in other reviews. The building could recieved a little more of love, it is very puerto rican, great view to the ocean, several pools and gardens. Palomino Island (the private beach) is amazing, a real paradise, quiet, crystal clear water, just beautiful, many water activities if you are willing to pay that much money. The Cons this is a very puertorican place, maybe that is the problem, lay back and thing (service) can be very slow most of the time, they need to pay more attention to details, or presentation of the hallways, etc. our card stop working almost 1 or 2 times per day, there is no way to get in touch with the help desk when u are in front of your door and realizing that the key card failed one more time, you have to walk ( a descent long distance) to the front desk and wait to be helped. The restaurants are the food,, avoid going there if you can. We were really frustrated and disapointed by the restaurants in the hotel, really overpriced, flavorless food, and slow service, we paid 90 dollars for breakfast (2 people) there are no many options around the hotel though, so food can be a big problem. Parking is a bid problem too, expensive and very far away from the actual buildings, image, you have to take a shuttle to get from the hotel parking to the front desk. TIPS: Dont take the Hotel shuttle from the airport of San Juan, it is very expensive. Rent a car instead, we rented a Honda Fit from a local company call Bella Rental Car, (www.bellarental.com) they have brand new honda car at a great price, (rent a compact and bring your gps, traffic is terrible in San Juan you dont want to drive a huge car there) for a good price this is also good to go visit "EL YUNQUE national park" only few minutes away from the hotel, recomended, but you need a car to get there and enjoy it at your own time. The hotel is very near to a luminecent bay, you can kayak your way there, tours are usually cheaper if you book them in the hotel , just go to the front desk Food is a real problem as I said, we tried a few local restaurant, but nothing I can recomend. sorry. Try to leave ealier to San Juan, as I said traffic can be terrible at certain times of the day Enjoy, and get a tan

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: travelbugManila
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the El Conquistador. Knowing it's a Waldorf Astoria resort, I had very high expectations despite the rather negative reviews here. First the pros: we were upgraded to an ocean view room which was huge and had a balcony with a spectacular view. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom really spacious. There's a boat that brings guests to Palomino Island, the hotel's private beach altho the hotel's pools are more than adequate. The property is really huge and perfect for conventions so the place can get pretty chaotic. It's also rather poorly maintained with used towels strewn along passageways to mop up rain puddles. Prices at the food outlets are prohibitive altho there is a Starbucks and the coffee shop by the water serves a ten dollar lunch special. There is a water park but guests have to pay extra to use it. The resort is beautiful but not luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Resort ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: Joseph E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the El Conquistador Resort in Fajardo, PR which is approximately 45 minutes from San Juan. The resort is amazing! We stayed in a Las Brisas Ocean View room which featured an outstanding view of the ocean. The staff was very friendly and professional. The resort has several restaurants and every restaurant that we ate at was great. The hotel also has a complimentary ferry that takes you to their private island. The island features white sand beaches, snorkeling, horse riding, jet skies, kayaking, and hiking, along with a few restaurants. If you are planning on staying at the resort, I recommend getting a rental car from the airport or the resort. The resort does offer packages that include roundtrip transfers to and from the airport. If you want to catch a taxi from the resort to San Juan it will cost around $100 per person each way. My wife and I went to San Juan two days, which would have cost us around $400 just for a taxi. Instead of blowing our money on a taxi, we spent $160 for a mid-size car from Enterprise Rental Car at the resort for four days. Another great benefit of renting a car from the resort is that you can park for free. This resort is great for couples and families. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “in LOVE with Palomino Island!!”
Reviews.Author: Hee Jeong S
Reviews.Content: I was here 15 years ago and the property was stunning!....now some areas need a new coat of paint but everything was nice and clean. My room at Las Brisas with an ocean view was amazing. The food at the hotel was hit and miss - some very good and some not so good at every meal. But the people were all very friendly and nice. If you like to swim in the beautiful water, their private island Palomino is best place to be. On my way to the airport, I sat with a person who has come there 3 times this year......

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: SmilesDb8
Reviews.Content: First time here. Highly recommended. Best time to be here. Rainy season but no rain and hotel is quite empty. Amazing service and food. A great place for those that like lots to do all in one place. Hotel has own marina and private beach.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME property... but a few flaws (all fixed though)!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieSTL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the El Conquistador for 4 nights of our honeymoon. We overall had a great time and enjoyed being in Fajardo as it's close to the fairy (went to Culbera for the day) and lots of activities such as kayaking and boating adventures. The resort itself is beautiful and has breathtaking views of the ocean - definitely ask to be upgraded to an ocean view room. It's worth it! The house keeping staff was amazing - stopping by two times a day and providing delicious chocolates left on our pillowcase (I ate both mine & my husbands several times). We stayed in the wing of the hotel that was close to the casino, restaurants, shops, etc. which was nice. There are lots of local restaurants around (not necessarily inexpensive like you might think though). But we also ate at a few restaurants on the resort such as the Strip house, we had the breakfast buffet as las brisas, coffee at Starbucks and pizzas one night at cafe bella vista. All was good delicious and the wait staff was very nice and accommodating. However, there are a few flaws that are worth mentioning (I told the management about it as well). We paid around $15 a night for self-parking. Seems pretty easy, huh? Nope! It was a true pain. It took sometimes close to 15- 20 minutes to get from the parking lot to either wait for the shuttle or even sometimes find a spot. Now, keep in mind that we did find out later that there was a big convention with a lot of locals which caused the jam in parking. But they way that I feel is that the parking for the convention should have been separate - not mixed in with the rest of the guest parking. Then, after dealing with the parking situation we went back to our room and heard a screaming baby. I don't mind a baby hungry for a bottle - I mean a baby screaming like no tomorrow. I understand that this is out of their control but I wanted to mention because I didn't want to deal with a crying baby during the rest of the honeymoon (sorry to say that). We went to the front desk and starting talking to a man named, Paul. We explained about the parking and crying baby. He was very apologetic but mentioned that the resort was to it's full capacity that night but to keep him posted on how the noise was, he would be happy to accommodate in any way possible. Thankfully, all turned out OK. Paul, called and left us a message the next night to see if he could do anything to help. We listened to the message and both thought it was nice of him to follow up. To top it off, Paul reached us later on that evening from home and wanted to mention that he went home sick but wanted to call and check on us. He said he he had to leave early but was concerned about how our stay us and was calling from his cell phone AT HOME. WOW - We were both really impressed of his passion to make sure we felt comfortable and were taken care of. He truly went above & beyond to make sure we liked the resort & everything was to our liking. They even took off the night of parking on the bad night and explained that an outside company runs the parking (an issue they were aware of). End of story - it was a beautiful resort and we would stay again. I think that we just happen to be there during a super busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: mike h
Reviews.Content: Ok, you get to the hotel and have to wait until someone deems it necessary to attend to you.
