Regardless of Hilton Honors, they have a station for HH members but they don't man it, so you have to stand in line like everyone else, so much for HH. Anyway, once you get service from the front desk, hope it is Marisol Bosques (she knows how to treat people), you are on your way to your room and fun. The off shore island is great. The service at the main pool is sloppy (Jose or something) told me I had to drink a specific beer, so much for freedom of choice. The Stingray Restaurant at the Marina is Outstanding!. The Ballyhoo Bar at the marina is pretty good, although at times it seems that the bartenders don't think they are a work, nevetheless, alright. The bouncers (yes, bouncers!) at the Casino Hotel bar (21) should be still in jail. The valet people are impertinent, hope you don't get the fat chick with the attitude and shrill voice. The best rooms are at the Marina, its a hike everywhere you go, but if you plan to relax, stick to the island (Palomino) and stay down below the main hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Huge property with lots of activities”
Reviews.Author: binsu16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and the check in staff was great. They upgraded and our room had a fantastic view. There are a million things to do on the resort and lots of options for everyone. The staff was great and it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: hloriol
Reviews.Content: I was not a fan of the main resort ( in fact had to move to the area i wanted to stay at) Las Casitas Village is the place to stay if you go. Smaller, more intimate, and better service. The hotel is very big. If you want to go to the beach or pool, you're in for a hike and a boat ride. Didn't feel relaxed the entire time I was there. I liked the island where the beach is. The staff was pretty friendly, especially as Las Casitas Village. Food is pretty good at the hotel. Lots of choices, and excellent food. Golf course is pretty challenging, and worth the $'s to play. i don't think that I'll ever go back. Not worth the money, and the place didn't wow me. The Hotel charged us $125 for a transfer fee from airport when the taxi was just $40! Thought that was insane. Puerto Rico's just not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff not so great management.”
Reviews.Author: Rivahgirl68
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a out of the way location. The staff here is exceptional. They are friendly, quick to help with any request and very accommodating. I can't say the same for the management and I suspect that most of the negative comments are directly related to this issue. We ask the hotel to match a package that we found--Hilton say they match if you find a lower price. But hotel management wouldn't agree to matching.The hotel did agree to include transportation in our room package. When we checked out we were charged $148 for transportation and management wouldn't honor the earlier agreement. We will go back to Puerto Rico but I'm not sure we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with incredible views!”
Reviews.Author: Cooperjc98
Reviews.Content: Not sure what all the bad reviews are about, but we didn't have a problem at all with the hotel, the service, or the amenities. Maybe our stay was better because it was the off season (first week of October), as I could see that it would quite busy with a full hotel/resort. There were a few days (ie, Monday-Wednesday) when we felt like we were one of the few people in the hotel, so perhaps it has to do when you book a trip here. Through Hilton Honors points, we got a few extra perks to the spa and the casino (which didn't help me), as well as free breakfast (buffet). We used valet parking ($5 more per day than self parking), and they had our car ready and waiting within 5 minutes of me calling. $20/day is still somewhat expensive though, but we ventured out at least once every day to restaurants, el Yunque rain forest, and old San Juan. We thought the extra $5 was worth it. Other than breakfast (good buffet with lots of fresh fruits and breads), we didn't eat at the hotel. We went out to restaurants close by (Tasca OleLelolai, La Estacion), as well as the kiosks at Luquillo (maybe 10 miles away). So, I can't comment on the resort food. Of course it seemed overpriced, but what resort doesn't overprice their food, right? There are plenty of pools and bars in the main area. My favorite bar was the one you can swim up to and order a pina colada. If you take a tram down to the marina area, there are two more pools there, but they seemed more like they were for families. We only went to the marina to catch the ferry to Palomino Island, the resort's private beach. That was like being in a Corona commerical with a drink in one hand and blue waters staring you in the face as you relax under a shaded hut. I want to go back to there. Our room had an excellent view of the water, overlooking the marina. The room was bright, open, and there was lots of space for our 5-day trip. The king bed was super comfy, and waking up to that incredible view was well worth the extra money we paid for the room. If I had a couple of suggestions for the resort, it would be to provide a copy of the bill, or a way to view the charges, sometime before checkout. It took a good 4-5 minutes to go through the charges just to make sure everything was correct. Also, some of the staff in the casino seemed like they didn't want to be there or were carrying on their own conversations, so we felt like we were interrupting them when we asked for drinks, change, or whatever. Other than those couple of things, I would go back tomorrow. Again, for this resort, I think it has to do when you plan your trip. Since this was early October, there were still some restaurants and stores that hadn't opened yet. Still, we were able to find great places to eat and go. I've only been to Puerto Rico in October and November, so I'm sure the busy season would get...well, busy. And we're not regular customers of the Waldolf Astoria line, so we weren't expecting any particular type of service. We're easy going travelers and were very happy with our overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory?”
Reviews.Author: miseno
Reviews.Content: After years of hearing about El Conquistador, I was a bit disappointed. While a beautiful location & facility - though a bit faded around the edges - the service was definitely disappointing. Housekeeping in particular disappointed on at least 3 occasions (and I only called 3 times - always when they had already failed to do something one would expect from a resort hotel, such as clean the room! And getting a washcloth - after they failed to leave any - took over 30 minutes when the place was fairly empty!) Concierge & check in staff also not quite up to par. Restaurant staff were very friendly & did a nice job, however. The pool was fabulous; private island also very nice; & the funicular was just plain fun! The grounds & landscaping were also just terrific. And the ocean view room had a very nice view. Not a bad stay, but not something to rave about, sadly.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Raiting... Terrible...”
Reviews.Author: Carmen P
Reviews.Content: The customer service id bad. When I arrives with my family, the reservation was for 4 people and the room has only 1 bed!!! I sleep in an air mattress the first night with my husband and my kids in the bed!! This is Puerto Rico.. Bad service, bad attentions. Never I returned to this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Dreams Left Much To Be Desired.”
Reviews.Author: rebecca s
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this resort. I wanted to come back with nothing but rave reviews, this is after all a part of the Waldorf Astoria line. Our overnight stay began when we arrived around 1pm for our friends wedding that was to begin at 5pm. We decided to opt for self parking for the night and lugged our suitcases up to the lobby. Strangely enough, even though we were planning on keeping our luggage with us until we had figured out the check-in situation, no one offered to take our luggage for us. After hiking up the driveway and dragging our suitcases up the stairs to what we thought was the entrance, our fault not theirs, I would have liked to have at least been asked for a little help as we arrived at the lobby. Admittedly, I hadn't double or triple checked the check-in time which I am typically known for before leaving our previous hotel, so when I was told that the room wouldn't be available until 4pm I started going into panic mode. How on earth would we be ready for the wedding only an hour after being let into the room when the ceremony was taking place on the complete opposite end of the resort? So of course, I then ask if there is a possibility of getting a room earlier or if maybe the staff could make the room a priority on their cleaning rotation. The gentleman at the front desk said that he couldn't promise anything and would call if it was available before 4pm. At 3:50, with still no call we went back to the front desk inquiring about our room status. The same gentlemen who had assisted us earlier said that the room was ready, but that the call had not yet been made and for us to disregard it when the automated message came through. Ok, wait, so the room is ready? How long has it been ready and why the hell have we been left so frazzled with now under an hour to shower and make it back to the wedding? This was a big no-no in my book, but I didn't have time to react negatively, I had just enough time to run clear across the property with my wedding date in tow, key in hand, to get ready for the evening and be out again in less than 45 minutes. It should be noted that the room was worth the wait as it had an absolutely breathtaking view of the resort, ocean, and Palomino Island. The bathroom was huge and had a giant walk-in closet with full length mirror, perfect for more than one person getting themselves pretty-fied. The setting on the hillside lent itself to a solid reverberating sing-song of the coqui as the sun was saying its goodbyes for the day. The wedding took place in a number of locations around the resort which gave us a real first hand look around the property. The ceremony took place in the lush Casitas Gardens overlooking the ocean, the cocktail hour took place also overlooking the ocean on one of their many terraces, and the reception was in the Magnolia Ballroom. Each event space was beautiful, you could tell that a lot of effort went into making this a special day. Now, we went from the bad to the good and now we're going back to the bad. The service at this wedding was unreal, and not in a good way. After the cocktail hour, we were all herded into the ballroom for introductions, dinner, dancing, the usual wedding celebratory stuff. The introductions were performed, first dances were danced, the toasts were made by the best man and matron of honor, the first course was brought out and then the DJ starts playing traditional Jewish wedding celebratory music. The bride and groom are being tossed around on chairs, and by the time the hullabaloo of the party kick-off subsides, but while family and friends are still lingering, we return to the table to find that the first course has already been cleared from the table. Ok weird. So we migrate to the bar to grab a cocktail, sit down to eat our second course, and while the best man and groomsmen are still engaged in conversation, the waitstaff try to take their plates. Like a bunch of vultures, the rest of the table yelled for them not to take it away. Funny enough, for as overly attentive as the waitstaff was, alcoholic cocktails were always left on the table. I understand efficiency and keeping a clean table, but this was just too harried and too much like hawking. As for the resort as a whole, I cannot speak enough praise for the spotless, perfectly manicured, and wonderfully constructed compound set atop the cliffs of Fajardo. It is absolutely breathtaking and given that it is so far removed from everything else in the area, and has everything on site including water park, 20+ restaurants, and golf that customers need not leave the premises. It's not my cup of tea, but I can see how others might enjoy it. Solid down the road 3-stars for it's equal positives and negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: kpc66
Reviews.Content: The customer service is why I gave a poor rating. The resort itself, is very nice, the pools are great and open 24/7, there are several restaurants to choose from with a good range of prices. The Strip House, which is a steak restaurant, was excellent! It was expensive, but worth it, this is the only place we received very good customer service. The private island is very nice, the snorkeling was great! the beach is clean and not crowded, however, the ferry that takes you to the island that is supposed to run every 1/2 hour was never on time, we waited almost an hour to board one time and the ferry was right there, they just didn't let anyone on and never explained why or gave an apology. The water park is nice, but be careful, they state in the resort information book that you can do a half day either in the morning or late afternoon, but this is not true, they only offer the late afternoon. We had planned our day around this, only to find out it wasn't available when we were there. We had trouble with our door lock, which kept breaking, they did eventually get it fixed (they had to replace the whole unit) but we were locked out more than once. They did not replace our towels when requested, and when they finally did, they only gave us two towels and we had three people. When we asked for information about things to do outside of the resort they were not at all helpful and actually gave us bad information. When we asked if they had computers that we could use to look up information, we were told they didn't have any. We later when walking around the resort found a computer room with computers for guest use (for a fee, which would have been okay, but they didn't even say they had the room). When we brought this up when checking out, they said we must have misunderstood and that they said they just didn't have it right then because the internet service was down. We asked very specifically about the computer and the answer was a flat no, not it was just that the internet service was down. I could go on with other problems, but I'll stop and just add one last thing and that is that you have to pay to park on the resort ($20/day) and the parking is very far away, so if you have trouble walking you will have to use the vallet parking and you'll be waiting a while for them to bring you your car. Thru out the stay, the customer service was just very bad, which is a shame, because otherwise the resort is nice. That said, because of the horrible customer service we won't stay there again, it really was very disapointing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: luvnabby
Reviews.Content: We loved our room and gorgeous views at the El Conquistador. The food on the resort was overpriced and okay quality. We did have a fridge in our room so we stocked up on beverages. The private beach was breathtaking...however, they do not let you take a cooler or your own drinks. They want you to buy their overpriced drinks. We enjoyed our stay, felt safe, and rooms were clean. The casino was a bit of a joke- very tiny, very slow to bring you "complimentary drinks." We will be going back to Puerto Rico, however will probably opt for a different, smaller hotel. The concierge at the hotel was very helpful also. Staff was nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but a schlepp to get around.”
Reviews.Author: T N
Reviews.Content: We came with our 2 year old daughter and my mother and stayed in a cute villa and it was really a pain to get around. We had a stroller and had to climb up hills and take a golf cart to get to the main hotel, then walk about 5-10 minutes to get to the boat that takes you to the beach. It probably took 45 minutes to get to the beach each time and this was annoying. The restaurants were okay, nothing special, and overall, the vacation was much more hassle than anyone expected or wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Second Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: TravelPauley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights in one of the Ocean View Rooms down by the Marina. Clean rooms, and friendly, accommodating staff. Palomino Island was our favorite! Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: ekperigin
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the villa (where parking is free) after a week long stay in Palmas del Mar (Humacao, PR). It was a nice experience, I have a "been there - done that" feeling about the place. The highlight is the infinity pool. Views that just take your breath away. I sat in the jucuzzi for an hour with cocktails and a magazine. The kids (16 and 9) played in the pool and enjoyed meeting other kids. We did take the ferry over to the private island. Well worth it. We snorkled most of the day. Saw some amazing fish in knee deep water. Overall our experience was good. The hotel was very pricey, so we brought in groceries and cooked our meals. When we walked over to the hotel, the pool was crowed. We were glad that we didn't stay in that area. Looking back we would have spent those last few days in Palmas del mar. It is more peaceful, not a massive tourist hot spot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Long Weekend Getaway....”
Reviews.Author: niknpatel
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 1/2yr old daughter and I just returned from a 4nt stay at the ElCon by Waldorf Astoria last week. I booked our trip on Travelocity last month, and found a great deal for 4nts for all 3 of us inc flights from Newark to San Juan for a total of $1350....so i'd be silly not be book it! I chose this resort on the great reviews from friends of ours here in NYC. Infact, another friend of ours got married out here about 5yrs ago. Let me start by saying that this is a HUGE MASSIVE GIGANTIC RESORT.....over 320 acres i believe! Having read the history of this hotel, there has been over $150m of total renovations etc that has been put in to this property. So when booking it, a return shuttle for 3 of us was $190. Being that the hotel was 1hr drive from San Juan Airport, and the fact that we didnt want to be stuck on the resort, we hired a car from Thrifty Rentals at the airport, and this was the BEST CHOICE we made! The rental cost if (including car seat for our daughter) $90 for 4 days....so this was cheaper than the shuttle! Then add $15/day parking cost at the hotel....it was still cheaper. NOW...this is where the rental car comes in handy...and the reason we saved ALOT of money overall. The resort itself is very expensive once you get there. There are over 15-20 restaurants etc there, so you dont really have to leave the resort BUT it can get costly....Water bottles were $6, a lunch for us 3 would easily run $70. So, i'd jump in the car, drive down the road to the local Walmart or Walgreens, and picked up a CASE of mineral water, some milk for our daughter etc, and we saved alot!!! The rooms here are nice, modern and clean, the service is AMAZING, and the overall appearance of the resort is great. They have a private island (Palomino island) which is a 15min FREE boat ride across and it's amazing. All in all, this was a great trip, and for $1300 for a 4nt stay.....i would definitely not complain! When we were there, Tropical Storm Maria was going to be hitting BUT we got very lucky and the weather was great. Due to this "Scare", the resort was dead....so quiet, like a ghost town....which was actually good as we got the whole place to ourselves! MY TIP...rent a car from the airport, buy some water/snacks etc from walmart/walgreens there, and save ALOT of money!

Reviews.Title: “The private island is everything”
Reviews.Author: emrtes
Reviews.Content: This property is worth visiting for the private island. It is pristine, beautiful, and infinitely relaxing - especiallly if you visit during the week (on weekends, there tend to be more private boaters visiting the island). The hotel itself is a bit dated, but cute.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: phatlozer
Reviews.Content: On our arrival at El Conquistador we were greeted by a bellman who took our luggage and directed us to the lobby. First impression of hotel- Beautiful, superb view of palamino island and pools. We proceded to check in and was told our room wasn't ready so they would up grade us to a different room (ocean view), That room also was not ready????? They gave us coupons for free drinks and said they would call us when the room was done. Drinks and a wonderful pizza later, plus a walk all around the resort (approx 2 1/2 hours) still no call. We went back to the desk and they said the room wasn't ready but they would give us one that was. We got the bellman to take us to the room (which still had people cleaning) and had to wait outside untill it was finished. Just to let you know we were there Sept. 9 ,2011 they were expecting hurricane maria so it was litterally a ghost town. Very few guests checking out or in. The room was very nice and clean ( I brought my own air freshner which I always do when staying on the water rooms can smell musty) The rest of the stay was nice no hurricane just occasional rain so the trip wasn't ruined. The hotel itself did not have much information of things to do around Farjardo. We rented a car (Enterprise not expensive at all and located right in the hotel so there are no parking fees.) Fortunatly I researched on the internet things to do and was able to do it all. If you use their tour services you would pay for one tour what we paid for our car rental. Visited San Juan, Old San Juan, Bacardi Distillery, Shopping, Yunique Rain Forest, Bioluminesent Bay, Ferries more shopping and just driving around looking at the views. The casino in the hotel was small but like any other casino takes your money LOL. We ate down by the bay with the locals, Their food was very good in the 3 different restaurants we ate in, not expensive and plentyful, just go to the marina turn left towards the condominiums and follow the road, that also is where the tours are for Bioluminesence is.( a 5 minute enjoyable walk) The only other problem was on our last day there we were in our room taking a nap when someone knocked at our door and then used his key to get in without even giving time for anyone to answer, he had other people with him and apoligized for bothering us (he must have been looking to show the room for a vacation rental) but what if we weren't in the room at the time would they just have come in and showed the room with all our personal stuff in there? Luckily that was our last day because we didn't feel to safe after that. Otherwise great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience, would likely to return some day!”
Reviews.Author: alextm21
Reviews.Content: I stay at El Conquistador this last weekend, from Wednesday to Sunday (first two days was business/pleasure and last 2 days were all pleasure). The hotel seems to be nice from the outside, and itâ€™s even better from the inside. The staffs at Front Desk were always nice. This is not a brand new hotel, so itâ€™s showing his age with deteriorate painting and maintenance, but in good condition. Here is a list of PROS and CONS: Pros: 1. Have his own private island (Palomino) where you can do a lot of different stuff from playing basketball, sand volleyball to even jet sky and horse riding. 2. Nice Pools. The main hotel has at least 3 pools, one with Volleyball net. The main pool has his own bar, and thereâ€™s service at the other pool where they can take your order. 3. Nice and clean rooms. I got an Ocean View room hotel. I heard that the rooms with Golf/Garden View were bigger, but I prefer my ocean view room. I was right up the pools. The roomsâ€™ services ladies were nice and kind with me. The only thing they need to do the make a better service is to go early to the rooms to make them. Mine they went about 3:00pm. 4. The Terrace Balcony (were dinner and after dinner party was held) was so nice with a Nice View. Also the Room that with use for our meeting was big and beautiful. 5. The food at the CafÃ© Brisas and the other rest. Were good, but a little bit expensive. I pay $30 for a Churrasco with Tostonesâ€¦ it was good, but if you have a car, just drive 5 or 10 min. along the coastline going to the BioBay or the Fajardo Port, and you will find same food for $15 or less. 6. The GOLF course. On Friday I went with some of my friend to play some golf. The staff there was really friendly with us. The golf course is a PGA certified one. It was a nice experience! 7. They got their own rent-a-car at the lobby (enterprise), so if you need a ride to visit Puerto Rico, they can help you with that. 8. The Coqui Water Park. Is not Wet-n-Wild or Aquatica, but it was fun! Got 3 water slides and it was nice for kids as well adult people. Got a lazy river and an endless pool with ocean view. 9. Palomino Island: Good for snorkeling, horse riding, beach volleyball, basketball, jet sky, enjoying the beach, rum and medellas! Cons: 1. The Parking. The parking itâ€™s in a really bad shape and over that is pretty far from the hotel. So you need to wait for a bus to pick you up and drove you to the Hotel and vice-versa. They need to update their parking lot ASAP. The bus that pick us up, was doing some really strange noises that I thought it could be the front wheel. 2. The Casino closed at midnight, and the bars too! (Only left one bar till 2am, but it was packed!). How are you going to close a full packed casino at midnight? Arenâ€™t the casino supposed to be open until you left with no money? At least they save me a few bucks! 3. The Disco was so laud that nobody was there. I counted 5 people in total at 12:15midnight. 4. The hotel need urgent a â€œmake upâ€�. Itâ€™s an old hotel, and need more attention from the Maintenance people. The painting and the roofs need help urgent! My overall rating for the hotel in a scale from 1 to 10, I gave them an 8.5, and I would likely return back again and stay in the Conquistador.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation - Expectations Met”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary at the El Conquistador. After reading some of the negative reviews, we had some concerns, but were looking forward to our vacation. Here is my take on the resort: - The overall review ratings is about 4 to 4.5 which we think is accurate. Is the resort perfect? No, but it is pretty great. It could use some cosmetic touchups, but that should not be a negating factor. The overall hotel is beautiful to look at, and the views and the grounds are spectacular. - Everyone that we dealt with at the hotel was very friendly and professional. From the valet, to check-in, to the service people at the bars and restaurants. If you get a car, use the valet. For the extra 5 dollars a day, it is worth it. The drinks are pricey, but you are at a resort. What do you expect? - For dinner, we ate off the resort all except for 1 night. La Estacion is about .5 miles from the main entrance. It is worth the trip. The food was great, the service was excellent, and the prices were good (NOTE: Closed on Tues & Wed during off season). At the resort, we ate at Blossoms which is a Chinese/Japanese cuisine. We had the Chinese menu, and it was very good, and the price was a little high, but not bad. - You have to take the ferry to get to Palomino island. You can see the ferry coming back from the island, so time it right, and you do not need to wait long. The ferry ride was nice, and the beaches at the island were very clean. Plenty of lounge chairs to choose from, and many activities on the island. We rented a Wave Runner for 30 minutes, and had a great time. There is sea weed around the shore, but you are in the ocean, what would you expect. I would suggest the water shoes though. - On Friday afternoon, we went back to the pool, and thought we landed at Spring break. The pools were packed with a younger crowd. The music was loud, and everyone was having a good time. Everything was under control, and my wife and I enjoyed watching the different people, having flashbacks to our younger days. If you want quiet, stay on the island. Overall, I recommend the hotel, and I would go back. I am sure some people had a bad experience, but don't let that stop you from going. Some people are always looking for the negatives. If you are going on vacation to have a good time, and don't sweat the small stuff, you will love this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: Marsha F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Conquistador in June. We had initially planned to stay in San Juan for a week, but we realized really fast that while San Juan has some interesting history, it was not the tropical get away we had in Juan is a city - a major city, not a tropical getaway at all. One day in San Juan is enough. Fajardo was amazing. We had friends who had stayed at El Conquistador the year before so we called and made arrangements to stay there for the remainder of our trip. El Conquistador's grounds are amazingly beautiful. The views are breathtaking. Our room was not only comfortable, but very clean and pretty. The architecture of the hotel is so nice, and the pools were awesome! The private island is a little piece of Heaven. We have zero complaints about the staff - They were all courteous and helpful. Here's my advice for a wonderful trip. Get plenty of gas before you leave San Juan to head to Fajardo - You won't pass a ton of gas stations. Stop at the kiosks and eat at Luquillo Beach. Authentic and really good. I think we ate at #23. Try to get a deal where breakfast is included. The breakfast restaurant is amazing! Very expensive if it's not included so work it out in your room price. Spend lots of time on the private island. Eat the pizza by the pool. It's excellent. Take the ferry out to Culebra Island. It is like Gilligans Island - so undeveloped and natural. You will be so glad you saw it! Kayak the bioluminescent bay. El Conquistador is located in the best spot - so convenient to these beautiful natural attractions. Such an awesome place for a family vacation or a romantic trip for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: cberrn76
Reviews.Content: We just finished our honeymoon to puerto rico - 7 days @El Con. On a recommendation of our travel agent in NY, we booked a room in Las Olas section. When we arrived and went to check in, the girl @ the desk told us that due to the impending tropical storm, they decided to close the Las Olas wing, so they were putting us in Las Brisas, but not to worry "this is DEFINATELY an upgrade!. We had done our homework before booking, but figured we would see what they were giving us. On the way to the room, my husband (who is Puerto Rican) was chatting with the bellman, and he told us Las Olas was closed for construction. The next day my husband went to the front desk and spoke with Arlene. He relayed our disappointment with our "upgraded" room. She appologized, and moved us to a gorgeous suite about 50ft from the ocean in La Marina village. We were very pleased with the upgrade, but unfortunately, our problems did not end there. Our room's A/C unit was leaking, and the carpet in the closet area was saturated. It took 3 calls to the front desk over 2 days, and finally the cleaning lady got someone to fix it! We checked with the front desk before taking the catamaran to their beautiful private Palomino island... and we were told we didn't need any cash... but when we tried to rent a jet ski, the guy told us it was $110 cash. The last day we were there, we returned from the island only to find our room keys wouldn't open the front door to the building. We called 5 times to the front desk, who kept telling us "security is on the way"... but after 45minutes of standing in the hot sun, only a call to the general manager got us any results ! Once we discussed our issues with the GM, security was there in minutes. The managers Dermott Connolly and Jesus Roman were more than appologetic for our inconveniences. They personally brought us new room keys, sent us champagne and strawberries, and offered a dinner at the restaurant of our choice. We were very pleased with their great customer service and willingness to remedy the situation. El Con is definately a beautiful resort, but for the price, I would expect more. The room was gorgeous, the view and Palomino Island was spectacular! Booking during hurricane season is risky, but the resort was empty most of our stay... and it was awsome! For the price of a room, we felt the parking and the water park should be complimentary for guests. In all the hotels we have ever been to, we've never paid $25/day to park! The food is over-priced, but that is to be expected. We did enjoy our stay, but will probably look to stay elsewhere on our next trip to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing architecture and views, great service”
Reviews.Author: mrsluna_az
Reviews.Content: This hotel has probably one of the most beautiful views in Puerto Rico, the staff is friendly and the service is very good. The prices are reasonable. Some rooms be be up for re-decoration, but the rooms are very clean and plesant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tschwartz28
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador was a wonderful place to have the family in August. At first we had a reservation for 3 rooms and when we arrived, we inquired into a Casita. We had stayed at a Casita as a couple once before, however, not with our family. We had ages 14 through 82 and everyone found something they loved. We especially liked having a pool by our room in the evenings for a final dip after excursions or the beach. And, when we would get to our room, our butler had fulfilled any requests that we made during the day, such as bringing bottled water getting fresh fruit or a few extra towels/sundries. If you wanted it, they got it. El conquistador sits on the side of an elevated hill/mountain and though the terrain is steep, the Casita drivers would come by with a limo golf cart to take us to the main lobby or to the golf course. And of course, would pick us up after dinner at one of the restaurants or Casino and take us to the room. While you could walk, sometimes it was just as well to take the cart. We dined at the Asian restaurant on Sushi and Japanese styled grill, and were constantly watched by our host, no water glass left unfilled. Pricing for the restaurants was typical of any resort. In addition, there are restaurants a cab fare away that a fabulous. Plus the cabbies will either wait or bring you back at a pre-determined time, you don't pay until they bring you home! Lot's of things to do, and, I recommend you go during the new moon so that you can excursion to one of the few Luminescent Bays in the world. However, if there is a full or partial moon, you won't see the majestic bay luminescents unless it is completely dark out at night.

Reviews.Title: “It depends what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: sovega11
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because the hotel I normally stay at (Rio Mar), did not have availability. Also, everytime I mentioned the name of the hotel everyone gave it dumbs up. Last time I take somebody word for it rather than doing my homework. First off, I must say that the grounds are beautiful and pretty well maintained. My dissapointment came when I entered my room. The room was truly mediocre. The rooms are deffinitely dated. The bathrooms are way too small, there isn't even a place for you to hang your towel when you are done with your shower. Not sure about you all but when I go on vacation I at least like to have most of the accomadations I have at home. The did not have a balcony, which I prefer because I like to sit the in the am and read while my husband is sleeping. Furthermore, we traveled during off peak season and still paid a significant amount of money. We ended going to the reservations desk personally and having our room changed. The reservationaist was very nice and helpful. She explained that the hotel was intially built in 1962 and that Waldorf is doing there best in updating the property. We were given a bigger room that has a sepereat bath tub, shower, which was seperate from the bathroom facilities. The room also had a balcony, which I was very happy about (still no towel bar, but hey you can't have it all, I guess).

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria affiliation is deceptive...”
Reviews.Author: Fynride1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort three times now over the last 4 years. The first time, I really enjoyed my stay. I thought the resort was nice and the staff were pleasant. The second time was similar... But the most recent (June '10), not so great. The only thing I will say is it is pretty cheap. But then again, you get what you pay for. I will say, although somewhat expensive for breakfast ($60+ for 2 adults), Las Brisas is a must. The omlet station is a delight! The resort is isolated from all activities, it may as well be on a separate island.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria....noooo....perhaps Motel 6??”
Reviews.Author: leeshattuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have always associated Waldorf Astoria as upmarket and sophisticated so we were bitterly disappointed with our choice for our summer vacation. Our vacation was ruined by badly behaved and noisy children who seemed to take over the property with no idea of how to behave in these surroundings. It speaks volumes for 'adult only hotels'. Our trip to Palomino island was also spoiled by an excessively loud siren which set off loud tasteless pop music....why?? iI go to the beach to hear the waves! The restaurants, of which we tried 2, were expensive and very bad...it is difficult to spoil calamari but they did it at the Cafe Caribe.... Blossom was no better. Luckily we found 2 great restaurants in nearby village and never ate in the hotel again. I was disgusted to note parents with their babies wearing diapers in the adult pool.... so gross and unhygenic since they have their own facility. On the positive side, the staff are terrific..... five star.... attentive and polite. Our room was pleasant. The golf course and the staff are superb... challenging but great course in excellent condition inspite of the Hurricane which hit the island two weeks previously. I am sad to have to write this review but prospective visitors need to be cognizant that this hotel is not what they expect when associated with Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “JUST GORGEOUS”
Reviews.Author: Lauren G
Reviews.Content: My family went to the El Conquistador for a week. Not long enough. I don't think i have ever seen a view quite like that. The hotel staff were very attentive and accommodating. We needed to switch rooms because we needed a handicapped bathroom. They did everything possible to find the best room for us. I mean everything. The food was great and so were the pina colodas!! It is worth it to do their meal plan. Splurge for a private cabana. Would go back in a heart beat. Don't rule this hotel out because of the distance from the airport. You'll be sorry if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not what you'd expect from Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: EmmaKatesmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 2 years anniversary last year. I'm a Hilton fanatic, so we thought this would be a great fit. The great things about this property: close to airport (I don't like traveling for hours to get to my hotel after a long flight); the staff was very helpful. I'm a diamond member, so they're supposed to upgrade our room if there's availability. The person helping us said there were no upgrades available, which was annoying, because when I looked on my phone (as I was standing there) there were rooms available. After having to explain my case, they finally upgraded our room. It was nice, but I'd hate to see what our other room was going to be! The best part about this hotel is that there is a casino on the property. It was probably the best casino there, since many outside guests were coming to play there. There was no smoking in the casino, which was nice too. The pools were very nice--I honestly never set foot on the beach, but if I had to guess it was nice too.Juan for lunch one day and it was a beautiful city. We had lunch at a cool little bistro and shopped around afterwards. I was told it would have been very crowded if a cruise ship had been in port that day, but we were lucky, there were no ships. We had the town to ourselves. All in all, I'd stay at this property again, but I think (even being the die hard loyal Hiltoner I am) that I'll try the new St. Regis next time! The standards of the Waldorf brand don't seem to live up to their name outside of the continental US.

Reviews.Title: “Buetiful time”
Reviews.Author: Dvdmdz
Reviews.Content: Beutiful and luxury. 5 star hotel. Resort has a Private beach - beutiful. Rooms were elegant. Stop on the marina level. Very private. Great family resort at main level. Marina level more private great for couples ...service , food , grounds, all top notch. Kind of pricey but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful, a bit expensive and probably not the best for young singles.”
Reviews.Author: NeRock04
Reviews.Content: I went to El Conquistador as a part of a girlfriend's getaway trip. Generally, we enjoyed the hotel's amazing oceanside bluff views, and private beach island. Our room was nice and included a balcony with a wonderful view as well as the biggest bathroom (with a walk-in closet!) I've ever had at any hotel. HOWEVER, I felt a bit out of place with all of the couples and families at the resort. My friends and I are single women with no kids, in our late 20s/ early 30s. Needless to say, we were bored evenings at the resort. Unfortunately, it seems that all the great nightlife is in San Juan quite far from the resort. Another disappointment was the hotel's food. We didn't even bother to try any of the hotel's several more expensive restaurants. Our stay included free breakfast buffet which was adequate to keep from being hungry but nothing to rave about....fruit, bagels, etc. We really, really wanted authentic food which was rare at the resort- tostones at the resort's marina restaurant was the only puertorican dish I found on any menu there. Luckily, one of the hotel workers was kind enough to give us directions for how to sneak past the resort gates and walk to restaurants. Drinks were pretty expensive everywhere at the resort but expected. The hotel provides free ferry rides to it's own private Palomino Island. The island was wonderful, the restaurant had good burgers and rum drinks, and they offered fun activities like horseback riding and snorkeling. Please note: the island was great for sunbathing but beach is waaay to rocky for shallow swimming. The only downside was that the last ferry returned to the resort around 5pm; it would have been nicer to stay longer, especially since I found the resort quite boring at night. All in all, great for families or couples or individuals looking for a relaxing time with amazing views. Singles looking for nightlife should stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok; won't be back”
Reviews.Author: lolo2772
Reviews.Content: We got to the resort on Thursday before Labor Day. We thought we were staying at the Las Casitas, but the Honors desk messed up our reservation. No fault of the ladies working at the desk at Las Casitas - they were great. After about 3 hours (no joke), we went to a room at the Marina part of the resort. The room was nice, but the pool nearby has no services - just a towel stand - and you literally had to take a couple of elevators, a tram and walk quite a long way to get to the main hotel. This is not feasible when you are traveling with small children. We went back to the Las Casitas and finally got checked into a room there about 4 after initially arriving at the hotel around 11. Service - The service at the Las Casitas is quite good. The have folks who come around to see if you need drinks/food at the Infinity Pool. (At the main pool at the hotel, there is no service, but there are a couple of bars/cafes nearby where you can get what you need.) In addition, the restaurant service was very good. The ladies who work at the reception in the Las Casitas were exceptional and helped us in many ways. Rooms - our initial room in the Marina part of the hotel was nicely decorated and had an ocean view. Except for the location, it would have been suitable. The room at the Las Casitas was a studio with a small kitchen, ocean view and a hot tub on the back deck. The small kitchen was great to have for our 19 month old. The only gripe I had about the room, was the shower, which was broken. The shower head had a leak where the head attached to the wall and a lot of water leaked all over and onto the floor. Most importantly, the rooms were clean and nicely appointed. Food - The food is pretty good, but boy did I feel gouged. In addition, do not come here thinking you or your kids will have a lot of healthy options. It was hard to locate a vegatable. We ate breakfast at the restaurant at the Las Casitas. It is your standard breakfast buffet, which in my opinion is overpriced for what you get. Also, it was the same everyday that we were there. $19 for fruit (pineapple, watermelon, canteloup, orange, grapefuit, honeydew), bacon, sausage, potatoes, pancakes or french toast, pastries, oatmeal, dry cereal, yogurt, scrambled eggs. No omlet station or waffle station. We had two nice dinners (with our daughter) at the Italian place and at Strip House. Again, good food but high prices and the wine was extremely expensive. Resort in general - The place needs a face lift. There are lots of places with peeling paint and men working all over, so maybe there will be an improvement coming. We enjoyed the beach, but you have walk a long way, take 2 elevators, a tram and a ferry to get there. Be prepared!

Reviews.Title: “All I saw were people having a great time”
Reviews.Author: reptileenthusiast
Reviews.Content: The reviews on El Conquistador are so split that it is hard to know what to think. We stayed for 2 nights several years ago and had a nice stay, although the time was so limited that we really did not have time to enjoy most of the amenities. This August I had a conference in San Juan and we decided to spend three nights at Conquistador prior to the conference. We were quite apprehensive given the reviews on this site, but decided to give it a try. I'm so glad we did. Following advice on this site we booked one of the Las Brisas rooms (third floor) and had fabulous views of the ocean and Palomino Island, as well as the hillside below the room which. If you look carefully in the morning, the hillside is full of large iguanas sunning at the tops of the trees. We went to Palomino Island both full days of the trip and had a fabulous time. We did not expect much from the snorkeling given the reviews here and elsewhere, and there is little coral to be found. But we saw schools of various fish, two species of butterfly fish, trunkfish, puffers, a barracuda, and best of all on our last snorkeling bout just as we were about to leave the water we saw an eel! The snorkeling definitely exceeded our (limited) expectations. Oh, and the frozen mudslides were awesome. Our room was clean and the furnishings were bright and modern, didn't care for the vinyl couch but it looked nice. Best part of the room was the balcony and that awesome view; hanging out on the balcony in the evenings listening to the coqui and feeling the gentle breezes was really magical. And watching the morning curtains of rain come through was really something. Breakfast as Las Brisas was included in our package and while there was always what looked like a long line to get in, it moved very quickly and never took us more than 10-15 minutes to be seated. Breakfast was plentiful enough that we skipped lunch each day. We found service to be helpful and friendly, it didn't seem to us that the staff were unhappy in general. Negatives - the air conditioning unit in the room created condensation on the floor; no big deal we wiped it up. Food is expensive, but that's to be expected. I agree that the food is very hit and miss. The first night we ate at the pizza and pasta restaurant - my pizza was delicious and my husband enjoyed his sandwich but was still hungry after. The next two nights we ate at the Bally hoo Grill next to the water - great view and ambiance but food, again, was highly variable. I had one of the best Cuban sandwiches I have ever had (and remember, I live in Florida) - OMG the roasted pork in that sandwich was phenomenal. On the other hand the previous night I ordered churrasco, something that the cook should be able to make in his sleep - ugh, very odd texture and not a lot of flavor. Although the food could have been better, that did not significantly impact our enjoyment. We loved our time at El Conquistador. Maybe we just got lucky, but honestly, all we saw around us were a lot of happy people having a great time snorkeling, sunning, and enjoying life. I can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Set the Record Straight”
Reviews.Author: mdavidosn664
Reviews.Content: Before my husband and I went on this trip (we had already booked the resort) I got on Trip Advisor and read some reviews. The reviews were all over the place. Needless to say after reading some of the reviews I was very worried. But for every bad review there seemed to be at least two good ones. When we arrived at the resort we opted for self parking instead of valet parking (always looking to save a few bucks). Signs could have been clearer. The resort is on the top of a hill. The parking is about 1/3 of the way down the hill. There was an attendant there who sat in his car, and there was a make shift tent for shade. We had to wait for the van, which was very dirty on the inside and packed with people who where just there to use the water park. We threw our luggage in the back and anxiously awaited whatever came next. Had we known, or had the attendant told us, we could have just driven up to the resort, dropped off our luggage and I could have just waited for my husband to go park and return either on fit or in said dirty van. Once we were up to the resort, my fears allayed a little. It looked gorgeous from the outside. Open and airy. We went inside and waited awkwardly for a few moments for reception to address us. From there on out it was all smiles, pleasantries and helpfulness from the staff. We had been upgraded to a full ocean view room (Hilton Honors member, plus low season). We were directed to our room and walked through the incredbly spacious and well-enough appointed lobby areas complete with caged tropical birds. We walked past the rum bar, starbucks, casino, cafe and shops. OK. Good. I am liking this. I mean anything with Starbucks gets kudos in my mind. We reached a carpeted area which was worn and in need of a good vacuuming. Worried again. We took the elevator "down" to the fourth level. Remember, it is on a cliff. There was a walkway past the rooms that opened up to a gorgeous courtyard. It smelled wonderful, and later I would learn that it sounded wonderful too. Resident lizards and iguana were everywhere. We opened the door to our room. It clearly needed a little updating, but it was spacious and very very clean. The bathroom was huge. We walked out onto the balcony, and I was hooked. The view of the ocean and surrounding hills and cliffs was beyond spectacular. The breeze came right off the ocean. This place surprised me on every turn. It is a very large property with a lot to do or absolutely nothing to do. The pools were clean, warm like bathwater, bouyant. The jacuzzis were too hot to use, however. There was a swim up bar in the main pool, which was fun. However, we soon learned to stick to wine and beer - and this is probably my biggest complaint about the place. Everything is expensive, that is true, but it is resort - you are a captive audience and you kind of have to expect that - so I was OK with that, but, every bar where we ordered a rum or other liquor drink served very, very watered down versions. My husband and I were trying to figure it out because usually we saw them pour the drinks and they seemed to be generous enough with the liquor. We could only assume the bottles must be watered down. Now we are not lushes by any stretch, but if I am paying $12-$14 for a fru-fru drink, or $9 for a rum and coke, I want some rum in it. Otherwise, I will just order a $3.50 coke. I am not making any accusations, that was just our observation. Certainly, melting ice could be a factor. After day 2, we were happy to order Coronas at the bar and wine with dinner. nbd. While there we did a tour of the El Yunque Rain Forest. That was amazing, especially since we were there only a couple of days after the re-opened it following the clean up after the hurricane. It really is a site to see and I will always remember the way it smells. We went over to Palamino Island twice. It is really the perfect beach spot. Again, we were off season and we took the first boat over and we had the island almost to ourselves for a while. There had a lot to do there, plenty of chaise lounges and tiki umbrellas. The water was warm. The first time we saw some jellyfish so we stayed out of the water most of that day. The next day we didn't see any, so we spent a good deal of time in the water. My husband and I decided it probably wouldn't be much fun in the high season. It was obvious some of the areas of theproperty needed some work and I wasn't sure how much of it was normal upkeep or issues from the recent hurricane, but they had people working on the property non-stop - painting, mowing, trimming, cleaning, serving. I was amazed by how many employees they have. And everyone was pleasant and helpful. That having been said, for the most part, is was an awesome, awesome property. I loved hearing the Coqui at night, but it might anoy the heck out of some people. For the first couple of days my husband and I had an ongoing "argument" about whether the sounds were natural or piped in. I thought they were too perfect and rhythmic to be natural and I kept telling him they were piped in in "Disney-esque fashion." I soon realized I was wrong. Also, our room was too close to the Funicular and we started hearing that go at about 6:00 a.m. All in all, we would go back in a heartbeat. It was a marvelous place for some serious downtime. M. Davidson

Reviews.Title: “Jaw-Dropping Ocean Views for a Relatively Low Price”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie1976
Reviews.Content: This resort is a steal for around $200/night including taxes. Gorgeous ocean views throughout property, amazing white-sand, turquoise water at Palomino Island. The service was far better than we have had at other Puerto Rican beach resorts. Staff was efficient, timely, and helpful. The forecast said it was going to be raining all three days, but each day was sunny (partly cloudy) and the nights were damp and warm. The pools were practically empty, so we felt like we had the resort to ourselves. We also looked into staying at the St. Regis, Bahia Beach, but that was $500 a night including taxes. One night we ate at Blossoms, which was delicious. Service was quick! First night we just drove down to the local Sizzler which was also clean. The only negative thing about the resort is that it needs some more upkeep (and TLC) because it gets pummeled during hurricane season. Our room was clean, but not squeaky clean. There was a stale urine smell throughout room, not sure if this was due to moisture accumulation overtime when door is open or cleaning with a dirty mop bucket. Everything was decorated white, so you do see stains from past guests which is kind of gross, hallway carpet needs to be replaced. Coqui water park was a blast, and a half day was about 12 dollars. Worth it because those pools are idyllic as well and the slides are a blast. Mostly adults on the slides! Saw a small nurse shark in shallow water on Palomino, but considering there's not a ton of fish to see while snorkeling, this was exciting. We're making El Conquistado our new getaway, you can't beat the value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but lacks service”
Reviews.Author: sarilamejor
Reviews.Content: When we went there was a convention going on of which we were not part of, of course the hotel didnt care about this detail. The only room available was a the Marina, please do not let them put you here this is the worst part of the hotel. Our room stunk like mold/mildew very gross and the room wasnt even close to par to the ones in the website. Will not stay here again very expensive for what you get., rather go to the Dominican Republic.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views, Good Golf but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this trip on Cheap Caribbean to celebrate my 51st birthday with two other couples that were going.We got here Sept. 1st and left Sept. 5th. When we got off the plane their was someone waiting from the resort to escort us to a bus to take us to the hotel. We thougt this was great -until after the fact (once we were at hotel) we found out there was a charge of $74.00 per person round trip. I will say one of the staff member at the check in desk was very helpful and very pleasant Marilyn Lopez . Whenever we had a question or if she seen us pass the front desk Marilyn went out of her way to be helpful. Saying good morning to us by name, rental car and tour information what was the best and least expensive way to see the island. If your going to visit ask for her. Our room smelled very musty and damp but we had a beautiful view. We were on third floor.The staff at pool bar very friendly but everywhere else needs serious help. Dinner at the Strip House -take my advise dont waste your money -and a lot of it would be wasted. Terrible service everything a la carte and you share your vegetables. I like my brocilli my husband baked potato. The size is enough for two but you have to agree to eat the same and the same dessert or it will cost you. I know your at a resort but you wont get out of here for under $120.00 for two and it is not a meal to remember. On the other hand the Stingray Rest and the Chinese Rest outstanding service and food. Heres what I can tell you if your going for 4 or 5 days besides the cost of your trip plan on it costing you around another $600.00 for food and drinks. My advise skip this resort and go to an all inclusive. Our friends were here about 6 years ago and said it was much better then before it became a Waldorf Astoria Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: abbey_315
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing our stay at this hotel-- very disappointing. We came for an event that was held here over the weekend. We were pleased to see that the resort was on the AMEX fine hotels and resorts program-- we have never been disappointed with any hotels on that list... Until now. We will be complaining to Amex and asking them to remove this dump from their list. I cannot believe this is one of the waldorf Astoria collection hotels-- I wouldn't even rank it as being as nice as your average Hilton. We were in two different rooms/ areas-- the views are beautiful- best part about the resort. Both rooms reeked HORRIBLY of mold/mildew- awful, overwhelming sour smell, yuck! Hard to sleep comfortably when your sheets and the entire room smell this way. Also-- the sheets-- the maids make the beds up and leave the bottom quarter of the mattress uncovered- what the heck?! The sheets are not of nice quality to begin with and I certainly don't want to sleep on the bare mattress. I thought maybe it was an error that would be corrected the next day... Nope, they just straighten your sheets, dont remake the bed. The grounds were nice, buildings in MUCH need of repair! This hotel is just not maintained. Furniture, doors, hallways, paint etc are all dingy, dirty... Just gross. Also- you can expect to see 95% of the people here are locals. The way the property is marketed makes the "private island" sound enticing... Just a pain in the you know what really. To get to said private island you have to hike across the resort, take the elevator down, then take the funicular, then get on the ferry... I knew this ahead of time and didn't think it would be a big deal, but I would MUCH rather be at a place that just had it's own beach right on the hotel property without so much hassle. This resort is equivalent of an all inclusive tropical hotel, which we have decided is not the way for us, and were very disappointed that this is what we got when we expected so much from a waldorf Astoria property that is NOT an all inclusive. The food on the resort is no good and very expensive to boot! The breakfast buffet was edible, but barely! Strip House was average at best with terrible service-- took more than an hour for us to get our food when we were one of three tables in the entire restaurant. As a whole, the service at this resort is sub-par. We are diamond Hilton Honors members AND booked with an AMEX bock card for the fine hotels and resorts program-- instead of getting better service I feel we got worse service. The private island was alright, but not the relaxing upscale environment i expected-- overcrowded, no privacy karaokee blasting... Local yokals with their coolers full of medell, and no servers to be found. The beach is not ever combed or raked and is badly in need of it. Most resorts with beaches pick up the chairs and rake the sand each day, not this one! The waterpark was alright- pretty small and kind of a ripoff- this should be included i your stay. Spa is nothing special, but that is one of the nicer things of the resort-- very small though and extremely overpriced. We are not cheP people, and we are used to paying alot of money for good food and spa services etc, but just dont waste your time and money. Waldorf Astoria AND Hilton should be embarrassed to have their name associated with this dive. If you are contemplating a vacation at this resort or another place in the Caribbean do yourself a favor and go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “We Arrived the Day After Hurricane Irene - Hotel Was Very Functional and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: wmbrett
Reviews.Content: After our inital trip plans to the W Hotel on Vieques was canceled due to power and water outages in Vieques, my wife and I had to scramble to find a hotel in PR with power and accomodations. The El Conquistador took us in. We were unable to get a Beach front room since most of those were flooded - but our garden view was acceptable. The hotel has its own power plant - so whereas most of the island was without power, it barely affected the hotel - we even had cable and internet. I think the family villas were without power. Food and Drink at the hotel was expensive - i.e. $22 for two small plastic cups of wine at the Rum bar and $100+ dollar dinners without alcohol - but considering the situation, we were glad the restaurants were open. My wife and I ventured out of the hotel to a local area that was interesting. If you exit through the Employee Parking Only exit (opposite from the water park) - through a big white gate on the ground (beach) level, and walk 5 minutes along the road, you come to a small area with about 10 little shops and restaurants. Only 1 was open at the time, and had its own power generator. Food was local and very cheap - about $20 for 3 beers, 2 wines, and meals for 2 of us. It was open air and chickens were walking under the tables. I'd be a little nervous about traveling that route at night, but daytime was fun, and a couple of stray dogs accompanied us. The little island they shuttle you to was great, we enjoyed snorkeling and had Verizon and ATT cell phone coverage and data.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in a hotel and more”
Reviews.Author: Mrslam
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through hotwire with a very good rate. We didn't come with high expectation due to its mixed review. But the hotel was beyond our expectation. It was clean, well-maintained, offered different activities for everyone in the family - only thing we didn't really try was the restaurants (we ate out most of the times). Our room was located in Las Brisas wing, which has a clear view to the ocean and the bio-lagoon. It's spacious, clean, everything you want in a tropical vacation hotel setting. The Golden door spa was to die for - make sure you ask for daily discount if you go there. I got 15% off service just by asking. The hotel has ferry that takes you to their private island; which was really nice. Then for our children, they have the water park. It's more worth it if you choose the half-day option. The restaurants were mostly overpriced, so we can't really comment on them. We did try their restaurant by the ferry dock. They have $9 daily special (pulled pork wrap & hotdog, both were delicious). Then we ate at the fastfood restaurant by the water park. Nothing special, just another fast food joint but convenient due to the location. They also have golf course and little shops scattered around the ground. There was walmart, local grocery & Walgreen 5 minutes away from the hotel - really really useful information from Tripadvisor reviewers. We stocked our breakfast items, water, even waterproof camera from Walmart. If you have a rental car, I suggest you to try out restaurants around the hotel. One of our favorites was El Calvadero, very close to the marina. On a rainy day (which happened to us one day during our stay), you can drive to the outlet mall which was about 20 min away. On your way there, you can stop at one of the restaurants at Luquillo for lunch or dinner. It may not be budget friendly, but they have really good food (Ceviche hut, etc). All in all, I would suggest this hotel to my friends and family and another visit is a welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: LisaP0
Reviews.Content: I must admit after reading several of the resort reviews I was very apprehensive about this trip. Based on the room reviews I began to lower my expectations. I also upgraded to an ocean front room and I am happy to say that our room was great. Yes, we had a closet in the bathroom but it worked really well for us. I am an early riser and wanted to hit the gym or tennis court so I could get dressed without waking anyone. We stayed in the Marina, which is not close to the pool, but very close to the water park (which we never saw), and the catamaran to the beach. Fabulous view, quiet, spacious, and perfect. Food is outrageously expensive, but there is a little town that is walking distance. If you do the bio bay tour make sure you walk from the hotel. It's seven minutes from the marina. There are a number of local restaurants worth checking out so if you do not have a car, its a good alternative to an expensive dinner. Other recommendations....pick up a few bottles of wine (or whatever you drink) in the airport duty free shop to put in the refrig in the room. Finally, consider renting a car. It's the best way to see the rain forest and get out for a bit. Just do it on-line for the best price.

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: thepolitetourist
Reviews.Content: I reconfirm my room early in the morning, and in the afternoon they call me to cancel my reservation bookinf from may 2011. because the room was wet (Irene Hurracaine) I have to book to another hotel. Other people they upgrade to las casitas people who made the reservation 30 days ago (july ), In 4 days you can know if the room be ok for stay. Please to check others hotels around very clean, good rates. I will never stayed here and if the Pharmacist Convention is here next year, I will not come. Mrs. Lopez

Reviews.Title: “We relaxed and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Lillian S
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at El Conquistador, we arrived the day after hurricane Irene passed through Puerto Rico. It was evident that the Hotel was in distress; however, the cordial and professional treatment from all personnel was comforting and appreciated. Most of the employees had been working over night and had their families at home with no electricity, but their professionalism and reassurance that everything was going to be fine make us feel confident that they will take care of us. Next day we went to the Spa and the experience was as positive and relaxing as expected, the place is beautiful and the staff was professional. The hotel has entertainment for all ages, all our dining experience were positive and delicious. My husband and I decided to return for our next anniversary in December. If you are looking for relaxation, and fun book your next vacation at El conquistador. Thank you to Ruth at housekeeping and to Sharyl Toko, Hotel Manager for their attentions and professional treatment. Lillian Santiago-Bauza

Reviews.Title: “Rated as one of the best vacations we've taken!”
Reviews.Author: jbjm3
Reviews.Content: Rent a car, especially worth it as the cost of the hotel's service is over the cost of a car rental; even though you pay for parking. If you don't pay for valet service there is a walk but it's not as far as the reviews say. Most times you can get the shuttle to take you anyway!! Still it isn't even a five minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back...”
Reviews.Author: tmouldm
Reviews.Content: We were in the Marina Ocean Front room. The moment we first walked into our room, my heart dropped. We had seen pictures online from the resort page and it looks very clean and up-to-date. However, this is far from the case. I expected a 4 star resort room and this room reminded me of a Days Inn at best. The "white" couch was filthy with hairs and stray marks all over it. The carpet was extremely dated. Actually everything about the room was dated. If you are expecting modern, this is not it. Trust me on this, if you care at all about cleanliness, you will be VERY disappointed and uncomfortable in these rooms. We experienced several issues with housekeeping. I'll list a day by day: Day 2: We returned from a day at the beach and of course, had some sand carried back with us to the room. Some actually got in the sheets (housekeeping had not been to our room at this time). This was around 4:00. We showered and went out for dinner hoping that when we returned housekeeping would have been there. We stopped by the front desk to ask for a toothbrush and they said they'd send it right down. I also asked if housekeeping automatically comes to the room or not because no one had come before we left. We were informed "they tidy up after 7" so we took this to mean that it was 7 in the evening...however, when we returned to our room, still no sign of housekeeping service. I had to call again and request the toothbrush and they insisted it was left on the sink. We searched and never found a toothbrush and called once again. They finally brought it. Day 3: We decided to put the Housekeeping Please sign in our door to make sure they came this day. We returned from the beach, only to find that the only service provided by housekeeping was they made our beds (with the same dirty sheets) and dropped off towels. No vacuuming, no cleaning the bathroom, etc. I called and was transferred to housekeeping and requested they provide us with clean sheets. They did send two women down who changed our sheets. Day 4: I raised the sheets up because I noticed my feet were touching the mattress. We investigated further, only to find that they had put the sheet on sideways. The bottom 1/4 of the bed was not covered by a sheet. So we turned it the right way and realized they had not placed a king size sheet on our bed, and turned it sideways in hopes that we wouldn't notice that we were actually lying on the bare mattress. I called and requested sheets to actually fit our bed. They sent one male down that barely spoke English and he handed me the sheets and walked away. We had to make our own bed that night. But luckily the sheets actually covered the entire bed. The rest of our stay they never once cleaned the toilet, shower, wiped the sinks, vacuumed, etc. You only get clean sheets if you request them. The rooms were filthy in every corner there is dirt and filth that has accumulated for who knows how long. For the majority of our stay, only one of the two boat taxis were in-service, so if you missed the boat to the island, you really were going to wait an hour before you could be transported over or to return to the resort. If you are wanting a RELAXING vacation, this is not the place for you. You have to rush in everything you do if you are going to the beach. We had to catch the tram up to breakfast each morning, fight the massive crowds at Las Brisas, hurry and ride the tram back down the hill and time it just right so you can catch the one boat that is actually in service to head to the beach. You then must fight the crowds in line to make sure you get a seat on the boat and not get left behind. Then once you make it to the island, you have to race to get one of the limited umbrellas. It just seemed like we were constantly in a hurry to "relax." Also, we weren't there to play golf and it's a good thing we weren't because they were doing maintenance on the golf course. We were not notified ahead of time and the remedy was to offer a 50% discount on golfing. Besides our issues with the room itself and the uncleanliness, the service is not what you would expect. Several other people we talked to complained of this as well. You would have to wait 20 minutes or longer for a drink refill at dinner. They see your glass is empty and walk right past you as if they don't even notice you. We would almost have to knock somebody down to get a refill or to even place and order once we were seated. Last, as I'm sure others have mentioned, you will pay tremendously for food. Expect $50 per person at least if you are going to one of the nicer restaurants. Expect $25 per person for a small lunch meal. We recommend the Strip House. It was our favorite and the service was actually up to par. Sorry I don't have many positives to mention. Every other vacation we have been on I have been extremely pleased and had many positive things to mention. I really just can't think of any with this resort other than that the views are amazing with the mountains and the ocean. Overall, I do not recommend this resort. For this to be a Waldorf Astoria Resort, we expected so much more in service and quality. We were extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: pologirl63
Reviews.Content: Felt safe and comfortable at this hotel...traveling with husband and three kids. We occupiied two spacious,adjoining rooms in the Las Brisas section which has close access to most amenities. The staff was friendly and helpful. Bring pool shoes or the like for Palomino Island (private beach).

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place in the world...there have their own island!”
Reviews.Author: Andre L
Reviews.Content: We were here during hurricane Irene, and while the rest of Puerto Rico had no water and power, we had Wifi, AC and 5 restaurants to choose from. Puerto Rico is an amazing place, and I think that impression was mainly formed by my stay at El Con. The place is grand, in the old world sense. There's amazing restaurants and bars, all classy, beautiful and very unique. It's the type of place you see in old films, the "good old days" of resorts. This is not to say the place is dated, it's very modern and the rooms are amazing, huge, with large bathrooms, walk in closets and other things that make you never want to go home. There's a ton of outdoor activities, from the beautiful golf course, to multitude of pools and water park, to my favorite, Palamino. Palamino is a private island, with the most beautiful beaches I've ever seen, horses, putting green, bars, and hiking. The place is huge, and only resort guests are allowed. If you want local flavor Fajardo has many finishing villages and other places where you can get delicious local food for very cheap. Basically this is the only place I've ever been where I would literally want to live and never go home. There's live music downstairs every night, the place is alive. There's a casino and too many bars to count. You'll never be bored. The staff is also very mellow and helpful. We survived hurricane Irene in this place and it was really not a big deal. They served free lunch, had activities all day for kids and adults, and kept the place running smoothly despite the devastating weather conditions. All in all, it's an amazing place and much better than any resort I've ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: richard l
Reviews.Content: Anothers Hotels around also Riomar Hotel good for stay! Conquistador very expensive, workers are not friendly. Rooms with mold.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: Our family returned from our trip the day after hurricane Irene blew threw puerto Rico. While we were there, the staff was excellent, the pools beautiful, the island relaxing. Rita does water aerobics at the main pool around 10 am. She is very pleasant and made exercise a lot of fun. The stingray cafe, strip house and the italian restaurant were all excellent. Dinners were delicious and staff was very attentive to anything that was needed. The swim up bar was enjoyed by all. All in all we had a lovely trip. They also made sure that everyone was taken care of safely during the hurricane.

Reviews.Title: “Las Casitas and nothing else”
Reviews.Author: arcanax
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this vacation, as we have two little kids (7 and 4). We are from NY and found a lot of Spanish people there which is good because it means natives go there. we had a spacious 1 bedroom at the Las Casitas, and enjoyed our three of four times a day walk through magnificent gardens and lush greenery to the main hotel. Warnings: food limited and very expensive- we wound up eating Chicken most days with fries. Loved the Infinity Pool overlooking the Snake Island. Coqui Park is a must do - Kids LOVED and wanted to be there EVERY day. we especially enjoyed all the flowers and beautiful walks around the grounds. If I have to sum this up to 3 main points: 1) very comfortable, rooms clean, and room service great 2) food not great, drinks limited, bar not that great. 3) scenery and pool and coqui park magnificent, with great family crowd - no issues at all. Bottom Line: if you want a bar scene, go to NYC. if you want to relax and don't expect a huge bar/food/drinking experience, then this spot is better than great.

Reviews.Title: “It was AMAZING!! Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaAddy I
Reviews.Content: When my partner and I arrived, we were having a tough morning due to missing our flight and other troubles we ran into prior to arriving to the resort. However, soon after our arrival we felt a million times better!! Not only was EVERYONE extremely nice as we arrived to the resort, the front desk receptionist, Marisol, greeted us and quickly helped us with the troubles we had with the reservations.
