Marisol, was extremely helpful, kind hearted and assisted us to the fullest. I've been to other resorts in other islands and i've never felt the way i did at El Conquistador Resort. Marisol assisted us in getting a beautiful and unforgettable suite which made our trip ten times more memorable, waking up to the sound of the ocean and gorgeous sunrise!! Throughout our trip all of the resort staff members were so sweet, helpful and respectful!! Each day started with a great buffet breakfast and being greeted by delightful Stacey at Las Brisas Restaurant and others such as Victor and Pirun and the very nice young lady that greeted everyone that walked in the restaraunt (can't really remember her name). The we were able to sit by the pool side and talk with the bartenders for hours and enjoy great food and drinks. Fernando was a hilarious bartender as well as others that accompanied him at the small restaurant/bar up top. We definitely enjoyed our stay at El Conquistador Resort. We have recommended this resort to others, i.e. couples and families because everyone there definitely makes you feel as if you were home away from your own home. It's a very comfortable atmosphere for adults as well as children. There are several activities for both age groups to do. We are already planning our next trip to El Conquistador to visit our new friends!! =)

Reviews.Title: “what can i say...its a resort...”
Reviews.Author: tomegrl7101
Reviews.Content: Let me just start with this property is BEAUTIFUL. The views are amazing...perched on a cliff with views of the ocean that go on for days. The lobby is has an open and welcoming feeling and all of the staff (at least that I came across) is extremely helpful. With all of that being said there were a few things that concerned me. Considering this is a 4 star resort there was quite a bit of maintenance that needed to be done on the grounds. The pools at night weren't illuminated (which i noticed a few lights but i could tell some of them were out) The elevators to take us down to the marina weren't working. The funicular was leaking inside. Some of the decorative pillars they have look like they haven't been painted in years. Now, my room was more than spacious but it wasn't as clean as i would expect. Our couch had stains and so did our curtains. The bathroom ceiling had black spots on it (couldn't tell if it was bugs or something else) and our drains had a funny smell coming out. Also, I was there during hurricane Irene and I was surprised at how well the resort took care of everyone. The night of the hurricane they kept all of the staff there. It was too unsafe for them to leave. They tried to keep everyones mind off the storm. The had a dj, lots of board games for the kids, played movies, had the bars open. The next morning all of the staff was hard at work cleaning up the mess the storm had made. The resort fed everyone for free for breakfast and lunch which was a nice surprise. I felt that the resort really tried to keep everyone comfortable and that counts for something. I will close with this, remember that this is a resort and the prices are higher than normal for EVERYTHING but I would recommend a stay here any day.

Reviews.Title: “Caution!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rocco05
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to be at El Conquistador for hurricane Irene. The sad part is it was the highlight of the vacation. I do not even know where to start. This resort is in the final stages of its life cycle. There should be a sequel to the movie the "Shining" at this place. It is evident that it once was a magnifient resort but many areas of the resort are simply abandoned. We stayed in the Las Olas section which could not even compare to a Best Western. The restaurant and outside bar on this level was abandoned many years ago. The only somewhat nice thing was the semi clean pool and jacuzzi. The rooms are outdated from the 1980's. The drains where clogged from the debris from the hurricane and flooded the entire upper level. We had 4 inches of water in our room. This of course was not anyones fault. The water made its way down the steps and flooded both lobbys and made its way through some of the ceilings on the lower levels. This section should be condemed after the hurricane but they have no intention of doing so. The rugs should of been changed 10 years ago never mind the destruction from the hurricane. They are simply sucking the water up and spraying chemicals to try to mask the unbearable mold smell. They moved us to the lower section of this building to one of the few rooms that did not get flooded. The smell of mildew and mold from the hallway started to penetrate the rooms. The trams to take you up and down the hill to your room are always breaking and should be retired long ago. They are on the verge of being unsafe. Listen to the other reviews. This resort gives you nothing. I mean nothing. The water park is cute but they have the audacity to charge you. The water park cost me $53. for 2 children and one adult. I am from New York and nothing surprises me concerning prices until I came here. I read the reviews and was very prepared. The first day we went VIA taxi($30) to the food store and stocked up on water wine beer and snacks for the kids. If you go down to the marina and walk to the left you can take a 7 minute walk to the local little town where you can get delicious food very cheap. I recommend the freshly made Tacos! As I said before the resort is in the fimall stages of its life. They fill the place up by doing extensive advertising to get the locals to go there for 70-80 bucks a night. If your airfare is paid already, do yourself a favor and book any other hotel. You cannot get anymore easy to please people than my family and I have to say this was the #1 worst vacation I ever had and it was not due to the hurricane. The hurricane only allowed us to momentarily make some excuses for the place. There is no where to run and hide from the ridiculous prices on premise. There is 17-18 dollar hamburgers. 30-50 dollar al la carte dinner entres, 10-11 dollar ice creams, 10-15 dollar drinks. This is not a place to bring the family. It can financially ruin you! This place should be put out of its misery and shut down. It is only a matter of time.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST VACATION EVER”
Reviews.Author: Gadiela2370
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband & my one year kid we stay at the Marina, the room was very clean and the view was wonderfull. The island Palomino was excellent perfect for the kids! ! And the hotel have many pool so can choose . The breakfast buffet was great!! We also went to the Croabas to get dinner and we found this resturant Pasion del Fongon the food was great and the service. I am sure we come back next year :)

Reviews.Title: “This resort is GARBAGE.”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyHall
Reviews.Content: So i'm here now at this resort, and I would say the only nice thing about this place is the scenery surrounding it. Literally EVERYTHING has gone wrong since we've been here. It took the front desk almost 2 hours to check us in, and we were not informed that you had to pay upfront. We were told you paid at the end of your vacation by our travel agent, and she clearly lied. The resort also neglects to tell you that you have to pay $100 a night security deposit UP FRONT, so there's an addition $700 fee they just decided not to tell you about before hand.The staff that checked us in we're EXTREMELY RUDE and we're literally laughing at us for being frustrated that THEY were taking so long. They "upgraded" our room.....dirty rug, stained walls, NO microwave, TV wasn't working....keep in mind we paid about $3000 for this room for a week. No god damn microwave....I've stayed in dump hotels that at least have a microwave, but here at this so called "resort", you have the pay to rent a microwave. You have to pay for laundry services, can't just do it yourself. We were told breakfast was free, and they charged us $70 for 3 people to eat breakfast. We've been experiencing bad weather, and they have shut down all the pools, no boats are going out to Palomino island, the elevators are all shut off, the salon is closed....so basically we're paying ridiculous amounts of money to sit in our rooms. We went to the resorts "nicest" Italian restaurant last night, it took them 30 minutes to even ask us what we wanted for drinks, then another 30 to bring them to us. ALL AROUND AWFUL SERVICE. Every person we have dealt with so far has been extremely rude. Everything is very expensive, and don't believe anything is "all-inclusive" for two seconds because I can assure you its not. Basically, we have been extremely unsatisfied thus far, and my optimism for the remainder of our vacation is diminishing with every experience we have. I would not recommend this place to anyone, I would rather stay in a one room shack on the beach. Awful service all around. This was supposed to be a relaxing vacation for a family who just lost a young soldier in Iraq and so far it has been NOTHING BUT STRESSFUL. Thumbs down, not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved our trip and recommend El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: K Q
Reviews.Content: I and my two daughters (ages 7 and 10) stayed in a Garden View room overlooking the golf course and bay. We were there 8 nights, 7 days. I found the El Con staff very accomodating and helpful in all aspects. I read the reviews and can confirm the pricing for meals and drinks are very expensive and recommend getting a deal for breakfast included in your stay (as we did.) Other than that, the resort was all it shows and more! We did all the activities kid oriented -- including going to Palomino, Little Palomino, Coqui waterpark, horseback riding, jet skiing, snorkeling, Bio Bay, El Yunque, riding in a horse drawn carriage in downtown San Juan, ziplining, scuba diving and especially playing in the pool. The resort staff were courteous and very responsive. We had two issues with the room (hair dryer didn't work and kid-locked safe), and both were addressed within 3 hours of our call. The kids loved the waterpark and I loved that it wasn't crowded. The funicular was quick and we did not have to wait often for a car. The views were FANTASTIC and the island is very beautiful. We had dinner one night at Blossoms and the kids loved the hibachi. To save a bit of money, rent a car and do El Yunque, ziplining, and San Juan on your own. El Yunque was a big hit -- do the La Mina trail and play in the pool at the bottom of the waterfall. Go early -- we got there about 10:30 AM and it was already getting crowded. San Juan is great and we were lucky to be there during a Culinary Festival in the old town. On the way back, we also hit McD's and Wal-Mart for cold cuts, etc. to save a few $ at lunch/dinner. You don't need a GPS if you have one on your cell phone, plus the directions Enterprise gives are easy to follow. Also, for the Bio Bay tours, walk to the nearby public marina -- go to the Dive Shop at the bottom of the hill, head out the gate to walk (15 minutes, maybe?) through the parking lot and out of the resort. The kids loved it and we had a really good time paddling in the mangroves. My 7 year old turns out to be an excellent kayaker! Be sure to check the moon cycle to pick the best night and either call or get there early to get a spot. We almost didn't get to go as everyone was busy that night. I TOTALLY recommend this resort and Puerto Rico as a family vacation destination. Luckily, we hit the weather timing right and had sun with just a few rain showers during our stay (we got out before hurricane Irene made landfall.) We did see a lot of jellyfish in the water, which is apparently common in August, so I'd recommend going earlier in the summer when the water is cooler. My oldest got stung, but she got an ice pack on it very quickly, and by evening the welts were gone. Pack your own snorkel gear (mask and snorkel) to save the daily rental -- you don't need fins as the coral is in knee to chest-deep water off the east coast of Palomino's beach. When I went diving with Casa Del Mar (great experience and fantastic sea life), I saw a bunch of jellies, but managed to avoid them during the dive. Do the morning 2 tank dive set -- we saw lobster, 2 sea turtles, huge sea fans that are in pristine condition, flounder, stingray, eel, tons of fish, and a whole field of conch. You can rent all of your dive gear at the shop which was nice and easy. Robert is an excellent divemaster! The island is lush and beautiful and everyone is very friendly. El Conquistador is a great resort and fun place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good full service resort”
Reviews.Author: dgecht
Reviews.Content: With the Waldorf running the show, we thought the level of service would have exceeded our expectations. The concierge was more like an information desk that was not too eager to help us book things. We had to push to get reservations made throughout the hotel. The pools were great and there were a lot of areas in and out of the sun to sit by the pool. The waiters came around every so often to see if we wanted something from the bar or something to eat. The private island was very nice and it was easy to get there on the ferry. The activities were very close to where the ferry docks and there were lots of quieter areas a short walk around the beach. The waiter service was VERY slow on the island and the food options were not great. The water park near the marina is quite small, but provided great entertainment in the afternoon. NB: The water park is half price in the afternoon. We also went to dinner at the restaurants that require reservations. The food was good, not great, and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and filthy”
Reviews.Author: Seacob13
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the hotel presently and I am disappointed with the cleanliness. We are in an oceanfront room by the Marina which has been refurbished I believe, but it is still run down. The white couch has huge marks all over it, the rug is filthy, and the bathroom appears to not have been cleaned lately. Whoever designed the room was not realistic. White pleather couches are a bad idea for a hotel room. The food is expensive but surprisingly decent, except for Ballyhoo's by the marina. The private island could be nice if they bothered cleaning it each day. There was crap on all the chairs the first day we went to the beach. Someone spilt strawberry daiquiri on the chair and it was there the next morning. The main pool area had cigarette butts everywhere. I also went to the spa for a massage, don't go!! The receptionist seemed to be bothered by my presence and the facilities are just average. The Waldorf and Red Door Spa brands need to rethink putting their brands on this place. They need a major cleaning. It's just gross at the moment. I was reading the booklet they leave in your room, and it's so far from reality I want to laugh!! In spite of being grossed out, we are having fun. Puerto Rico is very nice and I would definitely return, but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Bergerkg
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a Monday night due to airline delays of 8+ hours and were exhausted. At check-in we were upgraded to an Ocean View room, which was a very nice touch. The resort itself is massive with three different levels overlooking the Ocean. Our room was at the top, and afforded some incredibly picturesque views. Here's what you need to know about El Conquistador (in order of importance): 1. The restaurant prices are borderline exorbitant, so be prepared for sticker shock if you don't have a meal plan. Example - Lunch on the private island (2 sandwiches and drinks) was $58. I highly recommend getting off the resort at least once for a dinner in Fajardo or Las Croabas (try La Estaction right outside the resort - EXCELLENT). 2. The beach - which is lovely - is accessible only by the resort's catamarans. You have to plan ahead because it can take a good 10 minutes to get from your room all the way down to the marina (via the cable car-like Funicular), and the boats leave on the hour (7-10 minute trip). They return from the island at the bottom of the hour. The boats run from 9 AM - 5:30 PM. 3. Breakfast at Las Brisas ($20/pp) was a pretty good value and since it's a buffet, you get your money's worth and can skip an expensive lunch. 4. As stated in #1, try to get off the resort for at least one day. The resort has an Enterprise Car Rental at the front desk, but ***DON'T BOOK YOUR RENTAL AT THE DESK***. Make sure you book online, where you will literally save 50% off the quote they give you at the desk. Also, cars rented from Enterprise on-site park free on the resort (it's $16/day if you bring in an outside car) 5. It's about a one-hour drive to and from SJU Airport, so it's a good idea to pre-book roundtrip transfers from El Conquistador (~$70 pp), but make sure you leave plenty of time for your departure...leave at least 3 hours prior to your flight time! 6. If you have booked a Bioluminescent Bay kayaking expedition, you can walk there from the Marina level along an access road (sounds creepy, but it's well lit). Highly recommend doing this excursion...it's fascinating. 7. This wasn't an issue for us, but I would say that if you or someone you're traveling with has a disability or is in a wheelchair, this is not a great place to go. Far too many hills and inconveniences (like getting on and off a boat, etc...) that would really detract from your enjoyment of this place. Overall, we really enjoyed our time there and found it to be an unbeatable location with very friendly hotel and restaurant staff, all of whom are bilingual. There's no shortage of activities on the resort with a great golf course, casino, pools/hot tubs, spas, and water sport activities on the private island. Check out some reviews elsewhere on this site for restaurant and activity suggestions for a day away from the resort!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and definitely want to go back”
Reviews.Author: CHARLES S
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our vacation. The room and the hotel staff were superb. The private island was magnificent. It was difficult to leave!

Reviews.Title: “A terrible mess”
Reviews.Author: Drakeboston
Reviews.Content: Its a true shame that a hotel in such a picture perfect location is plagued by a serious lack of customer savvy. It started with a thirty minute wait in Line to Check in and although we could appreciate that our room was not quite ready, we didn't expect to have to lug our bags outside for storage. We were informed that we would get a call when our room was ready; we are still waiting for the call. Once in palomino island we were told we could only have one towel per guest despite a visible overabundance. The nickel and dime mentality occurred when we attempted to use the water park and were faced with separate charge. for all this money that they seem to make you would expect awnings that aren't ripped nor floors that are littered nor common area bathrooms that are dirty. Surely a great hotel that is way past due for an overhaul in customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: rbmdesigns
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered El Conquistador Resort, we were treated as a VIP quest. The staff has gone above and beyond my expectations.We have stayed at this resort many times prior to Waldorf taking over,and immediately felt the difference.Try to book a veiw of Palomino Island, which is there private beach.This is truly a relaxing getaway.You will not be disappointed. Make sure to spend the day at Coqui Park if you have kids.They had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: fmora617
Reviews.Content: Too big for its own good. Some restaurant areas smell like dirty kitchen. Everything closes early and the tram to get down/up the hotel is annoying. Beach is awful. You need shoes cuz there are rocks everywhere! Actually they don't have a beach. You need to take a boat to an island that has a beach. The boat comes every hour so if ur ready to leave u have to wait, and if it's full then your waiting another hour. We come to Puerto rico every year as we are have a condo here and decided to come here as something different. Very disappointed. Any hotel in isla verde is MUCH better! Not coming back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a Waldorf Astoria experience. Set expectations, low.”
Reviews.Author: Michele G
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was just rundown and it felt like they were having trouble maintaining a quality level of service. I would not recommend this hotel. There is nothing about it that makes you believe you are staying at a Waldorf Astoria (even hotel book in the room with information on services doesn't mention that they are part of the Hilton chain). We were thinking maybe Hilton recently acquired the El Conquistador but haven't yet renovated it to make it the caliber to call it a Waldorf Astoria. Arrival/Check-in We arrived by rental car around 6pm, there were a group of bell hops standing around talking and after we unloaded our car and brought the bags to the curb, then one decided to ask if we needed help. At that point, we just needed to roll them up the ramp to the lobby. The front desk help was mediocre when checking in. And they have all guests wear paper/plastic bracelets so that you can use resort facilities. But if you lose the wristband (which is the kind that will fall off in a day with a lot of swimming), the hotel charges you $25 for a replacement. Imagine having an 8, 6 and 3 year old wear them and having to worry that they got lost. If the bracelet breaks off and you bring it to the front desk, they will give you a replacement at no cost, but if it is lost, you have to pay the $25. It seemed like a ridiculous policy, particularly since no one checked our wrists to make sure we could take the funicular (which is only for hotel guests). Pool/Facilities The pools at the resort are open 24 hours which sounds great until one evening at 6pm we decided to go for a swim with the kids. There were no towels, so I asked the staff and was told that the towel service closed at 6pm and they left whatever towels were available on the stand. If there were no more towels, then we were supposed to go to our rooms and get the towels from there. So I went to the front desk to ask for pool towels, it took 20 minutes for them to go to the laundry and get fresh towels. Besides the towels, it was much nicer using the pools in the evening than during the day because it was less visible how dirty the pools were (the water was cloudy and the tiles on the edges needed to be scrubbed down to kill the green bacteria growing). I know I had read on the website that there was a waterslide in the pool, but there wasn't one in the upper pools (although the hotel book in the room said there was a slide and a lap lane pool...). Of course there is the Coqui Waterpark that has 3 waterslides. You need to pay extra to go, but the pools are so much cleaner and the park is much better maintained! You really can't spend a day at the park, so I suggest getting a 1/2 day ticket. If you go at 1:30pm, the rates is reduced by about 40%, so we went to Palomino Island in the morning, then to the park in the afternoon. Restaurants/Food If you are traveling with kids and are concerned about the costs, it is best to eat outside of the hotel whenever possible. The food is overpriced and just mediocre. Even the kids meals are expensive. And unlike other Hilton's and Waldorf Astoria's that are offering free kids meals with an adult meal purchase, the El Conquistador offers no deals for families. In fact, it felt like they needed to make a buck where ever they could (in the room they offer 12 oz water bottles for $3.50 each and the Marriott we stayed in later in the week in San Juan gives 2 bottles free each day). Your best option for a reasonable lunch with the kids at the resort is at the Starbucks at the resort. There are a selection of fresh, warm sandwiches for about $6, which is a steal. We ate 2 dinners at the hotel. One at the cafe outside by the pool which was an Italian style pizzeria. The other at the cafe by the marina. Both meals were average. We had a fabulous meal at a restaurant down the street from the hotel which was far superior to anything we had a the hotel. Room Quality We had a garden view room with 2 queen beds. Our room looked right over the tennis courts and we could see the ocean to the right in the far distance. The room was like the rest of the hotel, run down. I don't believe they vacuumed the room daily because there were some nasty dust balls on the rug for 2 days that I just ended up picking up with a tissue. When we arrived we had an ant infestation on our balcony (we believe the previous guest had spilled a sticky drink out there). They came to clean it (by first spraying some unhealthy bug spray), when we returned after dinner, there were still some ants, but it was better than before. The tub in the bathroom did not look very clean, and luckily there was no stopper for the kids to take a bath, so they all took showers. We were disappointed in the hotel and think if they didn't advertise as a Waldorf Astoria, we may not have had such high expectations. We spent 3 nights at the El Conquistador, then 3 nights at the San Juan Marriott which was beautifully maintained (pools were open 24 hrs and towels constantly replenished) and the staff was very helpful/responsive. It was definitely the better half of our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: debaNY
Reviews.Content: I traveled with friends and it was our third time visiting this hotel as it was one of our favorites. Although our last visit was about 6 years ago it seems that the hotel has not been maintained since. The hotel provides its own private transportation from airport. We had to wait close to an hour to get the bus, standing and waiting outside the airport in over 90 degree weather. We began to worry immediately that we were going to be disappointed and we were. We initially had garden rooms and upgraded to ocean view. However, the rooms were run down and one couple noticed black mold on the ceiling of their room. We complained and were moved to another building. Although the rooms were somewhat nicer than the previous ones, they were not really all that nice. However it seemed they had been recently painted since you could smell fresh paint. There is no turn down service at night and the cleanliness was questionable at times. The grounds could be beautiful as the hotel sits upon a mountain overlooking the Caribbean sea. The view is spectacular. However, the grounds are in need of major repairs. Much of the brick and cement work is broken and cracked. The beautiful foliage is overtaken by weeds in many spots. The canopies are torn and dirty. The tile around the pool is loaded with black and green mold. You have to take a boat shuttle to the beach which was nice but unfortunately jelly fish arrived at the same time as us. This, of course, is not the fault of the hotels but it left us with only the moldy pools to frequent. You need water shoes at the beach because the bottom is loaded with rocks and coral. There is no waitress or waiter service by the pools or at the beach. Additionally there is only one person manning the bar at the pool so the wait was long at times for a badly needed refreshment as weather was blistering hot and pool water was warm and not refreshing at all. The casino of our memory was much better. Apparently the economy forced them to lay off many dealers and therefore, they no longer have a craps table. The only card tables are blackjack and Caribbean stud. There are also slots but all in all a big disappointment. It also was only open from 4pm to 2 am. There are a variety of little shops right on the grounds if you like to shop. The restaurants for dinner were nice and the food was good. We ate at the steakhouse which had the best food. The Italian restaurant was also very nice. The Japanese restaurant, although provided good food, rushed us and we were done in less than an hour. Breakfast lacked variety. There is a buffet or you can have eggs your way or an omelet for an extra $6. There is a water park with a few slides, a lazy river, and an infinity pool. The infinity pool however is the same pool that the kiddie slide is in so it loses some of its appeal. The water park is extra money and unless you have children probably not worth going to. All in all we were very disappointed and will not return again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - hotel in decline!”
Reviews.Author: NYTom007
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at the El Conquistador about 15 years ago and had always wanted to return as we both had been very impressed by the quality of the hotel and service. Unfortunately, the less than flattering reviews we read were accurate. There is no doubt that the hotel needs some TLC or the entire structure will fall into disrepair. For example, you have to use the "furnicular" to get to the marina/ boat to the beach. These gondolas have bottoms that are rusted through in some places. Due to the proximity to the Ocean and the salt, some of the buildings show signs of concrete deterioration which will require expensive repairs at some point. Rooms are ok, but Housekeeping had left items from the previous guest in our room (an air-matress) and did not remove it for more than 2 hours (we decided to put it into the hallway ourselves, where it stayed another few hours). Bed-sheets had a hole and the maid did not even change them for the second night. The concierge sent menus for their "fine dining" restaurants before we arrived. Unfortunately, the actual menu was different when we got to the restaurant. Food in their casual restaurants is poor and the choices on Palomino Island are very limited. Food at the Stingray Restaurant was excellent though. Concierge also did not book the shuttle from the airport - good thing we called the day before arrival to reconfirm. It probably is cheaper to rent a car or get a cab from the airport, with 2 people sharing. Overall, a disappointing experience based on the first visit and expectations from a Waldorf-Astoria hotel. As a member in the Hilton Frequent Guest program not what you would expect from the "flagship-brand". Maybe our expectations were too high but pProbably will not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “It was paradise and we can't wait to get back.”
Reviews.Author: islandhopper68
Reviews.Content: My husband and 9 year old stepson stayed at the El Conquistador this past week and we definately found paradise here! Don't pay attention to any of the bad reviews! All the staff was helpful and friendly. I am a hilton honnors member and asked to be upgraded to a suite. I expected just a regulary suite but got the governors suite! My husband said they were "million dollar views" of the ocean and private island. We were in the Las Brisas section of the hotel which I think was newer. But I think even if you are not a hilton honnors member you might be able to get an upgrade to at least a superior room if you just ask! The breakfasts at the Las Brisas restaurant were amazing. my stepson enjoyed the bacon every single day. It is pricey! but it kept us pretty full until lunch. We didn't get the meal plan but we ended up spliting sandwhichs or a pizza. I would recommend the bella vista as it had very good flat bread pizza. The cozy market had a more limited choice but was cheaper than Caribe cafe. But the Caribe cafe was a bit pricier but had more choices. Their ice cream was prettty good. We had a rental car and found that off the property was definately cheaper for dinner. Loved the Luquillo kiosks as recommended in TA forums. Also there is a really good sushi restaurant near the movie theater and metropol I would have liked to try some of the more authentic puerto rican restaurants but my stepson wasn't that adventerous. He was a good sport about eating. We definately also liked salsaritas near the CVS.. We loved the private island it is definately something out of a post card or one of those corona commercials The water was so clear and turquoise as you would expect! Rented a wave runner and had a blast. The boats are supposed to leave every half hour but they ended up being an hour. The beach is nice but a bit rocky so bring water shoes! The water park was pretty fun only 3 slides but we went on them a few times, there is also an infinity pool. If you go after 1 it is half price and after 4 it is $5 a person. The 3 main pools were beautiful! you felt like you were floating in paradise! The main pool has a ping pong table near it which my stepson was always playing. There were always some kids around for him to have fun with. I would definitely come back!! I would recommend it for families more than couples without kids as sometimes the pools got noisy. The hotel was definately clean. I would recommend bringing ear plugs as the coqui frogs were loud at night! But all in all it was a vacation of dreams and I will remember it forever. It was paradise on earth!

Reviews.Title: “do not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: john3ma2
Reviews.Content: This is the first trip report I've ever written. Felt I needed to, as I was very disappointed with the El Con. I've travelled extensively, and don't mind spending more money on a hotel than average for a region, provided the accomodations are worth it. The El Con was not. I understand that locals are offered a rate that is almost 1/3 of the rate offered non-residents. Maybe if I had paid 2/3 less than I did, I would have a different view. A few of things that happended: our rooms weren't ready until 6:30-7pm (4pm is official check-in); the self-parking lot was apparently always full, requiring us to use valet services daily (requiring tipping); the air conditioner broke and was never really fixed - it flooded the bathroom and carpet daily; needed to call to have my room made on one day; prices ($11/magarita, $6/laundered tshirt); Aqua Water park closes at 7pm and ferries to only beach on resort stop at 3:30pm, so if you're on the lower level and want to swim in the evening, you need to take one of the 2 trams to upper level, walk 1/4 mi to an elevator up to upper level, the tram can involve a 20 minute wait depending on the line/time of day; and our room keys didn't work on several occasions, requiring the same 45-minute round trip to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderfully amazing--again!”
Reviews.Author: Denise46756
Reviews.Content: For our 40th anniversary my husband and I decided to treat our kids and grandkids to five days at this marvel of a resort. No newbie to the El Conquistador (my husband and have been there seven times since 1970 for both personal and corporate trips), it never ceases to amaze me. It offers the whole package: gorgeous facility with perfect views, water as beautiful as anywhere in the world, great golf course, first class spa and attentive staff throughout. With its long, interesting history, this hotel has shown some signs of wear over the years (like me!) but I'm happy to report that it appears quiet updating is restoring this gem to all its splendor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGrl87
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at the Waldorf Astoria. I was impressed with the grand scale of the property, it was huge with several buildings, restaurants, pools, etc. I used their shuttle service to and from the airport which is about 50% cheaper than a cab, but you must call ahead to arrange it. The room was large with a view of the ocean and the beautiful green landscaping. I loved having a private patio! The room was a bit dated and the ac unit dripped to the floor. There were also wipe marks all over the walls and we had a few housekeeping issues (coffee machine not cleaned, light bulbs out, etc) but they were quickly resolved by the housekeeping manager who was very professional. The bathroom was very large with a huge walk in closet. The pool was stunning with perfect ocean views. They had excellent service with drinks and lunch and towel service until 7pm. The spa was excellent as well, although very expensive. There is also a ferry to and from Palomino Island which is a fun way to spend the day. We stayed at the resort for 3 full days and found no reason to leave, other than the food. The restaurant selection is very strange for the location. There is Italian, Japanese, Steak, Pizza and sandwich shops. Everything is VERY overpriced and I thought it was strange to have no Puerto Rican restaurant. We had to leave the resort to get some delicious food (Pasion-had the BEST food in PR) and it would have been nice to have something like this at the hotel. Other than that, there is a small casino, cookie and ice cream shops, a small grocery store and many little stores for swimsuits and beach things. Overall, the resort was great, just needs a few updates but I will absolutely return!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE Resort, But Lovely...and nice private island”
Reviews.Author: BamaCzech
Reviews.Content: We weeded thru the good, bad and ugly of various reviews about this resort. Took a gamble and this family of 2 adults and an 11-yr old were very satisfied. Tip - got a much better room rate thru Expedia than anywhere else I could find. You will do lots of walking at this resort. Several buildings are spread out, yet connected by walkways and tram (fixed rail-gondola-type) funiculars. Our room was above avg, good ocean view and nice balcony, in an older bldg, overlooking marina and pool. Large bathroom and nice walkin closet. Trop Storm Emily blew thru during our 3-night stay, but didn't slow us down much. It did disrupt the free resort ferry to the private island for 1 day. Go there - great snorkling, coral reefs right offshore in 3-5 ft of water, plenty of shells to find. Bring water shoes, as coral and shell pieces line the ocean bottom. Watch for the iguanas that walk around the property. Find the hiking trail and take it - see if you can find the 2 secluded beaches. If you don't, at least take some panoramic pictures and enjoy the view from the building at the top. Note - NO BEACH at the resort, you must go to their private island for the beach, under 15 minute boat ferry ride. As for food, it's pricey, but eat at the Strip House - great food, great svs, one of our 2 best meals on the trip (the other being at Perla at La Concha Hotel). Some restaurants nearby, but you'll need a car to get to them. If you have a rental car, the lot is a hike from the front lobby and the hotel areas and you'll pay $15 a day for that. If you have an Enterprise rental, ask at their desk counter how you can park in their spaces for free. Or, if you are staying at one of the bldgs near marina, see if you can find the back road that goes to it, and park by the guard house down there for free. Golf course looked magnificent, and so did the tennis courts, but didn't have time for that. This is a big resort, but has nearly something for everyone - of course, it has resort prices, but that is to be expected. Bottomline: we enjoyed our visit, and are glad we experienced the resort.

Reviews.Title: “BLOWN AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Neutralizer
Reviews.Content: I read some of the negative reviews and two of them had the same wording. Hmm, makes you wonder. At any rate, here is the truth. The hotel is running on a very aggresive pricing strategy, which has accounted for more than 75% local tourism. So of course it going to be packed. This hotel is not to be compared to the Ritz Carlton. El Conquistador is about living your stay not for those looking to be treated like royalty. My family and I had a blast during our weekend stay. At Palomino, JAIME taught me how to use the Hobbie Cat and even went out of his way to "rescue" us when I was trying to return back to Palomino. We all enjoyed the water park and the breakfast buffet was included and the food was great. El Conquistador has plenty of things to do and the service was outstanding. The views are stunning and best of all you don't have to worry about being mugged. The hotel is safe, the staff is professional and the food at the Marina is very good. The hotel charges a resort fee beause they actually have two boats that take you to a private island, which includes lounging chairs, tiki huts and towels. I hear complaints about pricing, but having been to Miami where they charge you $20.00 to rent a beach umbrella and no breakfast included now that is a rip off. Go to the hotel enjoy the waterpark, Kayaking, the pools and beautiful beach. Don't listen to bad reviews they are not accurate at all!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise - Not up to Waldorf standard”
Reviews.Author: PKinATL
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member and have stayed at Hilton properties for over 10 years on business and pleasure. This hotel was not of quality seen at Waldorf or Conrad level. This should be rebranded to another Hilton brand more representative of El Conquistador service level and current property condition. We visited the resort previously 10 years ago under a different branding name. We were greatly impressed in our initial visit and greatly let down on our recent stay. Our overview - Pros - Private island getaway - Palomino Island. Plenty of activities, food and drinks on the island. Hilton Honors - checkin good Food - Blossoms good food - no typical hibachi style show Bella Vistas - reasonable price and variety that is kid friendly Ballyhoo - reasonable price, variety of choices, kid friendly and service very good Las Brisa's - great selection of morning fare, kid friendly, one of the best restaurant service teams Iguanas - reasonable price, variety of choices, kid friendly and service very good Casino - great action - not large scale betting though. BEST service team at resort (dealers - Samuel, Eric, Wilson, Joseph, Pablo, few others as well forgot the names) Kids treats - Cafe Caribe Ice cream counter - Veronica and few ladies that work 4pm to close great bunch with always postive attitude. Drinks - Twenty One has mostly straight pours Palmino Island - Iguana's bartenders best mixologists at resort NOT the other bar on the island. Bella Vistas - Very good mixologists - Fernado was the best - others okay. Golden Gate Spa - quality service. though needs better view and location at the resort. Perhaps the 2nd floor area of main hotel can better and provide great vistas while receiving massage or other treatments. Negatives- Property Not up to Waldorf standard, seems like prior and current owners do not have enough cashflow to provide the extra level of attention to detail. Items around the outside of building broken, in deseparate need of repair. Other residents complained for dirty rooms, carpets, moldy bathrooms. We saw carpets extremely dirty in common areas, landscaping needing refreshing, general items in room did not work Service - Lacked in many departments. There were great staff members - though they were out numbered 1 to 10. Power outages common in tropical storms - though main hotel power stayed on. The higher priced units at Callistas Village area were without power for couple days. One family with child under one years old, could not receive even a cooler for formula - just plain ice in ice bucket offered. Transportation - bus transportation in poor condition and costs more than private driver. One would think the private driver would be more expensive for airport trips. Rooms - beds were fair condition. Not Waldorf quality Food and beverage Sting Rays - service was ok, food selection poor, over priced and no local flavors -seemed like food came from Sysco or another like provider La Piccola Fontana - not fresh to order that would be expected at Waldorf property, service was below standard, menu not kid friendly italian or variety. Drakes - poor service and drinks ok Cafe Caribe - extremely poor service and kitchen can do better in food preparation (Strongly suggest coverting to Spanish Hacienda style spot with "true" puerto rican flavors. Pool - dirty and several times in early AM hours the morning staff lacked interest in clean up. One would expect a Waldorf property would be ready at sunrise and clean. underwear from prior night's activities where clearly visible in common pool area at 10am. Coqui Park - service poor, staff seemed overworked and underpaid attitudes. One occassion child or adult left out a "baby ruth - think caddy shack" during our visit and area was only shut for few hours. One would expect 24 hours min. shut down. Next visit someone went down slide after eating or drinking and splewed on the slide and in the water. Slide was shut for mere couple of hours. No orderly process of sharing tubes for lazy river - you need to be aggressive in order to get your kids a floaty to ride. Kids Video Game area- service machines broke and token machines not refilled regularly. Seems like an after thought. Teens lounge is dirty and generally could offer more. Great spot to put a small juice/smoothy bar for kids with foosball or other table games. Overall, if you are on special local rate ($89 package) or using Hilton points it is survivable if you come with open mind. Come with expectations of Waldorf quality stay - you will be disappointed big time. If owner is interested in making this quality spot - I challenge them to give me a call. I love the location and hate to see this place fade into the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: conlon10
Reviews.Content: Expectations. I had none about this hotel as I had read mixed reviews. WOW, was I amazed and impressed. We are Hilton Honors members and were using rewards points for our stay. Our check in was fast and one of the most pleasant experiences we have had, Hilton takes care of their members! The hotel is older but we had a lovely updated and spacious room with ocean view in the Las Brisas wing, convenient to everything. We enjoyed our stay very much, Palomino beach was beautiful. The pools were nice, although could have been cleaner. Had a delicious dinner at Stingray Cafe (same owner as La Pearla at La Concha in SJ) and ok meal at Striphouse, great lunch and reasonably priced at the beach, and Ballyhoo.

Reviews.Title: “Large resort with plenty of amenities and good location with a price.”
Reviews.Author: WabashClub
Reviews.Content: I went to PR in early June and it rained a little each day. The first thing you notice while travelling to the hotel that it seems to be surrounded by low income housing. After checking in there was an extremely long walk to the room. I'm not complaining but warning you. We stayed in the lower level where you had to take two elevators and a tram to get to. The lower level is where you catch the ferry to the private island and beach and where the water park. I was scared of the food based upon reading the previos reviews but I did eat breakfast which was good considering it was a buffet, I also had a sandwich that sucked. There was a casino on site but it was most forgettable. Nice swimming pools and plentiful towels. There's an old gameroom, disco, bars snack shop, gift shops and Internet cafe. The location is nice to do a few excursions like bio bay, rain forest, calebra, and zip lining. But due to rain we stayed close to the hotel and used the ferry to the island. People were friendly and helpful. Good eats near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good family place, lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: lindagaf
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the El Conquistador. It was a very busy weekend with lots of locals and tons of children. The pools look nice, though I didn't go in them. My kids loved Coqui Water Park. We enjoyed the boat ride over to Palomino Island, the beach was gorgeous, though I wish it had been a bit deeper for swimming. Grounds nicely landscaped, buildings generally well maintained. Good breakfast at the Strip House, nice views from the balcony there. The room was spacious, nice balcony with a great sea view. Tasteful decor, comfy bed. All the staff were friendly. We had the pleasure of meeting the manager, Dermot Connolly, on two occassions, and he was very hands on and helpful. I did see some evidence of upkeep being needed in the rooms and in more remote corners of the buildings, but it was pretty minor. The resort is huge, so that isn't too surprising. Everyone here, from the staff to the guests, seems to be having a good time, which lends a good atmosphere to the place. Wish we had stayed another night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but I wish it had more nightlife!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsRNyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conquistador in August 2010. The accomodations were awesome. The hotel is big and beautiful. The private beach was a great experience. The casino was awesome. My girlfriend and I were planning to hit the clubs in Old San Juan on Saturday night and we figured we would try the Hotel's loung/club called Casablanca. We went down at about 11:30pm and it was DEAD!!!...it kind of spoiled our Friday night because we had had some drinks in our room and couldn't drive to another spot. I believe they should offer maore of a night life every night of the week. Afterall people are on vacation and expect to have fun in the sun in the day and party all night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Las Casitas at El Conquistador Resort is where to stay for families.”
Reviews.Author: 5_Star_Holly
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a great trip to Puerto Rico and really liked Las Casitas, which are the villas at El Conquistador Resort. Las Casitas has its own beautiful infinity pool, business center with free internet and concierge service that goes out of its way to grant special requests. We were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday on the trip, so before we left I emailed Ana the concierge requesting a birthday cake to be delivered to the restaurant for his birthday dinner and she came through with flying colors! He was really surprised and the cake kicked off a great, long weekend in Puerto Rico. Ana also arranged for our airport transportation and was very helpful in recommending restaurants. I highly recommend Las Casitas which are villa like apartments with full kitchens with granite countertops, multiple bathrooms and offer much more space and privacy than the rooms at the main El Conquistador hotel. However, although it's a Waldorf Astoria Resort, its more like a four star property, not a five star hotel. Very nice, but not luxurious. We went to the main hotel every night though for great food at El Conquistador's many restaurants. We really liked the Hibachi grill at the Asian restaurant and loved having cocktails at the steak restaurant. El Conquistador is much more geared towards families and is very large! It has multiple pools, a water park and even a casino. I was surprised at how many local Puerto Rican families stay at El Conquistador and at times felt like we were some of the only Americans there. The customer service and villas are great at Las Casitas, but personally I prefer smaller, more intimate boutique type hotels and when we go back to Puerto Rico will likely stay at The W Hotel which is better for couples seeking romance. However, if you are traveling with a large family or younger children, Las Casitas at El Conquistador resort would be a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great private island but very expensive food & drinks”
Reviews.Author: 32332Michelle
Reviews.Content: Palominito island is the best, very pretty water & sand. Was expecting expensive food but not as much. About $15 for a burger and drinks are about $12 not to mention the shops there. Stayed at the Olas and was a hassle to get there and from the lobby. There is no other way but to use the funicular and it was really busy at certain times(it broke down a couple times while there). Coqui water park was ok since you didn't have to wait very long to get on the slides. Puerto Rican's expect a 20% tip for everything as far as i'm concerned a tip is earned and customer service out there is not at it's greatest. It's hard to get to and from the hotel but it is located very close to El Yunque and Bio Bay also only 45 min from Old San Juan. The golf course is beautiful but I feel that the only thing this hotel has going for itself is the private Palomino Island.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back someday!”
Reviews.Author: herburlness
Reviews.Content: My mom and I got a fantastic deal on Cheapcarribean for this resort. We rented a jeep when we arrived at the airport and drove to the hotel on our own. Which was quite an experience within itself! The resort is in Fajardo and without our trusty little GPS it would of been after midnight by the time we got there. Once we arrived we were amazed at how large this place was, we had no idea! Check in was not long for us, we waited our turn and there were about 4 people in front of us. My mom told the man we were there celebrating my birthday and he upgraded our room to one with the most beautiful view he said! The room was clean and beds nice and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious. We were excited to be here for the next four days. It was dark when we arrived so we went and ate at the outside dining area. The drinks were expensive but we knew we were at a resort and this is the way it goes. We didnt order anything extravagant but the food was good. We were exhausted and ready to get to bed to start the next day. The next morning the view we awoke to was amazing!! We went to the buffet that was included with our room......OMG....What a breakfast buffet this was!! They had everything you could imagine and it was all delicious!! We went back every morning after that! We drove to the local grocery store and bought our own liquer for drinks which I would highly reccomend. We never ate dinner at the restaurants in the resort. We chose to adventure out on our own and enjoy the true taste of Puerto Rico as if we were a local. We loved the food! We spent a day at the private island and the water was beautiful! We walked down to the end of the island where it was less crowded and basically had the beach to ourselves. In the morning was the best time to go to the pool, as the day goes on it can get pretty crowded. All in all I had no complaints. I would go back and I cant wait until I go back and share this incredible place with my boyfriend.

Reviews.Title: “We return every year.”
Reviews.Author: stb3
Reviews.Content: Our family has spent Thanksgiving here for the last three years. It is not super lux but it fits the bill for a family trip that won't break our bank. Though there are definitely rooms in need of refurbishment, we still enjoy the amazing views from our balcony, no matter which room we have had. Do get an ocean view room- it will make a big difference. There are many restaurants to choose from- you won't get bored of eating out at night. During the day, there is lunch available on the island and near the pool. The best place to eat lunch during the day was at the little poolside restaurant at the villas. Nighttime leaves many more options, and they are quite good. We never left the resort, so I can't tell you about day trips. The spa and fitness center are nice- not the nicest I have ever seen, but they are very nice. I have no complaints, except they grilled me each and every day to show my fitness center receipt. It was kind of annoying how they watched me like hawks every day. You have to pay to use the fitness center, but I didn't really mind. This is a large resort and there is much to do. Take a trip to the island to go to the beach. There are kayaks there and other water sports. I took the Kayak to the little island and it was fun. The water park is a nice distraction if you have children with you, and many do. There are lots of quiet spots at the resort, so not to worry. We ordered breakfast on our balcony every single day and it is lovely to have breakfast by the ocean. If you need a golf cart (we did) reserve it in advance. They book up. Also, make dinner reservations in advance. My daughter broke out in a horrible rash on Thanksgiving, and we had no reservations because we were pre-occupied with having to see a doctor. The staff arranged a nice dinner on our balcony and it was perfect. Thanks! The doctor was really nice, although he mis-diagnosed our daughter, it was nothing serious and no big deal. It is never fun to have a health problem on vacation and luckily, it ended up fine. Anyhow, I do like it here for the price and the direct flight from Philadelphia, even though it needs some renovation, in the rooms/ villas I stayed in. I can deal with that because they have a Starbucks in the hotel. Just like at home. AHHHH.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: juliehgrant
Reviews.Content: My friend and I choose this location for a girls' weekend. There were several things I liked about the property, but overall found it disappointing as a Waldorf property. I'll start with the good. The pools are large and plentiful and clean, though the chairs weren't the comfiest I've ever sat in. The room (we stayed in Las Brisas) was beautifully/tastefully decorated. The bathrooms were gorgeous! I loved the multiple levels of the property itself. The golf course is beautiful (though I did not play it). The marina is lovely to walk around, albeit a little small and isolated. Palomino Island is truly gorgeous and worth the trip. I like the varied dining options and we ate at every place they offered. We liked StripHouse and Stingrays the best. Good food, good offerings. We also liked the casino, though if you are looking for something large and extravagant, this isn't it. Now the not-so-good. The service at the front desk is really bad. It's not that they were rude or unhelpful, they were just terribly slow and probably understaffed. When I checked in, I waited 40 minutes in line. My room wasn't even ready even though it was 5:00pm. The representative offered me a drink ticket, but DIDN'T offer me a different room. I found this ridiculous. She did explain that there was a maintenance problem with the room and they would call me when it was ready. I wandered off to the bar and the bartender could tell I was annoyed. She was very nice and actually called the front desk for me to check on the room after about 45 minutes. It was from the BARTENDER I found out my room was ready, as the front desk never called me. But, I had to go stand in that ridiculous line again to get my room key. When I finally got to my room, it was right next to the elevator (boo) and there was condensation leaking from the roof directly outside the front of the door to our room. On top of that, at night, condensation built up (presumably from something underneath our room's foyer) on the tile floor leading into the bathroom. It was so bad that we had to put a towel down so that we didn't slip walking to the bathroom. in addition to these problems, the iPod player in our room didn't work, we couldn't reset the clock on it either. Admittedly, these are minor issues, but they detract from a stay when you expect more from a Waldorf property. Two other minor irritations: I went into two different bathrooms in different parts of the property on different days and there was no toilet paper in them. Finally, we got stuck in a torrential downpour while on Palomino. We wanted to drink our cares away, but the bar out there doesn't start serving until 11:00am. *sigh* I will reiterate that the property is quite beautiful, but the overall experience was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it but...”
Reviews.Author: Kbivid
Reviews.Content: Five girlfriends and I went to Puerto Rico to celebrate 2 of us turning 40. We spent 4 nights at El Conquistador and I left wanting to love the hotel and property but feeling very ambivalent about it. First, the property is immense, the grounds are lovely and the rooms are contemporary and clean. Checking in is a long, painful process. We decided it was because the property is so big that there are a lot of instructions to review. You also have to wear an armband to get anywhere at the hotel; to get to your room, to get on the boat, to get towels, etc. It was very distracting, uncomfortable and a little insulting to have to wear a plastic band for 4 days. Even Disney World doesn't make you do that. We stayed down by the marina. Our 1st room, however, was near the water park (read: lots of kids and noise) so we requested and received a move to a quieter area near the marina. The benefit of staying at the marina is proximity to the water though there is no usable beach at the resort. The resort has a private island that is about a 15 minute ferry ride and has a very nice beach and simple restaurant and bar. The breakfast bar had a nice variety of foods and there is also a Starbucks in the main building. Twice during our stay the coffee cream was sour but everything else seemed fresh. From our room you get to breakfast via a funicular, long walk, elevator and a short walk. It's takes about 10 minutes with planes, trains and automobiles to get from point a to point b at this resort. The staff stuck to the basics and didn't do anything above and beyond to make any form of impression. Nobody (guests or staff) was overly friendly or helpful, they were just doing their thing. One night we had dinner at the casual restaurant at the marina. The drinks were OK but the food was not. Several of us ordered the salmon salad and none of us finished it. It was fishy and dry. I guess my closing thoughts are that the hotel has the infrastructure and property to be a spectacular resort but it just falls short on customer service and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sanu70
Reviews.Content: Checked into hotel yesterday at 4 PM and it was a fish market. Kid you not there were over 70 (yes seventy) people in the lobby trying to check in/out. The place literally smelled of sweat. After a super long ordeal to check-in we went to the Las Olas pool at 6 PM which was littered with used towels with no fresh towels or attendant in sight. The attendant appeared at 6:30 PM and to our request for fresh towels replied briskly "No fresh towels we close at 7 PM" The place was again super busy with real slow service at the Cafe Bella Vista and the food quality was pretty ordinary. All in all really disappointing stay so far...not at all at the Waldorf quality.

Reviews.Title: “This place blew me away!!”
Reviews.Author: Trinidadal
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feelings about going on this trip with the kids. But it turned out to be the experience of a lifetime. From the time we pulled up to the valet they were very helpful and polite. The check and check out was quick and easy. The lobby was beautiful and had entertainment During the evenings. The restaurants were a bit pricey but make sure you get the breakfast package, it will save you lots of $$$. The private island "Palomino" island was beautiful and very relaxing. The horse back riding was fun but not cheap, however it was worth it. If you intend to travel, rent a car it will save $$$ if you intend to see El Yunque rain forest (well worth it a must see) and old San Juan. There's a Walmart on interstate 3, make sure you stock up on snacks and drinks. The food @ the Steakhouse was well worth the price, I had to return to get more. The kids loved the private waterpark and I did as well, even though it's not Disney's Typhoon Lagoon. It's a good substitute for the day. This place was truly a diamond and it my new happy place. Well worth the trip and a must visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation...Beautiful Resort.”
Reviews.Author: Nieves_Marinko
Reviews.Content: Our family recently visited El Conquistador and the children ages 10, 13, 15 and 17 loved it, were not bored, there was plenty to do ; and we ate very well at breakfast because we purchased the breakfast package which we strongly suggest. Food can be a little expensive so purchase the breakfast package and keep cold cuts, bread, peanut butter, milk, cereal, granola bars, etc in the room or carry in an insulated lunchbox w/ ice from the ice machine. We were able to have a 5 star vacation on a budget. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful, and the valet men were right there for you opening the door the moment you pull in. We rented from Enterprise, so we saved the 15.00 parking charge per day. We were able to park in their lot and walk a short walk to the lobby. It's worth it. The water park was amazing for the entire family and it was only $5.00 after 4:00 pm. This is definitely a deal! Palomino Island was fun to get to, but bring your water shoes for sure. Snorkling is a lot of fun, we saw plenty of fish and a little shark swam right by us. We brought bread to feed the fish and they gathered all around us. We walked along the beach and saw plenty of beautiful fish swimming near the shore. The Palominito Island directly accross from Palomino is where some scenes from Pirates of the Caribbean 4 were filmed. Cooloers are not allowed to be brought on the boat to Palomino Island, so put your insulated lunchbag with water in your beachbag. The beach was absolutely beautiful and clean. The views of the hotel are spectacular. There is nothing we would change about the hotel. Rooms were clean and great. Oh, and the pools are open 24 hours! We loved it so much that we are already looking to book next years trip at El Conquistador.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best place on earth”
Reviews.Author: Dodmartins
Reviews.Content: The staff is great but the location is better, the sunrise takes your breath away and palomino island is a piece of paradise

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: Evie049
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Conquistador two years ago and again this past March. It has really improved. The facility was spotless, great staff, beautiful views and plenty to do. Palomino Island is well worth the trip. There is no need to carry cash anywhere since everything is billed to your room if you wish. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated for the holidays”
Reviews.Author: citymouse7
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here once before and decided to ring in the new year in a warmer climate. They had everything well decorated for the holidays and a whole schedule of events for Christmas and New Year's eve. There were definitely a lot of families as I didn't run into another solo traveler but it was fine and everyone was incredibly nice. This hotel has a few pools but the bigger draw is the ferry to their private island. There are plenty of chairs and towels (which you pick up right when you walk in). The only downside for me is that the water is very shallow and there is a lot of sea grass. It's certainly possible to get wet but I usually enjoy playing in the waves. There are all kinds of water sports and activities if you don't feel like relaxing. The onsite restaurants are very good and the parrots in the lobby are fun to watch. Actually it's more fun to watch people reacting to the parrots! Rooms are ocean view or garden view. I have stayed in both and I enjoyed the ocean view more.

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION ON THE ISLAND! DON'T LET A FEW BAD REVIEWS STOP YOU!”
Reviews.Author: palmiter2
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Puerto Rico and we will not stay at ANY other resort from this point on....the best of the best. We had stayed in Dorado our first 2 times, but liked the El Conquistador in Fajardo much more. Views - 10 stars. Rooms - 10 stars. Views - 10 stars. Courtesy of staff - 10 stars. Food 10 stars (but pricey) Pools - 10. Palamino Island 10 stars!!!!! If you plan ahead a little you can save some cashola by bringing lunch meat and beverages and making sandwiches in the room so you don't eat at the restaurants 3 times a day. Definitely take advantage of the breakfast buffet in any package as it is lavish and more like a luncheon and will fill you up for a good part of the day. So much to do for kids to do - the water park, the pools, activities, clubs, arcades, and for our 10-yr. old the main attraction was CATCHING LIZARDS! We went to Walmart and bought a small net and it kept him occupied for hours. (you probably want to avoid the larger iguanas as they can whip you with their tails) We also bought a fishing pole and our son brought it to Palamino Island every day and fished on the dock for hours. You can buy squid or even use chicken tenders or any meat for bait. He caught some really cool fish! The staff was amazing...your wish is their command. Ask for MICHAEL ANTHONY when checking in as he gave us a personal tour of the resort and was so welcoming. I can't say enough about the staff at the El Conquistador. I think that the negative comments may be coming from the competition - this place is A+++++++++++++++++++++ in my book. We will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, lovely vacation at a lovely, warm and wonderful place!!”
Reviews.Author: pecanglo
Reviews.Content: It is with so much pleasure that I write an honest review of this magnificent facility. It is more than a resort. It is an adventure for the family. My daughter and grandson and I had so much fun. First let me say that our beautiful room with it's breathtaking view will be in my mind for a very long time. Seeing the Caribbean Sea and the boats docked from our balcony was all that and more. The resort and the staff are all top-notch and professional and not stuffy and not pretentious and just desiring that you enjoy your stay there. The food was good at all of the restaurants we went to, but my favorite would be Blossoms and also the restaurants on the marina. The water park and activities for the youngsters was one of the highlights for us along with our visit to the private island, Palomino, was pure pleasure. I recommend this facility for people with children and people who want a real family vacation that everyone can find something for each member of the family. I wish I could have stayed longer. Oh the facility is well kept and clean and the lobby is one of the beautiful places with the exotic birds and assorted chairs and sofas. So much to see and also we went to the Golden Door Spa which is a vacation treat in itself. OK it is a bit expensive but you know that and it's all worth it because you deserve the best. Enjoy and I will go back as soon as I can afford to do so.

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador Down the hill”
Reviews.Author: chanitaTampa
Reviews.Content: If you want to pay for view this is the place. The views and the private island are just beautiful. If you expect to get a decent room for your money well....this is not the place. I can't even describe how dirty our room was. The bathroom cealing was full of mold, there was an old choocolate stain on the closet doors, hand prints all over the slidding doors, dry ketchup in the chairs, unclean carpet etc... we stayed for two nights and we couldn't stay in the room too long. We found the service to be very good ,except at the fine dinning restaurant called Picola Fontana where the head waiter was running the place like a glorify cafeteria. I payed $49 for a lobster and I didn't appretiated how this lady ran the place. There is a piano in the hallway near the restaurant that was hit by children for our entire dinner. Unfortunately they keep the restaurants doors open at all times, so the teriible noise was horrific and nobody seemed to have control over what was done to the piano. My husband and I where hoping to get a relax dinner. I know it can be expensive and we were fine with that, what we didn't know is that in order to have dinner there we needed to tolarate horrific piano noise, a loud headwaiter shouting to the waiters from far, and ok food ( not excellent) for a $100+ dinner. Too Bad! El conquistador use to be one of my favorite places to stay but no more. They need to get better cleaning service and take care of their rooms. It is shameful.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT be back”
Reviews.Author: mich130
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this "Resort" in December 2010. Rooms were okay, nothing great. Service & food average. During our stay the casino, bars, and restaurants all closed by midnight. There are no bars close to this hotel. Cannot believe they roll up the carpet so early in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, couple of pitfalls”
Reviews.Author: Frank42808
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family of 4 in early July 2011. Staff was very friendly. Grounds and hotel very clean and well appointed. Cautions: once you are on the grounds - the food is really expensive. Best to have a rental car and get out to the local towns (Las Croabas etc) for more reasonable prices. Works better for booking tours yourself as well. Parking is a bit of hassle - so be prepared to take the good with the bad. Staying at a room in the Marina area of the resort is nice for the view - but the only access is via funicular. Lines can get long during peak times - and if one goes down for any reason - wait time can be long. If you stay in a room in this area - you need to be up for extra walking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Diana129
Reviews.Content: Really loved my stay here they haddock the best frozen piÃ±a coldas I can closed my eye and see my drink at the pool , there no beach you had to take a boat to the island but it comes and goes every 20 mins and the beach is so beautiful the water is so clear . We rented a car and went out for dinner because the food their was a little pricey . We got a room with a garden view and it was really pertty and a nice size too

Reviews.Title: “completely OVER RATED”
Reviews.Author: CuppaJoe80
Reviews.Content: I've never actually been motivated to log onto trip advisor and write a review, but this hotel stay made me a believer in trip advisor. This place is SUCH a has been hotel. I won't go into detail about the tired decor and the poor cleaning job the room received (pillows smelled like mildew and there was TOOTHPASTE in the bathtub) but my issue is the PRICE HIJAKING they give you during your ENTIRE stay. This being a resort in the middle of no where they know you can't get, say, a bottle of water down the road so they charge you $3.75. They DOUBLE the price on EVERYTHING and you are held hostage in the resort (unless you want to go ALLLL the way out to your car and drive ALLL the way down that hill into town...and who is going to do that???). They charge insane prices for just ho hum service (check in/check out was HORRIFIC and took FOREVER and we had to stand in this crazy line the whole time). I was not blown away and I am writing this review so that you will know BEFORE you step foot into that place they will: 1. charge you a ridiculous resort fee on TOP of your hotel room quote and local tax 2. rack up the price on everything from a slice of pizza to bottled water 3. make you pay $15 a day for parking. even if you park YOURSELF. this place nickels and dimes you and I will NEVER stay here again OR recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views but to pricey.”
Reviews.Author: SheilaAnn1080
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking hilltop sea and island views. Lobby lines after 4:30 pm on a Monday were over an hour. We stayed in the Las Brisas section overlooking Palamino Island. Pools were crowded but clean. The beach was located on Palamino Island. It was shallow and could not snorkel much. We had two rain showers on the Palamino Island one day. The rain did not spoil the day. We had to take a ferry over to the island about a 10 or 15 minute ride. No trouble with our room or air conditioning. The food was very expensive, but expected after reading many reviews. Car rental was expensive too. The casino was small. Not many card tables mostly slot machines. No winners in my group. Overall we would not go back to this resort. We did not rent a car. We did take the rainforest and Bio Bay Kayacking trip.

Reviews.Title: “We HATE IT!”
Reviews.Author: cruiseryatch
Reviews.Content: Do Not stay at this hotel Not go near the sorrounding areas outside the hotel more than likely you will get mugged Not try to get service from these hotel Not try to get your A/C to work properly

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ravi01
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have ever posted but I feel like I had to after this experience. We just spent three days of our PR vacation at El Conquistador. The issues started as soon as we got out of our taxi. There was no one there to greet us with our luggage or direct us to the lobby. We wound up standing around outside until we guessed the right direction to check-in and lugged our bags into the lobby ourselves. We were than "upgraded" to a better room. This room had a significantly worse view than the room we had booked and when we requested our booked room we were informed it was "not available." The beach was a hike using the transport boat which they said came every half and hour but really every hour. Once you reached the beach it was beautiful, but the hassle back and forth almost made it not worthwhile. Movement within the resort was slow because of elevator system that was in place which often took fifteen minutes to get from the marina to the lobby. The best thing about the resort was the excursions, but there was little help for transportation and the prices for taxis was out of control. After spending 6 nights in PR and staying in two other hotels we were disappointed to say the least. We would not return and I would not suggest this resort to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: islabery
Reviews.Content: Simply shocking that this "resort" would be allowed to carry the Waldorf name. There is not one ounce of this place that represents luxury and service (except for maybe the spa). We went with 2 other couples on our trip here. One couple had recently gotten engaged and they didn't offer much of anything as a special treat. Service here definitely leaves much to be desired... The grounds and the buildings are not well kept at all, and one couple we were with had to change rooms 3 times before they got one that was all in working and presentable order. The private island is definitely nice - but you have to take a shuttle there and there water there is not really conducive to swimming (too shallow). The pools were dirty and too overcrowded to even consider. There are a couple of local eateries that are incredible (la estacion), but to get anywhere you either need a car or to hire a taxi. We walked off the resort one day and the roads were narrow and definitely not conducive to exploring the local area. This resort is also ages away from San Juan, and the traffic is horrible at night so this really forces you to stay around the resort. The food on the resort is pretty poor and the prices are way too expensive for what you get. You also had to wait up to 40 minutes for a breakfast table to open up. The only positive about this place was the spa treatments. The spa itself was ok, small but nice. The treatment was awesome and I don't think I've ever had a more incredible massage... too bad this is only one piece of the whole experience here. Skip this place at all costs - it was a huge disappointment and not worth the money we paid. They need serious upgrading and maintence, and it's too crowded and impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday family getaway”
Reviews.Author: almondjoy_73
Reviews.Content: We decided to forgo our usual time share vacation to Disney and take our 12 yr old and 16 yr old to Puerto Rico.
