We booked a stay at the El Conquistador through our travel agent and got the package that included breakfast for the four of us. After a thorough look at the reviews for this property, we knew what to expect. We rented a vehicle from the airport. The total price for the vehicle was $138 for 5 days in addition to the $16 daily parking fee at the resort. For about $225 we avoided transfer fees from the airport and taxi fares to venture outside the resort. The shuttle to the lot ran frequently as well as pick up back from the lot. Check in as well as check out took minutes. The staff was helpful and extremely courteous. We stayed in the las Brisas section of the hotel and our room was clean and had a spectacular view of Palomino Island. The food at the hotel was expensive, but it is a resort....and I did my research ahead of time, so I wasn't surprised. I thoroughly enjoyed the Striphouse for my birthday dinner and the breakfast buffet offered several options for all of us. Our server on 3 of the mornings, Yahaira, was very pleasant and even remembered our individual drink orders every time! We visited Palamino Island and rode horses, the el Yunque rain forest and old San Juan the day of our departure. The kids also had a blast at the water park!! We visited off site eateries like Tasca Ole Lelolai and were very pleased with both the food and service. To end my review, the kids stated they want to come back and we agreed...we'll definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: travelingforfuninNE
Reviews.Content: To start of in a positive light... Pros: -the grounds are well-maintained - the views are beautiful - if you want to sit by a pool all day it is just fine Cons: -Food is very expensive and variety is low. It also terrible! Don't let them fool you- the "fine dining" is worse than the other fare. -The hidden fees and constant holds on your credit card are obnoxious -The location is far away from San Juan and places of interest- it is over 80 dollars to take a cab one way to San Juan - It is a schlep to their private island (it is nice in theory but it takes too much time and you cannot bring your own drinks/snacks) Tips: - If you decide to stay- upgrade to an ocean view room and get the breakfast package- otherwise breakfast is expensive, too. - Stay in the Las Brisas section of the hotel if you want tranquility/quiet -Eat at Cafe Caribe

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but food was overpriced for the quality”
Reviews.Author: JRo3
Reviews.Content: The resort and hotel rooms were beautiful. We paid for a garden view room, but were upgraded to a partial ocean view. The room was wonderful and roomy. We went off the resort 2 nights for dinner, and had great meals, however the 2 minute taxi ride cost $15.00 each way ($30.00 after 10:00 pm) The other 2 nights we ate dinner at the resort. The strip house restaurant was decent. I would not recommend the Italian restaurant. The service was strange and the food was not good. Our favorite bar was the bar near the pool. The bartender Tanya made great, strong drinks. We went to that bar every night. The breakfast buffet was included with our vacation package, so we ate there every morning. We would not recommend it if you have to pay for it. We would recommend renting a car at this resort, so that you can explore the area without having to pay enormous cab fare prices. The island beach was beautiful, however we did not like that we had to take a 10 minute ferry to get to the beach. We like to just walk out of our hotel and go to the beach. We enjoyed this vacation, but I do not think we will be back because of the overpriced and quality of food, and the schedule of the ferry was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Our worse vacation ever. This place is run down, expensive, and infested with bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: charo399
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks truly amazing from the outside looking in. It'sbuilt on top of a mountain and down the mountainside--sloping hundreds of feet down to a marina. Sounds like a dream vacation, but don't be fooled. Looks can be deceiving. Once inside this hotel, I wouldn't give it more than 2 1/2 stars. Be prepared to pay 5 star hotel prices, however! Inside it's a run down, dirty, mold infested, humid, bed-bug ridden, expensive hotel with nothing to do. There is no beach unless you travel down the mountain to the marina to catch a ferry to a small island and there is nothing on the island but expensive drinks and lots of scary seaweed in the water. The beach is not your typical white sandy paradise in the caribbean. The pool is small and overcrowded. The water park is a joke--very tiny and expensive! Entertainment in the lobby is Thursday through Saturday, but the guests hang out in the lobby with their young children through the night and the nightclub is very dark and full of teenagers who obviously don't want to be there with the adults or each other, but there is nothing else for them to do. The casino is a real joke with all the 1 cent slot machines. The hotel restaurants are way over-priced, but the food is not quality. We had bad Chinese food at their "gourmet" Blossoms restaurant which was horrific. Needless to say, I was very disappointed. I asked for a room change because my mattress was moldy and my room smelled, but I was only offered to move to the same kind of run-down room after having been there 2 days. I passed on the opportunity, only to be bitten by bed bugs the following day. They finally moved me to another building just the night before I left after I was up all night the night before asking for a room change which was denied. I had called because I had woken up with bed bug bites in the middle of the night. Fajardo is far away from everything. Very far from San Juan. Everything is 1 hour or 2 hours away at least. Don't waste your time. Don't spend your money. The only decent food I had was at the Cafe Caribe, which was their most casual dining restaurant, although I paid $20 for a simple rice and beans meal. The only thing in the area to do is to visit the rain forest and that's what my family did and they liked it. I will give credit to the staff which overall is friendly and they really do the best they can with what there is to offer. I had paid in advance through a package called "Cheapcaribbean.com" . It was very expensive which is why the nightmare I experienced was unexpected. I could not get a refund or move to another hotel because my money was locked in. I should have known walking in that the hotel was bad because the lobby looks like a zoo. It's very busy and the line is long like the lines at the rollercoaster rides at Great Adventure. Overall, the vacation was ruined because of a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: MJRTZ
Reviews.Content: I will give my positive and neagtive feedback: Positive: 1) The room was nice. It was updated with a nice size bathroom and a beautiful view. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioner worked great. Unfortunately the fridge, coffee maker and drinking water were all placed next to the toilet in a shelf. Weird......Yikes! 2) The staff was pleasant and eager to help. 3) They have a Starbucks. 4) Beaultiful view of the Ocean. Negatives: 1) The hotel needs some SERIOUS remodeling. It is literally a motel quality Hotel throughout the exterior. It has not been well maintained. The interior was adequate while the rooms were very nice. 2) The pools and the pool area are not clean. This was very dissapointing. Great ocean view from the pool area but all the pools are one grade above poor. 3) The Casino seems to have been an afterthought. It is small and inefficient. Don't waste your time. 4) Restaurants: Take my word on this........They are AWFUL. The food selection is terrible and the prices are above average for what you are getting. What a DISSAPOINTMENT!!! Get in your car and go to local eateries. If you want an AMZING meal go to TIERRA DE FUEGO in PLAZAS LAS AMERICAS in San Juan. It will blow your mind because their food dances with your taste buds and each taste feels like the first time. Absolutely amazing. 5) Check in: Good Luck checking in..... Long lines...HOOOOOOOT and Humid Lobby.....not pleasant. Can't do much until the room is ready and you have to stand on line again to get your keys. A bad start to the day..... I love Puerto Rico but this hotel exemplifies what is wrong with the Tourism industry in the Island. While this hotel was below expectations Puerto Rico has many beautiful things to offer. Best of Luck with your travels.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a resort with a view.”
Reviews.Author: dasfrsie
Reviews.Content: Great place went there on my honeymoon 2.0... it was a great stay. Great beach on their rivate island. Only comlaint was the hotel restaurants are bad and the food is even worse. Exlore local laces of the resort is a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “lovely exteriors, hideous room, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: dearedwina
Reviews.Content: OK, so we booked this trip through costco travel... does that mean we get the worst room in the place? Dated furniture, carpet on a ground level room - was damp the entire time. An a/c leak was finally "attended to" 3 days into our stay, but the carpet never dried. The bathroom was dingy, the food was subpar and very expensive (our cuban sandwich was served on bread that looked and tasted uncooked, the rice and beans should have been "rice and BEAN", it was all sauce and no beans, tried to buy a pina colada at the pool side bar and was never served...) The "water park" was nice, but it only has 3 slides and a lazy river, I wouldn't call it a park, really, just a nice pool. And on a crowded weekend it was more a river of people than water, and they ran out of tubes. The one positive was the breakfast omelette bar, but it was $23 pp, and I'm sure other hotels have them too. In summary, very disappointing stay in a bizillion star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put--PARADISE--Just Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Lucinda-Tony
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the grounds of the property, the sites are breathtaking! The hotel staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. The open areas are beautiful. I stayed in a ocean view room. When my family and I looked out over our balcony; words just can't explain the beauty of everything. The vegetation, the beautiful waters--all was again; BREATHTAKING! I highly recommend this property. It is also family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time and would love to come back”
Reviews.Author: Islandhoppercarib
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Las Brisas area and loved the view. The trips to Palomino Island were great especially since the staff on the Island was very friendly. George Vazquez was especially thoughtful and very helpful. His friendly attitude and knowledge of the island made us feel very welcome. The fanicular lines were not too bad but be ready to do some walking. The lobby and pools were great. The food and drinks were a little bit overpriced but overall not too bad considering its a five star hotel. The rain forest and snorkel tours were the highlight but much more to see if you have the time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but not a bargain at just short of $300 per night”
Reviews.Author: LukeandJennie
Reviews.Content: "I became ill during a wedding celebration held at the hotel. My husband procured a room and it was clean, cool (too chilly for my tastes, so I turned off the ac), and comfortable. As we came unprepared without luggage, the bathrobes provided by the hotel were much appreciated. The hotel 'complex' is enormous, so a map to our room would have been appreciated. Lovely venue!"

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: jolewis62
Reviews.Content: We stayed the El Conquistador July 4 - July 9th 2011. What a beautiful Hotel. Located on the east end of Puerto Rico about 1 hour from San Juan is truly a vacation gem. After driving the hour towards the hotel, you follow the signs and travel through a pretty simple part of town. You follow the long roadway up through their golf course and then there it is. Walking through the lobby you look out towards the ocean and you are just so happy to be there! We were checked in by Margheriita who was friendly, helpful and welcoming. Told us our room wouldnt be ready until 4 but gave us what we needed to take the ferry to their private island, told us we could change and use the pool or have one of the free complimentary welcoming cocktails we had. She said she would call my cell when our room was ready. We decided to take the ferry and check our Palomino Island and have lunch. The boat ride is about 15 minutes, can be a little bumpy but the island is very nice with plenty of chairs, towels given as you walk off the boat, shade if you want and things to rent (kayaks, floats, snorkel gear etc) We had lunch and less than an hour later my phone rang and Margheritta told us our rooms were ready. We had two oceanview rooms in the Las Brisa's wing, the room was beautiful..loved sitting out on my balcony. the rooms were large with a very large bathroom, changing room, and main bedroom. Very clean. We also had the package that included the buffet breakfast every morning. (at Las Brisas Restaurant). Every morning our waiter or waitress were very attentive. Our first morning, we had Noel, when I asked him about one of the items on the buffet, he asked me if I want the chef to come out and tell me how it was made..and she did!! The second morning we had William, and every morning after that he made a point of saying "hello family" to us every morning, even though we never had him again as our waiter. Maria and Yarimar were equally friendly and helpful, one checking the weather radar for us and the other telling us the best place to eat in Old San Juan (Raices-very good). The breakfast package was worth every penny..Paul at the front desk assisted us in gettting a late check out, as well as pointing us in the driection of Pinones for some fried Puerto Rican food (along with exactly what we should order) before we left to catch our late flight. Can not complain about the staff at all. The restaurants are pricey, we ate dinner mostly off site exploring. We did have lunch at Iguana's on Palomino Island, and dinner at Cafe Bella Vista, which were both moderately priced and decent quality. The pool area is also very nice...nice size, not too crowded, no problem getting a chair..although the hot tub's water was very hot! We liked the pool at the Las Olas Village, we went there after the beach and had the whole pool to ourselves with cabanas. The resort is near the rain forest, but you need a car if you want to go there, to San Juan or to the Caves which is a good 2 hour ride (See Camuy Caves). The hotel offers tours of San Juan and the rain forest, which is at least $55 a person, if you have a car its free..glad we had a car..there were 5 of us!) Loved the hotel and would go back again..

Reviews.Title: “Highly not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sue1178
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this resort from friends and were really disappointed. The rooms were not clean in great need of maintenance and old. The food was not good and greatly overpriced. The water park was very small and had very few rides and it cost 25$ per person.the private island was nice but overcrowded. Overall everything did not have 4star standard not even close. I wouldn't mind spending the money but getting what I am paying for. Not the case at all on this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful family resort”
Reviews.Author: monsieurlatour
Reviews.Content: This is a truly fine resort in a location that is absolutely stunning. We had a beautiful ocean view room in Las Brisas. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The private beach takes a little effort to get to and from, but is definitely worth it. There are numerous swimming pools, excellent tennis courts, nice bars and restaurants. We did not have a chance to play golf, but the course looks beautiful. Meals are pricey, and there are not many great options near the resort, but that's the only downside. In all, a special resort I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Water_Frog49
Reviews.Content: We spent a few more dollars for an ocean view room and it was well worth it. The view was amazing. The room was very clean as was the entire resort. The people were very helpful and nice. English is very prevalent and all employees spoke both English and Spanish. We booked some excursions through the resort and they were fun and a good value. We took the Bio-Luminescence Kayak tour which was a ton of fun for my husband and I. We took the tour of El Yunque (Rainforest) and the views were spectacular. Of course, the water was truly the color of every Corona commercial you've ever seen with the white sand beaches. That was breathtaking. We did the Waverunners and had a blast. Lots of pools and hot tubs - all very clean. My ONLY problem with the resort is the cost of the food on the resort site. Expensive, small portions and limited choices. It is not easy to go off site to get other meals without renting a car or taking a LONG stroll to go outside the resort. Otherwise, the trip was fantastic. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed ourselves.”
Reviews.Author: Tricia316
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to El Conquistador as part of a business convention I was speaking at. We had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and were expecting some pitfalls but looking forward to the warm weather! We were placed in a room in the Las Brisas wing of the hotel with two double beds. We had requested a room with a king bed. The room they put us in the first night had a musty smell as soon as we walked in. The bellman quickly called down to the front desk and spoke with someone about the smell and the bed mix up. He said they were booked up for that night but to call the front desk at noon the next day to get a transfer to a different room. After awhile you don't smell the smell in the room. We were on the bottom floor of the wing and overlooked a service road for the resort but beyond that was the bay and the town below. We could hear music and festivities coming up the from the valley below and it was fine. The next day my husband played two rounds of golf. He LOVED the course and took his camera the second round of the day after lunch to take photos. We were moved to a different room and it was right down the hall but much much better! I went to the private island and loved it. Very peaceful and I talked to every iguana I saw. Food at the resort was higher than you might find in your hometown, but if you budget for it, it's fine. We ended up eating two nights in a row at the outside bar overlooking the boats in the marina and really enjoyed it. We just ordered some appetizers (tapas) and shared. We wandered into the little town two nights in a row as well. Walking out the side gate of the marina and along the water is safe and easy to do. We ate at Tommy's restaurant and Tommy came and sat with us. He was a hoot. The food was good and we loved people watching. Felt very safe and enjoyed talking with the locals. Saw some free roaming dogs (and cats and chickens) and the dogs had red collars on. They are part of a country wide program called Island Dogs www.islanddogs.org where they get vet care and are fed regularly. I also pet and talked to the dogs and cats I could get close to. We didn't have our young daughter with us (she's 7) but she would have totally enjoyed the water park. We walked up to the gate to look in and the staff said we could go in free of charge if we wanted to walk around on the sidewalk and take a look. All of the staff we met were very very friendly and accomodating. My husband was in a golf tournament the last day we were there. It started late because of a rain show (and half of the golfers having hangovers!!) so I went to the front desk and asked if we could get a late checkout so my husband could shower. Not a problem. When it was apparent he wasn't going to be done golfing in time to have a shower and be out of our room at noon I asked again at the front desk and they had no problem again bumping our checkout time until 1pm!! Fantastic! The pools and the grounds were well maintained. There were some spots where paint might have been chipped or some times needed to be polished but overall it is a huge place and they are doing a great job!!

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador - Lovely Property - Beautiful Private Island - Gorgeous Views”
Reviews.Author: Crystal152
Reviews.Content: We loved the El Conquistador and will definitely visit this property again. They grounds are lovely and we took long strolls each evening after dinner to enjoy the views. The pools were very nice but we spent most of our time at Palomino Island. (Typically we are pool people, but at this resort we loved Palomino Island and spent most days there). We took water shoes because we knew the island beach area was rough in some areas â€“ lots of old coral). The boat ride to the island was about 10 minutes and an added treat. The most important thing to note about this hotel are the Views! The hotel sits on a bluff overlooking the Atlantic Ocean, Caribbean Sea and Vieques Sound. Several lush islands are scattered throughout the sea and offer different views as the sun rises and sets each day. Food choices were typical of a 4 star resort and we were very pleased with everything we ate. Breakfast buffet had standard offerings (variety of fruit, cereals, juices, eggs, potatoes, bacon, pancakes, French toast, and a few â€˜localâ€™ choices) and the facility was very clean. (Breakfast was included in our rate otherwise we would have eaten a lighter fair at Starbucks or one of the other small places). We ate at the seafood place in the Marina (Stingray CafÃ©) and my dinner was very good, my husbandâ€™s fish was a bit overcooked. The Italian place was very good (La Piccola Fontana) and the Steak place (Strip House) was excellent (our favorite in fact). We ate light fair at the pizza/grill place overlooking the pools and that was good (the drinks were delicious). The bar at Palomino Island only had a few bar food choices but their drinks were awesome! Be sure to say hi to Bezida â€“ she makes the BEST drinks! There were several shops on site where you could get snacks, alcohol, and souvenir type things. We did not visit the water park but walked through and it was very nice and very clean. We also did not golf, but the course looked well kept but quite hilly. We knew the El Con was an older property (my husband lived in PR for a few years). Some buildings are newer and top notch. Other areas are dated, but the resort has remodeled them. For us, this is not a major negative, but it should be noted. The overall Spanish architecture of the resort was charming and sophisticated. Our rooms was an ocean view with a walk out balcony and a direct view of Palomino Island â€“ True Paradise to wake up to every morning! We did venture off site and chartered a yacht for a day of snorkeling. This is a must! You can choose the loud party boats with 50+ people (Not our style) or contact Dr. Ingrid & Captain Dan from the Erin go Bragh for a more private and personal experience (awesome!). All in all, we loved the Waldorf Astoria El Con and would love to return soon. Puerto Rico is a lovely island with friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!no other place like it....love it love love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rossanapino
Reviews.Content: I received such a great welcome from Paul at the front desk. I had a million questions about the hotel and the surrounding areas and he was very knowledgeable. Paul was great and I give him 2 thumps up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing spa trip!”
Reviews.Author: toodycat
Reviews.Content: Our group of four travelled to the El Conquistador for four nights of friendship and relaxation. We had a fabulous time and I definitely want to return and spend more time in Puerto Rico. It was a fantastic vacation. Getting there: The El Conquistador is a little over an hour from the San Juan Airport. We were supposed to be picked up by the El Conquistador van, but it had a flat tire. The representative at the airport lost no time putting us in a cab and paying for it. This setback had little to no effect on our arrival time. Check-in was uneventful, but pleasant. Our bellman was full of useful information about the resort, restaurant recommendations and what we could find where. This was essential as the property is very large and has a lot of different public areas, shops and restaurants. Rooms: We paid $199 for oceanview rooms and, boy did those views deliver! We were in the Las Brisas portion of the resort. The rooms are white with colorful accents. The bedroom area had a desk, bureau, television and an upholstered chair . Sliding doors opened to the balcony and the beautiful view. Everything was in very good condition.Wifi is free which is a nice benefit. I left my computer on the desk throughout our stay, though it would have fit in the safe if necessary. (The electrical outlet for the computer is on the base of the desk lamp.) The bathroom was enormous and had a big closet area attached which easily absorbed the contents of our two large suitcases.NB: The refrigerator is in the bathroom, so it took me a little while to find. Public spaces: They are plentiful and since it rained our first day there, we were happy to spend time chatting in the large and comfortable lobby. In the evening, there is live music in the lobby. This area was the only part of the property where I saw some peeling paint, but, in their defense, this resort is so enormous and must require such tremendous upkeep that there is probably always a little bit of peeling paint somewhere. Overall though, the El Conquistador is in excellent condition. Adjacent to the lobby are a mini-mart with everything you could possibly need, a Starbuck's, a shop with resort wear, a bathing suit store and a souvenir store. There's also a casino and a kids' game room and a room where guests watched movies on rainy days. These shops are just the tip of the iceberg; other areas of the resort have more souvenir shops, David's Cookies, Sunglass Hut and a whole bunch of other retailers. Pools: There are multiple pools at El Conquistador. We spent our time at the main pool which has the nearby Oasis bar and grill. The service at both was excellent. The pool was clean and not too crowded most of the time. Poolside beverage service was unfailingly courteous and prompt. Spa: We had quite a few spa treatments during our vacation and there were no complaints. Spa staff were very gracious and professional. The massages were excellent. If you enjoy body treatments, the pineapple body bliss lives up to its name. My skin was unbelievably soft afterwards. After our first visit to the spa, we received phone calls daily offering us different discounts on services. I was kind of sorry that I had had all my treatments on the first day, so if I were to visit again, I would plan one or two treatments for my first day and then see what deals were offered. The savings were pretty significant. Restaurants: We only ate in a few of the restaurants. La Caribe is a diner-like place with a good breakfast. The waitress, like most of the El Conquistador's staff, was very helpful and sweet. The Las Brisas restaurant has a very generous breakfast buffet. The Chinese restaurant, Blossoms, serves a dish called Full Steam Ahead Fish which was a steamed fish with sauce and vegetables. It was outrageously fabulous. Stingray, the seafood restaurant, is by the resort's marina. We had to take the funicular to get there. The meal was delicious and the service was excellent. The tuna was perfectly cooked. Palomino Island: Taking the quick ferry to Palomino Island is a delightful way to spend a day. It is similar to the private islands one encounters on cruises. There are lounges along the beach and a casual restaurant and bar.In addition to swimming and sunbathing, activities such as horseback riding are also available. We chose to spend our time just swimming and sunbathing. We bought lunch and drinks at the restaurant. Fish and chips literally means a whole fish! The bartender was very nice to us. The beach is a little rocky and corally, so be cautious when walking. Staff: Every single person we encountered at the El Conquistador was very helpful and very friendly from the desk clerk who checked us in to the bellman who brought our suitcases to the server who took our lunch order to the kind spa staff who literally held onto us as they walked us to and from our spa treatments. This wasn't the kind of niceness that seems to be looking for a gratuity and it wasn't the kind of niceness that becomes routine because one's boss is watching closely. We really felt that the staff at the El Conquistador were just the sort of workers who have pride in the job they do and want every guest to feel special. This was clearly accomplished and is a big part of the reason I plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience”
Reviews.Author: virtuoso
Reviews.Content: I ust returned from a 5 day conference and found all aspects of the resort exceptional. The service level was tops, the views spectacular, the private beach island was "paradise" and the attitude of the staff made for a most memorable experience. The spa and golf was tops also. There was a nice selectionn of restaurants on property as well as off with the Strip Steak house exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort...lousy beach access”
Reviews.Author: breckbmcq
Reviews.Content: Place is nice but in serious need of renovation...water slide park costs $25 a person...sort of lame...the boat to the private island is a lot of work to get to the beaches....the Infinity Pool at the Casitas is very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Really Waldorf? Never again.”
Reviews.Author: CTFeil
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in late May on the advice of our travel agent. We booked a room at Las Casitas, which was supposed to be the more secluded and nicer side of the resort, which was definitely NOT worth the extra money. Despite the fact that our villa had a beautiful view of the recreation island, the resort did a terrible job of maintaining these villas, as we had rainwater coming in through our windows the entire time we were there. What was the resort's solution for this? More towels. I'm not even kidding. Aside from the leaky windows, we also seemed to have an AC unit that was possessed. Even when you tried to turn it off, it would still go full-blast at 60 degrees. As a result of this, the room felt soaking wet as soon as you walked in, and not from the humidity outside. No wonder the drywall looked like it would fall off if you touched it. My next beef with this resort was the food. I was blown away with the tremendous lack of options! I was really hoping that I would be able to enjoy some local food while on the resort, without having to get myself a taxi and going into town to get something. Sadly, if you really want to taste Puerto Rico, or at least have halfway decent food while you're there, that's your only option. At one of the cafes on resort, my mother, sister, and myself had dinner, which included two salads and a cheeseburger, at the cost of $96, NOT including a tip. The $25 cheeseburger (I didn't realize putting plantains on a burger could jack up the price that much) was so overcooked I couldn't eat it, and because it was so late, I couldn't send it back to the kitchen for a new one. The last night we were there, we went to the Hibachi restaurant (meant to resemble Benihana), and I've never been treated more poorly in my life. The three of us were seated at a table meant to seat around 15-20 people with our backs to the rest of the restaurant. After roughly 20 minutes, a waiter finally came over to take our wine orders. Roughly 15 minutes after that, our wine is delivered and our orders are taken. Seeing as the other tables (which were both full of people), were getting a full show from the chefs, I expected the same for our dinner. Sadly, we didn't get a single thing that could resemble entertainment. Our chef quietly came to our table, cooked our food, served it to us, and disappeared. That meal wound up costing us about $250, and the quality of the food should have made it worth about $30. Given the way we were treated, I expected the meal to be on the house. When the best thing on the resort is your room service's chicken tenders (even at $21 a plate), your kitchen has a very serious issue. My next issue is activities on the resort. When my family and I visited the resort, it was amidst one of the worst storms PR had seen in a while. Because of this storm, all the outdoor activities were shut down. Instead of planning ahead for something like this, the resort had no indoor activities, short of going to the casino which opened late in the afternoon. So, aside from the fact that being stuck inside for a few days might give one cabin fever, there's no options whatsoever! The last day we were there, the resort tried to open up one of its clubs to host a kids game room of sorts. They were showing movies on a small TV, had a Wii set up to play, and a ping pong table. While this was a valiant effort, I walked in to see half-full glasses filled with booze from the night before! Needless to say, not the best place to try to host a kids entertainment area. I could go on and on about the many things I took issue with, but I'll refrain. Bottom line, save yourself a LOT of money and pick another resort to go to. Despite the fact that the service was satisfactory, the facilities and overall quality of this resort leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute paradise and wonderful for families--my husband wants to go every year”
Reviews.Author: McTravelers4
Reviews.Content: We have done our share of traveling, are from Boston, and have pretty high expectations when it comes to resorts. My husband has already eliminated several prior locations from our 'list' that he will not return to. He is already saying that we will most definitely return to El Conquistador. The property is gorgeous and the services are five star. The staff is more than helpful once you arrive. It was a bit difficult ascertaining the lay-of-the-land over the phone when we were booking, so we offer a few tips. You CAN buy breakfast other places besides the Full Breakfast Buffet offered at Las Brisas. There is a Starbucks on site, and Cafe Caribe also has breakfasts that are smaller and less expensive than the daily buffet. We found the daily buffet was making everyone overeat and we didn't need it EVERY day. Since it was included in our plan for our kids, we made use of it and did not have lunch, but an early dinner. If you DO go to Las Brisas, it is best to go for the $20 buffet, as if you order cereal, coffee and juice like I did one morning, it cost $14.00, which is outrageous for cereal. There is also a little market (Cozy Market) on the property where you can buy cereal and Pop Tarts and other essentials. There is a markup for this, however. We packed a lot of things in our suitcases, like Pop Tarts, cereal, Crystal Light to mix in with waters, water bottles, juice bags (double Ziploc them) etc. Just make sure your bag is not over 50lbs. or you will pay at the airport. We rented a car one day ($85 bucks for a mid-size; compact would be less expensive) to take to the rainforest in Luqillo (which we highly recommend). On the way back, we stopped at CVS and Walmart in Fajardo (which is very close to El Conquistador) and bought Gatorades, water, Medalla Light beer (which is $7.00 a beer at the resort, but my husband bought a 12 pack at the gas station for $11.00!) and other essentials. If you do this early in your trip, you will save on all of this which adds up. The resort charges you $3.50 a water bottle, and on Palomino Island, it is $5.00 for a can of Arizona Ice Tea. Just be forewarned...if you have a big family, this adds up each time the kids want to drink! As other reviews state, the 9 AM ferry to Palomino Island is the way to go, as you will find plenty of chairs in the shade. My sons had a blast snorkeling on their own with their own masks, etc. They found a small, live, coral reef with blue and yellow fish, not too far out, and also small black tip reef sharks swam by them in a shallow beach section further around the island. (They are not harmful) Buy masks at CVS and Toys R Us before you go, as they charge $35. on the island to purchase) Also, pack plenty of drinks, as again, water on the island is $3.50 each. Buy underwater cameras before you go as well, as they sell them on the island and they are also pricey, but our 12 year old insisted upon getting one! 8) On the way back, with the rental car, we did eat at La Estacion, which is very close to the main gate of El Conquistador. It looks like a dive, but it is a nifty, authentic Puerto Rican restaurant with DELICIOUS food.....the barbeque is amazing (the boneless chicken BBQ is terrific) BUT...the flies descend upon you immediately once your food arrives. We were eating with one hand and waving flies away with another. I think the restaurant could put fly paper up (which is gross, but works) or do something to get rid of the flies. They are attracted to the sweet BBQ sauce. You could spray your table ahead of time with repellant, I suppose, but we didn't have any. Try the tostones (fried plaintains) which are yummy and authentic. My husband got the NY steak and rice and beans and ate every bit of it. Steve the waiter is from Cleveland, OH....ask for him, he's great! The Golden Door Spa is a must for the ladies. Grace at the front desk is wonderful and ask for Mary to give you the 80 minute Golden Door massage. She will blend in some deep tissue or therapeutic if she sees fit. This was the BEST massage I have ever had, and again...we've traveled quite a bit. I was in complete "la la land" once she finished. The resort is great about letting you shower and store your bags if you have a later flight on day of checkout. We stayed at the pool all day, showered and picked up our bags from the bellman. The only desire we have is that their shuttles run every hour instead of two hours, as we could have spent a little more time at the pool and less time at the airport. (We had to grab the 3pm shuttle instead of the 5pm for a 6:50 flight out of San Juan) Coqui Water park is so fun and the half-day price is a bargain. It is also fairly inexpensive to feed the kids dinner there, with a decent menu, before closing. The pools are open 24/7...imagine that!....and there are NO BUGS to compete with, which is such a delight! No gnats, flies, mosquitoes....it was pure joy! We sat out most nights until very late, watching the kids swim and enjoying cocktails by the pool. How fun! The only disappointment we had, was that we scheduled the Bio Bay tour on the night before we left, and it was canceled due to weather. My sons were disappointed. You should know that if you want to go by Electric Boat, they will ONLY take six people at a time. Book EARLY....we didn't, and the only option was the 10pm departure, which ended up being canceled anyway. We will book early when we go back next year, perhaps. Overall, we had the time of our lives. We traveled with another family who had all boys, as we do, and there were no complaints. We will be back and are telling all our friends. One additional note: the beds and pillows ARE EXCEPTIONALLY COMFORTABLE for a hotel! I usually hate hotel mattresses and pillows, but these were so incredibly comfortable.....I hope you they never change their vendor! Thank you, El Conquistador!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury accomodations on a budget”
Reviews.Author: FChipman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on advice from a friend. The facility is truly breath taking, perched on a cliff above the ocean. Views are magnificent. The drawback of the facility is cost, but with planning this can be managed. Tips: 1) Ask for a good room in advance, such as La Vista. The central rooms are best. Take care to avoid the rooms near the tram that goes to the beach, as it can be very noisy ALL NIGHT 2) Book a package that includes complimentary breakfast. 3) Rent an Enterprise car - so you can do day trips (definitely the Rain Forest). Enterprise has a parking area, so you avoid the $20 day parking charge 4) Definitely take meals (especially dinner) off-site. There are several very good restaurants close by. Reservations are usually necessary. The food is better than at EC 5) Sign up for Hilton Honors before you arrive. Then at the desk ask for the Spa package that is complimentary. You can thus go every day 6) Buy groceries/ beverages at local stores (like Wal-mary, which is close by) and make your own lunch, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: lorii
Reviews.Content: El Conquistafor is a lovely resort. Perched up high, the views are magnificent. The staff tries hard to please and the accomodations at La Marina where we stayed very nice, Staying over the 4th of July weekend, however, the resort is much too crowded for my taste. I prefer the quiet, more laid back feel that was prevalent the week preceeding the weekend. Having read other reviews prior to coming, we stopped at Walmart on our way here to stock up on snacks and drinks. When we valet parked and the bellman gathered our luggage, he informed us that it will cost us $2 for each Walmart bag. This was not the way one should first be greeted at the resort; we felt nickeled and dimed especially because they didn't bother putting a box of juice pouches back into the bag that had fallen out of, but rather charged us an additional $2 for it. Advice: go to Walmart after your first arrival or put your purchased items into a suitcase. Robert was not our bellman but we spoke to him at the resort---very knowledgeable and friendly! Also followed the advice of other visitors and went to outside restaurants some times. Paison por el Fogon was indeed excellent, but we don't need so fancy when we are in the islands and much prefered the funky tropical atmosphere of La Estacion, which also has excellent food. Do NOT go to the Trip Advisor #3 rated Tasca Olelelola---the food was horrible including what tasted like frozen fish and shrimp (which we ate some of anyway because we were starving); my stomach wasn't right for days. Metropol out on Route 3 was wonderful. Though a chain restaurant, the food we had all seemed fresh and homemade, not mass-produced in any way. The service there was the best! Ask for Jay---he is the best waiter/server we've had in ages. He goes above and beyond---we told him what we wanted that wasn't exactly on the menu and he came out with specially prepared dishes that were perfect! He is warm, friendly and caring and it is obvious that that is truly his personality. The portions are huge here, so it is hard to fit in dessert but try the diplomatic pudding anyway---recommended by Jay it is outstanding! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Should be 5 star, But”
Reviews.Author: Godguy
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing facility. You will get plenty of exercise walking from one area of the hotel to another. Seriously, it was nearly 2,000 steps from our room to the front desk. But while the facility is grand, we encountered some small problem each day during our week long stay. In all fairness, most were minor and all were corrected when we complained. However some issues should not have occurred and reflect a lack of training. The minipfridge was not plugged in. The liner for the shower curtain was removed but not replaced during our stay. Trash can liners were missing one day, as were towels or washcloths on other days. The views are spectacular, the facility and room clean, there was always adequate hot water and, despite other reviewers problems, we found the wait for the funicular to be reasonable. Be prepared for top dollar prices for all services and food. $100-150 per couple for dinner, for example. Breakfast was good, but the staff misinformed us the first day regarding our cost. We were told that we would pay the taxes and tip at checkout. We were not charged for the taxes. Further, my wife drinks tea. It was not until the third day that she was offered a choice of teas (they have more than a dozen). If you walk along the waterfront and leave the hotel grounds, you will find a series of cheap places with local cuisine. This is also where trips to the luminescent bay depart from so you can save some money. If you are renting a car on the island, it is about $75/day from the hotel. But you get free parking. While you can rent cheaper at the airport, you have to pay $20 a day to park at the hotel. Again, a long walk from either parking lot. As others have said, the beach is a private island and is pristine. Water was clear but not very deep. Hard to swim if that is your thing. But good wading. Wear beach shoes because of the coral/rock surface and sea urchins. The water park is $20 per day, but 1/2 price if you go after 1 PM. Pools are open 24 hours. Towels are only available until late evening. We did use the Golden Door Spa. It was lovely, but again pricey. We received 25% off which was much more than the $50 credit our check-in package promised. The equipment available for exercise is excellent and they offer daily classes.

Reviews.Title: “Boring”
Reviews.Author: sophia64
Reviews.Content: First they gave us a room with one bed when we asked for two beds. The cleaning service needs to do a better job cleaning the bathrooms. There's not much ongoing entertainment. However, the private beach was beautiful. The food in the hotel was very expensive and not that great. We had to eat somewhere else. This was my second time there and we don't plan on returning to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: #1METSFAN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night getaway at the "Fabulous El Conquistador". After reading other reviews I can't believe I stayed at the same hotel. The hotel is great and the service is excellent. My room was done twice a day as I asked for "turndown service". It is true that the food is expensive but I am from New york so this was not a problem for me or my wife. the beach is gorgeous and the feryy ride is not that much of a bother. Believe me when I say that you will have agreat time. DONT BELIEVETHE NEGATIVE REVIEWS. I guess some people are never satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: chargarcia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely big! Nice however it does not have a water slide as it claims. The hotel did have a very very small water park (3 slides) for a big fee of $15 children and $20 adults. Parking is expensive too, $16 for self parking and $21 for valet. The front of the hotel is 10 mins from the town (BK,KFC, Mc Donalds, etc). The staff was not very knowledgable with on site store and activities. If i return to Puerto Rico, i will not be staying here. The hotel has a 15min ferry ride to it's private beach, which is nice, but takes up time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a pretty good hotel, but if you like to stay busy, not much to do.”
Reviews.Author: SPMT
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Puerto Rico. We stayed 4 nights at the El Conquistador. In general, we are happy with our stay except for a long delay upon checking in. We were early so we expected to have to wait for our room. The problem is that when the room became available, we were not told because someone forgot to enter the data in the computer. After waiting for over 4 hours, I went to see the room for myself and realised it was ready and probably was ready for a long while (no cleaning lady in site). I obviuosly was not too happy and I let them know it. A part from that, the service was great. Food: Everything is over priced and unless you have a car, you are obliged to eat at the resort. I personally would not go back without renting a car. Most of the cost is paid off by not having to take the over-priced shuttle or an over-priced taxi and it allows you to visit and to eat on the outside. By the way, taxis are a rip-off and this is santionned by government regulations (they have tourist taxis which in other words means that since you are a tourist, we will charge you much more than if it were a standard taxi). Be sure to enquire as to the price of the taxi before taking it - they tend to make-up prices as they go. The food was ok but not worth the amount charged. We ate at the Stingray. Food was very good, but was served way too fast. We were out of there in less than an hour. Beach: The beach is located on an island that belongs to the resort. The beach is very nice, plenty of chairs, not over-crowded (although, we were there in June so it may be more crowded at other times of the year). The views from the island (take the trails) are fantastic. The down side is that there are a lot of rocks (or coral) at the bottom of the water. Also, it is a bit of a pain to have to take the ferry everytime you want to get to the beach. Hotel: The lobby is beautiful. The rooms could use a bit of work but they are very clean. All of the rooms seem to face the sea so views are great. Rooms have a balcony. Some sections of the hallways are semi-openned so you hear the frogs all night (believe me, it is very noisy). If you need complete quiet at night, you should ask for a closed area. Overall, we appreciated our stay. The staff was very nice and the place is very pleasant. However, due to the location of the resort, 4 days is plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Funnnnn”
Reviews.Author: Pike513
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our trip to this hotel with a family of 5. Postive Pools, free ferry to palamino island, beautiful location, great service, good ice cream shop. Conns Food was very expensive meals were a min of 15 per person for anything.. Distance from the city and other attractions. Resort fee on everything Feeling that you had to tip everyone for anything

Reviews.Title: “Needs maintenance, restaurant choices and client appreciation”
Reviews.Author: jvelis
Reviews.Content: Having lived in PR for 30 years, El Conquistador was always an icon of class and quality. Well not anymore. My family and I stayed during June 2011 and the hotel is in dire needs of maintenenance work. It needs to be painted, cleaned, and attention to the details. The lobby was in disarray and dirty most of the time,, nobody was fixing it up or cleaning the debris that the other guests ( most of them current employees that get the rooms for less than $90 per day) leave behind. Under the tables in the lobby there was rmnants of food and drinks. Then in the rooms, towels were very thin and grey. Well they were white years ago but today they are grey, thin and with stains. My room housekeeping was skipped for one day and when I called to request it they started to argue with me as to why it was skipped. The employees are well intentioned and they try to give good service, but the company who operates it, Walforf Astoria, I don't see having any committment to improve or make them better. Wakdorf really needs to invest $$ in this property to make the tourists who pay full rate to come back. El Conquistador years ago was a WOW hotel, today; no WOW just OK

Reviews.Title: “Best family vacation”
Reviews.Author: gonzo203
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but just got home from an amazing vacation at the El Conquistador and had to comment... We too were weary of the hotel after reading the wide range of reviews, but realized they helped us do our home work. We just got back from a week long family vacation with our two girls ages 8 and 12. After reading the reviews we booked a room in Las Brisas because it seemed to have the least amount of issues. Our room was ready when we got there, large, quiet, super clean with a great balcony and beautiful view. The room was one of the nicest we ever stayed in. We loved the private island beach, it was never crowded and was great for my daughters first time snorkeling...there is a pretty good coral reef right off the beach. I do think water shoes are a must because there is tons of coral ..The pools were great and the water park was a huge hit . My husband and I sat and read while the girls went down slide after slide. We also had great meals at the hotel. Yes they were pricey, but no more so than any other resort we have been to. The only real complaint I have is that basic drinks such as soda or water were on average 4 dollars which I did think was a little high, but both the island and pools had free jugs of tap water which was fine. I understand what people said about taking an elevator, tram and boat to get to the island and how cumbersome that could get, but I would do all that to have the amazing view perched on the cliff side... The staff were alway helpful, friendly and we never had to wait for anything. This is an exceptional family resort, we had a wonderful time and would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “lots of kids and not kept up.”
Reviews.Author: sjntraveler
Reviews.Content: maybe my standards are too high. but, i figured if you are going to use waldof in your name, you better excel. this property is not kept up. rooms run down with stains on ceiling, carpet and cracks in the walls. it is a hugh property and views are nice, but too many kids and just felt dirty to us. i have stayed at the ritz in san juan and it is top notch. i have stayed at the el san juan and it is next, then intercontinental. even when i was jn med school 10 years ago i stayed at a 40$ motel and it was kept up better. i am from miami and come to rico a lot. booked 4 nights at el con. and am leaving tomorrow, after one night, to go to ritz. last words: if you dont hAve kids, dont stay here. also, those who say it was awsome, i bet had their kids along.

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking views.”
Reviews.Author: Live2travel07
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good memories from this place, staff was very polite and friendly we loved " La Estacion rest." and " Passion por el fogon " best places for mofongo and seafood, if you would like pork take a ride to " Guavate . best rooms @ el conq. are the Marina rooms ideally located closed to everything. Book your tour with Kayaking Puerto Rico these people are the besttt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: jchurich
Reviews.Content: The El Con is a great resort the people are friendly and the rooms are very pretty. If you can get an ocean view do it! The Palomino island is a great perk- as a guest you go there for free on a 10 minute ferry and it has beautiful beaches. I recommend when staying at this resort you go to the CVS, kmart, or walmart near the resort and buy your alcohol, beer (local medalla is a great option) and snacks. The food options are high end and the drinks are pricey ie medalla is about a $1 everywhere else in PR and $5 at El Con. The water park is fun but mostly for kids and the lower deck rooms require the use of a funicular to get to the main part of the hotel. Do not rely on the concierge for reliable information. If you plan to go to Culebra get to the ferry really early, Vieques usually doesn't have the same demand but Red BEACH on Vieques is stunning. Keep in mind when travelling to PR that service is slow (island time) and verify directions ( everyone has a different answer). Be careful driving as laws in PR are more like guidelines and never leave your valuables unattended. If staying at the resort definitely try to get to Old San Juan, Condado/Isla Verde, and try PINCHOS ( BBQ'd Skewers). Just down the road from El Con is a restaurant called El Estacion. Great food, better prices, cool bartender and the owners are very hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Double Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: ny1480
Reviews.Content: We travel quite often and seldom write a review about our hotel experiences.But in this case our experiences can not go with out mention. We found this resort to be top shelf,everyone from top management down could not do enough for us. Our stay was absolutley incredible the property ,the service outstanding. Plenty to do within the resort with out leaving. Great choice of resturants from light fare to pretty much anything you wanted.Being in the travel business for over 25 years, This resort is definetly "DOUBLE THUMBS UP"

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Don't understand what all the complaints are about”
Reviews.Author: Boccaccia
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the El Conquistador on a 3 week business trip. I was a bit weary of booking the hotel after reading the bad reviews and I honestly don't see what all the fuss is about. I am well into the second week of my stay and am thoroughly enjotying it. My room has a beautiful view of the sea and Palomino Island. The rooms is clean, comfortable and stylishly furnished. The bathroom is clean, well appointed and has a large walk-in closet in which I was able to place 3 weeks' worth of business clothes. Other reviewers complained that they disappointed by the hotel. They have to bear in mind that this is a resort hotel. Frankly, Louis XV furniture and Ormolu are lovely in Versailles but would be very out of place at a Puerto Rican resort. I think that the hotel and the decor are perfect for the location and function. I do agree that at the weekend a hoard of loud barabarians descends on the hotel but staff do their best to maintain the ambiance and lets face it, although we might wish they could, they can't background check everyone who makes a reservation. A resort will always attract it's fair share of "undesirables". I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member and I have stayed at many Hilton properties including the Waldorf in London and the Waldorf Towers in New York. I am very pleased with the Hilton and Waldorf brands and I feel that the El Conquistador deserves to be a Waldorf. Thanks for the lovely stay so far!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE AND QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: mannyv7
Reviews.Content: I had a great time with my family at this AWESOME hotel. I noticed everybody works very hard and take time greet everybody, specially Mr. Dermot Connolly, the General Manager, and Mr. Manny Melendez, the Assistant Manager. These guys are true professionals. The water park the restaurants, and the rest of the facilities are great!

Reviews.Title: “Completely honest review -- I did not have to pay to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: acclaimToronto
Reviews.Content: I really didn't need to get too detailed on this review -- only 65% of reviewers recommend this property anyway. I just wanted to give a very honest opinion of the property -- we were here on business and most all expenses were paid by our sponsor. I was actually out very little (other than the few days of my life I can't get back...), so I'm certainly not writing this review from a "getting even" standpoint. I would just want to warn those considering spending their hard-earned money to come here. First, I will wholeheartedly confirm the rooms are entirely too run down for the star rating, Waldorf Astoria name, and price point. It reminded me of the little dingy beach motels we would stay in back in college. Incredibly stale, musty odors penetrated every fiber of every item in the room -- including the beds. Due to the fact that the A/C had not been running (they are on motion sensors and apparently cut off when you leave) the room was wet -- not humid -- wet. Ceilings, floors, walls -- all wet from the incredible humidity. I realize running the A/C costs money, but certainly the dehumidifying effects would save on wear and tear in the room. The condition of the rooms was depressing. The walls were stark white (as was all the decor in the room), but in bad need of a coat of paint. Gouges and holes in the walls were halfheartedly patched, but nobody seemed to think how much nicer the room would look if it was done even semi-professionally, and painted to match. The safety latch on the door had been broken off more than once, and simply relocated to another spot on the door frame. The prior holes weren't covered or painted over. The tiles in the bathroom were originally nice porcelain ones, but now cracked and chipped (and "repaired" with caulk!). Plumbing was exposed, mismatched PVC and chrome pipe -- it was just cheap, cheap, cheap. It was like your destitute uncle/handyman kept the place up. Customer service was lacking -- but I found this to be a theme throughout the "resort." The only time anyone really came to life was when there might be a dollar to be had. Upon arrival I was forcibly separated from my luggage, then after check-in had to walk by the bellman's desk to get to my room. I asked for my lone suitcase, and was told I would have to call from my room to have it "delivered." I attempted to explain that it was unnecessary, as I could just as easily take it with me, and was informed sternly this was their "policy." So I had to wait 20 minutes (in my wet, sweltering room) to get a clean change of clothes prior to venturing out. The front desk clerks had the most peculiar habit of going back into the office (behind closed doors) after attending to a guest. So if you approached the line and there were two clerks -- each attending to a guest -- you would be assured they would both leave for a 5-7 minute "break" after they finished. Once they left the desk completely unattended while I was the only person waiting to be assisted. And you will spend a lot of time in that line -- there were countless guests looking to switch rooms, get their card keys re-programmed (a particularly nasty little problem -- mine stopped working 4-5 times in two days), or generally vent about the poor condition of the rooms. I met lots of interesting people -- and learned of lots of interesting issues with the property -- while waiting in this line. I didn't get to dine in the "nice" restaurants on site; the first night I believe they all closed at 9pm (it was a Monday night, mind you). By the second night I was on to the place, and chose to make a go of it out in Fajardo. What a decision -- I had a wonderful, fresh, local barbecue meal for $30 -- including drinks. For lunch I made the mistake of eating out on the patio on the property, where I had a lifeless (?chicken) sandwich and fries, a Presidente beer, and poor service for a total of $42 (less tip). A grilled chicken sandwich and a beer for $42? I don't mind spending someone else's money for a good meal, but this is starting to test the limits of reason... So the east end of the island is beautiful, the private island very nice, and the golf course apparently well above average (I did not actually see the course myself). But there is little else to do other than take tours off property, and I could never, never recommend anyone actually staying at El Conquistador. I won't even go into the ridiculous hidden fees they extort off of guests at checkout (which total upwards of 30-40% of the quoted room rate) -- I wouldn't recommend this place for $169 all-inclusive. They need to bulldoze the property and start over. I don't have an ax to grind with anyone -- El Conquistador, Hilton, etc -- this place is just a squalid, run-down money trap. Read (and believe) the other 1-to-3 star reviews and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why all of the complaints!”
Reviews.Author: neen1952
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful stay at ElCon. We were treated respectfully and courteously by all staff, and our room was great. We were on the LasBrisas wing. We had researched the resort fully before our stay and knew there would be some waiting for the funicular, or the ferry. But, seriously, never more than 5 minutes for the funicular, and the ferry to Palomino ran every thirty minutes. Messages were left on our room phone with the ferry schedule for the day--so you knew exactly when the first one would be leaving and the last one coming back. We also knew that the restaurants would be pricey. Blossom's onsite was great and not overly expensive.There are alot of local eateries that are great and much less expensive. La Estacion is one in particular that was outstanding. It is less than 5 min from the resort gate to the right. We stopped at Walgreens, and bought water, soda, beer and snacks. Small refrigerator in the room and you just have to keep it stocked. Parking was not a problem. Only once did the shuttle not show, but the remainder of the time, it was less than a 5 minute wait. A/C in the shuttle not always working, but seriously you are only in the shuttle for a few minutes until you are dropped at the front door. Weather was great. Resort was great and only can say," I wish I were still there"! If you have a chance, also try to go to Culebra. BEAUTIFUL island! Get your ferry tickets early and there is ground transportation available for like $3-5 at the dock when you get off of the ferry. Make sure to go to Flamenco Beach. My recommendation is to do your homework before you go. Enjoy the beauty of the resort and relax. Set your clock for island-time. It is fabulous. PS. Contrary to some reviews- WIFI is complementary. NO fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but could have better service.”
Reviews.Author: Cbrown7
Reviews.Content: The resort overall is pretty nice but the service isn't too good. The tours arent too great either and are overrated.

Reviews.Title: “The most Awful vaction of my life!”
Reviews.Author: LC231
Reviews.Content: I have never in my life written a review, no less a poor review but my vacation was a disgrace due to the hotel management, supervisor Noel - worst treatment at his hands and disgusting rooms ever! This is NOT a 5 star resort! This is not even 4 star, it's 1 at best! I can not believe the hotel is a Waldorf Astoria property! We had to move rooms 4x on a 5 day vacation! There were termites in one of the rooms! We were infested with them. The hotel operator/guest services started to laugh on the phone when we called about the infestation and were freaking out! The supervisor Noel, he is awful too! He actually laughed in our face when we were livid with him and the treatment we got from day1 !!! They tried to put us in a room with one bed upon arrival and we had booked a double room on our voucher. He told us they were sold out and they offered to send us a blow up mattress! We had to go back to the front desk to demand what we paid for and that supervisor Noel did not even come out...what a slime ball! He sent the bellman back out with new room keys to a room with two beds but smelled musty like shack at the shore, the towel rack in the shower was ripped off, the hall light when you walk into the room was burnt out, no blow dryer, mosquitoes were abundant in the bathroom, and the water backed up when we took showers. It was gross and musty and we were bitten up that first night! I would not even put a stray dog in this room no less people! Next day I went to front desk and complained to another supervisor who was appaled and provided us with another room a few floors up....but that was missing a lamp..no big deal, as they gave us one right away. Day 3 was fine but on day 4 our last evening, we're getting ready to go out to dinner and allof a sudden our bathroom was infested with Termites!!! Maintenance sprayed our bathroom with bug spray and we were told we had to move to another room as they had to fumigate the room! FYI - the closet where all our clothes were is in the bathroom! It was our last night and this was the forth time we changed rooms! We are demanding a full refund and they have the nerve to say that they accommodate us! Most of the staff were pleasant (bellman &bar and restaurant service was great) but the supervisor and guest services are horrible. I had to toss all my toiletries out as it stunk of bug spray. We demanded dinner on our last night as it was late and our plans were ruined due to termite situation and having to pack and move once again. We also demanded new tooth brushed. This establishment is HORRIBLE, the rooms are sub par at best, and the guest services staff and the supervisor Noel need to go back for training or should not deal with guests at all! On the morning of our departure one of the assistant managers said he was going to work with travel agent and tour company on credits did not keep his word although he said he was embarrassed at our treatment. I had repeatedly asked for the hotel general manager but never saw or heard from him/her. DO NOT STAY HERE! BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE!!!! For all our trouble they think giving us a $20 pass to the water park and dinner that we demanded they give us was accommodating! WHAT A SHAME AS THE BEACH AND POOLS ARE NICE...THE LOBBY IS NICE TOO BUT THE ROOMS AND STAFF ARE THE WORST I HAVE EVER ENCOUNTERED IN MY 25+ YEARS OF TRAVELING!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not worth it better places to drop $$$”
Reviews.Author: travelin77
Reviews.Content: Grounds are nice but everything else is avg or below. The island is nice with its coconut trees, but didn't like swimming with the sharks. The staff was nice but my first night i slept on a blow up bed that deflated overnight. Must be standard practice here but as I told the manager the next day i didn't spent 4K for ANYONE to sleep on the floor. Had to change rooms 3 times during stay and have yet to see the 2 night credit. Even eating outside the resort was expensive 30 and up and was average quality. All in all you can go to better places like St Martin The Keys and have a tropical vacation. Best part about PR is the walk thru the rainforest, Bio Bay kayak and Old San Juan forts but nothing else special to me. Got really put out waiting on the Funicular tram all the time or just missing the ferry to the island and waiting another half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2011 felt like a vacation sans kids!”
Reviews.Author: covbrit
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador Resort, Puerto Rico My family and I stayed at this resort over Spring Break this past April. This was an outstanding resort. We were a little concerned as the drive from San Juan airport to the resort (which took about 40 minutes) took us through some areas of Puerto Rico where the standard of living was obviously lower than in some parts of the US. We were unsure what to expect, but upon arrival we were more than excited to be there. The resort itself is on a gated property with 24 hour security guard. The main resort sits on the top of the hill. Upon our arrival to the resort, we were immediately greeted by a bellboy who helped with our suitcases. Check in was quick and the reception clerks were very polite and genuinely happy. We were escorted to our room by the bellboy who greeted us, and during the trip to the room he pointed out the highlights of the resort and gave suggestions on how to fully maximize our stay. The resort grounds are beautiful. Our room was located in the Marina which is at the bottom of the main resort. Our room was in a building situated close to the water. The room itself had a beachy feel, very clean, and the pillows were dreamy! Must put those on my Christmas list as I never wanted to get out of bed! We had a patio that had seating for four and we would drink our tea out there in the morning and evening in a idyllic setting watching the sunsets. There are at least three different levels that house the resort but for the purpose of the review, I will simply divide it as upstairs (the main resort area) and downstairs (the marina area). Upstairs has the majority of the restaurants, stores, shops, pool, gyms, game rooms, clubs, and the casino etc. We ate at several of the restaurants and they were outstanding. If you go into town, I highly recommend Lolitas Mexican restaurant. Great family atmosphere and the food is delicious! The breakfast buffet at the on-site restaurant was good, with many hot and cold choices, and some healthy food options. Service was great and the servers interacted with the kids and were friendly. Restaurant was clean and food was replenished quickly. To reach the Marina you take the â€œfunicularâ€�, similar to a trolley style car that takes minutes to transit from the main resort down to the Marina. This area is where the water park is located, and the ferry that takes you to the resortsâ€™ private island where youâ€™ll find the beach. There is no beach at the Marina, but the ferry is a relaxing 7 minute boat ride to the island which the kids loved. The beach is clean and has many sun loungers. We spent most mornings at the beach and then back to the Marina to finish the afternoon at the water park. As it was a vacation we were never up early but never seemed to have a problem finding sun loungers at either location! The ferry departs roughly every 30 minutes. There is a cafÃ© restaurant on the private island which surprisingly was very reasonably priced for lunch and drinks. The snorkeling near the private island is great. The kids loved the on-site water park located in the Marina area. Height restrictions were 36 inches I think, so smaller kids can go on every ride, including the 50ft drop water slide which kept our kids aged 7, 8 and 11 entertained for hours â€“ literally! There were several water slides, some using tubes. Each area has a lifeguard on duty. There were a couple restaurants and shops located in the Marina area. As our room was located in the Marina it was a short walk to the water park or jump on the ferry to the private island. The only time we visited the main resort area was for breakfast and dinner. The outdoor grill style restaurant at the top of the resort has a balcony that overlooks the main pool and the pizzas are amazing! Be sure to ask for an events schedule when you arrive. We found this on our 2nd day there and they had some great activities to keep the kids entertained. Not sure if that was special with it being Spring Break week or whether that is an all-year- round program. One of those special events was a large TV screen poolside so the kids can swim and watch the movie. The one we went to was free and the kids enjoyed swimming in the pool at dark watching the movie on a big screen. The only other thing I would have added would have been a nostalgic popcorn machine where you could buy popcorn! Overall, it was a great experience and we cannot wait to go back again. It was one of those places were my husband and I felt like we had taken a vacation sans kids. We left feeling relaxed and the kids were kept entertained the whole stay. We will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations dashed - this place is a rip off”
Reviews.Author: LobstaSlaya
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at El Conquistadore for a getaway to Puerto Rico. This part of the island is beautiful. The tropical mountains here slope right down to the beach. Thereâ€™s nothing like it in the mainland. But if you do decide to travel to this part of the island, donâ€™t stay here. I donâ€™t care what others say about this hotel. The El Conquistadore I saw was dated, inconvenient, poorly maintained, staffed by unhappy people, and unfair in billing â€œextrasâ€� that most reasonable people would assume to be included in a room charge. Letâ€™s begin with the facility. The hotelâ€™s common areas are nice, but a little old. By contrast, the private areas are not what youâ€™d expect from a hotel that trades on being top-flight and exclusive. Our top floor ocean-view room was one of the most expensive. But it was small, uncomfortable, dirty, and old. A few examples: The hotel failed to change the air filters in the roomâ€™s a/c system. Every time the system came on, the room filled with musty air. The bathroom featured an industrial-style mega-flush toilet. Youâ€™d expect to see one at a gas station, not a â€œfour-starâ€� hotel. They tried to update the bathroom. They installed some new glass tile mosaic over the wash basis. But the workmanship was poor. Tiles were crooked and dirt accumulated between cracks. One of two small, grungy, and un-renovated elevators needed to access our building was out of service. They blocked it off with a used janitorial mop. But here is the worst part about this place: they nickel and dime everything. We pre-paid our room in full. I like to do that when I travel to distant places so there are no surprises later on. Well, there were surprises a-plenty at El Conquistador. The extras (which should have been included) were 80% of the price of the room per night! This place doesnâ€™t miss an opportunity to hit your credit card. Here are examples: Parking: Although El Conquistador is on a 100-acre spread in a rural part of the island, they charge for parking. Itâ€™s unreasonable. Whatâ€™s worse: they charge New York City rates. Parking is $20 a night at the good lot (which is valet whether you like it or not) and $15 at the main lot. Trying to save $5.00, I picked the main lot. What a mistake. It is so far away from the hotel, they send a golf cart to pick up guests. The carts run on an irregular schedule. I waited 20 minutes. It was as if they were punishing me for saving the $5.00. Resort fee: 12.00% of your room charge. Even if you donâ€™t use the facilities, get ready to pay up. Sure, they have a pool and some nice grounds. But they better, since they are marketing themselves as a destination, not a business travellerâ€™s, hotel. But get this: even after you pay the resort fee, it does not include access to the resort, including their off-site beach and other amenities. Thatâ€™s an extra fee. Check out fee: $65.00. Thereâ€™s a little more to this. We called and checked out by phone long before the check-out time. We asked their permission to stay on property and use the pool. The front desk said sure. My wife went to the pool. I did some errands off site. But on the way out, they handed us another bill. It was for $65.00. Apparently, their policy is that guest must not only vacate their rooms, but the property, or be charged a late check-out fee. What a crock. More parking fees: I paid the parking fee of $15.00 in cash earlier in the day when I ran my errands. But when I picked up my wife, the attendant didnâ€™t believe me and tried to add another $15.00 to my bill. I explained that I had paid it and they didnâ€™t believe me. The attendant called over his colleagues and I was suddenly explaining it again to five (yes FIVE) parking attendants, including what I assume was their supervisor. I felt like a defendant in a federal criminal proceeding. They finally excused me without further payment, but warned me that the hotel does not permit â€œin-and-outâ€� parking. For the record, I never re-parked. I merely drove up to the pick-up area to wait for my wife. Look, I am all about making money. Profit is what keeps any good hotel operating. But the owners and management of this hotel doesnâ€™t see human beings when guest walk into the Conquistador. They see dollars. Iâ€™m never going back.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico at its best.”
Reviews.Author: LilianCap
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and the location is one of the best locations in Puerto Rico. The golf course is a postcard. The best thing is that they own a pristine island in front of the hotel called Palominos. We spent most of the days in Palominos and came back just for dinner and some swiming in the beautiful swimingpools. I cannot think of anything negative about this hotel. One of the top resorts in the caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: b3141
Reviews.Content: Found out about this resort through a friend from P.R.. He helped me arrange it, and it was well worth it.
