The place is beautiful and the kids were constantly engaged and entertained. The rooms were nice with beautiful view. Manny Melendez (in charge of hotel part) was a great host. We went to the resorts's private island, and my daughter developed hives. Laura Lopez was the manager on the island and helped us find some Benadryl for her and was very helpful. Overall we enjoyed this vacation a lot.

Reviews.Title: “We had fun here but I wouldn't recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Calliope_123
Reviews.Content: We went in knowing the downsides of this hotel - long distances between locations in the hotel, only beach on separate island, etc, and planned to stay only two nights so we wouldn't get too irratated with these negatives. For the most part it worked but I think one issue with this hotel may be the staff. The parking lot is very far away and when we pulled up, nobody came up to try to take our car for valet or assist us with luggage. There were several staff members standing around, so I got out and asked them if we could leave the car here while we checked in. They said no, we need to go park and we can leave the luggage with the bellhop while we park. I had to then wait in a line at the bellhop desk and after a few minutes, I told my husband to go park while I waited with the luggage. He came back 30 minutes later, dripping with sweat. The lot is very far and the lot was very full so he had to drive around a lot and then walk back up the hill in the heat to the hotel. There is a parking shuttle but nobody told us when we talked to the valet and he never saw it. I understand we could have valet parked (and if I had known about the parking difficulty, we would have) but the least they could do when you pull up is acknowledge you, give you the parking shuttle information and take your bags instead of making you get out of the car and go up to them and then wait in a separate line for bellhops. There were other times during the stay where staff were just standing around and they didn't offer to take bags, bring you drinks at the pool, etc. I am really not a 5 star hotel person and normally stay at budget hotels so it is not like I am expecting to be spritzed with Evian as I pull up my car to the hotel but it would be nice if they gave you information and didn't ignore you when you pull up. The pools are not too exicting and I am not sure why they didn't do anything with the great view. You see a wall or bushes instead of the ocean view while in the pool. Our room was nice so maybe we had an updated one. The private island is nice but it isn't good to have to take so much time to get to the beach. I guess I had a lot of negatives but I did have fun here. I just wouldn't highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the trip!”
Reviews.Author: EthanKurtzman
Reviews.Content: Great place for a quick or long getaway. The property was beautiful and the staff could not have been nicer. Beautiful rooms, always immaculate. The food was FANTASTIC, thr Strip House, Stingray Cafe and the Italian place (can't remember the name) had some of the best food I'd had in a while. In my mind, the only minor drawback was that you have to take a ferry to palomino island (hotels private island) if you want to go to the beach, but the ferry ride is only 10 minutes and it runs every half hour. I would recommend not going on weekends in the summer as a lot of residents from the island go than and it gets pretty crowded. Also, we went for a couples getaway and the hotel had a bit too many kids for our liking. Not a huge deal, just something to keep in mind. All in all, a wonderful resort well worth the trip!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely return to El Conquistador...”
Reviews.Author: Kateau
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El Conquistador for three days with some friends. We had planed a trip for two, but a third friend joined us at the last minute. The front desk staff didn't even blink, but re-assigned us to a room with two beds on the marina level. The room was exceptionally large, and we had a little balcony overlooking the marina. The shower in the room, btw, was one of the best I have ever had in a hotel! The numerous pools were very clean and well-maintained. I agree with other reviewers that the food and drinks were expensive, but I expected to pay resort prices. The service was good, and the food was better than average. My only disappointment was that none of the restaurants specialized in local food. I thought the private island was nice, but not terribly exciting. The beach was pretty, and the bar/grill served adequate food. The biggest complaint I had was about something the hotel couldn't cure -- the sound of the coquis kept me up at night! One reviewer commented that the staff were noisy in the mornings. I thought that, too, until I realized that the noise I heard was actually the hotel's funicular!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort Updates needed No included Activities”
Reviews.Author: Blessed007
Reviews.Content: During our 5/24/11-5/28/11 stay at the El Conquistador resort, we found that the resort grounds are nice, but the guest rooms are in need of renovation. The carpet to start is very old striped, moldy odored, and stained. The cleaning crew I guess does what they can with the non updated rooms. However, I found some pre-existing hair on the shower wall when we checked into our room. We stayed in Las Casita. The Ocean view was nice as we were upgraded since we arrived on a Tuesday and the Hotel had not reached its full capacity. We went to Palomino Island twice via the boat/ferry ride which was free of charge. Palomino Island is small but nice. Be prepared to pay around 17-18 for a sandwich/burger-lunch while on the island as there is only one restaurant and El Conquistador wants you spend fund on their beach cafe. So don't think that El Conquistador will allow you to pack a lunch via cooler and take over to the island. We had our 2 year old son thus we had to take our snacks and water out of the cooler and store in our beach bag unless it wouldn't have been allowed. We went to the El Junque rainforest which was a hike, but the waterfalls are gorgeous. We rented a car, thus we paid for the $21/Day valet parking. We went to La Parilla restaurant in Kiosks (short 15-20min ride from the resort) and the food was very good. We also went to Las Estacion (2min from resort) and Raices (in San Juan) and the food was also good, but not as tasty as La Parilla. Also the resort concierge suggested that we go to Passion restaurant and once we arrived the what appeared to be owner/manager said that they could not take us and had a wedding rehearsal, this was after we stood waiting there for about 10min. I didn't really care for poor cust service here. Also resore suggested Calizo which is very pricy/supposed to be fine dining. We ate at Las Brisas for breakfast which was decent the charge was $19.99 and if you wanted an omelet from scratch, you had to pay an extra $6 We went to Baru' restaurant in San Juan which was overpriced garbage so please don't waste your time or money. The Fort was nice. On our way back to the airport we explored San Juan a little more and there were a lot of souveneir shops and very crowded. Also, it rained everyday for about 15-20min. The sun was out everyday until around 1pm. Overall Puerto Rico was nice, I wish the rooms at the resort were newer/nicer/modern and it would've been nice to have some type of entertainment at the resort like shows etc. If Puerto Rico is in competition with Mexico's resorts they have a long way to go as you don't get the shows, all inclusive deals, classes, and activities, and excursions in Puerto Rico as you do in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: beachprincess21
Reviews.Content: The Valentin Imperial was great! We would definitely go back. The food was average to good. The best restaurant was the asian restaurant. We also liked the french restaurant as well. The others were so so. The drinks were good too. The beach was beautiful and we spent a lot of time at the pool. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Not Fun At all”
Reviews.Author: lindsey15131
Reviews.Content: It was horriable just like my spanish, the distance to get anywhere was very bothersome no good resteraunts employees lie to you the casino is rigged room service takes a hour for a towel water park is the only baby pool and you have to pay every day 20$ per person it cost 7$ for a beer at bar and 4$ for a beer in gift shop chicken fingers cost 16$ its a great view and very pretty but your better off just looking at the photos on there messed up web site..........

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: hjelling
Reviews.Content: Hilton Diamond member here, so very familiar with Hiltons/Waldorfs. Found staff to be very friendly and really enjoyed the private island. Only negative was the food, which was medicore at best. While I'm used to paying resort prices at resorts, the prices here were about 25% higher than other 4 star resorts I have stayed at. $30 for a cocktail and cheeseburger, for example, in the casual restaurant. We joked that the best meal we had was at the cafeteria at the airport, which would be more funny if it wasn't true.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed, preferred the Rio Mar”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Symm
Reviews.Content: In early May I stayed 6 nights primarily for a conference but extended my stay for some other business as well. The service was great, from the time I arrived to check-out everyone I encountered was really friendly and helpful. The room I stayed in was not so great, at least not what you would expect from a 4 star resort and was terrible compared to my stay at the Rio Mar a number of years ago. The best part of my room was the view, it was amazing. The room was large and spacious but dingy with old furniture. It wasn't cleaned very well; there were hairs on the bathroom walls and there was paint peeling in places. Overall I was disappointed in the room. As some other reviewers noted things are expensive, almost to the point of gouging. They do have some great on-site dinging and business and conference rooms are nice. Overall if I was deciding on a resort in Puerto Rico I would choose the Rio Mar based on my experience.

Reviews.Title: “The spa was extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: AnnF72
Reviews.Content: About 30 minutes in to my massage a noise started. It sounded like there was a jack-hammer on the roof. It was less than relaxing, to say the least. When I inquired if they were having work done on the roof, they said that it was the power washer downstairs. Apparently the golf carts are cleaned in an area below the spa. When they turn on the power washer, it seems to rattle every water pipe in the building. It sent a vibration throughout the entire building. It was insanely loud. It was so ridiculous I had to laugh at them. What a joke of a spa treatment. And it cost $300. Why not wash the golf carts at a time when the spa is closed? But the water park was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Company Convention”
Reviews.Author: amuenk
Reviews.Content: We stayed May 15 - 22 and it rained all day, 5 of the 7 days. When it rains, there is very little to do at this resort, unless you want to do it in the rain. We stayed in room 4316 of La Vista, which needs some repair work, but the view of the pool area and Palamino island is amazing. No balcony, but we didn't miss it because you can open the sliding doors and enjoy the view. Wi-Fi was on and off all week, which made it difficult for everyone to work from resort. We tried our dial up thumb drive and it was extremely slow. Some days we couldn't get on wi-fi at all, others it ran flawlessly. The corporate events (600 people) were very well executed, food was all very good, with the exception of the buffet breakfast on our last day, which was served outside overlooking the pool area, and it was spectacular!! Funicular is a PAIN, so be prepared. Strip House is exceptional. Marina bar/restaurant serves great sandwiches and staff is great. Stingray was ok, portions were very small. Starbucks is a Godsend and great option for breakfast. Water park was better than I expected and everyone really enjoyed it, from children to adults. Lazy river was great. Palomino Island wasn't what I expected, only one restroom on the island, so if you want to sit at end of the island, near bar and have cocktails, you have to walk the length of the island to use the facilities. Take water shoes you will need them. Seaweed close to shore, so you can't really wade out very far. We didn't spend much time here because the pools are amazing and I didn't mind not having a beach. Shuttle was only running once an hour, so if it was full, you were stuck on the island until next boat. Overall the resort staff was wonderful. Prices are extremely high, so be prepared. Can of Banana Boat Aloe $20. Cocktails $12. Can of soda $2.50. Bottle of water $3.50. Travel size of Listerine mouth wash $4.99 Pizza at pool bar is really good for $12, nice mid-afternoon snack to share between 2 people. It's an hour drive from the airport, and if you want to tour San Juan, you need a minimum of 6 people for shuttle and it's an hour and 15 minutes drive. Shuttle service from airport was great, though. Staff was very helpful and helped with our bags the entire way to our rooms. Bell staff was exceptional. Nice exercise facilities at the hotel. We heard from others that Italian and Oriental restaurants were very good. Actually, we didn't hear any complaints about the food. Frogs will keep you up at night....they are very loud!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location and views. A vacation to remember.”
Reviews.Author: tmanasa
Reviews.Content: We held my sister-in-law's wedding at the El Conquistador and it turned out to be the most gorgeous wedding I have ever attended. The venue was outstanding. The staff went to great lengths to accomodate our specific needs--including making way for the groom to arrive in a horse-drawn carriage!--and worked with our family and technicians to set up the hand-built decorations, and the audio and visual effects. The help that the staff and management gave us was perhaps the most important aspect of the success of the event and therefore the pleasure of our stay. The rooms were tidy, well-equipped and comfortable. The only problem we had was that our suite did not have a refrigerator which made it difficult to store the babies' milk and dairy foods. So, at 2AM, we called the concierge about the issue and they sent us an icebox filled with ice! Great! The pools were most enjoyable and the kids loved them. The private island that you can charter the ferry to is exceptional and worth spending a few sun-soaked hours at. All in all, you can't go wrong with this place. It's not cheap by any means ($8 for a 1 liter bottle of water!) but if you're prepared for that, you could hardly do better on the shores of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Service Experience”
Reviews.Author: sassygirl40
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was very good but there was a gentleman working in the bellhop service that was exceptional!!! Ruben was such a huge help and so friendly. He truly went above and beyond to help us in anyway he could. After some not so good treatment from the locals Ruben was a true breathe of fresh air. If you go ask for him and ask him to show you a picture of his beautiful grandson! Be advised there is not direct access to the beach from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing beyond my wildest dream”
Reviews.Author: diptimehta34684
Reviews.Content: i had my daughter's wedding in may 2011 at the el conquistador- we had 350 guests that we had for 3 days. The amazing location pales in comparison to the professionalism and courteousness of the staff. the wedding was a traditional indian wedding-the staff was so flexible they let a horse carraige come all the way inside as per indian tradition-they allowed all the indian cooking from scratch and the chefs were most helpful-all the guests said it was the best wedding they had ever been to-thanks to the amazing staff. The guest rooms are incredible with spectacular views-there are not words to describe the experience- bravo!!!!!!! to the best resort in the world dipti mehta- mother of the bride

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in everyway!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph006
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort with exceptional service. Plenty to do every day for old and young alike. The staff is always willing to help. Thank you, The Ranieri's

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: tmurnane
Reviews.Content: My family traveled to Puerto Rico with high expectations. The El Conquistador had come highly recommended--however, the only good experience was the weather and beach. First, upon arrival with two kids in tow and a lot of luggage. The staff watched me struggle to the front desk with no offering to assist. Further, one staff member made my child cry. I would say 90% of hotel staff were rude. The most concerning issue is that I wrote to management of the hotel's parent company Hilton-Robert Allegrini, VP Corporate Communications and he was barely responsive "we will pass it on." I will never stay at a Hilton Resort again because of this experience. They have lost what is important-customer service all around

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: nicunurse2003
Reviews.Content: I had a great experienced and lots of fun when I stayed at the Conquistador in Puerto Rico. The registration was smooth and Tomacita was a great person , friendly, flexible and great customer service. The first room they gave me was in the 2nd floor and my ocean view room was more partial ocean view . Tomacita was great and change my room to the 5th floor without any excuse . My 19 and 17 yrs had a great time and they did not complain they were bored. so many activities , they were always at the pool or the private island . I recommend this place to any family. LOVED IT .

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: clove123_11
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this property for 1 week. Everyone on staff seemed to trip over themselves to serve us. I asked for another iron to be sent to my room, then they called to make sure I received it...now that is service. The views are amazing. Completely recommend this property to anyone and everyone. Great food, great service, great views.

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip for Families”
Reviews.Author: jsj3205
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Conquistador from 5/5 to 5/8. We stayed in the Las Olas section which was good because we had young kids that could swim in the pool with basically no one else around all day and evening. Las Olas needs a lot of work though. The room was fine but the exterior needs to be renovated and they need a restaurant or bar there. There is nothing there so you have to take the funicular up or down to eat or buy drinks. We had kids in our group from ages 3 to 11. They all loved the beach and the water park. And my kids at ages 3 and 5, really really really loved the water park. It did not have a lot of people there and my kids could go on the waterslides over and over again. The beach was also a lot of fun. The kids loved the activities over there and the iguanas most of all. One of the waitresses at the restaurant on the island, Wilma, was spectacular! For restaurants, the stand out was the Stingray Cafe. Yes, it was expensive but the food was very good! All in all, a great trip for our family but until they renovate Las Olas I would not recommend staying there unless you do not mind not having a restaurant and being in an older section of the hotel. You also have to walk up and down the stairs quite a bit so be prepared. There was one elevator not particularly close to the rooms. Personally I would only recommend this hotel to people who were going with family but because I was going with family, maybe I only had an experience that lent itself to family.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT ROMANTIC GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: Utopian-DreamerDC
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I actually stayed here May 2009 for our anniversary but I just realized I never reviewed it so here goes: The resort: First off- the resort itself is absolutely BEAUTIFUL!!! I mean drop dead GORGEOUS! Nestled on the cliffs of Fajardo & the views are spectacular. The room was absolutely gorgeous as well...I loved the bright inviting colors, the furnishings were new & modern, & it was quite spacious. It had a walk-in closet in the bathroom which was a nice surprise. The king bed was so comfy. Nice big balcony with a view of the ocean & a view of the Biobay as well in the distance. At night you can hear the comforting sounds of the Coqui frogs...so relaxing. Palamino Island (the resort's private island): We spent most of our time here. I didn't mind the 10 minute ride over there on the ferry...we actually thought it was quite nice. The food & drinks on the island were a bit overpriced & they will not let you bring a cooler (but we did hide a couple snacks & bottles of water in our beach bag) Palamino Island is AWESOME! I really felt like we did something different every day we went there. The island itself has many different features & a changing coast line so if you walked a little ways you could relax on several different types of beaches. When you first get off the ferry there is a beach with very very soft white sand. The water at this beach is very great for swimming. It is like bathwater & went out as deep as my shoulders. If you walked a little farther was a beach that was great for exploring & finding shells. The sand was still soft here but the water here only went up to my knees. It actually went out for miles like that. I highly suggest SWIM SHOES for this beach and especially for the beaches farther down. The farther down you walk the more interesting it gets as far as finding shells & stuff but it also gets more treacherous. One day we got very adventurous & decided to walk to the hidden beaches on the other side of the island. This walk was exciting & you will see iguanas & other creatures on the way there. You have to be in fairly good physical shape for this because you will hike up a small mountain to get there. Make sure to bring lots of water & wear sneakers because I only had my swim shoes on & a thorn went right through the bottom of them & it hurt so bad. You have to be careful to not hike the horse trail because that will take you in one big circle (we found out the hard way) The secluded beach was peaceful & surprisingly even had a couple lounge chairs there. We were there for about 3 hours & didn't see another person the whole time! I heard this was an unofficial "nude beach" but I wasn't brave enough to do it! ha ha. This beach has lots of great exploring but you have to wear SWIM SHOES because it had LOTS & LOTS of coral & a TON of sea urchins. We even hiked through a bunch of rocks to the left along the coast & found the "hidden" beach. Very rocky but it was really cool. My boyfriend even found a small octopus in between the rocks by the shore. Food: Food at the resort was really good but ridiculously expensive. We already knew it would be because of other reviews so we did this only once just to try it. The best food we had came from 2 local spots that you can walk to if you're feeling adventurous. They are right by the water & in the same spot as the Biobay tours launch spot. You have to walk along the water to the left of the resort. We tried Mofongo (best hangover food ever. haha) at OceanView restaurant & delicious Lobster Tails at Tommys Place. I highly recommend eating at either place. They are small family owned places and the food is authentic, tasty, & reasonably priced. Transportation: You should really rent a car when staying at El Con if you want to explore the rest of the island. We rented one from the airport because Fajardo is about a 45 drive from San Juan plus the resort is really not within walking distance of very many things. I highly recommend going to the El Yunque Rainforest! It was AMAZING! Many beautiful waterfalls & luscious vegetation. It's actually only about a 15-20 minute drive from the resort. My tips for this resort #1 Housekeeping staff is a little "sketchy" so lock up your valuables & make sure you do not leave anything in the room when checking out because you will never see your stuff again. I made the mistake of accidentally leaving some items in the nightstand. When I called to let them know I was coming back for them, the housekeeping staff said they "didn't find anything" which was a bold-faced lie because I know for a fact I left those items & I knew exactly where I had left them too. Of course they didn't "find" the items because one of them was a pre-paid $100 gift card. So someone got a nice little "tip" that day. #2 bring swim shoes because parts of the beach have lots of coral #3 Rent a car #4 Be prepared to spend ALOT of money on food if you're planning on eating at the resort or do what we did- we stopped to get groceries on the way there (drinks, snacks, stuff to make sandwiches) All in all, we had a fabulous vacation & would definitely go back to the El Conquistador!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBlueyz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week. Even though the weather was not great, we had a wonderful time. Best restaurants, pool and private beach. The staff had to be one of the best we've encountered in our many travels. We got an upgrade as soon as we checked in and they even discounted our first nite stay because we didn't arrive until 3 a.m. The hotel was immaculate, the concierge was very helpful with finding fun stuff for us to do. If you have children, there was so much to do for them. I especially liked the funicular which took you down to their marina and on to a ferry which went to their private beach. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “So happlily surprised”
Reviews.Author: FineDining5
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I can't think of anything negative to write! We did stay the week after Easter, so things were quiet. The only little pet peeve was the fact that we had to pay extra for the hotel's water park. That really should have been include. Charge a little more for the room or include it in the hotel's "resort charge". Ok, another pet peeve, but every hotel charges this 14%. As I was sitting by the water park pool, I struck up a conversation with a woman who was from San Juan. She said that El Conquistador was the BEST place on Puerto Rico to take kids. No contest. We simply loved the place, esp the private island, the funicular, the pools, hot tubs, restaurants. As someone who works for a MAJOR AIRLINE and has traveled the world with my kids, age 11, 9 & 7, they chose this as their favorite vacation! We rented a car and were able to go to the rain forest, bio bay (a must) and restaurants off site (La Estacion was the best meal in Puerto Rico). I kept thinking that things reminded me of Disney and then I realized that Disney, in all its fakeness, is trying to be like this. This was the real thing!! Loved, loved, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymooon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trueohioplaya
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The room was great, exactly as it showed on the website. The pools were great and weren;t too crowded at any given time The beach was a great time. One of the grounds keepers cut off the top and gave us a coconut. We mixed that with some rum an it wa pretty good. The drinks were pretty expensive, but you can bring your bag and bring a few drinks from the hotel room with you. There isn't much at the hotel in ways of nightlife. There is a casino and a club, neither of which I was much impressed with. The store on the property was rather expensive but expected. There is a Wal Mart about 5 -10 minutes from the hotel. Beer and liquor can be urchased here. Make sure to buy some of the fresh donuts at the entrance. Those things were AMAZING! There is a decent restaurant about 5 minutes from the hotel. I can't recall the name but if you ask you can find it. Great food and service. There is a little bit of walking involved when going from your room to the lobby or to the spa area. But its vacation, so you should have some time on your hands. Only reason I gave a low review for the location is that there isn't much going on around the hotel. There are some bio bay tours, but its not like you are staying in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “What a WONDERFUL Resort!”
Reviews.Author: ChiChi2011
Reviews.Content: I'm not really sure what hotel some of these reviewers were staying at that didn't like El Conquistador. We just returned from our honeymoon at this resort and we LOVED IT! We rented a car from the airport (already planning to leave the resort for some local fare/activities) and the drive to the resort was about 45 minutes. It was a straight shot, so no problems with getting lost. When we arrived at the resort main gate, the views are just awesome. The road up the hill through the golf course was a sight to see. We did self-parking (which was reasonable $15/day) and took the shuttle up the hill to the resort. Right from the start the service we received was friendly, warm and helpful. Jesus and Camila at the front desk went above and beyond with answering questions and getting us settled in. The two of them couldn't have been more friendly (as were all the other front desk clerks we interacted with during our stay). Our room was in the Las Brisas building with an oceanview that was spectacular. The rooms are very spacious and have mostly everything you need other than a microwave. The restaurants and bars at the hotel can be a bit pricey, but again we anticipated that going in. We're from the New York tri-state area, so pricey is NORMAL for us. We spent a lot of time at Cafe Bella Visa. The flat bread pizzas were terrific and our favorite bartender Tanya makes the best drinks on the island. We made it a point to stop by there daily for drinks and multiple trips on the days that she was working. Palamino Island was a treat, however I wish that we had packed swim shoes, as the coral in the water was a little rough on the feet, but either way we absolutely enjoyed the water and all the activities offered on Palamino. We did make dinner reservations for some of the more upscale restaurants on the property and I must say the food was very good. Not necessarily, 4-Star quality but very good. We did venture out and did some sightseeing on our own. The hiking in El Yuque Rainforest was very nice (pack water). We had dinner at La Estacion one night and the food was TOP NOTCH! I would definately recommend it. If you don't have a car the $10 cab ride is worth every penny. We also ate at Metropol one night and again the food and service was right on point. Overall, I have to say the trip was GREAT. We have already started playing a large group family trip for this resort next year. We can't wait to experience this resort again, this time with all our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Prices for AVERAGE accomodations throughout”
Reviews.Author: Oxide9
Reviews.Content: As a guest of this fine hotel I enjoyed the breathtaking views of the ocean from the pool areas, and harbor restaurants. I honestly don't believe anything else about this hotel is more than average. The Strip House is a very nice steak house, I enjoyed my meal but it was not worth the inflated prices. The concierge/front desk associates are helpful somewhat only when you are paying them a great deal of your money! When you question any strange fees you have incurred things get interesting. I spent a lot of time chin wagging with these people looking for answers to the array of fees that would pop up on my hotel bill. My room was spacious, and adequate for my personal needs. There was nothing special. I seriously don't understand the hype of this resort! If you like to golf, sure it's a nice course. If you enjoy entertaining guest/business clients again maybe.. Please explain to me why it's twice the price of a extended stay motel? Oh, it's the view, and it's located in Puerto Rico.... At this hotel you WILL spend a lot of money on anything you do inside it. You will be paying $20 per day for valet parking, which may be safer than self-parking which I was told can be a disaster. You will certainly have to make laundry arrangements since the only on sight laundry option is to pay the hotel $5 - $10 per item to be laundered. You will be paying a lot of money for small portions of food, and drink. Rooms have a small refrigerator. You will be charged insane prices for using the bottled water and toiletries in your room. Don't purchase anything in the convenience store in the lobby unless you enjoy throwing your money away. A conclusive breakfast can be made a part of your package, which I highly recommend but restrictions may apply... In conclusion I have to urge you to stay at the Fajardo Inn, or some other hotel instead of this one! You must get out and experience the local cuisine and culture as well! Good luck, and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, simple steps could produce vast improvements in certain areas”
Reviews.Author: cbngrl
Reviews.Content: We traveled with a large family group that included elderly folks and small children. Property is well maintained, surrounded by natural beauty. Landscaping well maintained. Excellent grounds, fresh flowers all over (despite drought in area). Gorgeous property. Check-in took over a half hour (peak time appears to be Thursday afternoon?). Ugh! This particular area of the hotel needs work - more staffing? Checkout was same. And why couldn't I check my bill in my room via my tv??? Frustrating. Staff extremely courteous and gracious overall (and acted ethically in one particular incident). Restaurants: decent, but as has been posted here, $$$ (and you expect more at these prices). However, candidly - we could find no restaurant in the general area (off the property) that was decent. Avoid the little places right off Luquillo beach (unless you want to vomit!) Breakfast was included in our package. Ample, fresh buffet, but nothing spectacular (mango was about as exotic as the cuisine got). After the 3rd day, we got a little tired of the same cuisine and just started hitting the Starbucks. We were "upgraded" to a big suite that had one king bed in one area, and a pullout sofa in the next room. Views were spectacular!!! Big bathroom was awesome. However, setup is weird - the 1st room has awful sofabed, no closet, and kitchen doesn't have microwave or fridge. The fridge in 2nd room is way too small. Everything worked well in the room, however (oh, except the tv in one room - no reception, perhaps satellite issue, and AT&T Wifi was sketchy). The kids were never bored, even when it rained. Parrots were great and we loved the cats all over the property :) Pool was clean and well maintained and not overly crowded. The beach: private, so no riff-raff. Loved it! Sand very clean and water was cool and clear. However, agreed you need shoes and many layers of sunblock. Best beach ever! Getting to the beach: yes, it's a hike getting there, but we thought it was fun (at least the kids did... the elderly people in our party hated it). The funicular ride is a ton of fun. Waiting an hour for the ferry - not fun! Why can't they run it every half hour?? The ferry ride itself is fantastic fun. Parking - Self-parking is quite the hike, but sometimes the carts pass by and pick you up for the ride back to the hotel. Valet parking was a waste - had to wait up to 20 minutes! Overall, we had a great time and we'd go back. It's unfortunate it's so $$$ though - the extras really start to add up and there are miscellaneous little problems. But I loved Palomino Island Beach - that was paradise. Hopefully Management trolls these sites and takes heed of suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay...”
Reviews.Author: PackLightly
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time at El Conquistador and were pleased with the location and rooms. The views looking out over the ocean at sunrise are amazing. Palomino island is pure heaven. The beaches are clean and the facilities are well kept. The best location is to walk around the point to find a private cove away from the crowds. We pulled our lounge chairs to the water edge and were in absolute heaven. The ferries leave every 30 minutes so make sure to check timing. The funicular can have a long wait... at one point the line was backed up along the walkway towards the pool. It seems to be the only easy way to get up and down the hillside. There are no pathways to walk down. It can also be loud at night (it runs all night long). We booked 80 minute massages at the Golden Door spa on our second day. The spa is well run and it is worth arriving early to enjoy the full facilities. We rented a car in San Juan and had no trouble finding our way around using the GPS on our cell phones. This made exploring El Yunque, the beaches in Luquillo with the great street food kiosks, and through Ceiba and Farjardo more enjoyable. The parking below was $15 per day. Valet was $20 without having to take the long walk/shuttle bus. Wish we had known this in advance. We booked a standard room in the old section overlooking the pools and were very pleased. The bathroom in our hotel room was huge... with a separate toilet room, closet, plenty of counter and storage space. The bed was comfortable and there was a small fridge- perfect for stashing extra water and cold drinks. Try to eat early. Most of the resort restaurants shut down early... which seemed strange considering many people arrive in the middle of the night on tour buses from the San Juan airport.

Reviews.Title: “SOOOOO RELAXING”
Reviews.Author: lisaNYC911
Reviews.Content: The only reason i didnt give it 5 stars was cause they dont have a Nightlife but i didnt go for that. me and my boyfriend both 26 yrs old couldnt make it to the Hard Rock Cafe in Dom. Rep so we decided on El conquistador. once we got there we made a stop @ the supermarket before heading to the hotel and stocked up on snacks and liqour. the hotel is an hr away from the airport and its a nice ride but be aware that if you want to leave back to san juan you will pay $80 for a cab or get a rental. FYI its a straight road so u wont get lost. to make a long story short, WE LOOOOOVEEDDD IT !!! we had the room with the marina view which was down the cliff. it was a beautiful view but everything was far from us. we had to ride the funicular and elevator everytime we wanted to walk around, eat or go to the big fancy pool, which sometimes i felt to lazy to do but watever. One big dissapointment was The breakfast @ la brisas it look soo good but it tasted like welfare food, barrfffff and its the only restaurant that serves breakfast unless u order room service. we didnt make reservations at any of the restaurants and still got a table in like 5 mins @ the steak and sting ray. we are from new york so those prices were actually good with us. i had a tasty churrasco pre fixed meal for $35, the churrasco couldve been bigger but i didnt eat it all anyways and my boyfriend had a ribeye the total was about $130 something including tip and drinks. i didnt find everything soooo expensive but im from new york so it was reasonable to me ,nothing too crazy. this hotel is great for coupleas and families by 11pm its very quiet, they do have a small club but it was too far frommy room and always empty lolol. the hotel did have lil things here and there to fix but the boat ride to thier beach and my AMAZING VIEW made up for eveything else. i couldnt reccomend a better hotel and im still upset that i left. !!!!!! plus on our last night we took a $10 cab to LA Estacion right outside the hotel, THE FOOD WAS BANGING !!!!!! I HAD THE FISH OF THE DAY A RED SNAPPER (PICTURE HOMER SIMPSONS FACE DROOLING) oooh i forgot to add that my massage lady almost bruised me up and my babe fell asleep during his massage (he didnt appreciate that lol) but the spa jacuzzi was wayyyyyy better then the actual massage, it helped me relax more after that painful massage lolol OOoooh and another thing the bed was soooo comfortable it was softer then clouds!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place was terrible!”
Reviews.Author: mvtraveler4
Reviews.Content: I don't know what you people are thinking, but this place was awful. The food was disgusting. We had the breakfast buffet included in our travel package and wish we hadn't. It was gross. I had peanut butter toast and cereal every day. The other food was inedible. When we first arrived we were put in a garden view/ocean view room in Las Olas. Our room was disgusting. There was a hole in the ceiling, mold stains on the headboard and stains all over the room. We called to complain and were moved to La Marina. This was a "deluxe ocean view room". I wouldn't say deluxe. The view was nice, however, the room wasn't much better than the first room we had. We had dinner at Ballyhoo for convenience on our first night. We paid $8 for a disgusting baked potato - really? The other food was not much better. An okay salad for $12 (no meat). We went to Palamino Island on our first full day at the resort. The beach was hard to walk in because there was so much coral. There were screaming kids everywhere, too. (We were on a girls weekend trip, not that we don't love kids, but we were just hoping for something more relaxing). We left there quickly and hung out at the pool for a little while, which was fine. We left the resort for dinner this night, which was great. We went to Pasion por el Fogon, which I would suggest. This was MUCH better than the food at the hotel. We went to Culebra on our third day and were exhausted when we arrived back home. So, we ate at the Caribe Cafe. This was DISGUSTING. I wouldn't ever eat at a place like this. It was like $15 for a hot dog! Ridiculous. After our horrible experience we checked out 2 nights early and went to La Concha in Condado. This place was AMAZING and exactly what we were looking for. The rooms ended up being less money and were much cleaner and way more beautiful. I would never sent anyone to this hotel. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid El Conquistador at any cost”
Reviews.Author: lovemykidsbrookville
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a very disappointing week at this resort i would like to alert all unsuspecting travelers to stay away at any cost. Apparently Hilton, or Waldorf Astoria have decided to pull the plug on this once mighty attraction as all of the conditions were deplorable. Here are some of the lowlights; Upon visiting the restrooms with my three year daughter for a potty break it took three tries to find a clean stall. The first two were too poor to describe. My wife heard from another guest that someone was cleaning the rest room floor with a lounge towel. A maintenance worker empties a trash receptacle and carries a leaking bag across the entire pool deck with a trail of something i can't describe. We were besieged by local residents celebrating the holiday weekend and could not locate lounge chairs or a place to sunbath. When we informed management we were told that the resort was on "lockdown" and that security was on red alert for unregistered guests. Appaently, local residents are given a special package for the holiday weekend at roughly 50 % of what I paid. Service at the Italian restauranct Piccolla can only be described as insulting. No mention of any specials, no requests for drinks or refills, we needed to ask to have our empty dishes removed and never encountered our server after our order was taken. We rented an Ocean Front Suite with one bedroom and a living area hoping to put the kids in one room and my wife and I in the other. We were given two queen beds in our room and an air mattress for the kids in the other room. To make matters worse, the first three air mattresses had leaks and the hotel had to spring for a new one on the fourth try. After payiing $1,000 per night for my room i was told that there would be $3 charge per person to watch the children's movie at the pool. Having purchased the tickets during the day to avoid a line at night my wife took the kids to catch the beginning of the show. When I caught up I explained to the gate keeper that my wife had my wrist band. I was forced to present two forms of ID prior to being admitted to the water park. Quite degrading. Looking to avoid the line for checking out on my last day I called the front desk to ask for my account. I was placed on hold for ten minutes before being hung up on. Of course when I arrived to check out it took no less than 20 minutes to give me my bill. This property has fallen so far that it would be criminal to send anyone there.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: bostonbeachnut
Reviews.Content: Like many of you, I have been scouring tripadvisor for new reviews on El Conquistador since we booked our vacation in early December. My family of 5 (three children aged 15, 10 and 8) travels fairly often, and are particular about where we stay. Because of the numerous negative reviews, we nearly cancelled our reservations to stay elsewhere. I am certainly glad that we didn't. We chose to rent a car as we were splitting the week between El Conquistador and Old San Juan. We found the drive from the airport to the hotel to be remarkably easy with a GPS (It should be noted however, that we are from Boston, where the drivers are rumored to be some of the most aggressive anywhere). We stayed in the La Brisas wing of the hotel. We had 2 adjoining ocean front rooms, both of which were freshly remodeled, spacious and spotlessly clean. We were located close to the main hotel and pools, however, we were also located above the funicular. I couldn't hear it with our balcony door closed, but it was certainly audible from the balcony. The views were spectacular. Our beds were comfortable, and all of the mechanicals in our rooms were in good working order. We found it helpful to arrive on Palomino Island early in the day (the first boat leaves the Marina at 9) in order to secure seats that would accommodate both the sun and shade lovers in our family. The beach was raked each morning and there were plenty of chairs. We brought some inflatable floats and our own snorkeling equipment, although these items could have been rented on site. We found the snorkeling to be just ok. The restaurant on the island was efficient, and the food was on par with any beach type restaurant. Bathrooms even on the island, were quite clean. Our favorite restaurant was Stingray Cafe. The food/service was outstanding. We also ate at the Strip House...very well prepared dishes and impeccable service. We ate at the hibachi tables at Blossoms, which was probably our least favorite, but the food was still quite good. The staff at Drake's Martini Bar were fun and the Mojitos were fantastic there. We went to Starbucks and brought stuff back to the rooms for breakfast to save time. Again, it would be advised to get there early, as the line can be extremely long. We used the water park twice. If you go after 1:00 it is 1/2 price. If you go during the last hour of the day, I was told the price was $5 per person. All three of my children enjoyed it there, although only the 10 and 8 year old chose to go back for the second day. The pools were warm and inviting. We enjoyed a few of the movies that they offered during the evenings as well. We felt that our interactions with all of the staff members, including the front desk, maids, waitstaff, funicular operators were pleasant, and they certainly went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating. One of the managers at the Strip House noticed that I had to give my sweater to my daughter (it's really cold in there) and she was thoughtful enough to lend me hers while I ate dinner. I would agree with the other reviewers who mentioned the lack of activity/entertainment in the hotel during the evening hours, although I'll admit, we were pretty wiped out from the beach/pool activities during the day, so heading back to the room by 10 was not an issue for our family. I typically don't like to visit the same place twice (so much to see...so little time), but I would make an exception with this property. We were quite sad to leave. My youngest child even remarked that he liked it much better than Disney World! I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Many compliments but their marina restaurant should be shut down!”
Reviews.Author: MTMB
Reviews.Content: This really is a lovely resort. We stayed in ocean front rooms with marina views of the harbor that were perfect for what we were looking for. The rooms were clean and quite comfortable. There is a ferry that runs quite frequently that brings guests over to the resort's Palomino Island which is great; beach chairs are set up on a lovely sandy beach with inviting blue ocean to swim in. There is a basketball court on the beach that my children enjoyed. There is also horseback riding on the beach which is great fun. My teenagers were delighted with the resort's water park which is close to the marina and has slides that even challenge teens, so that was also great. They do charge extra to use it. The resort is huge to say the least. The real downfall was the food. Really poor quality right across the board and we tried numerous restaurants on the grounds. The worse experience was the restaurant that jets out in an oval on the marina. After eating a few bites of a hamburger, my son thought that the meat was bad and guess what - It was. He was up ill all night and well in to the next day with nausea and horrific stomach cramps. I told the manager at this restaurant the next afternoon who clearly had apathy for my report. I explained to him that I was not looking for a refund and that I just didn't want to see someone else get ill. He told me that he would let someone know which I doubted. I found his reception really disturbing. I should have contacted the head restaurants director but didn't think of it at the time- Overall we enjoyed Puerto rico, but tended to have great difficulty with the dining experiences right across the board- If we were to return, I would really research the dining options and see what postings are showing positive reviews prior to choosing restaurants to dine at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: nj_family1998
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Conquistador for this years spring break. We have two children 8 and 10. We booked the package with Coqui Water Park and Breakfast each day. If your kids love the water slides it is better to have this included. The scenery from this hotal is gorgeous. Upon check in we were given a room in Las Olas Village. The room is very nicely renovated and the view was excellent. However we were next to where the funicular stop. After a few night my husband requested a new room. The hotel was more than accomodating and moved us to an ocean view room in the La Vista Wing. This room was also renovated and had a great view. This resort is quite large and built on the side of a mountain. The water park and ferry to Palomino Island are at the bottom of the mountain. The restaurants, most shopping, casino are at the top of the mountain. You are frequently on the funicular up and down. It is a big resort to navigate. You got to Palomino Island via the ferry. The island was clean. You need to get there early if you want seats with an umbrella. If your family prefers the beach you may find the daily trip annoying over time. And once you get to the island you are there for the day. They have plenty of activities and lunch was nice. During our stay we dined at La Piccola Fontana, Strip House, Stingray Cafe' and Blossoms. For a family of four those dinner were $200 give or take. Our favorites were La Piccola Fontana and Strip House. With an entree, app, drink and a shared dessert dinner ran approx. $200. The other nights we ate casual at Cafe Bella Vista and Cafe Caribe for under $100. Be prepared for this expense. The kids also loved to get ice cream at Cafe Caribe. The line would get long since this was the only place open at night. They could use a frozen yogurt machine. We also did zip lining at rainforestzipline.com. This was at the base of the rain forest and an excellent activity for a family. It was beginner zip lining, you weren't jumping over the edge of a water fall. Rather from platforms built in the trees. My husband and 10 year old also did the bio bay tour. They kayaked and had a great time. The water park was perfect for our kids. There are 3 slides and a lazy river. The area is small so the kids can run around. They have an outdoor restaurant where you can also get lunch. Since it was spring break most nights they showed movies at the main pool and had night swimming. Other than the casino there wasn't any night life. There was no live music and most of the stores closed at 7 pm. Since the resort is far from San Juan you don't have much to do at night. It gave me the feeling of an all inclusive but they forgot the night time entertainment. Also since this hotel was at capacity I have no idea why they closed the few stores they had. In all we had a very nice time. I could be convinced to return with friends but not sure I would choose this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply an Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Middlet0wn
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review to rebut some statements made on the April 16th review about this resort. I was there with my partner on the same company incentive trip that the author was, and have a different view of the resort. -Resort is NOT filthy. I think the staff and maintenance crew does a fair job of keeping the place up given the size of it. -Sheets were changed everyday, not every 3 days as stated. There were bathrobes in our closet within the bathroom. There were some stains on the tub, but not a vacation breaker. Bathroom and room was always kept nice. They came in twice per day; once in the morning and in the early evening to turn down the beds with chocolates! Towels were even changed out 2 times per day! Our maid was just fantastic. She did not touch our clothing or throw it in a bag. -Service was simply AWESOME. I have no complaints as everyone from Maids to Bellboys were courteous and polite. One minor complaint I do have is that the concierge seemed a bit clueless on some things and gave false information. Room service from "Armando" was top notch and friendly. Food was delivered within 30 minutes, not two hours. -Didn't watch any TV or DVD's. I mean, you are in Paradise for a week! You don't come here to watch television! -The ferry ride is not a big deal. It's a nice, smooth ride. The beach area is very clean and not dirty as another author claimed. Plenty of places to sit, but you must get there early if you want a shady spot; they seem to fill up fast and the Puerto Rican sun is STRONG! I highly recommend SPF 30 or higher if you burn easily. Also, reapply sunscreen every HOUR and AFTER you get out of the water. Wear flip-flips in the water; there is a lot of dead coral and it is very sharp. There are some areas you can step in bare footed without worry, but I highly recommend the use of flip-flips or water shoes. -About the food and prices. Yes, it is a bit steep, but you are at a resort and not Denny's. To complain about a $14 margarita served in a plastic cup is a bit ridiculous. There is a major safety reason for this. At the pool areas, you wouldn't want someone to drop a glass and have the shards end up in someone's foot! As it was, someone dropped a beer bottle in one pool and that pool had to be evacuated and cleaned. -I strongly urge everyone to make use of the IN ROOM SAFES! There was an instance of a camera theft in one person's room and the resort takes no responsibility for theft of valuables. The bottom line is, lock it up if you would mind it disappearing! There is dishonesty everywhere you go. -Our room was on the La Marina end and the view was spectacular! If you can afford to, I highly recommend those rooms and they do have a balcony with a small table and two chairs. It was sad to leave, and I would definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Not For Children”
Reviews.Author: gobears88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many different caribbean islands with our children and would not recommend this to families with children. There is not enough for children to do there and the real problem is it is not beach front property. The island is a boat ride away and could of been kept alot cleaner. I am used to staying on beach property that is raked daily. Be prepared to pay alot for everthing food was very good but very expensive . The water park was nice but small and not something kids would do on a daily basis. Explore other options check resort chains that cater to families with small children to teens. I recommend Turks and Jamaica where all food and activities are included. As I sum up this resort I would say the service was excellant staff always friendly. The resort is very dated and certain areas really show it especially the rooms and hallways. The food was wonderful but very overpriced. I think this property is just too big to keep up with every detail it's price reflects.

Reviews.Title: “I need to go back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: snsmith46
Reviews.Content: My husband and my two children, ages 8 and 13 just returned from El Conquistador. To be honest I was very skeptical when booking because of the negative reviews. So, I went there prepared for terrible service. The reviews I read about the staff being unfriendly and the rooms being dirty could not have been farther from the truth. Honestly, everyone always greeted me and had a smile. The most friendliest of all was Mr. Ortiz...he made sure everyone was greeted and safely on the fennicular. He always recognized my boys. My kids absolutely enjoyed the water park (60 feet slide was the favorite...for them, not me). The beds were very cozy and comfortable, sheets always clean, always had fresh towels. Yes, the food was expensive but isn't that what you expect at a resort? Research and financial planning is the key to enjoying yourself here at El Conquistador. The only things I would like to see added to this resort is nightly entertainment (shows, a real nightclub). I wish they also had a Spanish restaurant on the premise with authentic Puerto Rican dishes. I will definitely return, probably in a year or two...I want to give them time to fulfull all my wishes! Bottom line...judge for yourself. Don't go there close minded because of what you have read. Everyone has different expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views surround you”
Reviews.Author: LoveTaxidia
Reviews.Content: The best part of this property is certainly the sweeping ocean views that the cliff-top setting provide. I would recommend paying the premium for an oceanfront or oceanview room as they are fantastic. We spent lots of time in the morning and evenings having coffee or a cocktail and really enjoyed the view and ocean breeze. While this was a romantic trip for us, this resort is very family-friendly with lots of kids activiites, pools, evening movies pool-side, and the water park. Kids (and adults!) will also enjoy the funicular ride to the marina and the catamarn ride to the beach on the private Palomino Island. The beach on the island is fantastic. Gorgeous water and plenty of space on the beach to relax. I would recommend you skip the pools and spend your entire time on the island which feels like a slice of paradise. The food on the resort was good but not great for the prices charged. The best bargain for the price on the property is the burger at the steakhouse. If you are cost conscious I would definitely recommend stocking up on snacks, sodas and water off the resort. There are a few local places for food that are a short walk from the marina which were very good and reasonably priced for very fresh fish. This resort's setting can't be beat - but a rental car is a must for at least one day to explore the rain forest or Old San Juan. Carla at the Enterprise desk on the property was amazing and extremely helpful - offering us rides to the ferry (to Culebra - which is also a must-do) and back. Diana and the rest of the guys at the beach bar were fantastic and lots of fun. Generally speaking the service was excellent on the resort - we were constantly greeted and warmly welcomed. The one exception was at the check-in desk which actually tried to convince us that we would not be allowed to carry anything on to the island that we couldn't carry in our hands and that we should apply sunscreen before we left - and of course anything we needed during the day could be bought at the island shop. Complete nonsense of course, you can bring anything you like with you on the catamaran to the island, but definitely left a bad taste in our mouth. The rooms were recently renovated and very clean, with low-profile furniture to not obstruct the views. The only odd aspect of the rooms were that the closets are in the bathroom. Overall this was a wonderful resort with such a unique location! If you prefer early morning or late night strolls on the beach - you won't have access as the catamarans don't run all day - but this was not a problem for us and the island is well worth the inconvenience. Enjoy your stay, the beach and the views!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great”
Reviews.Author: bjk1025
Reviews.Content: My company treated me and my wife to 4 days in St. Thomas, after which we took the short flight to Puerto Rico to stay at this resort. Let me first say that as an avid business traveler I was able to get the room for free, so maybe that does help with my review, but this resort was awesome. This place has it all in my eyes. 4 different pools to choose from, and 4 hot tubs as well. During our stay they said they were busy, but at no point did we think it was even crowded. The private beach was sensational. Sure you have to take a boat over there, but once you get their you won't want to leave. It is great. So many activities to do. They have all of your basic beach things, jet ski's, kayaks, wind surfing. They can all be rented. But what I was impressed with was the other things on this island. you get beach chairs for no charge, and they have hiking, soccer, baskeball, croquet, mini-golf, pretty much everything you would want to keep your kids entertained. And the water was just perfect. Very small waves, meaning you can keep your children out there without the worry of the current or undertoe. It was like a huge infinity pool. We didn't use the water park, but it looked really cool. The food onsite was good. I have read a lot about high prices, but the prices were slightly less than what we paid in St. Thomas and was just as good if not better. I understand people complaining about the prices, but I am not sure what people expect. Remember, you are going to one of the top luxury resorts in the caribbean, you have to pay a premium for some things. To get away from the resort food, you can take a short 5-10 minute walk down a side road to a little area where they start the bio-bay tours. Take the kayak tour if possible. And their are quite a few restaurants down there as well. We went with just myself and my wife, but are already making plans to take our 3 children, ages 5, 3, and 11 months. This place has everything you need at a resort. I found it absolutely perfect for a trip with just my wife, but think it will be the perfect vacation with my children. Lastly, the room we had was great. We stayed at La Marina, and it was a very nice modern room. I can't speak for the other rooms. I have no idea if you can respond or if you can ask questions, but if you have any please feel free to reach out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good room, high price”
Reviews.Author: Jeff94114
Reviews.Content: The resort was much much better than reviews here led me to believe. Beautiful setting, gardens, beach, etc.. Food was not so great but the breakfast buffet was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Now I know why the reviews were so mixed!!”
Reviews.Author: RIley55
Reviews.Content: I reconfirmed my two connecting rooms two days before the trip only to arrive and find out they were not available. It took more than 30 min at check in to straighten that out. No apology and we get the farthest rooms from any activity. We found either hotel employees were friendly and professional or took forever to get anything done and seemed not to care. At the bar you would either get your drink right away or wait 30 min. The beach is not located at the hotel but on a nearby island It is a=a hike -- our rooms were at the far end of the resort so a 15 min walk, elevator ride down the hill to the funicular then a ferry ride so don't forget anything or it is a hike back! THe last night we ordered room service for the kids and went to La Piccola Fontana restaurant at the resort -- we waited 30 min and could not order. I called the waiter over and he said we have to wait to order with the captain Desiree. I said we have children waiting could she please come over we waited a total of 45 min and she never came. We had already ordered our wine so had to wait for the check another ten minutes and then went back and ordered room service which was quite good and served from professionally. Strip House restaurant was very good great food and service. Bio Bay was fun. Not worth the money! Very uneven service.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Bongo1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El Conquistador for a conference (also held in the resort). The staff were all professional and courteous. Upon entering the room, you can tell the facility is old. While the hotel attempted renovations, they did not complete every aspect of the room (specifically, the bathrooms). The tile around the tub was quite old and poorly cleaned (the grout between the tiles was mostly black). The tub itself was old and you could see where work had been done to fix the tub (poor job fixing the fiberglass). The furniture was also quite old in that it was stained throughout and had quite a few 'dents' in the vinyl covering. So much that it was uncomfortable to sit in. Upon pulling back the blanket for the bed, the sheets were stained (could not tell if they were old or if the sheets simply had not been changed). I requested the staff change the sheets (I could tolerate the other aspects of the room; especially since it was primarily just that the building was old -- e.g. the other rooms were probably the same quality). The staff was receptive and made no issues about changing the sheets. The food was okay. I would not be willing to pay the prices of the food back in the continental U.S. I eat regularly at Ruth's Chris and the like and do not mind paying high prices as long as the food is equivalent to the cost(s). Had the cost(s) associated with the hotel not been as high, I would have been okay with the issues (understanding that you get what you pay for). However, with the association of the Waldorf name with the El Conquistador I presumed the quality of the hotel would be far superior. I would not bring my family to the hotel unless it got an incredible face lift...

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: Michail99
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-day stay. I had read previous reviews about EC and thought I was prepared for the negatives I had read. First off, according to previous reviews, staying away from the older section (Las Olas) was on my mind. At check-in, guess where we were given a room? Yes, Las Olas. When I expressed my doubts about staying there I was told "if it isn't up to your expectations, we will move you." So, off we went. The first room we were given had just been painted, and I mean just. The smell of paint was so incredibly strong I could smell it from the hallway. I have asthma and cannot be around paint fumes. We were immediately given another room, ocean view, which was absolutely beautiful. The only drawback to this room was it was right next to the funicular, which runs ALL NIGHT LONG. SO, if you go, ask for an ocean view room FAR AWAY from the funicular. Other than that, Las Olas was great. We were right above the pool and hot tub which were practically deserted most of the time. Now for the food. The breakfast buffet is expensive, $19, but it's ALL you can eat, which includes beverages, so it's cheaper than the al a carte menu. We had anticipated the expense, so we brought our own breakfast food. We ate dinner there once, incredibly OVERPRICED. It was over $80 just for 2 very blah meals. I really wanted a pina colada but they charge $10 for one. Didn't want one that badly! (Had one locally the next night for $4.) So, go local for your meals.....and rent a car. Every single tour is twice what you can pay on your own. We went to the island once and we thought it was very nice. shops overpriced, too, but that is typical for resort shops. Wait until you go to San Juan and buy your souveniers. They charge $15 a day for "self-parking." There is no choice in this other than valet which I think was $25 a day. Would we go back? Yes. My son said "this is not a hotel, it's a park!" The views are beautiful. A must see and do is the Bio Bay experience, but you can save over half $ by booking directly with the company instead of going with a tour from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Family Vacation for both Children and Parents!”
Reviews.Author: berg4Nyc
Reviews.Content: The property, staff and service were all incredible. The Manager Manny Melendez is very attentive to his guests, trouble-shooting if any issues come up. This year we traveled with another family and he and the Reservations Supervisor, Giavanni, were both extremely helpful in making sure we got adjoining rooms that were near all of the amenities we were looking for.The children had lots of fun activities to do with the water-park, snorkeling at the beach and tennis lessons. The adults had a great time and the resort feels adult-friendly too. We just wish we had more time. No need to leave the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: virgo083171
Reviews.Content: Food was WAY over priced!!! The "private island" is not "private" locals are allowed on the beach.......and bring their own beverages (guests are not allowed to bring food or drinks onto the island unless they were purchased at the resort). Was told at check in that there would be a temp charge of 150.00 on my credit card. When I got home i noticed that they put a temp charge of 150.00 PER NIGHT. Called the hotel once I was home and even spoke with a manager.......didnt get anywhere. Refused to call my credit card company to have the hold released. Also told him that I thought the whole "private island of Palomino was false advertisment. He said that the water isnt private that anyone can go in it but as far as the beach itself no one but guests of the hotel are allowed on. I advised him that while we were at the beach we saw SEVERAL boats pull up and people jump off and come on to the island. He told me he would send security out to check it out??? I said uh I"M HOME already. Anyway you are better off staying in a hotel that is closer to San Juan so you don't have to pay for the over priced food.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning But Expensive”
Reviews.Author: hockeygypsy
Reviews.Content: This is just an incredible place. The location is completely stunning and the service was amazing. Our room was very clean and the beds were oh so soft. However, be sure to bring your savings because this place will cost you a pretty penny. The food is overpriced although very good. It is very easy to run up a big tab without even blinking. This was probably a once in a lifetime deal for us so well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great vacation at El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel633
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a one BR casita and had a great time. The unit was spacious and lovely. It also had kitchen amenities and a separate bedroom and the bathroom was designed to be able to access just one sink and toilet which helped when getting ready. The hotel staff, especially Joey, was very helpful and friendly. We were traveling with our kids, ages 9 and 13. They loved the "dive-in" movies and water park. We also enjoyed the pools at the resort and the beach at Palomino Island. The resort is massive so take a close look at the options of rooms and locations when making a desicion on where to stay. We liked being in the set of casitas that was closest to main hotel building, although it was a bit of a hassle getting to Palomino as you had to take an elevator and then funicular and then ferry. We liked proximity to Rain Forest too. The food was good, but not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with gorgeous views lacking nite life...”
Reviews.Author: WannabeeTraveler25
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical when I read the reviews on Trip Advisor but I was pleasantly surprised when we saw how beautiful it really was... I must say it was a little worn but it is on the ocean and like most properties on the water it does take a beating. It was being repaired all the while we where there but let's face it with such an enormous resort it's a constant, full time, year round job. And they were right on it... The one major complaint and probably the only reason I wouldn't go back is there was no nite life or entertainment. I mean none.... Don't get me wrong we golfed, we did lots of swimming and went over to relax on the island and had great meals in the restaurants (very pricey but we did get the meal plan and it's a good thing because we probably would have ended up eating pizza's a lot... ) but it would have been a real vacation to see a guy playing a guitar by one of the pool bars or a DJ to play some dancing music or even a Karaoke nite or talent show, some kind of show after you ate there was nothing to do... We were entertained one night by an 11 yr old playing a piano in the lobby who was excellent (Thank You Nicolette!) who drew quite an audience but you mean to tell me they couldn't get any singers, band anything?? Most of the people we met also agreed, and the problem is the property is kind of off by itself so to drive out at nite and have a drink and then find your way back might be tricky. We did rent a car from Enterprise and it was the best thing we did because we did go golfing off property and to the Rain Forest and did the Walmart thing for cups, soda, mixers for our drinks and snacks and stopped and bought a bottle of rum. It was only $75.00 more than a round trip shuttle back and forth to the Airport and it was very easy to find our way, we did bring a GPS but really didn't need it... Okay we did have a few exceptional staff members that made our stay even better and I must mention them... In the Stinray Restaurant Gian and Eddie were the guys to see I believe they were brothers. Darlyn the Hostess in Blossoms was a sweetheart and in the Las Brisas most were very pleasant but one who went above and beyond was Yarmimar Ramos... Also in the steak house Victor Diana was the man who did it with class.. Employees like that can make or break the whole trip and they made it...

Reviews.Title: “Awful with a capital "F".....”
Reviews.Author: Totallynorton
Reviews.Content: Forgive my brevity, but I'm using an iPad......The location is beautiful but the food is awful and so incredibly overpriced that it's shocking!!! I'm a HHonors elite member but was given a room with a view of the tennis courts....aka, opposite the ocean. The resort charges for just about everything short of breathing their air.....

Reviews.Title: “Great trip and good resort.”
Reviews.Author: 5chi
Reviews.Content: This is a big facility with plenty to do. Great change of pace between private beach, many pools and water park. Rooms are above average and clean - For the most part a very nice staff. Couple of minor issues, but front desk manager was very accommodating. Great restaurants very close to hotel - hotel spa was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing in Paradise is lost here.”
Reviews.Author: Egcondon
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully trained staff here at Palomina Island. Hats off to Ivan Gines and his team for dealing with a guest who apparently doesn't know how to behave back in the real world let alone on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “less than expected”
Reviews.Author: mcmski
Reviews.Content: While upon entering the hotel we were impressed with the sheer magnitude, that same largeness is its downfall. The front desk staff is unable to address the huge amount of guests and requests. There might as well not even be a concierge because it is impossible to get in touch with whoever that might be. The hotel is nice and clean. However, the prices are out of this world. For lunch one day, 2 of my kids and I ordered 2 sandwiches at the deli to go with no drinks and it was 35$. I have no problem paying for good food, but come on that is a bit much for 2 deli sandwiches. The funicular (tram that travels up and down the hillside) is quite loud if your room is on that same side. Ours was and even though I complained repeatedly, to a largely uncaring staff, the issue was never addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cplot
Reviews.Content: Recently my partner and I spent 5 days at this resort with AutoOwners Insurance and we had an amazing time. The resort is gorgeous! The ocean view from the room was breath taking, great size room. The restaurants within the resort were fabulous. The breakfast buffet at the Las Brias Restaurant was yummy. The staff was very friendly, and accomadating! Palamino Island was beautiful! We had a terrific trip. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Don't let bad reviews turn you away”
Reviews.Author: ML742
Reviews.Content: Over the past 10 years, I have been to the El Conquistador Resort 6 times. I have seen many changes, some for the better, and some for the worse. In late February of this year I went with my family for our sixth time. Overall we had a fantastic trip, however I was a little worried after reading some pretty bad reviews, but it was amazing, as I still knew it would be. The resort is huge - so expect a lot of walking. The grounds are absolutely breathtaking. It is located on top of a 300-ft cliff on the NE corner of Puerto Rico - which is a truly amazing location. The resort offers so much to do, such as jet-skiing, kayaking, scuba diving, snorkeling, the Coqui water park, sunset cruizes, and so much more. I was here for 6 full days, however this time I did not do very many activities, except for relaxing on the shores of the beautiful and secluded Palomino island which is a short 10-15 minute ride from the resort. My job is so stressful at times, and I often imagine myself sitting on a beach much like this one. My family and I needed to get away, and what an amazing place to go. The rooms are spacious and spotlessly clean and all have breathtaking views. Like others have said, yes, the food is ridiculusly expensive and not of amazing quality, but you are at a world-class Waldorf-Astoria resort in a very remote location. What do you expect? Service is great as long as you show a little respect to the employees...but remember: you are on vacation. Relax. Try to be more patient if it takes a few minutes (or hours, depending on what you are waiting for) longer than expected.
