Also, although it may seem annoying to have to walk, take elevators, or the Funiculars, the views make the walks worth it as they are spectacular. The Golden Door Spa on location is a great deal for five days if you like to work out, like me. They have a huge workout center, fitness classes you can take, and a great shower/steam room/hot tub floor. Well worth $100 for five days. Overall the resort is beautiful, the rooms fantastic, service great, food and prices average, island breathtaking, activities well worth it, and so much more. The resort is starting to get older, and although very well kept you can still see signs of aging. Five tips: 1. Try not to stay in Las Olas village- this is where the most signs of aging are (ex. mold, algae, severely peeling paint, and at one part the concrete was actually crumbling). Also only one Funicular stops here which is very invonvenient. I would recommend either Las Brisas or La Vista wings, as Las Brisas being my number one choice. 2. No matter what you do, DO NOT ask for an air bed. Long story short, we had a total of 4 different ones in 3 days- 2 had holes, one was absolutely disgusting and moldy, and the fourth was decent. When we had asked housekeeping to come back and blow up the first 2 air mattresses, they would take the old ones and bring another. The moldy bed was green and crusty, and I am not exaggerating. After having 2 beds that clearly didnt work, I had asked the front desk for a "brand new bed out of the box," and by looking at this "pile of mold," it was clearly in a very, very old box. Someone could get really sick from mold. Please save yourself the hassle and don't even bother. If you are that desperate, sleep on the floor. It is probably cleaner. Despite the moldy bed, I did receive a compensation. 3. Make sure to make your own transportation reservations to and from the resort before arriving. A resort shuttle is provided, however I have used it before and would stay away from it. Also, double-check the night before your flight that your driver will be READY TO LEAVE, as ours wasn't for 50 minutes. The lady in charge of private transportation to and from the resort kept telling me that our driver would be there in 10 minutes, but we waited there for 50. She also called me "muy impaciente," which in spanish means, "very impatient." I guess she didn't realize that I speak pretty fluent spanish. I also recieved compensation for this, due to her complete rued personality and the fact that our driver was on his iPhone the whole time, so he stopped short more than twice. 4. If you made dinner reservations, make sure to call and re-confirm them. One night we called and the person who ansewered the phone wrote down the wrong day. Very frustrating when they say you don't have a reservation but you made one. 5. Finally, RELAX. You are at one of the most beautiful and breathtaking places in the United States and possibly even the world. Be patient, because you have no worries. With these five tips, you will hopefully have an amazing and very relaxing stay at the El Conquistador Resort, like I have had 6 times in the past 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Rebgel10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 days at the El Conquistador. We went for my daughter's 13th birthday present. We had a ocean view room which was very comfortable with 2 queen size beds. The view was amaxing. We took the meal plan which I think works out well. Otherwise the prices are very high. The breakfast buffet was quite nice with something for everyone. The choices for dinner are ok but I think there should be a few more choices. Blossoms the chinese place was not very good. We ate at the hibaci table (like Benny Hanas). It was not very good & you are in & out in 45 minutes. The Stingray fish place is very good. The best place is the Strip House. The food there is delicious & service is great. The Italian place is just ok & the service was terrible. There are casual dining spots but we only had lunch there 2 times because we are so full from the late breakfast We loved going to Palamino Island. The beach is picture perfect. My daughter & husband went snorkling & had a great time. There are many things to do during the day. We did not leave the resort as we just wanted to relax. I would say that this resort is great for families with young kids & also for large groups. We loved the water park but found going one afternoon is enough although young kddies would love it everyday! After dinner there is not much to do. The casino is small but ok. There is a disco but no one is ever in there so I call it the ghost disco! At 7pm they show a movie at the pool for kids, which I thought was really nice. But if you have teenagers, then there is very little to do. So all in all we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great time perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SGregg1527
Reviews.Content: We loved the resort. I had read other reviews about poor service and non-working elevators. I can say none of that was true. The room was clean, the service was great and restaurants were fantastic. Yes they are expensive but you are at a resort and you pay resort prices. You can go off site if you would like to find cheap eats if you like. The boat to their island was on time and the beach on Palamino was very nice too. We had a message at the Golden Door Spa at the hotel. It was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away from it all"”
Reviews.Author: romi522
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Puerto Rico specifically with a restful vacation in mind, and all in all that is what we found at this property. Checking in at the desk always sets the tone for my stay, and Patricia was a wonderful ambassador for this resort. Found the staff on the whole to be very well trained and professional. We had a beautiful cliff top- ocean view room in the Las Brisas wing. An extremely critical person who carries a supply of cleaning products, I found this room well appointed, clean and comfortable. The balcony with a view overlooking the sunrise in the morning was gorgeous. It was exactly where I was picturing myself the entire stormy New England winter long. I could not find much to complain about. Room was cleaned well every day, and all requests for things they might have missed, responded to immediately. The location is perfect for a couples retreat, or a family getaway- but I would not recommend if you are looking for any kind of nightlife! Nothing to do here at night. Casino opens at 4pm- we are not casino people. Some cute little shops- loved the Conversation Piece for souveniers. I was so grateful to have rented a car (rent from Enterprise to save yourself the parking fee-) as I would have felt somewhat isolated otherwise. Driving was easy, (bring your navigation device for sure) and afforded us trips to the local shopping areas, and most importantly to dining choices off the property. The food here is just average- this is an area where they could really improve. Most notably the Strip House was a huge dissapointment. After waiting ten minutes just to be greeted by a hostess for an 8pm reservation, we found the meal boring and the service extremely rude. Go elsewhere- much better options for dinner a short drive away. Palomino island is a beautiful concept- the privacy factor here easy to find if you choose- or take part in the many activities they offer. All the grounds are gorgeous and very well maintained. This was our first time in PR and would certainly stay here again. As others have mentioned there is nothing economical about this property. You will pay well for everything. Having spent the first weekend of our trip at the busy Conrad in San Juan, this just better suited our desire for a few lazy, picure perfect days of pure relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “My 6 night stay in a hotel not meant for individual guests...groups are preferred”
Reviews.Author: ronrica
Reviews.Content: I have been to PR about 5 times and have mainly stayed in San Juan. This time I thought I would try something different. This resort is a good hour from San Juan airport. It has presence when you first arrive, but as I found during my stay, it is over rated. The focus is not on the individual but rather on groups (conferences, weddings, meetings. etc.) During our 7 day stay there was absolutely no entertainment or activities for us (unless you count the pathetic "clown" dog and bird show for $5...NO Thanks!). No cocktail hour, no tea/coffee break, no water bottles, nothing. They charge you for everything (water bottles are over $4, a 14% fee is added to your room rate, room tax + + ,...for Internet and fitness room even if you don't use them.) Why charge an extra 14% for something that I may use once or twice? I am a frequent business and leisure traveler and this hotel really knows how to rack up your bill with extra charges, very unwelcoming. Service: The only thing that makes this resort worth coming back to is the incredible staff that work there. Mostly local hires (which is great) the latin love is truly felt by guests. Our breakfast was something we looked forward to just to interact with our servers - to name a few of our favorites: Pirun (your smile is pure sunshine and you always made us feel happy), Emmanuel (what a gentleman), Israel (such a hard worker with precision), Yarimar (a sweetheart), Celines (you made my Mom feel special), Bryan (thanks for your help with the eggs), Stacey (our cheerful hostess), ...and the young men in the back kitchen who were always smiling and courteous. The Beach: There is no beach on the island - you have to take a shuttle boat to Palomino Island and you have to take a tram to get to the marina to hop on the boat. The island is nice but after a few days it gets old. There are no waves on the beach so it probably suits families with kids so they feel safe they won't get lost in the waves. Drinks are pricey ($10 for small pina colada) and a bit watered down. You have to pay extra for a real drink. The women at the bar are not very friendly (esp the skinny long haired "blonde" bar maid behind the counter - no personality) but the men were always helpful. Ivan and Michael opened a coconut for my Mom and made her day! Thanks guys!! Restaurants: The buffet breakfast was very good and reasonable. On site restaurants are all over priced. The chinese restaurant was just ok. The Cafe didn't look exciting. The best place surprisingly was the Seafood resto, Stingray, down by the marina. They had a very good seafood soup and salmon dish which I was told was wild caught. If you go past the gates by the marina and walk about 10 mins into town you will find a few local places to eat. We ate at Ocean View and Blue Bahia. Both were not bad and reasonable. The yuca mofogo at Ocean View was terrific. Tommy's Place was always deserted and a 'mans' hangout, so we never ate there. The hotel will discourage you from going into town (of course they want you to eat at their restos) but is certainly worth the walk if you want real puerto rican food. We went for walks as late as 10PM with no problem. Activities: None that were available. I inquired about yoga classes and was told the spa manages that but they charge ($10) a class and only have one if they fill their quota. I nixed that idea right away - wasn't worth my wait or time. Ambiance: I felt like an outsider since most guests were with groups. Sitting at a dinner table for 2 seemed odd when the majority of the tables were with 8-10 people or more and very, very noisy. They should have a section for guests that are not part of groups to avoid the loud inebriated groups. Bars: We only tried the bar outside on the lobby level. Fernando and Maricel were very friendly and funny to chat with. Great pair for a bar! I had a very good pina colada there. Pools: Looked nice - didn't bother to go in them, I am totally a beach person. Again, it seemed they were surrounded by the groups that were there. Spa: I went for the Back/neck therapy massage which was very good. The jacuzzi was great with the powerful jets and the steam room was not bad. My mom had a facial and enjoyed it. I didn't appreciate the automatic 20% service fee on top of the rate which is paid as soon as you step foot in the front door. So you pay for your spa treatment and gratuity before you even get started. Strange..... What if I want to give a really nice tip - then they are out of luck. Bad move. The spa hostess (Sonia?) was very, very personable, gracious and friendly Room: Our double bed partial-view room was ok - nothing special. Many ants in the room so I tried to keep it on the cool side but that didn't seem to do much. There is a two cup coffee pot - no tea kettle as I was told by phone. I had to ask 3 times in 3 days to give us a coffe pot maker (instead of the two cup one) so I could boil water for tea. There is an ironing board and iron in the closet with a hair dryer. Two bottles of water are on the counter but they are not gratis. You will pay for them if you choose to drink from them. The mini fridge is barely chilled. It doesn't really serve a purpose. The beds were comfortable and the alarm clock w/iPod connection is neat. There is also a DVD player. The view was somewhat golf/road/barely beach...nothing to stare at for more than a minute. We didn't rent a car but if you do, the parking is $15 a day. If you take a cab it is at least $15-20 to go 1 or 5 mins. It's a racket they have going in Fajardo with the hotels. Really a shame that they charge this amount for a 2 min ride to a restaurant. With a tip it can be $40-45 round trip. We did it once and that was the end of that. This is more expensive than a cab ride in NYC! Reservation: This is the most disappointing part, Hilton Honors will not grant you any points unless you make the reservation with Hilton directly. This "clause" is on their website in miniscule print and very hard to find. Very sneaky of HH to do that. They will probably loose my business if that's how they work. I made mine with American Express travel and they would not honor my Hilton Honors card for the room rate charged, although a HH rep told me that AMEX reservations would earn points.. Contrary to what I was told by a Hilton Honors rep - amex reservations are not ok when you check in. So I got screwed. The part that really gets me is that the front desk has a sign promoting the AMEX Platinum card for reservations. I used my Platinum card to make the reservation (which they clearly love since they advertise it at the check-in desk!) but they won't give me points for my room rate charged. It has been over two weeks since my visit and I have yet to hear from Mr. Dermot Connolly, Managing Director of the resort, who the check-out lady (Stephanie) left a note for regarding my concern and dissatisfaction (we actually bumped into him while walking through the courtyard to the Spa and he took a picture of us next to the beautiful unique tree). As I mentioned earlier, guests that are not in groups are just a number and I suppose this just proves my point. My experience with other major hotels, Marriott being one, is that I have always received points for my stay on all charges regardless how the reservation was made. I guess I will stick with Marriott. March is an exccellent time to go to Puerto Rico weather wise. It rained once for about 10 mins during our stay. Not a spectacular stay at this hotel but I would probably return to Isla Verde (San Juan) when I come back to Puerto Rico. I feel more welcomed there.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out great for us”
Reviews.Author: hzlwd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took two college age and one high school age sons here for spring break. The resort is not brand new but still very well kept. The most breathtaking view I've ever seen looking out to sea from the hotel on the ridge. The view of the resort itself at night is stunning looking across the grounds around the pools and marina. A very relaxing place. We paid attention to past reviews and found one very helpful so we followed their advice on many things and had a great trip. Here are our tips. 1. Arrange a rental car by internet to pick up once you disembark at the San Juan airport. We arrived about 9:30 pm and the shuttle to the rental hub was waiting for us. We got a mini van for less than $200 for a whole 7 days, unlimited mileage. IF YOU RENT FROM ENTERPRISE, PARKING IT AT EL CONQUISTADOR IS FREE!!! THEY HAVE THEIR OWN LOT ON SITE AND ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS TELL THE BELLMEN IT'S AN ENTERPRISE CAR AND THEY'LL DIRECT YOU TO THE LOT. BIG PERK!!! The return of the car was quick and hassle free with a 5 minute van trip directly to my departure gate. Buy a $100 Garmin and take it with you. They are perfectly accurate all over Puerto Rico. (side note: The San Juan Airport is easy to use. TSA at other American Airports could learn a few things from these people. They were thorough, serious, efficient, but pleasant to those taking departing flights-actually smiled) 2. We had a partial ocean view room (free upgrade from a garden view room given by the hotel without asking because we're HHonors members in good standing). The view from our room in the lower (older) part of the hotel down by the marina was absolutely beautiful. The adjoining rooms were very nicely kept, clean (excellent housekeeping), and spacious. Very contemporary. Don't be afraid to stay in the older part of the hotel. The trips back and forth on the cable car was a minor inconvenience and kind of nostalgic. 3. Bring water shoes and snorkel gear with you for Palomino Island. The ferry ride over took less than 30 minutes each way (including standing in line). Minor inconvenience. A very beautiful beach with ample beach lounges, a nice burger and sandwich place and bars for drinks. Prices were not cheap but reasonable. If you rent snorkel gear, it's cheap but has to be turned in around 3:30 (too early for my sons). Sea urchins along the coral reef so water shoes are necessary even though you don't want to step down unless absolutely necessary to try to prevent damage to the reef. There is a smaller island off Palomino with the reef between. Pretty nice snorkeling trip to and from but not for novice swimmers. We saw turtles, rays, beautiful corals, and all kinds of tropical fish. 2. There is a casual dress code but no sneakers or uncollared shirts in the evening. 3. El Yunque National Forest is the only rain forest in the U.S. Park system. It is within 20 minutes by car and is free unless you drive into the visitor center which is nice but unnecessary. The trails will take you to waterfalls and the summit of a couple pretty tall peaks. This was one of my son's favorite parts of the entire week. There is a burger shack about halfway up the forest road (between KM 10 and 11) that had good food and was a nice place to stop and get out. You can spend the better part of a day here if you want to hike. Take bottled water and a camera. 4. Resort food is good but relatively expensive unless you eat down by the marina. There are very good restaurants around Fajardo. We liked the Metropol. This is a Puerto Rican chain similar to Ruby Tuesdays but with Puerto Rican and Cuban food in large quantities. The fried plantains were excellent as was everything else we got there. (We recommend the Sangria and Metropol Punch) 5. We took in a movie at the Cinema in Fajardo (next to the Metropol.) If you're not bilingual, make sure you go to a show in English (can be checked on the internet). The commercials before the movie in Spanish were fun to watch. The seats were very nice. 6. If you can schedule your trip when the moon phases are dark (not during full moon), the trip to the bioluminescent bay is worth it but not if it's too light out. 7. We stayed at a hotel in Isla Verde near the airport the last night. It was decent but the area is like the run down parts of Panama City. We went to a huge mall at the recommendation of the concierge at this hotel and were astonished. It was the nicest mall with the largest array of nice stores I've ever been in. The patrons were dressed to the nines and were having a great time shopping. Apparently going to the mall in Puerto Rico is a special occasion. 8. The forts in Old San Juan are very interesting. Walking around Old San Juan will only take about three hours before you think you've probably seen enough. 9. We took a day trip by ferry to Vieques. The ferry ride is an hour each way and cost $4 round trip. The Red Beach was beautiful but no bathrooms, or concessions. The parking area was run down. Skip going to Vieques and stay on the big island. We didn't go to Culebra but were told by others that it was about the same. 10. You can stop at a store along the way and stock up on snacks and beverages to keep in your hotel room. Refrigerators but no microwaves in the rooms. Conclusion: This resort is very beautiful and has enough to keep a group like ours happy. The staff is professional/career level and were excellent to all guests. Treat them nice and they'll go out of their way for you. Don't be afraid to get a car and drive around. We wish we'd taken a road trip on Puerto Rico instead of Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel -- But Huge, and You Hardly Know You're In Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: RedSabre
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the El Con, and the first since the property had changed hands and undergone a much-needed refurbishing. The first visit was for a tennis vacation (and it was good for that, as the tennis facilities are top-notch); this time, we stayed here the night before a sailing trip out of Fajardo. In terms of convenience and comfort, our rooms in the Marina complex met our needs. The room was bright, spacious, comfortable and offered beautiful ocean views (even though we'd not booked an oceanview room, so that was a plus). The property, overall, is very beautifully landscaped and has all the amenities one would expect in a full-service resort. My two principal objections to the El Con are (a) how huge the property is, which makes it difficult and time-consuming to get to your room, much less accessing the various amenities (or even the reception area), and (b) how generic the hotel is, such that you know you are somewhere warm with palm trees, but with the exception of the friendly mostly-Puerto Rican staff, you could be in Miami or Aruba.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with the place!”
Reviews.Author: amktravel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this great resort. Approached cautiously with some of the concerning reviews. The room was lovely, in the marina area. Loved the daily ferry shuttle to the beautiful, private island. The main pool area was also great. Rented a car. They charge $15-20 daily for parking but it was worth it to sample the wonderful local restuarants and cuisine. Favorites were La Estacion, Ole-Lelolai and La Ola, a local hangout for boaters. Food at the hotel was pricey, but dining out made the experience an affordable and delicious adventure. We usuallly frequent small, boutique hotels. We really enjoyed our stay at El Conquistador. A little something for everyone, the staff was very polite and gracious and the surrounding mountains and blue Caribbean waters could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for a return visit”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyMess
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a fabulous time during the week we stayed here. Our room was upgraded by Anna (who was extremely friendly) when she heard that it was our 30th wedding anniversary. That gesture and the room we received made all the difference in the world regarding our stay. Our room was nice and bright all decorated in white but there are a few issues we had which I described below. As for the service at the hotel...everyone, and I mean everyone, were incredibly friendly and helpful. We utilized valet parking and one time because our car took long to come we were issued a credit for that night without even asking for one. The location of the hotel was great and the views of the ocean from our room were stunning. There were three weddings during our stay and our room overlooked them....it was really a special sight. The pools were very nice and Palomino island is a great and beautiful way to spend a day. The grounds are well manicured and there is a beautiful golf course, tennis courts and even a basketball net. There is free wi-fi in the room and it did come in handy. Make sure your cellphone carrier has towers on that part of the island...I have Verizon and we did not get a signal at the hotel. I would recommend getting the breakfast plan as it can be expensive for families, however, the choices and quality of food were excellent. So what are the negatives? We found the restaurants to be expensive even though the food was very good... so we also ventured off the premises and went to a local place called Passion which is a five minute drive from the hotel. The food at this restaurant was incredible and the price was great...highly recommended. I would advise the hotel to the upgrade the bathrooms....our bathtub had a lot of rust stains around the tiles...a little steam cleaning would fix that and a more expensive shower head should be included for a resort of this caliber. However, the bigger issue for us were the beds which definitely need better mattress and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Poor everything else”
Reviews.Author: texastravels2
Reviews.Content: If you can get a GREAT deal on this hotel, it is fine. If not, it is not worth it. We paid an outrageous price for what we got. The food is average at best, the prices are ridiculously high, you spend most of your time waiting on shuttles, elevators, etc. The private island beach is really nice. The waterpark is ok- not too much better than many local splash pads in the states. Once you get service, the people are nice. But, gettign the service takes forever. This is advertised and billed as a luxury resort. This is not a luxury resort. If you are expecting luxury based on their prices, don't.

Reviews.Title: “Good for R&R”
Reviews.Author: robslotkin_123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not close to the attractions and you either have to rent a car for $120/day or take tours to go anywhere. If you are looking to use the hotel as a base to travel, it isn't worth it and you'd be better off in San Juan which is more central. This hotel is good for people with small children who are looking to get out of the cold. There is nothing for teenagers to do and there is nothing going on at night unless you gamble. The views from the hotel are stunning. The groundskeepers do a wonderful job with the foliage. Food is ridiculously expensive. They won't tell you this at the desk but there are restaurants you can walk to along the waterfront by exiting a gate by the marina

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: gbenker
Reviews.Content: We didn't have much time to stay so we took a long weekend. Our favorite spot was Palimono Island -- spent most of our time there. Our favorite resturant by far was The Strip House -- Martinis were awesome, steaks were done to perfection, service was tremendous.

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador, Fajardo PR- place to avoid”
Reviews.Author: Dconrad36
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living. With that travel comes a couple of things. First, I think I know hotels. Second, I accumulate points, particularly, Hilton points. We like to take a family vacation over spring break (we have one teenager) with my points and miles. Last year we went to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Hilton Waikoloa Village and had an amazing time (highly recommend). This year we chose the El Conquistador in Fajardo, PR. BIG mistake! Since it is a Waldorf resort we were expecting it to have expensive restaurants but were prepared to deal with it since the room was covered on points. Well, right when you think price doesn't matter they make you rethink that philosophy. Ok, we decided to just deal with the high prices. Since itâ€™s a Waldorf the food and service should be excellent, right? Wrong! The customer service was nearly non-existent. The food selection and quality were both poor at best. If you order a soft drink with your dinner, be prepared to walk to the bar to get your own refill (and get dirty looks from the staff as you bypass them). Sometimes you'll wait 15 minutes before the wait staff will even make eye contact. Then, when you get their attention, it becomes obvious they have no skill or experience in the service industry. When the food comes out they always drop it at the table and seem to run away; I suppose hoping you don't tell them something is wrong. Itâ€™s almost humorous. That may be the last you see of your wait staff until you hunt them down and ask for the check. If you decide to valet park, call 1 hour before you need your car. We typically waited 20-30 minutes for our car. The valets are the most unmotivated group I have seen in my travels. They just don't care and expect to be tipped for their attitude. The rooms are also of poor quality. Being on the water can wear out a hotel quicker than elsewhere, but basic housekeeping is overlooked. Our room had a moldy shower, peeling paint, and outlets that didn't work. If this is typical of Waldorf then I'll take a Hampton Inn any day. Even the basic construction is poor. Watch your bill very closely. I needed to check out very early so I had the front desk provide an itemized bill the evening before we checked out. We had charged a snorkeling excursion to the room and it appeared twice. I had them remove the additional charge. Strangely, the second charge had reappeared by morning. ???? Itâ€™s a real shame that such an amazing location is wasted on this hotel. It has tons of potential but doesnâ€™t deliver. I contacted the Hilton Diamond Desk to discuss a refund of the points I wasted on this hotel. They forwarded my message to the local hotel manager but I haven't heard anything yet and I doubt that I will.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: TheHakes
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. Spacious and beautiful. Huge room lovely views. Four main restaurants with amazing food. A catamaran takes you to the island where you can lounge on a beautiful beach,crystal waters,go snorkelling or horse riding. Loads of iguanas,friendly. There's a small casino there but otherwise no evening entertainment. Great it want to relax and do nothing. The bioluminescent lagoon is a short walk away through the White gates in the harbour.small town there with bars and music. You can also go to the lagoon on a small electric boat there if you don't want to canoe,much better and half the price of the tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a brief getaway, with a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: 77hanners
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at El Conquistador for a four-day weekend, booked last-minute through a wholesale vacation package. While the "resort scene" isn't our usual style, we were pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere (more casual and friendly than you might gather from their literature). We stayed in the Las Brisas wing - our room was lovely, clean, very comfortable with a spectacular view of the ocean. Parts of the main infrastructure are showing their age and wear, but on the whole the resort was clean and well-maintained. Everyone we interacted with, from the front desk to wait staff to house keeping, was friendly and attentive, and delighted to give us advice about sightseeing and activities off-property. The dining was standard over-priced resort food - not bad but not great, either, with the notable exception of dinner in the (bizarrely decorated and overly air-conditioned) Strip House, which was excellent steakhouse fare by any standard. Our server, Ly, was a delightful font of information about Puerto Rico. We ate at the Stingray Cafe on our last night, which was also good, and with a lovely ambiance more fitting an island vacation, but expensive and oddly lacking in local seafood offerings. Other than breakfasts, and an overpriced hamburger on Palomino Island on the first day, we dined off-property the rest of the time, for much better value and local flavor. We had a car, but the taxi service around Fajardo seems to be pretty reliable, and some of the nearby spots are well worth checking out, particularly El Veradero inside the Puerto Chico marina off the 987 - great drinks and beautifully fresh fish. We also found that, consistent with our experience elsewhere in Puerto Rico, the best meals are often found in the most unlikely-looking places: trucks on the side of the road serving outstanding home-cooking; dive-y looking spots crowded with locals; places you'd swear weren't big enough to have kitchens. A little bravery reaps big rewards, and as always, you do better branching out and eating what the locals are eating... if you want a cheeseburger or chicken fingers, you'll do far better on resort property. We are generally pretty active vacationers, and were looking forward to some of the activities advertised at El Con, and were pretty disappointed to discover that most of them exist in name only; Palomino Island is a beautiful spot for sunbathing, decent for snorkeling, and from what we could tell, absolutely awesome if you have little ones. But for activities, there was only one shaky-looking wave-runner, a few very (VERY) leaky kayaks - most without drain plugs - and some inflatables. We had been excited to play around with windsurf or sailing equipment, which we were told was temporarily unavailable due to maintenance issues, but other people working there said they had never seen any of it actually in use. Nevertheless, we had a very nice afternoon snorkeling, filling a kayak full of water and capsizing, and snoozing on a beach chair, but other than that one day we ventured off-property for activities. The resort would do well to update their kayak fleet, and maybe give some attention to the rest of their advertised activities (or at least stop advertising that they are available). On the whole, we had a lovely time, and would definitely go back under similar circumstances (needed a short getaway with a direct flight from home).

Reviews.Title: “Disapointment at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Oregonvegetarian
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for the warm, tropical location this resort would have nothing else going for it. The food is horrid, the grounds unkempt, the elevators broke several times during a 6 day stay. Additional charges rack up at the end of the stay so be sure to read the fine print....(3 dollar/day housekeeping charge, 25.00/day resort fee). The water slide park is not included in the stay so if you have kids (we don't) be prepared to pay. The beach is "off property" and only accessible by boat (which amazingly does not cost anything to take). As my boyfriend said...it's like an all inclusive resort where nothing is included. Prices for food are astronomical!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort with gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: CaribTraveler71
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an oceanview room in the la vista wing which was very nice and had an amazing view. The room did, however show signs of being run down with chipped paint and tile, although it was clean. The condition seemed to be typical of all areas of the resort - chipping tile and cracks by the pool area and other common areas. The resort really needs to have constant maintenance given the size of it. That being said, our stay was pleasant. Customer service was good and it was a very relaxing atmosphere. The location was wonderful. Palomino Island was beautiful and there were never lines for the ferry to go over or come back. We ate at Stingray, Blossoms, and the Strip House. The food was just ok and by no means gourmet or five star for the prices you pay. La Brisas for the breakfast buffet was the same food every day - it would be nice if they changed it up a bit. Prices were very expensive for the quality received. The spa was nice but not spectacular compared to some others we have been to. Our treatments were good but way overpriced. We enjoyed venturing off the resort. The resort seems to discourage you from doing so, but take a left out of the marina and walk past the security gate and walk about 10 minutes and there are several local restaurants and the local marina which were fun to experience. We booked the Bioluminscent Bay tour with Captain Charlie in the electric boat and it was fantastic. We also ate at Le Estacion and loved it. We were glad we left the resort to experience these things. We would return to the resort, not for another couples get away as there were tons of kids and families. We will bring our young son next time, as the waterpark looked like something he would enjoy. Overall, the resort is nice, with a good location and fantastic views! You won't be disappointed if you go, but don't expect a pampering, romantic and fine culinary experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but improvement needed on customer service”
Reviews.Author: PRP1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in a span of less than 12 months that my husband and I stay here. Overall we enjoy our stay, but there are always issues with customer service that make us wonder if it's worth coming back. The first time we stayed here was in April 2010. We were given a very noisy handicapped accesible room in front of the tennis courts on a second floor. Also the room smelled like humidity and I think someone smoked in the room, even though the hotel has a non smoking policy. After waiting for more than three hours we were changed into a different room which was in a quieter area and had a much better view of the ocean, which is what we had booked initially. The rest of the stay was uneventful and we were able to finally enjoy our time. Now on our second stay in January 2011 we had problems with the service at their "very higly rated" restaurant Stingray. We were very happy to finally be able to have a quiet dinner just the two of us since our first daughter was born 6 mo ago. We got all dressed up and got a nice table at this restaurant, which was very empty. We were surprised that even with so little customers there were a lot of servers just talking and joking around gathered at the very entrance of the restaurant. We were greeted with very little enthusiasm and were directed to our table. We ordered wine and appetizers. When the server came to get our order my husband asked about this special seafood paella made with orechietti pasta, The server Jessica explained what kind of pasta it was and how it looked. My husband was very interested in the dish because of the pasta and ordered. When the dish was brought out to the table we noticed that the pasta didn't look at all like it was described to us it was actually just rottini pasta. So we called the server Jessica and she very rude and defensive said that they had run out of orichietti and that was a substitute pasta. My husband told her that it would have been nice she notified him of the change before bringing the item because he would have changed it for something else since what made him decide for it was specifically that pasta. We asked if we could get some adjustment on the price since it was not what we ordered. Then she came to us very rude and said that what we were paying for was the seafood not the pasta. We paid our bill and left the restaurant very upset. Stopped by the front desk area and complained to one of the employees there. She was very diligent and understood our complaint. She immediately went to the hotel manager and the hotel manager in a matter of 30 min had contacted us to our room and apologized for the inconvenience. He also proceeded to refund the full price of that particular item from our final bill, and told us that he had scheduled a meeting with Jessica (the waiter from the restaurant) to discuss the incident next day. The matter was resolved but it is the details that can be very easily prevented what can make the difference from a great stay to a not so great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best bet in island...”
Reviews.Author: anamouse
Reviews.Content: Born and raised in Puerto Rico I've been to El Conquistador various times, I've stayed there twice and gone back numerous times for conferences, business activities etc and I always leave with mixed feelings. Let's start with the bad, if you're from "out-of-state" it's a bit of a trip from the airport to Fajardo so make sure to grab a snack at the airport before boarding the bus (it's a 45 - 50 minute ride), checking in takes a really long time and staff members are usually not fully oriented with guest services, there is only on-site parking for hotel guests (which if you're going for a business affair is quite a pain having to park across from the hotel and wait for a shuttle) and parking starts at $15 per day if I'm not mistaken. Rooms are small but recently renovated. There is NO night life in the hotel with the exception of karaoke a few nights in the hotel and every time I've been there (around 8 times) the night club is always closed, food is RIDICULOUSLY overpriced and a very minimal selection (if you rent a car go out of the hotel for dinner!!!), the charge for towels, the pool was dirty the second time I visited (leaves, bandages, plastic cups in the bottom), some staff members talk in Spanish in front of American visitors thinking they don't understand and that is just rude, if it rains there isn't much to do and Puerto Rico weather is very unpredictable, ferry to Palomino/Palominito can take a while and Coqui Water Park has 2 slides, a big pool, a kiddie pool and a slow current stream...and is an extra charge on top of what you're already paying. Up side: great location once there, the views from the rooms are spectacular, you get to enjoy a resort reserved area of Palomino which is great and once there you can rent jet skis or hop on the banana boat, there's a little cafÃ© in the beach that offers regular beach-side food and drinks, I believe there's scuba available but I've never done it, and there's plenty of chairs with umbrellas available only to hotel guests. There is lots of shopping, of course over priced, but quite a few boutiques, souvenir shop, ice cream shoppes, etc... There are around 3 pools, spa (overpriced, but no surprise there), golf, and the Coqui water park is mostly good for little kids, big kids will get bored after riding everything twice. There are a few restaurant options (one american style informal restaurant near the casino, a formal Italian, Japanese and Steakhouse restaurants all good but beyond overpriced...a plate of food wont cost less than $23 in the formal restaurants and $15 in the informal), there's a Starbucks inside, the hotel is huge so you WILL get a lot of walking done and rooms are pretty cozy. Overpriced? Yes Good food? Not really but if you're stuck there make sure to take extra cash. Good for kids? Yes but not for too many days. I do recommend this hotel for it's sight, Palomino island, good shops and great location/rooms but if you're going for a family vacation and you're limiting your stay to just the hotel then don't go form more than 4 days, after that you will get bored and the price of food will begin to burn a hole in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mbm1964
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time here. We stayed in the villas with grandparents, teens, and nieghbors with younger children and everyone was happy. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “It wad awesome vacation”
Reviews.Author: Harleybabe883
Reviews.Content: The refills on soda was a charge and we didn't know it so there for we had alot if charges just for this. The island was great, horse back riding was good. The bartenders in Drakes Martini Bar were alittle slow and were mad at us and didn't want to serve us. The night life on the resort was Dead!!!! Dance club empty or in use for other things, casino dead, Buffett was good and comped, the ride there from the airport on the short bus made us sick but we had free Rum. Our room was great and the maid service was good. Things cost alot on the resort and will know next time to go to the store and buy things off the resort. Over all there was 4 girls staying there for our girls trip and we had an awesome time. Can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best family trips!!”
Reviews.Author: aax34
Reviews.Content: We had the best time here!! Everything was excellent, the rooms, the service, the restaurants!! The private island was fantastic, and the water park was so much fun!! Our kids had so much fun!! The best thing we did outside of resort was kayak to the bioilluminescent bay, that is a must!!!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING RESORT!”
Reviews.Author: axlepittsburgh
Reviews.Content: My wife got sick and had to go to hospital in Puerto Rico. The hotel was positively awesome! They called a squad, furnished a wheelchair, and sent a security person with us who stayed the entire time (about three hours). Then this same security person called another from the hotel who picked us up in her private vehicle. The place is beautiful and well kept. Clean and very personable personnel. The restaurants, while somewhat pricey, are superb! We are travellers, but would rate this resort among the best we have stayed at anywhere. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Everytime I thought I would not come back I met a fabulous staff person who was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ChooChoomama
Reviews.Content: Hated our first room in main building near lobby, small, no balcony, loud, near elevator, not at all what we expected but after my husband talk to front desk they offered to move us the next day! Marilyn at front desk was awesome and very helpful the next day. David our bellman so nice and helpful when we had trouble getting new room keys and charge cards, Alfonso the bartender super great in helping us get someone to come fix 3 broken things in our room. Diana at the concierge desk was so kind and patient and efficient! Really I learned the nicer you are the more likely people will help you in Puerto Rico. Yelling ranting and raving do not work but make them ignore you. The Strip House and Sting Ray restaurants on site FABULOUS but expensive. We spent well over $140.00 plus each meal(bought bottle of wine) but really love the food. Reservations are encouraged almost necessary. Couples massage great but very expensive $211.00 each but best massage ever had and I would get your pedicures before you go b/c they are $80.00. The Marina is where we ended staying and we liked it much better. Pools, landscaping, well kept. Private beach very cool with lots to do and pretty good bar/grill.

Reviews.Title: “the staff is excellent and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: trueckert
Reviews.Content: Hi Dermot, Just a note to say thank you for returning my wallet and papers to me. I am grateful to you and Manny for safely returning the wallet. It was a huge relief. At the time I had lost the wallet I had returned from the hospital with my daughter. She fell in the rainforest and had to have stitches. We were exhausted from the entire experience. Having kind, honest and diligent employees is a huge asset to the resort. The El Conquistador is a wonderful place. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be returning to stay again. Thanks again!! Sincerely, Tracy

Reviews.Title: “Would Gladly Go Back”
Reviews.Author: NewMexBound
Reviews.Content: We booked with some hesitation after reading some of the older reviews. But our 4 night stay was very pleasant. We found the staff polite, friendly and helpful across the board., We were upgraded to a top floor Partial Ocean view room. The view of the ocean, golf course, fountain, and El Yunkee mountains in the distance was very pleasnt. We watched the sun setting from our large balcony. We ate at Stingray and the The Strip House. Both were expensive but we liked our menu choices. TIP - Even if you don't eat at the upscale restaraunts upstairs, check out the views from the public balconies up there. They are beautiful. Breakfast was included in our package (agree with others that at $19.95 it would otherwise not be a good value). We also received a $50 daily credit that they deducted from our bill at checkout. We knew about the resort fee which was quite evident on the Hilton site where we booked from. There were no surprise fees or other charges on our bill at checkout. The resort is beautiful and quite spread out. We never waited long for the Funicular nor the ferry to Palomino island. We spent 2 enjoyable days at Palomino, relaxing and the enjoying the beach. We'd happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Did Away WithThe Winter Blues”
Reviews.Author: mhistmajor
Reviews.Content: We just got back 2 days ago and I couldnt wait to write this review. First I want to say that I read some of the previous reviews that ripped this hotel and almost changed my plans based on them. I am glad I didnt because although some things were on target most of the bad things I read did not exist in some cases quite the opposite. The Hotel itself is huge and beautiful nestled atop a cliff overlooking the ocean. It was never too hot and the breezes kept the weather perfect for the 9 days I was there. Check in was smooth and efficent. I met both Sharise and Bianca. They were friendly and a pleasure to deal with. When I got to my room on the first floor of the main building I noticed I had a partial ocean view which was not what I reserved. After going back to the desk Sharise and Bianca both worked to correct this. The told me to go to dinner and they would have my bags brought to my new room and to get the keys after we ate. The new room was as promised. It was on the 5th floor with a view of the ocean. It was clean. No peeling paint or musty smeel in the bathroom as some had said. The only problem with the room was the terrace doors as they didnt line up right and the winds howled through them. They tried to repair the doors but it did not help but that was the only problem with the room which I learned to deal with.Veronica was our housekeeper and she kept the room clean daily and got us what ever we needed. One other note. Bianca turned out to be like a gift from heaven. As my stay progressed she continued to be attentive to us and made us feel warm and welcome each time we saw her. I knew that if I had any problems she would help. She is an example of what a staff member should be. The food was expensive but the stingray cafe was by far the best as we ate there twice. The other resturants were just ok but for the price these resturants should not be just ok. There were several resturants off property which we found like Clazio, and Pasion which we ate at twice which were excellent and the prices were great also. I wrote seporate reviews for both. The Breakfast Buffet at Las Brisas was another story however. This was the sore spot for me. I had a package where it was included but for the 19.95 price charged it was far from worth it. Eggs scrambled and watery. bacon which was hard and brittle. No omlette station included. 6.00 additional for an omlette on top of a already high price. There was cereal and fruits but this was not a buffet that I expected here. The pool area was clean and chairs were plentyful. Aaron who served us drinks and lunch at the pool was attentive. He was always busy serving but managed to make eye contact to make sure we were ok. The private island was a short ride away and was beautiful. There were plenty of chairs on the beach and again the service was great for food and drinks. The golden door spa was a relaxing place where i felt great. I was greeted at the front desk by karen who was a pleasent young woman who made me feel welcome. I had my massage with Cindy who was the best. She knew what to do and seemed to really enjoy her job and I could sense that. I would up booking a second massage with her and my daughter had one as well.The 2 convience store stocked anything we needed but the prices were quite high. If you are into gambleing then this hotel is not for u. Only 4 blackjack tables with a long wait to sit at some points. Also for some reason this casino closes at 12 from Sunday to thursday at 2 Friday and Saturday. No one seems to know why and believe me I asked. One last little tip. I like to have a car where ever I go though you can get away without one here. I rented at enterprise at the airport and since they are at the hotel as well I was able to park in thier lot behind the hotel (a very very short walk) and did not pay the 20.00 per day fee. We will be coming back for sure. This was a great vacation where in my opinion the entire staff bent over backwards to make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous place, poor service”
Reviews.Author: tanannda
Reviews.Content: Location, views and grounds are outstanding. Private beach on an island near coral reef makes it truly a unique experience. Funicular and vista elevators present a great opportunity to see true nature wonder of a landscape that organically embraces the ocean views with smaller islands, picturesque beaches with marinas and yachts and green hills boasting tropical plants. We got a complimentary upgrade from a garden view to full ocean view and this literally made all the difference. The balcony overlooking the ocean with the evening breeze was essentially the best part of the room. All that, unfortunately, is complemented with a service that is almost obtrusive in some areas (like bellmen/porters that would almost yell at you if you try to move your luggage yourself) to non-existent in others (like a really sloppy room cleaning). To make a long story short: if there is an opportunity for a tip, they'll make sure not to miss it, yet when they have a reason to suspect that no tip will be given, they wouldn't bother doing anything for you at all. One notable exception is the waiting staff in the breakfast restaurant where they'd remember not just your name, but even the type of tea you asked for last morning. The restaurants in the resort are overpriced and do not carry a single local item. Not even a coconut or local ice cream. To put it straight, you do not need to go to Puerto Rico to get a mid-to-low-level Brooklyn fare at high Manhattan price. The worst part came at checkout, when the parking charges were "mistakenly" omitted from the bill. The trick here is obvious: we had enough of resort credit (included with the package) to cover the parking, yet since the parking was not on the bill, the credit got "automatically forfeited", yet when we came to claim the car, we were told that we have to pay the parking fees extra. After 45 minutes of going back and forth between the registration, the valet parking stand and a manager, the issue was resolved, but it left a really bad aftertaste. It was not really a great amount, yet the way it was done made me wonder if this is a standard practice there rather than a singular event. So, if you choose to stay there, do check your receipts and claim your car before you check out. Over-all it's a great place that unfortunately suffers from a sub-standard management. I would highly recommend having a car if you choose to stay there - this will greatly expand your dining, shopping and sight-seeing opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, unreasonably expensive restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: LeilaBug
Reviews.Content: The resort was absolutely beautiful. Great staff, old but clean rooms, reasonable room charges. The food was unreasonably expensive: $16 burgers, $18 salads, $5 can of ice tea, $14 Mojitos... For those of us who've done all inclusive resorts b4 this was out of control. Rented a car and went into San Juan for a day. Also ate outside of resort where the consierge recommended. Highly recommend that. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit even better than the first”
Reviews.Author: TTTNewton
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days at the resort and feel like we have been gone for 10. The hotel was packed when we were there, however it is so spread out that we never felt the crowds. What I love about this place is the variety of things to do. Each day was different. The kids loved the water park. I loved taking the ferry to the beach. During the day there is plenty to do for everyone. We stayed at the marina this time and our room was spacious and had the same decor as the last stay. Great sleep. Loved the addition of free wifi. It worked great. The magic show was really great and the kids loved the games set up for vacation week. The teen lounge was fun for them. I thought that I would mind taking the Funicular everywhere, however it did not bother me at all. We had three great dinners at the hotel. The Strip house has the best salad, Blossoms was a great family style chinese/sushi meal. The italian restaurant food was fabulous ( service was a little slow). Our most favorite place to eat was the pizza/salad spot just off the lobby overlooking the pool. The setting of the hotel is spectacular. It reminded us of Hawaii. The hotel is older so don't expect it to be "perfect". I'll take that "aged, casual feel" anytime, versus a new hotel in a setting that is less spectacular. We are already trying to figure out when we can go back. Kudos to the entire team at the hotel for making the stay so enjoyable. We made great family memories. We had 3 other families at the hotel due to our "talking up" the resort. They all loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel offers a "feast for the eyes" and more activities than you'll have time to enjoy in one trip!”
Reviews.Author: JenH3
Reviews.Content: We traveled with an 8 and 14 year old, a grandma and 2 sets of parents, and this hotel was a match for all of us. The beach has a wide array of activities-we tried snorkeling, kayaking, wave runners, rented floats, and went horseback riding. The ferry ride to the beach area ran often, and there were plenty of lounge chairs, both in sun and shade, even on a busy holiday week. The pools are large and clean, and there are jacuzzis near each pool. The water park was fun for everyone, although we wish there wasn't a separate charge per person to go in. We were very glad that breakfast was included, the large buffets were well stocked and replenished often. We were lucky to meet the supervisor Sonia, who went out of her way to make us feel like VIPs. We also had great service from Elaine and Joanne during breakfasts. We particularly liked the Stingray Cafe and La Piccola Fontana restaurants, as well as at the casual bar by the marina. There are plenty of places to buy snacks, supplies, and desserts. We can't wait to plan another trip to this piece of paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: parkslmom
Reviews.Content: This place is huge with so much to do, and very beautiful. Staff was professional and friendly. Desk clerk upgraded our room without us asking. We stayed down in the Marina area which is a little quieter (more our style) and makes going to the beach or the water park (terrific) so easy. But also means taking the funicular and then walking a distance to get to the main facility. Not an unpleasant thing - there's shopping, the workout room and beautiful views on the way - but could be a nuisance for an older person. This was a school vacation week so the place was packed with kids. Only down side is the restaurants are very pricey without being so great. We mostly ate outside of the resort (try restaurant Pasion por el Fogon for a decent dinner). Renting a car is good idea, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not incredible”
Reviews.Author: BethieB
Reviews.Content: A beautiful resort built into the side of a mountain. The ocean views are spectacular. The food was average and way overpriced. The staff were exceptional... friendly and helpful. If you asked for directions, they would walk you! The rooms were clean, loved the two queen beds. The bathrooms are missing an essential, a fan to vent shower steam. the beach is a private island that you reach by catamaran, which is also a drawback because the last boat leaves the island at 5. If you are traveling with more than one other person, do not take their bus to and from the airport... it is $40 each way, a cab is $80. Not a romantic resort, more for families.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Dougpfs
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place in a beautiful location. This was a business trip and we were considering a Hawaii trip with family. This place is changing our mind and we will bring them to the El Conquistador. We have been multiple times to Hawaii. This location has the same feel and look as Hawaii and much closer. The private beach is great and spectaclur rooms. Ours was in the La Casita section. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: BoSoxBrit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Elcon for a vacation combined with business meeting for a couple of days. Having read the range of reviews we were slightly apprehensive but in fact the Elcon significantly exceeded our expectations. The variety of restuarants meant we were never tempted out of the resort and the room was very comfortable with a stunning view of the marina and sea beyond. Fixture and fittings not quite so impressive and the lack of robes and coffee maker (although provided on request) was slighlty dissapointing. 2 things make this place stand out: Firstly, the beach on Palomino Island. The 10 minute catamaran shuttle ride is an experience in itself but the beach is wonderful - not too crowded with a couple of bars and a restaurant whene you need them. Secondly the staff at Elcon were wihtout exception friendly and accomodating. All in all a lovely place and one we would love to go back to. Finally, look out for the giant lizards which added a fascinating extra Jurasic Park type experience!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Manny”
Reviews.Author: Lincoln52
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at El Con. We booked two rooms in the Las Brisas wing and when we checked in, I had a terrible headache and forgot a fellow trip advisor suggestion to make certain we weren't near the tram. Big mistake. So, I remind you, please don't book a room near the tram unless you have lived near the el in Chicago. Fortunately, I came across an assistant manager named Manny M. Manny is a stud! He's worked there a long time and takes great pride in his work. I didn't seek him out but just started a simple conversation with him. From there, he took care of everything. On our way to process a room change, he bent down more than once to pick up garbage. It was obvious he was vested in the place and that he wanted us to enjoy our stay in HIS hotel. My preference when spending over $450 a night would be that I wouldn't have to find a manager in order to get things done right but the rest of the staff at El Con was pretty quick to admit that they couldn't help me or weren't authorized to do so. For example, the rooms we moved to were cheaper than my initially reserved rooms. You'd think they would have just adjusted the charge accordingly. But no, instead I get some crazy speech from someone at the front desk about how the hotel room charges change like airline tickets and were dependent on when I had made the reservation. It was like talking to the village idiot. (At that moment AND when I booked by initial rooms, the new rooms were $50 less per night). In the end, Manny made it right and we ended up enjoying our stay. He should probably give classes to their other employees on customer service because he gets it. The breakfast buffet is, well, to put it nicely, nothing special. We dined at two local restaurants, la estacion and pasions. Both were very good. la estacion only takes cash so be prepared. the biobay tour was fun. you can walk to the bay from the marina at El con if you want. we went on a rain forest "tour" but there wasn't much of a tour. It was more of a "I'm dropping you off here and will pick you up in an hour and a half at such and such a place. Our guide was nice but didn't teach us anything. We had a rental car and could have easily just done that ourselves. Spent one day in old San Juan and El Morro. Doubt you'd go to San Juan and skip those. Coqui water park was small but fine. not sure I'd do it again since Palamino island is more fun and its free. The waterpark is an extra $20 a head. In summary, if you want to stay in Puerto Rico, I'd have no reservations about staying at El Con. I don't think there is a better place on the island. Leaving at 0530, it takes exactly an hour to get to the airport Enterprise branch.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort, amazing room, great island & waterpark!”
Reviews.Author: JessLynn1982
Reviews.Content: We went for business and leisure and had a 2.5 yr old and 9 month old. They put us in the Las Casitas Village...AMAZING!!! It was a condo like room. Full size granite/stainless steel fully loaded kitchen, spacious living room and dining area, double french door balcony, a nice spacious bathroom and a nice room in the back with double beds. Looks like there should have been room for a washer dryer but ours was missing, our friends had one, which would have been nice. We had the upstairs, it was amazing view of the ocean but we had a double stroller that was a pain to carry up and down every day. The resort is HUGE...be ready to WALK A LOT!!! Lots of nice pools, the waterpark was amazing for little kids and fun for adults as well. We didnt have to pay for it bc of our company but $14.95 a day could have been a little annoying, not sure why it's not just included like other resorts. The private boat ride is short and fun over the the AMAZING island. The water and beach is breathtaking. Nice huts for shade. If you were into exploring or adventure (i wasn't with 2 babies) it looked to have a lot to do. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Beds were slightly comfy, not the best but not uncomfortable. My only compliant would have been the awful food! It was a common agreement among all of our friends that the food just wasn't good here and it was expensive. They had a market grocery store in the lobby since u have a full size kitchen but it was very pricey! Room service cost us $50 for 2 chicken tender meals and 2 cans of pop, still weren't very good. Even eating with our company (which is always amazing) the food was just ok, so don't come expecting gourmet dining. Overall, a wonderful vacation, I will go again!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Full Service Resort, Paradise Beach Getaway with deluxe amenities”
Reviews.Author: LlamaMama29
Reviews.Content: This a place far removed from San Juan Urbana... about 45 minutes out of the airport, and worth the drive (rent a car!). From the drive in through security gates and lush, landscaped golf course, you knew you were embarking on a special adventure. The security guard offered us options for parking- it was only an extra five bucks for the valet. We were treated like royalty at the curb, at the front desk, every where we went at the resort. Got coupons for a free rum drink from any resort bar when we checked in. Room was upgraded (even tho we got an awesome discounted price on line) from a garden view to a delightful view of the pool, ocean, and private island! There was a maintenance guy painting the room when we walked in... shows the property is well cared for. I only wish we had more than a day here! We barely got to see the grounds. The funicular and trip to the private marina was a treat in itself... and then you got on a ferry out to the private island for more relaxation. The island was very quiet, some gift shops and minimal assortment of dining choices. Dozens of loungechairs, gorgeous sugary white sand beaches, aquamarine Caribbean waters to play in. You could get lost in the resort hotel itself- lots of shops, restaurants, visual entertainment. The pool was amazing... many levels, waterfalls, swim up bar. Easy to relax there. Sure, the food was expensive. We saved a few bucks by choosing Starbucks for breakfast. We took the cinnamon rolls and coffee out past the pool, and enjoyed a very private veranda for less than $10! Fajardo wasn't that far away for local cuisine. There is a gigantic waterpark ($20 fee per day). We didn't have the time, or we would have spent a day there. One of the most memorable excursions of our lives was had right there out of the Fajardo Marina! Vieques Island/Mosquito Bay is right off shore. It's home to one of the biggest bioluminescent bays in the world (think underwater fireflies!), and the only one in Puerto Rico that will allow you to swim in it! You can take a short boat ride out, including drinks dinner and an amazing bay tour in the dark for about $120. We look forward to going back someday, and for definitely several days!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful venue, great staff, just ok food service”
Reviews.Author: kdbug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a business conference. The ride from the airport takes about an hour. The check in/check out staff was friendly and the process efficient. We were told in advance email that we would have a garden view room, but ended up in a suite with sitting area, spa tub, walk in shower, walk out balcony, CD and DVD player, nice stereo and full ocean view. Very nice room. It was recently updated, and the furniture and bed looked brand new. Had a bit of trouble getting the TV in the bedroom to work, but my husband figured it out. Radio had Ipod dock but we couldnt figure out how to reset the clock (it was at the wrong time )so we just unplugged it. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Everyone said hello or good morning, and there were so many around in case you needed assistance finding something Housekeeping came everyday and did a great job. We only ran into one staff member that didnt speak English well enough to help us with our questions and she brought someone else over to help us right away. Special thanks to Marisol at check in and Guillermo at Ballyhoos Bar and Grill. Speaking of food, that was our only disappointment. It was expensive for what you get. We ate 2 times at Ballyhoos (burgers were ok) and once at Cafe Caribe ( much better burger and about the same price $13). It took awhile to get service at Ballyhoos, but once we ordered, the food was timely and hot. Our other meals were provided for by our hosting business. Those meals were presented well, but tasted just ok. The staff serving the meals did a great job. It reminded me of the quality and price you would see at any resort/theme park where you are a captive guest. The resort is so large that it didnt seem like there were alot of people there, although there were. The only lines we waited in were for the funicular (tram) when everyone was going to the same place, i.e. Water taxi, or back from Palamino Island. The pool in the mid level was shallow, and therefore very quiet. We went twice and less than a dozen people were there both times. At night, in our part of the resort, the Coqui frogs were VERY loud. I had read about those here and brought ear plugs- thank goodness. Some may find them very annoying. I didnt have any experience with resort fees as those were paid by our company. I did need help with unlocking my safe, and there was no charge for security to come down (very quickly) and efficiently fix the problem. Fitness center was quite small and did have a broken elliptical. However, it wasnt crowded at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LauraSayerG
Reviews.Content: Great value, very, very nice. We took the resort diving course and then went on a 60 minute dive. This was the one of the best dives I have ever done. The water park was fun, Palomino Island relaxing. We also rented wave runners from Palomino. The rooms are beautifully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully breath taking but you pay a lot for the beauty and you have to be a very patient person bc service is the slowest I'”
Reviews.Author: Great808
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very beautiful. All white and very clean. Beautiful and breath taking view from our balcony. Huge bathroom. Room itself was spacious. Food and drinks were ridicously expensive. We found that you can walk down along the shoreline to the little town area to the left of the resort to buy local souveniers and eat amazing traditional puerto rican food like mufungo. There's also a stand with the best burrito and hot dogs I've ever had in the 29 years I've been alive. THE VERY VERY BEST EVER! The water park was fun. The only huge complaint I have is the service.. Horrible. The worst I've ever experienced. The bartenders were the WORST EVER IN THE WORLD. Seriously! I've been a bartender for 6 1/2 years and I was going crazy. The girl at the nestle ice cream and sandwich place was an exception though. They should promote her to bartender for sure. Otherwise it was a wonderful stay and resort.

Reviews.Title: “wet and wild”
Reviews.Author: guestco2
Reviews.Content: The two of us spent 3 days followon to Caribbean cruise at El Conquistador, where we planned to experience Puerto Rico's rain forest and bioluminescent bay. After debarking from the ship, we taxied to the airport for rental car, and headed east for some fun in the sun. The trip to Fajardo was effortless, and when we arrived at the hotel (earlier than checkin time) the valet told us the wait to check in might take awhile, because of the line of people checking out. We thought "no problem, we'll just hang out and explore the grounds until the line subsides". We did stop at the lobby anyway, and saw that there was no line at the HHonors check in counter, so we stopped and asked if we could check in early. The staff were very helpful and courteous, even though the line of people waiting to check out extended way past the lobby. I hadn't been in contact with the news services for several days, so I didn't realize what was happening. Hurricane Earl was imminently approaching the island, and this hotel at the eastern tip of Puerto Rico was directly in the predicted path. To make a long story short, the three days my wife and I spent celebrating our 41st anniversary were both scary and wonderful at the same time. The hotel staff did a great job keeping us comfortable through some of the worst weather we have ever experienced. Needless to say, all services and visitor facilities on the Island were shut down for most of that time, power outages were frequent, and our plans were totally ruined. We stuck it out though, and my wife and I got to spend some quality time together doing abolutely nothing but watching the weather. We couldn't be happier with the facilities at the hotel that kept at least minimal guest services running, Who could imagine that this would turn out to be such a memorable event doing absolutely nothing? We hope to return to the island and to this resort again in the near future to visit all the things we missed out on. But we have no regrets for the time we spent there in this beautiful, wild and wet paradise.

Reviews.Title: “This is what every other resort and cruise ship pretends to be...”
Reviews.Author: xyxoxy
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure I really need to write a review... this place sells itself. You can't beat the amenities, the location, the service... This was the last leg of a multi-stop tour of Puerto Rico. We decided that even if the rest of the trip was bad (which it was NOT) that at least the last day would be nice. The Conquistador far exceeded my already high expectations. From the moment you enter and park the staff guides you effortlessly through registration and acquiants you with the resort and all it offers. This place is like a self contained city. And though I recommend getting out to see Puerto Rico and all it offers... you really wouldn't need to leave the resort if you don't want to. You can get anything you need right there. Granted you will pay for it... but you don't go to a place like this if you are pinching pennies. Be sure to take advantage of the spa and get a massage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views of the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: april42
Reviews.Content: We were worried about staying because of the some of the bad reviews. The hotel grounds and the views of the ocean, marina and Island incrediable. The rooms are plain but big and clean. The food was only ok, and very expensive. Drinks were also very expensive but very good. The major problem is that the tram runs all night and day. It is very loud even with the balcony doors shut. Have them place you as far away from the tram as possible. My husband had to wear earplugs every night. The private lsland is worth the trip as it is free. We ate dinner out each night as we wanted traditional Puertorican food - which was great. Also, we went horseback riding near the rain forest - which is both a must! The pools and water park were great as well. There is a dive place right on the grounds, my husband - who is a master diver - said it was a good dive. He wanted to go out several times but there was not enough other folks for more dives.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Silverbell805
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted by the registration desk, I knew it was going to be a great vacation. We were greeted by Manny Melendez, assistant manager, who escorted us to our room in the Marina. He made sure that everything was perfect for us. Since we stayed in the Marina, we spent most of our time there. We ate at Stingray and the Ballyhoo bar many times.We met Jojo Torres, the head chef, who even took the time to make special foods for us. We ate breakfast at the Casita Village, and Joanne Jimenez was so friendly that we went back everyday. She made sure my capuccino was ready the moment she saw me. The two massages at Golden door from Jose and Richard were among the best I have ever had. Every employee we met greeted us with smiles and hellos. The boat ride to Palomino Island was enjoyable, and the beach was perfect with lots of chairs and thatched umbrellas. Maria Melendez knows how to make good tropical drinks at the bar. THe hotel is very big, with many places to eat and several pools, plus a well kept golf course. I hope to return and bring my family with me.

Reviews.Title: “Worth going for the beach alone!”
Reviews.Author: Oasis3796
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for peace and quiet, this is the perfect place! It's far from the clubs/restaurants of San Juan but it is so romantic and relaxing! Huge pools, great restaurants (try the seafood restaurant at the marina), spacious rooms and the best part - their beach. The resort sprawls across the cliffs and has a marina with additional rooms and their very own waterpark! Definitely family friendly. Their beach is something else... you take a high-speed ferry a few miles off the mainland of Puerto Rico to a GORGEOUS white sand covered island. Everything is set up and at your disposal - chairs, umbrellas, great food/drink service right on the beach, snorkeling and other water sports. Only hotel guests have access to the island which gives it a very private feel. I can't wait to go back! Although pricey I recommend going on the horseback trail to the top of the island where you see nothing but turquoise waters clear out to St. John. The only flaw this resort has is that it shows it's years sometimes, the rooms have a little more wear and tear than I like but the common areas of the hotel, it's wonderful staff and it's gorgeous amenities more than make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: brandywinelady
