Reviews.Content: El Conquistador was beautiful! The extensive property, gardens, golf course, tennis courts, pools not to mention the private island were beautiful and well maintained. The staff was a delight. I loved the sound of the little frogs at night. We rented a car and easily drove out to El Con. We visited local restaurants, hiked in the rain forest and kayaked in the Bio-Bay at night. A fantastic reprieve from the snow in the NorthEast US.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Las Casitas Village Resort!”
Reviews.Author: travel0818
Reviews.Content: The Las Casitas Village Waldorf Astoria is the sister resort to El Conquistador. It's basically the same resort but nicer/better accommodations (the rooms are nicer, check it out on Trip Advisor). This Waldorf Astoria resort is definitely the best place to stay in Puerto Rico. It's in Fajardo, which is where you want to stay most of your trip (San Juan resorts don't offer much beauty, they're in the city (which has slum areas), and the beaches aren't that nice). Las Casitas in Fajardo offers nice room accomodations and access to spa, water park, nice private beach/ferry to private island (Palomino) and water activities, as well as beautiful scenery. Places you gotta go while in PR: -Old San Juan -La Bombonera restaurant in Old San Juan (try the mallorcas!) -16th century forts -Las Casitas Village Waldorf Astoria -Bio-bay kayaking excursion (if there is no moon or half moon) -Aquafari excursion -Ferry to Culebra (go to Flamenco beach, hike to Carlos Rosario and other beach to the right )

Reviews.Title: “Great resort if you're the kind of person who wants to stay on property.”
Reviews.Author: scbelle
Reviews.Content: Like many, I was hesitant after reading some reviews, but I was travelling for a conference so I was hopeful. It was WONDERFUL for a conference hotel. WHICH BUILDING? A couple of the people I was travelling with have mobility issues/trouble walking long distances. I had mentioned that to the hotel during the reservation process. We also paid the $19 for a potential upgrade to Las Brisas--but when we arrived, they had applied the upgrade for free and had put us on the 3rd level (rooms began 33xx)--I highly recommend this area to anyone with issues walking long distances. These were the closest rooms to the main hotel out of anyone in our group, and the third level was nice, as you could walk right out to the pool or the elevator to the funicular. ROOMS: We had adjoining king and 2 queen rooms. They were the same size and absolutely lovely. If you don't like modern decor, it may not be your thing, but we found them extremely comfortable. Yes, there wasn't much sound insulation, but we were not over-bothered. We were HUGE fans of the large bathrooms and HUGE walk-in closets. This was wonderful when packing business, travel, evening, and beach clothes. The beds were RIDICULOUSLY comfortable. I truly didn't want to get out of them. Had a lovely view of the water. WONDERFUL water pressure in the shower. SERVICE: While evening turndown service was a bit spotty, we found the employees of this resort otherwise fantastic. They truly went out of their way to accomodate every need, and did so with a smile. WONDERFUL staff. CONVENTION SPACE: All areas (I checked out some rooms that were in use by other groups) were in great shape, and all of the equipment worked (phew). Hotel employees managing A/V equipment were top notch. RESTAURANTS: Las Brisas: By the pool, good flat bread pizza. Pool Bar: Great Mojitos. (Don't get the mango mojito though--not good) Cafe Caribe: Decent--what you'd expect from a cafeteria. The arroz con pollo was quite good, hot dog and fries ok. Room Service: Cheeseburger and Fries, arrived hot and when they said. THough that was longer than I'd expected. Blossoms: Did the Hibachi table; was remarkably good. (I forget the name, but:) The Italian: The homemade ricotta ravioli was superb, and I also heard rave reviews about the lobster risotto. Neither the osso bucco nor the veal chop were very good. The semi-freddo was the best dessert. Stingray: Everyone went hog-wild for the chilean sea bass, though I'm not sure if that's a sustainable fish! I had the filet mignon--pass on that. Not many non-seafood choices here. Luckily, they had a DELICIOUS chocolate soufflee--yum. Banquet Food: Dinners were extemely blah, though desserts were good. Lunches were like an catered sandwich lunch. Continental breakfast's were pitiful, though the buffet breakfasts were passing decent. NIGHTCLUB: This was pitiful. They actually would have more guests dancing if they turned it down a little bit. I love night clubs, but...No. It was painful. POOLS: Las Olas pool was dead all the time--go down there if you'd like quiet. Of the three main pools, I visited the center lap pool and the pool with the swim up bar. For lap-swimmers: beware. They need to put up lane dividers, because people do NOT respect your lane. My particular favorites were the two large men who launched their rafts perpindicular across the lanes as another lady and I were swimming. They were concerned that we might splash water in their beer. Did I mention there were THREE pools on that level? And that we were only using two of 6 lanes? Yeah. Moving on, the swim up bar-pool was great. shade and sunlight available at the bar. Outside of the pool, there were plenty of places for both sun and shade. Golden Door Spa: Got an amazing 80-minute therapeutic fusion massage from Kathy--ask for her! She is fantastic! The amenities were very nice but limited to a "o-furo" bath and a steam room. The O-furo Bath is not a traditional ofuro bath. It's more of a hot tub with two waterfalls. The water was not hot enough for me. The steam room was nice. The plumbing facilities (shower, toilets) were in a bit of disrepair--fixtures pulling away from the wall, etc. That was a bit shocking, but otherwise it was very clean. Like I said though EXCELLENT massage. Someone else had a thai massage by Richard? Former wrestler? That they very much enjoyed. Palomino Island: sorry folks, never made it here, but i got rave reviews from the rest of the group. Ferry was fun and quick. Beach had plenty of room/chairs, and plenty of shade was available. Any CONS? These are all nit-picky: -The bus ride to/from was dreadful. If you get in at rush hour, anticipate 1.5 hours. There was a bottle of rum, but not enough to go around. Truly wretched. But it's like paradise when you arrive! -I would expect some more free amenities from a hotel of this caliber (Waldorf Astoria) such as free bottled water in the rooms, robes, etc. I was shocked they didn't have robes, actually. OVERALL: Beautiful, beautiful resort. Love the mountain/hillside vistas, the sea views, the tropical landscape, the spanish colonial decor...even the parrots when they weren't sqawking ;) Would DEFINITELY love to attend another conference here. Not sure if I would book it for a private vacation unless I could get a better deal on room price... The restaurants are really pricey, and it's not super convenient to go off resort. For my $$$ I would probably prefer to go to a Mexican Riviera All Inclusive. -It would be nice if the chinese restaurant were open during the day as well. I was craving chinese for lunch! -The staff at the Golden Door Spa congregated in the quiet room/lounge while I was waiting for my service and chatttered on loudly. It was quite unprofessional; I've not seen that at any other spa.

Reviews.Title: “Fave vacation ever.....”
Reviews.Author: deville222
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the hotel. The food was delicious... The drinks were amazing.(an extensive and great wine selection)... The view is like no other. We went with 2 couples and we rented a jeep. So in addition to loving the hotel, we loved the fact that we could jump in the jeep and see the outskirts of PR. We just got home and cant wait to go back... The staff was amazing as well.... Thank you, Jodi, Anthony, Jamie and Palma

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Resort in Sheep's Clothing”
Reviews.Author: ResultsMatter
Reviews.Content: This resort is no better than a 3 star Marriott. This is NOT a luxury resort as billed. The location is beautiful and the facilities are very nice, but that is where it ends. Management is having a major issue with labor and it shows. The service is better at a Holiday Inn in Des Moines. The food is right out of a cafeteria, but the prices are in line with NYC prices. I would AVOID this resort!!! Bait and switch. Caveat Emptor

Reviews.Title: “Here's all you need to know about the El Con”
Reviews.Author: manoverboard
Reviews.Content: I am going to regret this because I will leak a few hidden tips that management will likely soon plug up. I have been to the El Con many times and have always liked it. You can find out all the other stuff on other reviews. 1. Rent a car from Enterprise at the Airport. It is an easy drive and all parking at the hotel will be free. ( I am going to pay for that one) If you have any other rental it will cost you $20/day/ 2. Drive out of the resort to the right. There are about 5 restaurants or more within 5 minutes that are very good and local in flavor. Some do take-out further down the road and are very busy on weekends. Totally O.K. to go to the more rustic ones near the baseball field. Ask at the hotel. 3, Drive out of the hotel to the left about 1 mile to Passion (make reservation). Relatively upscale..some groups brought in by "I don't know what hotel"...but very good food. The wait staff is very helpful. Tablecloths on the table. Not hip but cool enough. 4. Drive out of the hotel take a quick left and a quick right down the hill on the big road towards Fajardo. You will get lost unless you brought you GPS from the states- they work here!! You can ask anyone if you do. Most people speak English. At Route 3 and El Conquistador Avenue you will see a multiplex movie theater (enjoy as many as you want -mostly in English with Spanish subtitles) and all the most middle of the road films you can think of with an emphasis on ACTION!!! and the always good Metropole Restaurant. This place doesn't have the atmosphere of it's Isla Verde sister (that is a part of San Juan near the airport) but the food is just as good. Great alternative if you've got a rainy day. Popcorn is cheap. 5. Take your breakfast at Starbucks in the hotel if you haven't scored a free breakfast plan at the hotel. Usual Starbucks stuff, strong free wireless signal, and NY Times either for sale ore laying around. A tad more expensive than your local Starbucks. Remember the refill policy. Don't know it? Ask at your local Starbucks before you go. 6. The El Con food has been universally panned for years. But the outside grill near the pools serves good pizza and decent hamburgers. The wait staff there has great attitude. Some of them have been there forever. 7. There's a fridge in some (all?) rooms. Stop at one of the local markets and grab a bunch of stuff to bring with you. We always get fruit, wine, cheese, crackers, O.J. The hotel will supply you with an opener and glasses if you ask nicely. Saves a bundle. 8. At certain times of year there are outstanding packages with free nights and free breakfasts. Ask before you leave or look on the website. 9. Get your Hilton Honors card, if you don't have one, get it before you leave. Not worth much here but it may get you some perks. 10. Check out the Yoga instructor (Rita)at the spa . The classes tend to be very small and she is top notch, first class and very very smart and experienced. You will be impressed. 11. Ignore the pushy spa desk person, if she happens to be there. She not purposely unpleasant, she doesn't seem to know any better (in English or Spanish). Free apples on the desk, but not very tasty most of the time. 12, Ask for an upgrade for your room. 13. Do not pay extra for a room with a view. That's a five minute thrill for the view and a lot to pay for it.. 14. Be super nice to everyone. This is a monster resort with workers who are almost universally regular folk like you and me. They will go out of their way for you if you are kind to them. I can't tell you what they did for us because I know management reads these things and they will get into trouble. Suffice it to say I mentioned that I liked a certain food I could not find either at the hotel or locally, That mention did not go unnoticed and the dish arrived in a plastic bag the next day. I hope I haven't gotten someone fired. 15. El Palomino Island is far nicer in concept than execution. You will likely want to go for a day and the food there is perfectly adequate. You could bring a picnic if you wanted to do so. You can decide if you want to go for the extras they provide. I think there is horseback riding and the usual water sport stuff. you can pay for if that is your sort of thing. Remember, there is no beach at the hotel. You must take the (free) launch out to the island. 16. Make sure you ask for complementary vouchers when you check in. At different times and depending how seriously the desk people take you, you can get free spa vouchers and casino vouchers which will get you some discounts or a free game or two. 17. Find the short-cut to your room. There may be one you are not aware of. Ask the housekeeping staff or any employee you may see. This place is big and I've seen people repeatedly walking out of their way to get to their room. 18. There is no real night life at this hotel if you do not gamble or do not like loud Latin music played in spaces with lousy acoustics. HBO became my friend.. I think the rooms have DVD players (not sure) so bring some if would like.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family vacation”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMom23
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay in the Las Casitas section of this resort. It was absolutely fabulous. Our only complaint would be the hour bus ride from the airport. However once we arrived at the front lobby we were blown away by the amazing beauty of the resort and the views from every angle. It is truly breathtaking. We stayed in a 2 bedroom casitas and the room was perfect for our family of 6. It provided 2 large bedrooms each with it's own full bathroom. In the center was a large living/dining room and a beautiful kitchen. The amenities were great & housekeeping was very thorough. Even though we stayed in the villas, we spent most of our time enjoying the hotel area too. The pools were beautiful and not overly crowded. No problem getting chairs at all. The hot tub overlooking the Caribbean ocean was our favorite place to relax. We also enjoyed a day at their water park. It was the perfect size to be able to relax on a lounge chair and not worry that the kids are too far out of sight. We really enjoyed Palomino Island too. We rented paddle boards, went snorkeling and saw some amazing coral and fish. We also went horseback riding on the beach and to the highest point of the island. It was amazing and worth every penny. I don't understand all of the reviews about how bad the food is. We ate at almost every restaurant during our stay and had wonderful food & service with each meal. It was very nice to wake up & head over to La Brisas each day for the breakfast buffet. They offered quite a selection of fresh fruits & hot items. Our favorite meal by far was at The Striphouse. The chateaubriand was fabulous!!! The only bad time we had was when we had to check out! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: hpl07
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days at this beautiful resort. The Resort Manager was extremely helpful in order for us to book the right room-rate-location, thank you so much! The facilities are very well maintained, the room was very clean and perfectly located next to "Coqui waterpark". Food at Stingrays, Iguanas and Room Service was very good too. The short boat trip to Palomino Island went a very long way - Palomino is just beautiful and peaceful, yet very interesting for our 7 yrs. old, he really had a blast and we are so glad that we came to El Conquistador since this short time was meant to spend some family quality time - mission accomplished - Thank you Conqui!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for the kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: axenrodr
Reviews.Content: We spent the first half of our week vacation in Isla Verde, which is great, but weather between X-mas and New Years can be iffy, as was the case when we were there. We decided to pack an overnight bag and hop in the car and drive to Fajardo to spend the day at El Conquistador. Figuring that even if weather was not great, there would be plenty for kids to do, then if weather was good, we could see about a room. Upon arrival, weather was overcast, but we decided to see about a room. The Front Desk staff, and in particular the management staff could not have been more accomodating. Mind you this was a couple of days before NYE, the hotel was near capacity, and we did NOT have a reservation. We were promptly checked in, escorted to our room and quite literally pampered from that point forward. The room was an incredible oceanview room (down at the marina), which the front desk manager had to talk me in to (I was told by friends that staying at the upper hotel was more central, which it is, but also more crowded). The notion of the boat to the private beach seemed a little hokey at first (I had been there before kids and before the ferries were upgraded to hi speed boats), but it actually was great. Being off the coast, the water was much calmer and clearer, and frankly you have everything that you could possibly need at the private island. The kids loved it. The other thing that the kids loved was the water park. By far the best (clean, not too big, safe, incredibly well maintained) water park that we've ever been to. I generally try to avoid them because I'mnot a fan of crowds, but this was actually a pleasure, particularly because I didn't feel like we had to be on top of our kids. The restaurants were generally good. Some better than others, although lunch was pretty good everywhere. I really liked the fact that there were a lot of little places to get a quick breakfast (coffee, muffin, bagels, etc). We did the big buffet one day, but that's too much food for us. The staff around the entire hotel was really great. I had the oppoortunity to meet many of the managers, and it is evident that the attention to customer satisfaction eminates from them. Was truly a great place with great people. So much so that we are thinking of returning during Presidents week.

Reviews.Title: “Very family friendly”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMaMa38
Reviews.Content: We had not planned to stay at the El Conquistador, but when the seas were too rough for the ferry from Fajardo to Vieques, we needed a Plan B to keep the kiddos happy. We showed up at the El Conquistador about 11 am and were greeted with warm welcomes and an available guestroom. The rooms were spacious, clean, and recently renovated. We had a beautiful ocean view. We spent the afternoon at the pool where the kids made many friends from all over the US. My husband and I each learned how to make mojitos, poolside and we received a complimentary cocktail from our waiter. The kids played ping pong too. I asked the concierge about kayaking in the local biobay, as we were all devastated to have missed our Vieques biobay swim. She told me that all the groups were full, but recommended we just show up and see if there were any cancellations. What a great idea! We were able to secure spots for the 6:30 pm adventure with Fajardo Tours Eco Adventures ([--]). That was amazing and well worth the $45 a person fee. After the kayak we were wet, sandy, and cold and returned to the resort for dinner. The oven fire pizza was great and the kids loved the movies by the pool. We all slept great in the queen sized beds. The next day we took the free ferry to their private Palomino Island. It was beautiful! (Not as beautiful as Culebra...) The kids snorkeled, played putt putt golf, built sand castles, played soccer, gathered sea shells, and marveled at the iguanas. We had lunch and cocktails too. It was a very nice day. Next time, I would stay longer than one night, for sure, and we'd be prepared to play a few rounds of golf, as the Arthur Hill designed course looked beautiful with it's elevation changes and palm trees. We had read reviews of the resort that weren't very kind. I don't understand them. The reosrt was beautiful, well kept, clean, with friendly staff. The food was expensive, but we experienced that all over PR and not just at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “skip it”
Reviews.Author: tllchicago
Reviews.Content: Average dinner for 2 kids and 2 adults $300. Rooms are "OLD" and that is being nice. A glass of wine $12 a beer $8. Front desk was in no way ready to help, except when I brought a picture on my camera of the floor of our room that was flooded because of the A/C unit. Nice resort, way way overpriced. Been there, done that. Would go else where next time.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE WORST "LUXURY HOTEL" EVER! WE TRIED TO LEAVE A DAY EARLY IT WAS THAT BAD”
Reviews.Author: jcicc
Reviews.Content: PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW BEFORE YOU BOOK A TRIP HERE!!!!! HALT HALT HALT!!! My husband and I stayed here Dec 30-Jan 2 and it was the WORST experience I have ever had in my life. We paid 440.00 a NIGHT and the room they checked us into was not made up, dirt on floor and....PUBIC HAIR all over the sink. I called the Front Desk and they moved us to another room....that was about 60 years old, looked gross and.....HAD YELLOW DEAD BUGS ON THE BATHROOM CEILING!!!! AT LEAST 50 OF THEM!!!! At this ponit my Husband called downstairs and they moved us to our final room - which was ok at best. The linoelium wood floors were kinda of disgusting. To top it off - the hallways are all open air so you hear kids screaming and doors shutting all night long....and I mean SLAMMING DOORS with the echo. Not once did the management or staff apologize for the disgusting rooms. Food was good - totally unauthentic caribbean food....actually, you eat hot dogs and steak while you are there but cant get rice. SO unfortunate. KIDS screaming by the OLD DISGUSTING DIRTY POOL SECTION all day long. We took the private boat to Palomino Island which was really nice....eexcept their were o98609865094860985984 kids yelling and screaming. It was so unrelaxing!!!! To top it off they screwed up our return transfer back to the airport! This is in NO WAY SHAPE OR FORM a Waldorf Astoria hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! You will be miserable. Its a dirty, old huge hotel. Stay at the El San Juan or The Ritz Carlton instead!!!! I am furious we spent over 3500 to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facilities, Friendly Efficient Staff, Terrible Food that isn't cheap”
Reviews.Author: ChairmanMike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights prior to moving to a condo back in san juan, the idea was to pamper ourselves for a change since we normally only rent condos because of my son's food allergy (peanuts). With regard to the allergies, we were very happy with how the wait-staff and kitchen staff responded to our concerns and we felt that the food was perfectly safe. Overall, all of the staff at any position in the hotel were friendly and efficient. Check in was efficient without any hickups. Our room was perfectly clean, the beds were ok, certainly not high end, which is how I'd describe the room overall. There were feather pillows which happen to be a no-no for my wife and son. We called the front desk and then went out to the pool. When we came back, the new pillows were there and there was a call a little while later to check that we had received them. There are 2 different pool areas in the main hotel and the kids liked them both. Lots of nice facilities in the hotel and they did movies by the pool at night which the kids loved, my son watched an entire movie while standing and swimming in the waterpark pool one night. We took the catamaran to the island beach one afternoon and the kids enjoyed the mini golf and playing some volleyball. However, something they don't warn you about until you are there is that water shoes are recommended if you go in the water because it is reef like in terms of wildlife and you might step on a sea urchin and that wouldn't be fun. So that was quite annoying because we always travel with watershoes but had not realised we HAD to bring them. Overall the beach was nice and I wish we could have gone into the water which was quite warm (I did walk into it just a bit). The kids enjoyed the pools and the waterpark more then the beach so we didn't go back. We booked using a special package that included tickets to the waterpark and the buffet breakfast. This aspect was a really good deal, the buffet was excellent and the kids really enjoyed the water park. Paying the normal cost for the breakfast and admission to the waterpark each day would have had me seeing red, but packaged together I was smiling ear to ear. That being said, aside from the breakfast, the only restaurant that we actually enjoyed was the water side bar/grill in the harbour (excellent burgers and chicken fingers). Overall the food is way too expensive and more galling given that it isn't good. We were thinking that maybe it was us, or that we were going to the lower end restaurants, but talking to people by the pool everyone was unimpressed even with the high end restaurants. What was scary, was that one person said that he hasn't been to a single hotel in Puerto Rico that has good food and recommended going to local restaurants only. We signed the kids up for the tennis clinic 3 times (not cheap either), and the instructor was excellent and the kids got a good lesson and improved their shots (they've had three weeks of tennis camp over the previous 2 years). One afternoon we came back and our room lock had malfunctioned and could just be opened by turning the handle. Nothing was missing (although our valuables were in the free room safe). We called the front desk and a security person was over within 5 minutes to check the lock and called their locksmith. When it became apparent the locksmith would be delayed and would likely require some time to fix the problem, the security person assured us that he would protect the room and we could go to dinner in complete confidence. When we returned the lock was fixed. Overall, I would consider returning if we were going to be in that part of the island, but with the understanding that we should have a car and try to get out for dinners and have breakfast and lunch at the hotel. I was dissapointed that the casino didn't have poker, but did end up playing in a tournament at the Ritz in San Juan. I almost forgot, the coqui frogs are freaking loud at night, the kids loved hearing them and you can actually hear them in the rooms even with the sliding balcony door closed. That being said, they didn't keep us awake. The parrots in the lobby were also a big hit with the kids and they were amused that they spoke in spanish (ola! ola! ola!).

Reviews.Title: “Not the same...”
Reviews.Author: madisontex
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Conquistador every year for the past 9 years. This place has lost its luster. Still a nice hotel but not what is was a few years ago. Place is not clean and looks run down and dated. In addition, the service is not the same either. Water park is small and not worth the price of admission. Only plus is that the restaurants are still top notch. I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, people, attractions, beaches....had it all!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlos2998
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a great find...great location in regards to the airport, attractions, malls, restaurants, beaches....renting a car is a must, cause you need to explore the island and try not to be too confined to the resort itself. It makes the trip worthwhile. But as to the Hotel, it has its own private beach, which you have to take a 9 min or so ferry to get there....Once your there they have theyre own restaurant and bar. They also have boats, jet skis, parasails and horseback riding. And for a small fee you can also have your very own island for yourself and yours charged by the hour just minutes from the private island beach. I give this Hotel and Resort a 5 star during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: IdealReviewer001
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a week at the El Conquistador Resort located in Fajardo with my family of four. We stayed in a La Marina Ocean View room, and the view was spectacular! The room was definitely larger than expected. We had two queen beds, a large bathroom, a balcony with a view of the ocean and marina, and a flatscreen TV. I liked staying in the La Marina village because it was more secluded than staying in the main hotel, and it was very convenient to have the water taxi very close to our room. I also loved the architecture of the village because it had a very Spanish authentic look to it. I spent most of my trip in Puerto Rico lounging in my room just relaxing or lounging on the beach at Palomino Island. I think that this resort overall was great. The only issue I had with this hotel was how every single restaurant was good, but way to overpriced for what they were offering. The only restaurants I thought were worth the price were Blossoms (Hibachi Section) and the Strip House. You can't get an entree for under $20, which was pretty ridiculous. The appetizers (price wise) were even worse. For example at the Chinese section of the resort you only get one spring roll for $10. That is outrageous. These were just some minor things that I didn't like. I will definitely be back, except this time I'm going to try the Las Casitas Village.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Time, Lovely Location, Dated Programming”
Reviews.Author: Maybeinerror
Reviews.Content: I agree with the many reviewers who said lovely location but dated. This place has great bones and needs some good investment to bring it up a notch. Our children, 8 and 10, had the time of their lives, and therefore we had a great time, too. The kids loved the funicular down to our rooms (we were on the Marina level, which I would recommend with children). They loved the water park (3 slides and a nice pool, costs extra). They loved the private island (iguanas! beach! kayaking! hiking!). They enjoyed the "dive-in movies" at the pools. The location on the side of a cliff is spectacular, and the private island (a 10-minute catamaran ride away) was truly beautiful and special. Our room was comfortable, and the maid service was very good. The resort is very spread out, so there is a fair amount of walking-funicular-elevator... we certainly did not want to forget anything in our room when we went "upstairs," because it would be a 20-minute trip to get back to the room. The staff was helpful, although not outstanding. We had very dicey weather, but the hotel had some indoor activities and game rooms, and also opened the water park for free on a rainy afternoon. The concierge service was a bit vague about some things, and it was hard to tell what programs were hotel-sponsored and which ones were just available if you cared to take care of it. The lobby was very large and spread out, with tropical birds in cages and the all-important Starbucks. The negatives were the food (although I have come to expect this at most resorts)--costly, not very good, and often lines--and the lack of good evening activities and/or shows for adults. Since we were there as a family, the evening programs did not matter, but I would not come here without the kids. With the lines for breakfast (and for us, a hike up to the restaurants that served breakfast only to head back down to the water park and/or island), I would seriously consider getting room-service breakfast. (Our room had a refrigerator and a coffee maker.) There is an Enterprise car rental in the lobby, and we rented a car one afternoon to go to El Yunque, the rainforest (a must-see, 30 minutes away). There was a bus tour through the resort, but it was considerably cheaper to drive ourselves and see the same thing. I think that would depend on your comfort level. The same goes for transportation to and from the airport. It was much cheaper to take a taxi than the hotel shuttle. We regretted not booking some things earlier, especially the kayaking tours of the bioluminescent bay--they were full when we tried to go. FYI, the hotel wi-fi was ATT, which seemed to work well for ATT devices but not very well for other devices, even though you could technically link into the system. Our Verizon phones did not receive or send calls very well, either, which made them virtually useless as communication devices within the resort. The only other tropical resort I have been to is the Atlantis in the Bahamas. In comparison, El Conquistador seems a bit tired. On the other hand, I loved being able to go off-property and enjoy the culture of Puerto Rico itself. All in all, we had a great time and would go back again. I hope that they continue to modernize the services and offerings--it truly is a beautiful location and deserves a little pizzazz.

Reviews.Title: “Our fifth anniversary”
Reviews.Author: richardcollins2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Las Vistas wing right by the main lobby (On the same floor). Beautiful views of the ocean and Palomino Island from the terrace. The lobby is grand and well appointed. Self Parking is a little bit far and confusing but they have vans to drive you to the hotel. The golf course is out of this world (Especially after driving through Fajardo, the local town). The water park was discounted at this time of the year ($9 per day). Loved sitting in the water at the bar. We did the kayaking at night (great experience). Local restaurant by the beach very expensive. We absolutely recommend El Calizo Restaurant right outside the restaurant. We also had a baby sitter (Mimy) who we hired throught the hotel ($20/hour). Rain forest and San Juan were also great experiences in Puerto Rico. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort but needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: luv4travel80
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay. We found the property nice but it definitely needs some updating. It can be a long walk to the beach boat depending on your room but we did not mind it. We found the staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. At one restaurant we got a dish we did not order and the waiter brought us extra because he felt so bad. The scuba/snorkel tour was great. The staff could not have been nicer. The beach island is pretty and it is large so you don't feel that people are sitting on top of you. The food could be improved especially the fancy restaurants. The more causal restaurants were fine. The resort could also use some activities for teens. There is not much for them to do at night without parents.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: mrsvejk
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days at El Conquistador. It was an interesting experience in comfortable mediocrity. Everything was fine. Rooms were nice, People were friendly enough. Food was decent. Nothing was notable though. Renting a car was really the key to enjoying the place in my opinion. You don't have to ever leave the hotel compound. We rented the car after arriving to visit the nearby rain forest and just being able to see a little more of real life around the area felt like being released from house arrest. Old San Juan was pretty long drive but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: travelguru2466
Reviews.Content: We checked in here 3 days ago and are staying till Christmas day. It takes at least a good 15 minutes to get there. First take elevators then a tram then have to walk. The room we have has burnt curtains the bathroom has no lock the light switch is broken also the curtains in my room have no rod to close or open them. The housekeeping is horrible they do not clean the rooms at all. The first day we came back after they cleaned the room and the bathtub was still dirty the sink was not cleaned and they didn't even clean the coffee mugs or coffee area leaving a mess. This is not the first Waldorf Astoria I have stayed at but is def the worst because of the condition of the rooms and service. I complained to the front desk and they were saying they would do something but no they have not. This trip has been a disappointment to me and my family. The other thing i want to warn future guests is about parking. I did self parking the first day and its like they discourage self parking. I had to wait 15 minutes for a shuttle to the parking area and then when i am taking my car out the validated ticket did not work because it is only valid for 15 minutes.. So i was stuck in the parking lot. The next day i did Valet Parking and they took 20 minutes to get the car. THis is terrible service!!! I am sure there are a lot better hotels in the San Juan area

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views but expensive and terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: YYCM
Reviews.Content: We live in Puerto Rico so we have been several times in the hotel. It is expensive for the kind of food they have (not so good). And the service is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort you never want to leave”
Reviews.Author: tracys902
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 4 times and it gets better with every stay, the resort is beautiful, well kept and offers something for everyone. We travel with a special needs daughter and have not found another hotel anywhere that the staff is so helpful and accommodating. They have helped us on numerous occasions with location, mobility issues and just wonderful kindness. It is obvious everyone enjoys working there and they all have customer satisfaction in mind. I would recomend this resort to anyone that wants to get away and relax.

Reviews.Title: “A poorly run depressed property milking every last dollar out of what few loyal guests they have left!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a sad condition for a hotel as spectacular as el conquistador used to be! Employees for the most part have little interest in guests. Consierge was snotty, wait staff were more interested in their conversations than the customers in restaurants, food was overpriced and very poorly prepared, with the exception of the really energetic and pleasant man who greeted us from the bus and Franklin at Bella vista restaurant, the staff seems to be completely depressed and act as though the hotel is about to close. My advice to anyone thinking about this hotel: guard your wallet and prepare yourself to be scammed and/or bled dry at every turn within the hotel complex. Waldorf astoria quality? No way...this is a four star run like a two.

Reviews.Title: “WE KEEP COMING BACK!!”
Reviews.Author: jechlou3
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to the El Conquistador. My husband and I went for the first time in 2006 and have been coming back ever since. When we step foot onto the property, we feel as if we are home and the staff treat us like family members. The ambience is exquisite and the accommodations are impeccable. Each year we come back, it seems like the El Conquistador has added or changed something to keep up with ever changing times. We would like to say a special thanks to staff that have gone beyond the call of duty to meet our needs. Some of the staff we would like to recognize are: Sharyl Toko, Manny (assistant manager), Jessica (front desk), Juan (in the GoldenDoor Spa), Marcia (pool side grill bartender), Diana and Shorty (Palomino Island), Omar & Joel (Ballyhoo Bar & Grill), Evelyn (barista at Marina Cafe') and many others!!!!! Every year we also go to the Golden Door Spa, this by far is the Best Spa Ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: monita814
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice - had a great time - everyone who works there also very accommodating! And if you stay there, you have to take advantage of the shuttle to Palomino Island - it's absolutely gorgeous there.

Reviews.Title: “waldorf needs to replace their v.p. f & b and guest services. clean house!!!”
Reviews.Author: PJSKAL
Reviews.Content: Hotel: El Conquistador Resort - Waldorf Astoria Hotels & Resorts Location: Fajardo Type of Trip: Leisure How satisfied were you with the... Quality of hotel service? 4 Condition and maintenance of the hotel? 2 Cleanliness of your room? 2 Comfort of your room? 2 Overall satisfaction with the hotel? 2 Would you recommend this hotel to others as a place to stay? No Review Title WALDORF PROPERTIES NEED A TOTAL REVAMPING OF MKTNG STAFF!! Hotel Review: the times we live in its vital that this property needs to be tweaked. particularly attention to details. the big money guys in new yourk got to realize and face reality. they understand the concept of charging gourmet prices but,, have no concept of gourmet food and it's presentation. my wife and i have traveled all over the world. none of the outlets at this property have any redeeming qualities. none!!! from the hamburgers , ice berg lettuce and the horrible french fries. the bar another joke. poorly mixed drinks and the mixologist doesn't even know how to make a mamma bahamma. the sting ray thanksgiving dinner was a disgrace. the strip steak house was also a flop. the steak was over broiled and tastless. the only decent restaurant came close serving the veal chop. the chines restaurant they should send the chef back to china. this property as it is today is a loser. people sittling around in the lobby eating sandwiches. pop corn was to be provided to the kids for magic night. no one took time to prepare ahead so most of the kids did get the pop corn. the cotton candy machine the girl didn't know how to operate it. upon arrival while waiting for my wife i went into the casino on roulette wheel. i sat down it was filthy and smelled with mildew.i reported it but nothing was done about it. my daughte did take time to confront the manage but, all she got was lip service. i have spent 25 years in this business and i would fire the entire f & b staff right out of corporate office. i sent a formal letter to the waldor in new york. folks do yourself a favor. save you money and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property but not a great value”
Reviews.Author: DJK81
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days here right before Thanksgiving. The property is very attractive. However, I don't feel you get much value here. Meals are expensive and the food is nothing spectacular. The only dinner restaurant we liked was the Strip House. All of the others were mediocre. Expect to pay $120 - 150 per couple for dinner at this resort. Some may like the fact that you take a ferry to the beach, but I prefer to have the beach near my room. The Palomino Beach is nice. There is one lunch place on Palomino Island and it isn't very good. Fried foods or burgers for the most part. And you'll end up with a bill of around $50 per couple to eat there. The resort property itself is very nice and there is a golf course on site. There are two large pool areas. The pools are very plain looking. This is a place that seems to cater to families. Every night you go to dinner you will have children nearby. This may or may not bother you, but don't go here expecting a quiet, romantic getaway. One other annoying thing: there are caged birds in the main lobby screeching all day. They are cute for the first five seconds, but they get on your nerves after that. Rooms are very nice and I found the service to be quite good. However, as I mentioned, this is simply not a good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for peace and no nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Diveplan
Reviews.Content: Nice setting, no beach, you had to take a ferry to the island to get some beach time. Mango drinks were terrific - however, the nightclub was only open two nights a week, so stay in your room or go gambling that was it. Waterpark was ok, three slides total. The Asian cuisine was excellent, the steaks were good too. This is a true place for couples getaway, don't go with a bunch of friends.

Reviews.Title: “The remote island is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: GringaGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I have been to this resort a few times, I always prefer to stay in the Marina area so as not to have to deal with the funiculars too much AND because it gives me the closest proximity to the hotel boat that takes guests to/from Palomino Island which is just a great escape if rest and relaxation is what you're after. It's great, clean, has full amenities such as a nice casual outdoor restaurant, tiki-type bar and opportunities to go horseback riding if you're willing to pay extra. I must add that taking a taxi to/from the airport to the resort is the more economical way to go, almost all taxi's at the airports are vans and it'll cost you about $80 each way...the resorts mega-bus costs $35pp and so with two or more people, a cab is worth it for a direct route to this resort as soon as you land. This resort has grown on me over the years...for remote relaxation, this is IT!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best, Not the Worst”
Reviews.Author: pjsubway
Reviews.Content: I had a nice time here with my 7 year old. There was plenty to keep us occupied and it was fun exploring the grounds, at least the first day. The views were amazing and the staff was perfectly efficient and pleasant to deal with. After a while, the sprawl of the place became annoying, however, expecially having to catch a funicular and two sets of elevators just to get from our room to the main lobby. We got a pretty good deal on the price of the room, but the nickel and diming added up, with the resort fee and parking (15 bucks a day and the lot was a long schlep to the main lobby). All in all, you could do worse than this place, but it wasn't exactly a high end experience, either.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to the El Conquistador Resort”
Reviews.Author: ChrisL1212
Reviews.Content: After months of online research, I finalized our vacation plans choosing Hilton's El Conquistador in Fajardo, Peurto Rico. It was gorgeous! The staff was the friendliness and most helpful we have ever encountered! We spent six beautiful days there and can't wait to return. The pools, golf course, and restaurants were of the highest quality. The views are spectacular and our teenage boys never complained about being bored! I thank all of you who waited on us, talked with us, and gave us the dream vaction of a lifetime (I wish I remembered all your names). I am so grateful to Asst. Hotel Manager, Mr. Manny Melendez, for answering all of my questions and being so patient with me when booking the trip. It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Drop dead gorgeous; service horrible”
Reviews.Author: lth37209
Reviews.Content: The hotel, the rooms, the views, were spectacular. Felt like I was in Maui. Just breathtaking in every way. The rooms are unique and wonderful. However, very long lines to check in and this was off season; no one at the Hilton Honors desk at times. Staff had a no can do attitude. Breakfast was unorganized; waiting for tables in line every morning when there were plenty of empty tables available. It seemed that the staff was practicing on us for the real season. The pool area, while very beautiful, had a cold, unfriendly atmosphere and no shaded areas. Direct sun at all times. The seating at the pool was countryclubish, and semi uncomfortable. The private beach, Palomino Island, while nice, takes too much time to access. Going on the ferry is different and fun, but again, I like a beach that you can step out your front door. If the staff had only been a little more with it, it would have been a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: puplover
Reviews.Content: I can understand the mixed reviews on this hotel because some things about it are great and some are poor. To summarize: Pros: moderate price, beautiful room, beautiful ocean view, great restaurant, close to rain forest and biobay, nice private island, great housekeeping. Cons: very remote from Old San Juan and airport, hard to find if driving, staff is not friendly, no beach on site, lame casino, poor breakfast buffet, dead in off season. Despite all the pros, I can't recommend it. The main reason is the indifference of the staff (with a few great exceptions). They seemed to resent our presence. It just took a lot of the fun out of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip (Hotel was awesome”
Reviews.Author: love_to_travel_sid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is breath taking and really did take my breath away. The views from the Hotel to the Ocean as well as being right on the nature were the highlight of this stay. I loved this hotel and this is one of our best family vacation. Highlights Private island was great experience . We swam, relaxed and overall had a great time in the clean island Hotel rooms: We were upgraded to Ocean view without additional cost as i believe this was low season. We loved the view from the room to the ocean. Hotel room design was also outstanding. Scenary: I still have pleasant memories of the resort.. Just simply beautiful. I am from new york and i haven't seen this type of beauty anywhere else in the world. This is a true statement.. :)))) Overall because of this resort, our vacation turned out to be memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in the area, but won't WOW you”
Reviews.Author: Florida-Images
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Large Rooms * Nice Grounds * Private island beach access with water clear enough for snorkeling * Several restaurant choices and a Starbucks * Good location * coquis at night. Cons: Aging Property and furniture * self parking far from hotel (must validate and take shuttle each time) * service was 50-50, below average for a self-proclaimed "resort" * few staff at the check in desk (slow) * small and limited casino * daily resort fees, parking fees, etc . all add up quickly * restaurant quality and services (overpriced and unimpressive food). Would I go back? With a decent rate, probably yes as there isn't much competition in that part of the island. Just don't inflate your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Big bucks, terrible service!!”
Reviews.Author: retep4160
Reviews.Content: We were there for a wedding. The hotel did upgrade our room from a garden view to an ocean front room in the marina but it went down from there. We have traveled all over, including Hawaii, Europe & Australia but this hotel was very expensive for what you got. Unless you decide to eat in the Steakhouse, Italian, Seafood or Chinese Restuarants, the food is terrible and NOT CHEAP! The staff is either real nice or could care less about you or your needs, there is no in between. The hotel was clean and beautiful, especially the private island, but if your looking for great service from a HILTON HOTEL, this is not the place to go!!! Stay at a Mariott!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: pal3868
Reviews.Content: The resort is a great place to keep busy for a long weekend, but I would recommend to keep it short. We were very glad that we rented a car from San Juan for less than $170 which was less expensive than 4 of us taking the bus (approx. $40 each way). The first day we toured the grounds ended up eating at the Japanese steakhouse onsite for $120/couple. Great food. The next day we hit the El Yunque rainforest and hiked to La Mina waterfalls. Great drive and beautiful hike. Before returning to the resort, I hiked the west shoreline of the Nature Reserve de las Cabezas de San Juan peninsula close to the resort entrance (5 min. north from the municipal park). Both these hikes were fantastic. That night we ate at La Estacion which is less than two minutes north of the resort entrance and offers very tasty food and quaint atmosphere ($15-25/plate). The next day we hit Palomino Island. Very nice place and very relaxing. I fished the shoreline and hiked up the hillside to find fantastic views of the waters to the north. The water is very inviting for both kids and adults. Iguana's roamed near the restaurant while we ate. I was disappointed by the food however. Not super expensive but the quality was marginal and reminded me of cafeteria food. Overall I felt that resort may have too much to offer making it difficult to maintain quality. This place is enormous with a multitude of eateries, swimming pools, and places to relax and recreate. We did not dable in the fine dining, but the "middle of the road" food was average/below-average. It doesn't take much effort to put tomatos and toppings in a mixed green salad. The concierge offered little about dining outside the resort, presumeably to keep us there. I would have enjoyed some local cuisine and live music either on the resort or in town, but we did not find it. If planning to visit, my recommendations are (1) rent a car from Target rentals; (2) do your homework in advance for dining experiences outside the resort.

Reviews.Title: “This place has bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: roh85
Reviews.Content: I just went to stayed at the El Conquistador Resort few days ago, and came back with numerous bed bug bites. I've heard rumors that this place is known to have bed bugs, and I was apprehensive to stay, but it was for a wedding. My boyfriend and I came back with MANY bug bites that DO NOT resemble mosquito bites. I've gotten them checked out and they are definitely bed bug bites. We came back and washed ALL our clothes and cleaned everything that was at the hotel. The location was okay, a bit far from San Juan airport. Everything was over priced and the food was not that great at all. We couldn't sleep well because of the noise from the hallways. They also did not clean the hotels really well. This was also my second time in Puerto Rico, and I had a better stay at the Radisson Hotel in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: LivingInLititz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for his convention. It's beautiful! The marina and shuttle boat to the private island was the best!! I felt safe the entire trip. This was our first trip to Puerto Rico and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property....Great destination”
Reviews.Author: r3sons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Conquistador for a business conference in October. We loved the resort! Absolutely beautiful location. Rooms were very nicely appointed. Beds were very comfortable. The trip to Palomino Island was a highlight. What a great place to spend an afternoon. The pools were never crowded and the service was very good. Food was very good - with diverse offerings. The Strip House and seafood restaurant at the marina were favorites. The Martini Bar had great drinks and the barenders were so attentive. If you go, make sure to do the Bioluminescent Kayaking tour. Really a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel despite a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: ABLJ
Reviews.Content: Grounds and the drive in to the hotel: 5 stars! (If you're a golfer, then 6 stars!) Rooms: large, clean, stylish, great views, not that "charming" in decor, but its a matter of taste Complex amenities: Casino, many pools open late, shops, restaurants, gym, a starbucks, a private beach, water sports, golf, tennis, horseback riding...everything! Service/Staff: Excellent, friendly, competent, honest, proactive, attentive, fast! Other: The sound of coqui chirping away is really nice, and if you keep your ears open you can even see one in the outdoor passageways. Complaints: â€”Parking should be free ($15/day self park, $25 valet)...and the lot is a distance from the entry, though there is a very frequent shuttle â€”The breakfast buffet is really uninspired, food not very tasty and not a single vegetable to be found (though the service is very good) â€”The funicular going up and down is convenient and fun...for about 2 days, (4 days if you have kids)....then it gets a little bit annoying. â€”There is free internet in the lobby area, but you have to pay in the rooms. Hate when expensive hotels pull that one. Add at least an extra $30/day if you park and need internet in room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Eastsider33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Conquistador in early October and loved it. Hotel setting is spectacular and there is no need to leave resort if you donâ€™t want to. It is a little over an hour drive from San Juan airport and once you get there, you will be amazed at the view over looking the ocean. This resort is absolutely beautifull. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The ocean view is absolutely breathtaking, so many different shades of blue. Hotel staff and especially the front desk staff were very helpful. Every time we asked for something they called back. Palomino Island was awesome as were breakfast at Las Brisas and dinner at La Piccola Fontana. it is a big resort, so you have some walking to do to take in the surroundings. You can take a quick walk outside the resort to some local restaurants and enjoy their food, donâ€™t expect great service there. the golf course was fund and challenging but worth it. The ferry ride to the island of palomino was also real nice and worth the time. Outside of the price for food and other thing everything else was just perfect. I would strongly recommend El Conquistador for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Destination”
Reviews.Author: Chicag0Grandma
Reviews.Content: We traveled last Christmas with a large extended family - ages 5 to 69. This was a perfect destination. The hotel has a separate island which is reachable by a short ride on the hotel ferry. At the Palamino Island site there is plenty of shade, a beachside restaurant, volleyball, and water toys for rent. The beach is wide and not crowded. The whole family went for the day and was sorry when it was time to take the ferry back to the hotel. There is also an entire water park with various slides and a lazy river feature. This provided another whole day of fun for the entire family. There is a charge for entrance to this water park, but it was a nice way to vary the days. If you do not want to pay extra for the water park, there are plenty of beautiful swimming pools available. We also used the tennis facility and loved it. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable. We went on 2 "outings" while there. The first was the rain forest for hiking. The second was a night-time canoe trip to the luminescent pool. Both were relatively close by and a nice family outing. The night-time canoe triip might be too late for the very young. The food choices/restaurants offered great variety. We expeciallhy enjoyed the teppan-style dining where the chef entertained us all with his knife skills! I would definitely recommend this hotel for a family destination!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family property”
Reviews.Author: misscyndi13
Reviews.Content: The rooms are unique, clean, comfortable, bright and accommodates a family of 4 easily. The property was safe and teenager friendly. We enjoyed, the many pools, tennis courts, the ride over to the private island, and all the wonderful amenities. We did venture out to the rain forest, and Old San Juan in a rented car which the hotel concierge booked for us. The staff was wonderful, the morning brunch was delicious and filling for each of us. I recommended this property for friends who were celebrating their 50th anniversary and traveled with their grown children and their young grandchildren They all enjoyed the property and all it offered no matter what age.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious views, service, beach, food, and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: crewsp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our two teenage boys completely enjoyed our 8 day stay, during the beginning of August 2010. The hotel service was exceptional, the only flaw involved how busy the front desk is - all the time. But I guess that comes with being such a desirable resort. Every staff person we encountered was happy to help and very knowledgeable. The food at the better restaurants was everything you expect, and the choices were sufficient to keep us on property all 8 days.

Reviews.Title: “View to Die for from Las Casitas Resort”
Reviews.Author: GJGPrescott
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Las Casitas Resort immediately adjacent to the El Conquistador. Las Casitas guests have full access to all El Conquistador facilities including Palomino Island. We stayed in room 5250 (2 br/2 bath and a full kitchen). Beautiful unit (granite and stainless steel appliances in the kitchen) with a 100% unobstructed view of the ocean and nearby islands from a large (400 sq ft?) and 100% private covered patio. Having the kitchen limited the damage which would have otherwise resulted from high resort food prices. Shop at Amigo or Pueblo grocery stores in town. The room was not perfect (broken door knob, missing iron, etc), but very nice. Despite other reviews to the contrary, our three girls adored the water park which was nearly deserted on a Wednesday in October. Visit the Las Cabezas de San Juan Reserve in Fajardo during your stay. World class reserve featuring Mangrove forests and the oldest operational light house in Puerto Rico which has been meticulously restored. English tour available if you call in advance.

Reviews.Title: “hotel good + Palomino Island = very good”
Reviews.Author: Sherry B
Reviews.Content: There are great things about this hotel and frustrating things but over all for the deal that I got it made it more enjoyable. This is a resort and in resorts you will pay costly for food....bottom line. The most frustrating thing is that the resort is very secluded and there are no taxis.....anywhere. You are completely stranded unless you rent a car. Not to mention if you want to walk, there are points where there are no side walks. It's not very safe. The only real option to get out of the hotel is the side road near the ferry. It has a gate but it wasn't locked when we went through it. Even if it is locked all you need is your hotel key. You can walk down to some restaurants/bars. Almost all restaurants were closed during the week (not sure if this is just a low season thing or not). We took the Bio tour from Kayak Puerto Rico there...which was amazing. We reserved a spot for the mini boat tours (which is located in Puerto Chico...also near by but not walking distance). We took the hotel van (which charged us $15 for a 3 min. trip) not exactly knowing how we would get back but prepared to walk. Unfortunately we could not take the boats out that day due to weather conditions. We ended up eating at a restaurant at the dock and having a great time (Charlie the owner is awesome!). Palomino Island is so great! It really makes this hotel worth visiting. We went horseback riding on the island (up to the highest point and then down to the beach which was fun). I looked forward to this trip every day because it felt as if we were leaving the hotel (there is no charge for the ferry). Overall It is definitely not the most beautiful hotel I've ever been in. The food was ok. The only problem with the bill was we were over charged $12 which was quickly corrected (we saved our receipts). Some places take credit cards, some take cash... so have both (there is a couple of ATM's in the hotel)...you can charge everthing to the room if you wish. Our room was in Las Brisas and we had an amazing view. To sum it up....there was nothing bad about the hotel...and the good was so good that it made it worthwhile....if you get a good deal on the room!

Reviews.Title: “So much to do, with a hypnotic view!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingMichigander
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (forty-year old women) went to El Conquistador in July for a 5 day stay. We had a blast -- though the hotel doesn't have a beach, it has a ferry to a beautiful private island. The pool was large, the spa treatments were wonderful, and we got a free buffet breakfast every day. We were also within walking distance of town, where we were able to go on a bio-bay kayaking tour and had a great meal (WAY cheaper than the restaurants at the hotel - wish we would have discovered how close it was sooner!). The hotel's food was good, and we tried several of the restaurants, but we didn't get to try typical Puerto Rican dishes until we ventured off site. Cons: We didn't get the two double beds we requested, and because the hotel was full, we ended up with a king and an air mattress (my friend snores very loudly and we didn't want to share a bed). The hotel was packed (not their fault) so breakfast was really crazy. The last ferry leaves the island too early -- it would have been nice to be there until dinner/sunset. The drinks were very expensive, like on a cruise (to be expected, but still, a big added expense). Some of the common areas, like the elevators and lights, were sometimes less than clean or in disrepair. Pros: Beautiful view, pool, friendly staff, facilities were in good shape, everything on site you might need. The airport shuttle was prompt, and the hotel's island was incredible. The spa was surprisingly empty for such a crowded weekend, but the services were top notch. The gardens and grounds were lovely. I would definitely go back, and knowing how close the town is, would venture out sooner and have some great Puerto Rican food for a lot less money. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Mallvacation
Reviews.Content: WhenÂ IÂ bookedÂ thisÂ tripÂ thenÂ startedÂ readingÂ theÂ reviewsÂ IÂ startedÂ toÂ getÂ worryÂ andÂ concernÂ becauseÂ ofÂ theÂ neg.Â ReviewsÂ andÂ IÂ didn'tÂ wantÂ myÂ kidsÂ toÂ beÂ eatenÂ byÂ bedÂ bugsÂ IÂ wasÂ readyÂ toÂ cancelÂ itÂ soÂ myÂ expectationÂ wasÂ reallyÂ low.Â WhenÂ weÂ gotÂ thereÂ itÂ wasÂ aÂ pleasant surprise.Â Â TheÂ hotelÂ itselfÂ wasÂ beautifulÂ andÂ theÂ scenaryÂ wasÂ breatheÂ taking.Â JustÂ theÂ drivingÂ toÂ theÂ mainÂ entranceÂ hasÂ aÂ amazingÂ viewÂ ofÂ theÂ greatÂ golfÂ course. Â ifÂ uÂ areÂ aÂ golferÂ uÂ shouldÂ playÂ here.Â WhenÂ weÂ checkÂ inÂ itÂ onlyÂ tookÂ 10Â minsÂ orÂ lessÂ .Â AllÂ theÂ staffÂ wasÂ alwaysÂ friendlyÂ andÂ NEVERÂ rudeÂ atÂ all.Â IÂ evenÂ talkedÂ withÂ theÂ managersÂ andÂ theyÂ wereÂ theÂ bestÂ becauseÂ theyÂ areÂ soÂ willingÂ toÂ hearÂ urÂ concernÂ andÂ tryÂ toÂ makeÂ uÂ feel relaxÂ andÂ notÂ toÂ worryÂ aboutÂ anyÂ thing.Â WhenÂ weÂ gotÂ toÂ theÂ roomÂ everythingÂ weÂ pre-askÂ forÂ wasÂ setÂ upÂ inÂ theÂ roomÂ theÂ roomÂ wasÂ veryÂ cleanÂ andÂ nice.Â RecommendationÂ makeÂ sureÂ toÂ bookÂ aÂ oceanÂ viewÂ roomÂ becauseÂ theÂ viewÂ isÂ AMAZING!!!!Â ThisÂ resortÂ isÂ veryÂ bigÂ andÂ IÂ canÂ seeÂ howÂ hardÂ itÂ isÂ toÂ keepÂ itÂ maintainÂ plusÂ beingÂ inÂ tropicalÂ placeÂ itÂ willÂ haveÂ someÂ effectÂ onÂ buildingÂ likeÂ cracksÂ andÂ stuffÂ butÂ ifÂ uÂ justÂ ignoreÂ thoseÂ littleÂ thingsÂ thenÂ uÂ willÂ haveÂ aÂ greatÂ time.Â  TheÂ privateÂ beachÂ wasÂ reallyÂ niceÂ  andÂ cleanÂ .Â TheÂ funcularÂ wasÂ funÂ forÂ theÂ kidsÂ likedÂ itÂ iÂ reallyÂ doÂ wishÂ beforeÂ theÂ ferryÂ leaveÂ theyÂ shouldÂ checkÂ ifÂ anyoneÂ isÂ inÂ thereÂ soÂ theyÂ canÂ waitÂ forÂ themÂ beforeÂ theyÂ leavingÂ becauseÂ weÂ missedÂ itÂ aboutÂ 3Â timesÂ andÂ allÂ thoseÂ timesÂ weÂ wereÂ inÂ theÂ funcular. TheÂ poolsÂ hadÂ theÂ warmest Â waterÂ theÂ kidsÂ andÂ adultsÂ reallyÂ enjoyedÂ itÂ everynightÂ ,Â noÂ oneÂ wasÂ thereÂ andÂ itÂ wasÂ veryÂ clean. IÂ doÂ agreeÂ theÂ foodÂ andÂ drinksÂ areÂ veryÂ expensiveÂ butÂ it'sÂ prettyÂ standardÂ priceÂ forÂ aÂ resort. The free breakfast help a lot and it was good.Â  OverallÂ allÂ theÂ neg.Â ReviewsÂ IÂ readÂ hereÂ IÂ didn'tÂ experienceÂ itÂ atÂ allÂ IÂ lovedÂ thisÂ placeÂ andÂ IÂ willÂ recommendÂ thisÂ resortÂ justÂ makeÂ sureÂ uÂ getÂ oceanÂ viewÂ andÂ rentÂ aÂ car!Â Â Â Â Â Â

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Nikita141
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay and my room had a breathtaking view. The bed and sheets felt like heaven. Our bellhop, Jose, was awesome, very caring and attentive. And the manager Manny, also went above and beyond taking his time to visit us in our room upon check in and stayed a while explaining where things were located, he gave us ideas on things to do and places to go. Absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay At The El Conquistador!”
Reviews.Author: MS1Charlotte
Reviews.Content: We stay at this awesome resort every year. The service is always very good but this year it was absolutely the best ever! Every where, the front desk, bell hop services, restaurants and especially the out door bars/grills, outside by the main pool area. Late night the outside bar serves great brick oven pizzas. Perfect after leaving the casino late and still wanting some thing to eat. My Son and I recommend the Margherita with fresh prosciutto. Wonderful!!! As always, Palomino Island was beautiful. This is the resort's own private island, they ferry ride you out to it. One day I took a walk on the beach on the far side of the island. There was no one else around, it was amazing just walking through the blue waters all by myself. You talk about peaceful! I can go on and on about what a great resort The El Conquistador is. It's really some thing one needs to experience on their own. If you are looking for a wonderful Puerto Rico vacation, don't spend a lot of time looking all over for resorts to stay at. You Just Can't Miss If You Stay At The El Conquistador!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: JAM23_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to book this hotel for a couple of days for our honeymoon getaway. The hotel itself was beautiful and the scenary was breathe taking. However, the service "Sucked" for the lack of better wording. Most of the employees at the hotel were rude and lacked customer service..There were exceptions like the front desk person, Damaris, who was outstanding and the bartender, Kathy, from the main pool bar..Furthermore, if you're looking for great customer service, then this hotel is not the one. On a positive note, we had a room with the oceanview that was great..Our room was spacious and very clean. We even had a balcony where we could relax and just take in the beautiful view of the carribean. Thank God for the room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away. Stay Far Away.”
Reviews.Author: Bonefish25
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a long weekend (9/24-9/27/2010) because we were coming to meet friends that were staying here. We booked on the phone, with the reservation department at the hotel, two months in advance of our arrival. We requested a room in the main area of the resort "Closest to the casino." I know this request was in their system because they read it back to us exactly upon check in. I told them our friends were in Las Brisas, and requested a room in the same building. I did not ask for a view, upgrade, etc. They informed us that there was nothing available in that building. I asked for something close by, and they offered us an "upgrade" to a full ocean view. Can you imagine our suprise when we are lead ten minutes away, down the funicular, to the building furthest away from where we wanted to be? And when we opened the curtains our "full ocean view" was blocked by the tops of 2 giant palm trees and the roof of the building in front of us! We were tired, and didn't argue. After all, we weren't actually paying any more for the room. We cleaned up, met our friends at a restaurant off campus called Passion Something (excuse my limited Spanish skills and spelling). It was quite good and close by, and advertisements can be found in the hotel literature. Although for the price conscious, it is not inexpensive if you include an appitizer and cocktails, plus the tip for valet if you rented a car. The portions are very generous there...it seems if you went with a group you could order a few things, share and be satisfied. The next morning (Friday) we went to Palomino Island on the ferry. This is a real downer if you want a convenient beach, but there are restrooms (ladies was very clean between 10:00am and 1:00pm when we left), a little cafe offering cocktails and a limited lunch menu (simple, decent) and the beach itself was very clean when we arrived, looks like they rake the sand every morning. Our friend requested that our room be changed (he is a diamond hilton member) and they graciously accomodated us for the rest of the stay with a room in the same building as our friends. The gentlemen at the Hilton desk was very nice, said he would call us when the room was ready, and did so. He even sent the new keys down with a bellman. A word about the rooms: slightly dingy would be the best way to describe them, although we encountered no actual filth in either room. The sheets were clean, smelled clean, if not perfectly pristine white (few light marks but it's a hotel), and the bed was made nicely. The wear is obvious on the vinyl white upholstery and the throw pillows. Bathrooms: Not exactly modern. They are cleaned up and decorated to look modern, but the actual bathtubs (in both Marina and Las Brisas) and the toilet (in the Marina) were old. The bathroom set-up in the Marina room was better with a private toilet closet, because both rooms have the main clothes closet in the bathroom...tough for more than one person to get ready, use facilities at a time. In addition, the refrigerator and "bar" area was in the bathroom of the Las Brisas room, making it a large but strangely multi-purpose space. The Pools: Saturday was something. I know it is the busiest day in the resort, as lots of local / weekend vacationers are there. But I don't think all of the people using the facilities were actual guests. Not too sure what the story is there. The later it got in the afternoon, the more chaotic it got. Sunday was calmer, although there was trash in the pool (like plastic fork wrappers, plastic cups, etc) that multiple employees walked by. I picked it out of the pool myself because I couldn't stand looking at it anymore. Unacceptable. Pool Towels: Thin, faded and dirty looking. Dotted with gray marks and dirt stains everywhere. Time to invest in some new towels. Sunday we discovered that the hotel had checked us out of our room without our knowledge. We had a reservation for 4 nights (3 booked on points, the last paid for) and we let them know this upon check in, and were assured it would not be a problem. So, when my boyfriend went up to the room that afternoon, he had to go to the desk, where they told him he had to check out and check in again. So he signed the bill (after telling them to take parking charges off...we had no car), signed the imprinted copy of the credit card, and then asked to be checked back in. The desk receptionist then informed him he needed a credit card to check back in. Which, even though he had signed the imprinted copy of his own card in her presence, was a big problem, because our credit cards were locked in the safe in our room which we no longer had a working key for. Really. I can't make this up. A word on your bill: If you must go, read it closely! They tried to hit us with parking charges again the next day when we checked out for real. Other notes: The jacuzzi was filthy. It looked okay from where you enter, but the handrail was attached only to the top of the stairs. It had completely broken off the bottom of the whirlpool. Anyone for a tetnus shot? Not to mention there was mold (not a little...dark green and A LOT OF IT) all over as well as a good deal of trash left over in the bushes by some previous occupants. This is not only unpleasant, but that handrail was absolutely unsafe. Sitting at the pool bar: The wood finish is chipping and unmaintained and a real turn off--especially because it's an easy fix, and you are staring right at it while eating or drinking. Also noticed that every cocktail napkin that I got, at every public area bar, without exception said "Lexis Nexis" on it. I am sure they had a convention there, but they weren't there when we were there. For a name like the Waldorf Astoria, I saw nothing that even reminded guests where they were staying. Way to brand, Hilton Group. I actually asked the bartender when the Lexis Nexis convention was in town and he said, "I can't even remember." Whether they were there the day before we showed up or three months ago, it's not a good sign. The website: The pictures actually look nice, but when you arrive you will see that everything, everything needs a fresh coat of paint. Also, looks like there were at one time lots of retail stores that have gone out of business in the main lobby area. Kind of desolate. Bottom Line: This place is a big waste of time. It is a two star resort at best. If you are travelling from far away, skip it, spend a little more at a better hotel, and save yourself the extra money and inconvenience of having to rent a car and park or take a cab or shuttle an hour or more to this hotel (did I mention the traffic? Lots of road construction going on now.) You can do much better for your time and money than this place, even if you think the hotel rate is a "deal". I know it stinks to give a place a bad review, especially since I really wanted to enjoy this. And I travel a good deal. Not everything is going to be great, all the time. I understand the toll humidy and weather in the Caribbean takes on a property. I understand and welcome the concept of "Island Time". But there were so many incidents (even more than I wrote, and I've been writing a long time) that I felt like I was vacationing in a hostile environment. Outside of a few stand-out employees, a beautiful view from our second hotel room balcony (unexpected but a nice treat) this is not a place I would recommend to my worst enemy. Well...maybe my WORST enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: KIDSMD
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 wonderful nights at El Con.Nowhere to be found any of the Horror stories that I being reading at this site before the trip.After reading some of the reviews I was kind of concern & was ready to lower my expectations,to my surprise everything went really well. First : travel during low season,preferible monday to friday.Hotel gets super busy on weekends do to the conventions & local tourists.Watch for the weather but dont be scared.In PR rains almost every day but wait an hour & the sun will be out again. Check In: 10 min.Super Friendly Staff. Room : ocean view,Large,nice bathroom ,Walk in closet,Confy beds.Did I mention the view? NO BED BUGS!!! NO DIRTY LINNENS !!!! Very cold AC. I agree that the maintenance need some improvement,but this is a beach resort in the tropics,so I will expect some moist smell or the occational carpet stain or peeling paint. I also agree that this is not Waldorf Astoria luxury or service,but this was not WA prices neither.We paid 500 dollars for an ocean view room for 4 nights included breakfast for 3.taxes & resorts fees.I call that Hollyday Inn prices, not WA prices. Food,Drinks,Shops & Room service-Resorts Prices.With breakfast included,We just snacked light for lunch & dined out at incredible local places. La Estacion , Ole Lelolai & Pasion , just to name a few,WONDERFUL & CHEAP !!!!! Also You can buy your drinks & Water from the local supermarket. Always able to find parking close by at the upper part of the lot.Easy walk from the main hotel. Palominos Island & the boat ride to it,very refreshing. One morning there where only a docen people at the beach. And more than once had the pool to ourselves.Did not go to water park.Not a golfer , not a gambler.
