Rent a car.Will allow You to go out for dinner and take day trips to san Juan , El Yunque , Luquillo and the Bio Bay. We will for sure be back,again during low season & during week days.

Reviews.Title: “We found paradise”
Reviews.Author: golfinggirl0000
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the negative reviews we were very concerned about our first trip to puerto rico. We were worried for no reason and I wish I had not read the very negative comments because they are so far from the truth. Our experience has been wonderful; the grounds and views are breathtaking; a tropical paradise. The staff has been welcoming and very kind. The food and drinks are pricey but good, as it is in most hotels - even the upscale ones. After traveling the world and Caribbean islands I would recommend this property to my family and friends. Don't pay attention to the negative diatribe and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: sawsawdei
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view, we got out upgrades. Breakfast is excellent, a lot of fruits.. Staffs are very polite and friendly.. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Our (well-thought-out) trip was great!”
Reviews.Author: Canny-family
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property that you will enjoy more if you're canny about what you choose to spend your money on. Go during the off season and you can get a great price on your stay (we used cheap caribbean.com and got airfare from detroit, a room upgrade and free breakfasts for $449 per person for 5 days plus tax and tips). Rent a car at the airport and manage your own excursions. If you walk 10 mins. out the back gate from the hotel's marina, there are a couple of good restaurants and food stands and you can book a tour of the bio-luminescent bay there. Music in the bars there at night. Stock your mini fridge with snacks and drinks. We loved eating at some of the 60 kioskas (mini restaurants) at Luquillo Beach--local cheap tasty and fattening! The not too distant El Yunque National rainforest has waterfalls and no admission fee. There is a big outlet mall if you like that sort of thing. We used valet parking for $20 + tip rather than self parking for $15 each in-and-out because it was where we chose to have our little luxury. The hotel restaurant menus looked expensive but no more so than the fine dining places we went to in San Juan. Food is more expensive on islands. Catamarans to the private island and beach activities are free and run every hour from 9 to 3, last one returning by 5 --not sure if those are just the off season times. It was dark out by 7pm--but the beach property was great! Lots of activities there too. Several swimming pools including one with a swim-up bar-- drinks are a bit pricey but it was part of the experience. There is a free DVD player in the room (remember to plug in the connectors in the back) so we brought a few DVD's for nights when we were too tired to do much more. Our room and bathroom were very clean. We always tip room cleaners generously and in advance and seem to get great service. We also said Buenos Dias and Gracias a lot. September is hurricane season but we had beautiful weather. Historically, a big one hits PR once in 20 years--We took the risk. It rains every afternoon for about 10 minutes and then it stops. There weren't that many families with kids when we went, perhaps because of the time of year. We never bothered with the spa or waterpark so can't comment on those. Our service was great and overall we had a fabulous time. We would come again and would recommend El Conquistador to others: but don't be at the mercy of a hotel to provide your good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but BYO fun”
Reviews.Author: Cooberson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on the weekend of sept. 10, and right smack in horrible weather conditions. The drive is enjoyable for the most part, but after the highway ends, kind of challenging. Valet parking and guest parking is $20 a day, which considering how far it is from everything is a shame. My room was in the lower section, which has to be accessed by: one elevator, one funicular (kind of fun, but dangerous when it starts), and another elevator. The view is amazing and the room is very comfy and high. I needed a Microwave and it was brought within 15 minutes at no charge. There is a mini fridge, but as hotels go, they are no worth it. The room's A/C started failing and the technicians went above and beyond to make sure it was comfortable. My sole complaint is the room service, did not see them and only changed towels of our room. That said, you need to bring/make your own party, because by yourself, you'll be bored as hell. Palomino island rules, but if you bring food, you need to sneak it in.

Reviews.Title: “THIEVES.........”
Reviews.Author: CCT0325
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place...that was our first reaction...what a nice room..a little run down, but gorgeous 6th floor view of water, bay, golf course, mountains....THEN, they get you...prices are a good 40% more than your average rip-off hotel...($15 hamburger + $7 for fries!!!) however...we are STILL trying to get false charges and overcharges corrected...doubt I will ever get my money back....they refused to accept gift cards as payment...they mandate you leave a $400 deposit for 'daily expenses" and you need to watch each and every charge to your room...we were charged for two meals when only one of us even went to breakfast...we were charged twice for a tip: the one we added to the bill, and they they added ANOTHER ONE!!!!! Now I have just found a fraudulent charge on a gift card THEY REFUSED TO ACCEPT!!!! Guess they changed their minds! (They had kept a photocopy of it, for some obscure reason..now we know why!!) If you MUST go, get a printout every day to check charges to your room/credit card!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too big to be maintained properly or offer good service”
Reviews.Author: tripladyboston
Reviews.Content: This Waldorf Astoria resort was a disappointment. We are usually very happy with these hotels which usually offer excellent service in a wonderful location. The location of El Conquistador is great for water views from most locations. The resort is not located on a sandy beach. They own Palameno Island which is lovely and offer a boat to get you over to the island. Once there they offer everything you need. The boat ride takes about 10-15 minutes. The beach and pool towels need to be replaced, they are very thin, stained and many have holes. The customer service was average. The staff and bellmen were friendly at check-in, but we had 2 issues during our stay which were not addressed at all. First, there was no shower liner just a fabric curtain so during every shower the bathroom flooded with water. This got no response. Secondly, there was a very hard, long rain storm. We were in a La Marina room on the top floor. Water was pouring down from the ceiling and walls in the toilet room and we had to put many towels on the floor which couldn't even contain the water. Again I called with NO response. They should have at least come to mop up the water and remove all the wet towels. If you are looking for an affordable vacation this is for you but don't expect ANY extras or the staff to be very worried about your needs. You are on your own once you arrive to this huge resort. There are MANY shops, restaurants, a casino etc but not up to the standards of a Waldorf Astoria at all. Many of the buildings etc need to be painted. I would not rush back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, excellent service, lots of fun activities!”
Reviews.Author: MelvinandAngelina
Reviews.Content: Great place for honeymoon or just a romantic getaway! There is horseback riding, scubadiving, snorkeling among the beautiful coral, and exotic sealife, amazing restaurants and room service, and much more! We even rented a kayak, and went to a private little island belonging to the resort. It was a beautiful, white sand beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but some aspects are overpriced”
Reviews.Author: fynexio
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at El Con twice with my daughter (age 12). I agree with what other travelers have said. If you get a room with a view it is spectacular. The food, however, is extremely expensive from the Starbucks, the ice cream parlor, to the pool restaurants to the restaurant on Palomino Island. The rooms do not have refrigerators and they do not allow you to bring in coolers, so it is hard to economize on the food aspect. I rented a car and tended to go off premises to eat. I agree that it is ridiculous to pay to park, adding to the expense. We went horseback riding on Palomino Island (which is beautiful and snorkeling is great) but it was too expensive for a 1/2 hour ride. It is nice to have pool, water park, ferry & private island all in one and the grounds are beautiful, but you should use any deals and discounts (AAA) you can for your stay here and either plan on high expenses for food or go off premises.

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever!!”
Reviews.Author: DannyM4
Reviews.Content: Wish there would have been more time to explore the whole thing but the service was awesome and the islands off the coast were a nice plus!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid carribbean in summer - especially this place”
Reviews.Author: ramsvacations
Reviews.Content: We arrived very tired after a long flight at 3:30pm, a bit early for the 4pm checkin time. However, they did not have a room available and gave lot of silly reasons such as the room is being 'inspected' etc. and delayed us till 5pm. we were so exhausted by then we skipped all other activities for the day. Like several reviewers said, we discovered just how terrible tasteless the food was - especially if you don't like sharing dinner with cats, birds and flying insects. The saving grace was the included morning breakfast buffet where we could find something or other to fill us up. Like a lot of others, we rented a car rather than use the shuttle. Rental was a hustle and parking was a BIG hassle, but it allowed us to stock up on water (most Caribbean places skimp on water and charge so much for it?!) - a 20oz bottle costs $3.50 in the room. We also ate dinner outside on all days after the first day fiasco. El Estacion and Metro were good. We drove to El Yunque rain forest, which was quite nice. Beware of a very very long trek to the LaMina falls. We also went to the bioluminescent tour on Kayak. BEWARE of this trip if you are not an expert kayaker. Imagine kayaking in pitch darkness in the narrow pathways in mangrove forest with oncoming kayaks who cant see you either. However, I was impressed with the bioluminescent spectacle. On our last day we were nearly engulfed by hurricane Earl and they shut off the resort Funicular service, a cable trolley service to lower levels and moved several people to upper level. We had to use the room service to retrieve bags from the room. The resort beach was terrible, with sharp stones in sand and dead corral reefs very close to surface making it unpleasant to be in the water. A word of warning if you are thinking of renting from Enterprise car rental at San Juan airport. Itâ€™s a classic bait and switch service. We got advertised quote of $10 per day. Our total bill for 4 days after all the hidden fees etc? $281 !.. go figure. After identifying a billing errors such as billing us GPS they did not provide and billing for 5 days instead of 4 for being an hour late over the 12pm deadline etc, we still paid over $200. The car had severe wheel balancing problem so we had to restrict driving to minimum distances. The rental agency would not provide a replacement claiming nothing else was available. We feel we'd have enjoyed Puerto Rico better if we had stayed elsewhere and not taken Enterprise rental.

Reviews.Title: “If this is your last option, go camping”
Reviews.Author: Seasonedtraveler2854
Reviews.Content: E Conquistador Hotel is like a trap set by a beautiful person who happens to be a "Vampire". There is no doubt that the location of this hotel is outstanding, simply a beautiful setting; but from there everything else is terrible. I grew up in Puerto Rico and I am used to the lay back attitude but the attitude of the service personnel at most of the facilities at this hotel was simply rude to say the least. With the exeception of Anna at the Hilton Honors Desk, giving the greeting of the day by the rest of the service personnel was not something they are acustomed to doing...that was clear. The bar tenders at the Iguana Grill in Palomino Island were not just unfriendly, they were "hostile" and lacked common courtesy skills. We travelled with my elderly mother who is 85 and has trouble walking and when we asked for a wheel chair to pick her up, the front desk asked for a $100 dollar deposit!!!! Now, that's service isn't? But wait, the only evening we were there we used the services of the Valet Parking but when we went to retrieve our three vehicles, they could not find one and 45 minutes later and after losing our reservatio at a local restaurant, we told them to forget it and re-park the other two vehicles; that we were staying at the hotel to eat dinner. But wait, the next day when we went to retrieve the vehicles to go to the airport, they could not find the 15 passenger van and after one hour my wife drove to the lot where the valet parking vehicles were parked and had to point to the vehcile....never mind that we had described the van as a "15 Passenger White Van with big blue letters on each side that read THRIFTY.COM" When I approached the hotel management for help since we were going to miss our flight, the management told me that the Valet Parking Attendants did not work for the hotel, that there services were subcontracted to another company. This hotel should not be part of the "Waldorf Astoria Collection" I have received better service at roadside motels!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: precious_gurl
Reviews.Content: I recently went here for a long weekend trip with a friend. We got a good deal on cheapcaribbean.com so I was pleased. I was expecting a higher standard since this is a Waldorf Astoria collection resort, but overall I was pleased. The rooms could use some upkeep but the grounds are lovely and the views are amazing. I wouldn't pay full price for this place but if you can score a good deal, I don't think you'll be disappointed. Oh, and the service was excellent, once you could get them on the phone...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds...but won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: costarica08
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a week long stay at the El Conquistador in Puerto Rico. We stayed there from August 25th through Sept 1st. Before leaving, I was a little worried due to all of the bad reviews I had read. We figured what the heck, there were also good ones, so we hoped our experience would turn out to be good as well. We're both very easy going. So I figured we'd be akay. I will start with all of the good things about the hotel before ending with my one big complaint. The ride to the hotel wasn't as bad as I had read in recent reviews. We did rent a car from Entrerprise and that saved us alot of money. We rented it for 8 days and it came out to $150.00 total. We did opt for the insurance which I recomend, because people in Puerto Rico do not follow the law when it comes to driving!! It took us no more than 45 minutes to get to the hotel. On the way to the hotel, we stopped at Wallmart and stocked up on beer, water and snacks. Everything at the hotel was expensive. Even thier Starbucks was double the price we pay. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and the grounds are beuatiful. We never encountered anyone rude. We stayed in a room in the Las Vistas area. which is right next to the main hotel. It was perfect. We didn't have a view of the ocean or the pools but we had a view of the golf course and since my boyfriend is a big golfer, he was happy. The hotel is very big and spread out. We were really close to the entrance of the hotel and because of that, we were close to starbucks, shops, restaurants, casino and pools. The Marina area would have been nice too, but if you're staying there, you have to take the funicular and walk just to get to those areas. We visited Palomino island and it was gorgeous! We never waited more than 5 minutes for the funicular and maybe 10 for the ferry. The ride to the island was very enjoyable. The water at the island was clear and the weather was great. We did have lunch there which was about $40.00 for two of us. The food was prertty good. This was the first of only two meals we had at the resort. Our second was at the bar and grill which is located at the marina right by the ferry entrance. The food was okay. Not great and a bit expensive. Right outside of the resort, turn right and about 5 minutes away, you"ll find La Estacion. Very nice atmosphere and great food. probably the best we had the whole time we were there. They are open from 5pm until midnight everyday with the exception of Thursday. they are closed completely on Thursdays. It's not a ten dollar meal but for the price, the food is great and the portions are pretty big. I believe we spent around $80.00 total for dinner and drinks. Highly recomended. As far as parking goes, they do charge which we think is a total rip off. I would think that if you're already paying for the room, parking should be included. We parked illegally in the Enterprise parking lot and walked a little ways to our room. We didn't mind it at all. You're not supposed to park there unless you rent the car from the hotel which is alot more expensive than doing so by the airport. Park there. They will never know. There isn't much to do at the hotel after hours. The casino closes early and the night club was no night club at all. It was empty everytime we walked by. My biggest complaint of all, like so many others have mentioned before, is the housekeeping service. Housekeeping is in desperate need of new managment or new employees. I have to say, the bed was very comfortable. Our room was a little moldy, but that was ecpected after reading recent reviews. The bathroom needed a good cleaning. Especially the tub. Not once did anyone vaccumn, sweep or mop our room in the 8 days we were there. And our sheets although clean, were not changed until I requested them to be a few days later. I understand that sheets aren't changed daily, but they should be changed at least once in 8 days without being requested. I purposely, left pieces of lint and string that had fallen on the carpet and bathroom floors, on the floor, hoping it would be picked up. It never was. Housekeeping is BAD!! All in all, our vacation was great. Hurricane Earl hit close to the end of our vacation. The day that the hurricane hit the island, we stayed at the hotel all day and I have to give it them, they set up a game room where people could hang out and play games. They also played a movie for the kids. They had coffee, tea and popcorn. It was a good idea considering people were stuck indoors all day. The hotel iitself s nice but it's in need of some serious updating. Especially the rooms. And housekeeping needs to be supervised. We would love to return to Puerto Rico, but we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but beautiful scenary”
Reviews.Author: sa2000sha
Reviews.Content: The views surrounding this resort are simply amazing. I've never seen more beautiful surrounding in my life and I've traveled a lot. And if this is all you care about, then go for it. However, restaurants (and everything else) in this resort is redicuolosly overpriced. The small bottle of water goes for $3.50, two eggs breakfast costs $17 and small glass of orange juice is another $3.50. Me and my 10years old easily spent $500 on food in 5 days and we normally would share appetizer and one main dish and never order any drinks besides juice or water. They charge $20 per person for their own water park that consists of three water slides and lazy river. This is per day, not per stay. Service is very poor. The first thing you hear from a waiter is a reminder that tip is %15 and not included. Waterpark closes at 6pm, however at 5:30 I was told that they just put a bunch of chemicals in the pool and they don't want any people to be in it. The rooms are big, but run down. Dirty carpet, stains on the bed sheets. The pool towels needed to be replaced years ago. My daughter refused to use them at all. Beach at the private island is nice, however boats go there only once in a hour, so you have to wait in long line sometimes under the hot PR sun. Internet also costs money and the same about parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: lsbaylor
Reviews.Content: Although I'm sure this hotel is nice for some, my husband I chose to stay at this hotel after seeing the lovely pictures online and knowing the reputation of the Waldorf Astoria brand...let's just say we expected a certain level of quality. The drive up to the hotel was lovely, but as soon as we walked in the door it was downhill. The hotel needs a facelift, some deep cleaning and the staff is nowhere near as friendly as our experiences with other San Juan hotels. This is a kid-friendly resort, so keep that in mind as you book your stay. To sum it up, my husband and I changed up our plans to stay at this hotel for the week and moved to the El San Juan Waldorf which is much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Great views, good restaurants, good room, bad bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: thepaulse
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the El Conquistador resort (longer than expected due to Hurricane Earl) and truly enjoyed ourselves. However my wife and I both agree that we knew what to expect coming into the resort, which is why we enjoyed ourselves more than most people here. Here are a few things to know: Rooms - The rooms are nothing incredibly special, save for the view. The rooms are decorated in early 2000s Miami Chic white and neutral tones. The resort is old, so you can hear noise outside your room. However we pretty much only enter our room to shower and sleep, so this was not a problem for us. The bed was comfortable and the down pillows were ok, not great and not terrible. But the view... WOW. We had an amazing ocean view from our bed. 4* out of 5* Bathrooms - This was the largest downside for us. The bathrooms are very large and the sink/vanity area is modern and nicely appointed. However the tub was terrible. The shower had very little pressure (even though the spiggot had plenty) and the grout needs a severe bleaching. The tub could probably be replaced as well. The bathroom gets a 2* out of 5* from me. Beach - A complaint about this resort is that there is no beach at the resort, and that you have to take a ferry to get to Palomino Island. It's amusing to me that this is a complaint, as this was one of our favorite parts of staying at El Conquistador! we loved the ferry ride over (about 15 minutes each way) and we thought the beach was splendid. We walked to the far side of the island past the bar in the middle and found plenty of sandy areas to wade around in, as well as lots of natural shade under seagrapes trees. We also took out our Dacor masks/fins/snorkels and went about halfway between Palomino and Palominito and found lots of great reef habitats including a VERY large coral collection. We saw plenty of french grunts, as well as three small lemon sharks in addition to beautiful coral formations. I still think that locations like Magens Bay or Castaway Cay are better, but I really enjoyed Palomino Island. Beach gets a 4* out of 5* from me. Service - We travel 3-4 times a year to mostly caribbean destinations (as we work in Orlando for a very large tourist destination) for the relaxation factor. We truly appreciate the slower pace of life. I feel many people have issues getting into that particular state of mind. Service in most non-americanized caribbean locations will be slow, and I dont mind it one bit. That being said, I felt service was decent, up until the day of the hurricane. That's when the staff truly wowed me. We were allowed to extend our stay as long as possible at over 75% off the rack rate. They provided indoor activities, updates on the storm and opened multiple food and beverage locations, all on a limited staff (many staff members could not leave their homes due to the storm). Service gets a 4* out of 5* from me. Food and Beverage - This is a resort, and I certainly expected to pay resort prices. After reviewing our folio, I think that a fair price was paid for meals, and most meals were of a decent quality. Two standouts were the Bella Vista bar/grill and Iguanas at Palomino Island. The fish n chips meal at Iguanas was superb. I did notice the first day that most portions are large and my wife and I began to split meals. This made things quite economical to be honest. My wife tends to be a little picky on food quality, being a restaurant guest service manager, and she approved of most meals. One downer was Blossoms (tempanyaki). I strongly do NOT recommend eating there. Horribly slow service (we waited 50 minutes after we finished to get a bill), scallops were sub-par and the rest of the meal was just ok. There are multiple bars at resort-prices as well. Cuba Libres ran us about 7.00 each, which I'm used to being from Orlando. Restaurants 3 1/2* out of 5* Other notes - we never waited more than 5 minutes for the funicular and never more than 15-20 minutes for the ferry. When we waited for the ferry, we would stop by the shops in the marina. I highly recommend the nutella gelato. - i didn't find a single cast-member that did NOT speak english. nosotros hablamos espanol, but we really spoke a mixture, and found that there were even some cast members that spoke mostly english with just a little spanish - i'm not sure about activities for children, it was just my wife and I - the drive from San Juan (Luis Munoz) airport was about an hour. We rented a car through enterprise and are glad we did. You do have to pay for parking, but we were glad we had a car Good luck with your upcoming trip and I hope you pick a great resort. We stayed with two friends from Puerto Rico (from Trujillo Alto) and they really enjoyed the resort and said it was much better than the Rio Mar or Gran Melia.

Reviews.Title: “EL "CON"”
Reviews.Author: chuia23
Reviews.Content: So much to say with very little space. The hotel itself is beautiful. When you book your room what you're really paying for is the view. First rent a car, if you don't you'll be stuck at the hotel. I thought it would be better to sign up for the tours & have them drive us around however my boyfriend convinced me its more expensive that way. Rountrip shuttle for 2 is $148, car rental for 5 days with GPS was $180. Second with your rental car schedule your own tours. The tours through the hotel are expensive for example a tour of old san juan & the bacardi factory was about $50pp. You can drive to old san juan find parking for $4 an hour plus the bacardi tour is free. Taking the tour through the hotel is a rip off another example el yunque is free as well. The tour desk charges about $90pp. Don't take bio bay tour, they don't let you swim in the water anymore. We ate once at the hotel and that was enough. The quality of the food does not match the price. Food at the hotel is very expensive and does not taste good. Take your car and drive out of the hotel gate make a left or right and you will find plenty of restaurants with great food. There is also a supermaket & Walmart on the highway. The ferry to Culebra is only 15 mins from the hotel & it only cost $4.50pp roundtrip. Get there super early and watch your place in line, people will try to cut the line. Bring plenty of sunscreen/sunblock, cooler with drinks & snacks. If you can while at the hotel pay for everything in cash upfront (parking, food) make sure you keep your reciepts so that they don't charge it to your room. When you check out double check your bill make sure they didn't charge you for something that you already paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Not Waldorf Astoria quality”
Reviews.Author: sbauer101
Reviews.Content: This hotel had some good qualities, but at the price, should have been outstanding in every way. It has been sold several times, and really does not meet Waldorf Astoria standards. Although the view is lovely, they price gouge at every opportunity. Med. sized bottle of water in your room...$8.00 Charge to park your car...$20 Charge to get your car...$12... Charge for cover over your pool chair (can't remember - I think it was $50?) Since you are a captive audience, you either eat at their facility ( which was okay, not great), or or pay to get your car, so that you can go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with 'Change to Survive' rating"”
Reviews.Author: RKCO
Reviews.Content: Lots of pros and cons. Pros: The location is beautiful. Con: Not well maintained Pros: Club, Casino, pools, and private island. Con: While some parts are free, other activities seemed overpriced (i.e. horseback riding, el coqui waterpark, etc.) Pros: Large suite and comfortable bed. Con: Not as clean as would be expected from a hotel resort with this name. Pros: 24 hour Valet service, room service, etc. Con: Valet service lost our rental car keys on our checkout date. Pros: Good food. Con: Not very much local cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Has the Waldorf lowered their standards?”
Reviews.Author: TwistedWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is obviously quite old. Upon arrival in a rental car with my female partner, I observed approximately 6 men in white shirts standing to the side. No one offered to assist until I walked over myself and headed toward the car with the luggage cart. The clerk at check-in was not warm or friendly or welcoming. Her attitude appeared snippy and snotty. The directions she gave us to our room were incorrect and in fact, it took 4 different staff members to actually explain to us how to get to our room. It appears a lot of money has been spent toward amenities ie pool area. The rooms are old and musky. The door of the rooms opening into the carpeted (extremely dirty) hallways were covered with scuff marks - not just ours, all of them along the way. The layout is extremely confusing, as the hotel is quite expansive. I phoned the front desk 4 times to request an engineer to adjust the a/c in our room. When he finally arrived, he gave us different information than the staff on the telephone. The highest the a/c will go is 72, if you want it higher, the engineering department has to adjust it with a key. Odd. Also, there appeared to be no restaurant for evening dining.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs a renovation, but Palomino was incredible”
Reviews.Author: usclakertraveler
Reviews.Content: Service-We arrived at the el conquistador resort and spa, only to be greeted with a huge check in line that took forever. And when we finally got to the desk, they told us that the room wasn't ready, so we came back at 4 (check-in time), and we were told again that our room wasn't ready. After finally having our room changed, we were kindly escorted by our bellman, who was very nice and informative. Throughout the rest of our stay, the staff was friendly, and we never walked by a staff member without them saying hello, or good morning or good afternoon. All in all, the service was good. Coqui water park- The water park did not cost any money for us because we got a package deal (which i highly recommend). The slides were loads of fun, especially the straight down slide, which I did over and over again. The lazy river was relaxing and long, and the pool was large with great views. Overall the water park was fantastic and lots of fun. Food- The food was slightly over-priced but it was not outrageous, and the food itself wasn't bad. Blossoms was fantastic, along with stingray cafe. Iguanas on Palomino had great burgers, and the breakfast place (Las Brisas) had a nice selection of good tasting food. Overall, the food was good, a B+, but the prices were slightly high. Location- The views were absolutely incredible, and worth the one -hour drive from the airport. The tram was never an issue for us, and they were air-conditioned. So i give the location an A because of the resorts magnificent view. Room- We were in room 1405 in the La Marina village on the top floor. Our ceilings were very, very hgh, which was actually interesting, and kept the room cold because hot air rises. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the room itself was huge. The bathroom was modern and the shower was nice, except it took a while for the water to drain out. There is definitely a renovation needed in the rooms though, but we didn't care because we were never in the room anyways. So i give the room B in all. Palomino Island- I saved the best for last. Palomino was absolutely incredible! The water was extremely warm (almost too hot actually), and it was crystal clear. Snorkeling was fantastic, and so was horse back riding. Palominito was a very cool small island with lots of shells and corals, and again, extremely clear water. There was a basketball hoop, 2 bars, coconuts that had fallen from trees (that were very yummy), a volleyball court, and lots of different kinds of water sports. Snorkeling from Palomino to Palominito was fun, and you get a work out. Overall, Palomino gets an A+++++++. Recommendations- drink lots of water...a man actually fainted from heat stroke at iguanas one day while we were having lunch. So drink lots and lots of water. Right in between Palomino and Palominito, there is an area of snorkeling that is to die for, and there is another area about 1/4 of the way to palominito, more towards the east side of the island that was also amazing. All in all this was a fantastic resort.

Reviews.Title: “AN AMAZING RESORT, Stunningly Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: NCC1701Z
Reviews.Content: We visited El Con for 8 days/7 nights in Mid August and it was a fantastic relaxing vacation. We are HHonors members and reserved a partial ocean view. Instead, we were upgraded four levels to a Las Brisas Full Ocean View. First off, the natural beauty surrounding the resort is too stunning to put into words. The pictures on their website do not do it justice. The cliff top location of El con is in my opinion it's biggest draw and is what defines this resort. With that said, the cliff top location does present some logistical challenges but certainly not as severe as many other reviewers have said. There is no beach. So guess what, you have to take a 15 minute Ferry ride (and you'll be forced to look at the stunning Mountain views of Puerto Rico) in order to get to Palomino where you can swim and snorkel in the super warm Caribbean Sea. Is waiting for the ferry a pain? Maybe on weekends it can be bothersome but otherwise the ferry rides just added a unique experience to this vacation. To get to the marina yes you will have to take the funicular (where you will be forced to see even more stunning views). Don't let the other reviewers paint these as the end all be all. The funicular and the ferry are not that bad and can actually be fun! The pools at the resort were always super warm. You know how cold you get when you go from a hot tub to a pool? Well that won't happen here! The coqui water park was just the perfect size and we loved the "El Gigante" slide. Lots of folks complain that food prices are too high. Being from NY, it wasnt much of a stretch and I think most resorts are expensive when it comes to on site dining. My only complaint about the food was that there is no Puerto Rican food to be found on the resort. I shouldn't have to drive 4 miles to get to an Alcapurria! So we ended up at Metropol a lot. Some other gripes include: the path to the self parking lot is not lighted, Room service did not Vaccuum everyday and Palomino did attract alot of locals on the weekend. After most vacations, I say to myself that was fun and check it off the list, but when it comes to the El Conquistador, I can say with utmost certainty that - WE WILL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: GGRRtraveller
Reviews.Content: During the time my family and I were there, the hotel decided to put on a 'Heineken party'. This resulted in a large number of drunk people of in the hotel for the whole weekend. Given that it is supposed to be a high-end family resort and we were looking for relaxation, this completely ruined our stay. There was vomit in the elevators, one guy exposed himself, others were rude and loud to anyone they saw. I will never go back. The person whose bright idea this was should get fired.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: 224dolly
Reviews.Content: We were prepared after reading the reviews for this hotel not to be stateside five star quality and by those standards a three might be a better rating but our room was clean and cool, aging but lovely and the view of the ocean was a treat. We found the grounds beautiful and enjoyed swimming after dark in very warm pools. We were there on a package deal in the off season with a good price and were renting a car so the hotel made a lovely retreat. Palominos island has a rocky side and a more frequented sandy side were the walking and swimming were very comfortable. I definitely recommend this hotel if you go off season and shop for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget comfortable walking shoes and a wad of cash!”
Reviews.Author: creativeoutlet
Reviews.Content: It is a huge resort, like a little village. Some of the views form above are lovely. I recommend that you get valet parking if you plan on driving during your stay. The lot is a bit of a walk and the space is huge, can be difficult looking for your car at night. It is $21 a day and $16 for self park. But be warned, You have to get on a line to have someone drive up your car. So time it well if you have an engagement. With the price of the room rate I think it is terrible how much hotels are charging for parking. It is a rip off! We stayed in a room by the main building, personally we were grateful. Too much fuss to get to other areas of the resort, not my cup of tea. You could get lost if your not paying attention the first day. Not great for those with walking issues. The room looked exactly as it does in the pictures online. It was a nice bright room, could have used a larger TV screen but that's my preference. I had a view of the pool and in the distance you could see the ocean. It rained the entire 3 nights. We made the most of it. We used the casino, I sat in the club/lounge room to listen to music. The DJ was clueless, he blasted the music and played this tacky strobe light. I go to clubs in NYC so I guess I'm a snob, lol. But families danced, babies to older adults. That was cute but dead as far as the club scene goes. During the day they showed family movies and had a few table games. They could have done more to entertain people who were stuck inside because of the heavy rain. They should have had a cabaret show or a band. The resort has a game room, snack store and shops, restaurants. I enjoyed our expensive Japanese/Chinese food experience at Blossoms. To get to the beach you have to go on a free ferry to Palomino Island from their marina. The first time is charming but when its pouring raining, not so charming. Everyone is waiting on line hoping they will get on the boat. The Island was just ok in my book. One restaurant and a bar and an office to do water sports and such, beach was just ok. It is a shame they don't have the beach by the property. They had three pools where our room was located, and more throughout the property. The marina area was pleasant to be around. What was not cool was that you had to pay extra for their water park Coqui. Resort guests should have at least gotten a free pass or a discount. What I did enjoy was walking throughout the property at night and listening to the coqui, Puerto Rico's tree frog. All the rooms in my building was situated around a garden, and you could hear the sounds of nature, when indoors it was quiet. We went off property to eat and went to the movies, Caribbean Cinemas. Overall the hotel is close to the El Yunqui and Luquillo beach, so for a short stay I may recommend it, only if you get a great rate. You can look forward to the daily resort fee of $13+ a day along with taxes. I recommend you eat off property. We asked a staff member where they ate. If you want real Puerto Rican food, off property is your best bet. They had a mini mall which had fast food but we liked the Puerto Rican place, locals ate there. You ordered your dish wait for your name and carry to your table, it was upscale take out! lol It had a some Chinese food choices but popular for their mofongo (a mashed plantains dish) sorry I can't remember the name of the place. So if you have cash to burn and like to take a ferry to the beach and get lost every so often getting back to your room, then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sharen210
Reviews.Content: When you associate a hotel with the Waldorf Astoria Collection you think of luxury and upscale - dismissed that Idea from your head if you are staying at this hotel. I also do not understand why the hotel is rated so high. It is overpriced in every aspect. I just returned from a 4 night stay and this is the first time I have traveled to this location in PR. 1. The room we stayed in was in bad need of renovation. Mold on the ceiling in the bathroom closet which actually was leaking on to our clothes. Mold in tub/shower area and the countertop needed to be replaced. Walls needed to be painted and floor needed to be grouted and cleaed. The radio clock did not work - no way to tell what time it was, or to have some background music. 2. Slowest service I have ever witnessed, and I have traveled throughout the Carribean. Food and drinks highly priced plus they were always running out of products. 3. Our outside patio never had to be cleaned, around patio in grass glass and debris. 4. Casino closed at midnite, and the so-called nightclub had a sign stating either 18 or 21 or older to enter, collar shirts. Well, there was a baby in a stroller and lots of kids dancing on the dance floor. Hotel personnel walked in there and never said a word. 5. Went to the private island, took the tram down to the boat shuttle which only came every hour and was packed. The second day we went to the island "no towels" and no staff member seemed to know why, when or where to towels would arrive. 6. No adult section, the pool that had the swim up bar (usually for adults) filled with children - (jumping into the pool and screaming). The positive things about the hotel was the morning breakfast buffet was very nice and had a nice selection of food. You could rent a car from enterprises right at the resort. Arriving at the airport it was easy to find the shuttle to the hotel which they provided you with water, soda, and rum.

Reviews.Title: “Great views BUT...”
Reviews.Author: svwc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night because we were checking it out as a possible wedding venue. Our room was very nice with an AMAZING ocean view, of course, we were upgraded because of the purpose of our visit. I agree with the person who wrote that service was mediocre and very slow. That was very true & for a resort this expensive, we expected better. The pools were nice although not very refreshing as the water was very warm. Unfortunately, this is not a beach side hotel so we had to take the ferry to Palomino Island which again, was disappointing. I have traveled to PR MANY times because my family is from there. I was telling my fiance how beautiful the little islands off of the main island are but when we got to Palomino, I ate my words. There is not much of a swimming area and the water was full of green moss and rocks!! If you do decide to go there, bring your water shoes!! Trust me. We left back to the hotel on the next ferry that arrived. At least, the ferry was free! Now, if you want to go to Coqui Water Park, that's extra money. The hotel is so big, it's a mission to walk everywhere. Not good for our elderly guests. We ate pizza at the bar by the main pool which was good & we had dinner at the Steak house which was OK but pricey. My fiance ordered a hamburger which was $20!! Seriously?? lol Overall, not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled Food at Marina Cafe”
Reviews.Author: puertocoqui
Reviews.Content: At the Marina Cafe at the lower level of the Conquistador, I bought a pastry named "Quesito" and when I took a bite, it tasted bitter; when I looked at it, the quesito had grown mold. I took it back and they didn't even give me another quesito or my money back. MY point is if the pastry was bad, other foods can be bad and not checked by the employer just to make a sale!

Reviews.Title: “Surviving on a past reputation”
Reviews.Author: samalfi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to PR for a long weekend trip. Based on what I'd ready about this hotel, I was prepared to be impressed by a newly renovated "jewel of the carribean". The resort made an impression, but not the one I was hoping for. I cannot understand why this hotel is rated so highly. I can only guess that it was beautiful in its hey day and the reviews have not caught up with what it is now. Hilton/Waldorf are clearly neglecting this property. We found everything from mold in our bathroom, to torn rugs, a broken fire alarm on our floor and our security door latch was broken off. While the outdoor areas were lovely, many items were in disrepair. For example, the hand rail on the spa steps was not attached on one end and I almost slipped. None of the fountains around the property were working. There were broken tiles in the pool/spa. On a positive note, the golf course and spa were beautiful. The restaurants were pretty good, except 'Blossom' which was old, dusty and depressing. It's so sad because you can see how beautiful this resort can be and probably once was. However, these days I'd feel generous rating it a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment amidst beautiful scenery- El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: ziggy321
Reviews.Content: My family and I, including 2 boys aged 9 and 10 made a second visit to El Conquistador having previously visited 2-3 years ago. The grounds remain beautifully kept and scenery is great. The main attraction this time was the new water park which kept our boys interest for our time there.....that is a plus! We stayed in one of the villas which provided nice space and a good view, but was also accompanied by a non-functioning dishwasher despite requests for repair....the housekeeping people were very nice though! The real complaint about a so-called 5 star place is that during our stay they elected to host a Heineken promotional party. This turned out to be the equivalent of a low brow frat party with similarly aged patrons, most of whom were drunk and poorly clad, walking the grounds with open alcoholic beverages. Two of the pools were closed for the 2 day event and quite frankly, we did not want our kids entering those pools for days afterwards....the cloudy appearance was not appealing. What were they thinking? The other issue, true before and unchanged currently, is that the prices are generally high and border on outrageous for what is offered in terms of dining options. I suppose that is what one can expect at any resort. The problem with Fajardo is that outside of the El Conquistador, the dining options are limited. You would think with a captive audience held hostage at the hotel, there would be a capitalistic spirit.....even a pizzeria, a trattoria on the outside- NO!. Someone willing to work with a simple restaurant nearby is going to have a great business! There a couple of restaurants that are ok-to good....but the pickens are slim! So if you choose to go here, know that its an hour to san juan for a more expansive choice of dining experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing all around”
Reviews.Author: toautumn719
Reviews.Content: Don't let "The Waldorf Astoria Collection" name fool you. The hotel is no where near the quality of even run-of-the-mill chain motels. 1. Our room had debris all over the carpet (not vacuumed), dried mud in the entryway, a dried sticky spill in the bathroom, human hairs everywhere, and a pungent moldy smell. Pretty filthy. We were too tired to switch rooms until the following morning. Our new room was somewhat cleaner, but the bathroom floor was still dirty. After explaining our disspointment to hotel management, they gave us a "guest inconvenience" credit of $100, which we appreciated. 2. Restaurant service is mediocre and very slow. We couldn't believe how expensive the meals were as well. Our bill for two hamburgers and two iced teas came to $45. 3. Taxis are very expensive as well. We were quoted $80 each way to go to the El Yunque rainforest which is only 11 miles from the hotel. We rented a car, which cost us $72. 4. The hotel property itself is very beautiful with lush landscaping and a sprawling golf course. However, its isolated location limits your recreational options unless your willing to spend a lot of money. Hope this is informative! We are definitely going to research the hotels we go too more carefully after this disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: mlaug
Reviews.Content: For our purposes this was the perfect hotel. The rooms were spacious, immaculate and the bedding superb (they even iron their sheets!). Based on what we had read here, we rented a car to get around and away from having to have all our meals in the hotel (very pricey). Good call. Be prepared to do some walking, as the hotel is huge, and the parking some distance from it. If you opt to stay at the hotel, it has every possible convenience you could imagine, a perk that will be costly.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean, poor service, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: BKNY1
Reviews.Content: My experience is represented by many of the reviews already posted. I stayed in the 4000 block of rooms overlooking the pools. There was excessive molds on the walls, stains in the bathroom, and not only was the rug not vacuumed before I checked in, it was not vacuumed once during my week long stay. The staff while friendly, were not at all concerned about expedient service. The food was overpriced and poor quality. Tip - walk out the parking lot to the left of the marina to find local food stalls, best meal I had all week for $7. Other people commented about bogus charges on their bill. I reviewed my bill carefully and didn't find anything amiss. Though I was contacted my my credit card fraud agency 3 days after I checked out because of suspicious activity on my bill. Really I cannot understand the 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: Caribbean_D
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay here with a great friend of mine. She won the trip through her work, and they paid for her room and her airfare. I had the chance to take her scuba diving for her first time and she was hooked. The resort has the marinated and dive shop on site so no need to leave the resort. I would go back to the resort again it was perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel that I would never go back too”
Reviews.Author: TORIMATT
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on Aug 10th 2010 - Four nights promo - Great hotel and very nice facilities including the beach @ Palomino Island. The resteraunts including Blossoms and the Italian restaraunt were very good but extremely pricey. The room was beautifully decorated with a great view overlooking the Marina and looking out toward Paolimno island. No Complaints with the hotel. Jesus helped us at the front desk during checking and Check out and he did an excellent job. Here is my biggest issue and this has to be addressed with the GM Dermot Connolly along with Ross Klein from Hilton Hotels Luxury Brands. We received via a letter that was dropped (two days earlier) off on the room that the hotel was having a fantasy island fesitval sponsored by Heinken Beers on Saturday 14th. I understand that the hotel is trying to generate extra revenue maybe due to the slow season or overall economic impcat on carribean travel. In the meantime this festival was pay one price and get access to all of the beer and alcohol you want and hanging out by the pool listening to live bands from 11 AM to 11PM - This was a major inconvenience for all of the guests that were staying at the hotel and couldn't enjoy the amenities unless you paid to particpate in the fesitival. this only gave you one option which was to leave the hotel and go out to the private island to stay away from all of the noise incovenience and the behavior that occurs when you open up the bars and have an all you can drink fest at a 5 star resort. The results was a disaster. Many of the guests that i spoke to either checked out or complained that they received some compensenation for the MAJOR inconvenience. I was given a $100 credit by Jesus as i was leaving but honestly $100 is nothing compared to what we had to see and endure. The night before the people that checked in on friday night roamed the hotel hallways and knocked on my door a number of times in the middle of the night which woke my family up. Another family we met also endured watching these 20 year old kids drunk in the elevators and exposing themselves to the other guests. I knew that it was going to be a long day as I walked into the lobby the day of the event to see over 100 to 150 security guards dressed in a bright yellow tshirt to be deployed thrlough out the hotel. Why would the Waldorf Astoria collection Hotel offer such an event at their hotel. I stay at Hilton Properties on all of my business travels and I have never witnessed anything like this. I think that this was extremely poor judgement by the El Conquistador and their managament team to allowed this to happen. I think the hotel was great but the experience was a disaster. If you plan on going there make sure that they aren't sponsoring any music fesitivals while you are staying trhere. It is not rated G for family entertainment that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: ChanellD
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just okay. They need to really do a better job on upkeep and maintenance of the rooms and the resort overall. I noticed peeling or missing paint, missing caulkI, dirty patios and room service food sitting in the hall all day. It's situated in a remote location an hour or more away from the airport, shopping, restaurants and clubs. I wish I had conducted better research before booking as I would have liked to have choices. It was boring! There was really nothing to do because everything is so far away. A cab ride to the city is $110.00 bothways. To get to the beach there was a 20 min. ferry ride. The Waldorf Astoria should not be proud to claim this place.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: TheNextVacation
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the El Conquistador several times and I have never been disappointed. There is a reason I return to this resort. The employees are courteous and very attentive. The food divine....particularly the Lobster Risotto at Stingray. The recently remodeled rooms provide a very light and airy feeling. I have not experienced dirty, unkempt rooms or inattentive staff. The El Con offers low key relaxation whether on your patio, at the pool or on Palomino and yet, there are plenty of activities for families and people who like action packed vacations. I am looking forward to taking my 86 year old mother there for the Christmas holidays. I know she will enjoy it as much as I have in the past!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't know I was taking my toddler to spring break...”
Reviews.Author: cngh
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference at this hotel, and families were invited to join for the weekend (Thursday-Sunday). My son (19 months) and I joined my husband on Thursday. On Friday afternoon we found out that the main pool area would be closed all day saturday and part of Sunday. If we had known that ahead of time, I don't think we would have stayed the weekend as outside of not being able to use the pools, we also had to deal with really loud music, spilt beer, and people walking everywhere in their swim wear acting like they were at spring break. (while also navigating hoards of people) But, assumably most people reading this hopefully wouldn't be dealing with such a circus so I'll share the relevant parts of my experience. Check-in.- My husband mentioned it took more than 45 minutes after arriving in line at 3:30 pm. with only a couple people in front of him to get through check in and too his room. I asked him "why' and he said it seemed like they were trying to find rooms for everyone. El Conquistador handled the transfer from San Juan-surely they could have in the 1.5 hours it took to get to the resort work on finding rooms to expedite this process? Room- We were fortunate and unfortunate to be in the Marina area in a corner room overlooking coqui water park. On the plus side, this was a pretty quiet area of the park-particularly a corner unit. This was especially helpful for the chaos of the spring break Heineken party on the upper part of the resort. It was also close to the boat to Palomino island which was good for us. Finally, the room had been recently renovated so that was nice. Bathroom was huge, deck was huge, and room was a decent size. View was also nice. The negatives: Lighting was pretty bad at night. It only had 3 lights. This was okay for us as we put our son to sleep and hung out in the bathroom but would be irritating otherwise. Also, the location was far from most restaurants and basically the whole resort. It was kind of a pain to have to trek in for breakfast. In retrospect, I wish I just ordered room service on the days we were heading to the beach. Beach- This is a huge drawback and is actually why i had booked another hotel (caribe hilton) for our last night in Puerto Rico. In order to go to the beach, you need to take a ferry. I was told it was an 8 minute ferry leaving every 1/2 hour. The reality? A 20 minute ferry leaving whenever. The day we went to the beach, we treked up the funicular for breakfast then made it down for the 9:30 am ferry (arriving at 9:25 am) That ferry left at 10:15 am. Try waiting in line with a toddler for 45 minutes in the hot sun. fun. Ferries also have limited times- you can only go over to Palomino island between 9 and 3. Not very convenient to coordinate around naps. Once we got to the beach, it was nice, with many shallow areas for young kids. But, no showers that I could find. We had to rinse the sand off in our hotel room. Very odd. How can a beach not have any showere nearby? Pools- Well, they were closed for much of our stay. In 500 acres though, there didn't appear to be a toddler pool. I asked the bellman and he didn't know of one. He said my son could play on steps. Coqui water park (additional charge) had an area that was like a beach (with a low gradual increase in depth) We received complimentary passes with our group. If I were a regular guest, I'd be irritated that I had to pay separately for my toddler to go in a pool. (oh no fee for under 3, but I'd have to pay). Food- I actually was pleasantly surprised to have some affordable food options (ie. breakfast for $10/entree) No kids menu though. Most of our meals were included with the conference so I basically only went to breakfast. Thought the lunch on palmomino was good. Spa: A real trek t get here from the Marina. I did this the festival day and it was a bit of a headache. I did the caribbean escape session. I thought the spa was poorly marketed. If you are interested in attending, I'd look online to get the menu of things as none was really included in the room. The spa store closed before I got out of the lockerrom (before 6 pm). I was told to come back if I wanted any of the products used in my facial. Um, not happening. Toddler gripes- I wish they would have clear information on their sites for toddlers -ie. where can they swim, etc. Service- I thought it was fine. Everyone was very friendly etc and responsive to requests. HOwever, my husband thought service was terrible largley based on his huge wait to check in. I think the hotel might be doable for older kids. Not the best choice for the under 5 set. Much prefer the caribe hilton for that. We stayed in 3 hotels in Puerto Rico-El Convento (mom and dad's favorite), El Conquistador (a required hotel) and Caribe hilton (our son's favorite. If we were to go back to puerto rico its a toss up of where we'd stay-but not this place. Oh-and for the spring break thing- colleagues of my husband called security 6 times overnight do to a loud party. Nothing was done. There should be a limit to noise complaints then the guests are kicked out. Ridiculous. Others also complained about room conditions so I think it really depends on the luck of the draw as our room was renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but great. if you have the money to spend. this is your stay.”
Reviews.Author: Roxanalovestotravel
Reviews.Content: The resort is wonderful. When your coming from the taxi or airport shuttle you see such a beautiful golf course. I am not really a golfer but its really big and spacious. Our flight arrival was about 12:40 so we were really early when we arrived at the resort. Check in time is at 4:00pm. So we checked in and they gave us a room number and told us they would call when it was ready. We went to eat at the restaurant next to the lobby which is called Bella Vista Restaurant. The restaurant food was good. I ordered Chicken Tenders with french fries from the kids menu but they "adult" sized it and made the order bigger. It tasted really great. The price for the food was pricey though. That order I believe was about $20. The service there is really good. The waiter was really friendly, always appeared magically when I had little soda to refill and asked if we were fine. She also then came with the dessert menu. The waiter was very attentive. We then waited in the lobby where there is a lot of seating areas. There's a lot of couches and there are 3 parrots. The parrots like talking. They kept screaming loudly which then got pretty annoying. I'm not complaining though because they were really pretty. We waited for the room until 5:00pm. Which was like a four hour wait to get a room. 2 hrs went by really fast when we went to eat. We then asked if out room was ready and it wasn't so we went to check it out anyway. (We had no room key but we had a room number). We had reserved a partial ocean view room. The resort is in a cliff. So all the ocean view rooms are at the bottom of the cliff. To get down there you have to take a funicular. We took the funicular and went to our room. We noticed that the door was open so we went in. You could tell that the room wasn't clean so we clearly got out of there and went back to the lobby. By the way walking is a big factor in the hotel if you have a room with partial ocean view or complete ocean view rooms. As well to a lot of walking you need to take the funicular. The funicular is like a little train, it's really cool with great views. I recommend Coqui Park. That is cool. though there are only three slides and the whole park it's just awesome. There's floates, and the slides aren't scary at allt. There's also a pool that has the view of the ocean. I also recommend the Yunque Rainforest trail walk. It cost $52 per person. I was wearing sandals though they recommend flip flops. We rode on the bus and the tour guide was really funny and amusing. His name was Edwin. He made really funny jokes and explained the whole thing really entertaining. I do recommend to bring an umbrealla because it is a rainforest and it did rain when we were there and the tour can't stop because it's a rain forest and it will stop raining whenever nature wants it too. And we did get wet. I touched a baby lizard and saw the coqui frogs. As well we hiked into a beautiful waterfall. I was lucky i wore sandals because I actually got in the rocks and was able to take pictures in the water near the waterfall. The others had to take off their shoes and most of them didn't so they didn't get a picture in the water. Though the sandals were hard to walk in when we were hiking back down since they were wet and I was getting my feet muddy. After the tour the tour guide Edwin brought us to this little restaurant were the food was really good and very economic. This was the real Puerto Rico. I ate a huge plate full of good food for $5 dollars and the souvenirs and key chains were so cheap. I was like YES!!!!! And the sodas were $0.93. I will never forget the tour guide Edwin with his funny phrases. He woudl say "CHECK IT OUT" in his heavy Puerto Rican accent it was so funny. The food in the resort was very pricey in all the restaurants but other than that I will recommend this resort. Also the staff are super great and friendly and like they show the extra effort like they really appreciate you there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie24Edison
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 26. A mix of older individuals and kids. First the hotel looks very impressive. But very dissappointing, from the staff, the restaurants and transportation that was available. We booked a 7night stay, and we were never informed that the hotel also booked a Heineken sponsored party that was for 2days and was for people 18 and over. Which was an all day and all night drink fest and party. There were extremely rowdy kids that were partying all night right next door to us and all the hotel staff could do was apologize. The manager was not even helpful nor understanding or even affected by the whole situation. It seemed like they knew that it was going to cause an inconvenience to the other hotel guest and they only had a standard on what kind of credit they were going to give to the guest. The staff were rude and very unfriendly. It's totally not what you would expect from a 4 star hotel and from the Waldorf Astoria name. This hotel really gave the Hilton name a bad reputation. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone nor say anything nice about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravel11011
Reviews.Content: This was the best trip my whole family enjoyed it, especially my teens (1 girl, 1 boy). We thougth since it was spring break it would be TOO crowded but it wasn't. Driving to the hotel was hard because we had a rental car but once you got to the opening gates the confusion was all worth it! Just looking up the hill through the golf courses it looked like a palace. Once under the roof to the valet (not too expensive) the open space of the hotel amazed me and my familie! The service could not of been better, we were only in line for 10 minutes. During that time we could look at the menus and choose were to eat that night (we chose the strip house). Our room was pristine, no bugs or stains like we had heard about. The view of the gardens were amazing! (I recommend the gardens, not the ocean (you hear all the pool noise) or marina (too long to get to breakfast). Also the bathroom was huge great for 2 teens! All the nights that we ate in the hotel were amazing (not cheap, but not overpriced). Breakfast was amazing at all the places (we ate at both). Then the way down the marina was fun, the kids all love it (by the way you burn all the calories you eat walking around the hotel)! The ferry came every 1/2 hour and so much fun to sit in the front! The island was gorgeus, just don't sit in the first 100 yds. (too crowded) move down to the other side. You can even swim over to the other small island. The food was great at the cafe! The sun was good but strong (be sure you get on plenty of sun screen)! Then back at the resort the pools are great. The spa was amazing, the service was nice but could have gone faster (slow did help the relaxation process). At night for entertainment they had poolside movies, game night. But one night we went down into the towns on a "bio luminesints tour" (not sure of spelling), you canoed down a small river and into a big lake area that when you touched the water it glowed due to some microscopic organisim in the water. The oly hard part was canoeing out since the current is against you. (Not recommended if you have small children). We were all so sad to leave at the end of the week, but we are sure to come back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “I've written so much I can't think of an appropriate title”
Reviews.Author: hello_frankie
Reviews.Content: I do not review nearly as many places as I should/could, but I am taking the time to write a detailed review of El Conquistador hoping to help other travelers with their lodging selection. Reason being, Puerto Rico seemed like a wonderful island with fewer lodging choices than many other Caribbean areas (and therefore potentially more confusing to vacationers), and while El Con looks just as it does on its Web site FROM AFAR, please do not be lured by the aerial views! Last week I stayed at the El Conquistador resort and departed on August 15, thanks be to fate. Had I not planned to depart 8/15, I wouldn't have been able to tolerate one more day. From the ridiculously low quality food (ex: a $40 entree of small, tough shrimp that tasted like freeze-dried La Choy, served in a seriously 70s Asian-themed restaurant) to the dangerously under-secured Fantasy Island event, to the dilapidated rooms, it was dreadful. It's a shame, because the geographical surroundings are gorgeous. Upon arrival, I absolutely loved it. That love affair lasted all of three minutes. ROOMS The rooms are in dire need of updating and repair: moldy tubs, chipped tile, stained bedding and carpeting, etc. An overall look of an housing ad that would read "Rehabbers delight!" But worse. Previous TA reviewers' photos show this, so I didnâ€™t bother to take additional snapshots of things like insects (beyond typical for the region), missing grout, dated items galore, broken phones, and stains. White headboards + white furniture in a poorly managed hotel near water and hiking = nasty appearance in no time at all. The promo in the room actually read â€œComing in 2006!â€� with pics of the present furniture! So, you can imagine how awful this dÃ©cor has turned in 4-5 years. LOCATION Terrible, because of all the other factors. I wouldnâ€™t mind being 1-2 hours from town, IF I had good food options, a nice resort, etc., but with awful food, a less-than-comfy room, and sought-after resort amenities closed for private events, you are truly trapped thereâ€”at a high price for incidentals. BEACH The resort is not on the beach; you must take the ferry to get there. It didnâ€™t run at any set time, and I lost time by workers telling me incorrect times. I saw it leaving one morning at 10:35 just as I'd walked up. A pleasant worker told me the next one leaves at 11. Nope. We left at 11:25, and that was during the daily 1-2 hour window of more frequent departures. If you miss it, you might have to wait an hour+ for the next one! Huge pain to spend more than an hour to get to the beach of a â€œbeach resort,â€� due to poor ferry scheduling, and especially when pools were closed or undesirable. I must say the beach was my favorite feature. While small, it was very clean and all-around wonderful. The servers were lovely and the food and drink from the little bar and grill were the best I had at El Con. However, it all closes up around 5 pm and you must board the ferry to go back to El Con. For me, this was like a ferry back to Alcatraz. SERVICE Some people great, most indifferent, some bad. Compared to Mexico, as some TA users might be wondering, English is spoken more fluently and unfortunately, many El Con staffers have excellent command of sarcasm. Housekeeping was not good. Maid would remove items (washcloths, old soap, etc.) but not replenish. Frustrating to come back to not even a single washcloth after a day at the beach. SPA A beautiful and relaxing environment, but at >$200 for one treatment, the service was not acceptable. Tech seemed inexperienced, the whole process was clunky, and the products used were a letdown. Felt/smelled like any old Walgreens items. My appointment was running behind and two different people volunteered three totally different excuses. It made me wonder if my technician was hurtinâ€™ from attending the party the night before! GENERAL MANAGEMENT Back to Fantasy Island. Under the guise of a 12-hour live music event, this raucous fest held about 80% of the common areas captive for two days. Little advance warning from the resort--just a note (with an inadequate description of the magnitude of this circus) slipped under our door the late afternoon prior. Main pool area(s) closed to guests with no recourse and thousands of loud, shirtless/swimsuit-clad attendees flooded the lobby, corridors, Starbucks, parking lot--you name it. Basically any place they weren't supposed to be dressed as they were (according to dozens of El Con signs warning against lack of clothing in common areas), that's where they were. These are the kind of people, who while barely upright, can manage to don sunglasses at night, pop the top on a Red Bull, and break beer bottles outside your door for fun well into dawn. The noise/fighting throughout the night and entry attempts to our room from overserved guests are what sealed the deal for me to make the time to write this review. Note: I can appreciate a good time, but this disaster was completely disrespectful to resort guests. It was NOT the typical lively, youthful festival with expected loudness and indiscretion; the property became one humongous swim-up dive bar for two days. I believe my spouse and I are far more tolerant of noise and "extreme partying" than the average resort guest and we found it just plain gross. In elevators and walkways, the offended and outraged bonded, offering each other their horror stories, directly and unsolicited. Ex: One couple received threatening calls from the offenders after reporting them to security for fighting at 4 a.m. The day of and day after this event, the elevators were smelly and sticky from spilled drinks and who knows what else. It was the responsibility of El Con to keep it under control. El Con should not have served these guests as they did, and they should have done a better job of patrolling the antics throughout the night. It seems fairly easy to hire one security guard at each end of each floor. I am certain the profit from this carelessly planned mega-event could cover additional overnight security. Interestingly enough, here is a laugh-out-loud gem. When I went to the Waldorf Astoria Web site in effort to find corporate contact info, I saw a terribly glaring typo on the home page, made worse in its reverse type and large font with glitzy Flash photos as a backdrop: Book your summer holiday now to recieve one complimentary night's stay Haven't we all mastered the "except after c" memorization? It summarizes the lack of attention WA/El Con gives its guests, and the attention to the bottom line--let delinquents have free reign, others can hole up in their moldy barracks. Perhaps someone from the Fantasy Island party bartered to be a webmaster and copywriter in exchange for a night's lodging to the Fantasy Island fÃªte. SUMMARY All these less than appealing points aside, I would like to return to Puerto Rico, for I was enamored with many aspects of the area and its people, and especially the charm of Old San Juan. I am confused/mildly entertained by reviewers who write things like â€œa vacation is what you make it.â€� Um, yes. If Iâ€™m camping. Or paying $49 a night. This place is such a hassle and an expense just to get there, and I cannot imagine having to rally to enjoy a self-proclaimed luxury resort. Although my particular stay earned one star, I am giving it two stars since I feel it would deserve a solid two had it not been for the sloppy Fantasy fest. I don't wish to dwell on that specific incident, but I feel how poorly that event was managed and how guests' validated complaints were ignored speaks volumes about the property itself.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning place with extraordinary staff gone mad while resort plays”
Reviews.Author: rebeccacramirez
Reviews.Content: host to a local Heineken Festival: Starting Friday evening, most of the resort facilities were closed or restricted to regular guests while our cards were still charged the daily resort fees. There was no parking for at least 2 nights. There was deafening reggaeton played throughout the grounds and rich, local young people let in till the place became a scene out of a college dorm/ girls gone wild combo. Friday and Saturday nights there was no sleep to be had with young men drinking, turning over ashtrays, girls screaming and prancing around in nightgowns. There were broken Heineken bottles and trash in the parking lot and grounds, two cars were completely stripped and one person defecated in an elevator! Fortunately, we had a rental car and left the grounds but when we returned Saturday evening, our patio had been vandalized. There was broken glass, beer bottle caps and empty chip wrappers everywhere. Ironically, even with the evidence of who was out of control, the auxiliary security let in took it upon themselves to harass regular hotel guests. We were carded at every door, even when exiting the hotel lobby. My girlfriend's handbag was searched before she entered Las Brisas restaurant for breakfast. The guards shouted at me as I tried to pass too, demanding to know where I was going. In the same moment I saw an elder gentleman guest we had met there being frisked as he tried to go past Las Brisas toward the elevator with his wife. What a shame on the management of this hotel who tried to charge us an extra $25 to partake in these festivities! This obviously had nothing to do with the wonderful staff who seemed to be tolerating it all with a nervous smile.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: 1Mujer
Reviews.Content: You are island time and what a great time it is! Loved the pools, the marina, the restaurants, the water park and most of all the Coqui's at night!!

Reviews.Title: “Definetly paradise....”
Reviews.Author: tmb5587
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went to stayed at the El Conquistador to celebrate my birthday. I have read the reviews about the El Conquistador and I have to admit I was a little apprehensive about staying there. When we arrived we had no problem checking in, we got a beautiful ocean view room, and only paid for a Garden View. The bellman Gary was great and the customer service the entire time that we were there was above all expectations. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the pools are amazing. The private island was also beautiful. We did the horseback riding but my suggestion is to wear jeans! No one did and it is quite a rough ride, with thorns in bushes cutting your legs so come prepared. The views are wonderful on the ride though. I read reviews on having to wait in long lines for the ferry and the breakfast, we didnâ€™t have to wait longer than 10 minutes for anything. I do believe your vacation is what you make of it. My mom and I have a positive attitude going into it and didnâ€™t let the little things bother us.
