If I had to say anything negative about El Conquistador it would be the elevators got flooded when it rained and the walk back from Fajardo for the Biolumincent tour seems a bit dangerous so I would be careful. Also, the Bioluminescent tour was very disappointing because no one told us when it rains it limits the ability to see the water light up, we didnâ€™t see anything. My recommendation is to also go during the week, the weekends seem like when it gets busy and the lines for things get longer. But, I will definitely go back and stay at the El Conquistador!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected - Be Prepared and You will have a GREAT time”
Reviews.Author: LovinPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7 yr old daughter and I stayed at El Con along with my nephew and his family (yes - we talked them into the trip...) Aug 4 - 11th. I am very glad I read the reviews of the hotel and surrounding areas, as it made our trip so much more enjoyable! The walking around the resort - no big deal unless you are just lazy or handicapped. It is a BIG resort. Rooms - clean and no 5 star for sure - in the States would be 3 easily. Water shoes are a must for Palomino Island. If you are prepared with that, then the snorkelling is very nice - lots of pretty fish at a very shallow depth! The horse ride - bring long pants - there are thorns along the path that will scratch your legs - or be prepared to ride with your legs up around the horses neck up the hill of the island. The staff was more than accomodating - bellmen very nice - front desk always busy and not always knowedgeable. If check in 4 pm be sure to make sure your room is ready on time or be prepared to complain. They will keep you waiting if you play that game! The food at the Strip House if wonderful but be prepared to wait for at least 1 to 2 hours for the entree - we paid $200 for 3 of us and one was a child. We bought a cooler and brought liquor from Walmart; ate at Loquillo Beach (the best food for the dollor - even tho it was not air conditioned at Aye Bonita). El Yunque Rain Forest was really beautiful - be sure to bring a swimsuit if you go on a hike, as the waterfall seems to be the place to cool off after the hike there - we didn't know, so were unprepared. It was paved the whole way, but make sure you are in good physical condition to hike because it's not an easy hike. Say "Hi" to Efrain the bellman - he's a great addition to the resort. Suggestions to the resort - update your carpet - it's terribly worn in the hallways! We stayed on the top floor and had only tile, but my nephew stayed 2 levels down and it really was worn and not vacuumed at all. Have more people at the water park snack bar - it took us 45 min to get a couple beers and gatorade - they are missing out on a lot of income. Clean the poolside areas nightly! We found trash from the day before still lingering along the poolside. All it would take is one person to go around and pick this up!! What the deal? Management could make this resort a really wonderful resort, even with some downfalls... the little things DO count and sometimes overrule the big things. Replace burnt out light bulbs in the main area and lobby - it can't cost that much!! Overall - Puerto Rico is a great destination if you rent a car - are a VERY defensive driver and are prepared for where you stay. I wouldn't trade our experience for the world!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds! Ugly Interior!! Ugliest Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: tripevaluatorin2010
Reviews.Content: Even the recently renovated rooms leave much to be desired. Staff is stretched very thin to the point where they unable to be successful. That goes for the front desk, service staff, housekeeping, engineering and security. Bell staff and concierge are good. Restaurants rate from terribe to just OK as follows: Steakhouse (food is poor); Seafood( nothing good to say); Italian (fair); Chinese (average); cafe (not even close to a bad NJ diner). Security can be an issue. GM is a nice, attentive professional who seems overwhelmed by the problems and can't keep up. He tries his best. Network and related (phones) are unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Do they think we are all idiots??”
Reviews.Author: jujubeez
Reviews.Content: Rude service, Inconsiderate waiters and bar tenders. The rooms were not more than 2 steps above a motel 6. The funicular was out of commision for more than 75% of our trip trapping us in our room. all in all do NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property but do your homework.”
Reviews.Author: cameron1222
Reviews.Content: After reading several positive reviews as well as negative I felt compelled to offer my opinion on our recent stay at the El Con. I will address some of the aspets of the negative review and interject my experiences -The Chek in process: we arrived early to the hotel and asked if we could get in early. No problem we were in our rooms in 20 minutes. We checked in on Thursday, if you check in on a Friday expect to wait longer. The hotel is huge and with 60 to 100 people descending on the check in counter things tend to slow down at any resort you go to. -The prices: The biggest problem I had with this hotel. The food is overpriced and not very good. For 2 entrees and 3 cocktails cost my wife and family 75 dollars. Do yourself a favor and spend the money on a rental car. We rented a mini-van and ate all our meals outside the resort. Yes the area is run down but the restraunts are great and the people are very,very friendly. Don't judge a book by it's cover. -The rooms: My wife and I got a partial oceanview upgrade at check in. The room decor is ok nothing great but it was clean and everyday was cleaned by the staff unless my wife and I deemed it unneccesary. Pillows were kinda soft but we were resupplied with fresh towels and soap when we needed it. The mini fridges did not work in mine or my in laws rooms however but a 2 dollar cooler took care of that situation. -Waiting: The hotel is really big so it does take time to get from place to place. I didn't mind so much because the point of vacation was to slow down so it didn't bother me. -Customer Service: Everyone I met was friendly and helpfull. The bartenders recommended restraunts while the concierge told me of a few secret surf spots. the locals deal with tourists everyday. If you politely ask a question or request a service they will do everything they can to help. However if you are rude or demanding they will drag their feet and take their time and I honestly don't blame them. Yes things are a little slower on the island. They are on island time which means order another drink and relax. Some Helpful Hints: -Try to learn at least a few spanish words especially greetings. The locals will usually respond better and will generally treat you better if you make an attempt at their local language. However at least learn the proper pronunciation or they will laugh at you. - Rent a car: It will save you money on food as well as attractions. The bio bay kayaking that the resort charges $90 for can be purchased for $45 by driving down to the harbor at the bottom of the cliff. The El Yunqe rainforest is 25 minutes away by car. It is free and and there are trails and a waterfall you can swim in. Plus there are so many great secluded beaches and attractions around the property. - Buy a cooler: Stock it with beer water wine food and whatever else that you don't want to over pay for in the resort. -Try the Mofongo its delicious. Anywhere on the island. -Look online for cheap caribbean deals: We got our 4th night free plus free continental breakfast everyday. It came out to $8 a day for two people to eat breakfast everyday. the food is not great but a cheap and easy way to fuel up for the day. -make sure your hotel doors are closed securely: While we were there we had 2 wild iguanas sneak into our hallway. The maids told us when people don't secure their doors they crawl in the rooms and scare the hell out of the guests. the maids think it is funny as hell.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it.”
Reviews.Author: tallgirlonatrip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Con for a work/vacation trip and couldn't wait to get out. The views are spectacular and they definitely do their best to make the resort high-end, and by that I mean, they just charge the crap out of you for everything. The breakfast buffet is $19.99, for instance, and access to the swim park is $20 a person. The only good part about this hotel is access to the Palamino island via ferry. Unfortunately, though, you can't count on the ferry and the last one leaves at 3pm to the island. Instead, stay somewhere else and be on YOUR schedule versus the ferry/fernicular at this hotel. Not to mention, every time I called concierge the phone just rang and rang-no one that works there really cares if you are helped or not. I would go to another island in general-not worth my money.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Going Back”
Reviews.Author: Monty0124
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at El Conquistador from August 9, 2010 through August 13, 2010 following my brother's wedding in old San Juan. We stayed specifically with the intent to spend time together as a family and to be in close proximity to my sister-in-laws family, locals from San Juan, so they could join us for day trips. We called ahead to the resort to make sure we could have guests and we were assured that we could. Fast forward two days into our stay and my sister-in-law's family arrives to pick us up for a day trip into Fajardo. We're going to get some lunch, poke around bit, have a few drinks and close the day at the local beach with the kids. Well, no such luck. Security at El Conquistador denied them all entry to the resort because the security guard "knew" they were "locals just trying to get in to use the pool." Even with all of my family standing at the front desk telling them they were our invited guests, the hotel refused to allow them in. The were humiliated, and with good reason. Shame on the management of El Conquistador for that disgusting display. I bet if they were a group of white people they wouldn't have even been questioned. We'll be spending our time and money at a different resort next time we go down to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beware before you go!”
Reviews.Author: cmk70
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed when we arrived at the hotel was the awesome view. I've been to many places around the world...this was in the top 5! Unfortunately, that was it for the positive. Registration, okay i can wait 15, 20 minutes...but an hour and 15, that started to chip away at my confidence. Finally got checked in, like i said awesome view, had a good nights sleep, but noticed my mattress had dry moldy stains on them the next morning. This was suppose to be a 4.5 star hotel! The only thing that was 4.5 stars were the places of food and beverages! Go to town to eat! Please bring water shoes with you, they dont tell you most of the beach area is littered with coral. Also some of the activities are not child friendly....Horseback riding.(sign says make ur dreams come true) How about riding up a steep rocky incline with a very narrow path. Not good for a 9yr old who has never been on a horse! They just see dollar signs. would I recommend this hotel to anyone. I dont know...if I did, it would be with a beware....

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: jmoneyhun
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in my opinion NOT a 5 star hotel; I feel it was not even a 3.... The Hotel was dirty and the service was atrocious, the finish on the tub was wearing off and looked like it had been painted 100 times, no way would my family or I feel comfortable to bath in it. Let alone, mold on the tile in the bathroom was really a turn off; I had to ask 3 times for more towels, since they only gave us 3 towels for 4 guests. One night there was not even soap to bath so I had to use shampoo. Inasmuch how expensive this poor excuse for a 5 star hotel was, we paid for 4 sandwiches and three sodas $104.00 total highway robbery... Not to mention $160.00 to park my carâ€¦ INCREDIBLE!! I work for the press and have done my share of traveling and spent time in various levels of hotels all over the world and must say that this hotel was the worst experience that I have ever had as well as the nastiest hotel I have ever stayed in. So much so, that I am in the process of writing a letter to the folks at the "Waldorf Astoria - Hilton Hotels" to let them know about my incomprehensible experience, which is something I have never done in my life. I am sure they will throw any the letter but at least I can get it off my chest... My advise to anyone is to stay at the Rio Mar Resort in Rio Grande there they have a beautiful beach and dont have to worry about stepping on rock like you do at the "exclusive Palomino Island Beach.. HUGE rip off!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: jasmine4420
Reviews.Content: We rented 2 rooms, 1 for me and my husband and one for our kids. Checki-n was to be at 3:00 per our confrimed reservations. We did not get in until 4:30 and the kids did not get in their room until 6:30. Not a huge deal but I was disappointed with the response from management - no apology, they acted as if we were terrible people for expecting to check in on time. Prices are triple what they should be. $15 for a cheeseburger. We ate at the Italian Restaurant and while it was edible the prices were hard to swallow. For food that was about Olive Garden quality the prices were quadruple. Next day was even more unbelieveable. We parked our car $20/day in valet parking. When we went to pick up our car they could not find our car. Later on they brought back 2 cars because theycould not tell our car from someone elses. They asked us to prove which car was ours. They requested that we provide them with a copy of the rental car agreement. We refused and told them the receipt they gave us when we gave them our car should be sufficient. They claimed that we had taekn the car out the night before (we had not). We later found out that they gave our car to someone else the night before. After we inspected the car we found a dent in our car. They are telling us that we have to deal with the rental car company to have the dent repaired. We have also found out that they contract out their valet parking and we will have to deal with this company to get reimbursed for the repairs to the car. The lady at the valet parking was very rude and called me names in Spanish (gringa and punta). I told her she should not assume people cannot speak spanish just because they are from the US. I am fluent in Spanish and knew exactly what she was saying to her co workers about me. As compensation for calling me obscene names, giving our car to strangers and also damagingthey have given us free valet parking for the duration of our stay. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place. We have met many very friendly workers here but there are also many obscene, rude employees here who have made our stay thusfar a major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Overated, overpriced, rude staff, outrageous expense for a Ritz Carlton price. Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Teckard
Reviews.Content: Travel a lot with my family. Would never come or recommend to anyone to stay there. Puerto Rico is beautiful and odd resort service, food and costs were great. El Conquistador is so overrated and so under serviced. A want to be Ritz, Four Seasons, etc. Worst family vacation in twenty years based upon value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gapeachfl
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Hilton Honors Diamond so we stayed at the El Conquistador for free on points. The hotel was awesome and the rooms were decorated very trendy which we like. We had an ok room but definitely not one of the better views we have had. As a Diamond HH, we usually get one of the best views in the hotel but the hotel was busy so we enjoyed what we were given. The hotel has everything you need onsite but we always went to local restaurants for our meals since I had been to PR earlier in the year and knew the area. Palimino Island was awesome to get away from the pool to the beach. The Red Door Spa was very enjoyable!! I go to the Spa on most of our vacations and this experience was right up there with the best of the best spas. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The parking situation was kind of annoying to us since we come and go a lot each day. We hate to valet since we leave so often each day and this hotel is so large. Self Parking is kind of far to walk each time especially in dress clothes but they do have a shuttle to/from parking. There are so many great restaurants near the hotel and so many things to do! I would go back to the El Conq for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Needs to be Updated”
Reviews.Author: PAPITO69
Reviews.Content: Not the first time we have been to this hotel. i thought it would be updated now since it's HILTON. It's hasn't yet. Hotel lobby areas are nice. Food way way over priced. We went to Luquillo 15 min away on the beach there are a bunch of Kioskos(small restaurants). One stood out above all others. Kiosko#44 I think it was Diguito and markito. They speak perfect English. The owner is American. Food AWESOME. Great PuertoRican food. ofongo great. Also they had Mojitos for only $4 and they tasted different then others(great). Also make sure you have a car to get to resort and get around. Hoefully hotel updated soon.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Hear the Vows...What was that!!”
Reviews.Author: ysidronc
Reviews.Content: I was recently at the Conquistador with a group of more than 20 family members, for my nieces wedding. While the Conquistador is a beautiful resort, I was dissapointed and would not recommend that anyone have a wedding there. First clue was: We arrived at the the resort at around 2pm, check in is at 4pm- we were sent off to enjoy the resort until our rooms were ready...after arriving at the NYC airport at 7am for an 8:20 flight, the 4-hr flight an hour cab ride to the resort, all we wanted was to shower and get settled in. After 4:00 we complained at the concierge desk andstill and all our room wasn't ready until 4:30pm. one of our family members came in the day before the wedding and her room wasn't ready until 6:30 pm. Second: In order to have the hairstylist blow dry my nieces hair we had to wash it and bring her to the stlist with her hair wet. In order to have my sisters hair done up in a style, she had to wash and blow dry her own hair. Third: The outdoor wedding was beautiful and my nice looked like a Goddess, the problem was that the speakers weren't turned on and they had a pool party with a DJ going on at the same time as the wedding on the same side of the resort. So the audience heard LOUD MUSIC instead of the wedding vows.

Reviews.Title: “The Citizens Aren't the Only Hustlers”
Reviews.Author: kemystry2
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that my wife and I really connected during our stay at the hotel. It had more to do with our time away and less to do with the actual hotel. They require you to put down 500 dollars at check in. Know that they will try their best to get all of it before you leave. The food is expensive in that you do not always get what you pay for. I tried a few dishes and went away unsatisfied. Their store goods are overpriced as well. Second, know that you are being charged resort fees every day and that trip from the airport, you may as well rent a car. It was beautiful, but in hindsight, I would have rented a car and visited the city myself. Dont pay for the tours, drive yourself. It will save you a lot a money. There is a tour to Calebra on Sunday that does snorkling, go there. Dont pay 120 for someone to take you out to some dark water with 5 fishes and a stingray. Finally, if you have any problems, complain. They are hustling so you may as well hustle too. Thanks, priceline, but no thanks. Definitely wont be back anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful resort, but there are some glaring concerns.”
Reviews.Author: ksimon41
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sunday afternoon and stood in line for 2 hours to get our room. There were no explanations for why the line progressed so slowly. Our ocean view room was huge and gorgeous. The bed was very comfortable. Food was extremely pricey and mediocre in quality. Because we had no rental car, the area outside the resort was not accessible. Also the surrounding area was poverty stricken. We found it inconvenient to wait for a boat to take us to the beach (which was very lovely.) All in all, the resort was gorgeous and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Location is nice, but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster215
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before we went, and thought people were not used to paying a little more for quality, but I came to realize the reviews were pretty accurate. My husband and I, along with our two children (11 and 13) stayed here from Father's Day Sunday to Friday of that week. During those 5 days, we spent about $3000 on just FOOD. The resort is so secluded, that the only way to go somewhere else for a meal is if you have rented a car, and drive there. The resort obviously knows that and tripled the price of EVERYTHING in each of there restaurants. The breakfast buffet was $25/person, and the food was totally not worth it. (runny eggs, cold potatoes, burnt bacon, etc) A burger at the poolside bar is $15. For a family of four, expect to pay $100 for breakfast, $150 for lunch, and if you want a real dinner $300/night WITHOUT cocktails. Aside from the crazy food bill, the resort is pretty, but starting to show it's age a little. The waterpark is small, but fun for a few hours. There really is not enough to do to make a day of it. I highly recommend taking the boat trip to Palomino Island. It is secluded, and not too crowded. Remeber to bring water shoes, because there is a TON of coral in the water. There is a rum bar on the island to buy drinks and get lunch and you can rent snorkel equipment at the sport shop on the island. Also, if you are a gambler, the casino is only open from 4PM to midnight. Overall, this is one if the nicer hotels I saw in Puerto Rioco, but be prepared to pay out the nose.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - i didn't realize how beautiful Puerto Rico really was until now.”
Reviews.Author: khimb
Reviews.Content: Loved it - i didn't realize how beautiful Puerto Rico really was until now. I've stayed on islands like Turks and Caicos, Four season in Nevis, Ritz Carlton's all over and I've also roughed it in the mountains of Utah and Colorado on horseback and in tents ---- I say all of this just to say that I've been to a couple of places and I really enjoyed my stay at El Con. Of course all places have good and bad things about them, but PR was awesome. Attended a wedding in the middle of June in PR and we had to find a hotel b/c the wedding hotels, Rio Mar and Grand Melia were booked in mid June. So we stayed at El Conquistador as a result of our taking a risk on one of the hotwire/priceline/hotels.com type of sites. After we discovered that we got El Con, we read the reviews and were concerned initially (b/c of the negative reviews and b/c we didn't know how far the wedding would be) until we remembered that we always have great vacations. We arrived in PR and got a rental car. The garmin gps device I brought with me worked perfectly in PR. The garmin led us right to El Con. As we drove up the winding hill past the golf course we couldn't believe how beautiful the golf course and grounds were. It took a few minutes to get to the main hotel - its located on cliffs of a mountain. The distance from the entrance to the main hotel requires a drive unless you don't mind walking golf course length distances. We dropped off our luggage with the bell man and parked our own car. The outdoor part of the lobby was gorgeous and the inside was very nice also. I'm an outdoor and plant person. They have luscious plants throughout the hotel and beautiful birds in the lobby that say "hola" - hello in spanish. We waited to check in and our bell man took us to our room. The bell man was fabulous. He made sure that we were pleased with our accomodations and went over and beyond to ensure that we were happy. I have forgotten your name Mr. Bellman, sir, but Thank you. I will look for you when I return in August. During the walk to the room we saw the casino and all of the shops. The views are truly truly breathtaking. The hotel is sprawled over a mountain and cliffs. You navigate the cliffs using the elevators, stairs, and funiculars (like a cable car). The outer funicular (closest to the water) is express from marina level to the top - The inner funicular is local (bellman explained it). so we knew to stay away from the local funicular since our room was not located on a local floor. Since this property is so large there is lots of walking - which is good b/c walking is good exercise :) It may be an inconvenience for a person with some disabilities - there are ramps everywhere. Our room was located at the marina level with a wonderful view of the ocean, and a view of the ferry coming in and right next to coqui water park (for my nephew) and right in front of the EXPRESS FUNICULAR. I loved listening to the birds perched outside of my room. I had breakfast at Cafe Caribe. It was a nice breakfast that I was pleased with. Most people ate at the wonderful las brisas buffet, but I don't need that much food in the morning, I just need food for my energy - so I skipped it and stuck to Cafe Caribe or oatmeal in my room (water was boiled in coffee maker). Each day, my Mom, my brother, nephew and I hopped on the hotels' catamaran to Palamino island, the private beach. I love to be on the ocean so this daily ride to me was a fun part of my trip. It wasn't an inconvenience at all. Especially since I knew that the hotel was not located directly on the beach and required the catamaran ferry. I do hope that people check the hotels they book to know what they are getting into. I mean if the hotel is across a mountain and cliffs and part of the journey is a boat to your private island beach, then you should know that going into it. I would see the ferry coming and run out of my room, and down the steps ready to board. I loved the sand and the warm warm warm water. Water visibility was terrific. Yes there is alot of seaweed and rocks, but other reviews tell you to bring some water shoes. Its the ocean. I was barefoot most of the time except for when I would attempt to walk out to palamonito, the smaller island in front of palamino. I never actually made it (too afraid). Wear shoes if you explore and shoes aren't always needed on the side of the island where the ferry comes in. The ferry shuttled people to the island, just about every half hour or so. Every time looked up, it was coming or going. The island is really fabulous. I ordered a greek salad and chicken fingers while on the island each day. I enjoyed my lunch. Yes its pricey but we were at a hotel and we budgeted for the fact that we may have a few meals there. We actually never ate dinner at El Con after reading that the restaurants were expensive. We used our car and we explored. La Estacion - 3 times - loved it , loved it, loved it. The passion fruit salad (or whatever it was) was awesome. One day I wasn't pleased with it and they replaced it without question. Great customer service. Another restaurant "Pasion...." - we will not eat there again. We ate at a mexican restaurant that had a fabulous brownie desert with icecream and whipped cream and fudge in the middle of the brownie. It was heaven. I do not remember the name. We purchased our room alcohol from the "cash and carry" in the neighborhood (yes we went to the cash and carry) and we also shopped at the supermarket and walmart. My nephew and brother loved the water park. They no longer joined us at the beach b/c they preferred the water park each day until the day before we left. The only time I spent in the room was to change afer a day at the beach, to get ready for dinner, to wash and to sleep. I spent very little time in the room. I'm a golfer but decided to look at the golf course rather than play it. Very very hot weather in PR. The sunrise and set and the dew over the lush greenery was beautiful everyday. All of the people we met at the hotel and in PR were friendly and nice. When our balcony door wouldn't open, they sent someone up to fix it. The walk to the car to go to dinner was never bothersome. After dinner we would take our walk to the room and realized it was just the walk we needed after filling ourselves up at dinner (we would laugh at how tired we were but we encouraged each other on until we got to the room). Just looking at the paradise we were in really made it difficult to get mad. Of course the 6 year old would fall asleep at night and this sometimes required his father to carry him on a few occasions which added weight to our room walks. we worked it out. Nightlife for me was looking at the view, or reading a book. There was salsa dancing Friday and Saturday night in the lobby. There is also the casino. But with our day activities, nighttime for us meant, SLEEP. I slept comfortably everynight. On the last day while checking out, we inspected the bill carefully and everything was correct based on our package. While checking out we discovered the pools and the views on the main lobby side of the hotel and wondered how we missed this (we spent time going from palamino to coqui park to room to shops to car for dinner, to wedding activities back to room). The views by the pools are so spectacular we decided on the spot to return. We will be back at the end of August. Your vacation is what you make it. I knew from reading the reviews that I should rent a car, I knew that the restaurants would be expensive, so either plan for it or eat locally as we did. I knew there would be rocks and some seaweed and the reviews said you will be ok with shoes. And we were just fine. The staff was wonderful, helpful and friendly. If there are problems, address the issues and continue to have fun. Do NOT be afraid to explore. Have an open mind - you are in paradise for a short period of time. As I stated, I was just there in June 2010. I'm returning this month, August 2010. In August I plan to do the other things I missed - swim at the pools while watching the views (at night-while sipping drinks from the bar ), El Yunque, one of the luminescent bay tours, I will tour rincon beach on the westside, I will visit culebra and maybe vieques, party in San Juan at Club Bravo (maybe), visit the town of Loiza and old san juan, eat at La Parilla, Pasta y Pueblo, Calizo, Of course La Estacion and Metropol. I will only be there 8 days. If palamino island doesn't grab me again the way it did before I will accomplish all of this - with mom and this time auntie. Since we drove before we are very familiar with the territory and comfortable driving especially with our friend, Garmin Navigation.

Reviews.Title: “Let's see where I should begin this...”
Reviews.Author: Bholmes47
Reviews.Content: Let's see where I should begin this horrific review. We should start with the taxi ride from the airport to the hotel which was about an hour away that cost $97. Way too much for that distance but it was cheaper than the hotel shuttle of $120! The service is terrible the check in and out lines remain long from morning till night. We arrived at 5 pm and are room still wasn't ready! They have absolutely no free activities on the resort and all the excursions were overpriced for example to go kayaking in the bay was 85 per person. All the restaurants were overpriced, if you want a burger and fries $16 bucks. A breakfast buffet for two adults and kid will run you $70. The hotel room was $300 a night but doesn't include a microwave and the refridgerators don't get cold. They only have one ice machine for the entire four levels of rooms. I would strongly recommend not to stay at this resort. I could continue with this review but I am just gas we are on our way home

Reviews.Title: “if you have a reservation there "CANCEL IT"”
Reviews.Author: jdellepiane
Reviews.Content: The worst experience EVER!! the resort is magnificent, however, who ever runs it, it is going to run it to THE GROUND!! they have no customer service whatsoever. IT is expensive, however, if the customer service would have been better, I would have SPEND the money. WE GOT there on sat night, late, flight was delayed, our room ahd been given away, so they put us in a 1 king bed, and were told a mattress will be forthcoming, DID NOT GET THE MATTRESS TILL TUESDAY, and my kids slept on the floor. here is another example, the maid service, they bring u towels, but that is it, the room is not clean on a daily basis. one day we got back to the room at 10pm, and they have not cleaned the room at all, i called and they sent this lady that was mad about it, i asked to get me clean cups of coffee, and she told me to wash them myself in the bathroom. you have to wait for EVERTHING, from your room to the hotel, 20 to 30 minutes to transport, to go to the beach 30 to 45 minutes for the boat ride, to get your rental car 30 to 45 minutes, so i spend 1/2 of my week waiting, and NO ONE CARES!! if you want further information, please dont hesitate to call me, my name is Juan at 214-564-2277. IF YOU HAVE RESERVATIONS, CANCEL THEM NOW!! THE WHOLE EXPERIENCE WAS HORRIFIC.

Reviews.Title: “WAY Overpriced, completely underwhelming, and not a place for romance”
Reviews.Author: thekubicks
Reviews.Content: I'm from Puerto Rico, but my husband is not. After hearing rave reviews from everyone, we decided to stay there. Needless to say, I was beyond embarrassed at this hotel being such a big representation of PR. If you want to spend a romantic weekend with your sig. other, DEFINITELY NOT the place for it. There were kids EVERYWHERE and although I understand they have as much right to be there, I was looking for a quiet, adult friendly, luxurious place, which this is NOT. If you want an overcrowded, hidden fees, cruise ship style resort, this is the place for you. Not only was the room WAY overpriced for what it was (nothing special about it AT ALL), our air conditioner started making a huge noise when it turned on. After advising someone to come fix it, our toilet began flushing every 5 minutes as well! After waiting ALL day for someone to come, they ended up not being able to fix it and had to move us to another room. If you know anything about this place, you will see that there is NO way to get to the main part of the hotel unless you take a cable car. which is ALWAYS full. Our room was comparable to a Holiday Inn Express and while I don't mind them, if I'm going to pay $600+ per night I should expect something AMAZING. The restaurants were horrible, parking was $20/day, and Palomino island was so full, there was NO WHERE TO WALK much less swim! If you want luxury for sometimes even LESS, the HORNED DORSETT PRIMAVERA is the place to go. I'd pay twice as much to stay there where I know I'll have a good experience than revisit this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to wait in line for everything!”
Reviews.Author: ketnerrocks
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying the grounds, and the views are amazing. Not much else was relaxing or fun to deal with. We were constantly upset by our experiences! Now to start when we arrived there was a huge line to check in. We waited over an hour to check in. When we got to our room, we noticed that the sheets, bed spread and couch were all stained, as well as the carpet. We immediately decided to go to the pool. We got to the pool at around 3pm and found it to be absolutely packed with kids under the age of 10. You could barely see the water, for the amount of kids. We decided to head down the mountain to the 2nd pool which looked a lot less crowded. When we got there we found out that they had run out of towels for the day, and a member of the staff said, sorry, come earlier tomorrow. We were blown away. The next day we decided to go to the beach which is a 20 minute ferry boat ride away. We waited in line for over an hour to get on this boat that morning and then as soon as we got off at the island people took off sprinting to get lawn chairs. We had no idea what people were doing. by the time we got the beach all of the cabanas had been taken. So everytime we went to the beach that week we had to make sure we were on the first boat and that we ran as fast as we could to get off and claim a spot. The food was great always, but way way overpriced. This is a beautiful place, but overcrowded and declining in quality. Not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.. Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Giselle11642
Reviews.Content: Before I booked my vacation I read all the reviews about this hotel and for the most part they were all terrible but I decided to form my own opinion about it. All I have to say is that the grounds are gorgeous and the views are spectacular. I stayed at a Las Brisas room and the views were breathtaking but before I got to the room I went through hell. First of all I had to stand in line for 2 hours!!(yes 2 hours I am not kidding) to check in. Finally when I got up the counter they were so rude to me. They placed a $600 dollar hold on my account and that's only because I fought with the manager to lower it. She wanted to make $900.00 to cover room costs. This on top of the 14% resort fee that they charge!! Management is terrible.Period. Finally after 3 hours between the check in line and actually checking in I go up to my room and then decided to hit the casino for a little bit. Well I couldn't get back in my room because there was a problem with the card reader. Needless to say after a couple of more hours and 3 tries security let me back in the room and fixed the problem. This hotel needs better organization. When I would complain about something the answer would always be that they were under staffed. The only place in the hotel I would give 5 stars to is Cafe Caribe. The food was excellent, we were always seated promptly, the staff was super friendly and we never waited too long for the food. Domingo Cintron, George Agosto and the rest of their staff were amazing!! If I ever came back to this hotel it would be because of them. They made my experience at El Conquistador so much better. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Carribean Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: minnesotawildcat
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds and location over looking the ocean is beautiful. The rooms are not as elegant as you would expect , but they are OK. The restaurants are very nice but be prepared to spend a lot of money. Food and Drinks are very expensive throughout the resort. The private island is very nice with white sandy beaches, but the floor of the ocean is very rough with coral and will cut up your feet, so make sure you bring water shoes. Lots of sea life can be found snorkeling around the island, and some even spotted sharks. Overall this resort has one of the best ocean views in the world, guest rooms are a little underwhelming, and it gets very expensive by the time you pay for meals and drinks. I would recommend it to a friend, but recommend they rent a car and go off the property for dinner. There are some good restaurants in the area that are pretty reasonable. You also have to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: TurinaY
Reviews.Content: Not all inclusive resort...but has a water taxi (included) that transports you to a private island with all amenities (towels, shade, shops, activities) and shallow coral to snorkel with excellent water clarity. The hotel is Perfect and they did a free upgrade to a balcony room. Go during the summer months on their summer escape plan 3 nights/4th free...Staff are great!! NOT ONE COMPLAINT!!

Reviews.Title: “On The Decline”
Reviews.Author: GLizzle23
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the El Conquistador three years ago with my family on a vacation. I liked it so much that my new wife and I stayed here for three nights as part of our honeymoon to Puerto Rico. I'm not sure what happened in the time between my visits, but this property is in desperate need of a makeover. To begin with, we waited in line for about half an hour (not an exaggeration, I promise) just to check in -- and we were waiting in the HHonors line! We were told our room was ready; it wasn't. The bed was stripped, bathroom still hadn't been cleaned, and the carpet was absolutely soaked. (To be fair about the carpet: the island had seen a few days of non-stop rain prior to our arrival, which is nobody's fault...but still, it's not an excuse) We were quickly moved to a room four or five down from our original. The room was clean, but the carpet was still very wet. (Again: I'm aware that on an island, humidity is always a problem.) Anyway, I don't want to turn this review into a blow-by-blow account of our 3 nights there, so I'll move on. All staff encountered -- front desk, restaurants, housecleaning, etc. -- were superb. The onsite restaurants at which we dined were outstanding! The Stingray Cafe and the Strip House both serve terrific food and the service was great. This was where the El Conquistador got it right. Don't be fooled by the official website's description of the casino. It is SMALL, and has two -- yes, TWO -- tables for blackjack. It's only open from 4pm-midnight, so if you're picking this hotel because it has a casino, don't bother. The pools are nice; the hotel's private island isn't. The water is nice, but there was an incredible amount of seaweed in the water. As cool as it might sound to take a ferry to the island, it's actually somewhat of an inconvenience. (The hotel claims it's an 8-minute ride; it's actually more like 15, and the ferry only runs once every half hour in each direction) The Golden Door Spa is also a huge plus. The services are totally worth the price. You MUST get a massage! And, finally -- the rooms themselves get a D+. We had a terrific view of the ocean and our bathroom was huge, but that's about all that was redeeming. The comforter on the bed felt like it had been washed 1,000 times, the paint was peeling everywhere, the bathroom had rust on the sink, etc. Based upon the room itself, it's hard to believe that this is a Waldorf-Astoria property. The location of the hotel is so remote from anything (it's about 45 miles from San Juan) that, unless you're going to rent a car, you can't leave the resort. A feeling of seclusion is not uncommon...which is actually what my wife and I were going for, so it is a plus for us. Just be aware of this, because the location might not be a plus for others. Overall, I cannot recommend the El Conquistador. At one point, it was a must-stay when traveling to Puerto Rico, but that's just not the case anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: bonnamomma1990
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 3 children (12 and under) and my mother-in-law stayed at the El Con July 17-23, 2010. We picked this hotel after researching about 12 other properties & even after all the very negative reports. Online it had everything we were looking for from a 5 yr. old to adults plus we only wanted to hop one plane ride and not deal with passports. The resort grounds and buildings are gorgeous, breathtaking! We stayed in a 3 bedroom Las Casitas villa, NOT the main hotel. Check in was private, only 10 minutes, free water unlimited everyday, private breakfasts with (at most) 12 other people. Very nice and worth the price. The villas are gorgeous. Roomy and having a full kitchen was a huge plus. Went to the local WalMart and grocery store to stock up on drinks and snacks. No problem. We rented our own car at the airport because parking was free at the villas. FYI: when we were there we heard a lot of folks staying in the main hotel complaining about everything but not in the villas. You never saw anyone, it was quiet and very calm in that part of the resort. Food was great. Full breakfast, Stingray Cafe was awesome, Ballyhoo was our favorite & the restaurant on the island was great. Awesome drinks! We also ventured off the property 2 nights; to the Fajardo Inn to the Blue Iguana (excellent) and to Pasions (fantastic!) Maid service was excellent. They did our dishes everyday, turndown service and when our 1 hairdryer broke they brought us a brand new one right away. Now, the downsides: we were there when Trop Storm Bonnie was born. Not fun. It rained but we can't control that anyways. Still didn't stop us. Also, one thing the website and the sales reps DO NOT talk about is the logistics in getting around the resort. It is a HUGE place. HUGE!! It takes some time to get from one spot to the next but you just need to work that into your time. We went out to the island one day and waited in line about 45 mins for the first ferry. Twice we did have a 15 min wait for the incline down to the waterpark. They really do need to build another set of inclines or devise another way to move large quantities of people up/down the cliffs. It wasn't bad, you just had to wait sometimes. Also, the few times we went to the main hotel and walked thru the lobby it was a madhouse. I can't imagine staying in the main hotel. The villas were so worth the price and actually cheaper than 2 hotel rooms. We were so happy we stayed in the villas. Waterpark was fun too and a great option for something to do and not have to leave the property.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: MarieJD
Reviews.Content: Our group stay in the Hotel since thursday 22 'till sunday 25.It wasn't the first time we visit the Conquistador, but now under the new administration ,service is much better.Food is ok and ammenities have improved for the best.If you are staying don't forget to visit the small Island, beaches are gorgeous!!!! Breakfast at Las Brisas , friday morning, was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort but extremly over priced and unorganized”
Reviews.Author: AlexnNydia
Reviews.Content: Hello all let me describe our trip to the El Conquistador Resort first off the grounds and views are beautiful...You will get to know the groundsvery well while you are waiting for your room 4PM check-in nah more like 8:15 and we arrived at 1:30!!...and all front desk will say we will call you when your room is ready. To tell you about the service it does not live up to the Waldorf Astoria name...some staff is very helpful and some very rude...to give you example we checked in on Friday and did not get house keeping till Tuesday and when someone finally came they told us we are just going change your towels....The food taste and quality was great, but I hope you have a lot of money to pay for it....for example 1 hot dog 9.00 or cheese burger 15.95....and I hope you do not like sizzling fajitas b/c they are 29.95 and this is just at your lunch spots......the diner spots are even more expensive and don't thing about sharing b/c they will charge you 20.00 sharing fee.! If you like swiming, golf there are many pools, and very nice golf course.....but if you catch a few days of rain you will be bored stiff b/c there is nothing to do.....there is not much night life or activities.....for example we went to the island there to rent wave runners and they only had 1 plus one broken one....to sum it all up I would recommend this place but rent a car so yoy can explore the island but just to let you know they will charge you 22.00 per day to park. Have fun on your trip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: dmusson1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort for our awards trip and had a wonderful time. This is a beautiful facility. More importantly is the hospitality of the staff. I became sick during our trip and the convention manager went out of her way to make sure I was taken care of. She took me to her personal doctor, who then got me into a specialist. All of this was done with out me even having to ask. Thanks to her help, I was treated and started feeling immediately better.

Reviews.Title: “Keep on travelin'.”
Reviews.Author: travelin_mommi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Puerto Rico for our wedding anniversary. We were looking for a relaxing and luxurious vacation spot. El Conquistador was nice, but we saw other resorts in Puerto Rico that were nicer. Good points: nice bathroom, clean room, excellent views from hotel, nice pools, helpful hotel staff. Bad points: boat ride to private beach (a pain) moving cars up and down the mountain to get to some rooms and a must to get to the beach boat ride, expensive restaurants in the hotel, very crowded, "free" breakfast in the morning had 30 plus minute wait.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NawtyLiah
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absoulutely gorgouse. The customer service was out of this world. We actually asked the bell boy boy that assited us when we arrived (Will) to assist us as we departed-He was FABULOUS!!!!. I do have 2 complaints: FOOD-a bit pricey for my taste and why do they not offer Spanish food??? NIGHT LIFE- there was not much to do after 12am. Overall a 5 star in my book. I will return!!

Reviews.Title: “I was one of the unlucky ones, I guess”
Reviews.Author: loquito_92
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before going and went with my girlfriend from 7/8-7/13 hoping I would not encounter the service issues and problems others have encountered. Unfortunately I did. Don't really want to talk about it at length, but it should be sufficient to say that they forgot to clean our room one day, waited 25 minutes for my car at the valet one day (which I had to use because the parking lot was full), and waited 50 minutes for the funicular on a Saturday morning on our way to breakfast. The funicular situation was the worst. They were doing maitenance on one of them around 9:30am on Saturday, and the other one would not make a stop at our middle building. After looking at it pass in front of us for like 15 minutes, we had to walk down the stairs to the Marina level and catch it there. As we were standing in line we noticed it started making stops again at the building in the middle. Total wait to go upstairs to the lobby, almost an hour. So I stayed there for six days and they managed to aggravate me on three of them. I think that is pretty much a confirmation of how much "hit and miss" the service is in this hotel. you can tell from the comments here too. Some people go and dont encounter any issues, others are not so lucky... Also, no coffee maker, no mini fridge in my room, wth???

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/great amenities...if you have the $$$.”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth_jade
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in PR and my family would always stay at El Conquistador when we were looking for a getaway from our busy lives and seeing the upgrade from the 90's the rooms have received and unbelievable modern update with amazing bathrooms. I know live in South Carolina and I went 2 weeks ago with my husband and kids so we could have some fun (and see my parents who still live there) and I for one loved it. Yes there's no island music near the pool but I find that a plus, I mean seriously, it's quite quiet and relaxing and if you're looking to just loose your mind with a pina colada by the pool who needs all that extra music that makes you feel like you're in Barbados? -- Palomino and Palominito beach were great as always and I believe that the food in Palomino is a better bet that the one in the hotel. Be sure to get there early for the ferry as it takes I believe 20 minutes for the boat to make each trip. -- Coqui Water Park was great, our kids loved it (2 boys, 11 and 9 and a girl, 8) obviously it doesn't compare to Wet-N-Wild but the slides are great and the current pool is awesome (although it's only 3 ft. so adults be careful)..*TIP*: Get there early !! [oh and adults can ride all of the slides as well]. Now the "bad", now of course it's an expensive hotel, have you seen the size? facilities? views? ok then lets stop expecting to get rooms there for $40 a night. My worst complaint was (and always has been)..the food!!! Ridiculous prizes for not so great food, the pizza at Buena Vista [near the pool next to the lobby] is thinner than a cracker and I believe was almost $20. If you can..go out of the hotel to eat [the restaurants upstairs are good but well..really expensive. We ate at the hotel one night at Piccola Fontana and it ran us $300 for good but not amazing food!. Do some research before you come and if you rent a car go OUT of the perimeters to eat [My recommendation: El Metropol, it's 10 minutes out of the hotel and the food is great and reasonably priced]. Also, if you drive to the hotel stop by a supermarket (there's on in the same Avenue as the hotel) and stock up on fruits and snacks for the kids, it'll save you quite a lot !!!!!. Above all it's a great place, we love it and will go back without a doubt. The rooms are great, the beds are super comfy, quiet pool, great beach, yes drinks are expensive but hello it's a hotel !!. No it's not the same as the Waldorf Astoria hotels in the US but Puerto Rico is not the same as the US sooo...I like it and if you have the money go for it. Also..don't fight for a room with a view, most of them have it anyways and you really just go to the room to sleep and bathe. HAVE FUN :)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and views, not a Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: iheartreviews
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this resort we had a fairly realistic expectation of the accomodations and quickly confirmed that a "Waldorf" hotel in P.R. is not the same as it's equal in the U.S. Check-in was a long process (wait in line) but we were upgraded to a Marina, Ocean-view room (at no additional cost) and it was a wonderful location, with a private balcony that over-looked the water park. The room was clean, nicely decorated and showed just a few small signs of wear and tear. The pools and common areas were well maintained (not spotless) but the vast views from this resort could not be beat. We spent a full day at the island beach which was amazing. The best beach we visited during out trip to P.R. Drinks and food were moderate to expensive. Lots of options and the staff was fantastic. It is definitely a resort for families. Not best for quiet, romantic getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for no-hassle relaxation”
Reviews.Author: rongse
Reviews.Content: Staff at El Conquistador are friendly and helpful. They upgraded us to a room right by the marina with a full ocean view. It's a family friendly place with plenty of activities for kids. On one night, they were playing Avatar on a large movie screen by the pool. On 4th of July, they had fireworks on the golf course visible throughout the resort grounds. Palomino Island was wonderful. If you have your own snorkel equipment, you can go snorkeling in the blue, clear waters. There's a little bit of coral, but if you want to find the more interesting wildlife, you have to swim further out. The waters are shallow, so it's not awful. I'd recommend wearing water shoes or flippers to avoid stepping on sea urchins. There's one huge crown of coral with lots of colorful inside. I don't think most people discovered it since they were snorkeling over the sea grass. Not sure why. The sea grass is not really that interesting. Maybe they don't have lawns at home. The reviews criticizing the food are pretty accurate. It's all American or Americanized food (did not try the Chinese/Japanese place). There are affordable options on the premises, but they are not the most delicious. If you plan on staying at the resort for several days (and want to travel outside the resort grounds for a day), I would recommend renting a car the first day and dropping by Wal-Mart to pick up beverages and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: solisol
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a big disappointment. Checking-in took half an hour because they only had 3 people at the front desk and a lot of customers. Then it took another 15 minutes just to walk all the way to our room which was about half a mile away (we even had to take a tram!). Once we arrived to our room we realized that the room had not been cleaned, the beds had not been made, and there were no towels so we had to call room service right away. We had planned to complain upon check-out, but after waiting 20 minutes on the check-out line, we decided to do the automatic check out and get the hell out of there. Not to mention that they charge $15 for self-parking. A bad and expensive stay. Would not recommend it if you are a down-to-earth practical traveler.

Reviews.Title: “POOR SERVICE - does not live up to Waldorf name”
Reviews.Author: Nagels35805
Reviews.Content: Our trip did not get off to a good start....had to wait in hilton honors registration line, which you would think would be priority check in, for about 20 minutes before anyone came over to the desk. There were only 2 employees checking in the long line of guests. Room was not ready so we waited and when we returned to the desk to check in there was no one at the desk. We were told they were having lunch and would be with us shortly. 20 minutes later, i checked in with the concierge instead. They gave us a room with 1 king - we are a family of 4 and had requested 2 queen beds. They offered us an inflate a bed for the kids. The trip continued to go down hill from there....poor service at the pool bar restaurant - 30 minutes just to get our drinks, out of ketchup bottles, forgot the fudge on the hot 'fudge' sundaes, etc.... Housekeeping took our towels with kids swimsuits wrapped in them - never to be found - different story from each person we spoke to. Pool/beach towels were shabby and stained. Night life catered to the locals with VERY loud music taking over the lobby and pool area - quiet time could not be had at the starbucks or within the lobby area. Overall, not the service or atmosphere you expect with the Waldorf name. Positives: Palomino island was beautiful - Not great for swimming (you need water shoes), but the kids loved the snorkeling!

Reviews.Title: “A Waldorf Astoria property? It doesn't live up to it's brand image”
Reviews.Author: WilderC
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the El Con. A Waldorf Astoria brand bespeaks a commitment of excellence, an extremely high level of service, the highest level of quality in it's cuisine; a supremely upkept appearance and maintenance. None of this is displayed at the El Con. They should seriously either upgrade the service delivery or downgrade the branding. This is my biggest gripe. One has a certain image and expectation when staying at a luxury resort or even a mid-tier like a Hampton Inn. If my expectation was set properly, I wouldn't mind standing in the HHONORS line for 45 minutes only to be told my room wasn't ready...and then waiting another 2 hours for it to be ready. In line at 3:15pm. In front of the registration person at 4pm didn't get my room key until after 6pm. I told the check in person I self-parked but she didn't tell me how the parking works, where to validate, etc.. My package had breakfast included and she didn't tell me where the breakfast was nor the hours (by the way, skip breakfast, it isn't worth it, even if it is free). She didn't mention the Golden Door spa at all nor the fact I could use the exercise facilities at no charge given I have Diamond status. Nor the fact that I was given an upgraded room and then charged for it but didn't know until I checked out - I thought that was the room category I booked! The staff is indifferent at best and poorly trained. I guess I'm disappointed that a high-end resort makes you wait for hours, then hands you keys, ID cards and a map and then shoos you away without even telling you about the property. I'm at fault for having high expectations :) The food is less than mediocre and very pricey. Eat off property. Many good restaurants in Fajardo. Seriously, if they marketed this as an average resort, ok, great property. It just doesn't live up to its brand. The good news: great location. great views. The Golden Door spa is very nice and the hotel personnel there are exceedingly professional. My rant above aside, the Spa is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with a lot going for it but be aware”
Reviews.Author: jone7768
Reviews.Content: We just back from a 1 week stay at the El Conquistador and we really enjoyed it but there were a few down sides you might want to be aware of. On the positive first, this is probably one of the prettiest, most scenic resorts we've been to. The views are stunning, the grounds were gorgeous and with our Caribbean Escape package, we really enjoyed the free buffet breakfasts each day. When we first arrived we waited over an hour in the Hilton Honors line to get checked in. I learned later that there is a Express Checkin/out kiosk on the other side of the lobby and we need not have waited so long. The Express Check out also allowed us to sign in for our flights and print our boarding pass. I recommend you use it and avoid the lines at the desk which were constant and long the whole week we were there. It is extremely expensive to get to the resort so we rented our own rental car. It's an hour drive. I think in the end it paid for itself because we were able to go into town and buy water, sodas, snacks, and go out to eat dinner off the resort, go shopping at the outlets. This saved us alot and probably paid for the car. Be aware there is a $16/day parking fee. We kept the car the whole week so it was pricey but you rent one and return it. I was told you could pick up at the airport and return to a Fajardo location for a fee but since we kept the car the whole week I don't know how that would have worked out price wise. There is no beach on the resort, you ride the tram down and take a ferry over. It is very beautiful and scenic but be ware that there is a lot of coral in the sand (use beach shoes) and there was a lot of sea weed in the water. Overall, I was not impressed bc I don't like to swim in seaweed but my husband enjoyed it. The water is not very deep which I guess is good for those with kids. The resort is very child friendly with the water park, 4 foot swimming pools, and plenty of beach/lounge chairs. We were shocked that we never had a problem finding chairs. This was a first for us in the Caribbean and was great though it would have been nicer is the swimming pool was deeper for the adults. There 3 pools were all 4 foot deep, max. Finally I would say I was not impressed with the rooms or the food. The rooms were adequate and quite spacey but the furnishing was not what I expected for a Waldorf. If you want a coffee maker you will have to ask for one. They are not in the room. I guess they want you to spend your money at the Starbucks but if you ask they will provide one for free. Finally on the food be warned that it is expensive. $10+ for all drinks, and my husband and I easily dropped $100 for our dinner and drinks each night and we shared meals. Overall we didn't come out too bad spending wise but we are very light eaters and drinkers. If your family eats a lot be prepared to spend some big bucks ... or do what we did and load up on the buffet and use your car to go into town to keep the cost down. Overall the food was the worst part about it for me as I don't mind paying for good quality food and I thought the food was so so....so don't get me wrong, we enjoyed our trip and had a wonderful time but after it was all said and done we probably will not go back. The El San Juan in Isle Verde was more our speed and it is also a Waldorf Astoria...closer to the airport and other restaurants and has a beautiful beach but to each his own and this resort does have a lot going for it for the kids so I would recommend it with all the above caveats. PS. If you like tennis bring your raquets or it's $15 to rent and if you like to golf, call to find out how it works. The golf coarse was huge and looked extremely nice! Oh, and I almost forgot, if you don't like walking this resort is not for you. We actually liked it a lot and that was not a problem for us. It's a huge resort and to get to different parts of it you have to walk and take various elevators and the tram. It didn't bother us but I guess some may not like it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive, Not worth the price for the hassles”
Reviews.Author: mickman8
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort and we have been twice with my wife's company and this time it has been turned over to the Hilton family and we saw huge changes. First off, this is not an all inclusvie and it is VERY EXPENSIVE for very very average food. They have had a lot of cutbacks and the service is horrible. You need to plan to wait for quite a while to eat and be ready to pay! Drinks are 10 plus dollars, beer is about 6 bucks a pop, a burger is 15 bucks and so on. Breakfast can be upwards of 20 dollars a person. The resort is very large so be ready to travel. Getting to the beach is a job in itself. You must travel down about 3 levels and take a 15 minute ferry ride to the island. The beach itself is pretty nice and relaxing although the water is pretty dirty in most parts. The island is large so there are tons of things to do but you are basically stuck there and until a ferry returns. The pools are nice but get very crowded and are not peaceful in any way. The waterpark is neat but there is a charge to get in and the staff is beyond rude at the park. The casino now closes at midnight versus 4am the previous year and is very small. They only have a few tables and they will not have all of them open which causes huge problems. I even spoke with the manager about opening tables because so many people were waiting and they refuesed even though they had staff standing around. The spa is incredible and one of the best I have been too so that is a huge positive. The rooms are very nice and spacious with a great bathroom. There are tons of things to do at the resort such as watersports, golf, excurcisons, etc but be prepared to pay dearly and I mean dearly to do anything including to eat! Outside the resort is extremely dangerous so do not wander off. One year, a tourist was murdered right outside the resort when she was on a jog. There is a club at night that opens for dancing and etc but they have 1 bartender and you can never get a drink. My wife's company will not be returning due to the outrageously priced food that is average at best and the problems with the casino and inconvienence of the beach. I would look other places if you are looking at Peurto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well maintained resort.”
Reviews.Author: 3Horsegirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two hotels during our trip to Puerto Rico. The El Conquistador is HUGE. It is beautiful with wonderful views, very clean and everyone is very nice. The rooms are quite large and very clean. Sleeping was a challenge for us due to the birds and frogs that get really noisy in the wee hours of the morning but there is not much they can do about it. There are multiple levels to the hotel so it can take a while to get from one place to another. There is no beach at the hotel so you take a 10 minute boat ride to Palomino Island to get to the beach. The island is pretty, but the water is very shallow and you have to go out a long way in order to really swim or snorkel. The Iguana Cafe on the island was the best meal we had on the resort. The food on the resort is VERY expensive, but if you don't need anything fancy, turn right out of the resort and you can have a great, inexpensive meal on a porch with parrots and some local people. The resort is a great place to stay, but this end of the island does not have much to do outside of the resort other than snorkeling. The best day of our trip was our day of snorkeling on the Erin Go Bragh III. It's about a 15 minute drive from the hotel and was by far the best day of our entire trip but you do need to book ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation with alot of walking”
Reviews.Author: anna902
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful...Me and my cousin traveled with six 18 year olds and four 16 year olds. Our day started at the breakfast Buffet which was included in our package. then ,we went to the private island everyday so we could enjoy the beach and then back to the pool. theres ALOT of walking....we walked and walked and walked..and it was very humid...we never had lunch cause we were exhausted and hot and weren't hungry. Because we read the reviews here before we left, we called VIP tours and booked a round trip to and from airport..On the way to the hotel we stopped at a walmart and bought junk food, cases of water and liquor..which was great becuase a bottle of water at hotel was the same pice as what we paid for a case 24 bottles of poland springs at walmart. we ate at the chinse restaurant which was good and the italian. One night we rented two SUV's at enterprise at the hotel and went to old san jan for the night..and ate dinner there..many clubs there ..we went to senior frogs.another night we went to new san juan but paid one of the waiters who drives people on the side..we went to the san juan hotel, which had a big casino..that was also nice. and it had a great club The only negative I have to say about our stay was there is no night life. at our resort....the clubs at the hotel were not open all week and it was a holiday weekend...the casino closes at midnight...thank god all the kids we traveled with made the best of it. the one bar at the pool stood open to 130am.I thought their would be alot of tourists there, but from what we saw and the people we spoke to, this resort is a big travel spot for the locals there to go on vacation with many family members. alot of yound kids..the pools were open 24 hours, which is great cause it was too hot.. Overall it was a great vacation...beautiful hotel..not a hotel for people who don't like walking alot...it was clean and people were friendly....some things over priced but like i said you make the best of it..food was average I would say, not horrible but not the best..theres a starbucks, davids cookie, gelato place..the bar by the pool has good food ...but it is missing night life entertainment or nighlt clubs with some dancing.

Reviews.Title: “had to check out our first night”
Reviews.Author: petrock45
Reviews.Content: First, i don't have alot of money but i try to go on vacation once a year. So for the price they charge i think it should be a well keeped resort, but it was'nt. This was my honeymoon and fron just the drive alone i was getting angry. We got to the hotel and checked in at the front desk"wich was about a mile from our room. As we walked to our room we noticed there we no maitnance workers at all, nobody was cleaning anything. It really looked like the place was falling apart. After we had gotten settled we went to the pool where a chicken bone was on one of the ledges for a good 8 hours"i saw it there the next day." there was ants everwhere and bird poop. we decided to go to the beach from the pool wich takes about an hour especially with only one trolly taking you down the hill. When we arrived on their "secluded island" it turn out any can go as long as they have a boat. We finally got to go in the ocean wich was horrible. It was so rocky were u go in that we had to get out because our feet hurt. the island was dirty and did not look like a place u want to be stranded on for five minutes. The only good thing was the horseback ride. The man that gave us the tour was very friendly and that was just about the only good thing on that island. We went out to eat that night by the marina and the hole time we were eating it stunk like u know what. I called my travle agent and told them to "get me out" they hooked me up with the intercontanetal in san juan isle verde. Going from ther to here is like night and day. The beach and pool and whole area is about 100% cleaner nicer and plain better. never stay at el conpooopidor the wost decision anyone can make horrible bad nasty discussting!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnfader1965
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El Conquistador resort for nearly two weeks in June, 2010 with my wife and three kids 15, 13 and 1-1/2. The hotel grounds and views are absolutely beautiful. The main hotel lobby and mall area were great too. Our room was adequate and the bathroom with dressing area was large enough for our youngest sons crib during afternoon naps and early evenings. The overall hotel staff and especially the front desk staff were very helpful. Every time we asked for towels or anything else they called back in 10 minutes to make sure they were delivered. Once we returned home the hotel emailed me a link to an online survey and shortly after I completed it the hotel manager sent me an email and responded to my comments personally. That says a lot. High speed internet is FREE in the main hotel lobby area, Casino, Starbucks, etc. Palomino island is beautiful and great for snorkeling right off shore. The boat ride is FREE and less than 10 min. My son and I explored the area and found thousands of fish of every color. They charge rental for gear so I'm glad we brought our own. You can get by without the fins for most of the shallow area but to see some of the best views you will need fins. Also with so much coral on the beach you will want water shoes. The views from the top of the island are awesome and well worth the hike to the top. I had read a lot of information about high food prices and extra charges so we were prepared for the worst. Yes, the food on the island was a little expensive but okay. Burgers are good and the drinks are cold. We ate once at the cheap place in the hotel and although the food was okay it was overpriced and the service was pretty bad. Our waitress disappeared after she took our order and we had to beg for more water. We ate all of our dinners out. I highly recommend LA ESTACION (which is a right turn from the gate at the hotel) and METROPOL (which is near the main highway). To save money we got lots of bottled water and snacks at the ECONO food store. To pacify the kids we also ate at Pizza Hut, Sizzler (has a good buffet), Chilli's at the Mall and McDonalds. My kids begged to go back to Sizzler but I made them eat local the last few days. The main pools on the weekend are packed. I think they must let locals in or something because they had suits under their clothes. I would explore or do a day trip on Saturday to avoid. The Coqui Water Park was nice but should be cheaper as it only has three large slides, one kiddie slide and a lazy river. We enjoyed it for one day. We spent more time on the beach. The pool at the hotel halfway down the hill was never full. If you want to get away from the crowds check it out. There is also a sun deck overlooking the ocean. The Funicular to the lower hotels and marina was always working and never an issue. We wanted to ride when the last boat arrived from the island and did not have to wait long. It is really a cool experience, especially the kids. We rented a Enterprise car and parked it in the customer lot at the hotel for free. It can fill up on the weekends. Drive carefully on the island. They don't follow basic driving rules. They will make a left turn in the right lane. They will do U turns anywhere. Motorcycles travel in the center laneâ€¦.cops too. You get used to the driving, just be defensive. When you see how many cars, new cars, have damaged front bumpers you will be cautious. We toured and recommend El Yunque and Old San Juan. Plaza Las Americas Mall was nice and very packed during the week. We did a lot of exploring but it takes time to get places. Garmin works in PR but don't rely on it for estimated times.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel - Needs Some Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Me215
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at El Conquistador. We had a fairly large group occupying two rooms in the Las Olas section of the hotel and one room in the Marina. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, but I have some comments and observations: Iâ€™ll start by saying that the grounds and views are breathtaking. I have a photo that I took from the balcony of our Las Olas room set as the wallpaper on my pc. Our view was of the pool, the ocean, and palm trees. It was postcard worthy. The number of activities available at the hotel was also amazing. They have a private island, their own water park, water sports, horse-back riding, pools open 24 hours (no life guards), and just about anything you can imagine at a resort. Even though every amenity is available at the resort, the cost of those amenities tends to be outrageous. I recommend renting a car for your time at this resort. We tried a couple restaurants in the hotel and found them to be mediocre given the price. If youâ€™re willing to drive 10-15 minutes, there are numerous dining options in the area. Most of the businesses in the surrounding area are used to english-speaking tourists. Donâ€™t count on the concierge to help plan much, though. I found most of the concierge staff to be somewhat uninformed and not very eager to help. You may even want to go outside of the resort for your excursions. Just outside of the hotel you can usually find reputable guides for often MORE THAN HALF the price. You do have to be careful selecting a guide, though. Some of the people advertising various excursions did not seem reputable. We did a scuba excursion from the hotel and were very pleased with the experience. We also did a kayak trip using a tour group just outside of the resort and were also pleased (especially with the price). Our Las Olas room was huge, although laid out a bit oddly. There was a large bathroom which included a large walk-in closet and vanity. The fridge (or "cooler", as was the case) was located inside the vanity. There was a sliding door to the bathroom which did not lock and had large openings on each side when closed. I would have preferred a door with a lock on it. A final note about the bathroom: Considering that the bathroom and closet were the size of some smaller hotel rooms, the only ventilation was a very small return vent above the toilet. I found the ventilation to be inadequate and it was usually quite stuffy in the bathroom, especially after a shower. The beds were in a large room with a desk, LCD TV, and chair. Double sliding doors opened to a large balcony overlooking the pool and ocean. The sliding doors were effective at muting the noise coming from people in the pool around the clock. Electrical outlets were often occupied and not as plentiful as I would have liked. The furniture was older and definitely not as grand as you might expect from a Waldorf Resort. However, most pieces appeared to be in satisfactory condition. Air conditioning worked very well in the bedroom area. Our room was clean overall, although the bathroom floor could have used a good scrubbing. Upon seeing the other 2 rooms occupied by friends, I would say that the same comments apply. The Marina room was slightly smaller, but had a much more logical layout (fridge, counter, and sink in the hall, vanity in the bathroom). I did notice a slight mildew odor in the Marina room. Customer service at the hotel was not up to standard for a Waldorf resort.
