For example, when we arrived at the hotel we were promptly greeted by the bell staff at the car; however, unloading of the car seemed a bit disorganized and irritating. We had some drinks and snacks in a cooler, but were told that only the contents of the cooler would be allowed. So we had to empty the cooler and put our items in bags before we could continue unloading. We then watched the bell staff load a cart with our items along with the items for other guests. After finally getting all of our bags loaded on the cart, the entire group had to walk together from room-to-room while bags were delivered. It was like an involuntary group tour. Check-in and check-out were also a bit of a hassle. Because of room charge cards that are issued, every guest must be present at check-in time. Each person has to sign the room agreement and each charge card. The process took at least 30 minutes. At the time we checked out, the check-out kiosks were disabled. We had to wait in line for about 45 minutes to checkout. Turns out we would have had to wait even if the kiosks were available because there were incorrect charges on one of the room bills. No copy of the bill was provided the night before check-out, as is the standard at most hotels. The hotel is spralled out over a mountain with essentially 3 levels (Main, Las Olas, and Marina). You travel from one level to another using a series of walkways, elevators, and â€œfunicularsâ€�. The funiculars, while unusual and kind of neat at first, were not much â€œfunâ€� at all. There were only 2 funiculars in use and getting around often involved waiting extended amounts of time, as if waiting for a train. Sometimes when the funicular arrived it would be full or the operator would pass your floor because they didnâ€™t feel like stopping at that time. We found one operator in particular to be quite rude and inconsiderate. Itâ€™s necessary to hold on to a railing while riding the funicular, and if you release at any time you will be scolded by the operator. While the mountainous arrangement of the resort is a large part of its appeal, it makes it unusually difficult to get around. Overall, I do recommend this hotel for those without physical disabilities. We had an awesome time. I suggest renting a car to avoid astonishingly-high-priced amenities at the resort. Donâ€™t expect the same level of service that you would from other hotels in this class. The staff is generally relaxed and you may have to insist for some of the basic customer services that you take for granted elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive, no beach, private island nice but not convenient”
Reviews.Author: bogeysmomq
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to go to Puerto Rico and also excited about the resort prior to our arrival. The resort is huge, plan on walking a lot to get to anywhere. The concierge wasn't the most helpful, you had to ask specific questions and then you "might" get some information. No shuttle service to anywhere nearby. There is no beach at the resort, you have to take a ferry (which only runs certain hours) to the private island....so, don't expect to walk hand in hand at sunset or sunrise or walk looking for shells, etc. You will be back at the main resort. Everything was very pricey. To rent clubs and shoes and play golf will set you back over $230.00. You need to bring your own golf balls, as you don't even get a sleeve (which is traditional) with club rental. You must purchase them seperately. Most of the people were extremely friendly and the view is beautiful. Don't expect any snorkeling wonders but it is picturesque. Won't do that resort again. Rooms sufficient, no coffee makers, refrigerator door wouldn't stay closed, Not once during the check out did anyone ask how things had been during the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ride at your own risk!”
Reviews.Author: Kellyexcursions
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an 8 night stay at the Conquistador on the Caribbean Escape package which financially turned out to be a pretty good deal. However, I'm writing this review only about the horseback riding activity offered on the resorts partially owned island Palomino Island. My horseback riding experience is around 20 rides and my for my eight year old daugher it was her second ride. No reservations for this activity are accepted. It's first come first serve up to approximately 10-12 riders. My eight year old daughter and I stayed in San Juan for 4 days prior to the Fajardo visit and I had taken her horseback riding with PR4less in Corozal in which a 1 1/2 hour horseback ride through mountaneous trails and a river cost $55 per person. Palomino stables which is independently operated charged $147.66 for two people (no discounts for children) for 30 minutes of horseback riding time. We had myself, my 8 year old daughter and another rider and the orientation took around 10 minutes. I'm sure it would take much longer with more people. Off we go and 3 minutes into the ride on the trail and my horse goes slightly off the main path and I'm into a very thorny bush which cut my right arm in numerous places from my hand to my shoulder. I let out a shattering scream to which the guide did not stop, turn around to see if I was okay and did and said absolutely NOTHING! Since many of the scratches were bleeding I again reiterated I was injured and he did.... NOTHING! He just kept on riding. So, my scratches are swelling and some are bleeding and I start paying more attention to the foliage and I see these thorny bushes EVERYWHERE. Of course, while my wounds are swelling and bleeding I pay extra attention and am now worried about my daughter's safety. While we're riding I'm thinking how come he did not warn us in advance to stay in the center (if you can always control your horse that is). We get to the top in about 10 minutes and see some spectacular views and the guide says "welcome to my office" and I say my arm hurts. NO COMMENT. He completely ignored me. Then, he tells the other rider and my daughter it's okay to let the horses eat for a minute and she winds up tangled in some of these bushes, but he extricates her unharmed. Less than 10 minutes more and we are back at the stable. He asks me if "I had a good time"!!! To which I replied "no I did not, my arm is cut, bleeding and I need medical attention"! He looked like OKAYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY. ... I will get you a bandaid. The stable has no first aid kit at all, so he brings over some people from the island's facilities with a seriously undersupplied medical kit. They didn't even have antiseptic. I got the stable manager's phone number from The Conquistador's concierge. Basically, he told me this has happened before and it's the hotel's fault because they won't trim the shrubs back. I have to agree that if it's their responsibilty they are doing a very poor job. These shrubs are impossible to avoid if your horse goes a little off the center of the path. However, in response the guide's behavior, I asserted that he should have warned us which he did not and the manager agreed with me. The manager said I should have said I wanted to stop the ride when I was ignored multiple times. I asked him if I should have gone back alone with my daughter to the stables? He didn't have a response other than he would talk to his guide and make sure people are warned. He also asked me to write a letter to the Conquistador complaining about the shrubs (which i did). His offer to soften the horrible experience? A thirty five dollar credit to my account. When I checked my account at the hotel I asked if he had posted the credit which he promptly did and mentioned a small briefing of my experience. Looking at the cuts on my arm the front desk staff person said that $35 dollars doesn't seem reasonable and she would call him on my behalf. No change in the credit. The bottom line....find an off premise way to go horseback riding. For much less you can go for a much longer and probably safer ride.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property however the staff is completely useless and rude.”
Reviews.Author: kmarti
Reviews.Content: I needed to take a moment to write my review of my experience at the El Conquistador Resort. There are many reviews here that all express similar experiences at the hotel. I was hoping since it is a reputable Waldorf Astoria they were wrong. Unfortunately, I was. My newly wedded husband and I stayed on property May 20-24 2010 for our honeymoon which is low season for this hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 1pm. Our reservations were for an ocean view room. When we arrived, there were 5 men standing around the bell hop desk and the valet. No one came over to welcome us to the hotel, take our bags or even our car. Our room was not ready and we were assured that it wouldnâ€™t be long until the housekeeping staff had addressed our room and we would be able to check in. We provided both our cell phone numbers for the check in desk to ring us when the room was complete. My husband and I decided to go to the restaurant Las Brisas to have a nice lunch while we waited. We ordered our food and the service was slow. Then we noticed we had not seen our waitress in quite some time. After patiently waiting for our food to arrive and finally the check we went up to another server and asked for assistance. It turned out that she changed shifts and either didnâ€™t alert the new server or the new server didnâ€™t want to attend to our table. We later saw our waitress in the on property Starbucks sipping an iced coffee. An hour and a half had gone by while we were eating lunch. I went back to see if our room was available. The hotel staff asked me if I was called which I replied no, no one called me but I figured I would check in. They made it seem as though I was bothering them to check in again. I then asked if it was possible for us to leave our luggage at the front desk and if we could sit by the pool while we waited. I was told no, the pool is for registered guests and I needed to be checked in before I could use the facilities. Is there no hospitality room? They then offered me a room to check into but it was a double bed garden view. I mentioned it was our honeymoon and we booked the ocean view king bed and the woman not only didnâ€™t say congratulations but actually suggested that my husband and I take turns sleeping in one double bed for two days and the other double bed for the other two days. For real?!?!? I then explained to her that we had been traveling since 3am so if there was anything that they could do to expedite the room it would be greatly appreciated. The manager said she has already asked the cleaning staff to attend to another room and didnâ€™t want to upset them. We then proceeded to take our seats again on the wooden chairs directly across from the check in desk. Another hour and a half go by and now husband decided to see if we could check in since it is after check in time. The front desk agent said our room was available. He then questioned her why she gave me a hard time about not following up with the front desk until we were called to alert us that our room was available to which she said we must have forgotten. We were sitting on the wooden chairs in the lobby. They could see us just sitting there. How does a Waldorf Astoria Hotel that operates in the hospitality industry forget to check in their customers? We check in to our room and obviously had to carry our own bags. Our room itself was nice. Very open and clean. The ocean view was a broad statement. The view was of a giant grassy hill that lead down to the town. Then in the distance you could see the bay and a lighthouse and even further out was finally the ocean. So, technically, yes, you could see the ocean but only if you avoided looking at the town, the sweeping lawn and hills. My husband and I finally made it to the pool. We got our towels, a cocktail at the swim up bar, and took a dip. Our seats were at the lower pool and I accidentally dropped my towel into the water. I walked back up to the towel stand and the man there would not exchange my towel. We had just obtained the towels about an hour before. He said if I didnâ€™t have my card I couldnâ€™t get a new towel. The ID cards are not laminate. They are not plastic. They are paper that dissolves when wet. Great idea for a pool ID. I explained that I was psychically holding one of the towels and I simply wanted a dry one. He wouldnâ€™t do it unless I walked back down to the lower pool and got my ID. That was a summary of our first day at the Waldorf Astoria El Conquistador Hotel. This hotel had terrible customer service. Every day there was aggravating. The staffâ€™s attitude is something for the record books. The only person that was hospitable was the gardener that was pruning the shrubs outside my room every morning. The concierge was unwilling to help. She was completely worthless and unmotivated. She directs me to another staff member who is the trips coordinator who was also completely useless. The property is amazing. The hotel is beautiful. The unfortunate thing is if you want to enjoy your stay and relax this is not the place. They do not care about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel would be better suited as an ALL Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: MAVAmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a nice time at El Conquistador but not sure that we would return. The food was WAY over priced and the customer service was really disappointing. No one really went out of their way to help but they sure wanted the tip. We returned to our room to find a souvenir item we had bought was missing. We assumed it probably got thrown out and wasn't stolen but it sure did take the front desk awhile to resolve it and my husband had to be the one to push the issue after they failed to call us back. We tipped everyone we encountered EXCEPT for the housekeeping staff after this incident happened. Palomino Island was the best part of this resort. I recommend leaving on the first boat out and staking your spot for the day. There were a lot of locals there too...it's not a private beach like they advertise. No beaches in PR are private and locvals park their boat close to shore and use the island also. The resort is VERY noisy too. We could hear people outside all night long and the walls seemed paper thin. The vacation was relaxing and we had a good time but we are pretty easy going folks and can make the best of most situations.

Reviews.Title: “Good for convenience of being on a resort.”
Reviews.Author: SFtraveler88
Reviews.Content: Pros: Several restaurants there, you don't have to leave. Several pool locations. Had no problem getting spots at the pool. Palomino island beach is a nice beach option. Beautiful lobby and environment. A spa on the grounds. Cons: It's a large resort that hasn't been maintained to it's peak and it's evident. Elevators, rug, etc worn/dirty, spa rooms are nice but the steam room, etc provides little and is worn too. Food is very expensive compared to it's quality. Cleaning of rooms is subpar. There was a stain on our couch and hair all over the shower walls when we checked in. We moved the next day due to being close to the service elevator and were woken up the next moring to laundry sounds. It took some follow up but staff were responsive and wanted you to feel comfortable (Pro). It's not 4 or 5 star. But it's a fine place to relax, be by the pool. It would be a great addition if they served Puerto Rican food (they don't). They charge $15 for wi-fi and it's not reliable by the pools. Works ok in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, minus the bedbugs...”
Reviews.Author: aemalone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed recently at El Conquistador Resort for two nights while visiting Puerto Rico for a week for vacation. Not normally within our price range, we were able to find a great deal through Priceline, making the room $75 per night (not including parking, resort fees, etc.). We stayed at the Resort the last two nights of our trip. Here are our pros and cons: Pros: Great staff/Good service Beautiful grounds and setting Rooms were spacious, bright and cherry Palomino Island Sprawling, beautiful golf course Cons: Bed bugs (Garden room 4034) Overpriced, average-quality food Parking/Resort Fees are ridiculous Casino, Coqui Water-Park, Horse-back Riding all lack-luster Expensive activities (nearly everything has an extra fee) Priceline guests not treated equally The staff were all friendly and helpful during our stay. We were pleased the quality of service we received in that aspect. The grounds and views were also gorgeous. We loved the view we had from our room. If you enjoy golfing this would be a great place to do it; the grounds looked terrific. We also really enjoyed Palomino Island and the beautiful views there. Guests can take a 10-15 min. catamaran ride out to the resort's private island to enjoy the beach. I would encourage guests to take sandals or flip-flops that they can wear into the water, as the coral can be painful to walk on. The water was very clear (we saw fish and small, sand sharks) and refreshing; there were plenty of lounge chairs available in the sun or the shade; and there were lots of activities available to guests (miniature golf, snorkeling, kayaking, jet skis, horse-back riding - all at substantial fees however). I would encourage guests to visit the Cozy gourmet market (small convenience shop) inside the main resort to purchase a sandwich or a wrap before heading out to the island. There is a restaurant on the island but all of the meal options start at $17 and up. Our small, non-alcoholic drinks cost $4 and $6. Remember to pack the sunscreen too! While at the resort we ate at Bella Vista one evening and Blossoms the next. To be more cost effective we split a pizza at Bella Vista and found that it was plenty of food for the two of us. Some of the restaurants charge a steep splitting fee though, so beware. We ordered the take out at Blossoms since we were tired but didn't want to pay the room-service fee. Again, the food portions were large enough to split, just beware of splitting fees when you dine in. Although there were good-sized portions, we found that the food quality was just average. We weren't too impressed. Be sure to check the meal prices posted in the hotel portfolio as well. We were surprised that the amounts had changed at the restaurant since they had updated the prices in the book, so we had to pay more than we expected. We let the front desk know at check-out that this information was incorrect and needed to be updated. The most disappointing part of the trip was waking up to find that we had bed-bugs in our room. My husband's back was covered in small red bites. We were really surprised for how great this resort was supposed to be that they would have bed bugs. We told the front desk and they said they would have it looked at. I think an issue like that should receive more than an apology, such as a free meal, a free night's stay, a discount, something... anything. Other things to be mindful of... If you book on Priceline be prepared to be treated like a second-class guest. Our resort cards said Priceline Guests only, as if that were supposed to communicate our status every time we paid. Even though we prepaid they also placed a hold on our credit card (which I believe they do for all guests, not just Priceline customers). They didn't however tell us they were going to do this. I found out when I tried to use my card and it was refused and I called my credit card company. When we checked out they refused our card and we had to remind them to remove the hold on the card (which was much greater in value than what we actually spent). Be prepared to pay for everything... and at ridiculous rates... Horse-back riding - $70 per hour Two person Kayak - $40 per hour Coqui Water-Park - $20 per person (adults) Then all the extra fees: Resort fees (per night), Parking fees ($16 per night), extra service fees, etc. We would not recommend this hotel to friends and family after the experience we had. We tend to appreciate local experiences more, where you can interact with the culture, meet locals, eat local food, etc. This experience provided none of those.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pr_usa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, plenty of things to do, sights are beautiful. Palomino Island is great. Restaurants are little expensive tough but food is good.

Reviews.Title: “some undesirable service”
Reviews.Author: jumpship2010
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful, many activities for children, The Coqui park for addition charge water park.. Hotel room was great. You pay FIVE STAR prices for food, and get 2 star food. The Cleaning, and bar hops are great. Most of the bartenders especially by the marina, horrible service and food too. What a shame because it's a beautiful place. Also no music by pools, very quite, Casinos close very early every night., The only good meal wer had was at the Stripe House at a price of $176.00 for 2 people. great service there. I will visit the casino on my next visit to PR, but will never stay there again. much music

Reviews.Title: “over price”
Reviews.Author: maru050
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel thinking that it was a 5 star Hotel well to my surprise it was not. The staff was not friendly they ALL need customer service training!!! No one seems to know anything. I would ask how to get to a address and no one knew anything they would ask someone else they acted so stupid . Bathroom was awful with mole, carpet awful and looked dlirty. Staff at the front desk never has a smile on their face and rule. I would never go this Hotel again not even if they beg me. My advise to others do not go listen to the reviews they are never wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings on El Con”
Reviews.Author: Shellz79
Reviews.Content: So I arrived for a four night/five day stay to great facility of ocean views, architecture, and smiling faces. The valet/bell staff were approachable and ready to assist. Upon check in took awhile but that was ok with me. Nancy check us in she was great and efficient. Even surprised me with a Birthday cake. We got a room in the Marina, nice view. but very humid and sticky down there. Floors always felt clamy unless you had the AC high. Rooms are white modern and gorgeous. ONLY to LEARN WE HAD BEDBUGS... so the entire time i thought "a just mosquitos" thought i paranoid after reading 150 reviews before departing. NOW THEY ARE BACK IN NY with me and HELL to rid of. GGGGrrrrrr The resort is a nice place... don't expect much nightlife.. yes there is walking DUH! did you see the size of this place. We bought food theres walmart, great shoes stores, outlet nearby. Yes its pricey it is a Resort DUH! its not an ALL INCLUSIVE resort get real. *** Ziplined & Hiked with Rocazilla>>> Was great...included home made PR meal *** Ate at Tasca Ole Leotai>>> really close to the hotel *** Went to Culebra Island>>> Ferry is $2.00

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Family to El Con”
Reviews.Author: NYCVISIT
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador is not perfect but any negatives are more than made up for by the setting and the incredible selection of activities. The resort is very large but its size allows it to offer so much, including a Golden Door Spa, water park, golf, tennis, several swimming pools, and its own island with a full array of water activities (including surprisingly good snorkeling). The tour desk at the resort offers a number of off-site activities if you want more. The resort is a little large and busy for couples but is a great choice for families and conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Resort -- Honest Feed Back.”
Reviews.Author: Latinsunshine
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to have at least $500 on your credit card available for deposit upon stay... Even if you pre paid your package. The Resort was kind of dark and gloomy although they had several places to shop, gift shops etc... where u can use your hotel tab nothing worth buying. The restaurants were mostly fine dining prices. Caribe restaurant on second floor was cool, had some typical Puerto Rican cuisine... but also your slamming cheeseburger when u had the urge = Lunch for two expect to pay about $40 bucks. Las Brisas restaurant wich offered the free breakfast was crowded better to be there by 9 a.m. This hotel does offer a meal plan that was not offered to me thru my travel agency may have opted to do so. The Restaurant I would recommend is Blossoms. I traveled with three 18 yr olds and found the dining experience to be great. The food was good and they bring a tiny charcoal grill pot to your table where u can put your meat to cook longer if desired. Really cute. That was fun. The water park was very small and catered more to small children. There is no BEACH!!! you have to take a 20 minute boat ride on a Catamaran over to the private Island where the beach is filled with coral and it's kinda scary actually. But, if you prefer to have an UNFORGETTABLE experience stay at the sister hotel El San Juan @ Isla Verde. We took a cab ride to this hotel about 1 1/2 hrs away closer to the airport and that hotel had a live band in lobby, big casino, great bars, walking distance to everything 4 pools and the beach.... Love it. When I visit Puerto Rico again would stay there for the same price or less. :( Mad my travel agent did not suggest this. El conquistador is mostly for Golfers because the grounds are beautiful and made for a 3 day stay. Hope this helps. OMG I forgot to mention the venicular which is the apparatus that takes u down to the ground level... It does get stuck and did with us int it. :/

Reviews.Title: “El Inconvient-stador”
Reviews.Author: bluestravelor
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this place to anyone. I found this place to be very inconvenient for the everyday vacationer. It started with the trip to my room upon checking in. It took 15min to get there from the front desk. This "trip" to my room included two long walks, two elevator rides and the "Funicular" ride(Tram). Once I got to my room, it was damp and smelled like mold and mildew. Very disappointing for such a high rated resort. The other major inconvenience was getting to the beach. Although this resort is right along the ocean, they have no beach. They do have a boat that will take you 15min to their private island. A helpful hint......don't forget to bring everything you need. Not like you can run back to your room to get sunscreen or perhaps a mask and snorkel because it will take you an hour to do that. Lastly, the cost is a bit much. Hard to pay over $5 for a 10oz beer or $15 for a burger and fries. On a positive note, the resort has a beautiful and challenging golf course and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: tracypez
Reviews.Content: I just returned from El Conquistador where I traveled for my 50th birthday with my family. Imagine my suprise when I couldn't walk barefoot on the carpet in my room. This is not a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. We checked out after 2 days and moved to the Ritz Carlton in San Juan. The hotel charged us a $75.00 "early checkout" fee even though we had prepaid for our room and could not be refunded. This allowed them to resell our room and nick us for an extra fee. I never saw a groundskeeper the whole time I was there and this was reflected in the condition of the grounds. Palomino Island was equally disappointing. There is little sand, so to enter the water you have to cobble over coral. The pools were dirty as well as the pool bathrooms which I would not let my children use. The rating on this hotel needs to be reviewed. I am a picky traveler and chose this property based on the website and 4 star rating. Save yourself the headache and go right to the Ritz...

Reviews.Title: “I'd come back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: ladyhaydie
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador Resort is GREAT! The location is beautiful and everything is very clean. The staff and employees here are also very friendly. The only bad part is is that the food in the restaurants is pretty expensive, and the free (included) breakfast is a pain, because you have to wait in line for a while. I would recommend staying down at the marina. And check out the casino, my Dad and I won pretty big! I would also recommend checking out some of the local areas, like the kiosks in luquillo. If you like a clean and SUPER friendly place to eat, go to kiosko #44. They have the BEST frappes on the whole island. no lie. Also, take the ferry to culebra, it's probably the most beautiful island you'll ever see ( :

Reviews.Title: “excellent place, horrible 'free' breakfast experience”
Reviews.Author: fourpalms
Reviews.Content: Impressive hotel, many services and activities. The staff is extremely friendly. Palomino island is nice. Very expensive meals and drinks. The 'free' breakfast included with our package is a joke. You wait in line, like lemmings to the cliff, to fight for food with all the rude guests. We left the resort every day to experience the pleasures of the island and to meet the friendly locals. You must go to the kiosks just west of Luquillo, especially 'Kiosko #44', where the owners treat you like friends. La Parrilla is there also and has great food.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again....”
Reviews.Author: murrietraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the El Conquistador resort for 4 nights in April 2010. After reading the many alarmist reviews at Trip Advisor, we were a bit apprehensive about our stay. Although we have not stayed at too many resorts in our travels, the El Conquistador Resort turned out to be the nicest resort we have ever stayed at. It was raining upon our arrival and we pulled into the self parking lot and broke out our umbrellas for the 1 block walk to the resort entrance. To our surprise, a courtesy car immediately pulled up to take us to the entrance. The staff at the front desk were very polite and due to room availability we were upgraded from garden view to partial ocean view â€“ we didnâ€™t even request this! The resort was expansive and beautiful. Our room was fine. I did not play golf but being an avid golfer the course seemed to be PGA-quality. The resort is excellent for both couples and families. We loved Palmetto Island! The ferries leave for Palmetto Island every half hour. The water was beautiful although the snorkeling we did right off the beach was just OK (not too many fish). The restaurant on Palmetto had the best pina coloda mix Iâ€™ve ever had. The resort had many restaurant alternatives, although no Puerto Rican fare which was odd. The breakfast cafÃ©â€™s food was just OK. Thereâ€™s an ice-cream parlor, which is nice on hot days. The food and beverage prices were somewhat steep, but somebodyâ€™s got to pay for the upkeep of this beautiful resort. There is a neighborhood with a plaza about a 10 minute walk west from the resort along the ocean that had good restaurants/bars at more affordable prices. The kayaks and boats leave from this area after dark to see the glow-in-the-dark algae. Reservations are recommended because most guides were fully booked. The area becomes lively after dark. It seemed safe and the locals we chatted with were very helpful and friendly. We had a great experience at El Conquistador Resort and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This not a Waldorf property. The food was...”
Reviews.Author: Texasboy630
Reviews.Content: This not a Waldorf property. The food was ver inconsistent depending on where you ate. The pizza was the best. The casita we stayed had beautiful view but a very dated room and overall property. The nightlife was weak. Casino should be open later than midnite and no where to grab cocktails and relax after midnite. Even the martini bar closes at 12. The bright spot was the staff. From Eddie the driver to Edna and Lysandra the bartenders and Ernesto the waiter at the Italian restaraunt made the place fun and personable.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Resort”
Reviews.Author: tshine309
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I just had our Honeymoon and decided to stay at the El Conquistador in Fajardo PR and it was a Great decision. The service is wonderful! The views are simply amazing. We stayed in the Las Olas village, and trust me it's worth the extra few bucks a night. The pools are clean and well kept. Room service was delicious and quick! The cleaning service was wonderful. The Golden Door Spa is a must! I was so relaxed I fell asleep waiting for my Wife to join me for a massage before it even started. The spa is immaculute! Overall it is a very good candidate if your looking for a resort to spend some time in. The only complaint we had was that the fire alarm somhow went off 2 times but were false alarms that lasted about 20 minutes. Other than that it was A+

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, but Lots of Waiting and Limited Beach Access”
Reviews.Author: BostonSkiBunny
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night trip to El Conquistador to celebrate our 5 year wedding anniversary. We booked through the American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts (FHR) program, which was a fantastic deal. Upon arriving, we were upgraded to what we determined was among the nicer rooms (4th floor of the Las Brisas Ocean View Wing), received free breakfast each day, and received a $100 credit. The credit didn't go far, but we weren't exactly sticking to a budget. Food: We really enjoyed all of the food. I certainly wouldn't call any of it a value, but we certainly never felt ripped off. We had 2 lunches and 2 dinners on the property. At Iguana's on Palimino we split a sandwich (they even brought it on two plates with tons of fries), got waters, left a generous tip and it was $20. That's not bad for lunch! The other day we just shared a Quesadilla at the marina bar. For dinners we ate at Stingrays and Blossoms. Each was under $180 with drinks, apps, and a tip. The lobster at Stingrays was amazing. The waitstaff at the nicer restaurants was wonderful. Room: Our room was very nice, the bathroom was huge, and the view was fantastic. It was often moist despite the A/C working well, but I don't know how that could possibly fixed - it's very humid in PR. I did see one bug, but it was small and on the bathroom floor - not in my bed. I killed it and it was no big deal. Cleaning staff was friendly and came by twice a day. Palomino Island This very cool little islandhouses the hotel's only beach, as well as lots of lizards and neat birds. However, the water taxi schedule is awful. We watched an afternoon world cup match at the marina bar (since there are no TVs on Palamino) and when it was over after 4 we had missed the last shuttle at 3pm and couldn't go to the island despite having at least 5 hours of sunlight left in the day. As a result, the pool at this hour was packed. It was also unfortunate to not have the beach to walk on at night or at sunrise. Aside from the schedule, all the good points people have noted are true - it's very pretty and great to bring chairs in the water, which is very shallow. While there's tons of sea grass, rocks, and dead coral (equivalent to rocks if you step on it), this creates a very cool eco system for young sea life. We saw multiple juvenile sharks, sand crabs, and while sailing on a hobie cat we saw a small sea turtle surface. Very cool! Water Sports We did a snorkel trip with Casa del Mar and sailed on the hobie cats on Palamino. Both were expensive, but it seemed worth it for the convenience. However, neither proved to be particularly convenient. We were told we had to be at the water sports desk at 1:40 for the snorkel trip. We delayed sailing to make sure we were there on time, but when we got there all they did was hand us flippers and tell us to wait by the dock at 2:15. We headed over early, but the boat didn't show up until 2:30. Snorkeling itself was so-so. They brought us to what was probably a good location for PR, but we've been to much better snorkeling locations, so it wasn't phenomenal. We did see a spotted eel and a lot of grunts and tangs. At the end of the trip (around 4:30) they brought us back to the hotel, and of course we could not return to Palomino. The morning we wanted to take out the hobie-cat we headed over first thing and had to wait a while for the shop to open, which was a bit frustrating since we'd rushed over. However, actually sailing on the hobie cat was fun, and the staff was super nice, even coming out on a waverunner to tell us how much time we had since I'd voiced concern about not having a watch. I also think they were very generous on the time - perhaps to make up for keeping us waiting a bit. Nightlife Everything people have said regarding nightlife is also true. We played in the casino a bit, but not much else to do. Parking We did valet, and it was fully worth the few extra dollars. The parking lot seemed far away and the valet staff was very prompt. Funicular There is a trolley system that takes you from the marina level of the resort to the main level. We never had to wait long, but it was one more thing to wait for. Checkout We waited 15 minutes to check out, as for some reason the self checkout doesn't work at certain hours in the afternoon and there was a long line. We at first didn't notice the express line we could have used through our program, but even so there was a line for that. Those in the regular line waited about 20 minutes. More waiting. Overall, we liked the property, but found it a bit difficult to fully enjoy a three day trip. We were trying to do and see a lot (in addition to the above we spent one morning at El Yunque) and all the waiting and worrying about schedules detracted from our ability to spend much time actually enjoying our activities. I think this hotel would be really fun with a group of friends, or perhaps once we have kids to bring. Tip - wireless internet is $15 in your room, but free in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad deal for the view...indifferent workers”
Reviews.Author: tropicalgardener
Reviews.Content: We got an online deal, and we had a good time. The hotel grounds are fabulous, and Palomino Island is incredible, but the workers are surely, or indifferent. This is not unusual in Puerto Rico, but is is surprising at what bills itself as a resort. Clearly, the Walforf people should do some major firing/training and continual retraining of the staff. It's not like you are not given what you ask for, but the workers act like it's an imposition, or they are talking on the cell phone. Aside from the crummy workforce, the hotel is really breathtaking, and the pools are really cool. There were lots of families, and some skanky- looking, loud guests (discount summer cruise folks, I guess?), but they were a minor irritant. If you want to have fun in the sun, drink a few drinks in blue water, you can move away from the noise. Oh--the Starbucks is a godsend; the on-site eateries are overpriced and boring. Try Le Estacion, just a quick right outside the gate. We will go back, but make sure NOT to get a room near the all-night, all-day lift that ferries folks up and down to the beach (who thought this would not disturb guests when they designed this place?). It sound like someone is on a skateboard outside your window the whole time. The room was big and clean, but the beds were awful; my actually titled back, and the pillows were like mashed potatoes. I pressed two together, but it did no good. Finally, the towels were really ratty; dingy orange-tea colored, worn, old, and moist. One thing any hotel should know: never sink so low as to five guests bad pillow and skanky towels; this is merely cheap, and classless. Please replace the dead mattresses! Then, I think this so-called resort would be outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay - Leave the Hotel for Better Food”
Reviews.Author: jdprofile
Reviews.Content: Overall * People/Staff very friendly, resort was clean, there were a lot of kids however. It is not a young couples or singles scene at all. Room - We had an ocean view room overlooking the pool in Las Ventanas. It is a relatively modern wing. However, they played loud music in the afternoons so if you are trying to catch some sleep it could be difficult. Also, there was a corporate event one night where they played loud music from 8pm to 10pm. We had to walk down a very dark hallway to get to our rooms which could definitely use a light bulb. The room itself was clean an comfortable - no issues there at all. * Food - mediocre and a bit overpriced (especially at the hotel) * Food - I would say the food in PR is very mediocre and homogenous at best. If you like plantains, bread and butter you'll love it. Sure the food at El Con is overpriced and mediocre but what do you expect - its a resort in a foreign country in a satellite town to San Juan. Actually a lot of the food on the island seems to be imported and expensive. Even at Chilis the menu prices were as high or higher than they'd be in the US. There is some good seafood as you would expect. That said we did have a few good meals while we were there: Estaction - this is located less than a half mile from the hotel, just go out the drive and take a right - it will be on your left. The staff is very friendly and they have alfresco dining. Everything is prepared on a grill. Try the grilled red snapper or the BBQ chicken mofongo. It is very casual - shorts ok. Passion Por el Fogon - This is a bit more fine dining. The chef is a woman named Murta who has won many awards and takes great pride in her cooking. We had the whole fried fish which was nice. The staff is very professional. You can't just drive around town and hope to find a Chilis or Cheesecake Factory by sight. All you will find around the hotel is Burger King. Locate a few restaurants on a map before you go like Chilis - we went to one which was pretty good. For some reason they are not visible from the main roads in town - and there is no chain restaurant near the Wal mart other than the burger joints. The breakfast buffet was $25 but the omlette was good. All the other items were so-so. Nothing memorable. We ordered room service and the staff was extremely friendly. They add on $4 delivery charge and 20% tip. * Kiosks - what are kiosks? They are basically individual stores in a strip mall. One is located at a beach near the hotel (on the way to San Juan). They sell traditional PR street food (think fried, plantains, breads, meats, fish, rice). One mexican restaurant had very high prices. We liked one on the far eastern side, it looked a lot like the others but we got a meat dish with rice, and a couple plantain dishes and drinks for $12.80. It is like a beach bar. The beach behind it seemed like mostly locals. No reef or anything to see but the water was clear. Enterprise - we rented one at the airport except they don't tell you that if you get a nonsmoking car the cigarette lighter will be disabled so you won't be able to use your GPS charger. Getting back to Enterprise to drop off the car is a bit convoluted and not available on our GPS. Make sure you get directions during pick up. Other than that The car was fine. * Bioluminescent Bay Tour - the kayak trip is not for beginners and physically draining. You paddle for about 20-25 minutes to the lagoon through a mangrove-lined canal, in the dark, whilst separate tours are coming back from the other direction. All the while you're paddling against a current. If you'd like to go and you are not 2 strapping young men go on the motorboat tour. When you stick your hand in the water it lights up like strobe lights. Kind of cool. * Enterprise Parking Lot - located past the self-park lot on the left look for a sign that says "Authorized Personnel Only". No gate. You can walk back to the hotel from the Enterprise lot but the general self-park is more of a hike. General self park is $16.06/day for guests. You need to wait for a golf cart to take you to and fro the self-park lot. * Palomino Island - It is a very nice island. The boat ride is short. Don't bother renting snorkel gear as there's nothing to see. They have a basketball and volleyball court as well as jetskis for rent ($70 half hour / $120 for the hour). We did have water shoes which I would recommend. * San Juan - it is a bit of a drive from the hotel (45 min with no traffic). We had made reservations for a restaurant in town but there was a lot of traffic and our GPS stopped working (explained above) about half an hour in. I think it would have taken us about an hour and a half to get there - so keep that in mind if you book a dinner in San Juan. There is a lot of traffic between Fajardo and San Juan at night.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ily6807
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent five night at El Conquistador and it was great! When we first arrived we were worried about transportation to the resort since we knew it was about an hour away, to our surprise the resort provides a shuttle to the resort for a 37 dollars. Once we arrived at the resort we were greeted and directed to the check-in when we returned our luggage was ready and were walked to our room. The resort is very big and when you first arrive you are bound to get lost a few times but it is beautiful the ocean view is great and the pools are amazing. A water taxi is available to get to Palomino Island without extra charge its a 8-10 minute ferry ride but its worth it the beach is great and there are many activities like jet skiing and horse riding but id recommend to bring some beach shoes because its pretty rocky and the sand gets really hot. The food at the resort is quite expensive so bring extra money especially if you arent able to get a car rental because there isnt anything nearby. My favorite places to eat at the casino were Cafe Bella Vista because you can view the ocean while you eat and Cafe Caribe because its more restaurant type there are other restaurants but the prices are too much like 60 dollars per plate. The resort has a casino which is very entertaining if you go id recommend going to the far right 5 cent machines, me and my fiancee played and won about three hundred dollars.If you are unable to get a car rental expect to pay alot of money for taxi especially if you dont want to be in the resort the whole time you're there. . we had a tour of El Yunque rainforest and we had to pay 80 dollars each way, we also visited Belz Outlets and paid 85 each way. Our taxi driver was friendly and helped us a lot in finding what we were looking for his name is Javier. You get a charge card which allows you to charge food and other items from store within the resort to your room if i were you i wouldnt charge anything to that card unless you want to pay extra money most of the restaurants and store only accept cash. i also read some reviews that state bedbugs i had an ocean view room and it was clean and with no sign of any bugs. Lastly if you are looking for nightlife you are not going to find it here everything is so far from the resort if you want to visit old san juan or malls id suggest getting a rental car if not get ready to pay big bucks. Overall my expierence at the resort was amazing just the prices were a little expensive but we came to have fun and relax so that was the least the staff was super friendly and helped in any way possible i will definaly be back!

Reviews.Title: “4.5 Stars... Gorgeous views, excellent location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: AH1987
Reviews.Content: I'll be the first to say that I was a bit hesitant about going here after seeing the reviews. I got a fantastic deal with priceline, so El Conquistador was defintiley worth it for me, especially since we were upgraded to a full ocean view room and received 1 free breakfast. So on an overall level, I did not feel that we were nickle and dimed whatsoever. DEFINITLEY rent a car when coming here and DEFINTILEY check out what Fajardo has to offer outside of the resort - go to the Pasion de la fuga(?) restaurant and make sure you check out the El Yunque rainforest that is a 20-30 minute drive. PROS: - Location, location, location. This place is breathtaking - whether you have a view of the garden or the ocean, is absolutely beautiful. - Lots of pools all around - Ferry to the Palomino island - its like your own private island (when going early in the morning) - Its a resort that has plenty to offer, but it is also relaxing. I did not have any problems with loud noises or kids, etc. - You have to understand that life in Puerto Rico goes at a slower pace than the rest of the US. So while they may be a tad bit slower to respond to requests, they always make sure they address anything you ask for. I requested an iron to the room and the IPOD player didnt work. I had someone in the room within 10 minutes and received a call later on for both calls to make sure that I was satisfied. - The staff are honest. They are not affraid to make recommendations on places where you can get products/services for cheaper than the resort has to offer. - The beds were very comfortable with plenty of pillows. They did a great job cleaning. - Rooms were very clean and modern. Cons: - Casino isnt for the savvy gamblers. IT gets the job done but it isnt the most professional or modern. - The drinks are not as good as you would expect, and the prices are a bit much. I especially was not pleased with the small plastic cups that they came in. - Price for parking can add up... Self park is $15, valet is $20. We used the valet parking, and shelled out about an additional $10 per day for tips. - The food doesnt seem to do the trick. They have typical American food. We went off the resort for meals to experience some unique meals. - You have to pay $5 for 30 minutes in the business center - Free high speed internet only limitd to lobby... theres a $15 fee for in-room... but then again, who goes to PR to go on your computer?? Leave it at home! MUST DOs - El Yunque rainforest (DONT pay for a tour... you can do it yourself and save yourself $$) - Bio Bay - great experience - you can either kayak or get a motor boat. - Old San Juan ... go to one of the castles, gorgeous - Pasion de la fuga restaurant, truly fantastic. - Go to Palomino Island with the resort ferry (its included)... You can rent a kayak and go over to the smaller Palominito island for a truly private-island experience - Just relax, and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but everything is a la carte”
Reviews.Author: TheSliders2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Conquistador for 7 nights and had a fantastic time. Our room had a balcony overlooking the hotel. The pools were fabulous - warm and inviting. The beach (on Palomino Island, a short ferry trip away) was beautiful. We put our chairs in the water and enjoyed the day. Everyone was so nice and helpful. We loved the water park, but felt that it should be included in the resort fee (even if just a one day pass per guest). The food was okay, but we found great restaurants within 2 miles of the resort. We were not golfers but could still appreciate the beauty of the course.

Reviews.Title: “Best Quality and Service”
Reviews.Author: wilmor
Reviews.Content: The Check in was Fast. The service is excellent. The room was beatiful. My package include the breakfast buffett and is excellent. If you visit the hotel I recomended that you choose the option with Coqui water park. My childs love the park. me also. The hotel meals are too expensive, a coke $3.50, bottle water $3.50. Rice with chicken $20. The beach is in the Hotel private island and its a paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: 4lees_MO
Reviews.Content: We sqent a week at the El Conquistador and it was an amazing resort. Breath taking beautiful it exceeded all of our expectations. The only thing that we were not 100% satisfied with was a Discover Scuba trip booked through the dive shop at the marina. We did book three other excursions through Pure Adventure, East Wind Charters, and Eco Quest and they were all fantastic. Can't wait to return again!

Reviews.Title: “A few days in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Bumpo12
Reviews.Content: My Mother, sister, niece and I came to the El Conquistador to attend a destination wedding. It was a beautiful setting on a cliff overlooking the Caribbean Ocean and the landscape is superb with a beautiful array of flowering plants and trees. We were greeted at the airport in San Juan with a shuttle for a fee of $37 each way provided by the resort which was most helpful since the resort is about an hour's drive from San Juan and requires several turns with minimum direction signs. Our luggage was unloaded and held until we checked into our room. There was a little glitch from the communication between AARP Expedia where I made reservations to the El Conquistador but we were courteously taken to our room. All staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was a Garden view as reserved and contained two queen beds that proved to be very comfortable with a large bathroom, refrigerator and balcony with a beautiful view of the Atlantic Ocean and Tennis courts. We did have difficulty with the air conditioner not cooling our room adequately and were promptly moved to an upgrade room ocean front. The resort offers several types of restaurants to meet many tastes but are not opened for all meals. We did not dine at one of the fine dining restaurants during our stay but did dine at the cafe at the marina, Cafe Bella Vista near the pool, Cafe Iguana on Palomino Island and Cafe Caribe inside the main hotel. All were good and fairly reasonable to be in a resort. There are several pools to enjoy but the one we really enjoyed was the beach on Palomino Island which is an 8 minute ride on a catamaran provided as part of the resort fee which is 14 % added to your room rate whether or not you use any of the facilities. You ride down the funicular to catch the catamaran and we had no problem as I had read in earlier reviews. There are plenty of beach chairs, towels, and rental of snorkeling equipment on the island with tiki huts to block the sun. I would suggest wearing beach shoes to swim as the coral is very sharp and comes up to the shore. The snorkeling is great since the reef is right at the shore and the water not very deep but be careful to not bump the sharp coral. We saw several fairly large iguanas on the island and enjoyed the coconut and palm trees on the beach. Everything is very convenient on the resort including golf, tennis, casino, shopping, and dining. The wedding was held on a cliff overlooking the ocean with a classical guitar player and local minister. The welcome/rehersal reception was held at the golf grill patio and the food was super including a roasted pig. The wedding reception was held in a covered room with a patio and the food, cake, band, and flowers were wonderful. We arranged for a tour of the El Yunque Rain Forest which is the only tropical rain forest in the U.S. National Forest system. A minimum of 6 persons was required for this private guided tour which was easy to fulfill since there were other family members with us. We reserved with Manny Mulero recommended by a staff person and we were not disappointed with his comfortable van, water, and his knowledge of the island and the rain forest. We would have missed interesting information had we not been with him. He also, after a 4 hour tour, took us to a local restaurant, La Parrilla, located on Laquillo Beach and completely explained the menu of authentic and delicious Puerto Rican food . His phone is 787-863-7312/cell-787-315-8716 and I would highly recommend him courteously accommodating us and especially being sensitive to my 82 year old Mother. The grounds are just like paradise with a multitude of beautiful flowers and I even got pictures at night of the tiny Coqui frogs by using a flashlight and following the loud sound that they make, (co-key).

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe bad reviews..the hotel is one of a kind beautiful and staff are very nice”
Reviews.Author: barbaleman
Reviews.Content: I was afraid to go to the hotel after reading the horrible reviews posted on trip advisor, but since we already had reservations we had to make the best of it. The hotel is about 45 minutes from the San Juan airport and the property is HUGE!!! There is a huge golf course after you arrive through the gate that is magnificently beautiful, the hotel is on a cliff and is gorgeous, it's older, but still classically beautiful. The staff went OUT of their way to make us happy, we received an upgraded Marina room that was HUGE and clean, included a jacuzzi, beautiful robes, fresh heavy towels and toiletries and huge balcony with incredible views! We booked our package with Cheap Caribbean so we also recieved complimentary vouchers for the casino and for the breakfast buffet. The food in the hotel was very good, especially the breakfast buffet, which consisted of just about everything you could want for breakfast, omelet stations, breads, pastries, oatmeals, granolas, etc.. Alcohol drinks alittle expensive, but same price as any restaurant in South Florida. The town was a little depressing, Fajardo, we only found one great restaurant "Pasion por...something" Gourmet, excellent Food, very clean and modern, and gets booked easily since the prices are extremely reasonable. El Yunque was an incredible hiking trip and I highly recommend it as well as Palomino Island. Overall, even though it rained our entire trip, the people were very nice and friendly, the room was beautiful and the food was great and we had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved this place and will return this time with our children!”
Reviews.Author: loricogliano
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time at the el conquistador. When we arrived I let the girl at the desk know that this is the first time in many years that my husband and I were able to get away alone without kids. We were upgraded from a oceanview room to a suite with a hot tub! The room was very clean, the maids do a great job. There private island was so much fun, plenty of lounge chairs, the water was beautiful. There is also a restaurant on the island that was very good. I also came across some very nice employees that were so helpful Lydia at Tropical Togs helped me find a great suit for the beach and Paola Martinez at the front desk was wonderful. I will return and this time I will be bringing my kids, they would love this place. I made a point of writing this because after reading some of the reviews I almost picked a different resort... I am so glad we gave it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pamadues
Reviews.Content: we were at there from May 21-25. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My husband got sick on the plane and we needed a wheel chair. We had arranged for the transportation to get us from the airport to the resort. The transportation people notified the hotel and the manager met us and had a wheelchair available for us. They upgraded us to a handicap accessible oceanview room. They were very helpful at the front desk. The food was about double what you would expect to pay, but we had the breakfast buffet included in our reservation so that helped. The only lunch we did eat was at the Marina bar and grill and it was delicious. I would definitely recommend it. The resort was very nice and the accomodations were very nice. They had at least two pools, but I chose the quieter one. The main pool had a lot of activity and it seemed like the guests were really enjoying themselves. It is great if you want to just stay at a resort. It is about an hour ride from the airport. You definitely would need a car if you wanted to get out and explore Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: annetc2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the El Conquistador over Memorial Day weekend and overall had a great time. We did not have near the problems that most travelers have had with the hotel. First off, we didn't have bed bugs (our room was nice and spacious with a beautiful ocean view room which the guy who checked us in upgraded us to for free when I asked), we were not charged for the bell service, and booking through priceline really saved us on the 13% resort fee because it was based on your rate (our fee was only $13/day and we weren't even charged one day which I can only assume was because we didn't end up charging anything to our room that day because we were out and about in the rain forest and kayaking). Yes, I'll admit, there were parts about the room that could have been upgraded (new paint, etc) but nothing so disgusting that I was bothered. The furniture is cute and inviting. And Palomino Island is just fantastic. Worth the trip on the boat because it has some of the best views and you feel very secluded. We rented our car from Enterprise at the airport....was only $20/day which saved us on the airport shuttle and gave us the luxury of driving to the rain forest, off-site for dinner one night (La Estacion....yum and close to the hotel!), and a trip to Wal Mart for snacks and liquor. And parking in the Enterprise lot was a cinch and close walk to the hotel, and most importantly, FREE. However the lot can get filled so if you plan on driving and arriving back at the hotel late at night prepare to have to squeeze yourself in to a not so legal spot in the lot). The staff at the hotel were always pleasant and we didn't have to wait for service or anything like that during our stay. I know I'm jumping around here but the drive from the airport alone rt. 3 is a little seedy but once you reach the resort it really is magnificent. My boyfriend admired the golf course all weekend and when we finally made a tee time it sadly got rained out :( And one last note, the food is a little expensive but the portions are large and the food is delicious. I had no problem with the prices on the food....but where they get you is the alcohol. If you're able to make the trip to Wal Mart it really will save you some money. They don't check bags when loading the boat to the island so as long as you're not trying to haul a cooler on board it's easy just to fill a water bottle with what you'd like and ask for cups of ice when you're on the island.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: carlost75
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me start off by saying that I read every BAD and good review before going to the hotel and I was very apprehensive. Im glad to report that it wasn't that bad. The hotel and its grounds are beautiful and it has spectacular views of the ocean. Its literally located on top of a hill and far from the town of Fajardo. Transportation was waiting for us at the airport and we were lucky to be the only ones being picked up. The driver was friendly and gave us a little tour on our ride to the hotel. Alcohol was waiting on the bus, always a positive!! The check in and out went smooth. When checking in we got a free upgrade to a room with a view of the Marina. The room was spacious and clean and we had no problems with our bathroom. Our only problem was that the walls were pencil thin and could hear the guests next door who had a very rambunctious child. Every where we went in the resort service was great and the staff was friendly. We spoke Spanish to everyone (although everyone speaks perfect English) and that made the staff even warmer. One thing I was not prepared for was the exorbitant prices of the restaurants in the resort. I had read about it in the reviews but thought it was exaggerated... it wasn't! It was very very over priced. Out of all the restaurants Ballyhoo, in the Marina area, is the more reasonable (still pricey but not as much as the others). I over heard an American tourist say he had bought snacks and alcohol outside the hotel in order not to spend so much money at the restaurants. The last 2 days we were there we rented a car and ate outside which was a smart thing to do since outside the resort things are cheaper. We weren't charged for anything extra on our bill as I had read so many reviews claiming they were charged for some thing or another. The resort is very family oriented. There were plenty of kids running around. I would definitely return and I would recommend the resort, but I have to let people know to be aware food and drinks are very pricey specially if you're a person, couple or family traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico nothing to ofert in hotel...no more”
Reviews.Author: YelisetTorres
Reviews.Content: The view was perfect. Rooms was ok but bathrooms are old and dangers .Two members of our family fall in the shower, and when we call the reception does not give us a very nice help. Theyâ€™re rude and aggressive. To expensive and I think the pool does not have a good purification system .A men was cleaning old fashion. This is our second time in EL Conquistador.... never again .I love Puerto Rico but in hotel noâ€¦All hotels are expensive compare with a better hotels. Next vacations we prefer go to a hotel in the Caribbean like Cancun, Jamaica, Grand Cayman or Punta Cana. Better dial for all families. No more Puerto Rico nothing to offer in hotel for any person. Plus a different extra charge for each thing.

Reviews.Title: “Overly concerned (based on reviews) for nothing...”
Reviews.Author: jmmustin
Reviews.Content: Was quite worried after reviewing several bad reviews. Not to discredit others, but I did not experience some of what others did. As for the fees (I booked airfare and hotel as package through Expedia): Resort Fee was roughly $15/day, parking was $15/day. With taxes, my fees totaled roughly $100 for a 3 days. I did not have a bellman fee (rolled my own bag to my room at Los Olas) or housekeeping fee. I did not experience rude or unfriendly staff at check-in or check-out (did not have long waits at either). The island, Palomino, is a must - a great beach. While the main beach area was crowded (holiday weekend for Americans), you could walk to other beachers that were completely empty. As for drinks, did not drink alcholic beverages, but had frozen drinks that were around $10/each (pretty much what I would expect to pay at a beach resort). Went to the casino each night - was decent - but small (small compared to Vegas casinos, but normal compared to San Juan casinos). Did not eat on property at all. There were plenty of dining options (fast food and nice sit-down). Went out each morning to eat breakfast and grabbed Subway sandwich to bring back for lunch. Others have stated this property is not up to Waldorf Astoria standards. I felt it was a nicer property than the El San Juan - Waldorf Astoria Collection (located in San Juan). I felt the property was worth about the amount I paid. My room was very spacious and pretty quiet. I did not see any bed bugs. My one complaint had to do with one of the funiculars being broken from roughly Saturday evening through Sunday mid-day. Since only one funicular was working, the lines got backed up on Sunday morning into the afternoon (you have to ride funicular to get to marina area - which is where the waterpark is and where you catch the ferry to go to Palomino). I called guest services and complained and got nice compensation for the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: funkybatchgurrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned last night and although there were positives about the resort, I unfortunately have to say the negatives outweighed them. We arrived on Thursday, rented a car and drove in from San Juan airport. Took about an hour. Be careful though â€“ pretty careless drivers and they literally blow through red lights at night. The drive was definitely not pretty â€“ you pass through some sketchy parts of Puerto Rico but finally you arrive at what looks like paradiseâ€¦acres of beautifully landscaped hills and El Conquistador Resort is perched on top of this small mountain overlooking the ocean and you think ahhh, heaven.... Check-in was great, in fact they upgraded us for free to an ocean view room, what a great start! The views from the room were gorgeous although it was cloudy and rained EVERY DAY we were there, the views were beautiful. Bed was very comfortable, decently clean room but not immaculate, bedsheets smelled like mildew. The room was designed a little awkwardly â€“ no full length mirror, closet was in the bathroom, door to bathroom didnâ€™t close, only one towel hook, there was no coffee machine or mini-bar / refrigerator (one was provided at our request and it took 10 hours to cool down slightly and kept beverages at a â€œdrinkableâ€� temperature). That being said the hallway to our floor was outdoors and was dirty â€“ dead bugs, bird feathers, dust, and because of the rain it also flooded. Instead of mopping up the water the staff left towels in the hallway to soak up the excess water. The lights in the corridor were only lit one night - not sure if they were broken or the hotel was trying to conserve on energy costs but itâ€™s a little sketchy when you exit the stairwell. Yes, stairwell, because the entire time we were there (4 nights) the elevators in our building were BROKEN and we had to take the stairs. The pool grounds were gorgeous, if you didnâ€™t look too closely. Chairs and tables were dirty. Pool was filled with bugs â€“ I never saw anyone clean the pool. Poolside service was practically non-existent. During my stay I was asked once if I wanted a drink and then charged $10 for a frozen drink, which was actually pretty good but besides the point. As for the beach, I was a little mislead from their website. I was under the impression that you take the funicular down the mountain to the beach but in reality the funicular is taken to a ferry that brings you to Palomino Island, their private island. When we checked in we were told that it takes 7 minutes to get to Palomino Island. The first day it took us about 30 minutes, by the time we waited for the funicular and ferry. It was fine because the island was beautiful â€“ filled with iguanas, roosters and horseback riding, very peaceful. The water was warm but had lots of seaweed and the sand was super rocky from all the coral, to the point where it hurt to walk in the ocean. The restaurant on Palomino Island, Iguana Cafe, was absurdly overpriced ($9 for plantain chips and canned salsa served with plastic utensils, really?). The second day we attempted to go to Palomino Island one of the funiculars was broken. We were told they were repairing it and had to wait in line for 30 minutes with screaming children to board the funicular, and then another 20 minutes to board the ferry. Definitely not my idea of a vacation. They should make alternative arrangements in the event that the funicular is broken, like a shuttle service. Can't forget about the business center. What a joke. My husband had some work to do and wanted to log-on to check his email but for 2 days they had no internet service because they ran out of internet cards. Oh, and we passed by the gym and it was smaller than our room with equipment from the 80's. As for the casino, this casino is not for you if you like to gamble. The casino was tiny, almost laughable, and closed at midnight. Waiters were nowhere to be found at the blackjack table (once again â€“ poor level of service and understaffed) so I ventured to the bar to buy myself a $12 glass of sauvignon blanc. Finally, the waiter came around about 45 minutes later and I was able to get a free drink â€“ the cheapest Chardonnay Iâ€™ve ever tasted that gave me an instant headache. The prices in general were a total rip-off. For the condition of the hotel - rundown, paint chipping, lack of staff and management, they have some nerve to charge 5 star hotel prices. This hotel is a 3.0 star at BEST. We ordered in room service one night - 2 plates of pasta - was $65. We only ate at one of the restaurants, Piccola Fontana, which was actually quite good but also extremely pricey â€“ cheapest bottle of wine was $48. I have no problem spending the money but when a rundown hotel charges 5 star prices, that is just wrong. Especially since there is no where else to go to buy things other than their resort unless you have a rental car or take a cab, they shouldn't be ripping off their customers or who will want to come back? I would recommend that you rent a car as you will want to visit the rain forest, maybe drive into San Juan since the nightlife is totally non-existent in Fajardo and to avoid paying $5 for a bottle of water, drive to Walmart and buy a case. Maybe it will get slightly cooler than luke warm in the rinky-dink refrigerator they provide. If you are looking for nightlife, this hotel is not for you. If you are looking for a quiet, romantic getaway, this hotel is not for you. It was filled with kids and families and I must say I was disappointed to see how classles / trashy many of the guests were. All in all, it was nice to get away for Memorial Day Weekend but we would certainly not waste our money here again.

Reviews.Title: “Palomino Island and the Coquis were 5 Star; Rest "maybe" a 4”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJanice
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently stayed here for 4 nights. We had some initial difficulty in that we e-mailed the hotel in advance to confirm that our ocean-view room had 2 beds; however, the check-in staff could not find any e-mail and gave us a room with a king bed despite us telling him we needed 2 beds. There also seemed to be a bit of a language problem. Lovely room, but it did not work for us because of the single bed. We then were moved into room #2 with double beds; however, after returning from dinner that evening our floor was sopping wet due to an air conditioning leak. The service from the maintenance staff was incredible (much better than the front desk service!), their visit to our room was timely, and the staff actually asked the front desk to move us to a different room as they would be unable to fix the problem until the next day. Room 3 was a winner (although the front desk forget to give us an updated hotel card, which required a return trip). I certainly would not classify it as a 5 star room, but its location perched high on the cliff and looking down at Palomino Island and the marina could not be beat. What made the property special for us, however, was Palomino Island and the tree frog (coquis) at night. Having previously stayed in San Juan, Condado and the Isla Verde area, Palomino Island & its powdery white sands was just wonderful and the highlight of the trip. A ferry (with no additional fee, imagine that--just show your hotel card) whisked one to the island at specified times during the day. The island provided towels and beach loungers. Water activities, food and drinks and horseback riding were available for a fee. The hotel property is lovely; however, other than a stroll pass the Marina apartments to neaby Las Croabas, the grounds are not really condusive to strolling. I so wished I could walk the golf course paths!!! For those who dislike walking, be forewarned that it is a long walk to a very poorly marked parking lot for hotel guests and visitors. While there was golf car shuttle transporation between the lobby and the parking lot, it was unscheduled and was not offered by the person manning the ticket booth when we arrived. In retrospect, it would have been better to drive to the lobby first, if for no other reason to know where the hotel lobby was located. Our breakfast buffet was included (excellent made-to-order omelets and eggs, good selection of cereals & cold cuts, and mediocre selection fo fresh fruits) and while the food and service were good the experience of checking in & showing your hotel card, waiting to be seated (despite an uncrowded restaurant), showing your card (again!!!) when the bill came and having a 15% gratuity automatically added for the $25 buffet was very off-putting. The later in the morning the more apparent the problems became...there has to be a better way. Were the breakfast not included in the room rate, I probably would have dined elsehwere. I highly recommend a car, despite the $15 self-parking fee and the aggravation of having to stop at a parking desk in the lobby to show your hotel card and have your parking ticket validated each and every time you leave. While the hotel is somewhat difficult to find because of poorly marked streets and several required turns, it was a godsend in terms of off-site dinners at some of the best local restaurants I've ever found. Having a car also allowed us to drive into San Juan once or twice during the trip and to drive to El Yunque. We booked our room at a very favorable rate, so overall our experience (for the price we paid) was great. However, if I had paid the "rack rate" of $500+ for our room I would have been very disappointed. The rooms had been recently redecorated, but there was peeling paint, discolored grout, worn carpeting, etc. in our room and in the public areas. There also was no coffee maker in the room, although one was provided when we requested it. I also could see where one could be very unhappy if their room was not in the main building up-top and requireda funicular up and down. While the funicular itself was fun to ride, I would not have enjoyed it as the only way of getting to my hotel room. It also runs 24 hours a day and it somewhat noisy. On the other hand, the rooms at the marina and at Las Olas appeared to be much quieter than those in the main building. If there was one major deficit to this property, however, is that there needs to be a better way to identify guests other than a paper hotel card...perhaps a wrist bracelet, etc. Cards for the towels also would be a welcome addition. Since there is no accountability for towels, towels were everywhere. Guests on their way to the ferry back to the hotel would leave their towels strewn on their beach chairs! Pool guests would leave their towels at one pool and then wander to another pool and collect a fresh set of towels. Also, having stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village shortly after our stay at El Conquistador, I would say there is no comparison in the level of service and friendliness (the HHV wins hand-down).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely outstanding....but expensive”
Reviews.Author: SallyWillickers
Reviews.Content: Our experience at El Conquistador was absolutely luxurious! We went during May, the beginning of the off season, and there were virtually no lines and the service was impecable. The food is delicious, the people are incredibly friendly, and the beach and other amenities are outstanding. The spa and Palamino Island in particular were outstanding. My only complaint was the price! While the actual reservation cost was very acceptable and affordable for us, when we got there the cost of the food and, more importantly, the cocktails was frankly outrageous. Also, there were many elevators out of service during the stay and we often had to resort to stairs, which was inconvenient. That being said, our stay at the El Conquistador was one of the best vacations yet and I highly recommend it to anyone wishing to stay there....so long as you plan and prepare to spend a lot of money!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave - best resort ever”
Reviews.Author: KCBBQGirl
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Puerto Rico and I wasn't disappointed. The resort is beautiful perched on a cliffside overlooking the ocean.
