The private Palomino Island accessible by the resort's ferry was an island paradise (snorkel, horseback ride from sea to top of mountain, pristine beach - and even some large free-roaming iguanas). The staff at this resort were the best I have ever seen - super friendly and accomodating. All kinds of attractions within walking distance or a very short drive. We opened the balcony doors in our room every night to listen to the tree frogs all night long (Coqui's). I'm ready to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great but better for kids than couples”
Reviews.Author: hirscan
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews I was not excited for this resort. however, I was pleasantly surprised when I got there to find that a lot of the complaints were not my experience. Overall, it was a decent resort with lots to do and if the sun is shining could be a great time. It was raining the WHOLE week for us (apparently this is the rainy season) but I think that is an anomoly and not something (obviously) in control of the resort!! haha. THE GOOD 1. customer service - everyone was super nice and helpful. I guess it's all relative but service was not an issue for me and people who worked there were accomodating and really nice. 2. poloimino island - this private beach is really cool. easy way to get to the beach and has all the amenities you need. beach chairs, towels, ubrellas if you ask, palapalas, bar for drinks, etc. and the ferry is easy. 3. stingray - seafood rest was pretty good. very expensive for what it is but at least it was ok. but wine (everywhere on the island) is ridiculously expensive and horrible (low level normall $7/bottle kendel jackson for $35-40 bottle). ick! 4. car rental on site enterprise gives you free parking - otherwise they charge $15-20/day. 5. the biouminescent bay is right near the hotel - walking distance. that's a good advantage. dont book through the hotel. it cost double the price! and try to go on a night where the moon is not full or less full if you can because the darker it is the better your experience will be to see the beautiful sparkle. this is a great trip not to be missed. 6. try to book on costco - we didn't have any extra charges and got free bkfst, trasfers to the airport and discount on spa services! THE BAD 1. breakfast - was really good in terms of food quality and choice selection but they charged us gratuity for an included breakfast. I thought that was kind of a joke - and while i didn't mind paying the daily $7.50 it was the principle of having to pay on top of something that's supposed to be included. 2. rooms were ok but not great. I was in the brisas building where they served breakfast which was convenient. the view was great, balcony very cool, bathroom huge but our first room was more run down than I would have liked. We complained and were moved to a room that was a little better. I'm not someone who needs super fancy but it's nice to have a new feeling room - without water stains. but for the price (about $200/night inc brkfst) it was hard to complain too much on this point. 3. Blossoms was the worst chinese food. the habbachi looked pretty good so if you have a hankering for asian that's the way to go. 4. food generally is expensive for what it is. I am ok to pay $200 for dinner if i have to one or two nights if it's AMAZING food and wine - but it's not worth the cost so it's hard to justify that amount. 5. there is a bell hop fee. we took our own bags to and from our room because we were in the close building but if you're far it's not a good idea probably to do it yourself. this service should not have a fee and if it does they should at least tell you bEFORE hand. we were not charged but we read about this so declined them when asked to bring our bags. insider tips - 1. eat at l'estacion offsite. if you ask the hotel to drive you in a golf cart to the front entrance (it's really far to walk) and then make a right and walk about three blocks you'll find the restaurant. You can walk there without the golfcart but it will be about 20-25 minutes because the walk from the hotel to the front gate is very long with the golf course. food was sooooo good and a decent price. atmosphere was cute too. outdoor seating and very good service! 2. another good place is a tapas place on the water - i forget the name but it's authentic and delicious. and better priced than the hotel food. it's something with an "O" overlooks the water. 3. you can bring your own bottle of wine to the restaurants in the hotel if you pay for a $15 cork fee. this is a great idea because the wines are so expensive and not very good. we bought some of our good own in town and with the cork fee it was still $5-10 less than the worst bottle of wine on the list! 4. note that the spa has whirlpools and saunas in separate sections for each gender so you cannot enjoy these with your boyfriend/girlfriend which was a bummer. but the massages were really good. worth it if you can get a discount which we got (20% off) with our package by booking with costco! 5. there is a line at breakfast every morning - it's crazy. it looks longer than it is usually but try to get there before 8:30 a.m. or after 11:00 to avoid the wait. if you don't have bkfst included in your package there is really no need to go here - there are plenty of places on site where you can get something - like at starbucks or the store - and it's much less expensive. We wouldn't go back here unless we had kids because it's very kid friendly and wasn't that impressive to return. plus we like to explore other places. but for a week it did the trick and it's the carribean - what's not to love about beautiful blue water, sun, interesting food, lots to do (e.g, water park, beach, tennis, golf, views, water sports, pool, rainforest close by) and decent accomodations if you can get it at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Experience, Worth a Visit”
Reviews.Author: Viewpoint11
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth after reading alot of the reviews on this site. My wife and I just got back from the El Conquistador for our honeymoon. I usually do not write reviews, but felt it was necessary after reading alot of the negative reviews during the decision making process. The resort was great, what a wonderful place to experience Puerto Rico. As far as the staff they were all great. From the moment we stepped on property our bellman Cidely was great with descriptions of the property and provided great information about the whole area. The overall experience with the staff was first class from the front desk to the concierge to the restaurants to the beach. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The beach is unbelievable great place to relax and the water taxi is a short enjoyable ride. The prices were high, but fairly expected for a resort in a US territory. Dinners are expensive and drinks are a little high, but no more than you will pay in every major US city or resort. Overall this place was great and it was well worth not paying attention to the negative reviews. If you are a very critical person or one of those people that always wants to focus on the negatives then you might find negatives here as you would anywhere. A couple things to keep in mind we were there for a honeymoon and they upgraded us to a oceanview room at no charge. They also had a great breakfast every morning that was included in our room. The spa was awesome and is a must it is reasonable for all of the amentities you get as long as you have a service that day. The prices might look high at first, but they have a great mens and womens lounge with sauna, steam and gym. We also got to take a Yoga and Cardio class with a personal trainer that day at no additional cost because we had a service. Definetly recommend some type of service. Another strong recommendation is to at least rent a car one day. The resort is about 45 minutes from San Juan and pretty isolated. We took the hotel transfer both ways, but they have an Enterprise on sight. Side note use the business center and book it online for the next day and you will save about 40 dollars than reserving it at the desk. We took a day trip to the Rain Forest which was awesome and a must if you have time. The place is unbelievable and the rangers are very helpful with decriptions and directions to make sure you see everything. We also went to dinner at a local restaurant which was a nice change of pace. The only downsides I will note that were not suprises, but I will note them. The rooms walls are fairly thin and you can hear stuff in the halls and connecting rooms, but in our case we only heard noise maybe for an hour or two the whole week. The resort restaurants are expensive and not really on par with what you get. Expect to spend a minimum of a 100 a meal with cocktails. The food was middle of the road, it was good, but did not support the prices. Outside of that alot of great water activites and resort amentities that will keep you busy. I would definetly recommend this place to someone wanting to experience Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: PuertoricanTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is enourmous. Our room was located at las Olas which was at the center of the mountain, we had to walk a bit and take the furnicular but the room was worth it. Very spacious room, we had a king size bed, the bathroom even had a walk in closet! Very nice tiles , a mini fridge, hair dryer and coffe maker. The room also had a sofa area, not that comfortable but very fancy looking. The balcony was very big, it over looked the building's pool and you could see the ocean. There is a wide variety of restaurants to go to but be ware of the prices, a cup o soda was $4.00, that is insane. The waterpark is great! , thougth go when the weather is nice and arrive early so you can get a good seat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: LFP5810
Reviews.Content: We had an extremely memorable and amazing wedding at the El Conquistador. Our guests couldn't be happier with the entire weekend and the resort itself was a huge hit. The service was spectacular and the staff couldn't be more helpful in coordinating our special weekend. You really never know what you're going to get, and the El Conquistador exceeded our expectations in every way. We have incredible memories we will never forget. I highly recommend this hotel for family vacations, weddings, groups of friends, and for people of all ages. There is so much to do right on the resort grounds and it is absolutely gorgeous. You won't want to go home! I can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “We worried for nothing!”
Reviews.Author: kozski29
Reviews.Content: Shortly after we booked our non refundable trip to the El Con we started reading reviews online -- stories of awful service, hidden charges, bed bugs (GASP), a run down resort and dirty rooms -- I was literally no longer looking forward to vacation. To top it all off the 10 day forecast showed rain everyday...........and we worried for nothing! All experiences are different, people are different and expectations are different. Below are some comments and tips that might help you ease your mind as you wade through the "horror stories" out there. We stayed in the lower portion - Las Olas. WEATHER - 2 out of 7 days it rained for literally 5 minutes. The rest of the time was blue skies. FUNICULAR - this is the elevator that takes you from the marina level to Las Olas to the upper level. Both were in working condition the entire time. CAR - RENT A CAR at the airport. We got a full size sedan for 200 for the full week, unlimited mileage. Bring your GPS. Este is East, Oeste is West. Driving is not as crazy as we heard, just like any city keep your eyes open. The car allowed us to go to Kmart, Walmart and the grocery store to stock our room with beer and other essentials. FRIDGE - if you have a fridge in your room and its hidden in a cupboard take it out and set it on the floor. It will not get cold in the cupboard. FOOD - we only ate a few meals on site - we enjoyed light lunches at the marina bar and had a great 3 course meal at the Italian place for 36 per person (La PIccola Fontina). I have never had hotter, fresher food or friendlier service. We ate at Stingrays and Blossoms as well. Prices are in line with other resorts. We ate off site at Metropol a few minutes from the resort - awesome food. We ordered room service 4 or 5 nights it always arrived on time and it was fine. OLD SAN JUAN - lots of fun! If you have your own car and GPS its an easy fun day, lots of great history and wonderful bars, shops and authentic cuisine. PALOMINO ISLAND - GORGEOUS out in the middle of no where. Private, secluded. I was told to bring bug spray because you might get bit by sand flies which will results in welts that people mistakenly think are bed bug bites. The ferry over is a beautiful relaxing ride. LAS OLAS ROOM - Based on the carpeting in the lobby and hall I was certain our room would be awful. It wasn't. It had been renovated and it was very spacious with white furniture and white bedding. The tub seemed like the only thing not replaced but it was clean, just a bit worn. New fluffy white towels. The air conditioning was always working, our view was wonderful and most of the time we had the pool to ourselves. SERVICE- Just wonderful. Friendly, helpful, outgoing - certainly not what I get at home at the local grocery store or bank. I'd take Fajarado customer service any day. If someone is quieter it is probably because they don't speak fluent English but most people are bilingual. Most people have lived here their whole lives and are a great source for history and hot spots. CASINO - A fun stop. We are avid gamblers and even this small casino helped us get our fix. HIDDEN CHARGES - we obsessively kept every receipt just preparing to be armed with evidence when faced with hidden charges. Not a single one. Penny to penny. The only snag was that I thought the resort fee was already included however when I consulted my original reservation it was not. HUMIDITY - if your watch or camera fog or get condensation place it in a zip lock for a few minutes. OVERALL- During our stay the hotel was at 30% occupancy so it was perfectly empty for us. The view is incredible, there are a few shops and a few stores, multiple pools and many restaurants. It is very spacious with gorgeous flowers, lush greenery, iguanas, coqui frogs and a constant breeze through the towering palm trees. There is some wear on the property but they are always working to keep it clean. This isn't a Four Seasons or Wynn property but it also doesn't deserve the single star ratings. My advice is RELAX, be patient and smile. You are in paradise. Soon it will be over.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: guej
Reviews.Content: I'm going to try to keep this short, or I'll be here for the next hour writing a 3 page review of how awful this place was. In a nutshell, you'll pay Ritz Carlton prices for a motel experience. I don't mind paying money on vacation. What I do mind is paying A LOT of money and not getting anything close to what I paid in return. Here are some of the "highlights": - The front desk trying to scam my family by putting the 4 of us into one of the cheaper buildings, in a room with one king size bed, despite the fact that we paid for 2 beds in a room in the more expensive Las Brisas building. - Bed bugs that I unfortunately brought back home with me and have to deal with now. - ZERO management presence on the property. - Completely understaffed for the amount of people the week we went. - Throw up in the swimming pool that never got cleaned (of course, there was not a single staff member in sight the whole day, so who was going to clean it up?) - Dirty plastic cups floating in the pool first thing in the morning, which means no one cleaned it up from the day before. - Cups and food all over the floors around the pools, because there were no staff on duty to clean up (not to mention guests who apparently can't clean up after themselves by finding a garbage can). - With hundreds of guests the week we went, not a nurse or medical office on sight to deal with a medical emergency. You are screwed if something happens to you here. - Horrible mixed drinks. We opted for beer and wine by the 2nd day. - No foot or body showers in between the beach and the hotel, so if you are coming from the beach, you have to wash off in your room shower (which would account for the clogged drains after every shower), or like some guests, just jump into the pools. - Long lines everywhere because the resort was so seriously understaffed despite having capacity crowds. - A $42 "filet mignon" at Stingrays that tasted like a burnt miniature hockey puck. - A $140 resort fee charged to my room every day. Nothing is included. Assume your room price is just the starting point, and expect to pay signficantly up from that. - Had to move about 4 times on Palomino Island before we could find a few chairs that weren't completely broken. A few good things to note: - Golden Spa (obviously owned and run by another company) was beautiful and the services were great. I should have snuck in and slept there every night. - My husband and son enjoyed the golfing. - Boat ride to Palomino Island was fun. - The resort looks like it had huge potential because it really is beautiful. Unfortunately, current management is letting it get run into the ground. Like the title said, we'll never go back again and would never recommend it to anyone. My sister used to organize conferences here when it was run by Wyndham years ago. Apparently, things have gone downhill since then.

Reviews.Title: “Middle market resort”
Reviews.Author: bratscheBoston
Reviews.Content: Very average resort. Seems to cater to more of a working class clientele. Fine perhaps if you are traveling with children, but if you are looking for an elegant experience, and have stayed in truly lovely properties, keep looking. Be aware that most in our party had an incorrect charge on their bill upon checkout. Our was for 450.00, and when we mentioned this it was reversed, though without explanation or apology.

Reviews.Title: “BEST TRIP EVER”
Reviews.Author: alkmak
Reviews.Content: A celebration of our 47 th anniversary couldn't have been better The staff, the amenities, the ambiance, and the way we were greeted and treated were beyond our expectations We will be planning a return trip in december to celebrate birthdays and holidays

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pbergerTampa
Reviews.Content: We visited the El Conquistador last October for the first time and were blown away by the resort and its staff! From the moment we arrived we new we were someplace exceptional!The concierge and front desk staff were very accommodating , greeting us each time we walked by throughout our visit, asking how we were and if we needed anything. The resort is a destination unto itself and we rarely ventured beyond the property. There is a casino , several very nice restaurants, shops, a Golden Door Spa, a water park, a myriad of pools and jacuzzi's- and - wait for it-a private island for resort guests only! This island makes you fell like you are starring in your own Corona commercial. The rooms were very modern, spacious and had a tropical feel and the grounds were gorgeous.We had booked a garden view but were lucky and got a ocean view upgrade- very nice! We have decided to visit again this August to celebrate our anniversary- I could not think of a more beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at best”
Reviews.Author: littlebee1003
Reviews.Content: Please do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else! My family and I just returned from our vacation and the first thing I wanted to do was warn everyone of the mediocrity of the place. Just for some background, my family and I have stayed at some of the best island resorts: the Grace Bay Club in Turks and Caicos, and the Ritz Carlton in St. Thomas. We're foodies and have eaten at some of the highest rated restaurants in Philadelphia, New York, and London. That being said, the hotel seems worn out, the staff are not enthusiastic about what they're doing, and the food is horrible.The first night at the Stingray Cafe, the waiter got my order wrong and then when the scallops did arrive, they were chewy and flavorless. The sole was like a fish stick, and the rest of the meal was bland and unimpressive. Worst of all was probably breakfast, with the minimum being $50 for breakfast for four people. The breakfast consisted of a wet croissant with greasy scrambled eggs. The buffet option was $25 a person. My family and I scraped by with coffees at the in-hotel Starbucks every morning. Furthermore, the ocean view room wasn't ready when we got there, and when we finally got inside, we found the bathrooms dirty. The hallway outside echoed and the sheets were rough and old. This atmosphere made it difficult to sleep. The staff was lackluster about everything. They were slow at checking us in, printing our boarding passes, and checking out. Waitresses hardly smiled, and gardeners used leaf blowers while guests were obviously trying to enjoy the pool. The fitness center was a hole in the wall, with about 15 machines total. Finally, the hotel was over an hour from San Juan, so driving to any tourist attractions is costly and exhausting. There were some positives for this hotel. The views were amazing, and Palomino island, accessible via free boat transport from the hotel, was beautiful. The massage at the Golden Door Spa was great, despite the shabby lounge and jacuzzi area. The conference center area was huge and looked really nice, it was just desolate and empty when we were there. It was possible to see what this hotel used to be, but sadly it no longer lives up to whatever reputation it had. Just spend the extra dollars to stay at the Ritz Carlton! The location and service is much better and their restaurants are phenomenal. I wish my family and I hadn't tried to save a buck and just gone for what we knew all along was best!

Reviews.Title: “Trapped like a wet rat!”
Reviews.Author: Johnericc
Reviews.Content: The others have been nice with their reviews.. how else can you describe management at El Conquistador... CROOKS! Sorry, but I am not rich..just trying to provide for my family and show my kids interesting and cool places. I have no problem paying a REASONABLE price for anything, but $10 a beer, $5 a pop, $4 a coffee, $20 a sandwich, $40 a diner course. Oh, I forgot, I am a rich American who has to pay for Paris Hilton's new mansions and cars and employees to gas in'em for her. Absolute highway robbery. And no, one shouldn't "expect" to pay these prices! $100+ a meal, and you don't even get full. Upon arrival, they wanted to charge an additional $500 to my card..then after departing, they double charged me for services then charged an additional $112 to my card. I called, they were indifferent and responded that my card would be credited the difference. What if I wouldn't have caught it? It's quite evident that management has thought this through thoroughly. Lure you down, then really, and I mean really stick it to you. Unfortunately, this is the prevailing attitude towards tourist. Suck you dry, through you away for the next sucker. I think these travel companies should put alot pressure on them. What is even more appalling is how everyone just acts like it's okay to be screwed..like they have millions of dollars available to them. I could go on and on, but I will stop here.

Reviews.Title: “We just got back home, and I had to write...”
Reviews.Author: cheshrgato
Reviews.Content: We just got back home, and I had to write about our time at El Conquistador. A little background about us, so you can decide whether our opinion matters in comparison to the others. We traveled with a two year old toddler. We are in our 30s. We all love to travel, and spend a lot of time hiking and snorkeling on our vacations. We planned our vacation three months ago and got a rate of 135 a night with breakfast included. We were not penalized for paying this super cheap rate on check in, as we were given a great large room in the Las Brisas wing on the fourth floor. We had the most amazing view across the golf course to the beach and ocean to the northwest. We found this side of the hotel away from the cliffside and pools perfect for us, since it was super quiet at all times of day for the naps we had. The room was very large, with a balcony with chairs and a table, two queen beds, lounge chair with ottoman, desk, flat screen, bar area, and large bathroom with giant closet full of built-ins and separate toilet closet. There was a spot of peeling paint on the ceiling, and a few sloppily grouted tiles in the bath, but I only note this for the perfectionists who would care. After seeing the view, the amount of space, the comfortable beautyrest beds, and the super cleanliness of the rooms, we didn't care. All of the staff were super friendly, as long as you were nice to them. Some preferred Spanish, but all spoke English just fine. We saw a few rude people get perfunctory service, but they were awful to staff, and therefore didn't get the same extra niceness we did. As a large resort, you do have to really explore to find the best nooks and crannies of the place, like there are five pools on three levels. The toddler loved the multiple level pool with ledge options to walk around the edge of the pool. There were shade options nearby for us 100spf people. Palomino island was great, and there actually are some unusual coral formations to see between the beach and the tiny island off the shore of Palomino. Beautiful green and purple sea fans, a big dark orange coral formation with long branching handlike structures, tons of tropical colorful fish with yellow black and white, and a few blue and silver fish. The fish were plentiful and about a foot or so long. On the shore there was a bar and a cafe style restaurant. There were tons of shade umbrellas as well. We had no crowd issues, because it's shoulder season (may 2010). The funicular was fun and always working and never crowded even when the ferry boat came in. Our breakfast deal included the buffet so that's what we had each morning at the Las Brisas cafe. Everything was great- omelets made to order with veggies and meats, tons of fresh fruit and pastries, oatmeal, French toast, waffles, bagels, and fresh sqeezed orange juice and coffee. Choose the rate that includes breakfast!!! Otherwise it's $25 a person. We ate in town other than breakfast, because we are cheap and love the local criollo food. We also loaded up on snacks and drinks and rum at Walmart. We also rented our car from Enterprise and got free parking. We really maxed out the resort and had a total blast. In the end by doing it our way we got a ridiculous amount of fun and sun for a tiny price. We wouldn't change a thing about the place, and hope to go back someday. If you go, and love the outdoors like us, you need to see the Playa Colore a half mile to the west of Seven Seas beach. If you go all the way to the west end of the seven seas beach, there's a trail that starts to take you further out on the peninsula. We walked the first half mile to playa colore and snorkeled with the fish near the rocky areas. Gorgeous! Also, Vieques Bio Bay was incredible, but if you have a choice don't take the toddler. :)

Reviews.Title: “makes each very special for the guest”
Reviews.Author: durhamassoc
Reviews.Content: I have been coming each May for a week over the last 12 years. I wish you had a dance studio and a night club with latin music. I have spoken to many guests who share my thoughts. If you want to dance you have to go to San Juan. I think it would be a money maker for the hotel. The casino could use the crap table put back in as well. The staff and service is wonderful. Everyone is most helpful. The only problem I had was that I made an appointmrnt in the salon for a manicure and blow out. The young lady assured me the salon was open on Monday but it was closed and no body had the courtesy to inform me and so I could not get this service.

Reviews.Title: “Do your homework”
Reviews.Author: 1debbus
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay at El Con for a destination wedding. Before leaving for my trip I read every review on the web. Good thing! Because I did I was prepared for the unpleasant surprises. In case you haven't heard this is what you can expect... Upon check in you will be charged a $20 bellman fee, this is per stay and you pay even if you don't need a bellman, $3 per day maid service, both of these fees are taxed. Upon check in we were informed that our upgrade request was granted (at $29 per night) but our room wasn't ready (it was 2pm, check in is 4pm) so we had lunch while we waited. They said they would call our cell when the room was ready. While having lunch we bumped into other wedding guests and discovered we would be far from the wedding events, so we went back to the front desk to request to be with the others. We were told our upgrade room was ready (no call, but it was busy) but we decided to stay with the others (declining the upgrade). Final location in las brisas. When we checked out the upgrade charge was still there so we asked for it to be removed. We were told that since the room was ready when we chose to change rooms we would have to pay the up-charge anyway! When all the pocket picking was over, the $199 per day room rate (for two nights) plus transfers for two people came to over $725!!! Room rate, upgrade fee, bellman, housekeeping and taxes. Based on another review we didn't use the resort charge option for anything for fear of an additional tax for the convenience. All that being said, the resort location is beautiful. We had the best time at the private island. I had read comments about rocks but if you stayed at the beach area closest to the ferry drop-off, there were almost no rocks at all, just beautiful soft white sand. The spa was great. I had a mango tango treatment with Claire, awesome! for those of you planning/attending a wedding, the food was OK at the wedding but the rehearsal bbq and sunday brunch was just standard hotel chain food. If your worried about the $12 per cocktail you probably haven't stayed at too many resorts. It bothered me more that it was served in a cheap plastic cup (even at the wedding rehersal dinner) except at las brisas restaurant outside lobby. So... this hotel has it's plusses and minuses. If you are prepared you can have a very nice vacation, just be aware of the pitfalls.

Reviews.Title: “A resort that really doesnt try”
Reviews.Author: chidz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in the El Conquistador. The Hotel/resort seems to be much to big for its own good. Seems to be primarily a convention destination as there were a number of them during our stay. Upon entering this resort you really never get the feeling your on vacation. No music except ocassionally at one of the outdoor bars. Never any type of entertainment. Absolutely no surprises. The night club was open once and that was during a rainy day to show a movie. If you dont have a car to venture out to some of the activities and amazing dining options in the area you really wont find very much to do at the resort. They have ferry service to their own private island that happens to be very nice for about half a day. Not much to do there either except sun bathe and purchase over priced drinks. $12.00 for a pina colada served in a 12oz dixie cup. We sat at an outdoor bar one evening, there were maybe 12 people at the bar, and watched the bartender stroll by 4 or 5 times before I had to ask him for a drink. The staff in general seemed to have a way too layed back attitude bordering on lazy. I certainly am not the kind of person that needs constant pampering but the staff really didnt seem to have very much enthusiasm. Only had dinner one night in the resort at Blossoms. Very nice Chinese/ Sushi.. You will not find Puerto Rican food at the resort. Just outside the resort you will find La Estacion and the Ocean View among others where the food was simply amazing and will probably cost you half of what you will spend in the resort. Once the sun goes down, when most resorts become beautifully well lit, the El Con seems to be saving on electricty. Not attractive at all and very quiet. Although they claimed to be fully occuppied during our visit, the resort, maybe due to its size, seems quiet and empty. Be prepared to walk alot. This is a very large property that has very poor design requireing multiple elevators and a tram called a fonicular to get from one side of the resort to the other. No stairways where it seems painfully obvious that there should be one. Walking around, there really is not much to look at due to poor landscaping and lack of maintenance. Overall if your looking to stay in Fajardo there are not many options.I gave it a thumbs up for this reason alone. For the right price this resort is ok but do yourself a favor and rent a car. You will thank yourself. One down side to parking at the resort is they charge you. $15.00 self park $20.00 valet per day. What the hell is that?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property, Good Time, needs a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: raleighgrl
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's expensive, and yes, the service, especially at the bars, can be abrupt to downright rude, but hey, it's flat-out beautiful. The pools, the private island, the grounds, even the views out and around the property are all beautiful. Specifics: It took us an hour each way to and from the airport. Don't let them tell you it's only 40 minutes. Also, our room had a terrible problem with the AC that was evident upon checkin, and we had to move at 12:30am. They moved us and we still had a nice room with an even better view, but I think they should've known about the AC issue and not given us the bad room in the first place. Other than that, our room was very nice. I liked the bathroom/closet set up, and loved the beautiful large balcony. The doors are very thin and you can hear everything that happens in the hallway. Ours was a busy hallway and I listened to tacky drunk people from a wedding party running back and forth to the Governor's suite all night. We could also hear the family in the adjoining room with remarkable clarity. That realization meant we were very quiet in the room, trying not to disturb our neighbors. The drinks were way too expensive, and the blonde bartender at the poolside bar was flat out rude. On the other hand, the servers at the marina bar were very pleasant and attentive. Perhaps they have different ownership. Overall, I'd go back. It was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Moreyeel
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that this hotel is in the Waldorf Astoria collection, they clearly have not done a site visit. The ride from the airport takes much longer then advertised, plan on a hour or more. They do offer a free sample of the house rum. Check in takes forever, even with three agents at the desk, they only take one guest at at time because the other agents are busy on the computer or talking to the valets. This was not just once, but every time i passed the desk. The rooms are dated, with noticeable mold, poor lighting and stained carpet. It just felt dirty. The AC is loud, and the pipes bang when you turn on the hot water. The HSIA is $15 and spotty at best, don't plan on working while you are here. There was a used bar of soap in my shower from the previous guests. The customer service level is non-existent, you can stand at the bar for a half hour and go unnoticed, as the staff is so busy chatting with each other. The bar selection is lacking for a 'resort' one day there is Jack Daniels, the next day not, one day Patron, the next day not. The beer selection is atrocious and they are often making 'typical' drinks like Mai-Tai and Margaritas with what ever alcohol they can find. Do not think of ordering anything 'Top Shelf'. If you order something on the rocks, expect a pint glass of ice and a one ounce pour. The restaurants are not open when you would expect, and the food comes out like it was the costco special. You can sit at a table and be ignored for 20 mins, and forget drink refills, I suggest your order two at at time. The 'gym' has excellent equipment, but is dirty and has unusual hours. The shops seem to open and close on a whim. The view is beautiful, the pools are nice, and the golf course is world class.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and Tired Hotel with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: LadyHawk-inthesky
Reviews.Content: First note that hotels and travel are my business. In my opinion, the El Con is not a Luxury class hotel but ... it could be. I spent 4 days there at a business convention and would not recommend it to other meeting planners. My room was dirty down to the ring in the toilet, not stained, just dirty. The tile had black mold streaks and the tacky plastic headboard had imbedded head grease. It had clean sheets but the towels were stiff and scratchy. And it wasn't just my room. Others were even more moldy smelling to the point where more than one of the attendees got sick. Some had towels so thin and worn they likened them to an economy class hotel. The exterior had been painted too many times without scraping so every white railing had a textured feel that filled with dirt. The convention facilities were recently renovated (I was told) but whomever laid the carpet should be fired. The lines don't match and the edges are fraying and lifting, just terrible workmanship. It desperately needs a carpet stretcher immediately as the humps made several of us trip. I know convention meals can be tough for even the best kitchen but our group was only 150. Warm to hot should have been accomplished. And for the chef - onions in several dishes each meal, even at breakfast, really a bad choice! The orange juice was bitter and the coffee tasted terrible and was cold. Service everywhere was certainly NOT friendly. Everyone seems to have the non-smiling attitude that this is just a job and I don't need to earn my tips. The views are beautiful though! Palomino Island was nice but some of the lounges are really showing age. My suggestion to Hilton would be find a new manager, invest in hundreds of gallons of Clorox, teach your staff real customer service, fix that carpet and pray not too many meeting planners read my review. This is not up to your WA class hotels.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE AFTERMATH YOU EVEN PAY FOR THE AIRE YOU BREATH”
Reviews.Author: alexgon3
Reviews.Content: First when i got the room the rug was damp and wet no problem i wasnt going to be there anyways then the shuttle for the beach stops at 3:00 P.M. So I go to the water park surprise I have to pay for it because its not included 19.95 per person so i went to the pool and stood there all night because theres nothing else to do Finally i leave and I get another surprise theres a $300.00 hold on my credit card that no one told me about and I had to wait 5-10 business days for it to release IT WAS HORRIBLE ILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN DON T EVEN WAIST YOUR TIME, other than that it was a beautiful hotel thats the only good thing I have to say. ALEX A. GONZALEZ EMAIL {--}

Reviews.Title: “1 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: la_solitaria
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful. Loved the modern decor in the guest room & the platform bed. Mattress was one of the best I have slept on at any hotel in months (I travel for a living). Scenery is lovely. You can't beat that. The most disappointing part of the experience has been the unbelievably lousy service. They call this 5-star??? The front desk people are rude & unfriendly. I waited in line approx 20 minutes to check in. The concierge had a couldn't care less attitude and apparently gave me incorrect information about some activities because when I called back later the other concierge told me that all the information was inaccurate. The tour desk guy had a depressing & negative attitude and single handedly talked me out of every tour there was - telling all the reasons why I shouldn't sign up. Well, I wanted to sign up! Unfortunately, no one else signed up - which meant that there were NO tours. The only solution offered for activities to do was to "rent a car" and figure it out yourself. I was traveling for business & only had half a day for activities on my own & couldn't do anything I wanted to do. Well, so let's try the spa! Couldn't EVER get a hold of the spa to even discuss scheduling a massage or facial. They were too busy to talk to me. I would call, be promptly put on hold forever. Call back, be promptly put on hold. They finally said they would call me back, never did. Whoa! I hope if the big guys at top look at this hotel & ponder why revenues are down that they know that it is because they have a staff with poor attitudes who really couldn't care less about selling the services this hotel has to offer. The only highlight of the service was very kind bellman Efrain who was extremely kind, helpful & accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning as always”
Reviews.Author: Thewiz4u
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador always fulfill my expectations, is beautiful, clean excellent beach and pool. Pricey foods but very nice restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Go Off Site for Food”
Reviews.Author: passkey
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful, as are the pool areas, and their private island. We stayed in Las Brisas with a balcony ocean view. The rooms are comfortable with huge bathrooms, all of which have mini fridges. We rented a car, which I would highly recommend. We bought breakfast and lunch items at the local Amigos supermarket. The kids ate breakfast in the room, which saved some serious cash. We also ate at La Stacion (take a right out of the hotel driveway, and follow that road for a short distance. The restaurant is on your left). Great food, big portions, reasonably to cheaply priced. We also ate at Lolitas (great Mexican food), on route 3 towards San Juan (about a 10 minute drive. Other days we picked up breakfast and lunch at local panderias. If you do this, you will avoid the ridculous hotel restaurant prices. The hotel is great for its pools, and the boat ride to their private island, which is very nice. For the best snorkeling and some of the most beauitful beaches in the carribean, take the ferrry (about a 15 minute drive) to Culebra. The boat ride is over an hour, but the trip is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, too pricey”
Reviews.Author: PH1367
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited El Conquistador for our anniversary and had a great time. Staff very nice and beautiful scenery. Couldn't have picked a better hotel for the scenery. Food and drink, however, were way overpriced. $16 for a mojito was a little excessive. We went to dinner at two of their restaurants while we were there and felt a little snubbed when all we ordered was a couple appetizers and salads. We're not big eaters and were questioned about ordering a main entree. On our anniversary we went to the steakhouse and ordered two glasses of wine, I ordered soup, my husband ordered a salad and we shared a filet and our bill was $110, then add gratuity onto that. Then you also have your breakfast and lunch. I can't imagine spending that much every evening and we were there for three nights and four days. I would recommend this hotel to someone, just be prepared to fork out some cash.

Reviews.Title: “Pick pocketed at the El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: Flyer910
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stay at the El Conquistador. When planning I was looking for a great escape. I was considering Dominican Republic, Cancun and Puerto Rico. I picked the El Conquistador as I always heard it was "the" place to go in Puerto Rico. They were running a Spring Promo that included the fourth night free and it seemed like a great price. Downhill from there. This is not a five star hotel. Maybe at one point it was but no more. Most important, I felt that the entire experience was designed to fleece my wallet. The cheap rooms turned out to be the only value. It starts with a $15 - 25 per day parking charge. Remote parking for $15.00 per day that took 20 minutes to walk to. A bottle of water in the room $3.50. Two drinks to sit at the pool with... $26.00. Dinner - 1 appetizer, 2 Hamburgers, fries, two drinks, no dessert - $92.00. A salad and soup room service meal (no drinks, no dessert) - $56.00. Instead of enjoying the vacation, we spent the time trying to figure out how to navigate the stupid pricing on everything. It really is a beautiful place... if you want to play golf, the course is magnificent... but everything else is average. Rooms are nice, not great. Food was good but not great. Night club was empty (who can afford $10.00 a drink!). Buffet was good.. but not great. At the end of the day, I could have taken a great escape to the Riu Palace in the D.R. and had a great all - inclusive time... dancing, drinking, eating, shows and having fun without thinking about how they were going to fleece my wallet. It will be my last trip to the El Conquistador. D.R... here I come!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Scenery, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LaraAnn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a couple of days at El Conquistador after spending a day in old San Juan. We rented a car without doing very much research on driving in the area. We decided to kind of wing the trip and maybe should have done some more research, Blackberry Maps wouldnâ€™t update and we got kind of lost (our own fault). The traffic was horrible, a little lawless, so it took us about 2 hours to get from old San Juan to the hotel. Once we got to the hotel it was beautiful. The scenery was beautiful, the lobby and the room were both pretty nice. We were a little disappointed to see that we still had to pay for parking, but the valet and bellmen were very nice and helpful. They made getting the luggage to the room easy. The one thing we really had a problem with was how much everything cost. We kind of felt like they had us there and treated us like a captive audience. Pina Coladas were $9 at most bars and a Medella light (the local equivalent of Bud Light) was $7. We asked one of the bartenders and he said that he drinks Medella but itâ€™s a quarter at local bars. He gave us directions to some local places, that werenâ€™t dangerous but attached to nearby marinas, so I suggest asking around. When we checked out we found out that we had additional fees added to our room that took the $269 dollar a night room to $340, which seemed a little excessive. I didnâ€™t really notice, but my boyfriend kept pointing out maintenance issues. He saw mold in one of the vents in a restaurant. Dirty caulk in the restroom in our room. Mold on the ceiling in the elevator. The last major complaint we had, which wouldnâ€™t be a problem for everyone, is that there were a ton of kids running around. The pool with the bar in it was surrounded by children and we couldnâ€™t have a drink there without children splashing all around us. It would have been nicer if there was one pool designated as adults only. At Palomino island there was a strange mixture of kids running around and young adults getting wasted on the beach. All in all this would have been better if it was just a little more reasonably priced. We spent 1,200 for 2 days and felt like it just wasnâ€™t worth that much. The staff was very nice and helpful. The bartenders at the bar/restaurant right outside of the lobby were particularly fun. The grounds were definitely the best part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beatiful places we have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Ronn47
Reviews.Content: We read some reviews a week before our trip that were not so positive about El Conquistador... After staying there for five days we left saying "what were they thinking?" We LOVED El Conquistador. The location and scenery is unmatched by any place we have ever been. The staff couldn't have been any nicer. The amenities are great. The kids loved the pools, the water park, and Palamino Island (the resort's private island where you can sunbath, swim, horseback ride, snorkel, rent watercraft, etc.). We kept wondering how El Conquistador managed to provide so much. The only place where there was room for improvement was with the dining experience: A). We wish the lunch/bar menu had a few more choices (especially on the healthier side) and B). the service could have been a little faster (though, truth be told, the slower service seems to be consistent everywhere we went on the island. Once we expected slower service we actually got out of Boston/fast,fast,fast mode and relaxed. You have to tell yourself - "it's service 'island style' ". All in all -- great place.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the beach, not the hotel”
Reviews.Author: parisbound
Reviews.Content: The private beach here is absolutely amazing...truly one of the best beaches in Puerto Rico. The others would be in Culebra & Vieques in my opinion. It's really a perfect combination because you get the sweeping ocean view from the hotel with it being perched on the side of the mountain and you get the beautiful beach, too. The good - The beach (Palomino Island) - there are plenty of ferries and it doesn't take long to get to the beach - The view from the hotel - The main hotel facilities are nice - pool is nice, etc. The so-so - Service - It wasn't terrible at times, so-so at others. We are used to so much better. I don't consider myself spoiled or picky, so I think this could really use some work. For example, on the beach, we went to the rum shack to get a drink and 2 employees are standing with their backs to us talking (in Spanish) about how they can't wait until their shift is over. Nice. Well, first of all, we understand them, second of all....hello? service please... The front desk people weren't the greatest. The waiters and valet staff were nice though. - The room - there was nothing "wrong" with it, but I just expected better being at such a nice resort. I could just tell it had been remodeled and I guess I just don't care for the spartan quasi-modern look they were going for. We did opt for the cheapest garden room. The bed was comfortable though. And, it was a pretty big room. - Wireless is not free - I think it was like $15 for 16-24 hours. What?!? - Parking is not free - $16/day for self parking and $21/day for valet. Definitely pay the extra and do valet. We ate dinner every night outside of the hotel, so this was nice. Also the parking isn't super close, but I'm not sure if they'd take you in a golf cart. - There is nothing "Puerto Rican" about this place. This resort could be in any country or any island. If you don't care about that, then no big deal. My husband is from there and we just took a weekend holiday, but if you're coming from the states for the first time to Puerto Rico, you will NOT experience Puerto Rico here. Tips - Restaurants - The food we had for lunch was good, but very expensive. $40 one day for a hamburger and hotdog and drinks and $25 another for pizza and soda. - Breakfast is expensive. Bring something to eat or eat outside. - There is a wonderful spot to watch the sunset. From the main pool, there is an upper level deck above it. Just the right of this, there is a trellis and 2 chairs and a table. We went there one night, brought the bottle of wine from our room and our ipod and it was wonderful and private. Check it out. - If you are staying in the main El Conquistador resort, you CANNOT go to the Casitas Infinity pool. We walked over there, but you have to have a Casitas keycard to enter the gated pool. Bummer. However, if you keep all that in mind, and know what you're going here for (the view, the setting, the beach), then it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: brightgus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from five days at the El Con and had a great experience. Like many, we were nervous after reading all the horrible reviews. Who are you people? Your expectations are way to high! This is a Hilton, not a Ritz. The staff could not not have been friendlier or more helpful. Our ocean front accommodations in the Las Brisas building were fabulous. What an amazing view. The room was comfortable, clean and the shower was awesome! Overall, the food was decent. We were prepared for high prices due to the other reviews but you've got options. In our four nights, we took two meals at the "nicer" restaurants (Italian and Seafood) and two from the casual restaurants. Our favorites were the two by the Marina - Ballyhoo and Stingray. But the restaurant off the lobby, overlooking the pools, was also very good, especially the flatbread pizza. And the lunch was outstanding. Had Starbucks in the Lobby everymorning while I read the newspapers online (free internet in the lobby) and my wife slept in. We loved taking a boat everyday out to Pallomino Island and just laying at the beach, swimming and having lunch out there. I only wish they would have rented fishing poles so I could have fished from the "public" side of the beach. Otherwise it was great. We had two spa treatments at the Golden Door Spa and they were outstanding. Be sure to get the $20 coupon book when you check in. It gives you many discounts within the resort. Tip: rent a car from Enterprise at the Airport and drive to the resort. We rented a Standard Sized Car for $28 (total! with no drop off fee at the El Con. This allowed us to stop and buy groceries and beverages (good rum) at a supermarket along the way. We brought our Tom Tom GPS fromt he states and it worked great. The room had a fridge so we were all set. We were fortunate to miss the big spring break rush, wasn't too crowded and couldn't have had a better week. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: reinitaHolt_Michigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at El Conquistador the first week of April to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary. From the moment we arrived, we were treated with utmost professionalism. Manny, our bell hop, spent a ton of time with us, showing us around, answering questions and pointing out things we should check out later. At the front desk, I believe her name was Jessica (maybe Ana Jessica???) was fantastic. Our room in Las Brisas was outstanding. Comfortable and clean. Huge. Amazing ocean view. We spent a lot of time just sitting on the balcony, looking out. The grounds are gorgeous. We especially liked that we could keep our sliding glass door open at night. As others have mentioned, the funicular did break down a few times. That was a bit of a pain. But we were on vacation, so we just took our time. Thanks to others' reviews, we did rent from Enterprise and not only got a great deal for the week, but also got to park in their lot at the hotel for free. A very short walk; no problem whatsoever. We really enjoyed the pools and Palomino Island during the day. While we thought the open-air restaurant at Palomino was fun because we got to see the iguanas walking around, the food was just "so-so." Service was good and our waiter was friendly. But my husband had to send his meal back twice (asked for well-done burger and got red meat both times). They did take his meal off the bill, which we felt was fair. The food at the hotel restaurants was good. Especially enjoyed the pizza by the pool. Another example of the level of service: My husband mentioned to our server that he'd have preferred regular ham and pineapple on his pizza (not an option on the menu). The server tracked down ham and pineapple from another restaurant on the grounds. Boy, were we surprised! Prices were what we expected at a resort of this quality. Another upside: We were close enough to El Yunque rainforest that we took a day trip there. We also ran to the outlet mall at Canovanas. We stayed at another property in San Juan (La Concha) that was supposed to be of the same caliber for a couple of nights later in the week and kept comparing it to El Conquistador. It most definitely fell short in comparison to El Conquistador. Wish we were still there!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall experience but can be better”
Reviews.Author: dipsonlyin
Reviews.Content: This resort is nicely built and provides good price value overall. Its built ocean front and they have their own island for private beach experience. We enjoyed swimming pools and jacuzzis. They have casino and night club as well which are alright (also other things we didn't use). It's built on a hill and is a huge size resort. It doesn't seem its managed very well. Staff was not much concerned about providing good service. They were all nice but service has room for improvement. Initially we got not so clean rooms and got moved to good ones next day, which was not a good experience. Its also far from San Juan airport. Given the nice deal we got, we might go again if get similar deals.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH IT”
Reviews.Author: JOSEY-P
Reviews.Content: Wow. This place is part of the Waldorf Astoria collection? Let me start by saying this is my first hotel experience that I feel warrants a letter to the hotel operator. 1. TOOK FOREVER TO CHECK IN HALF AN HR. 2. Get to our room on the 4TH beautiful view fell in love was not cleaned. They offered us a different room on the main level but loved the view from the 4th floor. We waited 4 hrs for our room to get cleaned. 3. Service seems like half the staff could care less if they appear friendly or helpful. 4. Dining services were TOTALLY EXPENSIVE!! 5. When we arrived, I noticed dirt and crumbs beer bottles all over.. Obviously had not been cleaned satisfactorily. 6. NO night life at all besides the casino that rips you off and 1 club that is always empty and hardly open. I have been to many resorts but never had this experience!!

Reviews.Title: “World-Class Luxury, my Waldorf [--]-toria! El Conquistador is a Con”
Reviews.Author: TiareBora
Reviews.Content: My husband and I began our first trip to Puerto Rico in San Juan and we thoroughly enjoyed the time spent in San Juan. Unfortunately, the same can't be said of how our vacation ended. We moved on to the hugely disappointing El Conquistador in Fajardo -- and what a Con it was. 1. False Advertising: Their website boasts about how the Hilton El Con is a world-class, luxury hotel, Waldorf Astoria, 4 diamond resort. 4 diamond my [--]-toria! Clearly these are fake rocks. By claiming to be luxury, the El Con feels uninhibited to charge luxury prices on everything. At best, this is just your run-of-the-mill Hilton hotel; heck I've stayed at the Embassy Suites in Lake Tahoe (Hilton brand) and the rooms and service was much nicer than the El Con. I would not be as upset with our stay at El Con if only they called a spade, a spade. But they set their luxury prices & expectations. 2. Poor Customer Service: Staff have a general air of disdain towards customers. Here is just one of many examples I can share. Upon check in, I inquired as to how much it would cost if we wanted to upgrade. We had done the some at the hotel we stayed at in San Juan and was offered the largest and best room in the hotel (at a nominal upgrade cost). Instead, at the El Con, the person behind the counter wanted nothing more than to rush us thru the check in process and stated that no such room upgrades were available ... even if we agreed to pay more. Hard to believe given the size of this resort. 3. Beware of the room assignment: our room was ocean front on the Marina side of this sprawling hotel. It took at least 10 minutes from the lobby to get to our room. We walked thru a maze of shops and the casino, rode 2 flights down an elevator, walked thru another long corridor of shops until we got to the Tram that took you down the cliff to the bottom of the Marina. All this time, we're thinking about how much time will be spent getting from points A to B at this hotel. 4. Hotel geared towards families with young children: If you're a couple looking for peace and quiet, this is not the place to go. We felt like we were at a Disney hotel -- kids everywhere with their beleaguered parents. 5. El Con/Fajardo remote and far from airport: Traffic in PR can be quite bad and in most cases, getting from San Juan to Fajardo took more than an hour. Once you're at the El Con, you're pretty much stuck. In San Juan, we were within walking distance to other hotels and restaurants or a $20 cab ride to Old San Juan. Without a rental car you had to eat expensive meals at El Con. 6. Lowest point of our stay: Our room had a defective cold water tap/pipe hooked to the bathroom sink. Having watched plenty of This Old House episodes, it was the sound of a very loud, rattling loose pipe (sounded like a jack hammer). To fix the problem, they'd have to cut thru the ceiling dry wall (where the banging was loudest) and secure the pipe. (I took a video of this with audio and tried to post it with our review. Not sure if it will load/play.) We expected a so-called luxury hotel to immediately move us to a comparable, if not better room. But they insisted on sending someone to attempt to "fix" the problem saying it was simply air in the pipe -- riiiight. Needless to say, the staff engineer on duty was unable to remedy the problem. It was already late a night, we had unpacked and were exhausted from the long trip, check in to the El Con. Only after a number of calls between the front desk, did they offer to move us to another room 2 doors down. I truly marvel at the rave reviews posted by other people who stayed at the El Con. Did these people stay at the same place? I can only assume the following: They have never stayed at a true luxury property (Ritz Carlton/Four Seasons/Fairmont) and therefore have no appropriate point of comparison. And they are staying here for free using Hilton points. We will never return to this property and strongly recommend others to consider better places to spend their valuable vacation time and money. The only positive aspect of our stay at El Con was the spa. It was the closest thing that resembled luxury amenities and services. Their signature 50 min. massage was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - No complaints”
Reviews.Author: jerseyrussia
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before taking this trip..This property is beautiful. Its big but I cannot complain about walking on beautiful grounds in the sun. They do charge you for everything but I knew that going in. My room faced the ocean. It was big enough for the extra blow up mattress they sent up for us. The bathroom was big with a giant closet to store everything. Nothing was dirty, and we saw the staff cleaning everyday from the windows to the floors. Waiting for the funicular or ferry is not a problem. Again you are surrounded by beauty and on vacation. Palamino Island is fantastic. Restaurants all expensive. Stingrays very nice. Blossoms great. Steak House was just ok. Rent a car, and pick up your groceries at the local supermarket. You can keep beer, wine, milk in the fridge and there is a cabinet for groceries. My kids were so busy every day they kept mentioning they wanted to go to water park, but were so busy on Palamino Island and other things they never even got there. The staff was always friendly and helpful. When we asked for something from the conceirege we always got a follow up phone call to ask if everything had been taken care of. Trip was awesome, we would go again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Its an OK hotel, but be prepared for nickel and diming you to death!!”
Reviews.Author: Z-kows
Reviews.Content: Have been going to Hawaii for last 8 yrs with the kids for Easter. This year tried something closer. This hotel costs more than most in Hawaii and its not nearly as nice. Its relatively isolated. No shops are restaurants nearby. If you want to park your own car - $16/day. No internet -- that is another $15/day. Coffee in room? Nope. But get this -- you'll be charged 14% extra for "resort fee" and another 11% tax. So tack on 25% on top of the room rate, and add parking and internet, and you might as well buy a condo by the time your done here!@! By the way, we did not have any cleanliness problems like other reviewers have mentioned. Hotel was clean. Room was clean. I did NOT buy a package -- only the room.

Reviews.Title: “Real Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sml823
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the El conquistador fro Spring Break. It was recommended to us by a friend. The view from the property is beautiful, One of the nicest I have ever seen. After that the rest of the property goes downhill. We traveled with 3 young children that were up since 3am and looking forward to starting their vacation when we got there. When we arrived we were told we were going to stay at Las Olas, which is the desolate property in b/t the main hotel and the marina. Of course this would not work b/c we had 3 young kids and to go up and down on the funicular did not make sense. So they moved us to the Las vistas wing. This must be part of the original hotel b/c it was so run down and dirty. The 1st room they put us in was ground level. I too had read the reviews online about the hotel so I was prepared for the worst. Although I was kind of hoping that the reviews were wrong. Well they weren't! The room was filthy!!!! Beadspread had some sort of choclate all over it.In the linens themselves was a worm and they were dirty. Bathroom was not cleaned and floor at entrance was slimy. We were so upset. My kids were exhausted and all they wanted to do was swim. When we called to complain they told me that b/c I booked a package this was the class of room I was going to get. Ok so when I booked don't you think it would have been nice to tell me that I am going to get a disgusting room!!! They moved us to a top floor room in the same building which was a little less dirty. Overall, the hotel was a HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!! I would NEVER go back. Far too crowded and run down. In the week that I spent there I never saw one person cleaning the property. Also as a family with 3 young kids the hotel was way too big. All in all not a great place to stay. I hope they read these reviews and change some of the things that people write about. The location is gorgeous and it has the potential to be a great hotel if they did a comlete makeover and actually cared for the property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved PR”
Reviews.Author: lovedPR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first week of april and just loved the area and hotel..The rooms were good , but nothing too special.The dinning options were fine but a tad overpriced but still very nice. If you are looking to save some money and have a true PR experience Try the kiosks in Luqillo right on route 3. there are any range of dinning options there from simple finger foods and drinks.. to an upscale experience at Dieguito And Markitos .My wife had the grilled Shrimp ( They were HUGE)..and I had the skirt steak both of us found the service and food excellent at a much more reasonable price than other dinning options in the area ..

Reviews.Title: “Complete disappointment”
Reviews.Author: asl964
Reviews.Content: Wow. This place is part of the Waldorf Astoria collection? Let me start by saying this is my first hotel experience that I feel warrants a letter to the hotel operator. We arrived Easter night. Let me start with a "short" list of the issues we encountered: 1. We got a suite @$738 a night. Ocean views. Adjoining room for kids. First night no one from the hotel pulled down our bed from the wall. We called but were told they were shorthanded. So my wife and I took down a huge painting, moved a table and phone, and pulled down the bed. It was not made up. 2. Shower door handle broke and so did the bottom of the shower door. 3. When we arrived, I noticed dirt and crumbs all over the carpet. Obviously had not been cleaned satisfactorily. 4. Light fixtures in our room did not work. 5. TV armoire door was broken. 6. Service: seems like half the staff could care less if they appear friendly or helpful. 7. Palomino Island......overrated. Snorkel shop opened when they felt like it. When I asked the other marina activity shack why they were closed on a bright sunny day at 12:00 pm I was told "I don't know." Snorkel at your own risk. They show you where to go but it is not for the rookie snorkeler. Fortunately my son and I have snorkeled a lot, but you can find yourself in shallow water atop coral with waves breaking on you. Very dangerous. 8. Lots of chairs on Palomino Island are broken. 9. Dining service in Sting Ray and Strip was atrocious. Took forever to get meals. 10. Water park was ok. Kids had fun. No real complaints there. 11. Use the safes in your room. Other guest told me their money was stolen from their luggage prior to be moved from one room to another. 12. Cockroach in our bathtub. Felt like I was big game hunting. He was huge. Another guest told me a cockroach story. Think Jurassic Park Cockroaches. 13. Housekeeping did the bare minimum each day. Room was never truly clean. 14. Mystery nachos. My son and daughter ordered food poolside. My son's chicken fingers came within 15 minutes. When I asked the waitress where my daughter's nachos were, she just mumbled and walked away. 20 minutes later a basket of nachos arrived. Waitress was nasty and did not apologize for the ridiculous wait. 15. Trash. Either the trash dumpster down in the marina by the ferry or the trash that sits in stuffed trash cans could not be avoided. I could go on and on.....just got back last night, April 10th. Use caution if going here......highly overrated property and we cannot believe this is a Waldorf Astoria property.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation, have already booked next year”
Reviews.Author: TTTNewton
Reviews.Content: We spent February school vacation at the hotel. It was our first visit. It is a great spot to go to with kids of varied ages. We were there with another family( 4, 10, 11 and 14) and there were so many options of things to do that the kids had a ball. The guest rooms are spacious and we had a spectacular view and a balcony. It is a very big resort and therefore expect to walk quite a bit to get to an activity or location. The rooms seemed to be recently renovated. Some of the bathrooms are older- yet marble/tile. The closet is in the bathroom which seemed strange at first yet ended up okay. There is a "private" toilet which makes it nice since we had three in our room. There was a safe which we loved. The large size of the resort is what made it so nice. We were there for a week and we never felt bored and like we had done everything many times. I thought it would be a hassle to take the funicular and boat to the beach. Instead it was like an adventure. Every day we planned our day and left the room with all of our stuff. A beach bag was a must. Loved the boat to the beach. It reminded us of the nantucket ferry, just shorter. We did not spend much time at the beach. You must bring water shoes with you. Our friends gave us that tip. If you forget them they sell them at the resort. We did not have a car and stayed at the hotel for meals. Loved the Italian restaurant...one of the best we have ever tasted. The Strip house was great the first night and very slow the second night. The water park was fun for the kids. We went in the afternoon on three days and let some of the adults have the afternoon off. The kids enjoyed it. It was perfect for the little guy as well as the big kids. They loved some of the independence that they were able to have. I highly recommend the resort as long as you do not expect a four seasons. It is not as "fresh" as a 5 star hotel and could use a power wash or a coat of paint in quite a few locations, however it was an excellent value and they do not make views and locations like this spot. Be sure to enjoy the sunset in the jacuzzi on the cliff near the volleyball pool. Our daughter got sick and the hotel doctor came promptly and even drove my husband to the Walgreens( yes.....they even had access to our insurance information) . The staff was friendly and helpful. The front desk can be jammed but that is to be expected when everyone arrives at the same time or departs at the same time. Just don't plan to check out 5 minutes before you leave. We enjoyed the refreshing salads at the outdoor restaurant overlooking the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Overcrowded, in need of repair”
Reviews.Author: diva4Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Con with our two children, ages 10 and 14, during the recent spring break. We had stopped at the resort for lunch several years earlier and vowed to return after seeing the beautiful setting. Unfortunately, we found the hotel to be very disappointing. The crowds were overwhelming during spring break. Due to the sheer size of the resort, this made it difficult to get around. There was usually a long line for elevators, the funicular, chairs by the pool, etc. We were sure to pack everything we needed for the day so we wouldn't have to make a trip back to our room! Although we dined out each evening during our stay (thanks to the recommendations of other TripAdvisor members), we did try breakfast at the hotel. The quality was very poor, which again may have been due to the large number of people being fed each day. Our room was in need of a facelift. It lacked personality and even worse there were remnants of past guests - i.e. wine spills on the bedframe, stained sheets, dirty bathroom floor and walls, etc. Adding to all of these issues, extra hotel charges can quickly pile up (parking, wi-fi, etc) Although our overall experience was not great, there are some positives about the resort. The view from the property is spectacular. Our kids enjoyed the waterpark and Palomino island was very nice. We could not get a reservation at the spa, but I heard wonderful things from other guests. Sad to say that we will not be going back to El Con.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: LauraLErickson
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun. The service/staff was fabulous. We traveled with our 13 year old daughter. When asked by other's what her favorite part of the vacation was she said EVERYTHING !!!! We were pleased with the value. Can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Go4thgirl21
Reviews.Content: SO like many others have said they were a little worried about this resort. However, it was simply amazing. I have no idea where these other people were staying but I found this hotel to be beautiful!! the rooms were good size.. very bright.. and had a great view! as for the staff I didnt find one person that was at all rude (a word of advice if you get over yourself and be nice to the workers they will go out of their way to help you) if you are rude then you shouldnt expect to be treated with kindness. trust me I work at a hotel and The worse people are to me the less i care about them! and besides you shouldnt go to someplace this beautiful and be soo consumed with how u are treated... stop being so needy and you will have a greeeat time... as for the prices I was so worried going there that is was going to be outragous and it wasnt really that bad we ate at the ballyhoo grill and a burger and frys were only like 13 dollars thats only like 2 more than what we are used to paying and the food was good... also the caribe cafe was really good and the prices are not that bad.... The only negative thing i can say is that the drinks were not very good... if your not a big drinker you might just want to go without the drinks... they are expensive and small and just not good!! The resort is awesome and the island was nice! Dont let the bad reviews stop you from going here... It was my honeymoon and I am so glad we came to this hotel! like I said give some respect and kindness and they will show you the same in return. and even if you have a bad encounter dont let someone ruin your trip its rediculous if you think that everyone is supposed to bow to you or something.... ITS AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: afigueroa52
Reviews.Content: Great view, gorgeous private island, the food is amazing, the customer service was incredible, and perfect for a romantic getaway... I wish I could live here!!! And yes, it is expensive because it is one of the biggest and most luxurious resorts in the Caribbean! If you're cheap then stay at a motel for God's sake!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, great views”
Reviews.Author: Beroose49
Reviews.Content: The Resort was beautiful this time of year. The plants and views were extraordinary. The Resort was just acquired about 8 months ago and they need to do a review and some upgrades. We changed rooms once because we didn't like the view for one, my biggest reason was the mold growing in the bathroom. I always figured at the prices we were paying that the room would have been a little nicer but also the problems like the mold and caulk around the sink addressed. When we got moved to the Los Brisas side we liked it much better. When we called for anything the staff was friendly and we did get the things we asked for. We did get a call about a trip that was going to be billed to our account that we didn't make. We were glad they got a hold of us ahead of time for that. The checkout was a nightmare with two very slow women on duty. We needed to get out of there and get to our car rental and plane in San Juan. The best part was the Golden Door Spa and the treatments we had there. They are like the hotel (pricey) but it made the vacation more special. The staff there was also very nice and helpful. All in all I had a nice visit but I feel all the extra charges should be told to you or printed ahead of time so you know what you will be paying at the end. The rooms were average hotel rooms but the view we had over the marina was fantastic. I only ate one meal there and that was a breakfast, we ate off the grounds most of the time. Only a short drive down to Route 3 you could find places to eat like Sizzler and Pollo Tropical. We would eat lunch at those places and have dinner at a restaraunt where we were traveling. There are at least 5 pools to access if you wanted or a trip to Palamino Island which is beautiful. I hope the new ownership has many things to change and not just a whitewash. Parking costs 16.00 dollars a day so rent from Enterprise and get free parking, you can rent right there at the hotel or at the airport. Internet access is a charge in the room but you can get it free at Starbucks or just outside there in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about The El Conquistador!”
Reviews.Author: LoveWashingtonState
Reviews.Content: I too read many reviews before we stayed at El Conquistador and I'm so happy to say our experience was wonderful. We rented a car and was able to get around a bit, Jaimie at the front desk was terrific with directions and very courteous. Took the ferry to Palmino Island which only seemed to take five minutes and the island is beautiful. Very spacious, never felt crowded. My husband hiked all around which was great as he likes to explore. There were a lot of kids but who wouldn't bring their family there the place is perfect for everyone. The water park is amazing, can't wait to return with my children. We dined at Stingray the first night and it was fabulous.
