Our servers Jelissa and Christianson were very professional and we never felt neglected even though it was clear the restaurant was very busy. We're not gamblers but did go to the casino and played the slot machines for fun. The last night there we dined at the Steak House, my salmon cake was delicious, lamb not so good and the waiter fascinating; Alberto. We also enjoyed Starbucks in the lobby which was a bonus. Ask David what all the pins on his hat are for. So overall we had a great time. Yes the prices are high but prices are high anywhere you go that's equal to El Conquistador. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Spent the day here. Fantastic property!”
Reviews.Author: melissabh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped at El Conquistador for lunch just to see it. Next time we will definitely stay here! The property and view is far superior to the San Juan area for a vacation stay. Great for kids and families, but couples too from what I could see. Access to the hotel's private island, highly rated restaurants, and easy access to Vieques. This is a huge golf/resort property with all the amenities. Plan to come and stay at the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in outstanding surroundings!!!”
Reviews.Author: Adanne
Reviews.Content: You can tell this resort used to be one of the best hotels in PR, however it is in desperate need of refurbishment and general maintenance. It is really starting to show it's age. The biggest problem area is the room. There were visible stains on the headboard, the couch, the AC leaked the whole time and we had ants (which didn't bother me, we just didn't leave anything out once we saw them). The room has very sterile decor and it looked like it had water damage that was simply painted over. I got the room for a good rate on priceline.com, otherwise if I had paid full price I would have been upset. This hotel is no more than 3 stars based on the room. No bathrobes or coffee makers? Even days inn has a coffee maker in the room! I found out late in the stay that you could request one, but I think it's a ploy to get you to go to starbucks:-) Overall the staff was friendly. The spa is also a very nice facility, the highlight of my stay. The front desk was kind enough to upgrade my room to an ocean view in Las Brisas. Yes, the food was expensive, but since we had a car we just ate off the resort and explored. My favorite place was actually Cafe Caribe they have reasonable breakfast (the buffet at Las Brisas always had a long wait). The island is gorgeous. There is no nightlife, so if you're looking for that-stay in San Juan. The casino is a joke and NO ONE went to the Casablanca nightclub. From reading the previous reviews and forums I wasn't sure if the free parking at enterprise was true so I rented from Alamo who had a cheaper rate. I did find out that you CAN park for free if you rent from enterprise-but the parking spaces get full. Also, a little birdie told me that Enterprise does not keep tabs on who parks in their spaces and other people park there for free too. We didn't chance it, just wasn't worth it. Would I stay here again-yes, for a really good rate, but I doubt I want to stay that far from San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Careful Who You Book Through”
Reviews.Author: Motytrah
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador can be a good value hotel, depending on who you book through. We used Costco, as such all the things that people noted about getting charged for (like service fees, additional fees and taxes, breakfast, etc.) were included in the rate. The hotel is central to a number of activities, such as national parks, bioluminescent bays, and marinas. Partial ocean view is pretty close to a full ocean view. Rooms are updated, but obviously used hard. Dining at the resort is very expensive, as are drinks. Some of the restaurants on site are better than others. Get off-site if you can. There is an Amigo grocery store on the way to the resort you can stock up on. Enterprise has a rental counter at the hotel. Parking is free for Enterprise rented onsite. Wireless is free is you have an AT&T hotspot account.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to be everything, and is good at a few things. Beware of kids!”
Reviews.Author: cainrdc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to El Conquistador on hilton points, so I can't comment on actual room prices. We were upgraded to a Las Vistas room, but after reading reviews here I asked at check in for a room at the Marina. We had a private, detached balcony overlooking the marina, we slept with the door open most nights, and woke up to the sunrise. The pros: We had a gorgeous room - more european, spare chic than luxury, but perfect for the climate and location. The bathroom was enormous, with a separate WC and closet with drawers. All of the staff members we encountered were delightful and helpful. We arrived on a Wednesday and the resort was moderately full; we had no wait for the funicular and enjoyed the general quiet of the seaside. We dined at the Stingray Cafe - and yes, it's not cheap, but we thought the food was quite good, and the outdoor seating was just delightful. The wait staff was also a pleasure. I enjoyed a morning of exercise, yoga, and spa treatments (I loved it - the spa is very luxurious and the staff was the nicest i've encountered at a spa) while my husband went out with the dive shop (mediocre diving). Palomino Island ... we hiked over the hill to the other beaches; they were much prettier than the front-side beach, but did require a short, semi-steep walk to access. The negatives: Starting on Friday, the place was OVERRUN with children -- apparently on the week-long spring/easter break. Children everywhere! On one level, I can understand - it's a nice, contained place with entertainment for kids and parents ... but suddenly I found my romantic paradise impinged upon. Kids in my cliffside hot-tub, ruining my romantic sunset with their roughhousing. Noise between our room and our neighbors' became a bit of an issue after the arrival of the kids Restaurant-wise, I wish I could say nice things about the Ballyhoo Cafe. Terrible service, terrible drinks. We had a "cheap", casual dinner at the pizza place -- $62 for two glasses of wine, one OK pizza, and one OK salad. Money-saving tips: - buy the coupon book - $20 - at the spa, pro shop, or signature shop for discounts on meals, free spa services, BOGO ice cream, discounts on scuba, etc - refill your water bottles in the non-spa fitness center; they have a water cooler, and it's free for everyone -Hilton Honors members get 20% off spa services (not the packages) and free admission to the spa (Jacuzzi, steam room, nicer fitness center) - don't bother renting snorkel gear at Palomino, there is nothing to see. What I would do differently: - get a car early and stock up outside the hotel on breakfast and lunch items, wine/cocktail mixers - get a car early and go to the local beaches (Seven Seas was nice, but the two beaches to the left of it, Playa Escondido and another, were movie-set gorgeous with no one on them. On a glorious Saturday) - get a car and explore old san juan - the forts are fascinating, the food is excellent - check the school schedules - they are apparently overrun with families at Christmas, Presidents' Day, and Easter

Reviews.Title: “Awesome....only negative is...”
Reviews.Author: DrRhythm
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador- This was one great place. The layout is amazing, with the hotel built into a cliffside and a motorized car (funicular) that runs down to 2 lower levels...one with a separate pool and residences, and the lowest level with the pier, some more private-type rentals (more pricey), a couple of restaurants, and the ferry stop. The ferry takes you to Palomino Island...a private island solely for guests of El Conquistador that has beautiful ice blue water, very calm and shallow, horseback riding, snorkling, jetskiing, diving, etc. Awesome. The view from the top level main hotel complex is just breathtaking, overlooking the Caribbean with Palomino Island, Vieques, and Culebra in the distance (with some tiny little islands dotting the landscape). There are multiple pools, and multiple restaurant options within the resort. If you are used to staying in San Juan, then this will be a different experience. The hotel is amazingly beautiful, but the difference between this and San Juan is there really is nowhere to walk around outside the complex. Basically, you remain in the complex unless you rent a car or take a taxi (expensive). But, if you want to stay at a place that has it all and has one of the most spectacular views I've ever seen at a resort, then you must check it out. The negatives: There are really only 2 negatives that we felt are worth mentioning. First, the cost. The restaurants, and pretty much everything else in the resort, is very expensive. The food, especially, is very overpriced. The second negative are the children. We figured since it is a 4 star resort, people would be less likely to bring a gaggle of screaming kids along. The way the place is set up....very romantic with lots of adult-type of amenities, we were very surprised at how many people were there with tons of screaming little kids. Most of our attempts at having a nice peaceful drink at the pool bar were met with loud, annoying groups of kids with their parents taking up spots at the pool bar, kicking and splashing. When we mentioned it to the staff, they said they were surprised, too, at why people would bring their kids to such a resort, and they thought there were too many kids at the pool too. I don't know about you, but a very romantic, high class 4 star resort isn't where I bring kids. Especially given the prices. We had a family with screaming kids move in toward the end of our stay. So that is one negative: for those looking for romance, be aware of the large numbers of people with lots of children. (they must have big $$$$$!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Poorest service, rooms in disrepair, partly cleaned rooms for multiple guests, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: hkny007
Reviews.Content: Called 5 times to have cooler/fridge door repaired from 9am to 7pm, still never fixed. Children's milk & food spoiled. Toilet in room above us was leaking into our toilet. Bird droppigs all over balcony and balcony furniture in apparently all rooms. Other guests reported used toilettries on arrival in their room. Beds left partly made. Managment is carefree, unconcerned about service complaints. Managment/front desk responds they will "take care of it" but never follow up. Lots of extras to pay for at every opportuity with resort parks, childrens activities, movie night, ect. Restaurants way overpriced even for New Yorkers.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing i would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: alicen19
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with dont let the reviews below deter you from staying you will miss out on an absolutely beautiful hotel and vacation! We just got back this week and for a month prior had been reading all the awful revies and were very weary of our trip! We booked with cheap caribean and got an amazing deal! we checked in at 6pm with no issues and no waiting! We were brought down to our room free of charge (besides the tip we gave) by a great bell boy named Juan! He was super nice and extremely friendly! We stayed in the marina we had an gorgeous view and were only seconds from the water park, a bar, the funicular, the ferry and some shops! We rented a car for 180.00 vs paying the airport transfer fees of 150.00 and were able to avoid paying the obscure charges for food and drinks at the hotel! there is a walmart only about 4 miles away and we were able to stock up on waters and alcohol (yes they sell it at walmart there) :) i believe our charges at the hotel were minimal around 300.00 for 7 days! We did eat there a few times but not to much! i could see food and drink adding up real quickly had we! :) The private island is phenomenal and absolutely breathtaking! The only downer is the coral there is coral in the water everywhere! You def need water shoes! The service was great and very accomodating! We did an excursion of the rain forest and it was beautiful and highly recommended! We would go back in a heartbeat! :)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty views, nice pool, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: nycglobtrotter74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 3 year old recently. We picked it because it was highly rated in the 2010 Frommers Caribbean edition for people with kids. Think they gave it 2 stars which for them means "very highly recommended". Anyway, it was nice but not that nice. First, there are over 1000 rooms in the hotel and it's an immense property. For example, we stayed in the Las Olas section (more on this later) and it took the bell hop 20 minutes to get our bags and come back to the front desk because of the walking distance, multiple elevators and funicular. Second, the prices for food and activities are all over the place. It's $20/adult and $15/child to access the Coqui water park which has 3 slides, a small lazy river and a couple of pools. Nice views but overall not that interesting unless you're a tween. Our son was too young to use the slides. One of the very casual restaurants (Cafe Caribe) had fajita's for $30! Oddly enough, sushi rolls at Blossom (one of the more upscale restaurants) were $8 which is almost cheap by NYC standards; highly recommend this restaurant on the property. Third, the Las Olas rooms were a waste of money. The appeal was that the rooms had a separate pool with pool bar, game room, restaurant and sun deck. However, they failed to mention that if there aren't enough people they don't bother staffing the area so everything, but the pool, is closed. Towels were sporadic, no bar service, games were on but game room was looked (why?). This meant we never used that pool and had to take a funicular (seemed to not work for 1-2 hours every other day so unnecessary walking) to get to the main pool. God help you if you forget something in your room as it could take you 20 min. to get back! Beds were too soft, building looked like a 70s throwback, but the rooms were large and nice (except the tub). Finally, I don't know why they associate the property with "The Waldorf Collection". Felt very much like a generic Hilton property. Overpriced mediocre food, generic service, etc. The private island/beach was nice but you couldn't get there much before 10 and had to leave by 5:30 - lots of really sun burnt people because of midday basking. Overall, it was a nice looking property with beautiful views and I'm sure if you pony up for the Marina or Casitas room you'll probably really enjoy yourself. Skip Las Olas. Probably best to stay in San Juan at the Ritz Carlton or other hotel. At check-out they discounted our last night and credited me back some money to smooth things over; shouldn't be necessary at a "Waldorf" property.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid to book this hotel. It is great!”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_TexasMomtotwo
Reviews.Content: We almost canceled our trip based on the reviews listed here. I am so glad we didn't. It was one of the best vacations we ever had. We were looking for total relaxation and fun for the kids. We got the package that included airport tranportation, breakfast, and water park passes. It was perfect for us. El Con was waiting for us as soon as we got to the baggage area, and they had water and wine waiting on the bus for us. We were helped by Atlantis at the front counter. I told her my concerns about bed bugs and she immediately assured me that the rooms had been exterminated and it was no longer a problem. I know that bed bugs are a problem in tropical humid environments. The bellman explained where everthing in the hotel was located on the way to the room and even told us what restaurants would be open for dinner if we had not eaten. Make no mistake, this is a huge property. I saw maintaince (painting, cleaning etc..) going on constantly. If you are looking for soemthign to compain about, you can find it. But overall it was no different than any large hotel we had stayed at. I felt that the service was way above what you usually receive in th Carribean. Most everyone was extremly nice and made sure we got exactly what we needed. We called the night of our arrival becasue we needed more towels and a hairdryer. (About 11 at night) and recevied both items within 10 minutes. They even called to make sure we had received them. The beach is nice and we always found a shaded spot to lay in. There are plenty of activites and food on the isalnd. The ferry ride is very nice, and you get a beautiful view of the property. We are not the type of people who lay on the beach all day, so we went every morning and then headed to the water park. My children 9 and 13, loved it! It was great for a couple of hours each day. My huband played golf twice and had no problem getting a tee time. The course is beautiful. I went to the spa once and it was great. Orlando gives a wonderful massge. The property is large and there is quite a bit of walking. I would not have wanted to have a child in a stroller. We never had to wait for the funicular. Food- this is one of the biggest pluses for me. We stayed at the Grand Wailea several years ago and loved it, but the food was very average and expensive. All the food here is very good. We ate at the water park (burgers and churros), Palomino Beach (chicken), Strip House (excellent), Blossoms (great), La Piccola (wonderful), Las Brisas (breakfast every day) and the Cafe Bella (pizza). Yes, the food is expensive as you would expect of a resort, but it is very good. We walked into all the restaurants with no reservations and they always found a table for us. We ate a big breakfast every day at Las Brisas and then would split something for lunch and go to one of the restaurants for dinner. It worked out great for us. We had a ocean view room in the La Vista wing. It was close to the spa and golf course. It was always very quiet outside our room. We took a noise maker and it helped drown out the people slamming doors etc. There was a wait everyday at the water park to get your wristbands. The hotel computer system needs to be updated. You could easily have bar codes on the backs on the guest cards, and it would make everything run so much smoother. Overall it was a great relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: mcftbl
Reviews.Content: The pros: The staff at this place is extremely helpfull and friendly. I checked in with a group on 600-700 people and it took less then 15 minutes. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious. The grounds are some of the best I have seen with beatiful views. They do not have a beach directly off their grounds but they do have an Island that makes up for it. The Island and beach are some of the best in the Carribean. The water is about as aqua as your going to get and the Island has every eminity you can think of already on it. I would recommend bringing a cooler with some drinks and snacks before you go. They have a casino, I was a little disappointed with how small it is. 2 blackjack tables, 1 roulette table and no craps table. I did come out on top so I guess it satisified my needs. Keep in mind they do close at 11 on weekdays and 12 on weekends. They have a disco open and outdoor bar/lounge where you can hang out till 2 or 3 AM. Cons: expensive for almost everything on the resort. The water park is weak, has 3 slides in which only 2 are worth going on and they charge you to use the waterpark. Their taxes and extree daily fees are out of control. I think it was around and extra $70 a day on top of an already expensive room. I went to the Atlantis in the Bahamas last year around the same time I went to El Con. this year. The prices were roughly about the same. The Atlantis, yes I am sure you have seen the commercials and it is truley as awesome as the commecials make it look. The beaches, waterpark, casino and nightliff trump the El Con. by 10. Sorry El Con,, I enjoyed my stay but you guy's charge 4/5 star prices and you are not an Atlantis caliber resort. I did enjoy my stay and would love to come back when they drop their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Travel with yong children and teenager”
Reviews.Author: karamazhan
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews and It looks like most of family travellers were happy, so I decided to go with my wife and 11 month daughter and 21 y.o. teen. I just paid bit extra for ocean view and we slept with wide open windows listen tropical sounds watching stars and sea Indeed - very family oriented place: (+) 1. views are amazing 2. gardening + landscaping are fantastic. I even have asked for bio-tour around the property 3. Free sea-taxi to the hotel beach on the private island 4. Drinks are expensive, which is good 5. Tennis, Golf, Kayak, waterpark even childrengardern 6. Lobby and common areas are decorated very nicely 7. Talking parrotts 8. Proximity of Pure Adventure tour with biologyst to see illuminating bio bay 9. Proximity or rain forest (-) 1. Yachts rental was not available 2. Common areas in living sector should have more art from local Pouerto Rico artis 3. Not enough local see food (but one can go outside the hotel and get great sea food) Overall - very nice, but be prepared to spend another $700 in the hotel + 300 for car rental

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property with slightly slow service for the price”
Reviews.Author: davidcs
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the El Conquistador. Pluses are the amazing view from the Las Brisas rooms. The ferry ride to Palomino Island is very pleasant and scenic. I thought it would be a negative but was actually a fun thing. The Palomino Island beach is very nice. i recommend renting a kayak and snorkel gear and snorkel around the adjacent island. Starbucks in the lobby on the main level is a big plus. Did a great tour through the rain forest, El Yunque. Tour Guide Elian was great with adults and kids. Bio Bay tour with electric boat and Captain Suarez was outstanding and is highly recommended. Coqui frog serenade each night is beautiful. Negatives are the rooms are showing their age and are below what I would expect for the price. Service is a little slow at most of the restaurants and the prices are high which is not unusual for the destination resort that it is. General fitness room is a little spartan. For 25 more dollars per day or 50 dollars per 5 days you can get better facilities in the golden door spa. Queen beds seemed small.

Reviews.Title: “great resort if you got the money”
Reviews.Author: dannyman34
Reviews.Content: I went there for my honeymoon and had a good time but I think you can go to better placies and waste less money.

Reviews.Title: “Front Service staff...poor customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: RozCt
Reviews.Content: I'm puertorican..wanted to take my husband (Italian) for months to PR, we went as a whole family with our children. The Resort overall...such as in space,,view..having a great private island (Palomino) and a water park for the kids is excellent. However, the service is terrible..figure just to check-in we had to wait 1 hour, and to check out 1 hr too, there's about 8 front desk staff and there more worried about there make-up and the gossip of the day..finally when you get there..they have this snubby attitude, like if the whole freaking stay it would be for free. Second, the rooms are nasty for a 4 star resort..they stink and I felt itchy the whole night, the food at the restaurant is not that great, I guess I would of prefer Burger King around. I was a bit disapointed...I guess if the staff and among the hotel service would of be friendlier not with a bon-qui-qui attitude and rooms would of be cleaner..it would of deserve a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “We came home with bedbugs and went from disappointed to disgusted.”
Reviews.Author: mendogirl28
Reviews.Content: I came for business and brought my husband. We stayed some extra days hoping to relax on the beach and explore. While the resort appears beautiful with amazing views, we found it to be overpriced compared to it's value, without beach access(unless you pay to take a boat to their private island) and everything closes early; furthermore because you are so secluded from town; you cannot explore off the resort (by foot). To top it off, we came home with bedbugs. When I called to notify the resort of the bedbugs- they were rude and insinuated that I was lying and accused me of not using their "proper protocol" which I was told, was to file a complaint with security while still on the resort. I tried to explain that at the time I assumed the bites were from ants or mosquitoes, but that they have continued since we've come home. Today we peeled the sheets off our bed and found a bedbug so I decided to call them. I was simply disappointed in the beginning; but now I am offended and disgusted. I did not call today to argue, but to notify them of a problem and they were pretty awful to me. I would not EVER recommend this resort now.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: madamedragonfly
Reviews.Content: The bell staff, parking staff, check in staff and room cleaning staff were great. We went to two receptions and two dinners, and the food and service was great at both. Even the independent restaurants were still very good and took nothing away from our stay. I used your overall service in a talk with my employees, as an example of high quality training. I would definitely go back to this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: zipzapzoomin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a last minute Priceline package to the Conquistador to get out of the cold and chaos of NYC. It was a spectacular vacation! I had read all of the bad reviews and found myself searching for problems when we arrived at the hotel. By the second day I realized that I needed to stop searching for problems and just enjoy the pure beauty of the resort. By the way, I was so freaked out by the bed bug review that I checked the mattress immediately after entering the room. No bed bugs ... thank God! Pros: Beautiful ocean view room (free upgrade) Great staff The beach is GREAT! Food is expensive, but very good. Won $400 in the casino! Spa was wonderful, Richard is the best massage therapist I've ever been to. I highly recommend him! Cons: Expensive food and drinks If you are looking for a top of the line Four Seasons or Ritz vacation, this is not it. However, if you are looking for a very nice, relaxing, peaceful, beautiful get away ... I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Palomino Island but main hotel a bit shabby round the edges and no decent food”
Reviews.Author: rlwoking
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business trip with partners. Overall a pleasant stay and Palomino Island is great. Very disappointed with the food - tasteless and not appealing. Chips, burgers and pizzas seem to be the staples. Even the orange juics tasted watered down. Rooms pretty basic for a hotel of this class. I had an allergic reaction to the Rainforest facial which has never happened before so be careful. The massage was good.

Reviews.Title: “Much ado about nothing”
Reviews.Author: EddieBaez
Reviews.Content: Talk about false advertising. A really beautiful property but with the worse service. If it has won awards it wasn't for the service... The staff is rude and arrogant. You spend a lot of money and you are treated worse than going to a government agency. The staff behaves as if you are doing them a favor. There are many other islands in the Caribbean with beautiful scenery and great beaches without the lousy service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but reception desk was poor, slow and prices way too high”
Reviews.Author: anniep1977
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for two rooms. Our children and 4 month old grandchild were staying in one room and we were several rooms away. The rooms on either side of our children had very loud and disruptive people staying in them. Two phone calls were made to security in the middle of the night and again early in the morning. The night was lost as the baby was awaken and was unable to be calmed back down. The front desk did not respond in an appropriate manner and did not offer to refund the night's stay back to the kids. The front desk claimed that the kids and the baby should have moved their room in the middle of the night. Were they joking when they said that? After several discussions with the front desk, half the money was refunded back to the kids for the lost night. It was not until the last day of their stay that the hotel was willing to credit back more of the cost for the night. We found the front desk not accommodating and not sensitive to the needs of the hotel guests. They appeared angered and annoyed by inquiries. Very strange for a hotel with name Waldof Astoria associated with it. The property is beautiful, but there is nothing to do in the area, it takes quite awhile to get to the beach between the funicular and the ferry (and no one at the front desk knew the schedule of times for the ferry) and the prices for food is ridiculously expensive for a family. Another major problem is that everything is separately owned. The conference center is separate from the hotel, the valet is separate from the hotel, the restaurants are separate from the hotel;so no one knows anything. Really ridiculous. We have never been in a hotel that was so confusing and disorganized. But, if you want to go to a pretty property without any other expectations, the El Conquistador is your place. Every view is breath-taking and the ocean beautiful. But then again, maybe another hotel will offer it all for less money.

Reviews.Title: “A "WOWless" Waldorf Astoria Collection embarassment”
Reviews.Author: VagabondMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Let's see, where to begin: In the middle of nowhere an hour ride from San Juan. Felt like a prisoner. No adjacent beach but you can pay $8 to take a shuttlecraft to Palamino Island. Nice but not great pool area unless you want bar/restaurant service. Then it is touch and go. Last day there, both pool levels were open and in use but only food service was at the upper level. Lowere level bar was closed. If you want Meyers Rum with your colada forget about it. They're out. Or, you could pay $20 per day to use the "Water Park." In five days saw no one using it. $35 per day "Resort Fee". For What? The privilege of being there? Casino open from 4pm to Midnight then your are SOL. For an Astoria Collection property, El Conquistador is an embarassment. No "WOW!" factor at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect 4 Star service”
Reviews.Author: jcrobaina
Reviews.Content: Great property location, one of the most beautiful views in the Caribbean. Unfortunately the staff service is tactless and distant. For the price, other facilities are available with much better service.

Reviews.Title: “stunningly beautiful, but....”
Reviews.Author: Benefits
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days 2 nights at the beginning of March. First let me say that the grounds are absolutely beautiful, not a bad view from anywhere in the place. Whoever built it knew what they were doing. Also the staff are very pleasant and accommodating. They will do whatever they can to make your stay enjoyable. That being said, I must say the room my wife and I were "upgraded" into was in need of help. Lights out or missing, stains on the carpet, bugs in the room both nights, (snails from the garden that came out at night, must have killed 20 or more), no guest services directory in the room, rust stains on the sink countertop, and a bed that is still giving me back problems, I've been home a week. I did make management aware of this and they offered to move me, but seeing that we were only there two nights, I didn't want to spend 2 to 3 hours on the change. Moral of the story, make sure you thouroughly check your room before you unpack. The way I look at it is when staying at the "WALDORF ASTORIA COLLECTION" I should not have to begin repairing a room. As far as dining, bring your wallet. The second day I spent $170.00 on lunch and dinner for my wife and I. No alcohol, no snacks. We loved the pool and beach as the weather was perfect, and walked each night down buy the marina. Nightlife = None. Plan on going to your room around 9:00 or 10:00pm. Maybe it is better on the weekend as we were there mid-week, but from the tiny dance club and casino, this place is really about early to rise early to bed. I would probably go back but with caution, plan on spending for food and drink, and make sure you check the room thouroughly. I hope Hilton puts the money needed into the place to keep it going because you could see that right now its at a crossroads. Another couple of years of neglect and it might be on the selling block.

Reviews.Title: “Always Read TripAdvisor!”
Reviews.Author: HoustonMark
Reviews.Content: Upon check-out I noticed a $20 charge on my bill for the bellboy's helping us with our luggage when we checked in. This was in addition to the generous tip I gave him. When I questioned the charge, the lady at the desk said I should have been told about the charge when I checked in. I wasn't. My wife then told me she read about in on TripAdvisor. Oh well. One other thing: I was offerred and accepted an upgrade to a oceanside view. While the room was fine, what I wasn't told was that you must take two elevators, walk quite aways, and take a tram to get to your room. If you attending meetings, it is about a 10-15 minute trip each time. Not sure if it was worth it. And finally, everything is too expensive (but that was not a surprise).

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooning In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: aimeemabry
Reviews.Content: El conquistador was absolutely breathtaking! They upgraded us to a full ocean view room (see photos) because it was our honeymoon. I have traveled a lot & it was, by far, the best view ive ever had. The beds were VERY comfortable. Everything is very modern & there is so much to do! It is a little bit pricey, but we thought it was worth it. We also stayed at the Caribe Hilton in San Juan & got less value for more money. The ferry ride to private Polomino Island is quick & the island is MAGICAL! Simply beautiful. The pools were open 24 hours & most restaurant were open until 1 am. The casino was great also. I won a lot of money on the penny slots. There are SO MANY shops w/very friendly owners & a huge variety of restaurants to choose from. I would definitely return. I would not return to the Caribe Hilton. If you are staying in San Juan, I would reccomend Da House Hotel in Old San Juan. Another plus, the golden door spa & amazing snorkeling! They also have a brand new water park. I did not get to use it but I heard great things.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and great location; however, service level not on par with expectations of a Waldorf property.”
Reviews.Author: buckeyedcj
Reviews.Content: This was the first visit to Puerto Rico for my wife, 3 friends, and myself. Good points: beautiful grounds, lobby with exotic birds was great, was upgraded to an ocean view room, Blossom's asian restaurant, Jose and Shorty on Pallamino Island. Lackluster points: it took just under 15 minutes for the desk clerk (Luis) to check us in, the door our room was marked-up, maid did not take the wash cloth out of the shower, shattered pane of glass in hallway door for 3 days before it was fixed outside of room 3228, the fire alarm went off incessantly on the first night, sheets that were pilling, service level at the pool left something to be desired, service level of our waiter (Luis) at breakfast was slow even for island time, fitness equipment is in need of a serous overhaul as the treadmill sped up and threw my wife off on Thursday morning. I am a Hilton Honor Diamond member and overall I've had a better experience in a Hampton Inn. I expect superior service when I stay at the top level of Hilton and I was greatly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: LizLauzu88
Reviews.Content: best of best as explained by Ricky Martin not me! Greatest view of mountain and sea. Private beach and key. Funnicular.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Escape from Winter”
Reviews.Author: Lrising
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are extensive leisure travelers and are very picky about our accommodations. We hesitated to stay at this property due to the many negative reviews but as we were familiar with the location (having flown over it many times on our way to nearby Vieques) and were able to use Hilton Honors points for part of our stay we decided to give it a try. I am not sure where to start as we encountered almost none of the other reviewers' problems- it is almost as though they were staying at a different hotel! We have stayed at 5 other properties on Puerto Rico as well as having made 4 trips to Vieques, and 1 each to nearby St. John, St. Croix, and Guana Island. This time we were traveling alone without our family and wanted an escape winter getaway with a nice beach, snorkeling, nice room, and good food-- all of which we got at an excellent price. We stayed on a "Winter Escape" package which included 2 excellent breakfasts per day. We checked in quickly and were upgraded to an ocean view room in the "Las Brisas" wing due to our Hilton Gold status. The air con was already turned on and the room was 65 degrees right from the moment we stepped into it! Lovely room, with king-sized (very comfortable) bed, large sofa with chaise at one end, huge bathroom with separate closet/dressing room, balcony with 2 chairs and table. Loved it! Very clean, NO BED BUGS or ants, excellent maid service (replaced our towels even when we left them up to dry, multiple toiletry bottles that we couldn't even use up, extra towels, turn down service). Hallways throughout the hotel were tile- never saw any "dirty carpets" anywhere as another reviewer claimed and I purposely walked through the oldest part of the hotel (La Vista wing). We had read about the $20 luggage fee and since we only had carry-ons we declined any assistance. No fee appeared on our bill anyway as others have stated. Speaking of fees yes there is a 14% resort fee but this is common practice at most of the resorts we have stayed at and here we felt it was well deserved as this covered pool towels (no counts were kept and you didn't have to have them back by 5 pm or get charged), ferry service to the private island and cable car service-- the latter two being quite expensive to maintain. Food was good throughout the hotel. We did not rent a car and ate all but one meal at the hotel. There are many options with varying prices. We had excellent, albeit expensive, dinners at The Striphouse (steaks), La Piccola Fontana (Italian), and The Stingray Cafe (seafood). La Piccola Fontana had surprisingly excellent risotto and tiramisu (and we have been to Italy many times). Breakfast buffet was quite nice with made to order omelets and all the trimmings and there was no "auto tip" for the buffet with our package-- we left whatever tip we desired and we DO like to tip even for a buffet as the waiter still brings coffee, juice, etc. The Palomino island food was very pricey and limited in choice but then this is a small island 10 minutes off-shore so we didn't expect a bargain there. We had no trouble with our dinner reservations which we made on-line from home-- our reservations were not "lost" and we were never "rushed out of meals". Actually, the waiters brought my tiramisu with a candle and sang to me when my hubby casually mentioned it was my birthday!! Palomino Island was wonderful!! A very large beach with both sunny and shaded areas, beautiful sand, and decent off-shore snorkeling if you snorkel way out past the sea grass. Plenty of chairs, not crowded, all facilities at hand. What surprised us was how cool it was in the shade with a beautiful trade wind. We are used to baking on the beach even in the shade on nearby Vieques. This was comfortable enough to sit and read without even needing to get wet to cool off. Water park was very nice and worth the admission price with zero entry, infinity edge pool, lazy river, 3 water slides plus a mini one for the littlest guests, and the most comfortable lounge chairs in the resort. Overall a wonderful place to stay that we are considering returning to next year-- and we don't do a lot of places twice! Negatives- the walls are thin so you can sometimes hear your neighbors and it is more noisy in the common areas than the smaller hotels that we prefer. Finally, another plus is that there are lots of the wonderful coqui frogs on the property. We just love to listen to them at night. And there was very good shopping in the resort. We just got back yesterday so I will post some pics as soon as I get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Religious experience”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyS14
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful place I've ever seen period. Snorkeling was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Almost the perfect vacation...”
Reviews.Author: Jamesquad
Reviews.Content: Like others, I was a little concerned about staying at the El Conquistador Resort due to the mixed reviews. First of all, I am glad that I went . My wife & I stayed from Feb. 18th - Feb 23rd and we had a terrific time. I will start with the few concerns we had & a couple important tips: The first room we had smelled badly of mold, it obviosly had a leak somewhere. We arrived late (10:20P) and the hotel was booked, so we were stuck that night. They came & sprayed, but it was still pretty bad. The hotel did move us to a much better room the next afternoon in the Las Marinas section near the ferry to Palomino. We loved this room & that was the only real concern with anything at the hotel. We rented a car w/Dollar and this was a mistake. The agency was off the airport & navigating in PR is a challenge. Signage is optional & the mapquest directions were zero help, as was the GPS w/our iphones. It was nice to have wheels to get to Walmart for some snacks & the excursions, but next time we'll take the shuttle, save the parking charges, and forgo the drama finding thehotel & finding our way back to the dollar site. (Near impossible to get to, even after turning around a couple times and retracing steps from the airport) As most everyone has said, the hotel grounds & vistas are terrific. We found the staff to be friendly & other than some inconveniences when one of the funiculars was broken we had no other problems. The SPA is not to be missed & if you are a HH member, you have daily free access to the sauna, heated water, and workout rooms. We didn't know this going in, but it was a nice tip. Plus, you'll get a 20 or 30% discount on services. (Just not the combined specials) My wife loved her treatments & it was first-rate. The food is definitely expensive & having options for breakfast on your own would be a plus. It is $47 for two people for breakfast at Las Brisas for just a simple buffet. You can get oatmeal or something light in another spot, but we opted for cheerios & granola in our room. We bought 24 bottles of water & coupled with the snacks, were great for breakfast & in between meals. Lunch & Dinner on the resort were great. You can eat for $30 or pay $150, depending on the restaurant. We chose casual & lower priced options with great views at Las Brisas most evenings. The views are spectacular & their brick oven pizza is terrific. (Snacks & water were from Walmart about 4 miles away) It is a little loud on yorubalcony down as Las Marinas since it's right over the pier, a couple restaurants & their are a lot of people milling around. I didn't mind & was able to sit out & read with the water and people sounds more like white noise. Activities: We spent a day at the water park (Coqui) and it was fun, even though we'd left our kids at home. My wife would say I acted like a kid, but we both loved the water slides & it was overcast and we nearly had the place to ourselves. Definitely worth the $40 for both tickets at least one day & if you bring your kids, you might do 1/2 days almost everyday. We did the bio bay tour with Kayaking Puerto Rico & we can't say enough good things about it. You can walk there from the gate at the marina (we drove) in 10 min & it was a 10 out of 10 experience. Beautiful, amazing, warm, & the glowing algae were truly spectacular. We say a good bit of wildlife & the guide(s) were awesome. It's the best $45 PP you can spend. We did another excusions with this group & it was the opposite however. It was the miniboat adventure and the water was so rough (8-10ft swells) with zero wildlife. This was a bummer, because we'd heard about the stellar snorkling in PR. We'll try another option next time. They have killer reefs, but the seas were so bad we couldn't get there due to weather. They said this was rare, but I'd check for another option. It was neat captaining our own boat, but the weather ruined it for my wife and it was borderline unsafe. The rooms aren't super luxurious, but they are fairly spacious & servicable. Not 4 Seasons or Ritz-Carlton level by any means, more Hilton Garden Inn Modern. Clean & how much time are you really in their anyway? Palomino Island is great. It's 20 min by ferry and simply beautiful. We chilled under the trees & enjoyed the weather and wildlife. (Chickens, iguanas, etc...) You can play hoops, mini-golf, rent just about anything, eat, shop, or just sunbathe. Temper your expectations & you'll have a great time. We will definitely go back again in the next year, maybe with the kids in tow this time. The various pools were nice, albeit a little crowded at times. The weather was awesome for the most part too.

Reviews.Title: “Views were great but not worth the high prices”
Reviews.Author: kbbeach
Reviews.Content: As many others have said, this place has awesome views of scenery and the ocean. By far the sights from this hotel are its selling point. But after that it goes down hill. Food is pretty good sometimes even really good but you will pay for it (or wait for it). Food near and around the pool is burgers, sandwiches, etc and everything is about 15 bucks. Beers are $5.50 and cocktails get closer to $10 ...and if you want some fancy frozen drink plan on $15. Service when I was there was slow and waited for about an hour one day for a chicken wrap. The food at the restaurants is good and ambiance is nice but super pricey. The island is beautiful. I would advise anyone going there to bring some aqua shoes or something because I found it hard to walk out into the water without stepping on a lot of rocks/coral/shells. Casino is pretty small and the tables get full fast and they close at midnight....seemed pretty crazy one night when the place was packed that they would turn away people with good money ready to gamble. OK the worst part of this place for me was the cleanliness of my room. There were make-up stains on the pillow cases, hair in the corners of the room, and carpet that did not look like it had seen a vacuum. Its not like the room smelled or was obviously dirty, but everyday I would notice something off in the room that just made me realize, "well if they didn't pick up this candy wrapper off the floor what else have they ignored.". Actually the first thing I saw when I walked into our room was the lighter and cigarette butts out on the balcony. They were clear as day laying out there but obviously no one cared to sweep them up...so what else did they not care about. Because of the rooms I didn't want to spend anytime in there. The over all pros would be the views, the pool, the weather. Tips if you go: Bring bug spray! Check a bag and load it with plastic airplane bottles if you want to drink cheaper at the resort. You will still have to buy some sodas or something but it will really cut down on costs. Overall I would go back to Puerto Rico, but I wouldn't stay here again. Too expensive, so-so service, and unsanitary conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, but be ready to wait”
Reviews.Author: BARON27
Reviews.Content: Magnificent location, well maintained grounds, cheap furniture in the rooms, bur rooms a big and comfortable. Clean, but can do better. Very thin walls, always hear people talking in the hallway. Pros: Property, many restaurants almost for every budget and taste. Delicious food. Good spa. Cons: Very noise. In the evening movie at the pool, during the day parrots in lobby or Samba dancer instructor at the pool with deafening music. You can not relax. Private beach is by boat only, crowded cafe, overpriced beach toys, water is not transparent, but warm. Watch valet parking charges, a lot of errors. I would rate overall experience 5-6 out of ten. I would recommend the Hotel with a lot of explanations, not the best for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with terrible service”
Reviews.Author: girljordan
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of positive things to say about the El Conquistador....the rooms are great, the food is fabulous and Palomino Island is a slice of heaven. However, the trip was certainly dampened by the terrible service, especially in the casino area. We aren't big gamblers, but do enjoy playing some blackjack (for low stakes). The casino itself is small, lots of slots but not a lot of card tables. The average wait to get a spot at a table was 1+ hours, and the staff refused to open up additional tables. Also, the servers were not only slow but downright rude, especially the bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “What A Rip Off!!!”
Reviews.Author: rdgriffithunc
Reviews.Content: While the El Conquistador has a beautiful location and views from almost everywhere on the property, that is where it ends. The hidden (never disclosed) resort fee and taxes increased the daily room rate approximately 25%. The food at the resort is average at best and "extremely" expensive. While my wife and I enjoy a nice dinner and don't mind paying for good food and service, what I don't like is being rushed out of one of the resorts finer restaurants in less than an hour because they overbooked. The "free" breakfast that was offered with our package turned out to have a tip fee that was automatically charged to your account for the buffet, yes buffet where we served ourselves? We were scheduled to be at the resort for four days but left early after two room changes and approximately $1000 dollars down the drain...we had to stop the bleeding! Please don't make the same mistake we did, never book a room at the El Conquistador Golf and Beach Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property - Something for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: bigpuppy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the resort 6+ times over the past 10 years, in both the Las Caistas and the main hotel. This year we took advantage of a very attractive Travelzoo Coqui Water package that included:airport transfers for 4, breakfast daily for 4, admittance to the water park daily for 4, and the 5th night free for an ocean view room in the main hotel of $329 plus resort fees and tax. The rate was great - but the hotel gets you with their resort tax, meals, wifi charges, excursions and waterside rentals. Unfortunately upon arrival the ocean front view was not available and we were given a garden room, with no mention by management in a reduction in rate for the room differential. After calls to management, finally a reduction in the room rate of $30 per night was granted. The garden room was perfectly adequate for a family of 4. It had a large bathroom, fridge and a patio overlooking the golf and tennis courts. The room did not have a coffee maker - which was disappointing - because I am an early bird- and like to liesurely have my coffee in the am. Having to fully dress and walk a 1/2 mile to the Starbucks to get a cup of Joe at 6am was a little annoying every day. If you like to work out daily - I suggest visiting the Golden Door Sa and negotiating a vacation package with them for usage of their gym facility during your stay. I find their gym to be cleaner, less crowded, more equiptment options and more updated than the free gym Their normal rate is $25 per day or entrance is free with a spa treatment. However- I negotiated a $50 fee for our 5 night stay and found the extra expense worth it. Do not rely on their fitness class schedule or gym time hours- both were non consistent. One morning the gym was scheduled to open at 7am but the attendent did not show up until 8am. The hotel charges $15 a day for room WIFI access- however it is free in the lobby. Save yourself the $20 a day ( after resort fees and taxes) and carry your lap top to the expansive lobby to connect for free. You will see plenty of other "in the Know" travelers doing the same! The billing system at the hotel is not 100% automated. At 99% of the stores and service locations all purchased items had to be manually written up - which resulted in long waits and increased opportunity for billing error. I was very surprised that the hotel had not automated this process. Some places take cash or credit - but most of the convenience stores only accepted the room charge which then made each charge subject to the additional resort tax. I highly reccommend reviewing your bill with a fine tooth comb upon check out. I found over $400 in over charges that had to be adjusted. I also reccomend not booking any excursions through the hotel. One can book the bioluminiscent kayaking trip on their own for $35pp vs, the hotel's $90 pp charge. Also -no need to book a guided rain forest trip. One can book a car on their own for $50 and easily navigate the forest on their leisure. The enterprise rental car company is right on site and one can save $30 a night directly parking with them vs valeting at the hotel if there is availability in one of the 30 of the enterprise customer parking spots. Meals are pricey - be prepared to spend $200 a dinner. We ate off the resort and found those meals were equally expensive - but we enjoyed the off campus experience. If you rent a car to see the rain forest, try to fit a meal in at La Parilla at kiosko #2. The food was excellent, with a beautiful view of Loquillo Beach and it was enroute to the forest. I found the service to be adequate of a Carribean Island. I thought the concierge servive to be the worst of any hotel I have experienced. This hotel is not the Ritz Carlton in terms of service, but the property and amenities were parrallel to those of many other arribean Ritz Carlton Properties. Our children - 9 and 7 years- loved the resort and are anxious to return.Their parents - 41 and 43 - although over all pleased with the trip - are looking for a new spot to visit next year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: Bandlady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my 77-year-old mother and our teenage daughter to the El Con last week. Although we were told the property was at 100% capacity, we rarely felt that it was overly crowded, as the place is absolutely huge! We rented a car at SJU, which ended up being cheaper for the 4 of us than taking the hotel shuttle. Having the car made it possible for us to stock up on some breakfast items, tour the El Yunque rainforest, and visit a friend in Luquillo for dinner. The resort is beautifully decorated and landscaped, and is located on a cliff high above the ocean, making for stunning views. There are also rooms halfway down the cliff in the Las Olas section, and down by the water at La Marina. We were located in the marina section. All sections are connected by the funicular, which runs continually up and down the mountain. You really get an awesome view from there. Since the property is so large, be prepared to do a lot of walking. OK, there have been some negative posts about this place recently, but I think people have to be realistic about what they will experience in Puerto Rico. The culture is much more relaxed than in the "States". Get on "Puerto Rican time" as soon as you can, and you will be happy. If you can't accept the more relaxed style, vacation somewhere else. However, the staff was extremely friendly and welcoming, and we've waited longer in many NYC restaurants than we ever did at El Con. The staff is clearly trying very hard to please. Our room was beautiful, with a large bathroom and a marina view. The patio was quite large, and we enjoyed eating breakfast there. Everything was clean, although I believe the hotel will soon want to update some of the carpets and furnishings. We found the bed comfortable and the room amenities very nice. Yes, there was a coffee maker with excellent Puerto Rican coffee! We would recommend the food at Stingray if you like seafood. We also ate at the bar at the marina. The food was fine, and the service excellent. The restaurant on Palomino Island had similar food and fine service, as well. Prices at Stingray were similar to NYC restaurants - dinner for 4 came to about $200. with drinks. Prices at the bar are about half that. We saved money on breakfast by stocking up on OJ, cereal and milk, and then running up to Starbucks for our coffee. To sum up, the El Con is a stunning property with excellent service. You will pay "resort" prices, but considering the beautiful landscaping and view, they are worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “straight forward experience”
Reviews.Author: travel99boston
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews on here before picking a hotel. No hotel in Puerto Rico got consistently strong reviews, all seemed to have a hot/cold phenomenon taking place. Some folks loved each resort, others had horrible experiences. So, I took comfort in the fact we were visiting in mid Feb when it's not Christmas. I think that was key as the hotel was not ridiculously busy (though it seemed plenty busy.) We were able to snag chairs at the pool or at the beach by arriving early. This is not the place to casually saunter to the beach/pool at 11 a.m and expect to find many places to plop down. I think if this was Christmas week, we'd have to be on the first boat to the beach area to get the location and chairs we wanted. And even then it might be problematic. As it was, we took the 9:30 boat (first one leaves at 9), and we were fine, but the free umbrellas were taken so we rented one. At the beach, watch out for the coral when you swim, both my kids cut their feet and needed first aid attention despite the fact they wore flip flops (best to wear water shoes, truly.) For the pool, we got there at 10 a.m, and were fine, but by 11, most chairs were taken. The food was good, we actually liked the buffet place near the pool the best (it had the most local authentic cuisine). Service pool side was fine and tasty and appropriately hot or cold depending on the item. The restaurant at the beach was also nice, we waited a bit for our food, but got there before noon and were able to get a table. My guess is that the wait can be ugly during super busy weeks. The Italian place for dinner in the main complex was really average, and one of the most ridiculously expensive restaurants. Best to avoid that restaurant unless pasta is like oxygen for you. Every time I saw a small army manicuring the lawns, I realized that the inflated prices help keep the place looking nice. Thanks to trip advisor, we rented our car from Enterprise, and were able to park for free in the Entreprise lot on site. The weather made our experience. It was just wonderful. Thanks again to Trip Advisor, we didn't get a room that faces the funicular. It would be beyond unbearable to have a room adjacent to that thing. (There is a huge counterweight that makes a lot of noise.) We never had to wait for the funicular, so lines were not an issue for us (maybe once we had to wait, but nothing like what some folks seem to experience in prior posts. ) Best to put your rush hour thinking cap into action....in the late afternoon, as beachgoers return and line up for the funicular, it was busy. Just make sure you're not in a rush at that time of day. Vice versa for going down in the morning. Overall the staff was pleasant. We had a problem with our TV and our air conditioner upon checkin, and we had the engineering folks in our room within 25 minutes to fix both. Then we didn't have a hair dryer and within an hour someone from housekeeping brought one (our room was in the marina, so it was a bit of a hike from the main building.) We tried to tip the engineering staff and they refused. That was pleasant. Overall, we found everyone very attentive, very pleasant, and although the resort was busy, service was under control. I think for holiday weeks, it is likely more of a struggle to feel relaxed, as it's just so busy, and if we had to wait for that funicular, it would have certainly detracted from our stay. Overall, I would return, as it's easy to visit. and easy to get around. Roads easy to navigate (we used the iphone map application to get to the resort from the airport...but there is a new road, route 66 that is not yet on any satellite instruments (but it's on the rental car map, be sure to get one of those.) Flights easy. Also, when you leave PR, your bags get checked for fruit/vegetables, so if you have a prized apple or bag of mangoes, eat them before you get to the airport. They took all our fruit that I had meant for airplane snacks thanks to some nifty machines that sniff it out rather effectively.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: perfectvacay1
Reviews.Content: just got back from holiday with the family and the trip was truly disappointing. the website makes the hotel and resort look so inviting but we were fooled. yes the location is spectacular and the pools fun for the kids but that's about it. the food was awful, the staff unfriendly and at times rude. we had to wait for everything from eating to asking concierge a question and although staff was around no one approached to help. everything was expensive and we don't mind paying if only things were worth paying for like a great dinner with the family that didn't involve attitude and microwaved food. we were suppose to stay till the end of the week but it was really not worth the time or the money and so cut our so called vacation short. we only get a few vacations a year and really wanted to make this one a special one but like I said it was nothing but disappointing....

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: MPickhouse
Reviews.Content: We just came back from El Conquistador Resort in Puerto Rico and I just felt I had to write. We had a wonderful time and it was one of the best vacations ever. It was a great place for kids which made my life easier. The water park is wonderful for kids of all ages. At first we were disappointed that their was a marina and no beach, but then we found out the hotel had a ferry to their own private island which is pristine. No need to pack a picnic, the island has shops, food, drinks and waiter service and activities like horseback riding on the sand, jet skiing, snorkeling, etc. I did not have to entertain my kids. We rented a car and went out one night for dinner, but decided I liked the resort so much that we ate on premises the rest of our stay. It is a bit pricey, but well worth it. I have no complaints, just raves about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good outweighs the bad!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica7619
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel! Yea, prices are high and service is slow and not what it should be, but the grounds and the amenities are something to see. We were upgraded to a ocean view room in Las Brisas. The view was amazing, the room was nice, but cleanliness not quite up to par. We rented a car and drove to the hotel from the airport and were never told when making the reservation for the room that if you rent a car from Enterprise you do NOT have to pay the daily parking fee of $16.05 (wow!)......so be advised. When we expressed our displeasure with the hotel staff never making this clear we got an "oh well" response. We tried the Cafe Caribe for food and were not impressed, maybe the price tag has something to do with that. But we went off property for dinner the next night--Calizo Seafood--excellent! And just moments away from the hotel. Breakfast was included in our stay at Las Brisas restaurant and it was wonderful! Huge selection and amazing views! The funicular and Palomino ferry were very accesible and readily available. Will go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, High Prices, but Worth the Trip”
Reviews.Author: spinner24
Reviews.Content: Just came back from this Resort travelling for 4 days with my 80 year old mother and two teenage boys. Overall, loved the resort and all it had to offer. We stayed in Las Olas in the middle section. Wanted a cot, but they wouldn't give us one because we had 2 queen beds, so my sons had to switch sleeping on the floor. No car, so we had to eat all our meals on-site. Took the shuttle to and from the resort. The rooms were very big and balcony was generous size with great views of the pool, ocean and Palomino Island. Pros: staff was extremely friendly (some of the best in all of our travels), upper pools were crowded, but ours at Las Olas was not and is available to all hotel guests; island was very cool, even my mother travelled the funicular and all the walking that was needed; was a little rocky with coral, etc. so make sure you and kids have water shoes; snorkelling was ok if you can get out far enough, too murky close to the shore; funicular was easy to use and not long waits; we caught the catamaran every time to and fro the island with no wait or long lines; no car so eating at resort was very expensive. Cons: mini-frig didn't work when we checked in, then it took 2 days to get a new one. That one didn't work either. I filled an ice bag and stuck that in the frig. It kept it cold for rest of the stay. A little dirty......carpets need to be cleaned in the hallways. Room was clean, but balcony should have been rinsed off with a hose. Dirt and funk over most of it, couldn't really walk on it barefoot. Food was VERY expensive and drinks, but i expected this. Better for me than renting a car and trying to find some local joint to take everyone. At checkout, they didn't tally up my bill because they said charges were still coming in?? I still don't know what my final bill was and from what i am seeing on my card charges coming in today, it looks pretty screwed up. SUGGESTIONS - if you have kids, stay away from the "reservation only " more expensive restaurants. Food is not great there anyway. I had the best luck with casual restaranut at the Marina and casual restaurant and bar by the pool at the top. Also, bring you own wine in your check-in baggage. It saves a fortune!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs, Filthy, Terrible Management, Over Charged. Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: partnesr1407
Reviews.Content: I feel like the title says it all. I have traveled the world and never have I ever seen anything like this. We checked in early in the morning and the hotel without even mentioning charged us for the previous night. Our room was absolutely filthy and ants were all over the nightstand after we complained they switched us to another room which seemed nice. When we woke up in the morning I was covered in what I was told by the font desk as mosquito bite. The bites got worst and worst and when I got home I learned it was bed bugs and the hotel has a problem with them. 3 other people we spoke to experienced the same thing and were also told it was mosquito bites. After I called to complain they told me that the hotel doctor has to examine me, nice to learn when I already am back home. Also, this is something they could have mentioned when I complained several times to the front desk, at one point front desk even gave be bug spray and played it off as something very common. They informed me that they will fax me a form the following day so I can document the incident. As the woman tried to get off the phone with me she did not even ask what room I was in so they can inspect the room and clean it for the next guest. After I asked her if she wants to know my room number she said "oh I'm sorry what room were you in." Every guest I spoke to traveling with us for a wedding had extra charges on their bill, we had 3 breakfasts charged in one day, another couple had a $400 transportation charge, someone else had 5 breakfast in one day. On top of all the overcharges I looked at my credit card bill and they processed an extra $100 on my credit card. Still not clue why. The Waldorf Astoria brand should be embarrassed to have their name associated with this hotel. It's extremely unfortunate as the facilities are decent. Something else I found really cute is they charging for everything. Weather you use a bellhop or not checking in or out the hotel will still charge you a $20 fee plus tax. In addition, to that there is a $3 cleaning fee plus tax and if you even consider room service well you have to wait an hour. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids but a really bad beach”
Reviews.Author: Tiranga
Reviews.Content: Not a value destination but lots of activities for kids. It is a good resort to simply park, enjoy the weather and relax with kids but you'll be disappointed if you were looking for a great beach as well. From the chairs, the service, and the beach itself, it was nowhere near the standard we expected it to be from this resort. My kids love the water but could not venture into the beach because of the dirty weeds and stones and corals which hurt our feet a lot. So avoid if you love taking a dip in the beach. Albeit, the water temperature was great. Food was pricey as expected and restaurants were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NatashaP-M
Reviews.Content: The Red Door spa was the BEST! Hotel has a water park, golf course and marina. Beautiful views and really nice employees. The sushi in the Japanese/Chinese restaurant was outstanding! Would love to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to Spend All of Your Time Waiting”
Reviews.Author: JadieR
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel - it's absolutely gorgeous and the scenery and views are amazing. But it's such a frustrating experience I seriously can't see myself going back. The biggest problem is that you will wait for EVERYTHING. Checking in took about 30 minutes because of the line. Getting a bellhop to bring my bags (wasn't given the option of taking them myself), another 35 minutes. Waiting for elevators, waiting for the funicular (usually about 5-10 minutes), waiting for the water taxi to the island. The waiting for breakfast was unbelievable - the Las Brissas had about 30 people in line JUST to put your name on a list, and other restaurants were closed after 10 am (I was turned away at 10:03 - sorry, I was waiting for elevators and the funicular). Call the front desk? Be put on hold for 10 minutes. You spend so much time waiting you barely have time to enjoy the place. The other problem is that as a solo traveler you're pretty much invisible. The staff is friendly when they DO notice you, but if you don't have 3 children with you prepare to be ignored by the staff. That is, if you're not being hit on. My first day one of the male members of the staff decided to interrogate me about why I came alone and then suggested that he and I could "have some fun together." UGH. I just wanted to have a relaxing weekend and this is what I have to deal with? I don't think I'll come back here. It's a shame - it really is a beautiful place but there are insufficient staff/facilities for the number of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn style, Waldorf-Astoria prices”
Reviews.Author: mikevwguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled here on a last minute getaway for a week. Upon arriving there was a wait because our room in the Las Olas section was not ready yet. After about an hour wait we were taken to our room. The room had been hastily cleaned, but there were old cheese puffs under the TV stand and stains on the carpet. I complained and we were moved to another room in the Marina section, which was cleaner but not what I would call immaculate. The furniture is cheap and crookedly put together, and the carpet reminds me of a seedy Econo Lodge I once stayed at in Cleveland. The Palomino Island is visually striking, but the beach itself is largely strewn with very sharp coral which makes swimming a rather painful experience. The restaurants here are average in every aspect except for their prices, which are shamefully high. Expect to pay at least $20 for a simple hamburger and fries at lunch, and $40+ for a dinner entree at any of their on site restaurants. Neither the food quality nor the atmosphere justifies these prices. Same goes for any of the on-site sundries, where they charge $3.75 plus tax for a 20oz bottle of water. For half the price this would be a reasonably decent hotel, but this is by no means a luxury resort. No activities whatsoever are covered by the "Resort Service Fee" that is tacked onto the bill, and like many other reviewers, I do not know what exactly this is supposed to cover. The extent to which guests are nickled and dimed here leaves a bad taste in my mouth and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Frances70NewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a sales meeting. Two individuals in our group had to have their rooms fumigated due to bed bugs! I'm back home now and waiting for someone to assess my apartment because I may have brought them home with me! This hotel does not deserve the Waldorf Astoria brand name.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect vacation/business destination”
Reviews.Author: northdakotamom
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the El Con for business but went early for some rest. It is a huge property and it seemed quite empty, even when our whole group was there. I had read mixed reviews but am always on the positive side so I wasn't worried. We upgraded to an ocean view room in the number four section and were right in the thick of it all. No balcony but the view was wonderful. We had a fridge and bought pop and beer at WalMart because this is NOT an all inclusive resort and the drinks were spendy. The cab ride is about 40 round trip but saved it in a cooler and our own snacks/drinks. The private beach is wonderful and the spa is top notch...Food is great, too, but we did eat out and met locals who gave us suggestions regarding where to eat, tour, etc...We ended up relaxing on the beach or by the pool but did meet a wonderful fellow from the University who took us up into the mountains for a traditional Puerto Rican day with the locals. It was charming and the authentic rice, beans and pork were wonderful. I think Puerto Rico is beautiful and although the resort is spendy and I only saw our room, (which really the only blemish was that the bathroom needed updating) and I would have loved a deck...I would recommend the resort/property with so many pools, a casino, lots of restaurant choices and really nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria Group should be ashamed!”
Reviews.Author: mckan514w
Reviews.Content: First off the good: The property itself was BEAUTIFUL, the views, pools, island etc... were all gorgeous and it was very relaxing... and the beds were COMFORTABLE... but that's about it for the good. THE BAD-- the place and rooms were FILTHY! Our room was disgusting. The floors and tiles looked like they had not been cleaned in years. I do not think our sheets were EVER WASHED in the 5 nights we were there (they had a sign saying they washed sheets every three days due to "wanting to be 'green and environmental'" unless you left a note saying otherwise, we did, and they still were not washed (even every 3 days)-- there were no bathrobes in room, and all around some Hampton Inns are better rooms. Service was SLOW SLOW SLOW-- room service for a pot of coffee took 2 HOURS! and again with the filth, the pot was NEVER REMOVED from our room... it just sat there for 3 days. NICKLED AND DIMED! everything cost money... I expect to spend money at a resort like this but honestly every activity had some fee attached to it, I still can not figure out what our "resort fee" covered, except for the privillage of staying there. The Ritz San Juan also charges a resort fee, but with that you get use of all the amenities... here... nada! Food-- Food was mediocre at best, awful at worst, and despite numerous restaurants on site, they all seemed to have the same menu. Bottom line, if you do not care about anything other than a beautiful view and a relaxing time this is your place... but if you want a really nice resort atmosphere Stay away and head to one of the other upscale and much finer resorts in the area like the El San Juan or Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely out-dated and boring.”
Reviews.Author: Jenna181
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that I was very excited to get here. However, we lasted ONE night and went right to the Ritz Carlton in San Juan. This hotel is outdated, old, and the rooms are just boring. It looks like someone went to ikea and updated desks and beds with garbage! and although the palomino island is nice, its a FULL DAY excursion to get a damn tan. who wants to wait 1 hour for a boat just to go to the beach, and the beach seems nothing like a resort beach. what a joke of a place. i'm shocked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but prepared to be nickel and dimed.”
Reviews.Author: bdelsavio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 children, aged 6 and 8, spent a week here while we were at a conference. The property was beautifully situated on a cliff overlooking the water. Rooms were certainly nice, but I wouldn't call it luxurious. The staff was wonderful and friendly. My one beef with the hotel is that they charge you for everything! Transportation back and forth from the airport was almost $300 for all of us (their bus is slightly cheaper than a taxi). The waterpark, which is ONSITE and available only for guests, is $20/person/day. There is a mandatory "resort fee" of around $50 tacked on to your bill each day, and also a "maid fee" and a "luggage fee"....you see where this is going? It became somewhat ridiculous and that is the one reason I would never go back. Food is also crazily expensive ($15 for a hamburger), but that isn't any different than other high end resorts. As long as you know you will be charged to sneeze at this resort, it is otherwise lovely and charming, with plenty for kids and adults to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Treat - but not sure how I would feel if paying out of pocket.”
Reviews.Author: Ckthomas00
Reviews.Content: My husband won a work trip to the El Conquistador in April 2009. Therefore, we didn't have to pay anything out of pocket. Our ocean view room was paid for, all meals, etc. With that in mind, here's my review: Rooms - very nicely decorated...although I could see they were starting to show some wear. Nothing a good paint job and some scrubbing couldn't handle (ex: big marks on the wall, looks like blood or pizza sauce on the couch, etc.). The bed was extremely comfortable and I really liked the bathroom. The rooms were kept very clean. Grounds - the view and grounds were absolutely gorgeous. I loved walking around or taking the trolley car because the views were spectacle! Its a pretty far walk to a lot of the amenities, but the view makes them worthwile. Food - good, but the prices looked to be very expensive. Same with drinks. Beach - we LOVED the ferry and the beach. Gorgeous and there were plenty of sun chairs for everyone.
