The carpets in the hallways where dirty, the rooms smells, my room was full of ants and my daughthers room the bathtub was clogged. We ask to be moved the next morning, they assigned a room to my daughter Saturday morning and took 7 hours and four visits to the reception front desk in order to moved us to another room. Monday our rooms were never made, they came around 5;30 to clean the room while we were there, we just ask for towels. The excuse was that they had alot of checkouts. I don't understand because the hotel was empty by Monday afternoon. Elevators don't work most of the time and were dirty. I am a frequent traveler and a Hilton Honors member and this hotel is not a 5 star hotel . Thank god we got this thru a package, I wouldn't pay more than $129.00 a night for this hotel. If you travel to this hotel be sure not to stay in Las Olas Building. On the other hand, this Hotel have magnificient views and the private beach is beautifull, it is ashamed that the building are so poor maintain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Puerto Rico Resort”
Reviews.Author: DallasTX_Angel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El Con. in June of 2009 with two of my girlfriends for tropical getaway. This resort lived up to everyone of our expectations! We booked a Garden view room to save money and I feel we got much more than we paid for! Though it faced the back "garden" part of the hotel, we could actually see part of the ocean from our huge balcony! There is no beach directly located on the resort, but the El Conquistador holds access to it's own private island,only for resort guests. Palomino Island is only a 5 min ferry ride from the resort, it's powder white sand beaches, snorkeling & scuba activities , and cabana boy drink service made this an excellent first day retreat. Before I got there I was a bit bummed to find out that I wouldn't be able to walk straight out to the beach from my hotel, but this island makes it all worth it. Since it is private to El Con only it feels like you are on your own private beach resort. There are just enough people to take care of you, and just as few people to bother you and make you feel like you're at a crowded hotel. There are also scuba and snorkeling excursions you can do right from the island. It was perfect. The second day there we were a bit disappointed it was raining all day, but no worries- we all thought it best to have a spa day at the Golden Door Spa, part of the resort. I enjoyed the Pineapple Body Bliss treatment. One of the lesser expensive full body treatments, i was still able to experience the full luxury of the spa, and relax with a head to toe body scrub and massage. It left me smooth and silky for the rest of my trip. One day we made a trip up to El Yunque Rainforest. Only about a 30 min drive from the resort. What a beautiful place! It was a bit crowded with lots of people on the trails. But we were able to find a secluded waterfall along the way. We had to scale some slippery rocks to get there, but a few bumps ad bruises were well worth it to have that spot all to ourselves. Another excursion that I HIGHLY recommend is the bioluminescent bay tours! We walked down the Fajardo coast from the resort to see if we could hop on to one of the Bio-Bay tours. I had read so much about this natural phenomenon I was so excited to actually experience it for myself. This glowing natural wonder only occurs in 5 remote lagoons in the world! Puerto Rico is host to 3 of them. It was only a 5 min walk from the El Con resort, and once we got there it was easy to find a tour that we could hop on to (there are many ways to make reservations for the tours online, but we took a chance it it was very easy for the 3 of us to squeeze on to one of the trips). Once it's dark enough outside, they begin to take groups of about 10 two person kayaks at a time out to the lagoon. The experience of seeing the glowing water is absolutely breathtaking!!! For more pictures you can visit my flickr gallery: http://www.flickr.com/photos/amondragon/sets/72157605816316395/

Reviews.Title: “A refuge on the edge of the Ocean.”
Reviews.Author: MaspethMaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Con for four nights in the week preceding labor day. My spouse booked the trip on his own and I had many doubts and was apprehensive after having ready so many negative reviews here and on other sites. Our experience is based on two adults on a relaxing retreat on a moderate budget. We booked through a discount travel agency, so we got a very good rate and avoided paying the 14% resort tax because it was included in our package. We opted to rent a car so that we would have more mobility for excursions and meals off resort. After car rental and self parking, the cost of having a car was about $50 more than having taken the shuttle from the airport that the hotel runs (and charges you per-person for). The self parking lot has attendants and a shuttle or golf cart to take you to the main hotel. Sometimes there was a wait but it was usually no more than 10 minutes. In the meantime you can enjoy the views of the golf course, the mountains and El Yunque, and the lighthouse and grounds of the nature preserve Las Cabezas de San Juan. Since we arrived on a Tuesday during the off season, there was a very low occupancy rate and a we were given a free upgrade to an Ocean View room. This was a nice surprise, considering there was a convention going on at the time. Garden View would have been fine, since the grounds are very pretty, but Ocean View was fantastic since you got to see the sunrise over Culebra, Palomino Island and the nearby cays. Different levels of the resort are accessible via the funicular. We found it to be charming and a nice way to take in the views of the property, which ranges from just above sea level to 300 feet above sea level. We stayed on the 6th floor of the La Vista wing of the hotel. This afforded us views of Palomino, the cays of the cordillera, Laguna Grande, and the coastal towns. This was a perfect spot for watching the sunrise. Rooms were spacious and neat, with low modernist furniture. Some furniture was discolored and could use some careful cleaning. Some repairs were also needed in common areas of the hotel guest floors. Some of the issues were simply routine maintenance due to exposure to extreme temperatures and weather variations. Many areas looked to be in the midst of the repair process. A few of the elevators needed attention. One of the panoramic elevators in the las Brisas wing was under repair. Being up so high gave us stunning views of the sea, the full moon and stars, and the wall of rain that would envelop the surrounding islands. It is amazing to watch a storm approach like this. It could be raining ten feet away from where you are standing and you won't get wet until the cloud heads right to you. Water pressure in baths was good, bath drainage was not the best. It is further impeded by the type of in-drain tub stopper that is used in tubs. The force of water from the faucet is enough to partially depress the stopper, making efficient shower drainage difficult. It took me until my last day at the hotel to realize this was the root of the drainage problems. Clothing closets were large with many hangers. I experienced no problems with housekeeping/towel service and was generally pleased by their service to us. The pools are lovely, and when there is sun, the waters are warm all night. Night swimming here is really, really nice. There are no lifeguards, however, and it is swim at own risk. The pools are all fairly shallow, 3'6" or 1.1 meters in most places. There are several jaccuzzis, a few have ocean views. For night swimming there are no towels or attendants, so no poolside food or beverage service. The waterpark is nice, and has an infinity pool. Guests of las casitas have a private infinity pool just for their use. Guests of El Con only have access to this one (for a fee). The pools and slides were fun, and are scarier than they look if you are not careful. I took a couple of spills in the pool and was pretty banged up the next day. Again, there are no lifeguards, just attendants who occasionally were more interested in text messaging than in overseeing the water park activity, but that is typical for any amusement park. The Marina is being renovated in on area, so there is some construction noise and jackhammering. Since it was low occupancy season, it appears not many guests were staying there. The ferry to Palomino was lovely and it is a fast trip. Posting the departure and arrival times would have been helpful. Palomino Island is very pretty. The water at beachfront immediately near the ferry dock is clear, calm and not rocky. There are some dark patches of seaweed, which was soft like wet grass. You can walk out pretty far and be in up to about 4.5 feet. Swimming areas are cordoned off. The rocky areas of the beach are on the island's southern shore, and what you think are rocks are mostly damaged dead coral. This part of the beach makes from some more interesting snorkeling than comfortable swimming. There are marina and beach activities available through the hotel's marina desk as well as La Casa del Mar Dive center. They had decent prices, pretty competitive considering they are conveniently located at the hotel grounds. Since we were there during the off season, we were affected by a tropical storm. During storms, the Coast Guard regulates which off islands are open/closed. The CG issued a probition on passage to the island and to any of the cays for the last two days we were there. This cancelled our plans for further trips to the beach or on snorkeling excursions. We should have planned better for rainy day activities. In general, restaurants and food were very expensive. Rooms have a bar area and a refrigerator, but no coffee maker, which was annoying. Breakfast on resort is pricey, especially the breakfast buffet at the Las Brisas, which we did not get. Some packages include breakfast. Ours did not. We relied on Starbucks or waited to go off resort. At the end of Avenida Conquistador, on route 3, is El Meson Sandwiches, which serves good breakfast and great coffee. It is a reliable and tasty quick service cafe. Kind of like a diner, but with a more limited menu. For dinners we liked Tasca Ole Lelolai and Pasion por el Fogon in Fajardo, on route 987. We mostly skipped lunch or grabbed a little something from a roadside kiosk. The casino has a preponderance of slot machines. I will leave it at that. In bad/stormy weather, it is closed per government regulation. The Golden Door Spa is very, very nice, and during the off season has daily specials. The niwa/shower and bathing areas were clean and well lit, and the bathing products were luxurious. Tea rooms in the spa were well appointed, and staff was kind, professional and discreet. It is closed on Mondays. Overall this was a great trip. We felt like we were the only ones there most of the time. Business picked up toward the weekend and it was much more busy. El Con staff were friendly and helpful. I'd love to go back and spend more time at the beach and out on the cays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent renovations, 2nd time back and can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: esk10024
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my 2nd stay at El Conquistador and it was even better this time around. The first time I went there, it was a Wyndham and the rooms were dingy and in need of an upgrade. Regardless of the rooms, El Con is special because it has its own private island and this is the one, if only reason, to return. I did just that and was excited to see that the resort underwent a hundred-something million dollar renovation and I could definitely tell. CHECK-IN / ROOMS / SECURITY: The renovated rooms are now modern, simple, and elegantly designed. The staff was noticeably more attentive and courteous. Upon arrival, the line to check in was long but it is expected as it was a Friday and there were 5 front desk attendants checking in all the guests. I had reserved a single non-smoking king room and when the front desk realized they didn't have this on file, they arranged it so that we not only received a non-smoking king, but it was full ocean view. Our room was by the harbour and I found it to be beneficial because we did go to Palomino Island, the resort's private island, every day that we were there. The first night I was there, I noticed that the ice machine on my floor was broken so I was wandering around looking for another one. I went to another floor and immediately a security guard came up to me and mentioned that he watched me going from ice machine to ice machine and even escorted me and held an additional bag of ice that he insisted on bringing back to my room. It was a nice feeling that for a resort so large, security was able to spot one person out of several thousand. PALOMINO ISLAND: Palomino Island is spectacular and even if the hotel was a Super 8, I would still go back for the island alone. Yes, many people have suggest bringing acqua socks but I found that my flip flops worked just fine. It is about $25 to rent a full snorkel set on Palomino but I suggest purchasing your own prior to your trip. My entire set (mask/snorkel/fins) cost about $30 on Amazon and that's fine for someone like myself that uses it 1-2 times a year. We swam to Palominito, the mini island off of Palomino, a couple times and it is definitely worth it if you want to feel a sense of accomplishment. It's not close but is an enjoyable swim. FOOD: We rented a car from San Juan so we did not eat at the resort for the most part. It is overpriced so we did some light grocery shopping and packed sandwiches when we went to Palomino Island and ate dinner off-site. Palomino Island does have a no food/ no drink policy but during the summer I found it to be lax - no one stopped us from bringing food onto Palomino. I'm assuming that this policy is probably enforced during the peak season. We ate at some wonderful surround restaurants such as La Estacion and Calizo Seafood and the seafood at both restaurants is impeccable. CONS: If there was anything to complain about I would say that the on-site restaurants are overpriced for what they are and the housekeeping was a bit weak. I'm not a huge stickler on this but when we arrived, there was no shampoo or face towels in the room so I had to call the front desk about it. I thought that maybe they didn't provide but it was made clear that they did so these items were immediately brought to my room. My toiletries were not replenished for a few days after my arrival so I had to call the front desk again to bring shampoo, conditioner, body wash, etc. to my room. I thought that maybe it was an environmental thing but I guess housekeeping isn't that attentive even when you tip well. One last note - the sofa in the rooms is made out of a weird outdoor material so it may not feel suitable for indoors. Perhaps it's because most people are wet when they come back to their rooms? On a whole, El Con is even more pleasurable as a RItz and I can't wait to go back. My suggestions: rent a car, relax on Palomino, bring your own snorkel gear, and just enjoy what the island offers you.

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: shopahollic
Reviews.Content: its really beautiful.i love coqui waterpark and the coqui frogs make such a cute noise.its cheap for what you get.las brisas breakfast buffet is fantastic.piron and tony are the best servers.palomino is the best beach i have been to i should know i live in trinidad

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: PhilaPhil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our two sons (20 & 27) stayed for 5 nights and had a great time. We had two rooms so it wasn't cramped. The staff was great. The food & drinks are a little expensive but this isn't a budget resort. The golf course is excellent but was being aerated so we only played once. Well worth it but very humid when down in the valleys away from the breeze. The elevations are amazing. The water park is nice - go after 2 p.m., it's half price. Only a few rides, so unless you have young kids, you won't spend more than a few hours any way. The private island beaches are great, but make a reservation for the waverunners before you go out there or you may get shut out. You can't just walk up and rent one. Unless you're an avid snorkeler, take the half day tour on a motorboat rather than the all day on the catamaran. You can walk to the kayaking tour in the bioluminescent bay. Take the early tour, it'll be dark by the time you get to the bay. Otherwise you're kayaking both ways in the dark through a mangrove swamp. You're in the kayak for 2.5 - 3 hours and there are no lights except glowsticks on the kayaks. Pictures don't work, so don't bring a camera unless it's really expensive and takes really low light pictures in which case you probably don't want it in a wet kayak. The boys went ziplining through the rainforest, about 20 minutes away and loved it. The only downside is San Juan is a good hour's drive and the radiotelescope at Arecibo and the caves around there are a good two hour drive. The casino isn't very big and only has a few game tables, but they weren't crowded when we were there. The drinking age is 18, so we had our first legal drink with our youngest son. They also don't have daylight savings time, so they're an hour ahead of EST but the same as EDT.

Reviews.Title: “2-3 Star at Best”
Reviews.Author: cmflay
Reviews.Content: This hotel boasts a 5 star rating and I just don't see it. I've been fortunate to have stayed at 5 star hotel and resorts and this does not even come close. The service is a 2-3. Not very friendly, lazy and as if they are doing you the favor. The overall maintenance of the facilities is poor. Garbage urns take days to be emptied, rooms are not so clean, just straightened up, turn down service is inconsistent. Palomino island is a nice but you cannot swim without stepping on rocks. The beach has maybe 1 waitress/waiter serving cocktails. When you go to the bar yourself, they are more interested in talking to other employees than waiting on you. There is no night life other than the casino. The Bioluminecence (sp) bay was awesome. DO NOT BOOK any excursion through the hotel as they more than double the costs. Go direct to the vendors. Restaurants were good, expensive. Service was the best at the Hibachi Restaurant. If you are expecting a 5 start experience you will not find it here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't EVER go to this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Luvbugsil1
Reviews.Content: The ONLY GOOD thing about this resort is that it is beautiful. However, as pretty as it is, it is still DIRTY. The cleaning staff only cleans the bathroom and gives you towels and that's if you're lucky. We had bugs in our room the first night and had to change rooms. The staff is very unfriendly and b/c gratuity is included in most things, they do not work harder for tips. They are extremely short-staffed! They boast about 20 restaurants and bars and none are open except 2 at a time. It is not a place for young people or couples b/c there is no nightlife. The resort is in the middle of nowhere so you have no place to go out at night. They do not even have activities for the kids. It is NOT all-inclusive, so you are FORCED to pay exorbitant prices for food, snacks, and beverages. You are an hour from San Juan, (the center/the airport) which is a $100 taxi ride into the city one way. As a result, you are confined to the hotel b/c anything beyond the resort before San Juan is so ghetto and scary, you would be lucky to make it out alive. It does not matter whether you are traveling alone, as a couple, with friends, or children, they do not cater to any groups and you will be bored and annoyed with the people. Basically, NEVER GO TO THIS RESORT!

Reviews.Title: “Place needs a good scrub”
Reviews.Author: meetingplannerinkc
Reviews.Content: Because this is a Waldorf-Astoria hotel I had high hopes for great service, cleanliness and overall resort experience. Needless to say, I had high expectations because I am in the travel industry. What I actually found was a place that once may have been great, but was now run down and in need of a good scrub. Our room was nasty and by the end of my shower I had water around my ankles. You know it's a bad place when you aren't sure if the towels that housekeeping puts out are dirty or clean! I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor before going and they were spot on. The pool was full of locals, the price of food outrageous and the spa EXTREMELY expensive. You are also stuck there unless you have a rental--not good.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanjuantraveller
Reviews.Content: Just spent four days at the El Conquistador Hotel. We had a beautiful view and the room and amenities were above expectations. We also enjoyed the beautiful buffet breakfast daily which have more than enough for breakfast. The omelete station was great and overall the service at this hotel including the Las Brisas and all restaurants and bars was excellent. The island for the beach for was also extraordinary. What a great hotel, the views, the little island for the beach and everything is highly recommended. Don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking, Beautiful, Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: itruitt
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days at this resort after leaving a terrible resort in Dorado, what a difference!! I actually cried when I arrived due to the beauty, scenery and location and the fact that our other hotel was such a disappointment. I had a good friend that I work with that use to live in Puerto Rico suggest that we stay at this hotel, I didnt book it for fear of the cost, but am so glad that we transferred. The room was reasonable in cost, but not much else on the resort property, very expensive to eat, but well, well worth every penny. So much to do you dont even have to leave the resort, and the private island was wonderful to do water sports and just hang on the beach. This resort has something for everyone of every age and size, and it was right next to El Yungue and BioBay tours. Anyway thinking of visiting Puerto Rico, do not stay anywhere else!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador - Very Nice Place But Has Flaws”
Reviews.Author: maxnilsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Conquistador for 4 nights - very, very nice place but not a five star. The ocean view room we had was incredible - the room they boast is newly remodeled which it is BUT the bathrooms are not! Our bathroom had broken tiles - embedded and worn dirty floor and the wall were in dire need of paint - a definite strike here. You see in other reviews about the high price restaurants - not true - if you have travelled the islands you will know EVERYTHING on islands are more expensive - this place is no different. The average meal came out about $40.00 for two of us - really not bad. Here is where I vent about the below average side of this place - first The Golden Door Spa - Now from one who has been in some of the best spa's in the world - this place cannot hold a candle to them - while very nice there is nothing extraordinary. I took advantage of the spa access and enjoyed a jacuzzi which was very nice and a steam room which seemed slightly neglected. Here is where they fall off the cliff - the first day I went to shower in the ladies shower - of the 4 stalls - 2 doors were broken and stayed open when showing and 3 of them had women's hair stuck all over the wall! I figured maybe they had not had a chance to clean them and would give them a break - on the 3 following days I visited the spa - the same hair was hanging off the walls! They never cleaned the shower stalls! Gross yes! Next strike- the Strip Steak House - we had visited the Blossom Restaurant the night before and nothing could have been better! Great food - Great Service! So we figure try our luck at the Strip House - we saw that they had the PR native dish Mofongo and we were anxious to try it. The place itself seemed nice - good atmosphere. So we asked the waitress about the Mofongo and she told us it was fabulous - so on her recommendation we ordered one seafood and one steak mofongo When it was delivered - the presentation very nice - but the food HORRIBLE! The steak was a pile of meat doused in Mojo and had the texture of shoe leather. The seafood mofongo was horrible as well - the plantains mixed with the way they do their plantain mash turned my stomach. We sent back the steak dish and dug our way through the awful seafood dish as we were hungry. The kicker here - the busy boy saw us send the dish back and snuck over to our table when the waitress left and told us to not judge this PR native dish on how their chef does it - that he has seen how it is cooked and it was nothing like the native dish should be made. He recommended we go to a restaurant a few miles away to try it. It was horrible and no one should ever order this dish they way their chef makes it - it is an insult to the native dish. Beside that the trip was great - beside these two things - the place itself is a great place and I would go back again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Truly paradise, breathtaking views, beautiful room and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: mimosa718
Reviews.Content: My family and I just arrived home from our trip to the El Con. I was very apprehensive after so many negative reviews and almost changed our plans because of them. We were very happy that we didnt. I can see where some of the complaints may have possibly come from but I have to say, you would really have to be looking for things to complain about. At least thats my opinion. I am well traveled person and appreciate finer things and have stayed at the top resorts all over the world. Having said that, I was very pleased with the the resort and its amenities. The staff is a little thin overall but the workers they do have are very accommodating and friendly. They should definately do more in the way of night life. We traveled with a 20, 17 and 16year old.At night there was absolutely nothing for them to do. We were surprised the resort never had a live band or music playing. Ther were no teen activities at night at all. Except for the casino and ice cream shop- nothing to do at all after the sun goes down. So -the room, we had a 2 bed room suite in the las Brisas part of the hotel. I recommend this area especially if you dont like to walk far to the main hotel, have small children and like the quite. Our room was beautiful and clean with breathtaking views from every terrace. The cleaning staff could have been better -but over all it was very clean. Turn down service has to be requested at least I had to. But it wasnt what I am accustomed to in the way of nightly service. They just basically give you fresh towels(if requested) and turn down your bed. Other than that(very minor) we loved being in our room and felt very comfortable as it was fresh and clean every day. The resturants- The Italian resturant- dont bother going - it was terrible, I mean really bad. The sauce was like ketchup and the pasta dishes had no taste. The fish was inedible as was the chicken parm. Strip house- was very good. Everyone liked their food. The dishes were nicely prepared and fresh. Blossoms- fun for the family at the Hibachi table- if you like meeting and sitting with other families. Otherwise you can request a private table.The food was nice and they serve sushi as well. Sting ray cafe- At the marina - we also enjoyed. The dishes were flavorful and the resturant was pretty. WHen going to palimino island, you def need water shoes. If you walk to the other side of the island the water is clearer. No one checked our bags or even asked us if we had drinks etc. THe ride over took about 8 mins and was so very enjoyable. We loved going there. The food was pricey and not so good but for beach food, it was ok.You can do water sports, horse back ride or look at the bunnies and iguanas. THe pool areas were all very nice and clean. There was pool service at the lower pool off the main pool. The water park was fun for our 4 year old and the adults did also enjoy the pools and water slides. Half a day begins at 2 and seriously, doing a half day is plenty. We went to the beach in the morning one day tand then to the water park at 2. It was great. On other days we went early and bought full day tickets. But we never stayed a full day. So if your looking to save a little(and it is helpful to try here) I recommend a half day at the water park. The marina village is adorable and off the beaten path. I would not like to stay ther bec. you have to take the finicular every time you want to go the the main hotel, resturants etc. Las Olas look nice but again, you had to take the finicular there and everytime you wanted to go to the main part of the hotel. I hope this review helps, please feel free to contact me as I do have a lot more I could have mentioned! My advice is to go if your considering it, ask for a newly revnovated, refreshened room and enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful, fun resort..we loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_IllinoisJjss
Reviews.Content: I still cant figure out why there are so many negative reviews about this resort-it was so amazing! This was by far the best trip of our lives! I almost changed our reservations after reading all the negative reviews about the ELCon but I am so glad that I didnt. We would have really been missing out! We took a lot of the advice here and applied it which made the trip run very smoothly. I highly recommend renting a car and getting groceries so that you can eat in your room for some of the meals. We actually never ate at the resort restaurants due to so many complaints here about the expense of the food there. We got groceries for breakfast that we ate in our room, we made sandwiches for lunch and took them to Palomino Island with us and then we went to a different restaurant every night in Fajardo for dinner. Dinners in Fajardo ran an average of $50 for 2 adults and 2 kids. There is excellent local "caribbean" food a LUquillo Beach and many other places right outside the resort. Palomino Island was by far the best part of the resort. We were able to walk out and snorkel right off the shore. It was gorgeous!!! Definantly bring water shoes as the water is rocky. We also went hiking on the trails at the island which had amazing views. My husband and the kids also kayaked to a small nearby island. As far as parking goes, we loved the valet parking. It was only $5 more per night, which I thought was a steal! We just walked up to get our car each time we wanted to leave and within 3 minutes they had it for us. Service-We thought the service was outstanding. Yes, overall things move slower but we found that to be true throughout all of Puerto Rico, not just at the resort. As Americans, we are just so used to going at a faster pace than they go in Puerto Rico. Everyone at the resort was so friendly and very accomodating. Right when we checked in I asked if it was possible to be upgraded to one of the Marina view rooms rather than a garden view. Sure enough, they upgraded us at no extra charge. The waterpark was a little boring for our 8 and 12 year old girls. That was probably the only slight disappointment that we experienced. Sights to see-El Yunque is a must! Climbing the waterfall was such a unique experience although the climb to get there and back is long. Bioluminescent Bay is also amazing...just make sure you know how to kayak (I didnt and it was hard!). Old San Juan was very interesting too. Overall, I would highly recommend the El Conquistador as a wonderful place to stay....also, we looked at our bill line by line and we had not been overcharged for a single thing!

Reviews.Title: “Parts of this hotel were breathtaking, others in need of repair”
Reviews.Author: Ellie1222
Reviews.Content: My review of this hotel is mixed. Their were areas of this hotel, like the outdoor lobby level pool area for instance, where the scenary was so breathtaking it compares to no other hotel, caribbean or otherwise, I have ever stayed at. The problem is, parts of the hotel are old and run down, and some areas completely abandoned and unmaintained. These areas are visable, and you are required to pass through while returning to and from your room. For the price it cost to stay at this particular hotel I found these eyesores unacceptable. If you can ignore this sides of the coin, I'm sure you'll enjoy your visit. The staff was exceptionally friendly, and as I mentioned before, portions of this resort were spectacular. I personally would not stay there again for the cost, but my husband and I did enjoy our anniversary stay there non the less.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and still learning the Hilton HHonors ropes”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveller60
Reviews.Content: The service was terrific and Jamie and the front desk was superb. Great service was also particularly noticed at the on site Italian restaurant, the Strip House, Blossoms and from the gal at the snorkel place at Palomino Island. There is still work to do on the Hilton HHonors programs and the benefits of being special to Diamond members. In their defense the resort had two huge meetings going on and one meeting was a 700 person trip with a principal shareholder of the Company's also being an owner of the resort. Our room in La Vista was very good and the resort is beautiful, El Yunque is a must and our 4 year old made the hike to the La Mina Falls. The kids really enjoyed the water park and the is a perfect spot to take kids. Puerto Ricans are very nice and friendly. We had the sense that resoirt folks realy prefer speaking English to US folks who speak English as a first language and folks in San Juan are more open to speaking Spanish to the same.

Reviews.Title: “do not! stay here”
Reviews.Author: timidtuna
Reviews.Content: staff and employees were wonderful. hotel was terrible. a total rip off. everything was way overpriced. restaurants terribly over priced for mediocre food. $21..00 a fday parking, 14.95 a day for internet access, if you do not have a car, you are captive. the beautiful beach on palomina iskand?? the fire ants eat you up, besides, i have seen nicer mudholes. good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: noodles37
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews about this hotel, I must admit I was a little skeptic. I'm glad I didn't pay attention to those reviews that spoke bad about the hotel and it's employees. My experience was the complete opposite. When checking in, yes the wait was a little long, but then again after waiting an 1 1/2 at Enterprise rental the wait was nothing. My husband who is a member of Hilton Honors, the service was impeccable. We originally had a garden view, because it was low season, we were put an Ocean View on the 6th floor for the same price. The view was beautiful, with our own personal balcony. The rooms were clean and extremely roomy, the bathroom was huge compared to many we have seen. We had an issue with the room phone and the refrigerator, when we called the front desk, they had someone in our room within 10 minutes to address the problem. It was resolved immediately. Remember this hotel is huge, so be prepared to do a lot of walking. Breakfast is expensive ($25 pp), but we got a package that included it and all we had to pay was the gratuity ($14). Go out of the hotel to eat dinner if money is an issue, since that could be expensive as well. The Coqui Water Park was also included in our package, our kids loved the slides, especially because the wait was short. The lazy river was my thing. Palomino island was a beautiful beach, with white sand and clear blue water. Make sure you have sunblock on, especially if you sit on the top floor of the boat that takes you to the island. We didn't have any on, and we got burned and still suffering the consequences of it. I highly recommend the Bio-bay Kayak excursion. We had so much fun, the captain Andres was incredible and so were his associates. Looking forward to doing it again soon. The Conquistador was the highlight of our vacation. Granted we only stayed there for 3 days but well worth it. The rest of our time was spent throughout the island. So please if you are considering staying at the Conquistador, go and judge for yourself. I hope you love it as much as my family and I did.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: love2bead
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever had. We arrived at 4:30pm. Check in is suppose to be 4:00. There was no room ready for us. We had reserved two beds. At check in we were informed that there was not a room available with 2 beds but they would give us a blow up bed. We told them that this was not acceptable to us so we waited an hour for a room to become available with two beds. When we got to the room there was a huge leak in the ceiling and water all over the floor. I called from the hotel room and asked for the manager, I was put on hold for over a half an hour and no one ever came to the phone. My husband also calle from his cell phone and was disconnected after 10 minutes. Called back and walked back up to the lobby, the manager said he would work on getting us a room. We did not get a room until 7:30pm. You would think that during this time they would send maintenance over to fix the leak, this did not happen. They did upgrade us to a marina front room that was very nice, exluding the fact that from the balcony there was a stench of garbage. In addition to the poor service upon check in there is a problem with the funicular, it breaks down . At El Conquistador you spend way too much time waiting; the funicular, the ferry to the island (the only beach), the shuttle to the parking lot, just a waste of precious vacation time. Also the resort is in need of repairs. The carpet in the lobby is filthy dirty, there is actually a hole in the wall in the lobby that is open to the air from rotting wood. It is such a shame. My husband and I had been there about 10 years ago and it was a completely different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Activities, Rooms are OK”
Reviews.Author: Troy86
Reviews.Content: The El Conquistador is one of the oldest hotels in Puerto Rico, and because of that, the design of the rooms and the layout of the hotel are not up to modern standards. However, the rooms have been refurbished with modern furniture. If you expecting a 5 star experience, like the Waldorf in New York, you are going to be disappointed. After all, a 5 star hotel must have outstanding service on a consistent basis, which is non-existent in PR (things move in island time here, remember). This hotel has grown thru the years, so things are spread out and feel disjointed. Some public areas are in need of maintenance, around the funicular in particular. Parking is somewhat of a mess â€“ both self serve and valet. Now, if you expect a nice 4-star hotel, you should enjoy your stay here. The recreational facilities are excellent, especially if you have kids. My daughter has a great time at the pools, the water park, and Palomino island. There are many dining options, including some that will not break your budget. If you go to the fancy restaurants you will pay dearly, however, there is a cafeteria on the premises where prices are reasonable (food is not excellent, but you get what you pay for). Because the size of the hotel, the pools, water park and beach areas can get crowded, but if you get there right when open, you will have a couple of hours of relative quiet. You need a car if you want to move around the island or eat at restaurants outside the hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Large and beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: EPguy4
Reviews.Content: I have to say I'm very surprised by the number of negative reviews. My wife and I have not stayed in a lot fancy resorts like El Conquistador, so maybe our tastes are not discriminating enough, but we thought it was a fabulous place. There is plenty to do from swimming to horseback riding to water sports to a water park. The rooms are spacious and beautifully furnished. The location was beautiful and there is a large selection of restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. at the resort. We enjoyed watching the moon over the Caribbean from our balcony while a steel drum band performed below. In terms of the price, we paid the offseason rate in August and found that to be very fair. Coming from San Juan, Fajardo was a little out of the way, but given that we had just come from El Yuque rain forest, it wasn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: wasimata2
Reviews.Content: - Upon arrival, the line for the front desk was about 50 people long, and was comprised of both people checking in and checking out. - It took standing in line for 30 minutes for me to find out my room was not ready - I booked a one night stay thru AMEX FHR, which, if you are a member, entitles you to certain amenities, credits, etc., however I was not upgraded and had to educate the front desk agent on what was included. I actually asked her if she knew what the AMEX FHR package was and she said no. I went to eat lunch and came back at 5:30 PM; my room was still not ready (check in time published by the hotel was 4pm). The front desk agent said the room was clean but had not been inspected by a supervisor yet. - I wanted to go to the beach, however was told the hotel does not have a beach, but has a private island you can take a ferry to, only the last ferry to the island left at 3pm. How can a beach resort hotel stop letting people go to their beach at 3pm, when sunset is around 7pm? - The hotel's wireless internet has lots of defects; my room number and name did not match in the internet system. When I called the hotel operator to inquire they said it happens all the time and for me to use a generic login, which they provided. The internet was so slow it reminded me of when dialup internet first became available for your home PC. - I went to eat dinner at Striphouse, in the hotel. The restaurant was empty and was way too dark. The waiter was nice, but you could tell he was not a full-time waiter. There was no bartender and the waiters were making the drinks themselves. - I ordered my food and it came out quickly which was nice. The steak tasted strange, so I barely ate it. I also ordered a glass of wine and when it arrived it smelled and tasted stale, as if the bottle it came from had been opened a week or so ago. I did not drink the wine. The electricity also went out while I was eating. The generator took about 8 seconds to kick in, but the power going out was just another inconvenient surprise. - I left almost all my food and wine without eating it, and the waiter asked me if I wanted dessert, which I declined, but ordered an espresso. The waiter never brought the coffee, but brought me the check. - The next day housekeeping was knocking on my door at 9am despite the privacy sign. - I went to the ferry departure point at about noon to head to the beach. I stood in line for 15 minutes only to find out the guy before me was the last person they let on (boat was full). I waited another 30 minutes at the head of this new line, but the boat didn't come and I was so frustrated I decided to go to the pool. - Upon arrival at the pool, there were too many families with little kids, which is fine, but the parents did not control their kids and it made it inconvenient (not the hotel's fault, I understand). - There was a severe lack of pool servers, I was at the pool for 3 hours and no one asked me if I wanted anything to drink or eat. I would have ordered several beverages and lunch, so this was revenue loss for the hotel. - Upon returning to my room after the pool, my room key didn't work. I walked to the front desk and had to wait 20 minutes in line to have a new key made. The agent told me it didn't work because it was time for me to check out. I told her I had a guaranteed 4pm checkout with my booking, and she also had no idea what AMEX FHR was. - While showering the housekeeper knocked, again with the privacy sign on. When I said to please come back later she said "you need to check out" and closed the door. - I went to check out and again waited 20 minutes in line. I again had to argue about my $100 credit as part of the AMEX FHR booking, which I had to explain again. I will never stay here again, despite the hotel being reputed as being excellent and having 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: FFaiz
Reviews.Content: Overall the resort was okay. It was too big and impersonal. The service was nothing great.The most annoying part of the resort was that you had to take a boat to get to the beach and all in all this took about 30 minutes to get to and you had to get off the island at a certain time. The only plus of this hotel was that there were several good dining choices. It was overpriced and not worth the value at all.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't knock my Socks Off”
Reviews.Author: pgateacher
Reviews.Content: The resort is very big and not easy to get around - private isle beach is very nice...quality of the rooms was good but below expectation for the Waldorf Astoria brand...service at the resort was good for the islands, maid failed to do anything other than throw the comforter over the beds one day. Lots of people at the hotel and very loud on the weekend between rooms, I think there must have been 12 people sleeping in the room next door. Overall it was ok, but for the money it should be better quality and they should control the number of people that can be in a single room. Stayed next to the marina and the rooms could use a facelift, sub par materials for a waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding, superb. the best resort in all of the carribean”
Reviews.Author: mikieboy1
Reviews.Content: me husband and two children stood at el conquistador for 11 days, we rented a 1 bedroom villa and words cannot even describe the outstanding vacation we experienced. we travel 2x a year and this resort is #1. you feel like you are in paradise the villa was beautiful the service, people, food, was top-notice. do not book another vacation until you stay at el conquistador you would not be sorry, andrea vazquez

Reviews.Title: “DON'T Be Fooled!!”
Reviews.Author: twes
Reviews.Content: The rating of this resort is more like 2 star than 5 star. I would compare it to the Red Roof Inn. We were disgusted with the service, the overall appearance of the property. To sum it up, it was not at all worth the price and we were greatly disappointed with our stay. We ended up leaving Puerto Rico entirely after one night because we were so disgusted. The only beautiful was the view from our room. It took us about 45 minutes to check in, the lobby is completely outdated and the staff seemed exhausted and overworked. The door to our balchony was broken in our room and our linen's were horrible quality not to mention they were soiled, yes and I mean soiled! Our bathroom shower was not updated and the couches in the rooms are plastic. Needless to say we were soooo disappointed. Waldolf Astoria better do something because this property is in desperate need of a facelift!

Reviews.Title: “I will NEVER go there again!”
Reviews.Author: chickstein
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be filthy! At the end of the day I went to the pool bar and was standing in a puddle of water with cigarette butts, drinking cups and straws floating it it. The fountains had beer cans floating in them. The beach was not any better. It took moving three time to find a spot that was not covered in garbage. This is a Waldorf Astoria property? The inconsistencies aboud at the hotel. My friend was in the room next to mine and I received turn down service, she did not. She had a makeup mirror, I did not. I received shampoo, etc., my friend did not. Outrageous! Also, the walls in the room are paper thin. I heard my neighbors two rooms away fighting and the people in the room next to me arguing with their son for 30 minutes on whether or not he needed a bath. I awoke every night to the late night partyers returning to their rooms. At the end of my four day stay my bill was over $600 and my room charge was not included since I used points. I will never go back to this hotel again. As a Hilton Gold member, I am waiting on the survey I usually get asking about my experiences at this hotel. I can honestly say, I have had a better experience at a Hilton Garen Inn on 1-95 in Virginia (complete with truck noise), than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: BAMW
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at El Conquistador. The first was on our honeymoon 5 years ago. I think it was a bit better this time around. The resort was owned by Wynndam(sp?) the first time we stayed and now it is owned by Waldorf Astoria. The staff couldn't be nicer! We took advantage of the hotel deal going on for all of PR (I believe) where they give you a $200 credit, a $100 debit card and when you buy 3 nights, you get the 4th free. We also went through NWA's travel company and got an excellent package with airfare! I would highly recommend taking advantage of this offer this year! We had reserved a garden room and, upon check in, had received an up grade to an ocean view by the pools. The entire resort is beautiful! Being on the coast, I think the upkeep is pretty extensive. There were some parts of the resort that may have needed to be repainted, but nothing too severe. The room was nice. It was recently renovated, but needed some upkeep - worn light switches, needed some tile work in the bathroom, worn light fixtures in the bathroom, etc. But it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The best part about this resort is the private island - Palomino island! It's nice to go to a beach where there are only a few (50 or so) people around and it's not crowded. We got there early one day (9:30am) and basically had the beach to ourselves. My husband snorkeled while I lay on the beach under an umbrella and read. It was very relaxing! They have all kinds of water-type things to do on the beach - jet skis, catamarans, snorkel, etc. My only large complaint is the cost of eating at the resort. I understand they want you to pay for the convenience, but it's a little outrageous. We ate at the so-so japanese restaurant at the hibachi grill and our bill was $115 for two of the cheaper dinners, edamame and two beers. It was a lot more expensive than any other japanese restaurant I'v'e been too and it wasn't very good. The Italian restaurant was also pricey, but at least the food was very good. Some cost cutting measures we took this second trip - we rented a car (online before we left home) through Enterprise at the hotel and it was very cheep compared to walking up to the desk and renting a car when you got there. We went to the store (Wal-mart, Kmart, Sam's club, PitUSA, Costco are all near by) and bought water and beer to keep in our room's fridge. They charge about $6 per bottle of beer at the resort and you can get a six pack for about the same price. We ventured outside of the resort for dinner one night. L'estacion was right down the street from the resort (past the resort entrance about 1/4 mile) and I'd read lots of good reviews about the food there. However, we attempted to go there on a Wednesday night and they were closed. Also, the appearance of the outside of the restaurant (I believe all dining is outside too) did not look very nice. Maybe the food makes up for it. We never found out. We ate at Pasion restaurant which is the opposite way from L'estacion in relation to the resort. The car rental staff recommended it for dinner and it was excellent! They have mostly seafood, but some beef and chicken dishes. The service was also great! We also took the bioluminecent kayak tour which was highly recommended by people who had been to the resort. There are about 10 companies that offer the tour and we chose the one with the glass bottom kayaks. I would highly recommend taking this tour! It was $45 per person and the experience was worth the money! We were soaked when the tour was finished. So, make sure you wear clothes and shoes that you don't mind getting wet. There are signs on the way into the resort with phone numbers to call and reserve your spot for the kayak tour, you can look it up online before hand or you can just walk to the public beach which is a short walk down and to the left of the hotel - along the water. We will definitely go back - as long as there is a deal similar to the one we got for this trip. The normal prices for this hotel are out of our price range.

Reviews.Title: “First time to EL Conquistador - LOVED IT on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: abrahi
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before visiting and there are a few, very sensible and easy things one can do to save a few hundred dollars and enjoy this top notch resort. (A) rent a car instead of paying for the shuttle service. Yes, you have to pay to park at the resort, but not anywhere near what you would pay by taking the shuttle. Plus, guess what, you can drive to other places, like the rain forest, Old San Juan and other beaches, etc. at your leisure. Furthermore, on your drive to the resort, stop at the Walmart or any other of the hundred Walgreens or supermarkets you pass. Buy some zip locks, a loaf of bread, peanut butter and jelly and tunafish for lunches poolside or at the beach. No one checks your back pack or beach bag (it would be a different story if you blatantly brought a cooler filled with food and drinks). Oh yeah, another thing....if you don't want to pay an arm and leg for a beer/cocktail, buy alcohol at the thousand liquor stores you pass on your way to the resort. I had no problem shaking up my own martinis or having a brew. It felt great not to feel like a sucker paying Manhattan prices for a drink! They also have ice machines throughout the resort, so the guy that payed $.75 for a cup of ice is a moron. The mini-fridge is a decent size, so it holds plenty of drinks and food that needs to stay cool. We bought a whole case of water and it lasted us 5 days. Don't be embarrased to drag all this food and drink to your room either, especially if you have kids with you. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Bring your own snorkel gear for the beach so you don't have to pay the exhorbitant rental fee (plus, you'll know it's clean if it's your own stuff). Upon check-in, I asked for a room upgrade and specifed that I wanted to be in the Las Marinas Village because I wanted to be close to the boat that takes you to the beach. The hotel was empty when we went which was still season for Puerto Rico, so obviously there was plenty of rooms available. I think the economy has really affected tourism here. The view from our room was spectacular, overlooking the harbor and Palamino Island. A nice balcony to relax, sip a cocktail and enjoy the view/ocean breezes. If you don't expect to be at the beach too much and feel the tram is a hassle, then stay in the areas located above the tram. The pools are great...at many times throughout our stay, I felt as if we were the only people at the pool! One night we splurged and went to the steakhouse. Yes, it was pricey, but you get what you pay for. I thought it was one of the best steaks I ever had and the atmosphere was very posh and classy. Plus, the view was spectacular and service was top rate. If you want to save a few bucks and try some local flare, take a short walk to a few restaurants past the marina. Just ask anyone for directions if you can't find it. We went at night with another vacationing couple we met and it was safe and well lit. I wouldn't be out there past midnight, but again, I never felt out of place or unsafe. We found this awesome breakfast/bakery/diner on our last day leaving the resort (wish we found it sooner!) It's the first "sketchy" neighborhood you drive past on your way out (yes, there are sketchy areas of Puerto Rico). I forget the name of it, but it had diner stools and seemed like a locals place, so we gave it a shot. Food was great and had the local flare we were looking for. The best part was the price was dirt cheap! All in all, we splurged when it counted (on the room, casino, and some meals) and budgeted when we needed to. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “It is a dirty Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: kacnyc
Reviews.Content: If you have no problem with a dirty Vegas then you will love this place. What a huge disappointment! Way over priced...for example the breakfast buffet was $50 not including tax and tip. If I am paying $25 per person for a buffet then you better have lobster and filet mignon for breakfast not heat lamp eggs, fruit and orange juice. Need I go on...I will. The rooms are totally out dated and so is the entire atmosphere. My husband played gold (he has a 4 handicap) so he has played all over the world and has never been charged $155.00 for a course that is equivalent to a public course in New Jersey. We even went with friends and tried to laugh it off but had to leave early because after 3 days we realized it was not funny anymore. Anyone who loves this place thinks has clearly never travelled.

Reviews.Title: “75 cents for a cup of ICE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GreensalsaConn_
Reviews.Content: I would say that the title of my review is all you need to know. The resort is very pretty. BUT as you have read in all the reviews on here. This place nickle and dimes you to death. Make sure you check your bill very well. You will be hit with the 40$ random hotel charge. Not really sure what it was for. The transfers from the airport were $110 each way!!!! Take a Cab. When we were there the elevator and tran system where both broken and the faucet in my room came off in my hand. The final insult was when I was Charged 75 cents for a cup of ice!!!!! I almost fell off my chair. Do youself a favor. Just go to an all-inclusive and bring the kids to a water park for the day. You won't end up spending 1000s in fees and high priced food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: NjPrincess023
Reviews.Content: I loved this place!!! I thought the hotel staff was wonderful!!! The food was awesome.. It was expensive but what do you expect your on vacation! My husband and I just shared meals and they were plenty big for two. the room was great!!! we did not leave the resort at all.. Which was great. the beach is so nice!! Hopefully will be back next year!! and whomever gave this trip a bad reveiw , they are just super picky!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: loaiza17
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and truly elegant! The resort was perfect for my romantic get away!

Reviews.Title: “Third Time's NOT the Charm”
Reviews.Author: maythefal
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at this hotel, each time under a different hotel chain. First it was Wyndham, then Luxury Resort Hotels, and now Waldorf Astoria. While the prices went up under this new luxury chain, and new fees were added, the quality has gone WAY down. Last year I wrote a wonderful review for the hotel, which you won't see now. The grounds are still beautiful, the views are of romance book kind, and the options for activities are many, but I was very disappointed. Besides the room rate and tax, now you have to pay an additional 14% resort fee. Which many hotels have and is normally considered acceptable for a resort of this kind. What I don't consider acceptable is that if I'm being charged a 14% resort fee, I expect the amenities to be top notch, and they weren't. On top of that, admission to the water park comes at an additional price. So when you pay for all these extras, the least they could do was offer CLEAN towels WITHOUT holes in them, a clean bathtub (had hairs from previous guest upon our arrival, it was not cleaned when housekeeping went, had to clean it myself), bedsheets without stains and holes in them, no bird poop on the beach and pool chairs/lounges, and a working air conditioner. Oh, and to top it off, we were charged for lunch and drinks we didn't have. I had to make a long line upon check-out to get this corrected. But to their credit, they corrected this quickly and apologized (and another guest without principles had written our room number on the check, so it was a valid confusion). Mind you, I am NOT a complainer. I am one of those people that sees the ray on sunshine in even the worst conditions, so trust me when I say I was very disappointed this time. You can even compare the review I wrote last year with this one, and there is a great difference. So my recommendation? Stay there if you don't mind paying extra for services not provided. I wouldn't stay there again until they make some serious adjustments. I don't mind the extra costs, but I expect the highest quality if I'm paying for the service, and they did not provide them.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: casoenna
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities are splendid and well kept, except the rooms, which are showing signs of age. Room maintenance also lags the rest of the property, with some visible rust and mold marks around the bathroom, and worn out linens and towels. The beach (private island) is a paradise, as is the ferry ride there - out of this world! Keep in mind that getting there is a bit of a trek, so thereÂ´s no going back and forth to the room if you forget something, but itÂ´s well worth the endeavor. In many areas the water is on rocky beach, so I recommend aqua socks to make your walking easier. Service with a smile is non-existent. WeÂ´ve stayed there several times and not once have we gotten a "welcome back" from anyone. Also we had an electrical problem in our room and were moved to another room, but received no apologies or concessions for the inconvenience suffered. Restaurants in the hotel are mediocre and excessively over-priced (except Cafe Caribe for a quick a la carte breakfast), but thankfully there are plenty of good local places a short drive away into town (if you have a car). Bottom line - if you want the best beach out there, this is the place, but don't go with grandiose expectations of luxury hospitality or pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time on this Beautiful Island and Resort”
Reviews.Author: OhioPhoebe
Reviews.Content: The El Conquistador is a beautiful resort, located in a beautiful setting. Our room (two queen size beds, by the marina) was plenty spacious for our family, although we spent little time in it. The room was clean, bright and welcoming, and we enjoyed our view of the marina and the ocean. The service ranged from good to excellent -- no bad service experiences here. We received a great deal through CheapCaribbean.com, which helped offset some of the other expenses of our stay. Anyone who has read the reviews or is familiar with resorts should not be surprised at the expense of the meals. Thanks to the refrigerator in our room, we saved money by eating breakfast in the room (or on our patio) every morning. We ate lunch at the resort (usually at the restaurant on Palomino, or at the water park), and ate our dinners out on the island. There is a Wal-Mart and several grocery stores nearby at which you can purchase food items. The island was beautiful. As a parent, I loved the shallow water because I didn't have to worry about my kids as much. Had a great time relaxing while my kids played. You must bring water shoes though; the coral and rocks make it impossible to wade in otherwise. Water shoes on Palomino Island are outrageously priced ($20 to $30); you should bring them from home or stop at a local WalMart or Payless. The horseback rides are outrageously priced so we didn't indulge; lunch was also pricey but that was the only time on those days when we ate at a resort-based restaurant. Two things you must do: hike through El Yunque rainforest and kayak to the bioluminescent bay. It's cheaper to rent a car and drive to El Yunque yourself than Check out the lovely visitor center (with a brief movie about the park); I recommend taking Big Tree Trail to Las Minas falls (and for goodness sake, wear decent walking shoes, not flip-flops or 3-inch espadrilles...no wonder we kept getting asked "how much further?" on our way back...it's less than a mile to the waterfall, with plenty of places to stop and rest.) After El Yunque, stop at the kioskos by Luquillo beach for authentic, inexpensive Puerto Rican food. As for the bio-bay...there are only 5 such places in the world...Puerto Rico has 3 of them. We had a wonderful experience with Inland Island Adventures, and it was a great learning opportunity for our children. There are many wonderful places on the island to get authentic Puerto Rican food, including Rosas in Fajardo (not too cheap, but still cheaper than the hotel and much better food). Avoid the Ocean View restaurant in Las Croabas -- overpriced, dirty restaurant with poor service and lousy food. PR is an island that is blessed with great natural beauty. My husband is a native and I have been visiting the island for many years. Yes, there are many parts of the island that are unattractive or rundown -- this is a reflection of the poverty (no money to fix things up) and/or a culture whose tastes and budgets are simply different from the suburban American lifestyles of those of us visiting the resorts. Most parts of the island are not going to be beautifully manicured and freshly painted or well-maintained, unlike the resorts you are mostly likely going to be staying at. Don't let this put you off from exploring the island's natural wonders, historical treasures (like Old San Juan), and other fascinations (like the Arecibo Observatory -- my kids loved it.) Keep an open mind while visiting and remember that you are a guest in their world...you will find that many Puerto Ricans will bend over backwards to ensure that you have a pleasurable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent, Overpriced Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: BlueSheep718
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador sits atop a 300 foot bluff and most of the property overlooks the eastern shores of Puerto Rico. Our honeymoon started with the 60 minute coach ride from the airport to Fajardo, home to the resort. Check-in was quick and easy, and our room was upgraded to an ocean-front room at the marina level. The room was large, with modern design and light, airy colors. The bellman gave us a tour of the room, including a wonderful patio, but the handle to the door fell off in his hands. He called maintenance to fix it, but during the seven days we were there the door was never fixed. We did find a way to open the door, even without the handle, so we were able to enjoy the wonderful breezes during the day and the sounds of the rainforest at night. My wife saw a cockroach in the bathroom on two occasions, but by the time I rushed in to "save" her the cockroach had disappeared. The bed was very comfortable and we both slept solidly each night. The private beach at El Conquistador is accessed from a ferry that runs from 9-6 or so each day. We tended to take the first ferry. This gave us a lot of "alone time" on the beach, as most people didn't start to arrive until 11AM. The beaches are kept very clean, but I recommend wearing beach shoes, even in the water. The resort has an Enterprise car rental on-property. I recommend going on-line and reserving the car on the web, versus walking up to the counter. You can save yourself a lot of money. El Conquistador has many pools throughout the property, including a water park. The pools are extremely clean, and the water is a perfect temperature. The water park has two flumes, and a tall slide, plus a large pool. All of this is lovely, especially for the kids, but the $20 entry fee is prohibitive, especially if you've already paid thousands to stay at the resort. The food choices at El Conquistador range from grab-and-go counters to high-end restaurants. All of our food was excellent, especially the seafood and the steak. One thing we did do was buy groceries at Wal-Mart (in town). We found the prices of food to be very high across the board. Mostly we used our groceries for breakfast, but lunches would cost $40-60 (for two people) and dinners ranged from $120-250 (for two). El Conquistador offers various tours, including guided tours of El Yunque (rainforest), trips to San Juan, and Bioluminescent Bay. Expect to pay double if you book these through the resort, rather than making your own arrangements. We spent an afternoon at the Golden Door Spa, a full-service spa with treatments for men and women. The facility is extremely clean and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. We started with showers and soaking in the (gender separate) hot tubs. Our time included a nice couples massage, then the Mrs had a champagne/chocolate facial while I had a citrus scrub. She claimed the facial was so good she wanted to "eat it." My scrub, while invigorating, would not qualify as edible. We enjoyed the services provided, and purchased some of the cleaners/treatments available in the store downstairs. Again, expect to pay over $100 each for most treatments. We didn't play golf or tennis on the grounds, but were impressed with their beauty and design. I'm not sure of the costs associated with these services, but expect it to be on the high-end. Summary - a peaceful, relaxing, fun, and beautiful honeymoon experience. El Conquistador strikes an excellent balance for couples seeking fun (on-site casino) or privacy (private beach). Just know that a week's worth of amenities, excellent dining, and excursions will probably accumulate an extra $1k-$2k of charges on your room beyond the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “beware of hidden cost and lots of walking”
Reviews.Author: sewven
Reviews.Content: This place is very very large. There are rooms where you have to a tram to get to. If you get one of the refurbished rooms, you will be very pleased. The newer rooms are very nice. Spacious bathrooms. Nice shopping right there on the property and the view are breathtaking! What I did not like were the hidden cost for daily housekeeping, bell service, and resort fee. There was only one fitnes room an it was not state of the art, the food that was ffered was extemely pricey and it was not very good. You also need a car to get into the city. Were were at a conference and the rooms were very nice and comfortable. Fridge in the room but no microwave. Beautiful pools and many of them.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaVol
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the El Conquistador for five days in June as part of high school baseball team trip to play local PR teams. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are okay. But everything there is designed to separate you from your money. Wireless internet is only available in the immediate vicinity of their Starbucks, but no where else. Their private island (reached via a free 10 minute ferry ride) is a nice place to relax, I gotta give them that. However, the island closes at 4 pm and refreshment options are very limited. No coolers are permitted. You must rent a car if you want to go "off resort", which I did. The local food isn't any better than the resort food, but it's 40% cheaper. The room's have small fridges, which barely cool anything. Oh, yeah, the resort also charges you $15 per day to park your rental car 200 yards away from the resort in a satellite parking lot. $20 per day for valet parking. Avoid this place and Puerto Rico in general. There are too many other islands with nicer beaches and lower costs. Met a lot of nice locals, but the island is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Obscene prices, dishonest billing... otherwise good hotel”
Reviews.Author: demf
Reviews.Content: I'm a local, and my wife and I truly needed a break, so we decided to stay at El Conquistador, which is a 4-hr drive from where we reside in Puerto Rico, with our two children (4,9). Facility-wise, we knew what we were getting into, since we had visited the facility many times in the past. We had heard horror stories about the lack of value for the services they charge, and were advised to keep an eye at the tab. However, we weren't ready for this... I'll be the first to say that hotel service in Puerto Rico isn't usually great, and by our standards, the service ran from excellent to fair, depending on the person and the place (s)he served at -it tended to be good, not great. The facility overall is, of course, to die for: a huge 500-acre resort which probably would be a golfer's paradise (I couldn't care less about golf), with its own water park, marina, semi-private island, decent restaurants with good -even excellent- food, and ample rooms. Ours, however, smelled musty, and the balcony hadn't been cleaned -apparently in months. Clean, to the point of maid service leaving a full bottle of cleaning agent in the bathroom, in reach of my 4-yr old, who found it fun to spray the tiles with it... The water park was fun for the children -they wouldn't want to leave. The areas were generally well kept. The food is great. However, the prices are just obscene. Granted, it is a luxury resort, but a $75 breakfast buffet for four or a $42 brunch (three potato chip bags, three hot dogs, a serving of nachos and three soft drinks) is not my idea of value. I could live with that (merely by leaving in the evenings and explore nearby Fajardo), if it wasn't for the many cunning ways the resort would try to extricate money from you. A daily(?) $20 bellhop fee (Daily? Would the bellhop move your bags around the resort each day you stayed?) A $28.16 daily resort fee (claimed to be a tax... which truly wasn't). Three different excuses to charge, either partially or totally, the buffet that was included in our offer (which, of course, front desk didn't know the details for). Even $3.50 for bottled water... which we didn't use at all... I'm now being billed $121 for breakfasts that weren't apparently covered by the third different package offer they're claiming I bought. They either don't have their act together, or are just plain abusing of their patrons. I did ask some of the rank and file employees about why the service isn't as wonderful as the prices demand. Turns out they aren't happy, since management is squeezing the best out of them: to give you an example, apparently some bozo (promptly made an ex-employee soon after this) stole an apple from a buffet table and, as a reprisal, employees can't go to the water park to relax with their families any longer as a benefit. You'd chat with them, and they'd reluctantly tell you that they're being pressured left and right to cut costs and shave on the offerings... literally at the expense of guests. Guess what, folks, I'm only visiting from now on. You're not extorting a red penny from me ever again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not at these prices”
Reviews.Author: tyegator
Reviews.Content: Normally I do a great job researching our vacations. This one we did more based on the impression of friends...apparently we have different requirements for a great vacation. We went to Puerto Rico pretty much to stay here, and did a few other things along the way. The previous Spring we spent in Costa Rica for LESS money and did MUCH more. Based on a post here I requested an upgrade to the marina area. I think that worked out well, though getting anywhere (Las Brisas for bfx, car, groceries, ice cream) was a bit of a pain since it took about 15min from down there. Rooms were fine except the A/C didn't work in one of ours - not a big deal in April. The last night we were moved to the rooms we really paid for w/o an ocean view - functional, but not as nice in my opinion. Only thing I'd recommend about the Marina rooms is try to get up high as there's a bit of foot traffic. Of note, when you sit on your balcony, you're not listening to the waves. there are no waves! You're looking at the tops of boats, and a bar, then out to the (pretty) ocean and a built up island out there. there is no beach to walk to, you must take a ferry. Unfortunately that ferry does not run exactly on schedule...we ate a ridiculous lunch by the ferry ($14 burger for even the kids) and walked around the other side to the ferry with 5min to spare only to see the ferry already gone and we had to wait an hour (they had more running later in the week when they were busier). The breakfast in our plan at Las Brisas was terrific! but o/w we avoided eating at the hotel as the prices were just too insane. We rented a car and went into town for fast food sadly enough, so I can't comment on the quality. We went to the island twice. Frankly the beach is nothing compared to Florida! Brought snorkel gear but you can't go out very far before the coral makes the water too shallow to swim over. Wanted to rent floats to go over to the tiny island, but didn't have time. Climbed the trails but the kids stepped on cactus that went all the way through their tennies and had to abort. Views are nice, but very exposed and hot even in early April. Fitness center is WAYYY too small for the size of the hotel. People waited in line for a piece of cardio equipment and finally gave up...and that was at 7am! So, it's a nice enough hotel if you're going there anyway for a meeting, but I would recommend against planning a trip around this resort. If you want Caribbean choose another island. If you want rain forest go to Costa Rica!!

Reviews.Title: “May 25 - 29 - Great for Rest and Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: cartwin1
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the grounds of El Conquistador, I was pleased to see the beautiful landscape. This was only the start of a very nice vacation experience. Once we entered the lobby and checked-in we were pleasantly suprised to learn that our reserved garden view suite had been upgraded to an ocean view suite. Right on! Our room offered a wonderful view but unfortunately the first few days of our vacation the weather was overcast with the threat of rain. The only major negative with our room was that the sliding bathroom door was difficult to open and close. We did not have an all inclusive plan so meals on average were between $20 - $25 per person. Take this into consideration when budgeting. There were many restaurants and shops to select from. Since, I had toured San Juan and Old San Juan on previous trips my goal was to take full advantage of the resort and/or nearby attractions. A visit to the rain forest is a must. I would suggest renting a car if you want to see San Juan and other places. I loved the resort Palominto Island beach. The water was swallow but was fine for people with limited swimming skills. I really enjoyed the ferry ride to and from the island. It was fun yet very relaxing. It was nice to see that the resort catered to families with children. This resort could be a nice place for families, singles and honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Absurd”
Reviews.Author: utracj00
Reviews.Content: I havenâ€™t written lodging reviews before, but I simply have to write a review for this one: I came with my wife to a conference here at El Conquistador (our first time in Puerto Rico). This resort is in a pretty location and has many swimming pools, but this place is quite absurd. I came with my laptop so that I could work while my wife attended conference sessions. Wireless internet access from our room cost $15 per day but did not work properly. Despite a high signal strength, Email was very, very slow, and I could not download small (<1 MB) attachments in our room.
