Business / Internet A small business center is available with computers that allow for airline check-in for free but all other internet is for a cost - unless you know how to make the free check-in computer work for you to get other internet access (which I took advantage of). They advertise in room internet via WiFi, but it did not work in the Las Brisas wing and the hotel admitted that outside of the lobby, WiFi is sketchy. We used our computer in the lobby area and although they charge for WiFi, we were able to access it for free our entire stay. Palomino Island Great little island that is easy to get via the furnicular (little elevator) to the marina and short (7 to 10 minute) boat ride to the island. There is a small outside restaurant with normal lunch options and same drinks as the main pools. There is also a small bar out by the beach and two small stores with various things, including snacks and suntan lotion. There are activity options and I was really excited about doing some snorkeling. However, I would not recommend wasting your money renting snorkel gear on the island. The first 100 yards or so out from the beach is filled with rocks, dead coral, and grass in water about no deeper than 2 feet. It makes it rather impossible to get out to the area where you could snorkel in about 10 to 12 feet of water. You really would need water shoes to get out to this area as it is very tough to wade out in flippers and bare feet is not possible. Swimming in this shallow area is impossible as well. Just not worth the effort. Otherwise, the little island is great and enjoyable with plenty of lounge chairs and easy access to one set of bathrooms. Golden Door Spa We were very excited about using the Spa at this hotel for our long weekend and were very disappointed by it. Although they advertise a number of yoga classes and other activities at the spa, during our stay every time we went to attend one it was cancelled. I am guessing it was a result of the low occupancy numbers. However, there was bad communication between the Spa and the concierge in terms of timing for classes and availability. Every time we went to the spa, either a class was cancelled, its time had been changed or a service was not available that day. We never got to use the Spa once and the staff was completely indifferent about it at the Spa. This was a huge disappointment, especially since our winter getaway provided comp Spa access and 50% off second treatments. As mentioned above, not even the Spa Cafe was open any of the days we were there. We walked over there each morning in hopes of something being available, but never got to use it once. Check-Out When we checked-in, we were told we could receive a complimentary late check-out of 1:30PM. Normal check-out is between 11:00 and Noon according to the hotel staff. When we called Monday morning to confirm our late check-out, the staff told us it would be $65 an hour beyond Noon. With 17% occupancy and after spending almost $900 at the hotel, this was quite obnoxious. After some arguing, the hotel caved and allowed us to take a 1:30PM check-out at no extra cost. Otherwise, the check-out was a little tough as many of the places we ate / shopped at the property had different names when on the bill. This was quite confusing, especially since the hotel did not tell us at first as we struggled with the bill. Also, because most places on the property do not take cash, there are lots and lots of room charges, especially if you did not leave the property. In addition, although the hotel advertises free local / 800 calls, we were charged for them on our bill. After a lot of struggling to get them removed (the hotel gave us no problem removing them), they were removed from the bill. We are still waiting for our points to post, 4 days after departure. Conclusion Overall we really liked the property and it was perfect for a long weekend get away in the winter. Views are fantastic from the property and the property is clean and very well maintained. As mentioned above, the hotel should consider revamping the food options on the property. The hotel needs better management and is not worthy of the W=A designation yet. There is a lot of confusion on the property about Hilton and I imagine it will take time for the staff to get used to the system and general Hilton policies. I give it a year before they get this place in great working order and fix the lousy food options. I think there needs to be a lot of streamlining as a lot of people seemed to be doing nothing in some areas, while other areas of the hotel went unattended. Nonetheless, based on the property, the facilities and views, we would definitely return for a long weekend. We may be more inclined to rent a car next time, but that may be offset by $16 per day parking.

Reviews.Title: “great water park and pool, overpriced food”
Reviews.Author: azpNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We spent a week over february break at el conquistador with our 2 children. The facilities are amazing and really beautiful. Much nicer than staying on the strip in San Juan. The water park was great and the water was heated. The beach was beautiful and there was tons of stuff for our kids to do. THe food however was really really awful for the most part or extremely overpriced and you really are trapped at the hotel unless you rent a car. The upside is that they do have inclusive packages where you get breakfast and the waterpark included so you pay for lunch and dinner. The only place we could eat without getting sick was the strip house. Every other place was overpriced to the tune of $40 per entree and also had bad food. Breakfast however was fine. The staff really tries to be helpful in general and the pool areas are clean and well kept. I read a number of complaints that the rooms seemed run down but I think they were fine. And the place just had a huge renovation which is pretty apparent. Overall a very pleasant vacation except for the overpriced food. Check out their packages since you can get a better deal that way. Much nicer than their sister property El San Juan or any of the strip properties

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: MrFrozendrink
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days at the resort and had a wonderful time. The resort is very large. Despite sharing the place with back to back trips of lawyers (American College of Trial Lawyers) and insurance agents (Travelers), we felt as though we had the place to ourselves. The island beach was definitely the highlight. Nice beach, plenty of space, and decent snorkeling less than 100 yds from the shore. My children are 7 &10 (so-so swimmers) and had no problems seeing eels, puffers, and tons of other fish. Had a slight rub with the water park charging $15 a head for admission. The prices were already high, and it was almost an insult. Getting around the resort is not easy if you have small children, elderly, or other issues with steps. The restaurants are not cheap, but good. We liked the Japanese Steakhouse the best (benihana style where they cook in front of you). Good for the kids, good for the adults, but the shrimp tasted like they'd been frozen for a year. We have gone to Puerto Rico at least once/year for the past decade. Other stops were Dorado Beach and Rio Mar. If you like the beach and/or have younger children this is definitely your best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Door and El Conquistador in Puerto Rico down the drain....and the property too”
Reviews.Author: globaltravelkid
Reviews.Content: With my company's recent decision to have our annual gathering in warm Puerto Rico, I was aghast to find the property so far left unkept since my last review a few years ago. Despite the hotel's remodel/refurb, the lack of tourists obviously has resulted in some poorly-made decisions on the part of what remaining management there is (I say that because even the Golden Door Spa lacks a Spa Director--could never get anyone to give me his name). The refurbed rooms smell of mildew and all "new" carpeting has trapped scents of it. The skeleton crew, however pleasant, cannot maintain positive service when faced with a group our size because so many of staff has been let go for the recession. Unfortunately, we the guests w/expectations of the great El Con days past suffer when faced with sitting over 20 minutes for a coffee at Las Brisas. When we went to the Golden Door Spa, the cracks in the walls connecting the 3 floors tells enough about the investment of time and money going into this place. On the 2nd floor, all of the fun classes have been cancelled and some new idea has surfaced to chage $25 per class on an "as needed" basis if they can find an instructor. They used to offer 8 classes a day that were fun, exciting, and taught by industry professionals with dvds and books. Their program rivalled our David Lloyd and Virgin Active clubs here in the UK with great instructors, innovative classes, and amazing ideas. Gone is the aquatic fitnes as well which used to attract so many individuals around 11 each day as a COMPLIMENTARY attraction promoting the Spa. No more such fun exists. When we requested male therapists, we were told that there were none availalbe due to recent cutbacks. At Palomino Island, there is horrible service and no food option. When we wanted to visit a restaurant owned by the hotel, eveyrone told us that the trend of El Conquistador is to outsource everything, including all restaurants. When we contacted Strip House in NYC when we found it CLOSED here in Puerto Rico, they told us that they no longer want to be assosciated with this "Caribbean embarrassment." I can't recommend the property or the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Chill on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: BadgerConn
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe how many reviewers were from CT and then I realized PR is the only freakin' place we can get a direct flight from Hartford!! Anyways, I went for a long weekend getaway which I got a deal on. I found the pool and private island beach very relaxing. The food was a little pricy but there was a variety. The resort is fairly large and spread out. I'd recommend renting a car for a day and going to San Juan's old town and the Bicardi distillery for some sightseeing if you haven't been. The golf course looked very challenging and fun (hilly!), but my wife doesn't play and wasn't going to let me go since we were only there a couple days.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Vacation @ El Conquistador Resort”
Reviews.Author: BBSurfing
Reviews.Content: Write a review and relive this nightmare. The rating says it all. I WILL NOT AND CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. I love Puerto Rico and will return, but NOT TO THAT HOTEL! Great surfing around the island and love the people.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: Ortner73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to a number of excellent resorts in the last couple years such as the Phoenician in Arizona and the Ritz in Half Moon Bay, California. We really enjoyed these, but I didn't find either particularly worthy of taking the time to post a review. That fact alone speaks volumes for El Conquistador. This place is gorgeous and the views we had from the villas (casitas) were stunning! The views, combined with the great food, pools and water park make this resort 5 stars. And this doesn't even count the stuff that we did not take advantage of - golf course, tennis courts, casino, wave runners, etc. The fact that our casita had a washer/dryer was also a welcome surprise given that we have two small children. While I'm not one to spend my whole vacation on a resort, we could have easily done that here. They even have an airport shuttle so you don;t have to rent a car. I highly recommend the resort - especially las casitas due to the stunning views from ocean view porches - and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “All That We Hoped for and much More!”
Reviews.Author: Beachcomber399
Reviews.Content: The El Conquistador was absolutely gorgegous! The veiws were spectacular, there was plenty of things to do, and the employees were very kind and helpful. We were supposed to stay in Las Olas, but when we got to the room we found that the ocean veiw was parcialy blocked by a building and that the whole Las Olas area was in need of a little TLC. The front desk however accomodated us with a free upgrade to a better room in Las Marinas. I'd suggest that you definatley stay there. You are close to the boat so you can get to Palamino Island quickly, there are two resturants, shops,and a waterpark down in the marina area so it is not a pain to go down the funicular everytime you want to do one of those activities. Also, the veiws in the marina are beautiful as well. Going to Palomino Island was a highlight of the trip. It is only a 7 minute boat ride and your on a tropical island paradise. The water is warm, however there is alot of coral so i'd suggest you bring water shoes. There is a restaurant on the island as well as a small gift shop. Close to Palomino Island is an island called Palimonitos Island. You can rent anything from a noodle or a tube to a windsurfer or jetski to get over to the island. We took a kayak over and the ride was very fun. The island has nice water for snorkling or just swimmimg, and plently of treasures to find such as a sea fans or shells. You can also go horseback riding on Palamino Island (the main island). El Conquistador offers an array of fantastic dining. The Strip House had the most amazing steak I have ever tasted but it was quite expensive along with all of the other restuarants. If you have kids I would suggest going to the Ballyhoo Bar and Grill across from Stingray. They have salads, hamburgers, hot dogs ect. for a reasonable price. Up at the main hotel there are three great pools. One has volley ball net, the other is a lap pool and what we thought was the best was the large pool that had a swim-up bar. The hotel also offers a water park too. Coqui water park is located in the marina, it was actually right in front of our room. There is admission to get in. It has three water slides, a lazy river, and a very large infinity pool that i very warm. We were guests of people who owned a Casita in the Las Casitas Village. The area was very nice and the Horizon pool was great, and there is a great place for lunch. Overall the El Conquistador was a great hotel that I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No reason to leave the resort.”
Reviews.Author: Colgate17
Reviews.Content: My family (20 yr, 17 yr, 12 yr, wife and me) have been to El Conquistador many times over the last 20 years. On our last trip, we found the service and attentiveness to please to be at an all time high. The "Las Casitas" section of the resort is a hidden gem with beautiful rooms and magnificent views of the Carribean Sea. There is something to do (or not do!) for a family like ours with older children whether it is the new water park, the spa, Palomino Island, the great restaurants...there's no reason to leave the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip -Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: dmorris12
Reviews.Content: Our family- Two adults and a two year old -enjoyed the large hotel room with a spectacular view. Our room overlooked the cliffs and ocean, we could see surrounding islands icluding the resort's own island Palamino island, where we sat on the beach on lounge chairs under our own palm umbrella. The water park was great for our son and again there were plenty of chairs to go around. We were comfortable the entire time. My only criticism is that the food is extremely expensive(Two hot dogs and a salad with drinks running about $50).

Reviews.Title: “Top notch staff and surprisingly reasonable rates!”
Reviews.Author: dstyes
Reviews.Content: These guys bailed us out of a big-time jam! We were supposed to go from Fajardo to Vieques, but our trip got cancelled due to problems at the ferry (a long story). About 8PM my family hopped into a cab and drove about two miles or so to the El Conquistador, where I ran in and checked to see if they had vacancies. They DID, and we checked in for two days at $239 per night (garden view rate)...even better, the young lady at the check-in counter upgraded us to an ocean view room at that same rate! We took full advantage of the complimentary boat ride over to Palomino Island, where you can jet ski, sail, swim, or ride horses on the beach. We also went to the Coqui water park (additional charge applies, but hey it wasn't that big of a deal-about $20/person, and it make my 6-year-old son pretty happy). Room service was prompt, and the Italian restaurant on-premises was nice, too. The rooms were very nice and clean. The food was a bit expensive (i.e. $75 for three meals via room service), but it was quite good and it was served promptly after ording (very important when travelling with kids). If you are on a tight budget, this place is not for you...but if you are planning a "bucket list" trip, this is a great place to go. I was told while there that the resort is about to become part of the Hilton family of hotels and resorts in March 2009. We'll be going back next year, regardless of whether that's true or not!

Reviews.Title: “Las Casitas Village & Golden Spa- A Timeshare!!!”
Reviews.Author: hank66
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Las Casitas Village (south village unit) during presidents week- 2/14/09- 2/21/09. What a dump! My family and I travel each year to luxury hotels. This year a friend convinced us to stay at the casitas of El Conquistador Resort. The villas are all individually ownded and placed in a management pool for rental. This is a fancy way to say TIMESHARE. The units needs a major renovation. New furniture, new bathrooms and def new beds and linens. You expect a down comforter but you get a thin dirty blanket covered by old bleached white sheets. The villas were mostly filled but clearly the resort cut staff. Housekeeping was week and limited to a very quick turndown service in the evening. Try getting a pool boy to set up your chairs no where in sight. Oh thats when they have clean towels out at the pool. The main hotel was empty! We were told hotel was at 60% occupancy at best. They two need a major renovation on the grounds and rooms. The hot tub steps were filthy. Rusted with brown stains and layers of paint as they must just paint over them year after year. Overall, place is a rip-off. They charge for everything- Coke- $ 6.00, self parking - $ 15.00, valet $ 30.00. Baby sitter- $ 24.00 an hour for two kids. Brakfast for 2 adults and two kids at buffet - $ 110.00. I feel for the folks heading to this resort for Easter school break. Do yourself a favor cancel now and go somewhere else! I promise you will rememebr my posting and said should have listened to that guy!! - Oh yeah- the casino- cut staff and removed crap table and only open two BJ tables at best nughtly. Place is just boring and OLD.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting but nickeled & timed”
Reviews.Author: DaninVacamode
Reviews.Content: The setting of this resort could not be more beautiful. We knew it was expensive, but if you go there be ready to be nickeled & timed to death. We stayed in the Casitas, which has a kitchen, which we like as we prefer to make our own breakfast. The hotel offers a service whereby they will shop for you for a $25 service fee, however, this year they also overchared us for the items purchased on TOP of the service fee; for eg. we were charged $6 for a 12 oz bottle of Snapple, $15 for 4 quarts of milk, $17.50 for a 12 pack of Pepsi, $12 for a 6 pack of Sprite, etc. The restaurants are expensive and only ok. In any event, the nickle & time stuff does not sit well with me when you are already being charged 1st class rates for less than a 1st class resort. Been there 2 years in a row, will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “too big and expensive”
Reviews.Author: lor23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casita's and it's true, as one other review said, that if you stay here you should know that it's a big resort. I must say though that this place is HUGE. The room was beautiful and roomy, The shuttles were timely and the service was really superb but I would never stay here again. It took at least a half hour to get to the beach and it wasn't worth. The water was flat and boring. we actually ended up renting a car for $70 a day just to drive to the wyndam Rio Mar to stay by their beach which was sooo much nicer. It had waves! But even if you disregard all the advise, I would say that it is one of the most expensive hotels i have ever been to. My family of 4 spent at least $500 a day on food. Insane and unexceptable to me that a family resort should rip people off like that. You just can't have a good time that way. The spa was reasonable but not too nice. A little dirty and I didn't find it luxurious at all. I had a basic massage and it was only O.K. also, they charged $25 dollars to enter the fitness center which had 1 elliptical machine and 10 old junky step machines. I do not recommend this hotel mainly because I really felt ripped off the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Mimzoo
Reviews.Content: Very lovely, but overpriced. No question that the location is beautiful, but Paradise Island (Bahamas) is just as lovely and better priced. This is one of the least expensive "U.S." areas, they don't need to put a bottle of water in your room and charge $8.00 for it. The place was nearly empty, and won't make it unless they have some special offers going. We went out to local restaurants to eat, and found wonderful places at good prices. The Conquistador charges for every move they make, including parking, and then getting your car - even if you get it yourself. And so, dear Conquistador management, you will only scam me once.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place on off-week”
Reviews.Author: kick-back-beach-bum
Reviews.Content: This place is great on off-weeks. We stayed the week before Presidents Day week. It was great being able to walk into restaurants without reservation, waking up any time without the burden of having to get a seat at beach/pool. No lines at water park or Palomino ferry. Palomino island was empty. We could play volley ball, rent jet ski, etc. Fantastic. As Presidents Week approached, so did the crowds. Peolpe pushing to get seats at beach and pool. My kids were run over by two very rude NY woman getting on the ferry so they could get their seats. I would not want to be here during Pres Week with the usual crowds./

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Setting but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: eadj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the El Conquistador for 5 nights in February 2009. The resort has a magnificent setting, truly gorgeous, and Palomino Island is fantastic, but there are a lot of problems. Most have to do with management. The resort is under occupied and we suspect it is short staffed and it definitely overpriced for the services provided (remember to add about 25% to the cost of the hotel room for taxes and "resort fees.") Here are our comments and recommendations: (1) Rent a car in San Juan - the least expensive option - OR hire Carlos, a fantastic driver and guide who will meet you at the airport, give tours of the rain forest and other areas, recommend and take you to fun restaurants, etc. (I noticed another reviewer praised him as well) Otherwise, you are essentially stuck at the hotel. Cabs are VERY expensive ($20 minimum fee) If you do want a driver, phone the hotel before your arrival in San Juan and ask that Carlos be assigned to pick you up. (2) Be politely assertive about your rooms. We booked directly through the hotel and paid extra to stay at Las Olas to ensure a nice room with an ocean view - and it still took us almost 5 hours and 2 room changes before we were placed in an acceptable, albeit hugely overpriced, room. Las Olas is dated, tired looking, and most of all, dirty, so I can't figure out why it is more expensive than the main building. The carpets in the hallways are terribly stained and were not vacuumed once during our entire stay. Balcony furniture is minimal, without even a small table. Way overpriced (We could and should have stayed at Las Casitas for less.) (3) The food is exorbitant for the quality. Blossoms and Stingray have ok food, but overpriced. La Vista has a great view and good casual food; breakfasts at the Cafe Caribe are much less expensive than at Las Brisas; breakfast at the Bally hoo at the marina bar, is great and the setting unbeatable; the food on Palomino Island is absurdly expensive, but you can get take out sandwiches, chips and sodas at David's Cookies or the Cozy Gourmet at reasonable prices and take them with you. (4) The hotel had a low occupancy rate for most of our stay and several tours were cancelled. The eastern part of the island is noted for snorkeling, but the hotel was unable to get the minimum 8 people for a half or full day tour. (5) if you want to go to the bio-luminescent tour, do not book through the hotel. Go to the marina, past the ferry to the island, and through the gate. A short walk takes you to the small fishing village. At 6 pm, numerous kayak tour companies prepare to set out for the lagoon and you will pay half the cost of booking through the hotel. (6) This is also a good place to try some local food. (7) if we were to do it over again, we would book at least 1 night in Vieques or Culebra to take advantage of the beaches and snorkeling there - as well as the evening tour of Mosquito Bay, which has by far the best bio-luminescent displays (and you can swim in the water).; (8) the trip to the nature reserve near the El Conquistador is wonderful - well worth the short trip; (9) El Yunque, the rain forest, is also fun. Have Carlos take you in the morning, before the crowds arrive. He will see that you swim in a small clean pool under a waterfall, will find and identify some of the flowers and give options for various walks. (10) the main pools are nice with glorious views. Las Olas pool would be nice for families with small kids - maximum depth is about 3.5 feet.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views”
Reviews.Author: I'm_Travelin'
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful and includes many restaurants and shops, which is good because you definately don't want to go touring around the local town. The hotel security will tell you why if you really need to know. There is much to do at this resort if you can drag yourself away from the panoramic views of the ocean. The resort has a first-class spa, which I thoroughly enjoyed, a water park, pools, a casino and a private island that is a little slice of heaven. The cuisine in the restaurants was average to very good. If you are looking for world-class cuisine, you will not find it here; however, you will still be happily sated. The hotel rooms are stark and cold, but it's ok, because the views make up for it. The bathrooms are terrific and include a walk-in closet. Best of all, the staff was friendly and went out of their way to make you happy. Congratulations to whoever trains the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel217
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this resort until I got back and realized I had BED BUG bites all over. We read a couple of reviews that said some people got ant bites, and I was praying that's what I had, but I just went to the doctor and she said they are pretty classic bed bug bites. I bet those people just thought they were ant bites, b/c I've done some research (since I discovered mine) and found that a lot of people confuse these bites for other things. Now I remember seeing some man on the private beach, with his legs covered in huge bites, which look EXACTLY like pictures of terrible bed bug bites that the doctor gave me. At the time I thought he had just been eaten up by misquitoes, but I've never seen that many mosquito bites that close together unless someone was hiking in a dense forest or something. I am furious and scared to sleep in my apartment for fear that I brought some back. I had planned to write a review about the hotel being nice, but warning people to be careful about some of the hotels practices of gouging customers (bioluminescent bay is $90, but if you book through kayakpuertorico.com, it's $40-something, enterprise rent-a-car charges much more in the hotel lobby than online, etc, etc.) but now I just want to encourage everyone to just STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE, it's not worth the stress of dealing with BED BUG BITES and worrying that you brought them back into your home.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to a Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Gogo1032
Reviews.Content: Date: 8/8/08 Reviewer: Gomez/Frost Family, Westchester NY. We had our 25th wedding Aniversary at the hotel on 8/8/08 it was the most beautiful experience we had ever had. We started planning a year before and Sales people to the catering people to reservations we great especialy the catering manager (Patricia Villali). We had 80 guest 60 of them stayed at the resort, not one of my guess had nothing bad to say they all said that they will return on a future trip. The rooms they gave me and my guess all had ocean view it is one of the most beautiful view you could ever had any where in Puerto Rico. During my wedding the staff was great they attended to all our needs, The food was great and can't say much more becuase the trip was the best experience I have ever had till today my firends are still talking about the trip. So for who ever is planing a tropical wedding with some firends and family this is the place to come to and believe what I'm saying I was born here and this is the most beautul place I have ever been in Puerto Rico!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rugsmart
Reviews.Content: We first visited El Conquistador 7 years ago and while we had a great time, we were a bit underwhelmed. At that time it was owned by Wyndham. The resort is now owned by LXR and was completely renovated within the last 1.5 years and it's now just gorgeous. We stayed in the La Marina portion of the resort, which is down near the marina and the boat that takes you to the resort's own private island, Palomino.The rooms in La Marina are fresh and contemporary and completely hip. The bathrooms are huge and beautiful. Every room has a large balcony with an amazing ocean view. We were completely impressed with this place, which we were told was only at 33% occupancy while we were there, due to the slow economy. What a shame this place is so underutilized, as we've travelled all over the world and were so impressed that a property this large was now so well maintained. There is a brand new convention center that we toured, which is state of the art and beautiful. The ideal place for a corporate retreat. There are several restaurants on the site. Las Bresas had a great buffet breakfast every morning. We also ate at Stingray, which is their high-end seaford restaurant. We ate Dorado and Tuna, both of which were sourced locally. The food was excellent and the service superb. It was pricey, particularly the wine, but since we are NYC people, the prices seemed fair. There is a new water park with three fun water slides and we spent one entire day there and had a blast! We aren't golfers, but the golf course looks amazing. We did use the tennis courts, which were in excellent condition. They had both clay and hard courts for us to choose from. The staff was very friendly and accommodating everywhere we went. Just a pleasurable experience through and through. We felt fortunate to have experienced this resort so soon after complete renovations. The place is a gem that has experienced a total re-birth, just in time for the economy to soften. We will definately be back and really want to support everything they have done.

Reviews.Title: “Nice week, but won't return...”
Reviews.Author: travlinwithtykes
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of family for the week following xmas, over New Year's. While we enjoyed our week together, we were disappointed with the resort and won't return. Overall, we felt that it was comparable to an all-inclusive or a similarly mid-range hotel; had we paid a "budget" price, we would have been satisfied with our experience. It's not in the same class with similarly-priced high-end hotels. Our rooms were in the Marina with a beautiful ocean view. With an upgrade, we were on the top floor - these rooms have an elevated ceiling, which made the space feel huge. We were very happy with the rooms and the housekeeping staff. We hired babysitters for several nights and they were great. We found the funicular swift and fun for our kids. Ditto with the boat ride to Palomino island - rather than a drawback, it was actually a nice relaxing trip. We loved the island - as others have said, it's a beautiful beach. Our biggest complaint was the food. The food was as overpriced as one would expect at a major resort ($15 hamburgers, etc.), and we were prepared for that. It ranged in quality from poor to totally inedible. The only two exceptions were the dinners we had at the steak house and the teppanyaki place. The other "nice" restaurants were simply terrible.... for $35, the entrees were inexcusable. It was very frustrating that the cafe on the island was so horrible - we really couldn't eat there, so that forced us to return on the boat prior to lunch time. The water park is nice, but it's quite small and they charge a hefty daily fee for it, which was annoying; at Atlantis, for example, the daily "resort fee" covers the vastly larger water park options. Most of the areas of the hotel are far past their prime, including the main pools. We were glad to be staying at the marina, as the other wings looked very poorly kept up. There's lots of cracked cement, peeling paint, etc. everywhere - again, if you were at a budget hotel, this wouldn't seem so bad, but for the price you'd expect a lot more. It is certainly not comparable to other high-end resorts. The one exception seemed to be the Casitas; we took a walk up there and they look lovely, with their own pool and restaurants. They're owned and managed separately, so that's perhaps a better bet. All in all... it needs a major overhaul, as several others have commented. It's a big convention resort that has fallen on hard times, and it shows. For the price, there are many far better options.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: JRFNewYork
Reviews.Content: I had the frustrating experience of being at El Conquistador briefly for a business trip--too briefly. All the experience did was make me want to go back on vacation! I had been there a number of times in the past (it's an icon in Puerto Rico), but not for maybe 7-8 years. Wow! This place has been changed and upgraded a lot.! I always loved El Conquistador for its scene by the pool and great service and will never forget the stunning views of the Caribbean. The main hotel is really high up on a cliff so you can see a number of other islands on the horizon. There are new luxury condos you can rent in addition to the main resort (they call them Casitas, and they're perfect for families in particular). Someone said Mariah Carey had been there recently. I did have time to check out the new (new since I was last there, at least) Golden Door Spa, and I'm sure Mariah did, too. I took their little tram down the cliff and walked around the marina and noticed they've also built a cool new water park down there. I'll be back for that, too.

Reviews.Title: “Had higher expectations”
Reviews.Author: siteinspector
Reviews.Content: My co-worker and I just visited this resort last weekend. It was a quick site inspection to determine if we wanted to bring 80 people to the resort Spring 2010. Last year we were at an all inclusive property so we knew this property would be different but we expected this property to be above and beyond the all inclusive. We were very disappointed that the property needed a lot of remodeling. The property looked great on the website but in person you see a lot of things that could be changed....dirty floors, badly chipped doorways, etc. We did visit Palomino Island which was absolutely beautiful but that didn't make up for the rest of the property. We ate breakfast one morning and it was a $30 buffet. We felt like coming from the same budget at an all inclusive and going to a non-all inclusive that the property would exceed all of our expectations. We were disappointed in the resort overall and would not recommend going there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but has some downfalls”
Reviews.Author: vacationqueennh
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was good. My biggest complaint is the price of food. It is rediculous! I've stayed in many 5 star resorts and the prices are at least double maybe triple. I'm not a cheapo but it was crazy. $12 for quacamole and chips at the bar, $15 for a salad for lunch is crazy as far as I'm concerned. As others have said the hot tubs are not hot, we called them cold tubs. The golf course is beautiful and very challenging. The employees at the golf course go out of their way for you, very helpful and very accommodating. We had an oceanview room, no complaints. It was clean and comfortable. Some have complained about the funiculars being slow, they just replaced them 2 months ago so they are faster now. Overall it was a nice stay, wouldn't go back though, I'd try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jgypsy99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El Conquistador Resort on January 1st (2009) for one night. Shortly after our arrival, my husband and I found multiple different colored stains on our sheets along with a long black hair. Though the concierge promptly sent a housekeeping staff person to our room, I later discovered that the bathroom fixture was hanging by an ancient-looking piece of duct tape that was moldy and disgusting. In addition, there were more hairs on our shower walls, and it did not appear that the house keeping staff had bothered to sweep the closet in some time. A cordless desk phone was not working because it was not charged. Though this is minor, other members of our party reported the exact same problem in their room demonstrating a lack of attention to detail that is more commonplace then I would expect at a luxury resort. The white furniture in the room appeared stained. Our breakfast at CafÃ© Caribe was unpleasant. Two other members of our party found the coffee undrinkable and therefore requested coffee from a fresh pot. The disinterested waiter returned with two half-filled cups of sludge. I honestly expect more options for a cheese omelet then just American and Swiss cheeses and the French toast tasted stale. This unappetizing breakfast was certainly not worth $50 for only four people, and the experience left us unwilling to dine at any of the other resort restaurants. We received an e-mail before our arrival necessitating the advance purchase of non-refundable water park tickets (about $20 per person). The tone of the e-mail implied that this would be necessary to enjoy the grounds due to our early arrival (we arrived on a red eye from NY). I should have thought better of this because the three water slides and lazy river filled up a couple of hours but certainly not a whole day, and we were able to check in early without a problem. This experience was NOT worth $300+ a night and was a colossal waste of money. My husband and I were happy to leave after one night. I am so disappointed that I will not recommend this hotel to local family or visiting friends in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveller09
Reviews.Content: An easy trip with kids. Babysitting services were good (ask for Katherine). Waterpark is fun. Pools are nice. Drinks for Mom and Dad are great. Food is edible at best and the menus are incredibly limited. Rooms are fine and generally clean. Big conventions come to this hotel which is a negative.

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador thoughts...”
Reviews.Author: onefinebird
Reviews.Content: Here are my thoughts. The rooms are not luxurious as compared to other 5 star resorts. I do realize the resort is continually undergoing a facelift, but it is far from complete. We stayed in the 4000 building which on first impression as we were walking to our room reminded me of a vintage hospital with it's mint green walls and peeling paint. Beds were comfy, some had ants so if you are itching check that out. The view from our room was definately 5 star. Gorgeous sunrises! Room service is speedy and the Cubano sandwhich is so good we had it practically everyday. We had a $15 cab ride to a nearby gas station to buy beer and sodas so we wouldn't have to pay for them on the resort. We walked out the gate past the ferry down past the apartments and did the BioBay tour from there. It's $88 if you book through the hotel and only $45 if you go down there. Get the glass bottom kayaks. It is quite a paddle, if you are weak or not wanting to put some effort into it, don't go. When we went the tide was going out and it was very hard to paddle against it, but the bay at the end was totally worth it. Old San Juan is an hour away, take comfy shoes and plan to stay the day as there is a ton of stuff to do there. They have high end shopping as well as puerto rico vendor shopping. My husband booked a light tackle tour in the hotel for 6. It was about $700. They should have gone to the marina and hired someone themselves for about half that cost. But the trip was worth it as they all had a great time. The casino is small and dated, the stores at the resort are extrememly well priced for shirts and such. If you are waiting to go off resort to purchase these items cheaper you may rethink it. The quality of the resort items is well worth the extra couple of dollars. Lots of walking up and down slopes and stairs as well as a short ride on a cable trolley type thing called a funicular. I thought prices for food were reasonable considering we were on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Needs leadership overhaul”
Reviews.Author: PFT3
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a nice property with a large number of amenities, though you do have to pay a steep tariff for most. The major issues as we see it relate to management issues. The staff was knowledgable and quite pleasant and responsive. The problem is that this resort sells itself as a step above and "luxurious". We found many of the common areas to be somewhat shabby and in need of remodeling. The linens were pilled and the pillows atrocious. The casino is in desperate need of remodeling. Here is a nitpicking point, but emblematic of the issues. Cheap plastic cups for 9 dollar cocktails. C'mon, for that price a little better grade plastic at least. We felt as if the owners were squeezing every last dollar out for profit and not reinvesting in the little, but important details that make a resort a luxury resort.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: Gtch
Reviews.Content: Selected hotel because it was in the "American Express Finer Hotels & Resorts" book. The location and viewa are wonderful. The food in the finer restaurants was very good. Most of the staff were very accomodating but mostly when something was pointed out to them. I had a number of instances which service, amenities and basic comforts were lacking. For 3 days there wasn't any hot water in my room and one day I used the Golden Spa to shower. The refrigerator in the cabana we rented ($350 p/day) had to be replaced after the first day. Lunch at the lower main pool bar took 1 hour 20 minutes on another day. Our reservation at the Italina restaurant was not honored and we had to wait 45 minutes one evening. The spa needs signiffcant updating and renovations as does some other areas of the hotel. I spoke with the hotel manager one day about the incoveneinces my family had incurred (ie: lack of hot water, delayed lunch, dinner reservation, etc.). He asked what he could do for me and I said I will leave it up to you. absolutely nothing was done. The hotel does offer wonderful surrpondings and if you are willing to pay has enough amenities. It is not a great place for teenagers had limited activities in the evening for them. Having to take a water shuttle to the beach for all water activities is a inconveneioce guests should be aware of prior to booking. Overall the prices are steep based on the need for renovations of some areas. Could have stayed at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan for less money and been guarnateed hot water or at least a night's credit for lack of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Staff, Lots of Little Kids”
Reviews.Author: amberwithwings
Reviews.Content: The Lowdown: This place is huge. It's a little overwhelming, actually. There are a two or three shallow swimming pools (no deep ends) and then a water park consisting of three slides and a lazy river for an additional fee. To get to the beach, you need to wait for the ferry that will take you on a 10 minute ride to a private island that is owned by the hotel. It is open from 9 to 5 and has one restaurant that serves bar food for lunch. To get to the ferry, you need to take an elevator down to a funicular ride, and hope you've timed it so that the ferry isn't JUST pulling away as you get there. All of this means that from slapping on your bikini to flopping on your towel COULD take you an hour. The good: The staff was fantastically friendly. The food was pretty good. Try the key lime pie, it's to die for, in fact, I ordered it via room service at midnight, and it arrived SO promptly. The views are AMAZING! The water park is fun, and a neat addition. There are TONS of activities to do on the premises (kayaking, snorkeling, SCUBA diving, ocean swimming, pool swimming, nightly movies, jet skis, banana boats, golf, tennis, etc.) and the front desk can hook you up with other tours nearby. The beach island has iguanas, rabbits, tiny lizards and roosters. There is also a horse tour that looked fun, although I didn't go. The hiking is great, too, so if you're with people who lay around on the beach but you really want to get up and go, you can do both without having to separate all day long. That's pretty nice. The water is clean and clear, but there is sharp coral that bruised my feet. It's fun to collect though. I also found a conch in it's shell, and that was cool (be careful; one of the locals wandered over as I was showing a group of kids how cool our "new friend" was and talked about how she was going to use it when I was finished for soup. I set him free when she wasn't looking, to the delight of the little kids who were sad when she talked about cooking him and when her boyfriend talked about eating him raw.) My niece saw a manatee (we are all still jealous we missed it), and our whole family was greeted by a humming bird flitting around the bush we were sitting by. The bad: Even thought the hotel wasn't crowded, service in the restaurants and on the hotel's beach island was beyond slow. In the Italian restaurant we waited over an hour before our appetizers arrived, and I watched other people leave in disgust after waiting so long. We had a bad experience with our biolumninescent tour; it was nearly a mile of kayacking and was nearly impossible for my 60 something mother in law and 9 year old nephew to keep up with, even though we were told it was appropriate for all ages. Everyone in between (my husband and I, 26, and 27 and his siblings and older nieces and nephews) were just fine, as were all the other people in our group who were in the 16-50 range. This tour was booked through the hotel for $90 per person, but if you just go to the docks where they leave from, you can book on the spot for around $45. There are several companies that offer tours of this really cool glow-in-the-dark bay, so if you are a small group, this is probably a good option. (Go out the small white gate by where you catch the ferry, past the apartments, through a kind of sketchy area that just looks abandoned but is totally fine; there are parked cars, and just walk a bit. You'll stumble across several tourists snapping into life vests getting ready to go around 6, 6:30 and later. Def. check out those bioluminescent waters. It's pretty awesome.) The worst for me was the "hot"tubs, which we nicknamed "bubble tubs" because they were not hot at all. It was pretty disappointing. The water park is an extra charge, which is ridiculous considering what it is and what you're paying for everything else. It would be nice if it was free. There's plenty of room for adults to lounge "pool side" at the water park and there is a large shallow pool for the tiny kiddos, with a tiny kiddo waterslide, too. It would be great to get the families there and have the pools and hot tubs consisting of mostly adults. (We have a theory they kept the hot tubs so cool to be kid-friendly). The place is large which is cool, but I found this to be overwhelming and annoying, too. It was also overrun with little kids (the week between Christmas and New Years, though, means little kids everywhere.) We were a group aged 9 - 65 (ten of us), but I think we still would have preferred an older crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Still a terrific resort- but affected by the economy”
Reviews.Author: MMBINNJ
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd visit (over the last 12 years) to El Conquistador and while the resort is in need of a face lift, it is a great family getaway. If you are looking for a one stop destination- where you do not need to leave the resort to do anything- youâ€™ll love it. I will start with the pluses- the staff. They are sweet, attentive and seem to want to please. The golf is phenomenal- and this might be one of a few resorts in PR where there is golf onsite. The spa is good- but expensive ($147 for a 50 minute massage with mandatory added gratuity). While I always tip the therapist- it is usually commensurate with the quality of the service. I happened to have had a great massage but did not run back at the cost for a second service. To me the most fun activity is Palomino Island. They tender you over to their private island- where they have beautiful chairs with some umbrellas. Same drill as most resorts- early bird gets the worm with seating under shade. There are jet skis, banana boats, snorkeling, and kayaks. Beware- the restaurant had problems keeping up with our busy day and food was so-so. Maybe bring a sandwich from Starbucks (see below). Bring a small cooler for this that fits in a bag- they have ice machines near all rooms. Renting a little noodle was $6 and a raft $11 - bring a few blow up rings or floats for your little guys to save a few bucks there. A few cons. First the state of the maintenance of the resort is fair. Examples include facades in need of painting, the hot tub sans bubbles (no plan to fix I guess), floors needing cleaning, pools which could also be cleanerâ€¦ I truly think this is an economic related numbers issue- as occupancy is surely down. We laughed as the walk to the lower pool had dirt/hair balls the whole 6 days that just blew around and were never swept- well it is a big resort and must be a nightmare to maintain. If you have a teenager as I do- BEWARE as the drinking age is 18 (not 21). That blew me away and my son and my friends kids bellied up to the bar and drank. Heâ€™s 19- but I wish I had foreseen this and snuffed it out before we got there. Plus they had no problems freely serving my 17 year old either. Scary stuff as a parent. Every guest gets these charge cards- I wonder if they have a way to restrict them? Worth asking- after all, kids will be kids. Food is very expensive (what else is new at a resort). Lots of walking there too - I guess an issue if infirmed or elderly. Rooms could be just a tad cleaner- but the sweet staff taking care of the rooms made up for it. Also be aware the drive from the airport is long- with traffic could be an hour or more. One other con- my husband and son are certified in scuba diving- but my 17 year old is not. My 2 sons did get a refresher in the pool- but on their dive the staff was inattentive at best. They haphazardly checked their gear- and you better bring your own buddy to dive with as you are on your own. That is a little scary. Tips- bring a bottle of rum/some beer for your room if you like a drink before dinner. They have a refrigerator thatâ€™s empty. Bring snacks for the kids- the food is quite expensive and is nice to at least defray some of that. We bought rum, wine (bring a corkscrew), beer, cokes- and had a happy hour on our beautiful balconies that saved money. I spoke to a guy who rented a car and this gave him eating/drinking/snack flexibility we did not have. We booked the garden view- and they kindly gave us a partial and full ocean view- wow. We had originally booked partial- changed to garden- that saved us > $1000 each room. I recommend the marina location - unless you are a casino person. I liked being on the bottom of the funicular. After getting off the boat- I saw some people who had to wait in line to go up the mountain. You have snorkel gear? Bring it and snorkel to the small island next to Palomino- my husband and sons did this and said was terrific. I kayaked to there too- and it was awesome. Want to know the deal on the resort? Starbucks- yes thatâ€™s right. The cheapest sandwich seems to be $10-$14 elsewhere. The worker said they are the most expensive Starbucks on the island- but the hidden secret of the resort. The breakfast parfait is maybe $3- the breakfast buffet is (ready for this) $25 plus tax and tip. Yipes. Letâ€™s face it the food is always outrageous at nice resorts- but beware the dinners are a fortune too ($45 steak and $11 Caesar salad). What else? Well we ended up not doing the luminescence tour in the kayaks- but figured out if you walk around the corner (to the left of where you get on the boat)- is Â½ the cost as opposed to booking through the resort ($44 versus $88 or something like that). My other tip is the lower pool- kind of hidden but very relaxing versus the noisy upper pool. You know they have this water park- but our kids were maybe a little too old for it and I guess the $20 cost put them off (versus them sneaking daiquiris- go figure). I hope this information helps- I am always so indebted to tips I get from other reviews- so thanks to all of you.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Drexel3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about 6 years ago as a kid with my parent's. My dad had a conference here. I remember it being a truely wonderful place, and the private island they have was to die for. The tram ride is also a pretty unique thing. All in all, you could stay here your entire time in Puerto Rico and never leave the resort. However, I would recommend a trip into San Juan (on a tour) at least once, and the jungle tour as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: kbutts0060
Reviews.Content: We visited for a girlâ€™s long weekend. Although it was a good little ride from the airport, the service we received was great. The front desk staff is awesome! They went above and beyond to help us and always did it with a smile. We asked to upgrade to a better view and they moved us with no issue. Although the staff was nice at the Red Door Spa my massage was just ok but the felicity was relaxing. Beautiful views, nice rooms and had fun at in the casino. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We dont' get it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bayboy56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Conquistador for 4 nights from Nov 12 th to the 16th. The place was absolutely immaculate!!! We read all of the reviews on Trip Advisor that were negative an we were really worried about coming here. We saw no deferred maintenance, no grouchy staff, no problems with mold and wet carpet. Keeping this short, the place is fabulous. The landscaping was perfect. The food was awesome. And the room was great. We stayed at the Marina. (less kids-we were alone) The prices were a little high, but we new that coming in and who really goes to a place like this to save money? We highly recommend this place to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: lrcs
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but I felt compelled to write one after reading what others had written about this hotel. Before our trip, I saw many negative reviews, and we did not have a negative experience at all. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were beautiful. We stayed in the marina, and had a gorgeous view of the ocean, with the Coqui water park right next door. We were there during a time when there were no conventions, and the place was not busy at all. We were often times the only people in the pool. The only negative was the food prices. We rented a car and went to a local grocery store and got bread to make sandwiches for lunch. It would have cost us a fortune if we would have had to pay to eat 3 meals a day there. The Coqui Water Park is the perfect size for little kids. My son is 7 and my daughter is 2 1/2 and they both totally loved it. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: 2BFIT
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the El Conquestador! The hotel is secluded on the other side of the island, so expect an hour drive! It is set on top of a cliff, so the beaches are a boat ride away! The beach ride was actually a new experience for us and we did enjoy the beach one and they do have a bar! :) Our stay was during the most recent hurricane, which actually missed the island, so it was not crowded due to cancellations from the storm! The pools were warm and the weather was absolutely beautiful! Lots of hot tubs as well! The service was good, not great, but I'd hate to see it if the hotel was filled to capacity! Also, this is not an all-inclusive hotel, so remember to bring your wallet! The restaurant overlooking the pool was great for lunch and a quick dinner and the steak restaurant was fantastic, but pricey! They have two workout facilities, one in the spa and one on the cliff. Pay the $25.00 and use the spa workout facility as the one on the cliff is horrible! The golf course was beautiful and required some skill! My husband and I have stayed at a dozen resorts over the last 15 years and we would not go back to this particular resort. We truly enjoy the hospitality of Mexico or Jamaica over Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!!! Average room.”
Reviews.Author: slmnkn
Reviews.Content: We were attending a business meeting Oct. 26-30. We checked in on the 26th and out on Nov. 1., 2008. I brought the entire family - wife and 3 kids; 16, 13, & 8. First the great: The staff were wonderful. They are friendly, helpful, and patient. Service was not dependent on tips (though they were appreciated). The restaurants are world-class. We ate at Blossoms, the Strip House, Stingray Cafe, and other pool area cafes (warning: you will pay dearly for this quality!). The amenities are more than expected: a shuttle boat to the private island leaves every hour, the pools are varied and well-maintained, the shops are all-encompassing. Now the good: the housekeeping is good. We had a clean room every day, plenty of towels (family of 5 remember), and refills on soap,shampoo, etc. There are a number of hotel partnered activities: we went on the rainforest tour, the catarmaran snorkel trip, and the luminescent bay kayak trip. Thought the catarmaran tip was the most expensive ($100 per person) it was the most enjoyable. I recommend it to snorkelers. We also snorkeled at Palomino island but be prepared for a 100 yard trek over rocks and sea grass before you reach the reef. The cat drops you on top of a reef near Icacos Island (highlight of th trip for us). Next time I would travel to the rainforest on my own and hike, rather than with a guide (though our guide was very helpful, friendly, and educated). The trip is aimed at older folks who are not very fit or find exercise a problem. The kayak trip was nice but more of a workout than many in our group realized. The poor guide had to tow 3 boats after a short period of rowing. OK, now the bad: the room quality just doesn't fit the rest of the hotel. We stayed in 3503. The wall plaster was chipped. The room smelled strongly of mold. The decor was dated and just generally "worn". The tub handle was broken. People run up and down the hall at night knocking on doors. Good views from the balcony but beware if you have small children. The railing is a little loose and also aged. My summary: I would return but would try to rent one of the newer "condos" at the south end of the resort rather than a hotel room. Our timing was great. We felt like we had the resort to ourselves at times this last week of October. Not crowded at all early in the week. It did get more crowded on the weekend. There were days when we had Palomino island to ourselves in the late afternoon (except for the staff). Next time I would rent a car and see more of the island but this was a great first time for Puerto Rico and introduction to this wonderful island and its people.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: Noniof7
Reviews.Content: My friend and I didn't stay at the hotel but scheduled a massage at the Golden Door Spa. We visited the property and spa prior to scheduling. When we asked the receptionist for information about their services, she complied but certainly didn't exude a warm personality. We scheduled our massage over the phone, knowing exactly what we wanted. When we arrived the day of our appointment, the same receptionist was there. She handed us our credit card slips to sign. We each noticed that the charge was for 80 minutes, not the 50 minutes we requested. The receptionist was visibly irritated and said that "it's what we ordered". We were adamant that "NO", we ordered 50 minutes. She said, I wrote it down, then picked up the phone and spoke to the massage therapists to say, "they changed their minds". I was getting angry at this point and said, rather loudly, "we did not change our minds, you must have written it down incorrectly". She never backed down. I apologized to our therapists for any inconvenience. Our massage was average at best. We later visited the Gran Melia in Rio Grande. A much better feel to the hotel and staff...everyone was VERY nice and accomodating. We visited their spa and though it's a bit pricier, well worth it. I suggest you stay clear of the El Conquistador and head over to the Gran Melia. We also felt it was a much prettier resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place...could use some work”
Reviews.Author: lysrcruff6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Las Brisas wing. Our clerk was very helpful, gave us a beautiful room with goregous views. I was disappointed at the fact that they charged $15 for wireless inernet since the rooms are already so pricey. Self Parking is $15, I don't usually stay at this nice of a hotel but I assume that's fair? The bathroom was huge, which was a bonus. It didn't have washclothes, which seemed strange. There were 4 big towels, nice but not convenient. The room service took a little long but overall it was a great stay. This is definitely a hotel where you have to drop big bucks so if you can do that, it's a great place to do it at. The king size bed and its pillows were soooo comfortable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money....”
Reviews.Author: LynneVA
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Tripadvisor prior to coming on our trip. The reviews are really all over the board and I truly think it depends on your expectation level of a 5 star resort/vacation. We were part of a large group of realtors and spouses on a business retreat. Unfortunately, the weather did not cooperate as there was rain almost the entire week, with a threat of Hurricane Omar (that luckily missed the island). When you have the extra time on your hand, you tend to notice some of the imperfections (and there are many). The hotel overall is in serious need of maintenance. How they can maintain their 5 star rating is curious and almost laughable. With the current condition of the resort, this should receive 3 stars. The windows leaked throughout the resort and in the rooms. The staff had yellow pool towels rolled up at the base of every window, everywhere. Rugs were soggy... The pools are in need of refurbishing. It looks like my child did the grout work around the pool. The grounds are nice, but lacked maintenance. There is chipped paint, marks of the walls throughout the hallways, and generally feels like half of the staff did not show up to complete the level of work needed to maintain this caliber of hotel. With the anticipated storm, all but 2 of the restaurants closed (they have 21 I think) for two days. The food is expensive, so bring your wallet. Drinks too, and not just alcoholic. An Arizona Ice Tea ($1.00 a can in the States) is $5.75, a coke is $3.75 and the Fuji bottled water in the room is $7.00. We enjoyed a fabulous dinner one night at Stingrays, but it set us back $144. The rooms are a nice size with an incredible view of the ocean and pools. Our room looked like it had been recently renovated (very modern, sleek), however, the bathroom looked original (to what year, I'm not sure!). The grout was dirty and stained, and again was sloppy. There was peeling paint on the celing of our bathroom. The water was luke warm at best on some days. We were lucky enough to finally receive a wash cloth on the last 2 days of our 6 day stay. I'm not sure housekeeping spent more than a minute or so in our room cleaning it. The entrance as you come into the resort has large tiles. Obviously, the constant rain made it difficult to keep this area dry. But the tiles are dangerously slick. Someone in our group fell and injured her finger. Why anyone would think it is a good idea to put slick tile in a main entry way that is susceptible to rain, I don't know. We did not play the slot machines or even enter the casino. They did close the casinos down in anticipation of the storm. The area looked nice. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. I did not see any presence of management throughout our stay. Overall, it seemed like the hotel was generally understaffed. I am hopeful that by sharing our experience will help you make a decision about this resort. Again, I will say, had the weather been beautiful the whole week, our group would not have noticed all of the little details, I'm sure. But this resort has been seriously neglected and hopefully the next group managing it (we learned it is in the process of being sold) will but some serious money and efforts into refurbishing the resort. The potential is certainly there, but given the prices they are currently charging, you expect 5 star quality (in the resort itself, rooms, service). Save your money and pick another resort......or come back when it's been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views but Rundown”
Reviews.Author: Onthebeach09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there for a convention and were told wonderful things about this hotel by those who stayed there a few years ago. What a difference a few years make. First we were picked up by the hotel bus and he told us that we usually would have dinks on the bus (for the 1 to 1.5 hours drive from the airport) but he didn't have time to fill the cooler. We get to the hotel and our room is in the main building and has a great view until it rained that night. We woke up to a carpet that was drenched from the sliding doors almost to the bed. When we asked to switch rooms, we were told nothing was available until the next day with the view and king bed we paid for. The new room wasn't ready until the next night and it was a garden view with two doubles. We went to call the front desk and that room's phone wasn't working. The bellman called the front desk from his cell phone and they hung up on him twice before sending us to another room with and ocean view, but still two double beds. We were too tired of packing and moving rooms that night, so we accepted this room. We went to the casino and the female dealers were friendly, the male dealers were not. It was also took a long time to get a drink when playing the tables. We got back to our room to find water leaking from the ceiling into the bathroom. This was 2am so we waited unitl the next day and moved again. Four rooms in five days. In general the staff was nice but the hotel was in serious need of a cleaning. The pools were dirty and being a pool owner, I looked in the skimmers and found them clogged with debris. They did not clean the skimmers for the next two days. The maid service was horrible. They never vacuumed, we had to take wash clothes from the fitness room because they never left us any, even after asking and they were very frugal with large bath towels. There are several more things...lots of cracked plaster, missing tiles, broken elevators and tram, missing door knobs, etc...etc... but it is suffice to say we will never go there again. One of the staff told us they were purchased a couple of months ago by an investment bankers group. I don't know if the new owners are the cause or not, but this hotel needs better management and some money put into the upkeep.

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador was el magnifico!”
Reviews.Author: RLLYoungDoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything. We actually stayed in the villas (Las Casitas). If you like golf, the course was in good shape and had some amazing views. If you like gambling, the tables were fair and the dealers were fun to talk to. If you prefer just sitting by the pool or on the beach, you have a gazillion to choose from. You definitely have to go to the Yunque Forest and see the waterfalls. The only drawback is that it is a far trip to Old San Juan and the best beaches are on the west side of the island, which is not close to Fajardo.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay....”
Reviews.Author: NSL76
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i came here for a romantic getaway for valentines day. Big Mistake. This resort is huge and you can easily get lost. The room we had was very pretty but it was so far from everything. If you wanted to hang out by the beach you would have to treck a long way to get there. In fact estimate at least 1/2hr to 45min to go to the private island. because once you get to the end of the property you take a elevator to the bottom and then you wait for a boat to take you to it. The private island is nice but deserted there were no seating options or anything and if you got hungry you had to leave the island. We tried the mexican restaurant at the hotel and it was horrible. Thank god we rented a car because we spent most of the time touring the island. Oh and there were tons of families with kids so it's not the ideal place for a romantic getaway. We did a day trip to Calebra island. The boat ride is like 4 hours long and painful. Once on the island you are on your own and it was nice but not worth the effort. We took a small plane back to the hotel because we could not bare the thought of sitting on the boat again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views, but there is ends.”
Reviews.Author: margtrav
Reviews.Content: We have traveled a bit around the world but never went to PR before. We are a family of three, two adults and one 13 year old boy. The property is lovely but very loud, there is music EVERYWHERE. It is difficult to get away from it. The casino is located in the center of the lobby and impossible to escape. The rooms had small gnats that bit us throughout the night. Additionally the hotel booked two conventions for some of the days we wwere there which stressed the seriveces beyond what they capable of. There is a funicular to the private ferry and island that was often out of service. We have stayed at several comparable properties throughout the world and were not impressed with this one. Again, the view of the water is lovely but beyond that the hotel is a lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for any vacationer”
Reviews.Author: crazeecri
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this place could ever get negative reviews. There is something for everybody at this place! It was the perfect solution for all your vacation needs. My husband and I are not all-inclusive type people. So this place was perfect for us. We would start our day off with coffee from starbucks, maybe a banana and a power bar, and then pick lighty during the day and wait for dinner. The food was fantastic! Each meal topped the previous one, every restaurant we tried was just delicious. They have everything there, starbucks, fruit, brick oven pizza, chinese food, steakhouses, you name it! My husband and I are so sick of traveling to Vegas and Disney where there is always so much to do you squeeze it in a few short days and burn yourself out, we just wanted a resort where we could just sit and relax and not have to leave to go anywhere! We felt so safe and so relaxed just hanging out every day on the property, there is so much to see and so much to do. I like it that the beach is only accessible by boat, it was a very short and fun ride, and it made it adventurous, like something fun to do that day, instead of the usual boring stroll to the beach. The water park was awesome! We had more fun than the children there! We picked the best time to go. August 22nd was a very quiet week there, I guess because everyone was going back to school, but the week before was packed and a lot of people were complaining about waiting for the funnicular and elevators and boats, we had such an easy time. There were no waits, no lines, I enjoyed the ride in the funnicular to take us down to another part of the hotel, I loved walking around everywhere exploring learning the resort, it was great! The spa was really nice as well. And no I didn't think this resort or the restaurants were really expensive. MAybe because we are from the NY/NJ area, and we are used to getting bent, we're used to prices like that. In fact a red bull and vodka at the casino is only 7 bucks! NY it's 12!!! If you are all inclusive people, then I would suggest places like the Domincan Republic. But I hate all inclusive. The casino was fun but small, only one black jack table, no poker, no hold em my husband was disappointed. I had great luck playing the slots though, monte carlo was so fun and good to me! Our biggest regret was not taking our 2 year old. Yeah it was nice to get away, but we almost cried when we saw the baby water slide. He would have had a blast. This place is perfect for anyone , families, couples, romantic getaways, just not a place for a group of girls wanting to have fun, because there are no clubs and you are far from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Loving and Returing to the El Conquistador in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: krispykreme335
Reviews.Content: My trip came to an end on August 31, 2008. I must say my daughter, sister and I were sorry to leave the El Conquistador Spa and Resort in Farjado Puerto Rico. Before I left for my trip, I read several reviews on this website and after reading them, I was rethinking if I had made the right decision for our vacation spot, but that thought was quickly put to rest. We arrived on Tuesday August 26, 2008. We took the shuttle provided by the hotel and arrived quickly at our destination. Upon arriving we were greeted by friendly and informative staff, but there was one person in particular who was extremely nice and it was truly a pleasure doing business with him, Mr. Rogelio Santos is truly a professional. We were checked in, with no problems and shown to our room, given a small tour and left to enjoy paradise. My room was an ocean view located near the marina, its also very close to the water park, if you have kids that's where you want to be. Our first dining experience at the hotel was at Cafe Bell Vista. Once again I had read the reviews of how expensive food was and was a little apprehensive, but was I pleasantly surprised at our meal and the price and wonderful service. Everything was freshly prepared and served by our wonderful server Sally. Of course you are going to pay a little more, but that is to be expected but it wasn't outrageous and for the quality and quantity it was well worth it. We also ate at Cafe Caribe. Once again the food was delicious and freshly prepared. I thoroughly enjoyed the arroz con pollo. I also suggest the Ballyhoo, my sister had the steak with rice and beans, she couldn't stop talking about it. Drinks at the hotel are good and roughly the same price as I pay in any restaurant in New York. I chose to avoid the more expensive restaurants upstairs because their prices seemed over the top for what they were offering. We enjoyed several days at the beach and didn't venture out of the hotel because everything was there. The food at the beach was very good. I suggest the grilled chicken sandwich. ( Don't drop any food because the roosters will be right there to eat it. LOL.) The beach also offers horse back riding, which is cheaper than what the hotel offers. If you want to go on tours, they can be a little pricey. Private tours are available outside the hotel. Information for that was given by other guests who were staying there. ( I still have the number if anyone is interested.) If you have a little time on your hands don't hesitate to visit the casino. I would suggest a little more entertainment in the night club downstairs, or maybe even a beach party for the guests that would be nice. I think guests would enjoy a little diversion. LOL. My only complaints are as follows: My daughter has a sensitive stomach, so I had to keep ginger ale on stock. I paid $1.79 for a 10 oz botte. They don't provide anything larger. I spent roughly $20 on soda. I would suggest having larger sizes. The bugs will eat you alive, bring bug spray and anti-itch cream. Dining is outside in some restaurants, the bugs will get you. Since we were there around Labor Day weekend and there was a conference, I noticed that elevators and the funicular were broken during the weekend. It was quickly prepared, but I can only attribute this towards the large groups that began to arrive. It was an inconvenience, but the staff did everything to make sure the inconvenience was minimum. I went there for rest and relaxation and that is what I received. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are very modern and a pleasure to be sleep in. The cleaning staff was always there to provide whatever I needed as well as all the staff. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheesy and a disappointment, not for honeymooners.”
Reviews.Author: BoriquaWifey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I married in Puerto Rico because he is from there and so we elected to honeymoon on the island as well. The first three nights we stayed at a sister hotel to the El Con called the El San Juan Hotel in Isla Verde for the touristy, busy part of our honeymoon...loved it, and will go back. Then we spent 4 nights at the El Conquistador with the Romance Package including airport shuttle, daily breakfast for two, two 50 minute massages, and tax and tariff. good price offered for what we thought would be the "luxurious and romantic" part of our honeymoon...hated it, will NOT go back. First of all, everyone hit the nail on the head with expensive food costs. The cheapest meal was $45, for a cesear wrap and tuna pita, and water to drink. I agree the food was not anything to remember, not fantastic, nor worth the price.
