We were put in the Los Olas section, which is run down, concrete walls chipping, wood railings rotted, and carpeting in the lobby of Los Olas was filthy. Our room had been remodeled and was very pretty, but someone had not cleaned properly. They were very accommodating and moved us to the Marina, a new building and new rooms.....very satisified until we checked into the room (the only one available, according to them) and our premium "ocean view" room was right over the major construction of a water park, Coqui, which started promptly at 8AM and went until 6PM with backhoes, etc. and way too much noise to even sit on our deck overlooking the ocean! The food was outrageously priced.....such as $9.00 for a KIDS hotdog or $14 for a cheeseburger......and the list goes on. Won't go back. People were very friendly, however! Oh, the night kayaking ($89 per person) was a huge disappointment. The lumenated kayaks were nothing more than a Halloween glow stick on the front and back of the boats! Lots of rowing in the dark to see a little bit of luminance in the water......

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: newyorker491
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a large sprawling multilevel monster. It is located on the north-eastern point of the island and is miles from anyplace you would really want to travel. The prices are ridiculous and exorbitant for all commodities. The majority of the food is bland and tasteless and many of the restaurants are second rate. There is no creole food to speak of and what passes for authentic pr/caribe food is not to be eaten. You will be a captive at the resort since there is no local grocery store and the hotel does not sell anything you could use to fashion a meal. If you are unlucky enough to be stuck in one of the rooms serviced by the the funicular railroad, you will be spending much of the day waiting or walking. The room we had was spacious but the a/c was so noisy that it sounded like we had a jet engine or vacuum cleaner in the room when it was on-- we kept it off as much as possible. The staff was friendly enough but loud and noisy. I actually had to call the front desk one night when the security guards decided to have a party outside our room. The internet access is hit and miss since the wifi antennas are located in suboptimal locations. The road west is a nightmare(C-3) since it is stop and go traffic lights and the local drivers have a deathwish. Thus you will be disinclined to travel outside of the resort and sooner or later, if you stay long enough, you will feel trapped and abused by the outrageous prices and poor food. I can recommend a trip to San Juan to eat at Pikayo, the Wilo Benet restaurant in the Museum of Art. The food and service are superb and will make you cry when you must return to the hotel. Overall, I would never set foot in this place again. We stayed here to attend a meeting. Otherwise, we would have moved to the another hotel in San Juan. If you are looking for a Puerto Rican experience, do not stay here. If you are looking for an American type hotel where you can drink to your hearts content, get shafted by the costs, admire the view, compromise on most things, then this is the place for you. The hotel can only get away with such robbery if we pay the price. I say, don't do it. Go somewhere else, eat at local places, and really help the local economy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved El Conquistador Resort & Las Casitas Village”
Reviews.Author: lavidaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico: El Conquistador Resort Las Casitas Village Just sharing with everyone that this amazing Resort will become my personal getaway. My family and I were able to experience this beautiful Resort in two occassions and were extremely satisfied by not only the incredible views, sites and Villas, but, mostly by the special service provided by a staff/Butler of Las casitas Village, Jeffrey Franceshi. From the moment we arrived, he provided us with special attention incuding accomodations for our 9 month old baby and also provided special attenton to my parents. It was a pleasure to have him as our butler and will request him each time. He was always available for us and very diligent. I have traveled to many locations on the globe, but, this is definitely my favorite. Please remember this staff member of the El Conquistador and experience the excellent service. This resort offers wonderful grounds, pools, private islands and entertainment for the whole family. The hotel staff are very friendly and always attend you with a smile. Experience this resort and it's natural beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Blockie
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this beautiful resort. The atmosphere was relaxing, the room was luxurious and the staff was friendly. the pools are beautiful and a pleasure to lay beside. It is also the first hotel I have stayed with a private island and ferry service to and from. the food is also of excellent quality all over the resort. However, as any experienced traveler knows, it is the staff at a resort that can surely make the difference between an average experience or a wonderful one. I can specifically comment on three staff members who above and beyond the call of duty to help me, Nilmari, Alejandro and Yesenia. Any hotel or business would be privileged to have staff as personable and accommodating as they are. I hope the resort appreciates them as much as I did. Therefore, I not only recommend a stay here but insist that it is an experience that should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Too much -- in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: 4Bakes
Reviews.Content: My family (me, husband, 2 children (under age 10)) stayed at El Con from 1/26 - 2/2/08. I relied heavily upon this website before leaving for our visit and was glad it prepared me for the resort. Here is my take on it: Location: The drive from the airport to the resort was about 50 minutes...really far when travelling with children who had been up since 4 AM; and, with everyone ready to start vacation. We had the prearranged shuttle waiting for us, so, there was no time at the airport for us to eat (and the airline ran out of food before our seats were served) so needless to say, we were tired & hungry. The shuttle had a cooler with water bottles (HINT: grab a number of them and put them in your fridge once you get into your room, because the resort price for bottled water is about $3/bottle). Pulling into the resort you immediately see that it is well decorated and has beautiful grounds. However, the resort was far too big for me. I felt as though I was in a town. Nothing is really within a quick walk. Check In/Rooms: The hotel staff member we worked with was very helpful (Joanne) however, checking in was a problem for us. We had made a prior request for an ocean view room that would be near the main hotel area (versus taking the funicular to/from our room); and, we were told we had an ocean view room (2 queen beds) down the bottom of the funicular. The only ocean view room available that was not in the funicular area was a king size bed and, to accommodate the kids, we were told that they would bring in an air mattress! Now, that was not acceptable to us...our children were also on vacation and we were not paying those high rates for them to sleep on an air mattress. The only ocean view room with 2 queens in the main hotel part would be available in 3 days -- so, we took that one and stayed the first few nights in the king room and the air mattress. The first air mattress lost all of its air within 2 hours; and, the staff needed to come in the room and set up a new one (while my kids and I sat up in my bed in our PJs...an uncomfortable situation!). This ordeal took until 10:30 PM to sort out and we were very tired and hungry and not real pleased with El Con at this point! (HINT: if you are placed in this same situation, and are told you need to use an air mattress in a king bed room, make sure that you get one of the larger king bed rooms. There are 2 size rooms with king beds...the first one that they tried to use the air mattress in was so small that we literally needed to side step through the room in single file to get dressed, watch TV, get to the beds, etc. After complaining about that we were moved to a larger king size room which held the air mattress a little better and again because it was temporary (just 3 days) we suffered through). Now this next comment is going to sound odd, but, it was an issue: there are no blankets or covers. The room was always very cold and we switched back and forth between having the air set on 74 degrees or turned off and just ran the ceiling fan. We called guest services for 2 blankets, but, 4 blankets would have been better! The bathroom was very large and clean. My only complaint with the shower was in our room that had the 2 queen beds, and, that was that we never had hot water. It didn't matter if we showered first thing in the morning, afternoon or evening, our water was always tepid. And, when we moved the nozzle to "hot" there was a loud vibrating noise that ran the whole time we showered. Pools & Beach: The pools are kept very clean. The water temperature was fine, and, there are pool noodles, balls, towels, etc. (which did not have a service fee or charge attached to the use of these things --- that was surprising because with the exorbitant fees we paid for food/drinks/services for everything else, I would have expected a $20/person/day charge for the towels and pool usage!). Almost every day we took the boat ride to the private island to go to the beach (the resort is not directly on the beach...so if you want sand/snorkeling you need to get on the boat to get there). The food at the beach as well as the pool service (at the resort itself) is very expensive and nothing unique to Puerto Rico. It is very standard fare (burgers, chicken, salads, sandwiches). The drinks were all expensive and I am still sickened by the money we spent on food/drinks each day. Staff: The staff (at all places: pool, beach, front desk, concierge, restaurants, cafes, etc.) were always pleasant, quick, helpful, but that didn't take away the pain of the expense! Kids Activities: All I can say here is "it will cost you". There was one morning that my husband was golfing, and, I had to work for 1.5 hours. So, I put my kids in the kids club. Imagine my surprise to learn that the kids club is not free -- it is $45/child for 1/2 day (9:00 - 12:00, no lunch provided) and $75/child for a full day (lunch and snack provided). Yes, it was $90 for 1.5 hours. Restaurants within the Resort: The cost of food was astronomical. I saw a lot of comments about it before we left and somehow it didn't hit home until we experienced it...it is crazy what you will pay to feed a family of 4, 3 meals a day. And, the taste of the food is not very good and actually seemed worse given the cost! There were no places within the resort that offered local food. I kept forgetting I was on vacation because the menu choices were that what you get at home (but double the price). Water Park: The water park was supposed to open in December (which was a big reason we booked in November for a late January/early February stay). Well the opening got pushed back several times and it finally opened at 11 AM on the day before we left the resort. Due to the inconvenience of the opening day/time, we were allowed in for free. That was great! (Normally the fees are $20/adult; $15/child, I think). We spent the entire day at the water park and it is a lot of fun. I am glad that it was not opened the entire time we were there because the daily ticket prices would have just added to our outrageous bill. Checking Out: Read your bill extra carefully. We had a self parking fee on our bill for each day we were there -- and we didn't even have a car! The staff was great about taking it off immediately. There were also some charges that we did not expect due to taxes being added after we signed off on our bills already (example: we ordered food while on the beach; before you place your order you need to show your resort card and give your room #, then, the order is placed on your master bill with the resort. before you leave the beach for the day, you 'check out' with the beach staff, and you sign off on your bill. we would look it over and make sure the right number of drinks/food were noted; and, then we would add a tip. the total that we would sign off for would be about $45 (example only). yet, on the last day when the charges were all printed out for us to check-out, that $45 charge would show up as a $49 charge because they would add taxes to the bill after we signed it!) Feeling trapped: Okay, my final complaint --- I felt like we were stuck on the property (we did not rent a car due to the expense of rental and parking each day at the resort ($16/day to self park) and we felt forced to pay ridiculous prices in order to "survive". There are a few local restaurants within walking distance for adults, but, not for those with small children so we did not opt to walk 15-minutes to try out the food at these places. Overall, we spent an awful lot of money on the room and our meals/drinks and nothing felt luxurious or extravagant... it was all very ordinary and we were left feeling like we were ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Jan. 2008 trip”
Reviews.Author: tamlyn63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the El Con Jan. 6-11, 2008. The resort is really spectacular, and you WILL pay for that. Fortunately we were there through a trip with one of my chemical vendors, which included our airfare, ground transfers, breakfast every day, and a couple of dinners. The resort is sprawled out on 3 different levels. Be prepared to do a LOT of walking, especially if your room is on the marina level like ours was. The rooms was very big, very clean, and very well appointed. My only problem with our room was that it was on the first level right above the Ballyhoo Bar & Grill, so we did have a little noise on a couple nights we retired early. Prices at the resort are pretty outrageous in my opinion. $9 hot dogs, $14 burgers, etc. We ate at the Cafe Caribe the first night. Don't remember what I had, but it was $$$$$. We had a welcome buffet thru my vendor on our 2nd night which was very good and free! Third night we ate at the Strip House with 2 other couples and our bill was $700 plus $140 tip. 2 bottles of wine, 6 entrees, 6 sides, and 3 bottles of water. Ask for tap water or you pay$7 per btl for FIJI water. Entrees don't come with sides, those are priced separate. I had Mahi $32 and garlic mashed potatoes $11. It was good but not THAT good. We discovered too late that if you go down to the marina and walk west you come out in an area with a lot of local bars and restaurants. We did go there for a few beers after dinner and $2-3 per beer compared to $6 at the resort. We could have had lobster at one place for under $25. I would not venture out walking here unless you're in a group. There were 16 of us. Also rent a car! We got smart and rented one and went to Walmart and the grocery store. We bought beer, soda, rum n mixers,deli sandwhich fixings and snacks, and took it back to our room. That's what we ate for the remainder of our stay except for my vendors farewell dinner. To think of the money we could have saved if I had known beforehand! Palimino Island is great, but take your own food and snacks and drinks. I took ours in a small collapsible cooler from the Walmart. We pretty much just laid by the pool or on the beach the whole time except for one day a power cat to Culebra and Culebrita through www.eastwindcats.com I highly recommend them! Don't be surprised to see celebrities while staying at this resort either, we saw Mariah Carey and "Da Brat". Rumors were rampant thet Johnny Depp was also there, but if he was we didn't see him. All in all, the resort is great, staff is outstanding, views ore superb, and the rooms were impressive. This type of resort is not a place I'd normally stay because it is so expensive. Would I go back? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “I've Stayed at Better Resorts”
Reviews.Author: travwiz
Reviews.Content: Before traveling to Puerto Rico, I relied heavily on this site for tips, pictures, ect. and was determined to give my perspective of the El Conquistador when I returned. I like to travel but I will warn those of you reading this that I am very particular when it comes to where I stay and what I receive for my money. While I'm not cheap, it is very important to me when I'm on vacation that the accommodations are the same or better than what I'm accustomed to at home. With that said, here's my review. Location: Really far from the airport (about 45 minutes) and the same distance to most local shopping or sightseeing activities. The cab ride from here to town will cost you more that what it's worth so if you stay here, plan to be here your entire stay. However, the location is beautiful and the Resort is decorated really nicely. I recommend the boat ride to the private island for a day of fun in the sun as the El Conquistador is not directly on the beach. After 3 days of an all expense paid, job related event, my husband and I gladly relocated to a hotel closer in town and near the airport for the remainder of our stay in PR. Food: Sadly, the food was not what you would expect from a Resort style facility. Not only was it insanely expensive, it was not very good for what you were asked to pay. You could buy two gallons of ice cream for what they charged for two scoops. Unfortunately, you're stuck on the property and almost forced to pay if you want a treat. Rooms: I'm personally not a fan of platform beds so I was not pleased at having to fall down into the bed instead of crawling up. The mattress was too soft so if you have back problems, you're in trouble. I've been home for a week now and I still have sore muscles in my neck from the soft mattress and pillows. I'm an extra firm fan so if soft is your thing, you'll be right at home. The bathroom was nicely remodeled and clean. It was also surprisingly large. I did however have one complaint. Every time we took a shower, the water would drain really slowly in the tub and before long, I would be standing is water up to my ankles. I called and requested maintenance but we checked out before the problem was fixed. This is a really pricey resort so please consider your options carefully. Frankly, I would recomend the Marriott in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the El Con Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: mmt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the El Con in January with Travelzoo promotion that included breakfast for 2 for five nights. We are a 30 something couple, and had a wonderful time. We were very concerned about the reviews here referring to theft, but this turned out to be a non-issue...just exercise common sense and be careful and you'll be fine. The resort is beautiful, breathtaking grounds and golf course. We stayed in the main hotel area overlooking the main pool and our room was renovated, but I did not like the fact that we didn't have a balcony and the door entrance to our room was outside - I hate hearing high heels and the rolling of housekeeping and luggage carts on the cement outside our door.... but it wasn't bad - if the window was closed, we never heard sound from the events right outside our windows and definitely never heard those in the rooms next to us except for the doors slamming sometimes. Soundproofing is really good...If you want a balcony, and indoor carpeted entrances, then book Las Brisas. We couldn't get this wing because there was a convention there that had booked the whole wing. More about that - the hotel will not tell you if there is a convention booked during your upcoming stay, and on our second day there this company really took over the resort. It wasn't terrible, but we spent a lot of time, over an hour, at the harbor waiting to go to the beach because they chartered one of the two catamarans that takes you to the private island. There were some other regular hotel guests that were really steamed about this, and I totally don't blame them...but of course the resort is going to cater to the big group that's spending tons of money for their employees...there was a wedding on the first night we arrived, and another group coming in after the first convention left....seems to be nonstop conventions and private events. Also the hotel DID close the main pool area two of our five nights for the private events.... we could still go to the Las Olas pool area, and there is a hot tub there as well..so really it wasn't that big of a deal. We had breakfast everyday in Las Brisas - very nice buffet, $25 a person, or you can order a la carte, but it's resort prices so be forewarned...we had breakfast included so we took advantage of this. There is a Starbucks on site, and another cafe with ice cream and late night sandwiches, but but we never ate at any of the other restaurants, except the one by the main pool. We ordered a brick oven pizza and took it back to our room and it was delicious, like $16.00 for 12 inch I think....the resort is very family and child friendly, and beside from 1 very badly behaved tyrannical British 4 year old, (you could seriously hear this kid coming from a mile away...and then we would laugh as his parents tried to catch up with him and stop his terrorizing of hotel staff and guests)....the kids were not a problem, they have great programs to keep them busy and happy and out of the adults' peaceful vacations... the beach is beautiful with padded chairs and shade huts, watersports and waitered bar service, bring beach shoes it is very rocky, and not good for snorkeling unless you go over the cliff to the other side, but it's treacherous among the coral and rocks.....very shallow, warm water. We were lucky every day was sunny and 90 degrees....you can rent a small sail hobie for $45 and go out to the Palominito island which is tiny but much smoother and sandier.....The bio luminescent bay tour is fun - just walk down to the left of the harbor and you can sign up with a company - you shouldn't pay more than $40 a person to go.....quite an experience. There will be many island dogs and cats laying around and if you decide to eat in one of the local restaurants around the park where the bio bay tours set off from, the dogs will follow you around, don't be scared. We took the ferry from Fajardo to Vieques and (an hour and a half) and went to Media Luna Beach - the ferry is only $2.25 and the dock is very close to the resort - if you have a rental car (we did) you can drive there in less than 10 minutes. Media Luna is a TRIP to get to (get a cab) but very unspoiled - again, bring beach shoes, there are not much fish to see but plenty of stingrays in this amazingly white soft sandy beach. Bring towels and water as well - no amenities here....we also went to Old San Juan (about 50 minutes from resort)- there were five cruiseships in that evening and lots of action, and the rainforest El Yunque was so exciting, after about a mile and a half hike up you will find a waterfall you can swim in, only 25 minutes from the resort with a $3.00 per person entrance fee!! There is so much to do in Puerto Rico we cannot wait to go back and explore the caves, and Culebra, we just ran out of time but we really recommend this resort for your home base!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with the Updates”
Reviews.Author: Manatee
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the El Con last year for a convention I was interested in seeing how the renovations had come along when I found out the same convention would be returning this year. I was very impressed. I was in one of the renovated Las Brisas ocean view rooms. Very clean, crisp, bright and modern. The bed was very comfortable and the room as a whole was spacious. No problems at all with anything electrical or water pressure. I arrived back to my room each night to a turned down bed, chocolates on the pillow, and the radio playing. I had a perfect view of the ocean and could hear the singing tree frogs at night. The new convention area of the hotel is beautiful and there are plenty of different sized rooms for use for whatever size group might attend. The staff was very helpful and attentive during the entire stay. Check in was smooth and quick. Eva was very pleasant and courteous. All of the staff that I encountered said hello and were willing to help. I tried Stingray Cafe this year. The sea bass was excellent and the waitress was willing to substitute items if asked. The restaurant was busy, but I did not feel rushed and the atmosphere was very nice. There are new stores in the hotel and a Starbucks. I think the hotel is definitely getting better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: peporican
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Conquistador early this year. First, the service was great. All of the staff members were very helpful. In particular, Marisol Bosque setup my reservation and I could not have been more pleased with her service and her ability to accommodate me in short notice. If anyone is looking to book a vacation with a group they should definitely ask for her. I will absolutely stay at this hotel every time I visit PR. The rooms were spacious and had great views. In addition to Marisol, Diana Cortes was very helpful during my checkout process. The Spa was by far the best that I have ever been to. I could not get enough of the spa treatment. Overall, I had a great time. Thanks for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “How SAD”
Reviews.Author: amasmom
Reviews.Content: If you were to be blindfolded and dropped off at this place the only thing you would know is that you were on an island somewhere. My husband and I are not golfers and the prettiest part of the hotel IS the golf course. We stayed in Las Vistas wing in which you were awakened to what seemed like a jack-hammering noise probably due to old water pipes. The elevators were broken since the day we arrived and we were on the fifth floor. There was no tropical atmosphere in your room whatsoever. The food was beyond below expectations. Again, being in Puerto Rico a person would expect to have some kind of local foods to sample. If we would have eaten at IHop the food would have been better. We attended a semi-formal event in which we were served hockey-pucks. Thankfully we were there on a business reward otherwise my review would prabably be worse. I feel bad for the fact that our company had to dish out money to this place where we could have had more fun in South Florida. The only good point is that the staff is friendly. The worst part of the whole place was the fact that if you wanted to go to San Juan or elsewhere, which YOU wanted to, it was an hour and a half out. We spent half a day on sitting on buses. There are plenty of hotels within three miles of the airport which are cheaper and better worth your time. It is truly false advertising for them to state they are a luxury hotel. Whoever owns this hotel is truly milking it for the business events. Two stars at best. This is the type of hotel which makes you not want to returnt to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...Great Resort...Golf Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TBoonePickens
Reviews.Content: I am a (25) Year old reviewer and am very blessed/fortunate to have stayed at many caribbean resorts from punta cana and aruba to st johns/thomas, nieves, barbados, turks caicos, cancun and jamaica..I ONLY say this because i have a fairly good grasp on caribbean travelling..So anyways I stayed with my girlfriend in a las casitas guestroom and the room was great and the grounds are very lush and well maintained like a private golf course...The actual golf course was great but very hot, geez was it hot during my stay, bring sunblock. I played as a single golfer and saw monkeys and mammoth iguana on nearly every hole, very cool...So about the resort you know food expensive and service may or may not be sub par, this happens on any resort and this one is huge so get over it.....Palomino island is great for lounging and i mean special/great awesome place/ but def not snorkeling like st john/barbados..I dont snorkel so i always brought my gap wedge and chipped on their chipping/putting surface on Palomino very cool, when i wasnt swimming .Basically for new insight that other reviewers havnt touched on if you want great nightlife go to Cancun, Cabo or Aruba....If you want the best of the best ever go to Sandy Lane Barbados or 4 Seasons Nieves/St Kitts but beside these aforementioned destinations this can not be beat.....I would never stay at a San Juan resort or dominican republic after going here. The Cove at Atlantis is cool but this place is better than that in some ways...BTW Strip House is very good like NYC good and we also went off site at the marina entrance and at local food while drinking beer we bought at convenience store..you can walk wherever you please while drinking from golf to the pool to the island and restaurants...Tip: go offsite and eat where the locals are its funny...TIP: Also i bought couple hundred dollars of tequila/gin at the duty free shop in the san juan airport for dirt cheap and than had top shelf liquor on heavy ice waiting for my signif other and I whenever we wanted TIP: Also for the $65 you pay for the shuttle I filled a duffle bag with about 25 bottles of spring water and had bottles of water on heavy ice during our entire trip for free....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: evamaria26
Reviews.Content: The resort location is stunning, the newly renovated rooms are trendy and comfy and the pools and private island beautiful. Great golf course. However the service and staff is not top level. We received a cold welcome/greeting at the reception, and didnt get access to our room until 5pm, even if we were promised the room at 3pm. When calling concierge, the line was often busy with no waiting system. Service in the pool bars/restaurant was below average and on out on the island we waited 20 minutes to order a drink in the bar. It was not busy at all but the bartender ingnored us and a another staffer was just hanging out and advised he "only served food". By the main pool area, i specifically asked if a certain sandwich came with fries, and the waiter said "yes". It then came without, and when i asked for the fries I had to wait and was then charged extra for them. Not the end of the world, but with the rates of the El Conq, you expect top notch service. I still recommed this resort though since the location is stunning and amenities are very good. We stayed 3 nights/4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive on all Fronts!”
Reviews.Author: silverspot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Puerto Rico for 5 nights, and we stayed at this hotel as well as the InterContinental. The El Conquistador is about an hour's drive from the airport, which makes it feel like a tranquil getaway yet doesn't take 5 hours of driving to get to. Compared to Intercontinental, which is basically in the middle of a semi-sketchy area, this place was paradise. We stayed in the new tower that had just been renovated. It was super clean, modern, and chic, and had an incredible view of the ocean. The resort is a self contained unit, ideal for families or couples who want to get to their destination and then just relax, without the trouble of renting a car, etc. There are multiple restaurants and shops. The pools are beautiful and you can't possibly walk the grounds without being in absolute awe of the views. Everywhere you turn, beauty. The hotel has exclusive access to a small island, and you basically get an i.d. bracelet each morning, which allows you to take a boat (free) from the hotel to the island. Once you arrive, you'll find lawn chairs and water sport equipment rentals available at average prices. There's a small cafe with basic burger/salad options. There's a teeny tiny island (like 20 yards across!) that you can kayak to or swim, if you're so inclined. The snorkeling in this part of Puerto Rico is disappointing, if you're used to seeing lots of sea life when snorkeling other islands. There was lots of dead (maybe bleached) coral, and it was tough to determine if it was from hurricane damage or global warming. We chartered a sailboat (I recommend Erin Go Braugh) and they took us to some great places that were accessible by boat only. Still, it's no St. John! We had no problem with service. In fact, the woman at the front desk was an absolute gem. Very helpful. If you're looking for a place where you can relax by a pool, or have an adventurous day scouting a teeny tiny postcard-esque island, this is a place for you. It's also within driving distance of a lovely rain forest trail, so you aren't limited to staying at the resort. There's so much to do at this resort - I can imagine that this place is great for families with children. If we find ourselves in Puerto Rico again, we won't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A consistently great family resort.......”
Reviews.Author: schwa
Reviews.Content: We just finished our 4th stay in a row at Christmas time at The ElCon resort....Both my sons and wife are ready to book for 2008. If you like incredible five star service...perfect weather....quiet safe beaches....excellent hiking trails...gorgeous golf courses....intense spa treatments.....go stay and enjoy...the casitas are outrageous...we had a beautiful full moon and stars each night in the clear skies on our balcony.. our butlers made you feel like royalty..the casino was big enough to enjoy without getting lost ... the new water park is fun....the new high speed boats have improved the travel to the beach to under 8 minutes...you will never want to leave even though the rain forest and bioluminescence trips are worth while. The renovations are all done very tastefully and with greatg thought....the management shouild be applauded at their efforts.....

Reviews.Title: “Working hard to emerge as a beautiful butterfly”
Reviews.Author: scubasam
Reviews.Content: As with most of the folks on the Travel Board, we read very mixed reviews about the El Conquistador Resort & Golden Door Spa and decided to give it a try for after Christmas & New Years. After everything room wise etc, we recommend this resort, read on. We normally stay at small boutique style hotels but wanted a large resort to stay on property and use their facilities â€“ Pool, Restaurants etc. We are in our early 50â€™s with No kids traveling with us and we are travel professionals. As with previous reports, this one has a lot of details â€“ some things were left out as they were already mentioned on the board. We decided to take the resorts motorcoach service from the airport and we were met in the baggage claim area and advised where to pick up the bus. The bus ride took about an hour, bathroom on board was in rough shape and non-useable and the bus had a musty-moldy smell from the A/C. I thought what did we get into? The return trip in the motor coach went better with hardly any smell â€“ not sure about the bathroom. Use their motorcoach service, unless you plan to be off property, you can save the drive out and car rental/parking fees. The bus has complementary refreshments on board. We were met at the bus and our bags were removed and we went to the main reception area for check in. At check in we were assigned â€“ A Las Caitas Village North suite â€“ Oceanview. The room was large with a full kitchen â€“ large bathroom, King bed and separate sitting area with TV, nice stereo & DVD systems and according to my wife had a nice charm to it. However, our worst fear hit â€“ we were in a non-renovated room â€“ musty smell â€“ couch-carpets were dirty and bedroom ceiling was dirty. We were not happy â€“ no rooms were available for change but we were assured that a change could & would happen the next day. Note: We understand the 5500 & above Las Caitas area was renovated. After speaking with the front desk, based on our room rate, and explaining our problem an Oceanview Marina room was assigned to us. What a difference! Large single room, one TV, nice balcony, great view of the marina and ocean, nice Bathroom and modern (Clean). This room lacked the Charm but was much nicer. I would recommend the marina area. Restaurants: 1st night â€“ Las Brisas Restaurant â€“ Billed as Caribbean & Latin American food â€“ Roasted chicken $ 19.50 very large half a chicken â€“ excellent Paella (Seafood with rice) $ 26.25 Fair â€“ Dry Service for the evening was typical Caribbean â€“ Would recommend the roasted chicken. Last morning- Best overall value for Buffet Breakfast, Great food worth the $25.pp. Las Brisas offers a Full American breakfast â€“ It was great. 2nd night â€“ Strip house â€“ Great steak house â€“ Bibb Salad with house cheese dressing - Great $ 15. Clams Casino â€“ stay away from them - $ 13. Lamb Rack â€“ Fantastic â€“ Best I have ever eaten and cooked perfect $ 44. 10 oz Petit Filet Mignon â€“ was cooked perfect as ordered $39. Creamed spinach side was great $ 11. Overview all Service this night was ok, kitchen was very slow but the manager came over offered us a free desert & waiter brought us a round of drinks. 3rd night â€“ New Years Eve â€“ Otelloâ€™s â€“ Italiano Calamari - $ 14. was very good Large Veal Chop â€“ Flattened and breaded - very dry $39. Scrimp Scampi â€“ was ok â€“ no garlic flavor $ 35. Food here was so, so but service was great â€“ very busy evening. 4th night â€“ We were going to go to Stingray CafÃ© but decided to go back to the Strip house. Tuna $ 32. was great Chocolate cake desert $ 16. well worth it, feeds the table Filet was again great. Service was fantastic and the food came out within a reasonable time frame. Major recommend. Breakfasts were at the Casitas CafÃ© in the Las Casitas Village area â€“ average $ 50. for two. (20% tip included here automatically) service was ok or CafÃ© Caribe coffee shop - $ 28. for breakfast for two. Lunch - Marina â€“ we were told upfront by the manager that something was going on and it will take them about 20 to 30 min for our food once we ordered â€“ since we had time we stayed and 10 min. after our order was taken our food arrived. Chicken wrap $ 12. Shrimp wrap $ 14. Both were very good. Recommend restaurant Virgin Burger â€“ Main Pool â€“ Chicken Wrap $14. was very good Frozen Mojitos excellent CafÃ© Caribe â€“ coffee shop â€“ Breakfast was ok lunch â€“ Cuban sandwich $ 15. dry. Hit Drakes Bar upstairs for an evening cocktail or two before dinner no kids under 18 allowed. Starbucks was very busy throughout our stay. Sweet Corner CafÃ© was real good as well. Activities: Casino - Oh well what can I say you win some and you lose some but we had fun. 18+ Palomino Island â€“ Great boat ride over and very relaxing â€“ bring sunscreen â€“ was very nice. Plenty of beach lounge chairs available. The Coqui Waterpark- since there were a lot of kids - young/teen and young at heart around they opened the waterpark on limited 2 daily - 4 hour basis by room numbers. The slides were great, they had a large fast body slide, body slide with curves and a slide for tubes into the lazy river ride plus a swimming pool - see pictures. You could not hold the kids back they were so excited. Once officially opened it will be beautiful and a great place to spend time with the family. Estimated February. Main Swimming Pool â€“ Great service around the pool, people offering fresh fruit, cool water sprays and cold towels. Plus other servers taking drink & food orders. Teen Club â€“ Based on all the teens/families for the holidays â€“ they had a teen club with DJ/Soda etc available. Heard it was a success, the staff hopes they keep it open â€“ the teens need a place to go in the evening especially if you offer them a waterpark during the day! Spa & Golf course looked great â€“ we didnâ€™t partake. Overall the hotel was great, we had a wonderful time. Food & Service overall was Ok, somewhat expensive. They did a great job handling the families and reflecting a holiday â€“ Festive mood. New Years Fireworks at Mid-night were long and beautiful. Notes: Make sure you are in a renovated room or suite â€“ Many complaints here from not just us. We noticed most complaints in general were service or food wise at restaurants, room type etc at Front Desk were handled professionally by all. Renovations are going on around the property but it did not disturb our stay. Bar drinks averaged around $10. to $15. Special thanks to Magda â€“ Front Desk. Great Service & greetings. As I said in my title â€“ They are working hard to emerge as a beautiful butterfly, go and enjoy yourself. Write with questions and we hope this report helps make your stay extra special. PS One major note - All staff said Hello, Good Evening and after New Years â€“ Happy New Year Overall staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It will be nice when it is fully renovated, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: StuckinNY
Reviews.Content: We booked a 5 day, last minute getaway to El Conquistador for Christmas at a great price, or so we thought. We knew a bunch of people who had stayed there and raved about everything except its location- about an hour away from San Juan airport. So we thought it was a safe bet. I even did my homework on trip advisor, and noticed that some people mentioned some renovations being done on grounds. So I called the hotel and asked about that. Two different people told me that everything was fully opened and the only thing being worked on was the Coqui Water park (due to open Dec 2007). So off we went. First thing I hear when we check in in the lobby? Drills! First thing I smell? Paint. Lovely. But not enough to ruin the trip. Our room was renovated and big and nice and clean (part of the 50% of the hotel rooms that were available as the rest of the rooms were in fact being worked on). The pools were pretty but 2 of them were closed for 3 out of the 5 days we were there. The restuarant on the beach? Closed. Virgin Burger (poolside food service?) Closed for 2 days. The worst part was that no one at the hotel had a good handle of what was going on. The front desk continued to tell us things were open when we were standing there and they were closed. The people taking reservations (we called to test them) told us the water park was complete and open! They did let people in on strict schedules the day we left, but there were still men gluing fake grass on the ground and I would say it was still only 89% done. (it will be good entertainment for kids when it is finished). The other part that disappointed us was that there was NO ONE there! Yes I know it should be nice to have a huge resort to yourself, but there is something creepy about being the ONLY people in a restaurant at 7:30pm! The positives: Easy to get seats at the beach/pool everyday, the service at restaurants and by housekeeping was very attentive. Maria the poolside server was great she brought me waters all day long (I am pregnant!) while another male server told us he was too busy when we asked him for something! The hotel did fill up a but more closer to Christmas, which made it feel more alive. The casino was fun but it is hardly the world class gambling mecca they claim it to be. So maybe we were just there at the wrong time. The bottom line is it is a pretty place, will be even nicer when it is complete, but don't trust what they tell you over the phone! It is a quick easy flight from NY, and it's remote and there is a lot to keep you busy if you don't want to make the drive to San Juan. Give it a shot but maybe wait till next winter!

Reviews.Title: “Renovations looking good!”
Reviews.Author: johnnyjumpstart
Reviews.Content: I was in a group of 300 people staying at the resort for 4 nights to play golf in the Ambassador's Cup. This is my 3rd year at the resort & the hotel is looking much better than it has in the past! I was in one of the newly renovated rooms which were excellent. The rooms have a very light colored, white/yellow oriented color scheme. 26" lcd TVS are now standard. The rooms are totally new including all furniture, carpets, wall paint & complete bathrooms.High end toiletries are plentiful. Even the balconies are new. My only complaint is that the very light carpeting in the hallways is already in need of cleaning. There are inroom safes & refrigerators as well. All the shops have been redone and a STARBUCKS added. The hotel has purcahsed 2 new high speed ferries to take guests to the private beach island now cutting the transit to only 7 minutes! The new wing added to the hotel since last season is a wonderful place for a convention or wedding . If u can wrangle one of the new rooms then your stya will be wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “stayed in the hotel and the Villas”
Reviews.Author: x-gadget-x
Reviews.Content: I took my family to the El conquistador last year. We went at the end of president's week in February, when many schools are closed in the Northeast. Since my little guy is too young for school, we went Thursday to Thursday. As a result, we were unable to get into the Villas until Saturday. So I can write about the experience of being in the El Conquistador as a hotel guest, and also as a guest in the Villas, which are attached. The hotel..a new wing was under construction, and the existing one's rooms were somewhat tired. We all came down with something like the Norwalk virus, so we were grateful that the staff happily brought us towels, new sheets, etc. in the middle of the night.So we didn't explore much at first... Then we moved to the Villas, and WOW are they great! A good kitchen, a nice living room, even made us sick-folk comfortable. Once we recovered, we began to explore. The boat ride to the island for beaching is quick, and lots of fun for my little guy. The island itself has natives: iguanas and chickens, along with the snack bars and rentals. Close by is the El Yunque rainforest, good hiking, even some tame enough for 3 year olds. We loved the Villas (although they aren't a bargain) and would go again, but avoiding President's week is my preference...

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: jlrb
Reviews.Content: We arrived late our first night and went straight to bed. The next morning while on the beach at Palamino both my husband and I noticed we had small bites on our feet and ankles. We thought it was from sand flees. The next day we had a few more and that day we hadn't gone to the beach at all. It wasn't until the fourth day when I started welting up that I thought something was wrong. When we were at the airport another couple who was on the same trip mentioned that they had bites all over their bodies and they were having to take benadryl and they were sure it was BED BUGS!. By the time our plane landed I had welts all over my legs and arms. I went to my doctor right away and he also said that it was more than likely BED BUGS and that I was having an alergic reaction to the bites. When you wake up with bumps that you didn't have when you went to bed....it can only be one thing...BED BUGS. I would never go back to that resort and now I'll have difficulty staying anywhere until the mattress, linens and headboard have all been inspected.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever”
Reviews.Author: terrysimon
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this was the nicest resort we have ever stayed at and the people where very friendly. The resturants where 5 star all the way. Room service was great and the drinks where fantastic. I highly recomend going to the Palamino Islands also and take in the Rain Forrest. Thank you El Conquitador for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: wwmmNewYork
Reviews.Content: 12/3/07 - To all who are considering El Conquistador as a destination - do not hesitate!!! My boyfriend and I spent 4 fabulous days this past November at this resort and loved every minute!! Our room was great, right next to the to the water with a balcony. The room was immaculate, soft sheets, comfortable bed with a modern decor. I believe these rooms were all just re-done. The food and service were exceptional! The views from the hotel are spectacular! Everyone at the hotel could not have been nicer, more helpful and very funny! Marisol Bosque (I hope I have her last name right) at the front desk was wonderful about extending our stay after we decided not to go on to Vieques because we loved El Conquistador so much! She was a sweetheart and also gave us great tips on exploring the island. We will definitely be contacting her to help book our next stay there! We are very much looking forward to going back with our family and friends!!! Thanks to everyone for making our trip so memorable!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: indexman
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the El Conquistador. This was a great place to get away and relax. I ate at the Italian restaurant and the stingray cafe. Both were good. However the Japanese restaurant was the best. The sushi chef working that night was great! The local food and environment around the bend was quite a good experiance also. Overall the staff was courteous. However, upon one of my visits to the front desk I happened upon a young lady named Marilyn Lopez who I believe went out of her way to help me; she is a superstar for the resort! The landscape and scenery of this resort is beautiful and like no other. Overall everything was nice. Bring money because this is a real vacation spot. I will be back to the El Conquistador!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: billbermudez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spectacular. It's Beautiful. The views are like a wonderful Dream. I was taken with the Employees there: We were given the VIP treatment by the following Employees: Marisol Bosque, Marilu Nieves and Madalin Trinidad, Outstanding employees. The food at the Italian rest. was excellent. But you must come with money or stay home. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Resort, but be prepared to pay”
Reviews.Author: Goblu
Reviews.Content: This resort is truly spectacular, as it sits 300 ft above the water, which provides amazing views, particularly at sunrise. The grounds are a tropical paradise. The milti-tiered pools allow you to lay out with some degree of privacy. I enjoyed travelling down the inclinator to the marina and rooms at sea level. The seafood restaurant there is very good, and the outdoor bar is a lot of fun. What makes this resort really special is the private Palamino island serviced by large ferry boats. The water, beach and amenities are outstanding. Some may feel inconvenienced by the ferry trip, but I felt it just put you in the right "mental attitude" to go the beach. for those who just can't be "unwired" I got a good cell signal from the island. I had no problems with check-in, or any of the services during the trip. All staff were very friendly. The resort is somewhat remote, so--aside from a small village just down the road (walking distance...but did not eat/drink there) you're pretty much "at" the resort. That brings me to my one negative...that prices are very expensive for food and beverages (e.g. $17 hamburgers). I understand this is a resort, but just be preprared for the $$ when you go. One other note...there was room construction going on while I was there, but I felt it was not an inconvenience with regard to noise, construction activity, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Resort And Service”
Reviews.Author: davidkSanDiego
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador Resort & Golden Door Spa Fajardo, Puerto Rico November 2007 Without much fanfare or signage, one passes through a collection of multi-colored small homes when they get to the front gates of an oasis perched upon a 300 foot cliff. As you proceed pass through a lush, manicured golf course laced with fountains and palm trees, you are greeted by Felix, a Brooklyn transplant who warmly welcomes you to the resort. As you walk from your vehicle through an outdoor cavernous walkway, you are awestruck but it's beautiful tropical awnings/canopys as you peer at the blue Carribean waters that appear so inviting. Once inside, if you are as lucky as me, you will be greeted by Krysis, Magda or Marilyn. Initially, I was met by Krysis and her glowing smile. I can honestly say that the service I received upon my check-in with Krysis was unparrelled. She was charming and explained each and every one of the amenities at the resort, including but not limited to their private island, the transportation there with the resorts private transportation; the golf courses; shopping and dining venues and the casino. Krysis arranged for me to stay in an ocean front room with balcony was tropically decorated and elegant yet serene as I could see the crystal blue waters and skies. As I sat in total awe on my balcony, I observed small and large watercrafts dotting the waters and berthed at the resorts marina. I could also see the resorts private island, Palomino and in the foreground, the island that is home to Flamenco Beach. Flamenco Beach is reknowned and a must see which can be reached by a small 9 seat plane or by ferry. I took the 15 minute flight and it was spectacular as we flew over the sea and look at the various islands along the way. During the remainder of the stay, I was very fortunate in that I got to meet Tomas and Edwin at the concierge desk. They were the individuals that told me to visit Flamenco Beach and made all of the arrangements. They also told me to visit the Bio-illuminescent Bay and arranged for me to meet with Captain Suartez, the 14 seat boat owner who captained our boat through the mangroves in the dark of night only to reach this incredible phoshorous water. He invited us to jump in the water and swim. As each of the participants glowed, one could only think of how lucky they were to be at that place in that point of time. It was incredible!. Tomas and Edwin, when asked about off-site restaurants, immediately stated Pasions without hesitation. Krysis confirmed that Pasions was her favorite as well. I went there with high expectations that were exceeded by incomparable atmosphere and phenomenal food. Sadly, I had to leave earlier than expected to return to San Diego for a meeting I had forgotten. However, I will not forget the El Conquistador Resort and will make it a point to return, if for no other reason than Krysis, Magda, Marily, Felix, Tomas and Edwin.

Reviews.Title: “Love it or hate it the location is spectacular”
Reviews.Author: krpcentury
Reviews.Content: There seems to be a battle between those who love and those who hate this resort. Before my trip to El Conquistador I read all of the ratings I could find on the internet and I was very confused and wasnâ€™t sure what to expect. When it comes to a place this large there are many opportunities to disappoint a customer and I guess over time improvements can change things as well. OK, after all that I am one of the customers that felt very good about my trip to El Con. Our room was on the north side of the Las Brisas wing overlooking the village of Las Croabas. It was very well appointed and except for the safe being locked when we arrived (it was easily fixed by security) the room was very pleasant and even if it werenâ€™t the view was so spectacular that the condition of the room wouldnâ€™t almost matter. To be clear the room was top notch. As far as the resort atmosphere it is spectacular. There is such beauty to behold I found myself just taking pictures everywhere I went. The pictures on the web site will give you a good idea of how beautiful this place is. [--] We found the service to be adequate. A few times we waited a little bit longer that we were used to but after we relaxed into the place it was not so long as to concern us. I am not used to spending a small fortune on a resort like this so because it was a business outing it was worth it to me. We were able to take advantage of a good room rate and extend our stay a few days and enjoy the resort. The cost of everything at the resort is at resort prices but that is to be expected at a place like this. We rented a car because of the ratings we read and it was worth it. It allowed us the flexibility to take advantage of the local countryside and local stores. Overall, this is not a resort for bargain hunters and never will be. But we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We never ate at the three big restaurants in the Mirador level but we ate twice at the Stingray CafÃ© in the marina and found that it was great food at a good value. The breakfast buffet is very nice but very pricey. The pool area is unmatched in options and beauty. Palomino Island is a nice spot to relax. I would suggest you bring a pair of water shoes as the sandy beach doesnâ€™t extend too far off the shore and if you want to get to deep water you have to go a ways out. Take the short walk from the Marina to the village of Las Croabas. You will have instant contact with the local color. In the evening in Las Croabas, if the moon isnâ€™t too full you might want to take a kayak to the lagoon and see the bioluminescent organism that live in the water there. I personally never had the time to do this but from all the folks I talked to they said it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The El Conquistador Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: PNYC
Reviews.Content: Took a friend of mine to Puerto Rico to celebrate her 40th birthday. She had been to El Conquistador, before, and loved it. Little did I know that I would fall in love with it, too! We were met by a limo, which took us to the property (about an hour east of the San Juan Airport). We were met by our concierge, Angie, who had also arranged all our special needs for our trip--two connected rooms, special birthday surprises, dining reservations, and spa appointments. From the touchdown to takeoff, we were treated with warmth and superior service. The spa staff--especially Frenchie at the front desk and Betsy, our masseuse--were extremely courteous and accommodating, especially when we had to quickly reschedule some appointments/treatments due to other activities (tennis, tanning, and sleeping in too late!). Although the resort is out of the way--something I prefer, actually--it's well worth the trip, the expense, and the wait. (At peak times, it's hard to get into this exquisite resort.) When (not if) you go, please say hello to Angie and Betsy for me! P New York, New York

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacations”
Reviews.Author: jrdeleon
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best place me and my family have ever stayed before. The environment is awesome, as well as facilities, and recreational areas. The island of Palominos was a never (ever) had experience. Staff was very courdious, and they always made the environment great for every member of the family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, but at a cost!”
Reviews.Author: Ledstewart
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through hotwire.com on this place - nice deluxe room, which was comfortable and impressive - equally impressive was the 2 inch roach inside the hotel guide which rather shattered the first impression of luxury. Again, beautiful views from the room but everything is very expensive - breakfast $25 per person per day, internet and parking, similar fees. The private island is a novelty, but by the time you ride the tram down to the dock and the boat to the island, the novelty wears off. Bottom line - glad we went there, glad to have seen the views, glad we had a rental car to escape to town where we could afford to eat, glad we only stayed a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Attendee”
Reviews.Author: varickst
Reviews.Content: First, understand that I was atttending a convention, I looked at the pools but never took a dip, rode the water taxi but never touched the sand on the private island, walked the Casino but never lost a cent and admired the golf course but never made a putt. Second the resort is now called the El Conquistador Golf Resort and Casino. The negatives. The water level got to be about a foot deep in the tub while I showered, good thing I was rooming alone because it took a couple of hours for it to drain. I checked with the guest in the room below me and he indicated that his drain worked just fine. I called engineering about 4 times for assistance, I am pretty sure that help did not arrrive for about 8 hours, and though his intensions were good the results were poor, water still pooled in the tub. Next, I requested a wake up call for 7:00 am on the day of departure that I am still waiting for. On my last day I figured I could squeeze in a fast trip to the private island for a swim. I was on the water taxi that departs at 9:00 am only to find out that the chef was running late and we departed at about 9:30, well there went my swim. The boat could have left, went to the island, dropped off the vacationers and returnded by 9:30, why we waited I will never know. The television did not have a signal at first, but that was corrected quickly and I never turned it on again. The bar at the marina was out of local beer? The positives. The front desk clerk, Nilmari, had a smile when I checked-in and a smile when I departed. She was polite, courteous and made me feel welcomed. The room located in a two story building surrounding the marina at the bottom of the funicular was clean, comfortable and airy. The bed was quite comfortable and the linens fresh. The bathroom was spotless, spacious and the vent worked. No musty smell, no mold and no insects (If only the drain worked)! There was a small deli by the funicular at the top of the hill, not many selections but lunch and snacks were fresh and the prices were reasonable. I did not have a chance to eat at any of the hotel restaurants, however there was a spot about a mile outside the main gate heading to the left, Pasion Por El Fogon that is worth going to. Would I stay here again? Yes, the overall experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Too big for their own good”
Reviews.Author: KOinCT
Reviews.Content: Perhaps due to the low expectations (from all the negative reviews I read here!), I ended up having a very pleasant stay at El Conquistador in Fajardo, Puerto Rico. One thing you notice right away is how incredibly huge the resort is. You'd think it would have left me with a feeling of awe and enchantment, but if anything, I just felt sorry for the poor blokes who have to run the place. With that being said, I can see how some of the negative reviews might have generated; El Con is simply too big for their own good. With a place that size, things are bound to get overlooked and neglected. Store fronts with broken/smashed windows, common areas with peeling paint, ferries that could have run more on time, and the ol' broken funicular. Nonetheless, there were still many "pros" not to be dismissed. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The beds were cozy and inviting and the bathrooms were stocked with towels and good toiletries. The flat screen TV and iPod dock were also nice additions. El Con's private island, "Palomino Island" was relaxing and calm. I could have lounged there all day and night. The ferry ride was a quick 7-10 mins away, perfect for any seasick -prone patron (like me)! As for the high prices, I think it's "manageble" with the right planning. Don't eat at all the fancy, expensive restaurants if you can't. The hotel bars served decent "bar & grill" type meals for cheaper. A newly opened Starbucks on the premise is also a god-send. It definitely saved me a few dollars in the morning, getting some coffee and a breakfast sandwich instead of the $25 hotel buffet. The local beer (Medalla) was about $3-4/bottle. The pool area is also quite decent, with cabanas for rent for additional privacy. There was also an area with a ping pong table and foos ball for added enjoyment. That was a pleasant surprise. Overall, I think El Con does a great job anticipating guests' needs. A major "con" however is that the place is not terribly accessible. Our room was towards the bottom of a hill - an elevator and funicular ride away (one of them being broken). Sometimes, we also encounted a long line at the funicular, which took 2-3 cycles before we actually made it on. We felt bad for the patrons in wheelchairs who had to navigate that terrain on a daily basis. The good news is, you do end up getting used to the trek by the 2nd or 3rd day! As for the service, we felt that the staff was quite pleasant and attentive. Always saying hello in the hallways and meeting our needs. I will say though, that they don't go out of their way to be nice if you don't deserve it. Don't expect any major [--]-kissing because you won't get it here. Just straight-forward, no-nonense assistance is how I can best put it. Also, while the hotel advertises as being 45 mins away from the airport, I would say it's closer to 1.5 hours on any given day. Seemed to take that long for us to get to the hotel, due to the rush hour on a Saturday afternoon. Then, getting to the airport on Monday morning, it easily took that long due to an accident on the freeway and the snail-like traffic on the backroads. Definitely give yourself plenty of time! I barely made my flight home! The shuttles back to the airport only run every hour and a half (i.e. 5am, 6:30am, 8am, 9:30am, etc), so plan accordingly. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by El Con. The staff was friendly, the rooms were very nice, and the views are gorgeous. I would absolutely recommend this place to others. They've got quite a handful to deal with, and perhaps they're doing the best they can. Hire a few more staff, get that 2nd funicular up and running, and they'll be good to go!

Reviews.Title: “No!!”
Reviews.Author: deniroNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stay away. Half the hotel is under renovation, the other half is totally dysfunctional. The nicer rooms are at the bottom of a very steep hill, at the marina, but to reach it you need to take a cable car up and down. Given the shoddy desk service, lack of in-room amenities, failed wireless internet access, bad food, horrible bellhop service, and other disappointments, there's no reason to think one should have confidence in the cable car (which in fact went on the blink when we were there).

Reviews.Title: “We loved El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: julie078
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be absolutely wonderful... landscaping was incredible - as was the water taxi ride to the private island. There you'll find a beautiful, secluded beach. The staff was attentive and helpful, our guestroom was wondeful, the entire experience was great. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views!!!”
Reviews.Author: thaddues63
Reviews.Content: i was afraid to stay at this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but i am so very happy to say that we has a great time, the views from the resort are just some of the best i have seen. the view from the infinity pool is just so awsome and the way the pool is built on the side of the hill ,it really looks as if you will just slide off the side. we were very lucky we got a newly renovated room and a partial ocean view, we were offered an ocean view but is is not as private and quite, because they are renovating down the hill it is not to noisy but we really wanted the most private spot that would still offer a great partial view of the ocean if you can , ask to stay at the las brisas partial ocean view in one of the renovated rooms. the new rooms have an ipod dock so it was great because both my daughters were able to charge thier ipods and listen to thier music. there is also a small fridge in the bathroom. i really liked that the new rooms have plenty of drawer space it made it very easy for us to unpack and not have to share a drawer there were four of us my husband and my two teenage daughters. we usally stay at an embassy or a condo, but i really did not want to cook and i always wanted to stay at this resort. i have been coming to puerto rico for the past 8 years and i have to say that i love this place the best!! there is renovation going on in the hotel but it did not affect us in anyway, just if you look around the property you will see people working in some of the areas away from las brisas wing, and the main pool area. i am so glad that the new owners are renovating this property it is located in such an amazing spot that it is really worth staying here. the cons about this property is that the food is expensive, but we always rent a car when we are in puerto rico, and we where able to eat at the many many places within five to ten minutes away. we even went to walmart which is five minutes away and brought snacks, yogurts, parmalat milk and were able to have food when ever we wanted. there was no coffee pot in the room , so we purchased a $8.00 4 cup coffee maker at walmart along with $2.00 bag of puerto rican cofffee and my husband and i would enjoy our coffee everymorning on the balcony. if you are going to stay here i would really suggest a rental car, because there is so much to do around this area and we drove to old san juan using the new route 66 which really does cut down on the traffic. we stayed here for 9 days and the service was great, it does get busy at the resort on friday and saturday because they hold thier local conventions thier on the weekends, but the resort is so large that you can find a great spot no matter where you are. the front desk staff was great, roberto, iyveannet, ivette, and the best waitress was minex. the boat to the private beach is new and a quick 10 minute ride to the private island.. i loved the island, we had water shoes so we where able to walk far out and enjoy. also there are two spots where they have chairs, one right at the dock and one around the bend from there. we rented the jet skis, for $70. for half an hour but since we did that on a tuesday there was no one else renting them so we where out for forty five minutes! you can pull your chair into the water and lay on you chair in the water that was so relaxing. i loved it. my favorite spot on the resort hands down was the infinity pool over by las casitas, it is a five minute walk thru the pool areas over to las casitas or you can ask for a ride from the golf cart at the bell station. the view and peace and quiet from this spot was the best i have seen by far. i have been to alot of infinity pools and the negative edge on this one was the best. when you first get in this pool you dont see the edge it is so cool. you really have to get close to finally see the edge. i cant wait to be able to go back and stay again. any questions please email me.

Reviews.Title: “Experienced Traveler Review”
Reviews.Author: Ace787
Reviews.Content: When reading the reviews for the El Con, it can be kind of scary, even taking into account the knowledge that most people writing reviews are doing it because they had a bad experience. As someone who travels quite a bit for business and pleasure, I was leary of the El Con because of some of the bad reviews, yet the dramatic 'loved it' or 'hated it' was confusing. I needed a quick trip without a passport, so I gave it a shot. The resort itself is beautiful and kept immaculate. Everything I saw there was very well maintained. It was a busy weekend and the main hotel was booked so we were moved to Las Casitas. If you have kids, stay at the main hotel, more activities for kids. If you want peace and quite and can spend a few extra bucks, I highly recommend staying at Las Casitas. It is only a minute or two walk between the main hotel and Las Casitas. The staff was exceptionally friendly and very eager to please. Palamino island is incredible. Rent some snorkelling gear and swim to the little island, quite impressive fish and sea life. The hotel casino is very small, if you are a gambler, you are a long way from Vegas. Two blackjack tables, 1 poker table, 1 roulette wheel, 1 craps table, 1 Carribean Stud table, that's it for table games. Only 4 video poker machines. Save your gambling $$ for Vegas, rent a snorkel and enjoy the beautiful fish on Palamino. The things I would agree with most reviews on is the prices on food and billing issues. The resort is in an area where you probably won't want to leave the resort, so you are left only with the resort restaraunts. I went expecting resort prices, maybe 20% over NYC or Vegas, but it was considerably higher. Dinner for 2 in the Italian restaraunt was over $100, with simply one app and 2 entrees (add the $65 bottle of wine that would go for maybe $30 in an NYC restaraunt, grand total of over $185). Breakfast at Las Casitas cafe was usually around $50. (French Toast - 17, omlette 19, plus drinks). Breakfast buffet at Las Brisas rest is good, but at $25 per person, can be pricey for just breakfast. The food and service were exceptional in every restaraunt, but if you are staying for more than a day or two it can start to get expensive. Several reviews complianed about the El Con billing. I am dealing with this right now. Be sure to check your bill carefully and make sure everything is correct and you are paying for the correct account. It wasn't the fault of the desk person, it seems they have a lousy system. Thus far they have been very helpful in resolving the issue. I would definitely stay at the El Con again and recommend it. I would suggest staying at Las Casitas, and if you can, get a casita with a kitchen and hit at one of the grocery stores close by. If you can have a couple of meals in your casita, you'll be able to make up the difference in price on the room vs eating every meal in the restaraunts. If you stay at Las Casitas, rent a car at the airport, it's cheaper than the El Con shuttle, parking at Las Casitas is free, and you can run out to the store to save a few bucks. Parking at the El Con is 15-20 a day. Go for the beautiful beach and sea life on Palamino, super friendly people, and well kept resort. Plan ahead for extra food budget and make sure you check your bill when before you pay when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “paradise gone bad”
Reviews.Author: GeorigaCasinoman
Reviews.Content: We have recently came back to what we hoped,a great 15 year anniversary trip. This place came highly reconmend to us by people who have traveled extensively and who I trust. The hotel is renoun for its service our so we thought. I booked through the casino at the resort because me and my wife like to gamble a little. The casnio is small but with a cosy personailty. Here is where the nightmare began on our anniversary night we had a great dinner at the strip house with is a premire steak house the food was excellent and service was above average. We decided to go to the casino around 11.30 p.m. for texas holdem limt play . My wife gracelessly asked if I would like to take the only empty seat at the one table they had. I sat down while she put her name on the waiting list for the next seat several others that came in after us also put there name on the waiting list. About 35 minutes went by, be for there was a open seat at the table, a gentleman who had just arrived at the casino took a seat my wife informed the dealer that she had been waiting for the seat for 35 minutes and her name was next on the list. The dealer continued to ignore her and continued to allow the gentleman who afford to give the seat up since there was a waiting list the dealer informed my wife that he would have the seat since he is a man and she could wait. Sexual Discrimanation at its worst she in formed the pit bose who also ignoed her and then procedded to ask for the casnio manager who also gave her lip service wanting to voice my opionin in the mattter but not wanting to trump my wife handling of this matter I continued to be a spectator, after the situation continued with not the slightest apology or resolution ,she told me she was going up stairs to pack and that we checking out after that, but for me to continue my game till then. They had numerous opportunities to apologize to her but they never did . They did offer us dinner on them witch we refused. This casnio is poorly ran with the dealers not knowning the rules and pit boses who are not capable of making sound judgements as to the gaming rules , not all the dealers and pit boses, but most are poorly trained . When my wife came down to say she was ready to check out at 3.00am, I gatherd my chips and in the hast to leave took my cards that we in play at the table with my chips. They offerd me a 3 night comp Till this day I have never recieved our room comp that they said should make up for the blatent sexual discrimination that presist in the el conquistador resorts casino . .So women beware sexual discrimination is alive and well in that resort. It truely could be one of the premire resorts in the caribbean, It is a shame the management will not step up and address this issue, as any competent resort would. They will never make that 5 star if this is not changed .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: Digital824
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Conquistador during the first week of July. My wife and 2 teenagers as well as myself were really impressed with the faciltiy and staff. The highlight of our trip was definitely Palomino Island. Great snorkeling, friendly service on the island and just a great time. As part of our trip to Puerto Rico, we wanted to travel the island, therfore we rented a car. Only one complaint I have was the hotel's parking facility. Finding a parking spot was an adventure, and when you have a problem at the parking lot, no one can help you. When we went to the hotel and spoke the parking people about our situation, they could care less., ,Later we found out that the parking is owned or operated by a third party. Despite the parking fiasco the rest of our stay was remarkable and we plan on returning. (Hopefully parking situation will be resolved by then)

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: alloverwhenican
Reviews.Content: If you are disabled, or have difficulty walking. DO NOT STAY HERE! Everything is incredibly far, even rooms to the elevator. The hotel is like an L shape. The elevator to the lower pool area is at the end of the L shape, if you have difficulty walking--no pool for you! There are NO Handicapped rooms with two double beds. There are no courtesy wheel chairs, they rent for $25 a day. Frankly, there was no courtesy anythig! Be prepared to pay for everything. DO NOT be fooled by the pretty "recently removated" rooms on the web site, these do not exist, at least at the normal people rate. One of our rooms was missing a lamp FROM THE WALL over the bed, the bathrooms were big, but kind of grimmy from aging. The mattreses were awful, you could hear the springs every time you turned. The only really nice thing was the ferry to Palominos island. The boats are new and the crew very courtious and nice. Be aware that they do not let you bring even a water bottle on board. This is because once you are captive at Palominos they nail you for everything. The water sports come at a high price also. In short, although the hotel grounds are neatly maintained and the view is spectacular, the accomodations, amenities and services are poor. Another terrible thing was the uncooperative, and unfriendliness of the folks at th front desk. They made little effort to accomodate or help resolve a situation. I stayed there this one time, but will not return. If they sell themselves as a luxury hotel, they should deliver what they sell. I also stayesd at Parador Villa Parguera and when compared, I will return to La Parguera, but not to El Conquistador.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: tears1988
