A day later, one of the people in our party was checking their bank account, and $500 was shown as being withdrawn at the ATM. Other folks checked and sure enough money was missing from their account as well. When folks approached the hotel front desk about this concern they were told that it wasn't their issue and it had to be addressed directly with the bank. We had taken a Dive Trip on the second day we arrived. We had a great time and three other folks in our party were convinced to take the Resort Certification and do a dive trip with the resort Dive Shop a few days later. One of the dive masters, which we hadn't had on the trip before, was completely rude, sarcastic, and impatient with the new divers, which is undoubtedly a dangerous situation. When these folks had submerged below water, things got much worse to the point that one of the people we were with had decided not to take the second dive. They were ignored and at some points felt in danger. Besides this, at one point, there was a child snorkeling without a life vest who had gone a ways to far who was having trouble breathing. Since our dive master was too busy doing her own thing, one of the people in our party had to swim out to get this child. We had called to inquire on the time the airport shuttle left the hotel for the aiport on our way home. We were told that there was a shuttle every 20 minutes. When we arrived to the lobby, we were surprised to learn that the shuttle actually leaves every hour, which put us in jeopardy of missing our flight. When I had told the person at the front desk that I was told every 20 minutes, she was very confrontative and combatitive about who I had asked and that no one would tell me that at the hotel. The issues don't stop at the trip. Good luck calling to get another copy of your detailed bill. When we called in for this invoice, we were put on hold for at least 30 minutes because no one wanted to help us with this. We had to call in again and were promised the bill within 10 minutes, to which we have yet to receive. Again, if you have heard the El Conquistador is the way to go, don't do it! Quite honestly, I would even second think going to Puerto Rico at all.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review for El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from El Conquistador from a stay with 2 older children 16 and 20. Our opinions are definitely mixed. The shuttle from the airport took nearly 2 hours when we arrived and over an hour even for the 5am return shuttle and cost us $192 round trip for 3 travellers. Our room was average but conveniently located on the main part of the hotel for the pool, casino, etc. My daughter and I had to ask 4 different people before we could figure out how to get to the fitness center- an elevator plus funicula ride away. Sometimes it took 15 minutes to get the funicula back to the main hotel. It also took awhile to get to the beach- funicula ride plus water taxi that only runs every half hour. The beach is beautiful but the bottom is rocky in parts. Service is relaxed to say the least. We frequently had to ask multiple times to get things but on the other hand you can sit in the casino bar and watch the Yankee game and no one will hassle you to buy drinks. Staff are friendly but have no sense of urgency and checking in can take huge amounts of time. Overall my children and I really enjoyed the beautiful beach and pools and were very relaxed. We found the buffet breakfast the best value for the money. The food is expensive but typical of resorts and there are 16 restaurants to choose from so there is always somewhere to eat where you don't have to wait which is a plus. Overall we enjoyed our stay despite the drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Inside Theft Ring...Stay away from the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was one of several guests staying at the Wyndham El Conquistador Casita Village for an event at the hotel. Several guest had their rooms robbed of money hidden in various, inconspicuous places. One guest had $600 taken from their LOCKED SAFE. Their key was hidden in the bottom of their suitcase. They never take all of what might be left in the room. What they take is a portion of your money - enough to question if you've spent it or inadvertently misplaced it. Several reports were filed with the police and the hotel claims to have "done an investigation and found no fault with their staff and is not liable". So, in other words folks, spend thousands to stay at this hotel, walk 3 miles to get to the beach, have money stolen from your locked safe or suitcase and then be told that you should never leave money in your room! Several guest left the hotel prior to their departure date, fearful of what else could happen. PLEASE, PLEASE do yourself a favor and not waste your time vacationing at an establishment that clearly has a well-established, inside theft ring designed to place the traveler at fault!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Propery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading some past reviews, but we had a great time. We had no problems regarding the funicular or the ferry to Palomino Island. I recommend joining Wyndham by Request to take advantage of their 2 for 1 offers (golf, spa treatments, etc.) As others have stated, food is very expensive. Rent a car and go outside the hotel to some local places (Lolita's for Mexican- A La Banda for seafood and steak). The golf course was amazing but bring a lot of golf balls. It get's a little easier if you play it a second time. My wife and I both enjoyed the spa. The casino was small but adequate (not too many people playing craps). On Palamino Island we used the wave-runners, which were fun and we also went horseback riding (a waste of money). The pools were also very nice and there are 3 or 4 of them to chose from. The staff was friendly and helpful our whole stay. Yes, the rooms themselves were average at best, but the overall property was beautiful and if you're looking to get away for a few days, I would recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 days at the El Conquistador and I am now very relaxed. It's not a resort that has alot of activities planned during the day like Sandals and other big resorts but it is a place to go to just relax and chill out which is exactly what I needed on this trip. We went as an incentive trip for my company and everyone enjoyed themselves for the most part. Food was expensive and service was slow some times but the food was good and filled you up. We took water and Gatorade and kept it in our room. We would take it over to Palamino with us and I wish I would have brought a cooler but if you put your bag in the shade, it keeps it a bit cool. Also, stock up on your alcohol at a liquor store...will save you lots of $$$ as drinks are at least $6.00 each. Palamino was just gorgeous...the water was so calm and shallow that it was great for beginner snorklers. They were very accomodating for our group when we would do a group activity. Check out was slow!!! The disco wasn't very happening and I am not sure why. There was plenty of lounging space at the many pools and on Palamino. If you couldn't get an umbrella there were definitely plenty of trees to lay under for shade and all the chairs were comfortable. One in our group was claustrophobic and they don't offer any other way to get down to the marina so she couldn't go to Palamino. We went off the resort to go on the Spread Eagle II Catamaran trip which was awesome! 2 snorkle sites and a buffet lunch. Also got a massage one day for $110 which was a bit overpriced for a 50 min massage but it was relaxing and you can use the spa ammenities all day if you would like (but we wanted to be in the sun). Overall a great, relaxing trip to reward us for a year of hard work! Would go again..makes Florida beach look like crap.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: anav
Reviews.Content: We are Wyndham members so I booked a deluxe ocean view room. We drove from the San Juan airport and were immediately checked in and upgraded to Las Casitas. I cannot say enough wonderful things about the room. It overlooked the ocean, was clean and large. The staff was helpful. The restaurants were very over priced for the quality of the food and the service. We left 2 restaurants at the resort after waiting 20 minutes just to get menus!!! The staff in the restaurants was not at all interested in working!! I was disappointed that we had to go out to a grocery store and buy stuff to cook at a luxury resort. We are from NYC and the quality of the food was like eating at a diner but for $100 plus. Anyway putting aside the food issue it was very relaxing. The main pools were always crowded but the Las Casitas pool was clean and we basically had it to ourselves. Palomino Island is beautiful. The ferry ride is gorgeous. I found the staff there helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again and would recommed it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate does not dive a damn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wrote corporate a letter about my bad experience at El Conquistador and corporate left if up to the hotel to deal with - this shows that Corporate does not care. Read all the reviews carefully because the service is really bad - the food is terrible and the overall experience will be dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always, too many locals”
Reviews.Author: Meir_USA
Reviews.Content: This is our Third time to the El Con, we went for 5 days over the 4th of July Weekend. As always the energy is great during the night, the water and pools were great. I would certainly go agin, any time. The only complaint i had was that each day during our trip when we went ot hte pool, we heard most people speaking in Spanish, while at first i thought nothing of it, i later discoverd that there must have been a special of the year as the place was filled with locals, and the pool was crowded that at 10:00 am you were lucky to get a place to settle. During our stay our sink started to leak, we called the engineer and they came to fix it right away. The weather was sposse to be crappy, but we took a chance, and the weather was absolutly great!!! we could not ask for better. All in all, we had a mega good time, and we look forward going again soon. A few tips. 1. take the furnicular down to the middle level, over there you do not have to give a card to get a towel rather there are towels laid out on every seat. Also, it is cleaner and quieter. the pool is very nice, and you can even go into the gym/fitness room [that was just moved there from the top floor] and get some ice cold wet washcloths sitting in the fridge, for an instant cool off. 2. get a room that overlooks the ocean, and NOT the golf course, the extra money is well worth it. [for the sea breaze alone.] 3. bring a darn good camera. 4. bring a mini cooler. We brought a mini cooler, filled it up with cold soda beer, and snacks, and took it for the day trip to the palamino island. At first they gave us beef they wanted us to leave it behind, so that we should buy expensive hotel drinks, at the island. I talked may way into bringing the cooler on onto the island thus enabling me to have what i need without haveing to keep buying drinkds from the hotel just to stay hydrated. Our first day there we took our rented car to the main road[ 7 minutes frin the hotel, ] and went to the super market, called pueblo x, and got everything as if we were in a normal ameriacan store. As we bought, wine, juice, soda, bread, the most delicias fruits, the mangos were honey. We empteed our mini bar and put in our drinks instead. obviousy the prices are much better when you buy it localy at the supermarket, instead of buying it form the hotel. [in case you were never in puerto rico, i must tell you, that driving down the highway you would think you are in any american city, walmarts walgreens, sams clubs, to name a few.] makes it easy in the event that you want to take a $5 taxi from the hotel into town. Again before the first time i went to the el con, most people told us, dont go, it is far out, and it takes 40 minutes to get there. Do not listen to them as once you get to the hotel, you have no reason to leave, on the contrary, you hope to never have to leave. [keeping in mind that this hotel was originaly built as a grand hare krishna ashram.] this place is really heaven on earth. Also, you wa much closer to the el yunke rain forest [only 15 minutes by car] then if you stayed in San Juan. My last peice of advice is that if you want ot rent a car, call a local company called L & M they have no fril cars for no frill prices, yet all the cars are new and clean, and the prices are $24.00 a day, not only are they nice it is my second time using them and never had a problem. if you would like more about my trip and need some more tips feel free to contact me at; mholtzberg@hpnyc.com PS. as we keep Kosher we were able to find kosher food both in the supermarket, as well as being able to pre-order kosher food for shabbat, at chabadpuertorico --> tourist information link.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: jujubeez
Reviews.Content: We checked in on May 11th, and left on the 14th. I have never been so dissapointed by a resort in my life. We stayed on the Marina level; the Funicular broke twice, the Funicular is the ONLY way to get between the main resort and the two smaller "villages" The first time there was a 2-hour line to get back to our room. The second time we were trapped on the Marina level and missed half a day in San Juan. I expected the food to be expensive, but we were disappointed at how poor the quality of both the food and service was. We ate at the Chinese Restaurant the first night and I have received better service at a Dennyâ€™s. Living in New Orleans we are lucky to have to opportunity of top notch restaurants and service, the food and service within the resort would not pass muster at a Holiday inn. It poured everyday I know that no one can control the weather, but for a resort that is open to the elements there were no plans to handle the rain. There were huge puddles everywhere, trying to navigate them in heels was a nightmare, there was nowhere to eat lunch without sitting out in the rain other than a nasty cafeteria. There is only one choice for breakfast; a buffet, I do not eat at buffets. Because of the rain there were piles of dirty towels all over the resort that Housekeeping had piled up to soak up water, then never picked up... three days later. Housekeeping was very odd. We had to call and ask for the bathroom to be cleaned and clean towels everyday, but she took the time to line up all of our shoes under the desk, and all of my toiletries every day. The ferry to the island and beach were not unpleasant however, on the trip back there was only one ferry running and people had to wait in line for almost a full hour in the sun, to get back to the Resort. The kicker of course was when we went to the front desk to voice our unhapiness with the troubles and the staff pretended not to be able to understand our english.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved this Place - But Its a Splurge!”
Reviews.Author: B00mie
Reviews.Content: I cannot lie - I adored this place. I went with my husband and two kids and it was the most gorgeous place and possibly my favorite hotel ever. And we travel a lot. Don't get me wrong. Its pricey. We used Amex points and splurged. The hotel room was beautiful. We loved the day trips to the beach by boat. The 6 restaurants on premises were ok, all were expensive. One thing we adored was the "DIVE IN" movies, where the kids would float in the pool and watch the movie and the adults could hang with adults on the lounge chairs. Most of us ordered pizza and took it with us to the pool area. My kids had a wonderful time and they look back on it as one of their favorite trips. The views from the place are unsurpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this resort to anyone really. If you are between the age of 20-65and don't want to sit in your room all day then this hotel is not for you. It is in the middle of no where and they know it. They charge an arm and a leg for decent food. If you want to be adventurous and try some local flavor outside the resort then they charge $20 each way in a cab company that they own, oh yeah the ride is only about 4 minutes each way too. The beach is cool the first time you go there, but after that it is a pain to have a 15 minute boat ride to and from with screaming foriegn kids. Also, the town of Fajardo is not the safest town either. My wife I walekd down to a public pier and felt very unsafe. I would warn you to look elsewhere on the island. PR is a beautiful islanld with many other options away from San Juan. I would recommned The Hyatt at Dorado Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not relaxing”
Reviews.Author: sbn68
Reviews.Content: The resort was very beautiful and tropical. It is on a mountainside, and it is a large resort. This means alot of walking uphill and downhill to get anywhere. There is a funicular that takes you down the mountain to catch the boat over to the beach. No beach at the resort. The funicular was broken down 4 of the 7 nights we stayed, which made for very angry people (because there is no other way to get back to your room on the lobby level from the beach!) The beach area is wonderful after you get off the boat- it has a restaurant and bar, and a place to buy sundries and rent tubes, rafts, umbrellas, etc. The resort was lacking in cleanliness and service. The beach (or private island, Palomino) was lovely. We went on a horseback ride down the beach there. However, it was just too much work getting around with small children to make it relaxing. We were overcharged everywhere- including at the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Palomino Island was lovely.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the week of June 5th at El Conquistador after hearing raves from family, etc. We arrived at the airport at 12:40, got our luggage and proceeded to the van awaiting our long needed vacation. The van left a little past 1:30. This is the damper of our vacation: we arrived at the hotel at 3:45. We were registered as Wyndham by Request members, which can be done on the internet and I highly recommend doing so. At the hotel check in for members we were met by an extremely unfriendly, cold employee and were instructed to return at 4:00 when our room would be ready. We had requested a garden view. At 4:15 we returned and the room was not ready yet. Some helpful gentleman helped us out and called up. We got to our room and I was upset to see a view of the golf course and tennis court and found the room not meeting our expectations in cleanliness. My wife returned to the front desk (not the same employee as before), and requested an upgrade and the cost for an oceanview. We were upgraded to the Club floor facing Palomino Island complimentary since we were Wynhdam By Request Members. This was quite an improvement. By the time we got our luggage and resettled it was 5:35. We started out from Newark at 8:40. I could have been in Europe. The hotels architecture is beautiful, with choices in pools, and Palomino Island was a short ferry ride away which we loved.wherethe food there was the best and most reasonably priced. Palomino Island has beautiful turquoise waters, very shallow with some coral and ok snorkeling. If you have kids bring water shoes. Also, while snorkeling I found a few sea urchins on the reefs so be careful. The hotel food was very expensive.(Blossoms was very good and you can get a pizza by the pool bar which is open for dinner). I found the dining much more expensive in comparison to NYC which I frequent quite often. The hotel was very clean in the lobby etc. Everyone we met felt room cleanliness(bathrooms) was a bit of a problem, we certainly did. The staff was very helpful and sweet when approached with questions. We have traveled to almost all of the Caribbean and stayed at the Hyatt Dorado last visit to Puerto Rico in 1990. All in all this was a restful vacation at a beautiful hotel. Unfortunately, the long trip to the hotel and leaving early for our return trip to the airport (it was only 1:15 min) created a lost day. They are supposed to be building a new highway this September which should shorten the 35 mile trip considerably. By the way, there were conventions going on while we were there and one of the pools closed down at 3:00 and we were requested to go to another pool and Palomino Island had a function one day and we were asked to leave by 4:30 instead of 5:30. This was quite disappointing since I enjoyed every minute there. I doubt I would return to this hotel for vacation, but think it might be more enjoyable for families. P.S. I found a rock in my dinner at Stingray and reported it to the waiter, complained on the questionnaire and on the internet form and to date, (July 7th) we have not even had an apology which I find unusual..

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No beach access. Far from airport and any outside life. Way too expensive and not worth it. Taking a funicular to and from the pool and restaurants was like waiting for the subway. Not fun. Our room lacked a toilet paper roller, and a clock. We had to call to have our room cleaned - TWICE! The lounge chairs were full of bird droppings. Don't go.

Reviews.Title: “This writer had an incredible time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had been reading the reviews for a solid 3 months prior to my trip.I was at this resort from June 26-July 1st.I was finding,in the reviews, that most people either hated or loved this place with very little in between.However,I came here with a very open mind in expectation and a positive attitude. I have virtually no complaints(except for U.S. Air and the Philly airport-LOL).From my expedient arrival courtesy of WBR to the friendly staffers throughout the hotel to our very clean and quiet room in Las Brisas(one of the best properties within the hotel and the funicular is very quiet) to the service at the restaurants-all very above average. I would highly recommend Otello's and Isabella's for the food.I heard many of the restaurants were solid and decent.Yes, you'll be charged $10-$12 for a sandwich but is that any different than San Fran or NYC? Marie-Luc is the consummate professional at Isabella's and she knows her wine.Milton,the maitre'd at Otello's will be more than happy to furnish you with some long pants if you forgot to pack any( yes, they enforce their dress code.WARNING-all men over 6'0" tall will appear as if they were crossing a stream in a flood!) There is a gent who works security down by the casino who takes his job very seriously and we had sidebets on whether we could get him to crack a smile.He must have had KGB training as his background. Palomino Island is most certainly worth the trip .Man,was it hot that day but I heard the mercury hit 102 back in Toronto on the same day so go figure? People were snorkelling right off the beach and the water is very shallow.You can hike,go horseback riding,participate in a ton of water sports-easily could be a daytrip. On the monday,I had slept in by 1/2 hr. so I missed the group excursion to Old San Juan and the Bacardi factory so a colleague and I rented a car and did it ourselves.We got lost so many times and finally found the factory after close to 3 hrs.Not one map is the same as another, signs are horribly located or just plain missing.Apparently, many locals ( after kicking back a little too much of the local export) snafu them.But,it all added to the adventure. This property is far from most everything but it is a stunning locale and I would come back here and to Puerto Rico in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time twice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to the El Conquistador on my last two vacations, would definately go a third. I am sure if I looked for something to complain about I would find it, but that goes to say about anywhere you could go. I am from New York City, and the food is expensive even by NYC standards, but you go on vacation not to care about that kind of thing, right? The Spa was great, had a copules massage with my wife, enjoyed every second. Brough my golf clubs, met a few guys during my first round, and played with them every other morning, had a great time. Went fishing on moring, caught a 75+ lbs sailfish, definatley a great experience. Palomino, was nice, I enjoyed the feeling of being removed from the mainland. The only draw back is that it is a 30 minute boat ride, but it is small price to pay. The casino was fun, I taught my wife to play craps, the dealers are generally cool, if you are winning throw them a bone once in while, it goes a long way, i.e., they might forget to remove a losing bet, here or there. The rooms are good, not great, not my taste of decor, but clean. I don't spend much time in the room why I go on vacation, so as long as it is clean, and things are in working order, I am satisfied. On my last two trips, I did not leave the property once, I found no reason, if you are concerned about spending too much on food and incendental items, this may not be the place for you, but if you can relax and appreciate not being on the downtown #6 train, you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location..Not so clean...Over priced”
Reviews.Author: AGav12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last week. The facility was very beautiful and got some great pictures. When we checked in, the front desk staff was very cold and took them a few minutes to notice that we were standing in front of them. They checked us in and the bellman came to take our luggage to the room. We went down the funicular and went into the Las Olas Village. While walking through to halls, I noticed it was quite dirty with dust and bits of paper all over. The bellman opened our guestroom door and we walked in. In the middle of the room there was a huge red stain on the carpet. (It looked like someone spilled a pitcher of Hawaiian punch on the carpet and let it dry). The toilet had tissue paper sitting in the bottom of the bowl; there was long black hair all over the bathroom floor. We opened up the curtains and about 15 feet from our window was the pool. (Not to mention the first site we saw was a big fat hairy backed man jumping in the pool) There was dust on the furniture. I picked up the phone to ask if there was another room they could move us to and there was a "curly black hair" stuck to the phone. The phone didn't even have a dial tone. We finally got a hold of the front desk to see if there was another room available. After a few minutes of describing the condition of the room, they moved us up to a room in the grand hotel level. Everything else was good in terms of the room and service. My friend and I went to the beach (which is a 25 min ferry ride) or the pool each day and had fabulous weather. There were a lot of kids running around everywhere. Not a really relaxing environment, but I guess good for families. We ate in the restaurants for each meal but were not over indulgent, at the end of the 6 nights the bill on the room was close to $1200.00 just for food and drinks. It was really over priced, however, the service in the restaurants was good. The last night my friend and I ate at the French restaurant â€œLe Bistroâ€�. The service again was great, but the chicken entrÃ©e I ordered was horribly dry and when the bill came, it was over $180.00 for the two of us! Totally not worth it. Conclusion 1: Do not stay in Las Olas unless you want to stay in a rundown motel setting. Conclusion 2: If you want to relax and have peaceful days next to the pool or ocean, bring ear plugs. Conclusion 3: Be ready to pay more for food each day than you are paying for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: CandidAdvisor
Reviews.Content: A gorgeous, magnificent hotel covering lots of ground. About the size of a small town! Beautifully planned and appointed. While I wouldn't personally encourage the hotel or PR as a destination, if you're going there for a convention, the hotel is quite a treat to behold. Many postings on this site about this hotel are rightly critical of the hotel service. Rooms are sub-standard in cleanliness--that seems to be the general complaint I've read about PR hotels and we found it to be sadly true everywhere we stayed and ate. Not a real premium on cleanliness there!! On one of the days, maid service didn't even show up! For daytime meals, service was far too slow and slack. Food prices are exorbitant, bordering on abusive, oddly enough most especially breakfast and lunch Guests have little choice but to take their meals on the property. Service for evening meals was good, and the food quite good too, as a matter of fact, service and the meal at the Bistro was memorably superb.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for paradise, this is it! We just returned from 4 nights at the Wyndham El Conquistador Resort & Golden Door Spa in Puerto Rico. Nestled atop a cliff overlooking the ocean, this resort is the ultimate indulgence! Everything you could possibly want is located right on the property, so there is no need to leave. Even though it was a holiday weekend and the hotel was fully booked, it did not seem crowded at all. The service was excellent. The staff went out of their way to greet us with a smile and catered to our every need. There are many wonderful restaurants at the resort. Blossoms (a Teppanyaki Grill) was our favorite, and the Stingray Cafe was a very close runner-up. Meals were on the pricey-side, but definitely worth it. The preparations were fresh, creative, and delicious! They featured many local ingredients. Palomino Island, the El Conquistador's private beach is just a water taxi ride away. The taxis ran frequently and there were shops, a restaurant and bar located on the island. There were plenty of beach chairs, umbrellas, and water activities/sports for guests to enjoy. The spa was fabulous! Try the Golden Door's signature massage. The menu of spa treatments is endless! A very classy operation. Try your luck at the casino located near the lobby of the main hotel. During the evenings live Salsa and Merengue bands were featured in the lobby adjacent to the casino and many guests danced the night away! Go for the Romance Package which includes champagne and fresh tropical fruits upon arrival, a complementary breakfast buffet at Las Brisas every morning (the best breakfast we've ever had), dinner for two at Isabella's, a spa treatment, and free golf on a beautiful course. The setting at Isabella's was beautiful and although the food was good, it was similar to many other steak houses we have been to elsewhere. Try the other restaurants instead for a more unique dining experience. The only sore point was the long shuttle ride to and from the airport. The El Conquistador staff made every effort to make the trip a pleasant one by providing cold drinks and friendly service. This was not a big deal given all of the positive aspects of our trip. We cannot wait to return as this paradise has become a family favorite! You must visit there! Definitely opt for an oceanfront room in the main hotel (we stayed on the third floor above the main level). It's well worth the spectacular view! P.S. I have no affiliation with the El Conquistador. I appreciate great service as it is hard to find these days. This place truly deserves this glowing review.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation to remember”
Reviews.Author: Momof3GorgeousGirls
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at El Conquistador and still think about it often, it was so wonderful. The resort is gorgeous, one of the prettiest and well-kept I've ever stayed in. It is a huge resort, and even though the hotel was sold out during winter break 2005, when we stayed, we hardly ran into anyone. The staff was friendly and the rooms standard but clean as a whistle and if you get an ocean view room (request the Brisas wing), the sunrises are amazing. It is family friendly, as my husband and I and our three daughter (5 and 18 month old twins) were always made to feel like VIPs. The restaurants are delicious but very expensive- be prepared to drop about $200 + for dinner each night, and Othellos went to great lengths to make my daughter's 5th birthday very special. My friends all started researching El Conquistador after I emailed them my pictures, because they all looked like postcards, especially the pools and the crystal-clear waters of El Palomino Island, their private island. I thought a week of just eating and sitting on the beach with my family, and no nanny, would be too hectic and perhaps tiresome, but I was sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Vacation, pricey food”
Reviews.Author: jplayny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Memorial Day weekend and had one of the most enjoyable vacations in memory. They have great packages, and we got 2 for 1 golf, spa treatments and water sports. The spa is fantastic, the golf course is beautiful and challenging-though filled with mosquitoes (it is near the rainforest after all). The beach at Palomino Island was gorgeous, and there are tons of things to do. Walking distance from the hotel is one of PRs bioluminescent bays. There were a couple of drawbacks, but not enough to ruin the trip for us. First of all, the food is expensive. I've read comments from other New Yorkers saying that prices are on par with New York, which is true, but you're not trying to eat at expensive restaurants three meals a day, every day! Breakfast was sub-par pretty much everywhere, but Isabella's Steakhouse and the Mexican Restaurant at Las Olas were fantastic. We ordered an appetizer of Nachos at the mexican restaurant and ended up cancelling our dinner, there was so much food! One thing that's very annoying is that you cannot use cash at most of the resort, or on the beach, so everything has to be charged to your room. This of course is so you spend more money, so be careful of this. I recommend staying in Las Brisas or Las Vistas, which are right next to the main building. I imagine it gets annoying travelling by funicular from the marina to the main building all the time. It looked like a great place for families, but if you're bothered by kids around, it's not so great for you.

Reviews.Title: “breath taking and wonderful people.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at the El Conquistador hotel in Puerto rico in 1999 The staff were great,and food was excellent. I would definitely come back to it again, The plants are so wonderful, I loved waking up and taking in the beautiful scenery outide. I loved the fresh salty air. The prices may be a bit pricey according to one person that stayed there. but, they have to remember they are in another country and the seafood isn't cheap. it isn't like you just go to a store and buy the stuff. there are men out in boats every day who have to go out and catch the seafood for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wish we had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: nacrsatmsncom
Reviews.Content: my family went to p.r. for 9 days end of april beginning of may. we wanted to see the whole island so we rented a truck and did some hotel hopping. all i can say is i wish i would have skipped my three nights in san juan and just stayed here. the resort is incredibibly beautiful. the grounds are magnificent . the funicular did not break down even once. the food is waaaay overpriced but we had the truck so we had other options. no roaches and no leakage, not even god given rain! (lucky us). we stayed in las olas and had a an ocean view. it was wonderful to fall asleep with the sound of the crashing waves and the ocean breeze and awaken to the most glorious sunrises. the ferry is easy and quick. palomino is spectacular. i guess i am with the guy who said if you smile and greet the workers with a positive attitude they will probably do the same. remember, we are all people and someone might be having a moment. we did not expect slavish service and we were treated great. we stayed at a number of hotels during our stay, some great, okay, and not so okay. but the wyndham blew them all way. far far way.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It rained the entire time of our stay. We had a great time (it was our honeymoon!) but we were disappointed more than once at this hotel. First of all, the hotel didn't even acknowledge we were honeymooners. Then, because of the heavy rain we were pretty much at the hotels mercy. Problem is, the prices are outrageous. $18 for a hotdog at lunch? Give me a break. Average drink prices were $10 and be prepared to spend at least $30 per person for dinner. The food was not that good either. Blossoms was the best restaurant by far. Skip the Mexican restaraunt. It was awful. One day we rented a car to Old San Juan and stopped at the supermarket to stock up on beer and snacks since we were so sick of paying so much. But upon our return the bellmen wouldn't even speak to us about the parking situation (lot was full) and then about 5 of them watched me struggle with bags and never offered to help me. Also, because of the rain the hotel really didn't offer much to the guests for entertainment. They set up bingo in the nightclub. That was about it. Speaking of the nightclub, it had terrible music and was empty every night. Problem is, the hotel is pretty secluded from everything else so it is almost impossible to ventrure out to a nightspot on your own. The staff was great about cleaning the rooms, however nothing seemed to work in the hotel. The elevators were broken most of our trip and also one of the esclators. I'm sure we wouldn't have cared as much about these things if we were able to go outside, but again the rain...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: lakes25
Reviews.Content: I read thousands of reviews on numerous web sites and I feel obligated to share my experience. This hotel was amazing! My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time. We stayed from May 18 - 22. I would not recommend this hotel for childeren or for people that do not get around easily. For anyone else this hotel is the place to go. The views are out of this world and the service was great. The prices at the restaurants were high but it is what I expected. The food was delicious and the service was great so I did not mind paying the price. We stayed in Las Olas and think it is probably the best area of the hotel to stay in as far as location. I would recommend going to the rain forest - the tour guide was great! People must be real picky to complain about this place. The funicular never broke down and our room was clean and updated. The casino was great and we even saw live music one night. They had a huge Bacardi convention going on and we never felt ignored. The maid forgot towels one day but we called and within 15 minutes we had fresh new towels. I really think it is all what you make of it. This place was too nice to be picky about anything. Palomino island was amazing! Do not believe all the negative reviews - those people are out of their minds. They must be the type of people that complain about anything. This place was fantastic! We would definately go back to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Third Time is NOT a Charm.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our third visit to the Wyndhal El Conquistador. The prior two trips were wonderful. We never had a problem with the service and the resort was very well maintained. Upon returning to the El Conquistador, we encountered numerous problems. For one, the rooms were horrible. For starters, our ceiling was leaking. On top of that, we had no hot water and when we first checked in the water that did run was brown. Literally, brown, dirty water. To make matters worse, you can hear everything that the people next to you are doing. In addition, the staff was not friendly, at all. I know another reviewer stated that if you smile and try to be amiable, the staff will respond to you in the same manner. I beg to differ. The staff, with the exception of a few encounters, are often unfriendly and not helpful. We were misinformed on quite a few occassions and most of the staff is unwilling to offer any assistance. Listen, this is not a cheap hotel. If you intend to go somewhere and pinch pennies--this is not the place to do it. If you want to pay for a great vacation--go somewhere else. There are many, many wonderful places to stay where the resort, rooms, etc are well maintained and the staff is super-friendly. If you asked me prior to this vacation what I thought of the Wyndham El Conquistador--I would have had nothing but great things to say about it. But, after returning from this trip, I will never return. After checking my credit card statement to make sure the charges from the hotel were in order, I discovered that they double charged me for all of my hotel expenses. This place is not on the ball. I will say that Isabella's (the steakhouse) is great and the service is top-notch. Also, if you do go to Fajardo, definitely venture out and try Rosa's Seafood. It's not fancy at all, but the food is super fresh, local and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel expecting total paradise and was very disappointed, especially for the price. The room next to us had so many roaches they had to call an exterminator and our bathroom was leaking water from the roof. They hotel staff would leave plates of food sitting outside the rooms for days. We went to the resteraunt on the terrace off the lobby one morning to find there were tables that still had plates of food on them from the night before. We got there before they opened so I guess they thought they would clean them when they got there that morning or something. The employees that worked the desk at the casino acted like they didn't know what they were doing. However, I must say, ALOT of people were winning money from the slot machines....alot. I would say at least half the people that were in our group won at least a couple hundred dollars. About the resteraunts.........my GOD! They are way overpriced. I expected to pay alot for the food but it wasn't worth the money. We went to Isabellas one night and we all ordered steak. My friend ordered it medium and it came out well done. I mean it was even burnt on the bottom. When you pay $50 for just a steak (no sides, breads or vegatables...those are extra) you want it to be right. Our friends that were staying on the lower part of the hotel said it was flooded with water and our friends that were staying by the lobby said they had no electricity one day. The ferry workers were really great and told us alot of info on where to go and things to see. Also, Palamino Island is georgous. The people that worked in the restraunt over there were VERY nice and friendly and made our time over there very memorable. The best thing we did there was rent a kayak and go over to the small island off Palamino Island. It was the best part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Negative reviews are way off!”
Reviews.Author: catheed
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday May 15 from a week long stay at the El Conquistador and we are so glad we didnt trust the negative reviews we have been reading. We stayed in Las Brisas, which is very convenient to the pools and most of the restaurants. The room was a good size, not the most updated furniture going, but still not bad. We paid $259 a night for the Deluxe Ocean View with a King bed and pretty nice view. As far as the restaurants go, you will definitely have a wide range of culinary delights to fit your mood. There is Blossoms, which is Japanese Habachi style, Isabella's which is a steak house and Otello's which is Italian, just to name a few. We had great meals in all of them, pricey meals, but good. Portion size is never a problem. We live at the Jersey Shore and are close to NY, so paying alot of $$ for dinner is the norm for us. There are plenty of pools and great lounge chairs with big fat cushions to relax on. Many reviews spoke about rude service or impolite help but we had no such problem. Some are friendlier than others, but you will find that anywhere! The grounds and views are truly lovely and it is way worth a second visit. Maybe next time the sun will actually be out! Bottom line: Consider renting a car so you can explore San Juan on your own. Expect to pay for high prices for meals, bring your appetite, bring your sunscreen and lay back and relax!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest vacation in long time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late at night with my family and thought it was going to be tough to find something to eat...not true the restaurant outside overlooking the pools was clean, and offered a great late night menu for all of us...and the smiles very welcoming from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Next day off to the beach via water taxi kids loved it and the beach area a definte WOW!! at night plenty of restaurants to choose from all different price ranges...we danced, we ate, we walked, great!!! Sorry my wife nor I took advantage of the Spa or golf course as we were having too much fun on the Island and just were not there long enough...can't wait to go back would encourage family's or wedding party's to visit the El Con we saw 4 weddings from our balcony taking place outside overlooking the ocean made me want to propose all over again

Reviews.Title: “Are you people kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: abc123
Reviews.Content: How spoiled are people? What elso could you possibly need on a vacation? Who are the Trumps of the world that complain about a place like this? This resort was marvelous! The people, the island beach, the pools, the food, the room, the views, the weather, the palm trees, the memories, the breakfast on the balcony, and of course the company you keep on the trip. Smile and be polite for heavens sake and the staff will do the same. I heard a customer complain that her steak wasn't pink enough, ate the whole thing and the second steak she received for free within minutes. If someone just cooked you a 10 oz. steak, say thank you and be thrilled you are not at home doing the dishes that your steak is on. I was amazed at all this resort offered and fell in love with puerto rico. Be thankful you are not at work and enjoy paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need major overhaul”
Reviews.Author: wyatts4
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews before I made the reservations. The positive about the Wyndham was the service. (Except for hotel check in- which took about 30 minutes because of the line) And the view from the room was nice. But the condition of the room was unacceptable for a 4* hotel. The painted lights were peeling as was the furniture in the room. The bathroom was dated and dirty with hair in the tub upon arrival. The price of food was very expensive. Overall I was disappointed and would not recommend or return unless there was a major overhaul of the rooms. P.S. The elevators are still leaking

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: tearsofjoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from spending 4 days at the Wyndham. I read all the reviews before leaving and was not sure what to expect. Having traveled extensively to Europe and the Caribbean, we have a pretty good idea of what a 4-star hotel should be. The grounds at the Wyndham are incredible, my hubby who is an avid golfer was drooling the second he saw the golf course. The rooms, on the other hand, could use some work. The walls are very thin so bring ear plugs of you are a light sleeper. I was awake every morning by 7am because that is when the family who was in the adjoining room woke up. Hubby is a heavy sleeper and he heard them as well. After the first night we decided to place a towel under the door to block out some of the noise. We were placed in a room with no bathtub and the bathroom floor flooded each time we took a shower. Not abig deal since we would cover the floor in towels and house cleaning would clean it up. The food was pricey, not anymore than places in Jamaica, Grand Cayman, etc. that we have visited. The beach on Palomino Island is beautiful, and the taxi to and from was not that big of a hassle. All in all, it was a great vacation. We wanted to relax for a couple of days and we were able to do just that. Since we got a great deal on priceline I was not terribly disappointed. However, there is no way I would spend $200+ a night to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: relocating_to_tampa
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Wyndham in 2004. We got a great rate by signing up for the Wyndham frequent guest program that also gives you a couple of extra perks while at the hotel. Their private beach is amazing. Great service. Clean rooms with great views. Large pool that was always empty and several whirlpools. Ask for a room near the funicle which overlooks the water(this is the exterior elevator that takes you down to their ferry to get across to their beach). The restaurants were pricey but in par for resort prices and was pretty tasty. I would suggest renting a car if you are staying there so that you can eat at some of the very good local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing...Tropical...a wonderful retreat for the weekend.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read 50+ reviews on the Tripadvisor website which gave me a great opportunity to set my expectations: Used Wyndham ByRequest and checked-in within 5 minutes and had goodies waiting in our room. Had a wonderful room overlooking the golf course (La Vistas) which was quiet and peaceful. Grabbed a few breakfast pastries from David's cookies and caught the first taxi out to Palamino Island every morning. We immediately went to the opposite side of the island to maximize the serenity. (If you retreat to the beach, bring water shoes...it's a must due to the coral and rock). Resort has a jewelry store offering %off of David Yurman and Rolex AND no TAX!!! This was a DEAL! Prices on food/drink were standard for any resort that we have ever been to: Poolside Pina Coladas/Mixed Drinks = $8 Hot Dog and Fries = $9 Pizza = $18 Calamari = $11 I'd go back...without a doubt...

Reviews.Title: “Pricey”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirl3
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days at the El Conquistador Resort & Golden Door Spa. Took the shuttle (provided by El Conquistador) to the resort - they offered free drinks (soda, water, bacardi) on the shuttle bus. Took 1.25 hours to get from airport to the resort (don't expect a beautiful view en route to the resort - you drive through very poor areas). Had private check in at Las Casistas Village, then straight into the Infinity Pool. Service was v. good (the people are VERY friendly). Took a walk to familiarize ourselves with the property. Immediately made spa appointments for the following 2 days - service was outstanding at the Spa. Had both a deep tissue massage and a facial -- both recco'd. Also I recco signing up for any day tours asap (as some are only offered on certain days). Cost $49/person for a ride down to Viejo San Juan (no tours, no guide, just a ride). Would recco finding a Pueblo (small grocery store) and purchasing a bottle of wine & corkscrew for afternoon drinks back at the resort! Only downside to this place is the cost of food. If you are not on an all inclusive plan be prepared to spend $$$. A grilled hot dog at one of the restaurants is $8.75 (even a Fenway Frank is only $3.75!) Overall, this is a great place for a short getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me on this review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay at the El Conquistador "Resort and Country Club". I'm not sure if I would call it that. I was hesitant to write a review, but I feel that someone who's considering staying here should be aware of some negative things. Overall, we had a wonderful time. Like my husband says, "A vacation is what you make of it." But, for the price we paid, I expected more. I always say, it's the little things that count. A five star resort usually goes out of their way to make your stay special. I didn't find that here. As far as the food goes, my husband and don't mind spending money on a good meal. We knew that it was going to be expensive. But I can't help but feel cheated. Just not the quality or service that you would expect for a $200 dinner. We averaged about $300/day for meals. We also had alot of rain in the evening. But that can happen anywhere. What bothered me was out of the two main elevators, only one was working the whole time. And when it rained, water would come in from the top of the glass elevator and the floor was flooded. And I don't mean a slight leak. It struck me as being unsafe. The rooms are spacious, but in desperate need of remodeling. I hope this helps someone who is debating on this resort. Please don't let anyone tell you that this is a "Five Star Luxury Resort". The location and view is beautiful, but I would not stay here again unless the resort had a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations are everything!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned on April 26th. I must admit that after booking my stay, I read negative reviews on Tripadviser, Frommers and Foders- they all said about the same thing- bad service, bad and overpriced food, Holiday Inn or lower sleeping rooms. I wanted to cancel my hotel and find another but I would have lost money so I decided to hang in there. The travel agent called hotel to alert them to my concerns and I also called- gave them my Wyndham By Request # and expressed my concerns. They reassured me that all would be well and told my travel agent I would be upgraded to an ocean-view room. Expecting the worse, I was pleasantly surprised by the nice folks that greeting me when I arrived from the airport. The ride to the hotel was long, but I was warned of that by other travelers who wrote reviews. We rode through very depressed areas- that was an incentive for me to stay on hotel property. When I arrived on Friday afternoon, there were no long lines at check-in and everything went smoothly. The property is absolutely gorgeous (exterior). The views are spectacular. The ocean view from room was a dream. The room itself was very average- or for a resort, below average (I stayed in Las Brisas off main bldg). Mattress was soft and bedspreads, clean but cheap. (rooms look just like the plain, dated rooms on the Internet). At least the room was clean and I did not have any of the problems the others experienced (mildew/dirty carpet, etc.). Tub required a step down. Would not have been good for an elderly person. Food is pricey! I had 1 very good meal at Stingray (Tuna). They kindly substituted potatoes for spinach. Fresh, hot and good. $30. Meals at other restaurants were not much of a value, but to catch a cab to other local restaurants when I was traveling alone did not seem like a good idea. Went to Cantina (horrible chicken fajitas- $22!!), Blossoms (avg Chinese food- very fresh vegetable soup), Belle Vista- (mediterrean salad was good, but skimpy on feta and olives)- later I learned the brick-oven pizzas were a hit)- Had Eggbeaters at Caribe Cafe- okay. The best thing to do is to bring your own food for in between-- if you are bringing kids and not on the kids eat free family getaway plan, you should bring your own snacks. If you forget- they are cheaper in the airport than they are in the hotel! I saw folks bringing their own food- sandwhich meat, bread, junk food, boxed juices, etc. like they were going on a picnic or going camping. (-: All rooms have refrigerators. On the drive from the airport to hotel there is a Walmart and Walgreens- if you are driving- it is worth a stop for last minute needs. Fitness Ctr in Las Olas was nice and clean. Fresh towels and water cooler- nice view of the ocean while on cardio equip. Also has "Life Circuit" weight centers. More equip is at the Golden Door Spa, but for $20 and no view, I thought Las Olas was just fine. You will do alot of walking- most resorts are spread out- it is just that since this is on a cliff, you cannot ride a golf cart up and down the steep hill! The funiculars were clean and operated well unlike what some previous reviewers experienced. The 5-star neighboring Las Casitas is lovely. The Infinity pool is not as large as photos make it seem, but absolutely gorgeous and worth a walk or golf cart ride over there. The pools were all nice and well-maintained. Everyone in the hotel were so friendly and helpful. Ran into one lady with a bad attitude at Caribe Cafe. I asked for oatmeal with no sugar and of course when I got it she told me it was pre-mixed- with what I wondered- and sure enough it had sugar. She had an attitude about taking it back, though she said, "no problem" her tone was different. Otherwise, every single staff person I ran into was really nice! Palamino Island was nice- I found a chaise with no problem- did some kayaking- that was fun. The beach was beautiful and crystal clear (though not as large as I imagined, but very sufficient) Very casual resort. Night life sorta lacking outside of the casino. Maybe if there is a big group in town, the dance floor gets jumping, but it never jumped any of the nights I was there unless that happened after midnight. I guess I stayed at a good time- all was well. Everyone seemed to be having a good time. I had a very nice experience. If I had paid top dollar, I would have been disappointed- I am very particular about bedding. But haven gotten a really great deal and knowing that it was not the Ritz, I was overall pleasantly surprised and pleased. Last note- the Gen. Mgr has made himself very accessible so if you have any problems, you should contact him immediately. It is all about expectations- read the reviews (don't believe everything)- know what to tentatively expect and how you might handle that and you will have a delightful time.

Reviews.Title: “Family enjoyed El Conquistador and Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: lovethecape
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from El Conquistador and really enjoyed it. I have two sons ages 12 and 8. We've been to Disney twice (stayed at the Polynesian) and Atlantis in the Bahamas last year - all large, family resorts. The place did not seem to be too crowded. The only day we had trouble getting into a better restaurant without a reservation was on the weekend. We paid $260 a night, which I thought was a good price. The kids meals were free if they ate off the children's menu, we had 2 for one watersports, and we could use the fitness cetner at the spa for free - Family Getaways - By Request. I think opinions posted are often based on how crowded the place is at the time and how much you pay for a room. Some of the rooms are worn (ours was). We could have asked for an free upgrade the next day (the day we checked in was full) because we are Wyndham By Request members but we stayed because the location was convenient (we were in Las Vistas) - close to the Main Lobby and restaurants and the view of the golf course and harbor in the distance was beautiful. We were also away from the noisy pools. Most of the staff were wonderful, a few were not (mostly on the island). The food was actually pretty good, but you won't be wowed. We had a light breakfast at David's every morning, juice, tea, bagels, pastires. We had most lunches at the resort on the island at Iguana's, the only place to eat there. Lunch adds up since everything on the menu is around $12 + $3 for a soda or $8 for a tropical drink. They do have a kid's menu at most places but they don't automatically bring it (grilled cheese, PBJ's, chicken fingers, all about $5). Ask for it. I think we spent the most money on the island because we kept getting ice waters and drinks. We ate at Stingrays which was good, La Cantina, very basic Mexcican food but the kids liked it since they were starving at got chips and salsa right away. Otello's was good but the Japanese grill and sushi were very good. These meals were much less expensive than Atlantis and there were many other more casual places to eat during the evening at this resort (burgers, pizza,...) Some folks bring over little cooler (hidden in their bags) with water or their own rum and mix. We just decided we were on vacation and didn't want to work too hard. Do ask for a couple of cups of ice with your bottled water because it gets warm so fast. The kids loved the private island. We kayaked to the smaller island near by and had it all to ourselves. The water was warm and crystal clear. We saw stingrays on our ride over. They jet skied with their dad and rented floats. They also enoyed seeing the large iguanas which were in the little field right behind the restaurant. If we didn't have the kids, we would have gone to the quiet beaches on the otehr side of the island. One of their highlights was seeing the Ba Ha Men perform for the Nextel group on the beach- even though we weren't part of that group. The Ba Ha men were great and signed autographs after the show. They also enjoyed the pool with the water slide, filled with children, loud, with music playing. I just got a pina coldada and read my book. Go to Las Olas or the Marina Pool which are basically empty if you want a quieter area. The grounds of the resort and views are beautiful. We enjoyed Old San Juan (rented a car) and El Yunque rain forest (about 15 minute drive away). Take the Las Minas trail to the waterfall in the rain forest and wear sneakers and bathing suits under your clothes. Many people take a dip into the pools near the falls. Don't pay any attention to the weather forecast on the internet. Yes, they predicted rain for every day of our trip. But it was sunny most of the day and we would get showers in the evening. Or it would be raining at the main hotel but the island would be beautiful and sunny (its only a 15 minute boat ride). We really loved Puerto Rico and hope you have a nice trip. There is no reason not to have a good time at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back last night.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, first let me say, I am very fair in my reviews and will tell it like it is. I am a 30 year old software sales executive from the New England area and travel very frequently on both business and pleaseure with my wife. We have been to places such as: Hyatt Kauai, Las Ventanas in Cabo San Lucas, various Ritz Carlton/Four Seasons, Sandals Negril, and now El Conquistador in Puerto Rico. In a nutshell, VERY disappointed. I will never return, nor recommend this resort to anyone. The hotel is dirty, not kept up, very expensive, poor service, and rude, apathetic employees. The two positives on El Conquistador is the private island has a beautiful beach/water and the rooms are large. I have have stayed in some of the best resorts in the world and have no problem paying top dollar for excellent quality and service. El COnquistador did not have either. Occasionally, we would encounter a waiter here or there that were far superior to the rest, but that was rare. Here are some of our experiances, and you can judge for yourselves: * It rained alot at night, and the hallways and elevators were flooded * 2 Days later, the stagnenet water from the flooding rains were still there and not cleaned up * The elevators and tram service to the main hotel frequently broke down, or were "Under Repair" as they called it * The water taxi was broken down on one of our days, so us and about 100 aother people had to wait 1 hour in line while they shuttled people 30 at a time on a much smaller boat. * We paid $250 for dinner one night at Le Bistro. Had to send back my steak, it was still mooing it was so raw. The service was horrible. They automatically add in 20% tip, so they don't care about working hard for their tip, they already are guarenteed 20%. The waiter sneezed over our table, walked in and out of the room laughing hysterically from some joke another waiter just told. - For a $250 meal, we should not have to have the service equivillant to Denny's. * One night our electronic door swipe reader (the key to get into the room) broke. It "ran out of batteries". We called MANY times and the manager waz rude. She made it seem to be my fault that the door reader was not working. My wife and I had to wait 1 hour in the hallway for them to send security to replace the batteries so it would work and let us into our room. - Did I mention, while we were waiting 1 hour, it was a tropical downpoour the whole time. When I spoke to the manager she gave me an attitude. I spoke with her manager and she was nice enough to waive our $110 transfer fee to/from the airport. * I'm in sales, so I am used to it, but there are about 3 "President's Club" sales trips going on at any given day. Corporate events are always going on where you will have hundreds of people from various companies all over the place. * Our room (in the Marina section) was nice, however, it had an ajoining door to the next room, which you could hear the people next door. Not a problem, until the locals checked in. The hotel offers local Puerto Ricans discounted rates to the hotel and many locals will check in on the weekend. - Our neighbors consisted of about eight people ranging from ages 25 and under. They partied all night, were very loud yelling in Spanish, and playing Spanish Music all night. They partied until 3am. We didn't call security because we shared an end unit with them and if security came, they would know it was us and we wanted to avoid any confrontations with the locals. * Can of Coors Lite = $5.50 * Mixed Drink= $8 - $10 Sorry for the bad review. If I had a great experiance, I'd post that too. I just wanted to let people know because I look to this site for advice when looking to book a vacation. If you haven't booked it yet, do yourself a favor and go somewhere else other that El Conquistador. It seems to be a property that was once 5 Star back in the 70's & 80's, but it is CLEARLY not what it once was, or what it is portrayed to be....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but an overpriced ripoff for just about everything else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What is most telling about what a rip off this place was, is when I went to purchase a copy of the Sunday New York Times at the hotel shop. The Sunday edition is normally $3.50, but the hotel price is $10.85. I was not expecting modestly priced food and beverages, but this place is ridiculous. The amount of money you can spend here is substantial, be forewarned. Another example, a single small scoop of ice cream is $3.50 - so if you're traveling with children, be prepared to spend lots of money on all meals at the hotel. The golden door spa and the golf club is beautiful. Overall, a nice place to visit if you have lots of money to spend beyond plane fare and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can understand negative reviews.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I traveled down to this resort on 04/17 through 04/20 with a large group.. I was EXTREMELY nervous about this resort due to the many, upon many negative reviews, but felt that I was going to just go down with a positive attitude and come what may........The resort's views are breathtaking!!!! I live in southern Florida where it is pretty much paradise all the time, but I found myself just standing at a balcony just taking in the view for hours!!!!! It is really unimaginable how beautiful it is..... We traveled the back roads to the resort from the airport since it was rush traffic, and i have never seen such poverty and filth in my life on the island of Puerto Rico!!! Me and my partner agreed we were not going to venture out much outside the resort, but the complaints that it took a long time from the airport to the resort, I think is just people not patient and not willing to just sit back and relax...... Check-in was easy and the bellmen were right there waiting to help us to our room with our baggage. Now, being with a large group, I guess i cannot say if the treatment would have been the same. But honestly, I observed and watched everyone getting the same treatment! AGain, we were with a large group and pretty much had everything paid for.. But, we saw the receipts of some of the meals, etc. and it was absolutely outrageous. Breakfast buffet for two was $50; way too expensive!! Prices are outrageous! WE usually just split the meals that we were responsible for, but be prepared to show the cash!! The staff overall was very nice but I can see where people could partake them as being rude. We did have a few that we just shook our heads at but the ones that were nice and helpful went out of their way for us....But honestly in general, I believe that was the general attitude on the whole island.. The people even at the airport in San Juan were not very helpful and the language barrier can be very difficult if you do not know where you are going...and just as it can be here, money talks and if you are willing to tip for good service, we usually got it 99% of the time.... NOw some positives that I disagree with in some of the reviews, one night we had a major company party at the bottom of the cliff, so you are talking couple of hundred people needing to get to the bottom and it could not have gone any smoother. About 30 people can go in one car, and both cars were running and it went very smoothly. I have to disagree with people that the furnicular is such a hike. Remember, you are on the side of a cliff, so how do you expect to get from one level to another? If you are going to complain then stay home....The boat to the island was beautiful and again went smooth!!! I really cannot understand what people are complaining about. The view is breathtaking!!! Just sit back and relax. You are supposed to be on vacation! It took no longer than 15 minutes, which is really not long at all and the pictures you can get are worth it....The Palomino island was beautiful. We never encountered one rude person the several times we went over there. Everyone was gracious and helpful and whatever towels we needed, we were provided them.... Same at the hotel. Maid service was right on and gave us everything we needed....OUr room and bathroom were clean. Yes, it was worn some, but this is not New York! OUr only discomfort was the air conditioning in the room, which i heard several people complaining of. The rooms would not get cool and when you come in from being out at the pool or beach, you want some cool air!!!! But, they offered to change our room and we declined. I really think that this resort on a cliff and in the climate it is in just has problems with the temperature, but that is just my opinion. It was not unbearable though. we just kept the heavy curtains closed during the day when we were gone to keep the sun out... THe casino was great! We won at Blackjack most of the time. Everyone was having a great time. On friday night, the place was packed and tables were cheering and it was a general good feeling of people having fun! No, it is not Las Vegas big, but it was a blast! They also had a big salsa type Latin band in the hotel playing in the lobby right outside the casino on Friday and SAturday night. Everyone kind of gathered around and danced. The atmosphere was very fun and festive! The pool area was fantastic. Staff friendly. Pool was clean and towels were right there, all you had to do was go to the towel stand and check them out. I really just could not imagine why people were complaining of that.. It was very simple!!! The spa!! Oh my gosh! I again cannot understand what people were talking about. They were right on. I got a locker and the girl attending the showers was right there putting in fresh towels and you could get shower shoes and then sit in the tea room or just sit around and relax in your robe and read. It was very, very clean..... I inspected very closely let me tell you.... It was heaven!!!!! The girl who gave my massage was waiting for me when i got out of the shower and the massage was one of the best i have received. She was very professional and it was soo relaxing. But again, the price was high; $120 for a 50 minute massage.. This is a very honest opinion. I wanted to lay it out there because I know how i felt wondering....You need to remember you are not in Las Vegas or New York, and the resort shows that but it was still very clean and we had a great time. Just be prepared to shell out the cash. If you are on a tight budget, I would say this resort is not for you......I would be very nervous with little ones. There are too many stairs and pools and things for them to get hurt on and a stroller can be more work than actually being easy......If you decide to go, Relax and enjoy. It really is a beautiful place... REmember: Every place has it quirks, but it is what you make of it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador - huge, expensive, mediocre”
Reviews.Author: golfhead
Reviews.Content: Something about this place depressed me....our room was a bit dated and we spent $50 for dinner....canned soup & bad rice and beans....AND for breakfast......a nothing-special buffet. With taxes, our room came to $300....not worth it. If you can live without golf and Disneyesque shops, etc. go to Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “First and Last trip to El Conquistador (and Puerto Rico)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We brought our four children, ages 1, 4, 10 and 13 on a trip for 5 days. Although there were lovely things about this resort, I literally kissed the ground when we got back home. I don't want to repeat what others have written, I'll just "ditto" the slow service, mediocre food comments. I have a few additional problems to report that haven't been mentioned as far as I've read. First let me say that this website was extremely helpful to me in planning for this trip. I was able to really prepare and didn't feel lost when I got to the resort. Okay, first of all I am not a cheapskate. I am willing to pay for high quality service and goods. I had sticker shock at every turn in this place: $11.00 for two scrambled eggs with an unmelted slice of american cheese, $4.00 for a snack-size bag of goldfish crackers. I've always scoffed at people who do this, but I wish I had checked a suitcase full of snacks. Palomino Island was nice, but if you have kids with motion sickness, give them dramamine before the water taxi. This next issue is really important. We had adjoining rooms in Las Brisas, with ocean views. We had our adjoining doors open the whole time. If the balcony door was open and someone came in the room's main door, the vacuum effect from the ocean breeze would slam the adjoining doors shut. I was caught by the door the first time this happened and I couldn't physically hold the door back from slamming on me, the force was so great. The next time it happened I was holding my baby in my arms, but I turned in time so I took the brunt of the hit. The next time, our 4 year old son got hit in the head, and went flying into the opposite wall. We called the front desk saying we wanted a doctor and they questioned us about whether we would be willing to pay for a doctor and did we know it would take 45 minutes for a doctor to arrive? If we wanted a doctor to call it would take just as long, but would cost $50.00. Unable to get past the billing process, we hung up and said we'd figure it out for ourselves. Someone from the Hotel came to check on us, he barely spoke English and used sign language to communicate with our son. He kept saying the hospital is 5 minutes away (we were so confused!). He left and we continued to monitor our son who recovered nicely and was left with only bruising on either side of his head. This left us feeling extremely vulnerable. We moved heavy furniture in front of the adjoining doors. The door design is really poor and they should at least post warnings about the "vacuum effect". Beware the gift shops! My husband touched a large wooden cat on a shelf in "The Conversation Piece" and the whole thing fell and several items broke. The two ladies working there got very upset, switching back and forth from English to Spanish. The instant this happened we said we would pay for anything that was broken, but they were still really mad and rude to us. They spread glue all over the broken things until I told them to stop. I had to say, "I am buying these, they are mine now and I don't want you to try to fix them". Before this happened we had already purchased two souvenirs worth over $100, so it's not like we were looky-loos or something. Overall, I wish we had saved the time and money and gone to a mainland resort. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Easter Week at El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: cornsilk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Conquistador during a busy time, Easter week. Our check-in was marred by a double booking of our reservation, and it took hours to straighten this out. However, to the credit of the hotel, the manager did offer us compensation for the delay we were subjected to. We went as a family of five with 3 single, adult daughters. Everyone had a wonderful time. The girls loved the spa and its treatments, and enjoyed their classes there. My husband loved the pool, and swimming laps. I loved the boat ride daily to Palomino Island. I never had a problem finding a chair on the island, nor did I have any difficulty getting drinks or food brought to me on the beach from the Palomino restaurant. We all enjoyed our meals there. Our favorite restaurant in the hotel proper was definitely Blossoms, in the table section in the rear. The manager there was very friendly and accommodating. Restaurants in the hotel are pricey, but that was to be expected. The kayak trip was great fun, and we had our own adventure when we took a small plane to Culebra to satisfy our daughter's desire for exploration. It was a great day, but for me, Palomino Island was so lovely, there was really no need to go to Culebra. One of the best tips I have is to register for the VIP Club room. This made it very easy to eat and relax and not have to go to a restaurant first thing in the morning. The staff here could not have been nicer or more accommodating. It was great to have computer access in the VIP lounge and to watch large screen TV, use the library, and help yourself to refreshments throughout the day, in addition to the hors d'oeurves and appetizers in the evening. Our room was in Las Brisas, oceanfront, and the view was magnificent. The rooms need refurbishing and decorating, but they were always clean and the maid service was attentive and considerate. Everyone I met through the 8 days I was there was helpful and kind and friendly. My only regret was that there was really no nightlife available for my single daughters. The supposed nightclub/disco/bar was empty every night. And it really is too far to go into San Juan for the evening.
