But, we had such full days, that really the lack of nightlife was not a major problem. The grounds were spectacular. The flowers, the water views, the public areas were all beautiful, and the best part of our stay here was just the sheer physical beauty of this spot. The weather was perfect the whole time. We stayed at the Hyatt Dorado Beach last year, and that was lovely, too, but more understated, and quieter. The rooms there were also in need of refurbishing. But, overall, I would say that the El Conquistador provides a memorable vacation, and I would highly recommend it. Tip: Become a Wyndham by Request member and get take advantage of any special deals they offer, e.g. stay 3 nights, get the 4th night free. If you don't want to join the VIP lounge option, then stay in the Marina, in a higher floor, in the area facing the Marina pool. This is a pretty, peaceful, serene area, which allows you to go to the beach daily without taking the funicular.

Reviews.Title: “Never come here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to this motel (yes motel) on business in April - three words - the staff suxs!! After bad service at stingrays we didn't tip - The manager followed us out of the restaurant and demanded a tip. All the bars have only 2 servers and they smell like rotten beer - the never smile or say thank you- At the Pizza place the server refused to give us plates - we called the night manager, Glenn, he came down and made the server give us plates. It takes 30 minutes to get a cocktail - after explaining to hostess it was unacceptable for a 5 star resort to have guests waiting that long for a beverage. You are going to wait 40 minutes to get a room than 4 hours to get your bags brought up- I finally commandeered a luggage cart and brought my bags to my room - one of the bell hops approached me and asked if I need help - "NO, I've got!" he then explained that I was not allowed to use the cart and, I told him how long I had been waiting - his answer sorry hotel policy and took my bags back to Bell services and another guy brought them to the room 30 minutes later. If you are trying to call Palomino water sports to book a jet-ski, forget-about-it. The operator transferred me 3 times to Marina water sports, each time I tried to tell her "Not marina water sports" I finally gave up after the gal in marina water sports asked if I was an idiot - for the third time "This is MARINA water sports NOT palomino water sports!!" (yea i Know!!) Our company had booked 12 three hour spa appointment - they were all screed up by the spa staff, thus people had to decide to golf or spa and missed their other activity, the stupid people at the hotel tried to charge us for not canceling tee times ect. in the minimum time. You will wait 30 mins. to get your appetizer 20 on drinks 40 minutes to get down to the marina (if the trolley is not broken) 60 minutes to get to the island 4 hours for your bags takes 7 hours to play 18 holes of golf 10 minutes to get an operator, front desk, bell services or reservation on the phone The rooms are $300+ per night, are average at best, breakfast buffet is $28 ($3 for a banana), $5.50 for a 10oz beer, the free gym is inadequate (you want need the gym itâ€™s a Â½ mile to anything from anywhere) an average dinner for two is $130. At the Mexican restaurant Â½ of my staff had already been seated at around 8:45, the other half ran to their rooms to get cleaned up after a day at the beach. When they came down the hostess locked the door and would not let them in, after yelling through the window the manager finally let them in and told us to hurry and order because the cook wanted to go home. So they did, I took 2 hours from the time they sat down until the check has signed. (we think the went home and came back an hour forty five minutes later. The bad news â€“ this only part of the crap we put up with from these people We should have known â€“ The Boston Wyndham fire alarm goes off every other day at 3am due to â€˜wallpaper fumesâ€™ (we a minimum of 30 guests there per week)

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a 6 day stay. My partner was part of a rewards/recognition trip for a world-wide organization. We have traveled extensively and have been fortunate enough to be able to stay at the top brands including Four Seasons, Rosewood, Mandarin Oriental and Ritz Carlton so this will give you the basis for my review (see my reviews at those properties). The property is positioned on the top of a cliff with the most amazing views of where the Atlantic meets the Carribean Sea. It is quite dramatic with very lush and beautiful grounds. The facility is huge, megaresort as mentioned in a previous review, with many different "villages" based on the location of the rooms with many activities for families to enjoy. All are centered around their own pools and are either at the top of the bluff, mid-way down the bluff or at sea level. We stayed in the Marina Village by the water. For a 3 star property is was very nice with some interesting pieces of artwork all trying to give you a sense of Spanish Colonial. Overall nice, but it was in the details which limits the quality of the hotel. The facility was a bit worn with small things like paint chipping, cracks in the corners, stains in the carpets and rugs and things which were not quite pristine, which you would never find a 5 star property. As for the room, it was large with a nice size bathroom and a beautiful view of the marina and ocean. If you are on the ground floor, you will have people looking in as you front the major walkway which overlooks the marina. The sheets were stained, the bathroom only had one sink and although the furniture was tired, it was comfortable. I found the service to be good especially considering the massive size of our group, but could see that if you weren't part of the group, it could be problematic and slow. The only real incident I had was with dry cleaning which after 48 hours never made it to the dry cleaning and had to be sent back unfinished as I had to leave the following day. The spa treatments were wonderful, facial and massage, but again the facility itself was not quite top notch. For example there was carpeting in the men's locker room and waiting area which I found a bit unsanitary. The showers did not seem quite clean and the treatment rooms did not give you that sense of cleanliness you would want in that setting. The staff were very polite but it was a bit nerve-wracking in that they did not instill a sense of calm in the facility. For example, the staff would yell to each other from the 3 floors of the lobby rather than call or come down to each other. I found this to break the sense of serenity a spa should be instilling. The restaurants and bars were nice but average. I particularly enjoyed the Ballyhoo bar and grill located in the Marina Village. The outdoor setting by the water was wonderful, the staff attentive, the drinks potent but the food avergage. We ddid not have a chance to try room service so I can't comment on that. We did venture to the Island for the beach but for a private party. What I saw was quite pretty and the boat ride itself was nice. It gave you a nice perspective to look back at Puerto Rico. All in all, if you have a family to entertain and are looking for a 3 star property you will not be disappointed. If you are looking for something more upscale, private and secluded, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Astrid L
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel at least twice a year because it is excellent. I live in Puerto Rico and have stayed at all the great hotels, but this is the best by far. Great food, golf,pool,service,casino, beach. If you can afford it look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive for what it is, and too much work getting around...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the El Conquistador with our three daughters, age 22, 15 and 14, on Thursday March 24 with very high expectations of the resort. We had booked two rooms in the Las Brisas wing, and were hoping to be upgraded to an ocean view room. We were very disappointed to find that we were in the Las Vistas wing on the first floor on the other side of the resort. For the price, the rooms should be beautiful, but they are tired and need redecorating. The patio was filthy, the table chipped and dirty, and there was only one chair out there. The same was true of our daughter's room. There was very little privacy, as the tennis courts were right outside our doors. When I talked to the young women at Wyndham By Request about a different room, she basically laughed at me. Apparently, the hotel was very overbooked for Easter weekend. Which caused many of the problems we had. The funicular kept breaking down, We had to wait in line to get on the boat for the beach---in fact, on Saturday, it took my daughter and me a full hour to get from our room to the beach. From Friday through Monday morning, I made sure to get up very early, skip breakfast with my husband, and get on the earliest boat to Palomino Island in an effort to secure chairs and towels for my family. On Friday, they stopped bringing people over because the island was over-ful, and on Saturday, an announcement was made at around 1:00 that they would continue bringing people over to the island, but that there were no chairs left. The main three pools on the lobby level were also extremely crowded, and looked dirty. I would not set foot in them. We did have one delightful day at the pool on the middle level---but the bar service there was awful---there was no wait staff to accomodate us. I waited at that bar for more than ten minutes to get drinks---there was only one girl working the bar. The drinks were extremely expensive and contained not nearly a full shot of alcohol. Since there was not enough wait staff available, my daughters went to various dining establishments to eat lunch---and routinely waited for an hour for service. The same was true at Palomino Island. The food at the restaurants was always good, but not good enough to warrant the prices. My husband and oldest daughter had to go home on Tuesday, and I moved into room 4041 with my two younger daughters until we left on Friday. My husband left very disappointed in his vacation. Happily for us, the hotel cleared out on Monday and Tuesday, and it was easier to get around, and to get service. Then, unfortunately, Citibank came on Wednesday, and took over the beach on Thursday. I was glad to leave on Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Underserviced”
Reviews.Author: lin77
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews on the resort I was hesitant to say the least, but being a company function had no choice. As many reviewers have said, the grounds are beautiful and wonderfully maintained, but this resort leaves a lot to be desired. The room we were initially given was directly over the pool(open 24 hours)and had no balcony. The room was tiny but my main concern was the mildewy smell. We requested another room and reluctantly were given one in the same section but overlooking the golf course. It was much bigger and had a large patio and the moldy smell was not there. The two main concerns we had with this resort was the service (or lack of) and pricey food, regardless of which restaurant you went to. (At Stingray we were told we could not have salad as they were out). One and then both funiculars broke down over the time we were there and the staff made little or no effort communicate this to us or provide alternate transportation until repeatedly asked. It took us an hour to get from our room to the restaurant for our dinner reservation that evening. We felt as if we were a nuisance in this situation and many others. On one occasion, the housekeeper knocked on the door and when I conveyed we would be vacating the room in a few minutes she "explained" the clean room/do not disturb sign to me in a very condescending manner. At nine dollars for a hot dog and twelve for a hamburger my husband and I found ourselves sharing lunch on a daily basis. It is true that you are held captive there as to get to a grocery/liquor store is $30 return by taxi. We made use of the Wyndham By Request as that assured us of a couple of bottles of beer, bottled water and cheese and crackers in our room. The beach was very nice, but took a while to get to so you had to plan it all out - mornings are best. We spent most of our time at the pool at the Marina as it was quiet and peaceful and there is a grassy area where you can sit in the shade relatively undisturbed. It seemed like the best location to stay on the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Resort is immense, yet beautiful. Setting is fantastic. However, you will pay for EVERYTHING, and you will pay through the nose! Ridiculously expensive food is mediocre, at best. Service is entirely inconsistent. I don't mind paying for quality, but I left the El Conquistador with the unmistakable feeling that I'd been ripped off. Perhaps it was the $13 hamburgers, the daily resort "tax", or the $65 late check out fee. Either way, I won't be taking the $30 airport shuttle (each way per person) back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: 23hoops
Reviews.Content: Okay, here is the situation. My wife and I decided to book El Conquistador to celebrate our 5 year anniversary over spring break (We are both teachers). We found the resort to exceed just about every one of our expectations coming in. We were able to get an incredible deal through priceline, which helped out b/c like I mentioned before we are both teachers, and we are both young to be staying at a resort like this (24 and 25). I would reccomend to anybody thinking about staying here to check out priceline and see what they have to offer. After getting to the airport we got on the Resort shuttle, and were off to the resort. The trip took approximately 1 hour 15 mins, and there were no problems. Upon arrival, because we signed up for Wyndham by request online, we walked right up to the desk and were checked in right away. Everyone else on the bus had to wait in a long line. We paid for a sunset room, and we were upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View room in Las Brisas wing. The room was extremely clean, spacious, and the view was breathtaking. Palomino Island was very nice, and boat ride over was fun. We went to the beaches on the other side of the beach area the first day (Not the Nude beach), and we were all alone until about 1:00. Beautiful views, and we didn't have to worry about kids kicking sand on us. The only improvement I would like to see them make would be to clean the water up a bit. There is very little swimmable beach b/c of coral and seaweed. The pools and hot tubs were great, and happy hour at the main pool was welcomed on our end (5-6 pm). There is something about a 3 dollar Dacquiri that makes it taste better than an 8 dollar one! We really felt that service at this resort was wonderful. Everyone was so nice and accommodating to us. I am shocked to see some of the other reviews on here, and how other people felt about the service. My feeling is that you get what you give. If you want people to be nice to you, be nice to them. Simple principle, yet effective. The Food was excellent, and we never spent over $60 for a meal. CHEAPSKATES TIPS FOR EL CONQUISTADOR. 1. Bring your own drinks. (We packed a couple 12 packs of pop in our suitcases and saved lots of money!) We brought our own drinks over to Palomino Island and no one ever said anything. 2. Bring some snacks. 3. Split meals. (Most of the restaurants serve a big enough portion that you can split an entree) 4. Use the Free fitness center at Las Olas. (You have to pay $25 to use the fitness center at Golden door spa, and it's not much better) 5. Massage your significant other!! ($150 in the spa!) I know I'm too cheap! 6. Rent a car. We did not but several people did, and were able to save a ton of money. 7. Eat pastries from David's cookies for breakfast. The buffet is $22, and a pastry is like 2 or 3 bucks. In closing, we would definitely go back to El conquistador. It was a beautiful 5 STAR resort with everything you could ever need. Sit back, relax, and ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property with Pricey Food”
Reviews.Author: phillyh
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old son and i just returned from a week over "spring break" at this hotel. It was our first trip to Puerto Rico and found the island to be a cross between Hawaii and Mexico, but certainly less"3rd World" than Mexico. The hotel is best described as HUGE, with close to 1,000 rooms. We were there during a peak week, and it was quite crowded. If you are staying on top of the cliff, you are required to ride a funincular to the bottom and ride a ferry to the beach at Palomino Island (22 minutes each way). The beach was great, with OK snorkling (great water, not too many fish). The staff was very friendly and helpful, but ran out of gear (umbrellas, floats, etc) pretty quick. One day they closed the beach around 1PM, saying that it was at capactity and did not allow my buddy to come over and meet us after he fiinished his golf round. There is a clothing optional beach on the othr side of the island, but we did not go there!!! The food in the various restauants quality wise is OK, with our favorities, in order, Stingray(seafood, down by the marina), Othello, (italian), Isabellas (steaks), Las Olas (Mexican) and last and least, The Chinese place. It was not good at all, way over priced and sucky food.(We did not do the teppan Yaki or sit at the sushi bar, just had a table) In all restaurants,the food is extremely expensive. The wine lists are extensive, with few bargains, and the some of the better wines at a "fair" (compared to the $396 bottles that would be $55 elsewhere) they were out of. This did not prevent us from having a great time and enjoying our meals. The golf was first rate. Also , the tennis was of the highest quality in every way. The pros , especially Juanito, wre gentlemen, helpful , professional and caring. I give the tennis and golf 5 stars. To traverse the property takes some time, it is huge, and you spend some time waiting for the fununcular, but not too bad. We stayed down below right by the marina, and would reccomend those rooms. There is a quiet poool down there, and easy access to the ferry. Taake the trip to El Junques also, the rainforest. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location/Bad food & service”
Reviews.Author: BarbieBattaglia
Reviews.Content: We went to Puerto Rico with my husband's company last week & I must say I was disappointed in the Wyndham El Conquistador. The resort itself was beautiful and well maintained. The service, however, was below average. For example, when we arrived it took them 5 hours to bring our luggage to us and we missed our dinner reservations. Others in our party, complained of smelly rooms, no electrity, hanging light fixtures, and tv didn't work. We stayed at the Marina which meant that we needed to use the incline cars and elevators to reach the main resort. Because one of the inclines wasn't working while we were there, it took us approx. an hour to an hour and a half to get from our room to the main entrance. We weren't thrilled with any of the restaurants we ate at either. Service was VERY slow and food was expensive and mediocre. The hotel has a captive audience so expect to pay $7 for a rum & coke, $10-15 for a salad, and $30-40 for dinner. We learned after a few days to buy our own bottled rum & coke in the gift shop to save some $$. Even there it was 3x what you'd pay outside the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel with horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to this hotel. I was very impressed with the public areas, but after that it was an average trip. The rooms were very dated. We had an ocean view in the new section and still felt the rooms were average to bad. Old bed spreads, peeling paint, old bathrooms, etc. The food was the most over priced I have ever seen at a resort. A normal breakfast of 2 eggs and bacon for both my wife and I, ice tea for her and diet coke for me, ran somewhere in the neighborhood of $32. We travel extensively and found the value for the money the worst we have seen. It is clear that you are at a resort with no other food options, so they pretty much extort you. Service. I am traveling extensively for a current client. I spend a good bit of time in the Philadelphia Crowne Plaza and the Hightstown, New Jersey Ramada Inn. Comically enough, the Ramada Inn in New Jersey has MUCH better service than found at this resort. My wife and I were at one of the bars by the water trying to get a drink before going to the private island. A bar tender actually looked at my wife after her 3rd request for a drink and told her she should wait a minute. He then lit a smoke and finished it before he waited on her. His name was Javier and the bar was Bally Hoo in case people think this is an exaggeration. This was one of the better experiences at this bar. It got worse. All in All, worst resort service of all time. Example of the service we expect at a resort, Westin at Whistler in British Columbia. Room Charges. Since this is a resort, every person has the room charge capacity. REVIEW YOUR BILL. Found over $300 worth of incorrect charges to my room number. Had to go through line by line with front desk. Apparently man people abuse this as they wanted to pull all disputed charge receipts. When they pulled them they found incorrect names and room numbers charged to my room. Be very careful. This was a work trip for my wife (top 10% account execs). We both agreed that we will not attend next yearâ€™s trip if it is in the same resort.

Reviews.Title: “very nice property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Jusr got back from a 4 night stay at El Conquistador... We had a terrific time... The resort is huge with plenty to do... Our room was in the La Olas section.. Nice room, ocean view, very clean... This section is the smallest one at the resort so the pool was never crowded and we had no noise from the neighbors... We read all the negative reviews before we left and were apprensive but there was no need! The funicular takes some time and it did break down a few times but it is a fun was to get up and down the cliff! We found the food to be terrific(stingrays was the best!) food and drink very expensive so be prepared. The service was good and the employee's were so nice... All and all a fun resort!

Reviews.Title: “Property Great, Rooms Outdated”
Reviews.Author: ConnieS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at this resort. This was a group trip so I'm writing this on behalf of many of us with the same experience. Overall the resort is beautiful, with lots of activities for singles, couples or families. What was disappointing is the room. Dirty and outdated. Carpets, walls, bathrooms not the cleaniness you would expect for a resort of this caliber. Since the rooms are not great, be sure you get a water view room that extends over the pool area out to Palimino Island. This is the best view. Make sure you stay in the wing that is attached to the main lobby area. Any other location is a hike to get to the pool area or food/coffee. The Golden Door Spa is overrated. It was very busy, but that is no excuse for cleaniness. I did not feel pampered in he least bit. They ran out of massage therapist, so I was forced to have my massage by a male therapist. He wouldn't listen to me when I said he was pressing too hard, and I ended up with brusing on my legs and back. Food was okay, but a little overpriced for the quality. Service.....low marks for service. No one went out of their way to make you feel like you were important. Every request from a glass of water to a beverage refill...just seemed like we were offending them or making them work too hard. All in all, my husband and I have been to many resorts in the carribean, try any other island before chosing PR. It is a city with a beach. It is very hard to feel like your on vacation and to receive the pampering you wish to have while on vacation. We never felt like we were on vacation...it just seemed like NY City with a beach with average service. Based on feedback from other guests...if your going to stay in PR than this is the resort. Don't even bother staying anywhere else. This resort is as good as they come on this island.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great..!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW.........great experience...!!! We just returned from PR..and we stayed 8 nights at this resort. We have stayed before at four seasons and always prefer staying at top class places for vacation...This is the place...!!! Will write review in detail later....now just copying some of the pictures I took... Enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “Resort 5 star NOT INCLUDING sad rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Feb 25-Mar 3, 2005. NOTE: Do not arrive during the week between 3-5 pm. Traffic is always btb then--3 hrs. and 20 mins. for the normal 1 hr and 15 min ride to the hotel (on comfortable a/c'd hotel bus). The reviews we read here are mostly accurate. Five stars for appearance, grounds and amenities. The rooms are initially attractive but a second look reveals a definite and overdue need for refurbishing. Everything is clean, just VERY worn, stained, or broken. The cost of food ran $75 for lunch and $150 for dinner on avg for two with no alcohol. We ate in all restaurants/cafes except Mexican and food was very good with better than avg portion sizes. Resort personnel were always helpful, attentive and friendly; some privately owned shop employees weren't. We stayed in both the Grand Hotel (golf view) and Las Brisas (ocean view) and both were the same: unbelievably noisy with doors routinely slamming, all-night whistling frogs, 24-hr funicular cranking up and down the cliff, all day pool side volleyball competition with loudspeaker and loud music 9-3 for two days, flushing toilets, deck chairs raking across patios, fighting guests, lots of stroller-sized children crying and running everywhere...only sleeping pills and dead sleepers will survive. As one review correctly noted, the guests were something else. Most often interactions revealed demanding, rude, impatient attitudes. We visited the spa, paid $280 for a very basic manicure/pedicure--not worth it. The grounds of the resort are clean, beautiful, and offer lots of places for privacy, fun and quiet. The hotel was booked to capacity this week, but we never felt crowded or had to wait for anything. Palimino Island is best to visit first couple boat rides or last trip over at 2:30ish as roped swimming area is small. Unless they improve the room accommodations, we wouldn't think of returning again except to enjoy dinner or cliff views.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd wonderful trip to El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: twoplustwo
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week at El Conquistador -- our second trip there -- and had a wonderful time. We were in a room in the main hotel with a gorgeous view of the water, with access to a VIP lounge (a very nicely appointed room, with big couches, internet access, a widescreen TV tuned to CNN, and breakfast -- muffins, cereal, fruit -- and hors d'oeuves daily). We found the housekeeping service to be excellent; our room was sparkling clean, and any requests for extra towels were immediately fulfilled. My only complaints are s-l-o-w service at the restaurants (not a problem if you're not travelling with antsy kids!), and construction noise from the rehab of Las Brezas restaurant. SOME POINTERS: 1) Get up early and reserve a chaise by the pool, particularly if you want shade. Ignore the signs saying that you're not allowed to do this -- everyone does. I suggest putting more than a towel; leave a magazine and flip-flops or a t-shirt. Then go have breakfast and come back later. 2) On nice days, it's also smart to rent tubes/rafts early as well -- once they're gone, they're gone. This is particularly true on the island. 3) Skip the food by the pool. It's ridiculously overpriced (a $10 hotdog!) and not very good. Except the fries. 4) The restaurant above the pool (Bella Vista) has very, very good pizza, and you can go there in your swimsuits. Service there for dinner, though, can be VERY slow. 5) Blossoms is fun for kids, and worth the money. Make sure you reserve a table by the hibachi. Again, VERY slow service. 6) There's a buffet dinner right near Otello's -- can't remember the name of the place. The food's not fabulous, but it's good enough, and it's a nice option if you have antsy kids. 7) The restaurant on Palomino Island is fine (I liked the grilled chicken sandwich), and fun because the occasional chicken or lizard will run under your chair. 8) I suggest beach shoes for swimming at the island, unless you have tough soles. 9) I had a great time at the Spa (though I don't have much experience to compare it to). Had the Isla Bonita Body Scrub, which was wonderful. And the gym there is nice. You can pay $25 for a day pass to the spa, and use the gym, the showers, the jacuzzi (which I thought was lovely), and relax in the lounge. Worth it. (If you pay for a treatment -- the body scrub was $115 -- you can use the spa all day.) 10) The snorkling trip was fun, but don't expect to see a whole lot....some colorful fish, some sea urchins, and maybe a turtle. But dolphins swam right by our boat on the way over! 11) The nighttime kayak trip to the bioluminiscent bay was GREAT. Be prepared -- it's a 30 ride (with two of you in a kayak, going in a line with the other people) up a mangrove channel in darkness -- very cool. I was with my 8-year-old, so it was hard work. But worth it! Then you hear an interesting talk, and if you want, jump in and swim for a few minutes. Look down at yourself -- you'll look like you're covered in pixie dust. Memorable. 12) There's a place to rent DVDs and videos to watch in your room--right by David's cookies. 13) We highly recommend the mint chocolate chip at Cafe Caribe! (And the arroz con pollo.) Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Ideal Vacation Spot!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyBugDi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from El Conquistador, Puerto Rico resort and had a marvelous time (02/24/05 to 03/03/05). I have read many, many reviews of this resort and specifically looked for all the negative aspects which were mentioned and I found "NONE" to hold true. Simply stated... the staff/personnel were all very, very friendly and helpful. In fact, one of the maids offered to go get us ice. When she returned we were going to tip her, and she refused to accept it. How nice is that? Our room was immaculate and had a spectacular view of the ocean and Palomino island. Despite what others have said, the funnicular never broke down and it was quite a fun way to get down the cliff. There were no mosquitos, and the beach on Palomino Island was NOT rocky or hard on the feet. The restaurants were plentiful and had a total realm of price ranges to meet just about all budgets. Sure there were very expensive restaurants there (ranging about $35 per entree), but there were also places you get a sandwich, pasta, pizza or a chicken ceaser salad for much, much less. AND, we found "ALL" the food that we had there to be very, very good. Stingray was a pricey restaurant but, very very good as was Isabella's (we had the petite filet mignon)... excellent service and great tasting. But we also budgeted ourselves and had pizza one night outdoors by the pool... it was great as was the spagetti and meatballs. We also ate at Ballyhoo's down by the marina and we had a chicken ceaser wrap which was about $9... terrific. The only negative thing we encountered was that initially the Conceirge desk made it seem that only the very expensive restaurants were available, and they suggested we make reservations for them all ahead of time since they book up fast. But after doing a little research on our own, we discovered that there were about 5 other restaurants to go for meals on the resort which were much more affordable. It helps to be resourceful! The views and setting of this resort were outstanding in every way. Many flowers and greenery everywhere! The pools were beautiful! Great place for kids. They showed a movie outdoors by the pool one night for all the kids! How nice is that?? Also, there were many activities for kids to do there.. including a wonderful waterslide. Staff was constantly cleaning and maintaining the resort.. which shows their interest in preserving the quality. The boat over to Palomino Island was so much fun! We even saw a 35 foot whale next to our boat, since it was mating season!! The staff on the boat are very careful and adhere to safety at all times! Palomino Island was simply beautiful... a true carribean island... You must go up to the trails and see the Igaunas! We must have seen 50 of them during the week... some as large as 5 feet long. They are so interesting yet harmless. Taking photos of them was a real challenge since they run fast. All in all, this is a highly recommended resort... not for singles, but for families and couples. Would definitely go back. Please read all negative reviews with a grain of salt (or sand... whatever the case may be). Please go there and enjoy!!!!! Its all worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Average & Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: lexitaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 3 kids 1/2 President's week 2/23 - 3/2. Wow, what a difference. The place was SO CROWDED the first few days with all the kids off from school (our travel agent had warned us) but I wasn't anticipating not being able to get dinner reservations within the hotel nor did I think we'd have such a hard time getting a chair at the pool/beach! Also, both the pool and the beach are packed, packed, packed with lounge chairs that are so close together and line up in so many rows, you can barely walk around them to get anywhere. I kept waiting for someone to fall into the pool as they slithered by the edge just to get to the bathroom. Here's the deal. Even without the crowding, this place is on a beautiful cliff overlooking the ocean. The weather and the view were spectacular, however, the pools are a bit funky and need a good cleaning as could the rooms use. When we checked in, there was dark hair in our shower and on the floor (my family is all blonde) which led me to believe they don't clean very well. That hair remained there for several days and my husband finally called and asked the bathroom be recleaned. On the last few days of our stay, the hotel was fixing, hammering, and powerwashing making it extremely noisy and took away from our 'relaxing' vacation. The men were powerwashing at 11:00 am with people all around the pool and the gas fumes were gross as I sat and watched all of the debri from the grout going INTO the pool where my kids were swimming. We took them out and went and had another overpriced, mediocre lunch. The workers were replacing a roof the entire time were there and the casino had jackhammers running during the day as it looked like they were ripping up some pipes. I wondered why they would do all of this work during the busy season and can only attrribute it to poor planning/management. To get to the beach, you need to take a 20 minute boat ride across the ocean and it can be very bumpy so if you are a person who doesn't like boats, don't go here because there is NO BEACH at this hotel, which is a bummer if you like early morning walks on the beach or running as my husband does. Can't do it here. There were days my kids wanted to stay at the pool which was very noisy and I wanted to go to the beach and read a book quietly, but there is not much quiet here and that option was not available since it is such a haul back/forth to the beach. The food is okay (Blossom's the Japanese place actually had very good food) but the prices are truly a joke. $40 for a steak and everything else alacart $8 for baked potato, $3 for small coffee, $15 for salad, $10-12 for drinks. My husband ended up taking a taxi into town just to get some snacks and juice boxes for the kids. We were then told we weren't allowed to take our small cooler to the pool or beach. It also annoyed me how they nickel and dimed us to death. They don't have kids menus at most restaurants, so they have to order a 1/2 dinner. My 3 kids each had a bowl of pasta without even a meatball in it for $10 each and it was the smallest plate I have ever seen. My 4 year old was still hungry. We live in an expensive area and are not usually shocked at how expensive things are, but this place is truly outrageous, and it's simply not wonderful enough to warrant it. We've taken several trips to Cancun and Jamaica with our kids and have found this place to be the LEAST kid friendly. It has 'activities' listed, however whenever we showed up at one, i.e. Beach Volleyball, Sand Art, etc. no body was there. We hit the volleyball in the pool around ourselves and that was that. They did have a kids program, (extra $$$ of course) but we didn't feel comfortable with the fact that they would be taking our kids , 10, 7, 4 on the boat to the island. At other resorts, the kids programs are typically included and they were always close by so we didn't worry. Forget about massges, and/or golf unless you are willing to pay 3 X more than you should. My husband wanted to play a round of golf but when he found out it was $165 PLUS club rental PLUS cart rental he passed. I won't even go into the price of the massages. We've had them at other resorts and the price wasn't even close. We wanted to get a sitter one night so we could have dinner alone and hit the casino, and were willing to pay the $16 per hour (minimum 3 hours required) but when they handed my a 5 page disclaimer telling me the hotel was in no way responsible for any injury to my child and that they were not responsible for the 'actions' of the sitter, we passed. Again, other places we've stayed have these people fully screened and we didn't worry. There is a finuclar which is like a cable car that rides you up and down the cliff to get to some of the pools, restaurants and boat ride. This thing broke down while we were there and my husband was waiting 45 minutes for me to get back up to the room. There are no stairs or any means to get back up, which I found unbelievable in the case of emergency. Also, this resort is HUGE. 900 rooms and very disorganized. The reservations system at the front desk was either down or slow and the restaurants always had all kinds of mistakes and/or people waiting very long and becoming irrate. If you are someone who wants a more intimate or romantic setting, don't stay here. It's mainly families and lots of corporations having business meetings. Did I mention that the pool near our room was CLOSED for 2 full days because of a company convention? When we got there later around 5:00, many of the men were drunk and lound and talking obscenities in front of my kids. Overall, I'd have to say I was very happy to get away from the cold weather in New York and got myself a nice tan. But I would not stay at this resort again. There are too many other beautiful islands with better deals and better managed. I was torn between giving the hotel a 2 or a 3 star rating. I'd like to say 2 1/2 would be just right. Only because of the view and the pretty beach did I give it a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time for All”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this website I was a little nervous. When we got to the hotel the view was beautiful, overlooking the carribean sea. When we checked in we were told that since we were Wyndham by Request Members we had been upgraded to the Las Casitas section of the hotel which has 5 star service and is like a resort with in a resort. We arrived at 11 Am and were told that the room had not been vacated yet and they were at 100% occupancy. They took our bags let us change and gave us our passes to all the facilities. While sitting and waiting we met very nice ppl and heard nothign but good things about the hotel. Since our room took a little while to get ready the manager gave us dinner for free without an complaining or asking for it. The rest of the week was excellent the staff was very service oriented, polite and really cared about the guests. The facilities are wonderful the pools are great and Palomino Island is a blast. Yes the drinks are expensive but that is normal for a resort. The water at the island is like a big bathtub calm, clear and warm. The week was great and I would ablolutly return.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been any more fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: tchambl
Reviews.Content: What is wrong with some of you whiny people out there? This is a great place, beautiful setting and wonderful staff. The brilliant flowers, the blue skies, the many greens and blues of the sea--it felt like paradise! We just spent 5 days there and I wish it had been longer! We stayed in the Marina area with a fabulous room overlooking the water. We loved being away from the hustle and bustle of the main hotel area and had no problem riding the funicular and/or the walking involved in getting from our room up to the main area. We enjoyed the walk to the main hotel along the upper boardwalk with its amazing view. It's vacation!!! Why be in such a hurry? And I can't believe the people complaining about the beach being a 20 minute ferry ride away! We loved the chance to be out on the water during the ride and the beach was heaven on earth! Yes, the food was on the high side, but what do you expect at such a large and lavish resort? Go to the Cantina at the Marina and have the plate of nachos for $10--plenty for a meal for 2. Or walk down the road from the Marina to some of the local restaurants. All I can say is if you're going to complain about this place, you should just stay home!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Resort - Needs a Facelift!”
Reviews.Author: globejumper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel quite a bit in the Caribbean and we were looking forward to an enjoyable first stay in Puerto Rico. Needless to say, we were very disappointed with the El Conquistador. The entire resort is in need of a serious renovation. The rooms are marginal at best. The food ($20 breakfast - $30 lunch - $50 to $100 dinner) and drinks ($8 per) are expensive and not very good. The beach is on a separate island so you don't go from the beach to pool very easy. The gym is in horrible shape and the Spa is small (single hot tub (cold), 6 showers, steam room (broken)) and not very impressive. There are much better choices on other islands available for about the same cost ($295/night).

Reviews.Title: “Just came back from Puerto Rico - Loved the Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: Maynard_Marc
Reviews.Content: My family and I were a bit concerned reading the reviews, but we just can't understand the negative feedback. We stayed in the Marina section, the room was terrific and up to date. No problems at all with the room. The staff was OK, but I can see how people felt that they were too negative. The only bad thing really was the restaurant quality for the prices. Many options, including Otellos Italian cuisine. The meal at Otello's was certainly lackluster and way overpriced. Trips to Palomino were terrific. The funicular was being serviced a couple of times, but it did not seem to slow us down too much. One of the pools was being serviced. I would certainly recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting BUT rooms are dumps!”
Reviews.Author: stlmogal
Reviews.Content: Returned from trip to PR on Feb. 18th. The public areas, setting, and grounds are beautiful. Once we pulled up after the 2 hour trip on the bus to get to this destination (the traffic is extremely congested, making 31 miles feel like 150), the setting was breathtaking-lush tropical greenery, manicured golf course, a courtyard overlooking the pools and the Caribean Sea. But, once we checked in and arrived at our room in the Las Vistas section -YUCK! The room was filthy with mold and mildew all over the bathroom, one of the drawer bottoms in the armoire was falling out, the closet door was broken and woudln't slide shut, and the sink drain would not open, leaving water in the sink and requiring us to wash our hands in the tub. To top that off, there is a water pipe on top of this section which had air in it and anytime someone turned on the water in their room, it sounded like a jackhammer! After complaining to the hotel 4 times and threatening to challenge the charges on my AMEX, the resort finally refunded a portion of my money and moved us to another room. This one wasn't much better, though. It was in the Las Brisas section with an ocean view. But, again mold and mildew in the bathroom and a drop ceiling that had water stains all over it and was sagging! In addition, there was a 2 foot piece of molding broken off around the door to the room. Don't stay here! Stay at the Ritz-Carlton in San Juan. It is beautiful and costs LESS!

Reviews.Title: “Could not recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel years ago for our honeymoon. We fouind the staff less than courteous. In one instance we had extremely unsatisfactory waiter service. He ran after us as we left the dining room saying. "You forgot the tip!"My reply was 'I never tip for absolutely unsatisfactory service." The qual;ity of meals was neither good nor bad. The service was consistently below average for a resort hotel. Much of the staff was discourteous or uninterested in their guests.They also seemed surprised when they discovered we were fluent in Spanish. The nearby town of Fajardo is delightful. The views from the hotel are magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the setting, needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: 3Trotamundos
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 10 yr-old daughter and me stayed for 4 days at El Conquistador the week before Christmas and agree with many of the neutral reviews. I am not going to repeat what others have said in regards to location, it is plain BEAUTIFUL! However, the hotel rooms need major renovation. We stayed in the section of the hotel between the lobby and the GD SPA. We had an ocean front room, with a terrace. However, furnishing is old, dusty. The walls of the room are clearly showing signs of humidity and mildew. The bathroom was dirty and old. Fixtures were rusted, as well as the closet sliding glass door we couldn't open, more like 2 star hotel. The outdoor furnishing was also rusted; we couldn't sit outside and enjoy the ocean view. I guess it is hard to keep up with the maintenance of the common areas of this huge hotel, sometimes they were clean others not so much. Food is extremely pricey and fair quality. I know Puerto Rico pretty well, the food here is overpriced, and it has nothing to do with shipping food to an island. Funicular, just be patient, it is actually fun and different. Free ferry to Palomino, again, relax and enjoy the ride. We actually saw dolphins on our way back to the hotel late in the afternoon!! Palomino, heaven on earth. Spa, just ok, can get same service for less at other spas. Golf course, well kept with wonderful views but pricey. On the good side, great hotel for families, my daughter had a blast at the pool. Hotel provides entertainment for the kids. Again, GREAT cocktail drinks. Service was very good, friendly staff, check in and check out were easy. This is a beautiful hotel in a beautiful location, I would highly recommended it if you make sure to book an updated newer room and have the chance to explore local restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What you see is what you get "Beautiful". No negatives can be written about this lovely place, unless you some kind of wack or never been there. Encountered no problems. We ate at the various restaurants, NYC prices but the food was better. The room was above average, great views, clean. The boat ride over to their island easy. Great spa. Terrific golf course. Nice pools. Good casino. Hoterl layout, firnishings impressive. Only criticism was the lack of signs to find the hotel once you got near after a an hrs' drive on a stop and go lightfilled road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - if the price is right!”
Reviews.Author: GranReserva
Reviews.Content: I just came back to Europe from a 17-night trip to Puerto Rico. I spent 5 nights in this hotel, in Marina Village. The resort is huge and has many buildings, oldest ones must be from the 1950's. The Marina Village was very nice, like a small seaside village in Southern Europe. Las Casitas up in the hill looked like Positano in Amalfi Coast near Naples. The Marina Village area is perhaps 15-20 years old and some updating could be done. TV-set was old and not connected in a digital network - the picture was unclear. The room itself is spacious, beds are quite good, bathroom very nice and large, almost same size than average rooms in France! The room is equipped with VCR, CD and radio. We had a nice view to the Marina from a small balcony where the boat service to Palomino island departed. However, in this part of the hotel, aging was not a problem. The room was in a reasonable shape. All public areas were also quite nice. It was fun to see dozens of seniors being so concentrated in the Casino. That is quite exotic for a European traveller. They looked like kids playing video games. I have never felt safer than in el Conquistador, the hotel seems to be quite a substantial employer. The staff was very kind and helpful. Pools were nice but very shallow, only 1.00m (3.3f). I didn't see many waiters around, but 6$ + 18% for a 10fl oz beer won't make me thirsty. Palomino island is perhaps the best asset for this hotel. It was really a place to relax, surprisingly not very good for swimming. The transport is free, the only thing in the resort - in fact the cost is included in the resort fee. If you want to have a plastic kayak, it costs you 35$ per hour! My Toyota Corolla was around the same for 24 hours. I can recommend this resort if you get a good deal. At least half of the guests seemed to be in a conference or other business related trip. For them the cost issue is quite irrelevant. The lowest room rate in the hotel web page was over 300$ + tax + resort fee + parking etc. You could easily spend additional 300$ a day per person which makes me think other alternatives, like an all-inclusive package somewhere else. My room rate was discounted around 70% - at that cost I felt it was very good value in Puerto Rican standards. Perhaps the mixed feedback is based on a fact that this hotel is not luxurious enough for the wealthy people, but on the other hand it's too expensive for the middle income vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “The mystery continues....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read the positive and negative reviews on this property for years, and decided to check it out myself with a 9-day stay. The naysayers are right. Yes, this resort is spectacularly situated on a cliff with beautiful ocean views. That's the good news. The bad news is that a 20% gratuity is charged on top of prices that are already triple what they should be, two thirds of the restaurants specialize in frozen pizza and sandwiches only, and the sheer enormity of the property gives you a feeling of anonymity right from the start. The staff are either very nice or very nasty. Example: As I checked out, the receptionist, Rachel L. Rosa, glared at me from the start. Here I was, paying $1,400 for non-room charges (my total was more than $4,000) and she, unprovoked, is surly, demonstrating a marked attitude of being inconvenienced by a customer! Asking for a manager, I was given the classic predictable runaround. This is a busy, noisy property. If you're a high-activity extrovert, maybe down for the weekend to party or to play golf, or with business colleagues (there are always many large groups of rowdy business people), you'll like the mayhem. If you want peace and quiet and rest, it will be hard to find. Go to the Inn on the Blue Horizon on Vieques instead. This resort costs too much for what it promises, and the quality is very, very uneven.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Resort, But A Few Issues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. If you plan on going to Puerto Rico this is the place to stay. The rooms are very spacious and clean and some offer a great view of the pools and the ocean. Anything that you need or want is available at this place. The crew is very friendly and helpful. The issues: 1) Be prepared to spend money. Everything is expensive and very pricey. You can find a great deal on this place, but drinks and food is very expensive. Be prepared to spend. 2) Very Noisy. The birds in the morning are loud, but that was okay. Around 9:00am when the cleaning crew goes to work, it is almost intolerable. They housekeeping crew is through but very loud. A lot of slamming doors and cabinets. 3) The shuttle from the airport is very expensive. Even though the resort is almost an hour away. $60 per person is a bit expensive for my taste. Overall, I was happy with my time there. I recommend the resort to everyone. All the people who gave 1 or 2 star reviews, I don't think they were fair. This resort is no way anything close to 1 or 2 star rating. !! THIS IS ONLY MY OPINION !!!

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the bargain!”
Reviews.Author: jw9691
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 3-night stay here, and for what we paid, thought it was very nice. the rooms are average and the restaurants overpriced, but the pool area, golden door spa, and private beach (complete with lounge chairs, umbrellas, and waiters to deliver the tropical cocktails) made for a great getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Warm your soul in sunny paradise”
Reviews.Author: Island_Sun
Reviews.Content: A fantastic family resort. So much to do, so little time. The view is where the Atlantic meets the Carribean. The wife went to the spa, my daughter went to the Kids Club and I went golfing. We met back at the pool and swam to the bar for island exotic refreshments. The restaurants are a bit expensive, favorite restaurant was Isabellas, one serving can feed two adults. There was also a fantastic island beach where we took in the sun and rode horses. A babysitter at night allowed us to enjoy the casino and dancing. The room was average, but they all look the same when you are sleeping. We can not wait to go back and take a sailboat ride and explore the rainforest.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort Ever- and I'm a harsh critic!”
Reviews.Author: SheilaNYNJ
Reviews.Content: I'll try to keep it short and sweet since I'm notorious for going on and on and on about this place.. Reasons why I love this place and will never stay at another hotel in PR 1) It's simply breathtaking... as soon as you pull into the resort you feel as though you are driving up and around a mountain approaching a castle. Incredible. 2) No need for a car- cab it. This resort has EVERYTHING. Casino, dancing, Italian, Japanese, Spanish and American restaurants... upscale and affordable ones... 3) Has its own island! Yes... you take a free 15 minute ferry to Palomino island and if you take the first ferry at 9am, chances are you'll be alone on the beach! Horseback riding, jet skis, kayaks, tubes, etc. Amazing waters... shallow at first for kids play... minimal waves. (bring sandals... the sand is not without shells) 4) Perched atop a mountain, the views are spectacular! (Must get an ocean view!) 5) Roller coaster like "elevator" brings you down the side of the mountain to the marina... awesome. 6) People are so nice- not just the workers, but the class of guests. 7) Diverse food selection and delicious at that! (Japanese restaurant was decent, but then again, I'm a particular New Yorker :) ) 8) Bang for your buck. If you have AAA use it... this hotel is fit for a king but can be booked at affordable prices. 9) Bar in the pool is IN the pool! (see pic)

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The way Wyndham purports this hotel is a fallacy. El Conquistador is NOTHING SHORT OF A DUMP! The room we first checked into appeared as if it hadn't been cleaned in a decade....no towels, thick gooey dust on the vents, standing water on our balcony,etc. The hallways are disgusting & the place has no insulation. We could hear people taking showers two floors above us. Doors constantly slamming--There is no room to rest - what a shame. Our second room--upon walking in, i found, leftover from the previous guests, a woman's razor on my pillow...no towels, half emptied toiletries and again thick gooey dust on the air vents. On top of it, we were situated in between five inconsiderate families with multiple kids each (all together). The parents allowed their kids to sing songs in the hallways and run back and forth slamming doors from 7a-10a everyday. When we contacted security--several times, they continued to say that somone was on their way. Finally, I got to speak with the security guard personally, and he said "mam, I have been trying to call the room next door for the last half hour." What is that? How the heck are you going to solve a problem unless someone physically goes to the room and addresses it? Basically, I felt UNSAFE at this resort. I asked security, "what if I was being raped?" what are you going to do--call my room. The staff is LAZY!!!!!! When I asked the folks next door to control their kids and to keep the noise down, the woman said to me: "Its not my fault your room is tucked between five our families." After getting NOWHERE with security, I called the front desk again. They told me: "the good news is that the families are checking out tomorrow." What a consolation... I planned for my vacation for 9 months and saved all my pennies to have fun & relax in a "luxury" resort. We spent $2,000 bucks alone on food, beverage and massages--What a waste. It took 45 minutes to get a waitress at the pool. ONe day, I waited two hours for a corona. what a joke!! Additionally, the fernicular was broken down for five of the seven days we were there....on several occasions, we had close to 100 people sardined in one fernicular. This hotel is not capable of providing anything close to 5* acommodations..Their literature and ratings purporting themselves as first class resort are a FALLACY. Don't waste your time or MONEY!! The food is expensive and it sucks. I expect to pay $25 for a salad-but at least at other resorts, you get ripped off and it tastes good--here--don't count on anything tasting good except the french fries. Good luck if you stay here, but don't say you were never warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a gourmet food conference there and we were treated like queens! My room was located in the Marina section, so it was a haul from the main conference area, but spectacular views riding the funicular! And being able to run right out and hop the water taxi to Palomino Island was slick! We were a little concerned in having to wait for the funicular when trying to get to the meetings in the morning, but it didn't pose a problem as long as you allowed enough time. Our room was clean and very roomy. Everything was in working order. Diana the concierge was the most helpful hotel staff person I have ever encountered. Mariela the bartender at Bella Vista was great and her own concoction of a multiple Bacardi drink was superb!! The only complaint was trying to get to the Cantina for a Mexican meal. Could never get in. Our conference attendees (800+!) overtook the place, so that probably had something to do with it! Palomino Island was spectacular and worth the ride. Only other drawback is how long it takes to get there from the airport, but worth it once you arrive!

Reviews.Title: “Read it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our vacations in P.R. were a complete "fiasco" their meaning of customer service is a bad joke. We went for a wedding traveling with an 18month old child, knowing that they put us in "las Casitas". People! If you have a child you need an elevator there was none so we have to go three floors carrying a stroller, baby bags and anything else you wanted. The concierge counter was useless. We pre-paid (as a package) for 6 nights and since the first day we ask for a room change to which they said there were no rooms available. I sent my suit for dry cleaning and wasn't ready until 20 minutes before the weeding which was 45 minutes from the hotel. The "beautiful" funicular broke and was out of service for three hours. Room service was pathetic 55 minutes to bring your food and they manage (in the Caribbean) to deliver it cold! To make thing more interesting he complaint because we did not tip him!! The night before checking out the room key-card didn't worked so we called the front desk from the hall phone it took them an hour and forty five minutes to bring a replacement which guess what... didn't work neither. By them we ask to speak with the front desk manager who at the end of the conversation offered to give us a different room near by the lobby elevator... so now they did had rooms available. While leaving the room we tried to calm down and thought that we just had bad luck; real bad luck. For our peace of mind we ran into a couple that spend 3 out of 5 days with out a working shower and in exchange management offer them 2 additional free nights!

Reviews.Title: “mixed review”
Reviews.Author: beach47
Reviews.Content: My husband, our then 8 yr old daughter, and I went for 5 nights to this resort a while back. It's about a 45 min. - 1 hour drive from the airport, but the sights and the cab driver's information about PR made it go by quickly. The resort itself is beautiful. The fact that it's on a cliff gives you the most magnificent scenery around! We stayed in the Las Brisas section with an oceanfront view. It was an amazing view! The resort itself is very tropical with a lot of foliage, very beautiful. The other great thing about the resort is Palimino Island. It's a great way to spend the day. We went horseback riding, snorkeling, and just enjoyed a great beach day. The spa was great as well. The staff at the resort and in PR were wonderful, very friendly, and very helpful. The food was okay and it was expensive, not quite worth it for the taste. Now, for the room. We stayed in the Las Brisas section. The oceanfront room was up high on the cliff, so it gave you the most AMAZING view. You can NEVER get tired of the view. The room was spacious enough. It had ample storage and a walk-in closet. However, on closer inspection, it needed to be really upgraded, especially the carpets and the lighting. Mostly, it didn't bother us because we enjoyed the rest of the resort and the view was so beautiful. However, the last day, we got the shock of our life. They give you a hamper in the walk-in closet. When I went to empty it to pack our clothes, I found a huge cockroach along with my clothes! That scared the life out of me, and I had to drag my showering husband to go hunt it down and kill it. When I told the staff, they really didn't do anything except to say that they were sorry! Since it was our last day, I didn't push the issue, but I doubt I would go back to this resort again. That was the HUGE downfall. They need to do a major overhaul on the rooms, and improve the food. Otherwise, the location of the resort and the scenery is great.

Reviews.Title: “Just Not Clean Enough for so Many Stars!”
Reviews.Author: katieself
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviews this is a tricky place to rate due to the fact that the setting of the hotel is so beautiful. Although pricey, we did not feel it was anymore so than other nega resorts. My husband and I were there for him to attend a conference so we had a reasonable room rate and it gave us a chance to visit the island. We hoped it might be a place we might like to return due to the proximity and easy flight from Tampa. We rented a car, visited San Juan and then, despite poor directions from Avis, eventually arrrived at the hotel. We were checked in promptly and told the room, although smaller than others, had a large balcony. We have traveled in Europe for 30 years and are used to looking at a room before checking in but were tired and wanted to get settled so we did just that. My initial concern was that the bath/shower was old and did not look very clean but then I decided it was just worn. We were assigned to Room 4109 in the building between La Casitas and the main building with a nice ocean and pool view. We ate, visited the casino and I returned to the room to shower and get to bed. First disappointment came when I unpacked & the small closet doors came off the runner but you could slide them although it was bothersome. Then, putting toiletries on the bath counter was a large clump of hair that the maid missed. Now I am getting concerned! But I wiped the counters and continued! Then, all ready for a relaxing shower, I discover the water control handle in the tub was totally broken so I could not shower! Now 11pm, I had to dress, call housekeeping and wait for repairmen. They arrived, oohed and awed and then left to get a piece to fix it. After the second trip I called the desk to advise them it looked grim and we wanted a room with running water in the shower to which the woman replied "We have no rooms as we are 90% full"! I responded that I expected to be moved into a room in the other 10% if the third attempt to fix the faucet failed! Indeed, at midnight they finally said it was not going to be fixed. It was apparent that my inital concern that the bath was not clean was correct. The maid might have wiped it down but it certainly was not scrubbed with water! Why this room was not taken out of inventory for rehab is beyond me. This separates the property, in our opinion, from deserving any more than 3 stars. No one should have to pay in the high hundreds or thousands to expect a clean, orderly, working room. At 12:30 am we were finally moved into a much nicer room in the main hotel building and were satisfied with that room. So, now, the prestigious Golden Door Spa, which I have enjoyed at the Venetian in Vegas. I had made appointments before leaving the US but it rained all one day so I decided to go spend the day, enjoying the facilities at a reasonable $25 fee and hoping for a massage apt. to open up. I went to the shower area and stall after stall was disgusting with hairs and stuff from the bottom of people's spa flip-flops. I settled on one that seemed the least dirty! I maneuvered the shower heads to spray the corners where there was a buildup of accumulated "grunge" and hair and felt I improved it a bit. I was there all day and a woman repeatedly mopped the area around the jacuzzi when her time could have been spent cleaning the stalls with a brush and cleanser. There was a lot of mildew, a problem I am familiar with having lived in Florida all my life. However, I also know that a simple spraying of Tilex or bleach on a regular basis eliminates that problemvery easily. It was apparent the stalls in the spa and our room had not been thoroughly cleaned in some time. I heard several people comment that the hot tub in the pool area was not clean either and they chose not to go in it. I did go in it but agree that more effort should be made to clean around the tile edges. We enjoyed the restaurants and the foliage and felt the property had great potential. Regretfully, we would not choose to go back there. There are equally as beautiful properties in Florida with higher standards of cleanliness but n one that have the combo of the island beauty and culture, the casino, and the nearby rain forest. This places deserves to be first class.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the El Conquistador in mid December - 2004. Having read the reviews on this site, I was in 2 minds as to what to expect. What a pleasant surprise!! I have travelled to many international resorts and hotels around the world. Being in the travel industry myself, I have high expectations of quality and service -and the staff and facilities at the resort certainly met those expectations. Being Wyndham by request members allowed us a room upgrade at check in with welcome drinks and snacks in the room. We were upgraded to the Marina rooms - perfectly located for the water taxi to Palomino Island. The rooms were clean, and well equipped. I would recommend the Marina rooms if the beach/island is your main priority. Staying in the main hotel requires a "schlep" on the funicular to get to the water taxi - which I found a lot more appealing when used to go for dinner at night. Regarding dinner - the policy of most of the restaurants in the hotel is men have to wear slacks. Strange for a beach resort, and we were not advised about this until we tried to go to one of the restaurants. I found the costs comparable to many resorts I have visited - not expensive as some reviews have said. Overall a very pleasant experience, great beach activities, good facilities, good food, friendly staff and excellent location. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week at EC. My wife, our 11month old daughter and I had a great time ! Although it is not cheap, you get what you pay for, and EC is one of the best. The private island is great, but the many pools are a good place to hang out as well. The golf course looked very inviting, but unfortunately, I did not play. The place is very kid friendly; the Kids Klub is for 4 and older. If you stay more than a few days, take a trip to the El Junque rainforest and/or old San Juan. (by organized tour or your own rental car)

Reviews.Title: “Great view, lousy dirty rooms, bad food, indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: Jaewriter
Reviews.Content: Went to the hotel on business. Every single one of the thirteen attendees had complaints about their rooms: dirty sheets, dust-caked rattan chairs, moldy floors, bulb and socket fell out of sconce over bed when I tried to turn it on. The overpriced Italian restaurant had food about the equivalent of Applebee's. While the grounds are pretty and view spectacular, the overall care and feeding at this hotel are abysmal.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, two year old son and I traveled to Puerto Rico in December 2004 for 5 days. Its a beautiful Resort,(specially at Christmas time) the staff was friendly and accomadating....we requested a crib (even though we didn't use it, way to small ....) it was brough to the room right away..the room was spacious and clean....the food was exelent plenty to choose from....the private beach was gourgeous...we practicarly had the whole beach to ourselves ....the funicular was awesome definately a different experience. I recomend that people with kids stay at the marina its more convinient..the pools where beautiful. Definately try the mexican restaurant it was out of this world...I read so many reviews before I went and was so worried that I wouldn't like it all I can say is that everybody has his/her own experience....don't let reviews interfere with your decision you need to experience it on your own... loved Puerto Rico and the Wyndham and Conquistador we will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: pal56
Reviews.Content: My wife, two children (ages 8 and 16) and I stayed at El Conquistador for three days in December 2004. Overall, we had a great time. Our room was in the Las Brisas wing. Although the furnishings were a little tired (maybe 3 star, but certainly not 4 or 5 star quality), the room was spacious, clean, quiet and had a magnificent view of the Caribbean. The Las Brisas wing also is convenient to the swimming pools, restuarants, casino and the trolley down the hill to the marina. I found the service at check-in and at the various restuarants to be slow, but otherwise friendly, professional and courteous. Palomino Island was a highlight. The ferries over to the island are frequent and the ride is relaxing. We rode horses to the hills overlooking the island, which was scenic and enjoyable. We also snorkeled from the Palomino island beach over to a smaller island about 1/4 mile offshore, which was fun. We also jet skiied. The restuarant on Palomino island has a friendly staff and pretty good food. Service was slow, however. My wife and I did make the 10 minute hike to the back of the island where there are two clothing optional, small, secluded beaches with lounge chairs. One afternoon we were alone. The next afternoon there were two other couples. I won $1,100 playing blackjack at the casino over 3 days. Never had a problem finding an open table. Most tables were $5 or $10 minimum. The pool areas, grounds, spa and golf courses are all first rate. There are a couple of hot spas near the main pool that are relaxing to soak in, but you need to bring a towel after sunset. I would recommend renting a car from the airport. It's inexpensive and parking is only $10 a day at the hotel. The drive from the airport can be as short as 45 minutes and as long as 80 minutes depending on traffic. We encountered alot of traffic around noon on a weekday when we arrived. The last two miles can be tricky as signs from the main highway to the hotel are poorly marked and it's easy to get lost as you get near the hotel, but just ask someone for directions. The resort is isolated and a good hour or hour and 15 minutes from Old San Juan. I would return for a family vacation. It's also a nice spot for couples.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely time at Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After our one horrid night at Wyndham's Condado, I am sure anything would have seemed great, but we really did enjoy this place. The pluses are the pools, kid-friendly atmosphere, views and lots of food options (Isabels was a hit with us - breakfast and dinner). Minuses are the boat ride to the beautiful beach and looong drive from the airport. The boat to the beach was worth the trip, but sometimes you just want to roll over and land on the beach when you are on vacation. I would not stay in Las Olas or Las Marinas because you must take a funicular to get there. We saw quite a few boling tempers over the wait. We stayed in Las Brisas, which was very convenient to the pool and the funicular, which all guests must take to get to the marina where the island boat leaves from. Had we been there a whole week we would have gone for Las Casitas, very pricey but seemed lovely. I would ask for one near the pool though since they can be a hike. Overall, too pricey for a beach not on the premises, but we did have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent Xmas week at the EC and had a great time. Traveled with our AuPair, wife and 3 children, ages 8, 1 and 4 months. Went on a great package, "Four for Free" which included transfers from the airport and breakfast for two at the main buffet, now being held in Isabellas as Las Brisas is closed for renovations. We had two connecting rooms in the Las Brisas bldg. overlooking the Caribbean Sea...What a beautiful sight. The pools are beautiful, the service in the restaurants was quite good. The staff was friendly and always willing to help. Chairs at the pool were plentiful. I would go down to choose my seat at 7 am and was always the first and only person there for a while. I would sit and watch the sun rise on a beautiful horizon facing directly east. Lots of umbrellas by the pool as well, especially good with infants. Lunch service by the pool was very good. Made one trip to Palomino Island with the whole clan. The sea water is warm and clear...warmer than the pools at the hotel. Ate at Blossoms, Otello, Le Bistro, Cafe Caribe, Stingray and Cantina Las Olas. They were all good. Le Bistro was as good as any french restaurant on the mainland, but an Adults only affair...get a sitter and leave the kids home. All the other restaurants are very family friendly. The food and drink are expensive but this is the caribbean, a nice resort and one should expect to pay a bit more for these items. If this bothers you, you should rent a car and venture to Fajardo where you can certainly find less expensive venues. How can you not sip at least one Mai Tai or Pina Colada by the pool? Try it!! You're on Vacation. The golf course is magnificent. Played alone very early in am as sun rose. Finished in two hours because of a little rain. Again, pricey but well worth it. They also have great rental clubs...Callaways with two sleeves of balls included...you'll need them. The Casino is moderate in size. Not a huge gambler but they had $5.00 tables which made it easy to sit down and play for a while. There are ramps everywhere so pushing strollers around the resort is very easy. Good sturdy cribs provided. The resort is enormous and difficult to maintain. It is also over 50 years old. That being said the EC is a great hotel to travel to with your young family. Easy access in and out of SJU makes it a sure thing...no customs or immigration to deal with. Pack your bags, bring some sunscreen and have a great time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Las Casitas”
Reviews.Author: EquineAddict
Reviews.Content: Before leaving I read the reviews on this website in depth. It's true, the food is average at many of the resteraunts. However, the RUM drinks are out of this world! I recommend everyone of them! The best food was served at a resteraunt in the Casitas village. They even went out of their way to make my daughter a cheese burger that wasn't on the menu. I'm just sorry it took me two days to find this resteraunt. My husband was playing in the Ambassador's Cup so we ate most of our dinners buffet style. I'm not going to bother wasting everyone's time with a critque because no matter how hard you try, banquet food sucks...It was free, it was edible.....I'm not going to complain. I recommend anyone considering going to this resort to upgrade to the casitas! The service is the best, with 24 hour butler service. Just remember it's not a new york minute but rather a laid back island and you'll be stress free. Hector was a wonderful butler however, he got sick and we had a few in training that took over. We had a two bedroom Casita which really needed a make over. There was mold in the kid's shower and our bathroom was a bit better but needed new tile as well. The thing that really bothered me was the damn closet door that was broken, which made it difficult to get my clothes. One would have thought they'd have repaired this. The rug in the hallway was stained and needed to be replaced. The mini bar was never restocked but other then that, things were great. We spent very little time in our room, therefore, I overlooked the negitive and enjoyed the service and ocean front view.
