It did look like they were renovating buildings so it's possible our Casista just hadn't been worked on yet. Our favorite pool was again the one for Casita Guests...it had an awesome view of the ocean and was less crowded then the others. The Spa........hmmmmmmm how to begin I'm not a spa person but I decided to give it a shot since I was given a complimentary message worth $110. It was OK but I wouldn't waste my money. My therapist decided to discuss politics with me which just stressed me out....so much for relaxing. My kids (13 and 16) found it OK but no big deal as well. I guess we missed out on the spa genes in our family. The Roman Jacquizzi/hot tub/whatever you call it, was a hot 104 degrees...to hot for my tootsies so I by passed boiling in water and turning into a lobster. Saturday (12/17) was an off day for the Spa people. The manicurist was just down right rude to my daughter and I really wanted to stiff her on a tip. But, when I went to pay, the receoptionist asked me in a very loud voice if I wanted to give the standard 20% tip. I cracked under the pressure and consented! Palamino Island is just wonderful for the kids, you can rent innertubes, noodles, jetskies, kayaks....yada yada. The beach is bueatiful and the water warm. Note to parents...the kids have to be 18 to rent a jetski. Bottom line, the Casatas are wonderful, flaws and all and I would go back in a newyork heatbeat! I loved it! My husband will be playing in the Golf Tournment next year and we plan on booking an extra day. Oh yeah, tips for sightseeing... Hire a private driver for the Rainforest and make sure for the 45 minute walk, he drops you off on top so you walk down. Most of the tours drop you off at the bottom and the walk up hill is very strenuous if you aren't in good shape. Ask for Carlos..he is a great tour guide. For three people it cost us $150 but it would have cost the same if we had gone on the bus tour with a bunch of strangers. The private tour is the way to go. We also had limited time but we did go to Old San Juan for the shopping. Typical tourist shopping. We had dinner at the Parrot Club which I highly recommend. Brenda was one of the best waitresses I've ever been served by. Again, it's an hour drive to Old San Juan and we had no choice but to hire a private car or rent a car. We chose the private car. It picked us up at 3:30 (warning: many of the stores close at 5:30) and got back around 9:30 pm. The price (sit down) $350 which included a tip. For those on a budget...don't bother going to this resort. It's not cheap! Excluding drinks I'd say the average lunch bill for myself and my two kids ran about 40 dollars. Can't tell you about Breakfast or Dinners since ours were compted by Travel and Leasure Mag. We ate Breakfast at Isabels which was very good. One last note, Casita guests are given a comp breakfast at their private resteraunt. It looked good, fresh fruit, bake goods, coffee.... I hope this helps everyone out. Enjoy the resort, remember no place is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Christmas week at El Conquistador. This was just about the most perfect vacation we have ever taken. After reading some of the "horror stories" posted on this site, we were more than a little concerned. Check-in was fairly smooth, especially given the number of guests checking in at the same time. Our room wasn't ready, so we went out to the terrace to have lunch. After lunch, we checked into a beautiful room, very clean with a wonderful view. The resort is extremely well maintained. The pool areas, especially the ones in the upper areas are fantastic. During the week of our stay ( when the hotel was very busy) we never had a problem getting a chair at any pool or the beach. Many days there was some form of live entertainment at the beach or pool. Towels were plentiful as well, and food and beverage service was extremely professional and pleasant. In fact, from the management staff to the housekeepers, every employee we dealt with was nice and seemed concerned that we have a nice stay. We stayed on the property the entire week and found the food to be very good, in general. The few times it wasn't to our liking it was replaced immmediately or removed from the check. In terms of food prices, they are high; however, there are a number of choices in restaurants ranging from bakeries to high end, fancier eating areas. Regardless of where we ate, food prices were in line with other upscale Caribbean resorts. The only exception was Isabella's steak house which was extremely expensive ($44 for a fair ala carte steak) with terrible service. Avoid it. Blossoms proved to be a great choice. We played in the casino every night and although we lost, the casino staff was helpful and pleasant. They only negative experience was some cash taken from our daughters' room. Had they used the in-room safe, as we told them to, this would have the the BEST vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “I'll take Mexico any day!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms were fairly nice with great view. Food prices way over priced for the quality. Breakfast buffet $22 per person and never changed from day to day. Watered down drinks with jack hammers running inside the bar area during lunch and dinner hours. Cold hot dogs for only $8.00 with take or leave it wait staff. Resorts in Mexico far superior!

Reviews.Title: “The Finest Resort in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: detroitguy29
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three night stay at this property. I took my mother there for a Christmas gift. The reason I decided to go was because the Food and Beverage Director at this property was the former General Manager at The Martineau bay property where we had an excellent experience. We ran into this individual, who remembered us and he also seemed genuinely interested in our needs. He was also very appreciative of our loyalty. The room we stayed in had a lovely view of the ocean, and the beautiful, lush surroundings. We spent two of the days at the pool area, and one of the days on Palamino Island. The Pool areas were impeccably maintained, moreso than any other resort where I have stayed. I have read other postings about the island being a hassle to get to; I believe this is all a matter of where your head is. I considered it an adventure. Taking the transportation down to the dock is incredible. Whether in the elevator, or walking down the hallway, you are surrounded by incredible views. The fact that the elevator has glass windows really shows how much thought went into the design of this place. You have a beautiful view, no matter what you are doing. The 10 to 15 boat ride to the island was incredibly beautiful! The beaches there were white sandy beaches, with Clear, Clear water. What more could you want in a Carribean resort? The boat departs to/from the island every thirty minutes, so you never feel like you are stuck there. As far as the food being expensive; There are several different food/price options available, from moderate to expensive which affords everyone a wide range of choices. We had two appetizers at the bar from one of the restaurants which were incredible! They were also reasonably priced. The staff was pleasant and accomodating. At one point I had to deal with the Director of Security, who resolved a problem that we had almost immediately. He also seemed genuinely concerened about our stay at the property. I have stayed at every single resort in Puerto Rico, and the Wyndham El Conquistador is the Finest in every way. Sit back, relax and enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: suzypac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the El Conquistador and were happy with this property. We had some reservations given the mixed reviews and found that both the good and the bad are both true. The good: Well kept and manicured grounds. Incredible views from the resort's location. Rooms are clean, spacious. Staff is friendly. Palomino Island, the resort's private island and therefore the only beach access through this resort is very pretty with plenty of space/chairs/cabanas for everyone. Stingray Cafe is above average food. Common areas of the resort are well maintained. Very easy to get to El Yunque from resort. The bad: Rooms are starting to show their age. Walls are thin so there is potential for sleepless nights if you have noisy neighbors. Funiculars are a bit of a pain to have to deal with. That was probably my least favorite aspect of our stay. We didn't mind the water taxis to get to Palamino Island as much as some. I thought it was kind of fun plus you're on no time constraints when you're on vacation so who cares if it takes a few minutes to get there. Of course the mark up price of everything associated with resorts is true here also. We had an overall good experience. We would recommend this to others although I would advise to keep your expectations of this property to be closer to 3.0- 3.5 stars room amenities.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a great!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieCS
Reviews.Content: We returned a little over a week ago from a Family Reunion which included my mother's 75th birthday at this gorgeous resort. The food was great (I don't understand previous complaints at all). There were 18 of us and naturally over the course of almost a week, a few minor upsets occured. I don't think this was any different that the chance of this happening in any restaurant anywhere.Our rooms were lovely, clean, well-maintained. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, friendly and accomodating. They are well-trained to respond to any request or need. The lobby is luxurious and expansive. I think my favorite meal was the breakfast buffet. Fresh mangoes,papayas, grapefruit and heavenly pineapple. No, wait I think my favorite was the shrimp at Stingray's, perhaps it was the rack of lamb at Isabella's.....Hmmmmm.........

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day stay over Thanksgiving. Having read other trip advisor reviews before we left, we were somewhat prepared for both the negative and positive comments that have been made, and both are valid. We rented a car upon arrival, and true to what we read, traffic from San Juan is a nightmare. It is bumper to bumper on Highway 3 for at least 45 minutes. Plan on taking an hour and a half to get there. Also, the road to the El Conquistador is not well-marked (you follow these little blue signs that show a picture of a bed indicating a hotel) and the road winds around a lot - just when you think you are lost, you finally arrive at the resort. Upon arrival, we had no problem with check-in, unlike some others have reported. We arrived on the Tuesday before Thanksgiving, and I would think that there would have been a big crowd arriving around that time, but again, no problems. We requested, and got, the La Vista wing, which is up the cliff in the main hotel section. I agree with the comments that the lobby and dining areas are beautiful, but that the rooms are functional at best. They are clean, but they are bland, somewhat outdated in appearance. The landscaping is beautiful, but the walkways outside the hotel rooms are drab, with older, chipped tiles. It's all worth it because the views and location of the hotel is spectacular. The water is gorgeous, and the rain forest is at the back of the hotel, providing beautiful views of the mountains and the storm clouds over them. Most of the restaurants overlook the water, and it was wonderful having breakfast each morning while looking at views of the sparkling water and the other islands. We did not have any problems with the staff. They were more than accomodating and friendly. We had to cancel one room at the last minute (the day before arrival) due to a family illness, and the front desk refunded the deposit even though the reservation expressly stated that cancellations needed to be made 3 days in advance. Several times when we ordered soft drinks for the kids at the bars at the beach or pool, the bartenders gave them to us for free. I didn't think the drink prices were any different than at other resorts in Hawaii, or Vegas. Food was pricey, but typical resort prices. I did think the quality was slightly lower than most other resort hotels, but again, we were in the Caribbean, so I somewhat expect that. There is a grocery store 10 minutes away, so we stocked up on some basics (each room has a refrigerator), and snacked in the room. We were on a plan where the adults got the breakfast buffet for free, so we ate there every morning, and it was good. The food at Blossoms (Chinese) was not. There is also lots of fast food choices (Wendy's, Ponderosa, Sizzler) just up the street if you are traveling with kids. The beach and private island were beautiful. On the first day, one of the funiculars was broken, and as other people have noted, it was a real pain. We had to wait half an hour to get back up the cliff after spending the day in the sun. When both of the funiculars were running, it wasn't too bad. The ferries run regularly. The beach is on a peninsula, and one side is sandier, with less coral, and the other side has more coral (and better snorkeling). There is also sand volleyball and a basketball court. Everyone had something to do. The food at Iguana's on the island was good and reasonably priced. Because we had heard that the drinks were not, we just brought our own in a beach bag. Even with it being a holiday week, we never had a problem getting a chair, and we aren't exactly early risers. Same goes for the pool. Having a rental car increased our options. We did the rain forest tour ourselves. It's only 15 minutes away, and we paid $3 per person to get into the visitors' center instead of $50 on a tour. The trails are well-marked. We hiked to a waterfall-I would definitely recommend it. We were unable to due the biobay tour due to the full moon, but I've heard it's awesome. We did book a snorkeling trip through the hotel and were not disappointed. Prices no different than elsewhere in the Caribbean or Hawaii for the snorkeling, and it was just as good as those places. A couple of the nights, the hotel had a "dive in movie" at the pool for the kids. They loved it, and hotel staff passed out popcorn and drinks. The adults sat at a restaurant on the terrace overlooking the pool, and had a relaxing dinner while the kids watched the movie. We did not bother trying the Kids Club or the Golden Door spa after reading other comments about the prices. I agree with others that I am not going to pay an additional $20 to get into the spa and use the nice workout room. The regular workout room just looked so-so. We were so busy, it didn't matter too much. Although there was some construction going on at a restaurant near the pool, it did not interfere with our stay at all. Maybe it was because of our room location. The walls are thin, so if you get noisy neighbors, you're screwed. We were pretty lucky there as well. I think that happens at a lot of hotels, though, so nothing unusual there. In conclusion, if you know what to expect before you go, you will not be disappointed. We would go back (we went with 2 families, and both agreed).

Reviews.Title: “A great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: cnjmichael
Reviews.Content: Prior to our stay at this property over the Thanksgiving holiday, I must admit I was quite nervous about what to expect after reading so many negative reviews. Here is a snapshot of what we experienced: TO THE HOTEL -> The majority of the route to the hotel was on mutli-lane highways; traffic was no problem at all. It would have taken about 50 minutes to reach the hotel; however, I did have problems with the driving directions the hotel provided. After calling the concierge and getting better directions, we finally reached the hotel (lost about 20 minutes of driving multiple times past the turn-off point into what is a residential area. All told, I probably should have gotten more detailed directions before I left. CHECK-IN -> As a Wyndham By Request member, the express check-in took a total of 5 minutes, including time waiting in line. For a busy holiday weekend, I thought this was great! THE ROOM -> We booked a deluxe ocean view room w/balcony and requested either the Las Brisas or Las Vista wing so we could be close to the restaurants and pool. We got a room in Las Brisas on the 3rd floor - same level as the main pool area. The room condition and furnishings were okay, approaching 3 1/2 stars. This was more than compensated by the large bathroom, walk-in closet, and spacious balcony with outstanding views of Palomino Island. We reserved the family getaways by request special which gave us a 4th night free, 2 for 1 spa services, and free kid's meals (except for Isabela's below). RESTAURANTS -> Our first night, Thanksgiving Day, we ate the special holiday buffet at Isabela's. The food was well-prepared and the presentation was quite nice. We enjoyed the special Puerto Rican touches, such as tropical salsas and other spices that made it a little more than just a traditional Thanksgiving dinner. Very pricey ($55 for adults, $25 for our 5-year old). We ate lunch one day at Bella Vista, which overlooks the main pool. High quality food (I had a meatball sandwich on an extremely fresh baguette) and my wife had a chicken caesar salad. Lunch was about $45, including my son's pizza (which was free) and a large slice of tiramasu which we all shared. Breakfast at Cafe Caribe was less than adequate and for about $29, was completely lacking in value and quality. Another lunch was poolside, courtesy of Virgin and although the fare was standard (chicken fingers, tuna sandwich on pita bread, and fried), the quality was quite good. Our final dinner was at Blossom's, where we had the teppanyaki service. I had the filet mignon, my wife had scallops, and my son had a 1/2 order of shrimp (again free). Total cost was $93 and completely worth it, for both the quality and taste of the food as well as the entertaining preparation. PALOMINO ISLAND -> We went on the first full day around 10am in the morning. Taking the funicular down to La Marina was quick and efficient. In the four days we were at the hotel, both funiculars were in working order and we never waited more than 3-5 minutes in any direction. The ferry ride to Palomino took about 20 minutes, which is about the maximum I think we could tolerate. Once at the beach, it was easy to find an available palapa and relax beachside. I rented a pedal bike for me and my son for an hour ($30) and pedaled our way to a tiny atoll about 1/2 mile away from Palomino. It was a fun little open sea adventure and great exercise! POOL AREA -> My son went to the pool area every day and loved it. He particularly liked the kiddy slide and would spend an hour or more on this alone. We were always able to find deck chairs with tables and umbrellas, which allowed us to alternately sun and shade. GOLDEN DOOR SPA -> I had a 50 minute Golden Door massage ($110), which was just phenomenal. Of course, I've only had three massages in my lifetime, but nevertheless, this was the best. My wife had a facial for $115 and she said it was okay (not the best she's ever had), but worth the price, considering my massage was free of charge. OVERALL: I chose to rate the hotel as "above average" due to two factors: inconsistent restaurant quality and average room accommodations. Regardless, we will definitely visit again. We didn't try to do everything, but what we chose to experience was fantastic. Please feel free to email me if you have questions.

Reviews.Title: “Do not even consider staying at the El Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What else can you say about a resort where you pay top-dollar for a room during high season and they dont even bother to tell you that they will be doing major construction, with jackhammers, by the pool, even on Thanksgiving Day? Where there is sand in your bed from filthy blankets and comforters two out of the five nights you were there, even after you have asked for them to be removed? Where you are wakened by the sounds of compressors outside your door before 8 am twice in 5 days? Where every single mechanical device was broken 50% of the time? Where workers allow dangerous conditions to exist? You would have to say that this is not the place for you or you family, that this is a two star resort run by people who have never understood what four stars means. The El Conquistador will embarrass you in front of your guests over and over again...stay away...

Reviews.Title: “Stop Whining”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: *sigh* So many people who simply cannot enjoy themselves. First of all...stop complaining about prices. It is a high class RESORT HOTEL. Of course you will be paying a lot! If you do not want to loosen the purse strings, go to a motel 8 somewhere. Seriously...get over it. This hotel is simply marvelous. It is beautiful and very privately located. Palomino Island is a must see. But people...stop complaining about the Funicular's. They're fun! Where else can you take a ride on a funicular? Just relax for a few minutes and enjoy it as you descend down a lush green hill to the sparkling waters of the Caribbean Sea. The boat ride is also fun. Where is the sense of adventure? A boat ride across a part of the Caribbean Sea to get to a private beautiful island is not the end of the world. The snorkling there is great. May I suggest that when you all visit Puerto Rico, go see the El Yunque Rainforest. It's simply beautiful. But my two top concerns are people whining about prices and the funiculars. The pricing here is appropriate for the type of hotel you are visiting-a resort hotel. Also, be more adventurous. You're on a vacation to a tropical resort hotel surrounded by the beautiful ocean. Take a moment and breathe so you can take in all the sights/sounds. This hotel is simply wonderful. A true treasure on the island of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff did the best they could. The rest - 45 minutes to check-in in the express line. The roof leaked throughout the hotel when it rained. Deluxe ocean view had urine stain in the carpet, hallways were a mess. Over a half dozen folks we spoke with moved rooms at least twice. We moved to a Casita which is supposed to be a five star suite. TV cable wires hanging in the bathroom with no TV, dirty tub and dirty wine glasses in the kitchen. For the same price, you can stay in a suite at the Ritz in St. Thomas and have better time and more enjoyable experience. Avoid this at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Should have listened to the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unless you are looking for a golf and spa vacation (and willing to pay top dollar for it), I would not recommend the El Conquistador. My boyfriend and I often travel to the Caribbean. Our ideal vacation consists of relaxing on the beach, going to a nice dinner, and out for drinks. We ended up going to Puerto Rico for a 4-day getaway because of the convenient/reasonable airfare and we did get a good deal through Expedia, but the El Conquistador will nail you in every way possible once you are there. Since there are no prices listed on Wyndhamâ€™s website, here are a few examples: $40 Breakfast for 2 $40 Lunch for 2 (2 sodas, cheeseburger, club sandwich) $12 Watch a movie in your room $300 45-minute massage in the spa $40 30-minute abdominal class $20 daily fitness pass (or you can use the free gym but good luck getting a treadmill) $60 round-trip airport transfer per person $200 Nice dinner at Isabellaâ€™s for 2 (1 appetizer, bottle of wine, 2 dinners) â€“ food was good but have had much better for the money; Other dinner options are Otellos which is a fairly reasonable and decent Italian restaurant and Blossomâ€™s Hibachti-style Japanese but make sure you have reservations in advance $20 rent a tube to float on the beach $7 magazine (price sticker over the standard cover price of $3.50) The main reason I would never stay at the El Conquistador again is due to the hassle to get to the beach. We had to take a â€˜funicularâ€™ ride (there was often a wait as you are packed in the carts with room service, etc.) to the marina to wait for the boat to take us on the 20-minute ride to the island. This was an hour-long process so make sure you do not forget anything from the room! I wish I knew this in advance. As for the nightlife, there is one club. They play a good mix of music (meringue, pop, hip-hop, etc.) but is was basically empty every night we were there. There is also a casino for entertainment but the tables are defiantly over-crowded and the drinks do not come often (you actually have to pay for your own drinks if playing poker). The room was fine. It was a bit outdated but we did have a nice view from the balcony. The hallways, etc. were also outdated. We stepped in puddles of water outside the door our hotel room everyday. The rooms were clean. The cleaning service woke us up daily at 6:30 am. Even with the â€˜Do not disturbâ€™ on the door, we were walked in on. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. The El Conquistador capitalizes on the fact that there are No hotels in the area and you are basically stuck in the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good/Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night 11/15. The resort is lovely/staff was very accomodating. Check in is ridiculous (over 1/2 hour). The meals were expensive and quality was mediocre at best. They should invest in better chefs. Rooms were large and clean - however- for 2 nights we had to listen to a family of 4+ at all hours yacking etc... I would request a room away from families if possible. Drinks were pricey so I would hit the local grocery store to stock up the mini fridge. We rented a car from San Juan and found the trip extremely depressing - lousy drivers/poverty and trash everywhere. We did do a day trip into Old San Juan which was clean and nice - still I would try and find out more info on where to get a decent meal. The excursions from the hotel were pricey - and because of weather conditions the snorkeling tour was cancelled for 5 days. The private island is very nice and I would recommend walking around because you can find some very private beaches that are great . The Bacardi Rum tour was informative with free drinks to sample at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Some people are never happy!”
Reviews.Author: TheUglyAmerican
Reviews.Content: This resort is a typical Carribean vacation spot. Yes, the food is a little on the expensive side but GET OVER IT! My wife and I ate in the "gormet" restaurants for three nights and the food and service were great. No more expensive than The Atlantis on Paradise Island or at The Westin on St. John or other nice places in the Carribean. Good food is expensive when you have to fly it in from all over the world to prepare it properly and then serve it to a bunch of whiney Americans. (Probably angry Yankees fans) The rooms were great (we stayed in Las Marinas) and the Funicular was a little of an inconvenience to get up to the main hotel, but you're only there for a few days, relax and enjoy yourself. Now if we could do something about the rain (it rained every day!). Casino is a little on the small side but if gambling is your main focus then you probably should be headed elsewhere. Overall a pleasant experience for a reasonable amount of money. JOIN WYNDHAM BY REQUEST before you go! It's great.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, But Worth It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful. We stayed in the Marina District, which was obviously the quietest and best. We were reluctant to buy the expensive food, but we just got a cheap fries and Burger. Pool's beautiful, great for kids. Never got time to enjoy the island, but I can tell if I had stayed longer I would have loved it. Biggest resort I have ever stayed at, surrounded by poverty-filled slums. Family member got stuck in cable car, one of very few inconveniences. Welccoming as soon as arrival, best yet to come inside. Living up to the high prices, the food is wonderful, especially seafood restaurant. Overall 4 and a half stars, but that rounds to 5.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some say!”
Reviews.Author: CoachRod
Reviews.Content: Just got back, Nov.1, 2004, and had a great time. Resort was not in its high season so we were able to enjoy it with no worry of over crowding. We went on the "Troon package" and got everything we had expected. Very good golf course with very hospitable course personnel. The restaurants were pricey, but if you have a problem with that, you could go out of the resort grounds and pick up everything from McDonalds to very enjoyable dinners at local eateries. We went with an another couple and will return next year around the same time. The ride from the airport is a real pain though, bumper to bumper traffic for about 1 hr. We're glad we didn't let the negative posts dictate that we not go to this very fine resort.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star at Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The entry to the hotel property and lobby and grounds are incredible, giving you the feeling that you've arrived in paradise at a 4 to 5 star resort. However, once you enter into the rooms and heart of the resort, the ratings really fall short. The property is in major need of maintenance and repair throughout: missing ceiling tiles throughout the lobby and main building, cracked walls in need of repair and painting and only one funicular was functioning during our entire stay. The staff was at best "uninterested" and at worst arrogant. The property has 5 or so restaurants...all extremely overpriced. A breakfast fruit plate was $12 and a bottled water was $4; dinners averaged $40+ not counting an appetizer or salad. If you go, I'd recommend renting a car and trying some of the local restaurants. They are small and quaint, but the food was much better, the people very friendly and you get more of a "local" feel. Also, I'd recommend bringing bug spray. We were covered in bites....both mosquitos and others that we were convinced came from the bedding. Bed bugs!!!???? Not something I expect from a supposedly top rated Wyndham. The private island was a nice touch, but be prepared for a $12 hamburger for lunch. If you want to use the spa work out room, it's a pricey $25 dollars a day....pretty steep for an hour of exercise. There is a small "free" workout area, but the equipment is old and not in good shape. For the price, this is property is definetely not worth it. I expected to be spoiled in the lap of luxury, but felt completed ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Never again will we return, there's no rating low enough!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the entrance youâ€™re lead to believe that youâ€™ve paradise but unless youâ€™ve majored in landscape design youâ€™ll be sorely disappointed upon entering the premises. It has a sort of corporate fake character taste throughout the hotel and layouts. If you wish to literally toss you money away you can do so at the in-house casino or better yet on a $7.50 ice cream cone or $22 burrito, yes a burrito. The hotel was not up kept well at all leading us to wonder when the last time Wyndham examined the resort. Between the outrageous pricing for food, internet 14.95 a day, a fight to get back a lousy $2 for an 800 call that failed to go through that you would have thought I was asking for $150 the way they acted and the overall condition would lead to a do not recommend! The $2 was not a money issue it was a matter of principle, if you pick up a phone make a call and it fails to connect you should not have to pay, you havenâ€™t received anything and that was my point but the desk agent at checkout made a federal case out of use of the phone. Apparently at El Conquistador if you even pick up the phone in an attempt to make a call theyâ€™re right to assess a charge is now permitted. If you like to jet ski just simply take the free cruise over to private Palomino Island owned by the resort and rent a jet ski for the low rate of $65 for 30 minutes, I did say rent, for those rates youâ€™d think you just bought stock in the machine. Now are you starting to get the picture? By the way we went Oct 14th the low point of the PR travel season, what do they do during primetime weâ€™ll never know. El Conquistador, never again!

Reviews.Title: “get it all in WRITING”
Reviews.Author: salsagirl1995
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this hotel--we're not big fans of staying in a resort, but this hotel makes it easy to just kick back and be lazy and listen to the surf and the tree frogs. Yes, the food is absolutely overpriced, but some of the restaurants are surprisingly good. (Le Bistro, however, was the ultimate ripoff. I do NOT recommend it.) The views are amazing and the rooms are surprisingly spacious. We love lounging and snorkeling around Palomino Island (bring your own snorkeling equipment and save a bundle). Bring beach shoes for walking on coral, and lots of high powered sunscreen. One really easy way to keep your costs down is not to buy any reservation "packages". When you calculate the "a la carte" cost of the things they include in the "packages" (like breakfast) there really is no savings. Moreover, you end up paying 30% in tariffs and taxes on your hotel rate, so if your hotel rate includes anything except the room, you're not getting a good deal. What made our most recent trip unpleasant was the way central reservations handled our reservation. When you book your reservation, you are sent a confirmation email which does not detail any promotions you might have purchased. In our case, we had booked a 5 night stay. The first four nights were under the "Getaways By Request" plan, which had a rate of $159/night and included the fourth night free (aka "stay three nights get the fourth night free"). The fifth night we had a triple A rate of $141. I made the mistake of not making sure to get the specifics of these promotions in writing immediately. When I called 3 weeks before our trip to confirm, they told me I had booked a completely different package, at a similar nightly rate ($158 for the first four nights, $141 for the last night) but instead of a free night, it had "two for one" deals on golf and spa treatments--the overall difference was more than $100 in their favor). When I insisted that this was not the package I had booked (we don't golf and we don't spa, plus the "two for one" package was a three day package, so why would we have wanted it for four nights when a cheaper AAA rate was available?) they refused to admit the mistake (implying that I was lying) and told me the package I wanted was sold out and there was nothing they could do about it. I asked them to produce "quality assurance" recordings of the phone conversation because I was completely sure they were wrong, but they said they couldn't. Only after many HOURS spent on the phone and computer (I eventually wised up and switched to email in order to generate a paper trail) did they give me the package they had initially sold me. Even then, they screwed up and I had to produce copies of this correspondence at check-out in order to get them to fix the bill. I considered complaining to the Better Business Bureau, but Wyndham already has bad BBB ratings so it wouldn't have done any good. I was getting ready to create a site at complaints when they finally told me they would change the reservation. All of this was the fault of Wyndham central reservations, NOT the staff at the Conquistador itself. The lesson I've learned: whenever booking on the phone with Wyndham, get the name of who you're talking to. Then get them to email a DETAILED WRITTEN CONFIRMATION. Make sure you bring hard copies of this, just in case. One additional thing about the hotel--I agree with another reviewer that it's insane that they include high powered stereos in all the rooms. During most of our nights there we've been lucky, but the last couple nights we had inconsiderate neighbors, and there's really nothing you can do about that.

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it's not absolutely Perfect. It is showing it's age in places, the food is pricey in some of the restaurants, and the service is not always impeccable. Nevertheless, it was stunning, I had a fabulous time there and would go back in a heartbeat. I just got back from 5 days at Las Casitas Village with my husband and 2 children ages 10 and 15. We had a one bedroom suite with a sofabed and rollaway for the 4 of us. There was a covered patio with a view of the distant ocean past the rolling hills of the golf course. It was lovely. Some of the casitas have more spectacular ocean views, but we had lots of privacy, and gorgeous sunsets. Las Casitas is the newest part of the resort so, if you're sensative to its age, go here. It is a substantial walk from Las Casitas to the main resort and the funicular. WE all enjoyed this walk! It's so beautiful, and there are so many things to see, that we discovered new things everytime we walked. There is a brand new infinity pool reserved for Las Casitas guests which is so spectacular that once there, we could hardly tear ourselves away. But I'm glad we did since Palomino Island is so wonderful. Again, we enjoyed the trip there...the shops along the way, the funicular, the marina, and the ferry ride. The island itself is a wonderful little oasis. We took advantage of the horseback riding, and jet skis as well as snorkeling and shell collecting. It was a thoroughly relaxing time, with something for everyone to do. While there, we took the resort's kayak tour of the bioluminescent bay, and would highly recommend that excursion. Our experience with scuba diving from the resort was less successful since they informed us upon arrival thet they did not have enough people to justify going out. When pressed however, they contacted another local company which had no problem taking just the 2 of us out, and the diving was excellent. WE also had a disappointing experience with the spa which messed up my massage appointment but gave me a free facial and a gift, to make up for it. This is a good example of what would happened in general. Service was not perfect, but it was always very fiendly and nice, and IF there was a mistake people were more that willing to correct it if possible, and even go a little further. The restaurants on at the resort were fine. We had a teriffic lunch at La Belle Vista Cafe overlooking the main pool, and a fun time at the hibachi table at Blossoms. Our only disappointment was Isabelas steakhouse where the service was so slow, and the portions as big as the prices. But, if what you want in Puerto Rico is a traditional steakhouse, then go there. We enjoyed the off resort restaurants that we drove to, more. One of these, Caliza, was only 5 minutes from the resort entrance. The other, King Seafood, was in Luquillo Beach, 10-15 minutes away. In both cases, we took the recommendation of our butler at Las Casitas, and we were not disappointed. You'll spend half as much at local restaurants as you would at the resort. I think a car is a must, unless you don't plan to leave the resort. Parking was free at Las CAsitas, and right by the rooms. WE had no trouble driving from the airport, and were then able to explore locally. In addition to the local restaurants at night, we also visited El Yunque rain forest, and spent some time at the local beach in Luquillo. It's a beauty, by the way. We had planned to spend a day in old San Juan, but were seduced by the infinity pool which seemed so preferable to several hours on the road. I guess we'll just have to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The facility was of disappointing character, in need of a serious face-lift, and extremely overpriced! The food was just ok and overpriced ($12 for a hot dog) The staff was rude, impatient, and inconsiderate. When we asked for help with an issue, they would just look at us and smile, no help, no solutions, no suggestions. The conciere knew very little about PR, and absolutely nothing about adjacent islands (St. Thomas, St. John, etc). When we approached the Manager, he seemed totally unconcerned. He asked us what we thought he should do about it. Although they apparently want to be considered as a world class resort, I would give them only a "single star" at the most. I strongly suggest that you 'pick another place'!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Price Gouging Abounds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our four night/three day honeymoon at the El Conquistador. On the positive side, the room was nice (I'm not sure if it was worth the price), the views were incredible, and everything seemed to be very clean. However, we were extremely disappointed by the quality and price of the food. On our first night, we ate at Cafe Caribe and ordered the chicken strips for 9.00. There were three of them. The next morning, we ate breakfast at Las Brisas - a buffet for 21.00 per person. It wasn't worth it. On our second night, we decided to try Blossoms. We tried to dress nicely for this dinner, since the hotel literature stressed the importance of "maintaining ambiance after sunset." (We quickly discovered that this is basically a bunch of crap, and we wore jeans and flip flops the rest of the week.) At Blossoms, we told the hostess that we were interested in having sushi, so all she gave us was a piece of paper to write our order on when she sat us. No menus. When our server finally arrived, we had to ask him to bring us menus, and he sounded really surprised. When we informed him we would like to order sushi as an appetizer, he said, "You better order it fast then, cause we only have one chef, and he's busy." Ok, then. We also each ordered entrees, which were worse than the worst Chinese takeout, I have ever eaten. Both entrees - one pork and one chicken - had been obviously frozen and simply reheated. My chicken, which was too tough to eat, was served on a bed of salad in a bag and covered in a pool of sauce. The service continued to be horrible, and we were only going to leave a 10% tip. Unfortunately, we didn't have a choice, since they thoughtfully included a 15% gratuity in the check. I understand this practice for large parties, but there were two of us. I was disappointed to find out that the only beach is a 20 minute boat ride away. Palomino island is ok...the boat ride gets old. If you want to escape the screaming children and go to a clothing optional beach, it's a 1.22 mile hike. We didn't feel like doing this, so I can't say if it's nice. If you eat at the restaurant on the island, there are chickens roaming around (I don't feel they qualify as Carribean ambiance), and their feces are all over the ground. The water is warm, but too shallow to swim, and the beaches are rocky. On the plus side, sitting on the beach is very relaxing and the views are beautiful. Alcohol prices are mind blowing. For example, beer costs 50 cents per oz, and the standard size of a beer is 10 oz. So, the cheapest beer at the hotel is 5.00 (available in your mini bar). A 6 pack at the hotel store is 30.00. Mixed drinks, with alcohol, are 8.00. The casino is a joke. We went there to kill some time, but we didn't stay very long. The dealers are surly and inexperienced. If you get a blackjack (3/2 odds), they keep the extra 1/2 and only pay it if you win your next hand. The slot machines do not pay out. I played between 35 and 40 times without a winning hand. The airport transportation is 30.00 per person unless you are a Wyndham member. I think they took us the (excruciatingly) long way to the hotel so they could play their informational video. The way back was much faster and on major roads. The pools were very nice, and the chairs were comfortable. If you don't want to be around children, this isn't the place to hang out. The food at Cafe Bella Vista, which overlooks the pool, actually tastes good, but is still overpriced. Basically, the resort is beautiful and decently maintained, but the overpricing and sub par quality of the food and services left a bad taste in our mouth. If it weren't for this, we would have had a great time instead of just ok. I wish that I had read reviews advising us to rent a car because I'm sure it would have made a difference to get out of the hotel for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel hasn't been updated in 20 years - or so it seemed!”
Reviews.Author: Burgercj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in July and were quite disappointed. Our room overlooked the pool, where loud music was started at 9:00 am and went until about 11:00 pm. The room appeared as if it hadn't been rennovated in a LONG time! While the room was clean, it was so old, it was in poor shape. The resort offers a number of dining options, most of which I found to be overpriced and poor quality - to be expected in the Carribean, but that doesn't make it right. The resort is far away from anything else to do, so if you go, you're in it for the long haul. I'd recommend staying in San Juan if you're going to Puerto Rico at all. Also, keep in mind that to get to the beach at the resort you have to take a 20 minute ferry ride.

Reviews.Title: “just ok.”
Reviews.Author: jjstone75
Reviews.Content: i really liked the resort and the island area. but the food stinks. i would recommend eating off the resort if possible. the 10 dollar parking fee is a rip also.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at The Conquistador”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip from San Juan. Before I went to this resort I read reviews for at least 6 months and was very torn before I left. I decided to write this review because of the mixed reviews. We arrived in San Juan on Thursday August 12, 2004. Our wedding was to be held on August 15, 2004. Upon arrival (around 7:30 pm) we were able to check in. There were no long lines at this time and the staff was GREAT!!! Our room was in the Marina Village. It was GREAT!!! not a 5 star but at least a 4 star room. The views were also great! On Friday, the hotel had arragned for a driver to take us to the appropriate places for the different things we needed for our wedding. It took about 2 hours and then we met our wedding corridinator. She was great!! She made sure everything went off without a hitch! After all this, we went over to Palimino Island. Beautiful!! The ride over was nice, it took about 15 min. Not too crowded. The food there was expensive. Hamburger $14.00 Chicken Strips $14.00 drinks were $8.00. Coke $3.00 per 6 oz cup. But the island was great. We ate dinner at Blossoms. Great food but very expensive. Dinner for two for the cheapest on the menu no drinks, just coke and tea $88.00. The next morning we at the breakfast buffet. Yes the birds were flying around, but your in the Carribean, it's all about the atmosphere. We loved it. The breakfast buffet every morning cost us $42.00. The food is good, but way over priced. Our wedding was wonderful, the priest had the most romantic cerimony I have ever heard. The photographer was also great!! and not expensive. After the wedding our wedding party ate at Isabellas. Lovely restuarant as far as atmosphere. Very formal and elegant. VERY EXPENSIVE!!! Dinner for two with no drinks again tea and coke $165.00. Since it was our wedding, that's ok for a special occasion. Food good, but not that good. Over all, this was a beautiful resort with a friendly staff and great rooms (at least where we were). Would I go back? Probably not, just because of the food expense. When we go to a resort we want to just chill out, not leave and relax. This place was that good, but the food was tooooo expensive for that. We'll stick with all inclusive. But for our wedding this place was perfect as far as location and views. On Sunday, we headed off to the Carnival Destiny for our Honeymoon!! Great Time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our vacation at El Conquistador, Fajardo (Aug. 15 to Aug. 19th). Overall, I would say it was a very good experience. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, the vistas are spectacular, the service was excellent, the room was better than we expected. The only negitives I encountered were; 1) everything at the hotel was excessively expensive 2) Very difficult to see any sights because of its remote location. I would highly recommend renting a car if you want to do any sight seeing and eat in restaurants outside of the hotel. Other than that, everything else was excellent. You definitely get the feeling that you are staying at a quality resort. I would return again, but next time I'm renting a car and bringing my own water (they charge $3 to $4 a bottle)

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, but.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Good: Beautiful locaton and grounds. Room we had was lovely, with a great view of the lower grounds and ocean, and a large terrace. The staff, with one or two exceptions, were pleasant and helpful. The Okay: The V-shaped main hotel building we stayed at was a bit older and the hallways showed their age, though the rooms were nice. The front dest customer service, while polite, took their time with requests to make a room change due to noise from next door. Palomino Island was a nice option, but they really should install some showers for rinsing off after a swim. The Not-So-Okay: Charging hotel guests $10.00 for self parking is a travesty. The lack of reasonably priced dining options (not to mention no Puerto Rican cuisine at the hotel...are they kidding??), made us have to eat pricey Mexican food our first night there at the Cantina, but to it's credit, the portions were very generous. Echoing noises in the hall can be heard from inside the rooms. Perhaps the hallways should be carpeted. All in all, we enjoyed our 3 days here, but since I know my way around the island, we went to different places to eat and sightsee. For someone who doesn't, they are not enjoying the true essence of Puerto Rico. It's kind of homogenized. But the hotel is truly a lovely place to see. Especially the views. I would recommend it for a short stay or if you rent a car to see the rest of the island.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel matches the typical Wyndham property. The resort is magnificient but the service is horrible. The only way this resort could have received AAA 4 diamond award is only if they brought it. First, the valet parking charges an incredible $15 per night. When you pull up to the property, it takes an average of 3 minutes before a bell boy even hands you a number. In addition, you can not call for your car from your hotel room. The only way to get your car from the hotel is by going down stairs in person and requesting your car. Typically, make sure you request your car at LEAST 20 minutes prior to your desired departure time. The meals at the resort are INCREDIBLY overpriced. For example, to order a stack of three pancakes off of the menu will cost you $14. To order a burrito from the on-site mexican restaurant, it will cost you a minimum of $20. A hot dog in Caribe Restaurant cost $7.95 . In addition, if you don't mind sharing your meal with the birds on the island then eat your meal out doors. Finally, don't expect for the Wyndham employees to speak to you or open the door for you. I feel that my visit to the Wyndham was NOT worth the money. If you are looking for a great value then do NOT consider this property.

Reviews.Title: “There is a lot of room for improvement at the Wyndham El Conquistador!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wyndham El Conquistador from July 29, 2004 through August 5, 2004. We picked that resort because there was a family wedding on July 31, and the bride and groom had picked that resort for their wedding ceremony and reception. First of all, we rented a car and became lost while driving from the airport to the hotel. There were signs for a lot of other resorts in the area, but not one single sign for the El Conquistador. The directions in the Frommer's travel guide were useless since most of the streets in Puerto Rico are unmarked. We finally met a wonderful gentleman who did not speak English but led us right to the entrance of the resort! When we finally reached the hotel and stopped our car in the front to drop off our luggage, the bell staff was hostile and immediately harassed us to move our car. There is a $10 parking charge per day at the resort, and the self-parking lot is a long walk from the hotel. If you opt to take the shuttle instead, you may have a long wait since they were unreliable. Every single time you leave the resort, you have to wait in line in your car for approximately five minutes to show your room ID and your parking ticket before they open the gate and permit you to exit! Therefore, just leaving the resort turns into a half-hour process! We arrived at the hotel at 2:00 p.m., but our room was not ready. So we had lunch consisting of a small pizza and two soft drinks by the pool, which cost us over $25! Our room was FINALLY ready at 4:30. The resort is very beautiful, and our room was in the marina section - gorgeous room facing the marina and Palomino Island (where the beach is located). Our room was very clean and the king sized bed was extremely comfortable. The maid service was EXCELLENT! However, the A/C did not work properly - we had to keep the thermostat set at 50 degrees to get the room temp down to 72! The television had terrible reception and the doors on the television armoire were broken. We didn't bother complaining since we were hardly in the room anyway. It took three days of complaints before we finally received our Wyndham By Request amenities. The service at the reception counter was extremely slow. We went to the only resort beach, which is located on Palomino Island, the next day with all of our family members, which exceeded 20 people. The general consensus in our family was that the beach was terrible. . . . the water was full of seaweed and rocks (you definitely need to wear water shoes), and the water was too shallow for swimming as it never seemed to get any deeper than your waist. Family members that did swim out far enough for the water to be deep got caught in a riptide and experienced difficulty swimming back to the beach. There were no lifeguards at the beach or at the pools. One family member was badly stung by a jellyfish while on Palomino Island, and when she went to the First Aid station, she was told she would have to wait a half hour for a medic to arrive from the mainland. The main pools at the top of the cliff were very crowded and by the end of the day they were dirty and had pieces of food floating in them. We all wound up hanging out at the Las Olas pool or the pool down in the marina section, as they were cleaner, less crowded, and more peaceful. Don't even bother eating at any of the resort's restaurants - we thought the food is horrible and grossly overpriced! The first night at the resort we all ate dinner at Otello's, the resort's Italian restaurant. The food was mediocre and very salty. The next night we ate at the rehearsal dinner and the quality of the food was also mediocre to poor. The following night the hor doerves at the wedding cocktail hour were horrendous. For example, the empanadas had no filling - they were just empty pieces of dough! The resort did not provide enough entrees at the wedding reception dinner - even though they were provided with an accurate guest count several weeks prior to the wedding! The wedding dinner consisted of either filet mignon/lobster or chicken/sea bass with a mound of disgusting potatoes and overcooked veggies. The meals were basically inedible. The wedding cake was terrible - the icing was like a full sheet of cardboard - no one could eat it! The coffee was served cold at both the rehearsal dinner and the wedding reception. For the remainder of our stay, we ate outside the resort and had delicious food every time for a LOT LESS MONEY! In order to reach the ferry to Palomino Island or the Las Olas and Las Marinas pools, you have to take a cable railway called a funicular to get up and down the cliff. There are two funiculars. Two days before we went home, the one funicular broke down and was out of service the rest of our stay. The other funicular happened to break down while we were in it (it was overcrowded since the other funicular was not operating) and halfway up the cliff and we were stuck in it for a while, which was a little unnerving to say the least! There is no other way to get up and down the cliff. In summation, if you plan to stay at the Wyndham El Conquistador, definitely plan on (1) renting a car, (2) eating at restaurants outside the resort, (3) bringing water shoes for the beach, and (4) using the Las Olas or Las Marinas pools.

Reviews.Title: “place look great but I had a bad nigth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: don't give me wrong the hotel looks great and has some incredible views also the pool area looks great. But I'talking about the staff at the mexican restaurant. I was looking foward to staying at the wyndham conquistador so we were to check the palce out. Every thing so far good until we got to the mexican restaurant. First of all they made us wait like an hour to sit us down and the place was empty at that time. Also they dont have young waitress there, the one that serve us was mad looking and she didn't even offer water.they made us wait like to ours for our food and she wanted a $20 tip/ whatttttt you know people like that realy damage the whole hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 day get away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great 3 day get away for my 17 year old and me from July 28-31. We got a ROH room that ended up in La Marina with a deluxe ocean view and a patio. The room was medium sized with a king bed and queen pull out. CLEAN, the room was spotless and they put out fresh fruit for us. We,girls, visited the spa everyday and if u went between 12N and 3PM there was a 20% discount. Then we kicked back by the pool and pined our vacation time away! Oh, must we come back to reality so soon! Yes, everything is VERY EXPENSIVE, but well worth 3 days of all about me.....GO, LIVE and SPA at THE GOLDEN DOORs. Maybe, I'll see u there someday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from our honeymoon at El Conquistador last night. I have to say, it was an amazing experience overall. We arrived around midnight, so we really didn't get a full appreciation for the amazing views until the next morning. With Wyndham By Request, we got a free upgrade to a deluxe ocean front room. I must admit I was dissapointed with the room that night- it was clean and comfortable, but not as nice as I would expect, and in need of an update. When I woke up the next morning and stepped out onto the balcony however, I was blown away by the breathtaking view of the ocean! It made me feel better about the room, and besides, when you're in a tropical paradise, does it really matter what color the carpet is or the pattern of the couch in your room??? We spent the first 2 days of the trip on Palomino Island. We took advantage of a 2 for 1 offer we had for watersports, and rented out a Waverunner for an hour. It started to storm about 15 minutes into our time, and we were called back onto the shore. As soon as the weather cleared (about 15 minutes) they let us back out, and gave us another full hour even though we had already used some of our time. Lots of fun!!! That afternoon, we took a horseback tour around the island, and up to the highest point of the hills. Gorgeous views, and also alot of fun. Next day was a discovery scuba diving excursion. I would highly recommend this if you would like a taste of scubadiving without going through the certification process. Every meal we ate at this resort was good to excellent, with the exception of the breakfast buffet at Las Brisas. THe buffet was overpriced, and the food was lousy. It was also overrun with blackbrids, who are not shy about flying up to your table and taking food from your plate! We ate at Blossoms twice, and loved the sushi and tepenyaki tables. Isabella's was a wonderful restaurant- very quiet and romantic, and the food was outstanding. I was thrilled with this hotel, and would love to go back! Hope this review is useful!

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador was a good choice for us...”
Reviews.Author: shamai
Reviews.Content: I, like many others, had concerns based on some of the negative reviews, but decided to try it anyway. Normally, I would have choose a smaller, more quaint hotel, but the Expedia package was reasonably priced. Yes, the food, shops, and parking is definitely expensive. I would recommend having a rental car (most tours only pickup from San Juan area hotels only). Compare prices before buying stuff in the hotel shops. Traffic between the hotel and San Juan is heavy, but not bad elsewhere (save your coins for toll roads, or use the right toll booths marked with a C (for change). Check with the concierge about dining specials if you do eat there. I was also told that if you rented an AVIS car (I don't think it needs to be from the hotel), there is no charge for parking (unfortunately I had Hertz and paid $10 day for self-park). You can easily avoid the crowds by swimming early in the morning or at night (pool is open 24hrs.) and going to private island on one of the first three boats (starts at 9:00a) and returning about 1:00p or so when it start to get crowded (no waiting at all). I found the staff reasonably friendly, maintenance and cleanliness acceptable. We tracked in alot of sand in our room (we had our own snorkel equipt. which saved $15 per person to rent) and they did a great job of cleaning our room each time. Don't miss the Bio Bay kayak night tour with Las Tortuga Tours (formerly Caribe Kayak - you can walk to the starting point) and I highly recommend a snorkel trip by Monkey Island on Frank Lopez's boat Pasedores in nearby Playa Naguabo. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it, if you are willing to drive / pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: chrisnyaol
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the mixed reviews on the El Conquistador I was confused and suspicious. After spending 5 nights (mid July) with my wife and two children (10 and 13) I now understand why. There are some excellent features that this resort has to offer, but there are many poor aspects that can turn people off. Depending on what bothers you or what pleases you, you will either love this resort or hate it. I will describe the negatives first. I booked a â€œfour for freeâ€� package that included a fifth night free, free breakfast for two, and free round-trip transfers for two. The cost was $229 per night plus $50 in taxes that was clearly documented on the Wyndham website. Breakfast is an all you can eat buffet and normally $22 for adults, $10 for children. They charged us $80 for the kids transfers, and the kids either had a piece of fruit or cereal($2) for breakfast, so according to my calculations, my net cost per night was $243 (including breakfast and transfers). This I find to be a fair price, but almost everything else at this resort is excessively higher than the â€œfair market valueâ€� and marginally higher than other resorts we have been to. For example, in San Juan, or NY, or Boston, a dinner entrÃ©e in a premium restaurant is $18-24. At the El Conquistador expect to pay $30-40. I looked in every night to find only 4 â€“ 10 people in any of these restaurants (10% full). What is management thinking? Drop the price of an entrÃ©e by $10 and you will probably double your volume, make a nice profit and you wonâ€™t turn people off. Also, the parking lot was full so I expect many of the guests eat outside the resort. Fortunately there are 5 cafÃ© type restaurants in the resort at $15-20, but again the fair value for a cafÃ© is $8-15. The cafes had about 10 â€“ 20 people when we ate (30% full). At the El Conq., $3.50 for a stale kiddie cup of ice cream. A kiddie cup of ice-cream is $1.70 at my local Baskin Robbins. Bottled water is $2 at the resort, but $3 on Palomino island where you really need it. This island is part of the resort. The fact that they charge 50% more than they do at the main resort and 300% more than outside the resort is a real turn off. Also I paid three different prices for a Medallia beer ($4.50,$5,$6) depending on where I was. A martini was $10, a mudslide $7 or $8 depending where also. I think drink prices should be consistent throughout a resort. Use of the steamroom/sauna/spa/fitness center is $25 per day. I never had to pay for the use of these facilities at any other resort including the Wyndham Martineau. They do have a free fitness center, but the equipment is low quality and there is not even a single TV. A 50 minute massage is $110 (in NY $60-$90) and they assigned me a male therapist when I requested a female. Also the rain forest tour from the resort is $50 per person. This would cost me $200! An economy rental car from the resort is $70, but from Thrifty $40 (which is 10 minutes away and they pick you up and drop you off for free). We rented the car from Thrifty and toured the rainforest on our own for free! We stopped at Luqillo beach on the way back and had huge TACOS and Pina Coladas for $1 each. Other bad aspects I should point out is the lack of maintenance. Although the lobby is 5 star quality, as soon as you enter the Las Brisas wing you will notice chipped tiles, rusted metals, peeling and fading paint, and torn carpets everywhere. Also, being a large resort with many children, the pools need extra attention to keep clean. Again, this is poor management. Hire a full time maintenance crew! Believe me, they can afford it. They are pouring money into an expansion of the Las Casistas wing, but they neglect the rest of the resort. Noise is also a problem. You will have trouble sleeping, as all the doors need to be forced hard to close. The slamming of the doors in any of the rooms near yours causes your own room to shake! The doors are old and of poor quality, and offer no sound insulation. This would not be too much of a problem if people walking the halls late at night would whisper, but unfortunately many people are inconsiderate. Also, why in the world does Wyndham feature high powered stereos in the rooms? Management, please remove all the stereos! They also cause the walls to vibrate and unfortunately many people are inconsiderate playing the stereo loud late at night. The express check in (Wyndham By Request) offered no advantage. Although the line was smaller than the regular check in, there was only one person working express and five at the regular desk. I noticed a couple who arrived at the same time as me actually checked in faster at the regular check in. I waited 20 minutes for two people in front of me. If they had some kind of problem, an additional staffer should have been pulled off the regular check in. Again, management. Communication: Where are the â€œchalk boardsâ€� listing the daily events or specials? We stumbled upon a movie at the main pool. Missed the first half because there was no mention. Also no mention of happy hour (2-3pm)at the main pool bar. $3 pina coladas. Also from 5-7pm $5 margaritas at the Mexican restaurant with free chips and salsa. Only a small note in the window. Glad I saw it. The Mexican restaurant also has a HUGE plate of NACHOS for $10. This was my dinner one night, excellent! Noticed a live band playing in the lobby/bar one night during a late night walk. Would have liked to catch the earlier set, but again no mention. Management? Now the good part. Join Wyndham by request. You will need every advantage possible to override the negatives. We received a free upgrade to an ocean view with balcony, amazing views! In fact, the whole resort is built into a cliff and the views from the upper pool and cafÃ© are also amazing! The welcome snack was a small bottle of wine and a bag of nuts. Probably cost Wyndham $3 but it hit the spot. The Mexican restaurant was a fair value. Palomino island is great with calm, but very salty waters for snorkeling (although fair visibility), excellent hiking trails (I saw a huge IGUANA), and amazing views from the top. If you are in shape, you can hike to some secluded beaches on the other side and have the whole place to yourself. Spa treatments are 20% off between 12-3pm and they waive the $25 fee if you book a treatment. Hint: book a 25 min treatment during this time and it will cost you only $40 and you can use the spa facilities (steam,sauna,jacuzzi,fitness,classes) all day. In conclusion, I do expect to pay a premium for food,drink, etc. at a resort, but not 100%. I expect a good nights sleep and well maintained grounds. The fantastic views are the only thing this resort has going for it. We stayed at all Wyndham properties during a 10 night trip. The El Conquistador during the first part (5 nights). â€“ Vieques(2 nights) â€“ Old San Juan(3 nights) . I have posted separate reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, had an amazing time.”
Reviews.Author: sgerber1
Reviews.Content: I don't usually read these reviews, but my wife persuading me to write one since we had such an amazing time at this beautiful Hotel. Plus, when we returned home (we went from July 6th to July 11th), she showed me the reviews of others, so I felt I had to set the record straight. This Hotel is beautiful. Period. Its not a 5 star hotel, but who cares. Its faults are for the most part meaningless (chipped paint here and there, etc.) and will not affect your enjoyment of the amenities and the facilities. It has everything you would want and expect on a trip to the Caribbean. However, if you only love the beach and are not a pool lover, you might be disappointed since the beach, although on a beautiful private island, is a 20 minute boat ride away, which I'll get to later. The staff was friendly and helpful, housekeeping was fine, and the Concierge was excellent - always willing to help, make reservations, etc. It does help to be a Wyndham by Request member as you get certain upgrades, a wlecome package, and no charge for local and calling card calls from the room, and other little perks. We stayed at the Las Brisas wing which I feel was the best location - close to the pool, funicular (tram like ride to the Marina discussed below), lobby, casino, etc. The room was fine (certainly larger than a standard hotel room), with 2 phones, TV, DVD player, a rather large bathroom, and a great balcony - at night you can hear the frogs. Although no location is bad, I personally would avoid the rooms down by the marina since you have to take the funicular to get to the main hotel, and although its reliable and only a short ride, it might get annoying over a 4 or 5 day vacation. However, if you want to avoid the main hotel the pool down by the marina was fine, there was food and shopping down there, and you are that much closer to the ferry to the beach. The main pool area, which is where we spent most of our time, was as nice as any hotel I have seen. We went to Hawaii for our Honeymoon and stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels, and this pool area was as nice an any of those, and the views were unquestionably the best. The Hotel is on a cliff with the pool area facing the ocean, and you can see crystal clear blue Caribbean as far as the eye can see, while sitting in the pool! The main pool area consisted of 3 large pools surrounded by tropical flowers and palm trees, with plenty of lounge chairs to go around, even on the weekend when it got crowded. One pool had a kiddie water slide and a volleyball net. There were jacuzzis all over in secluded little places, and the entire pool area is open 24 hours a day (no lifeguards though so if you go with kids be careful). The beach was on a private island that you had to get to by ferry (no charge). The boats run about every half hour and we had no problem despite what other reviewers said. Plenty of water sports to choose from (snorkeling, sailing, waverunners, scuba diving, etc.) but they were pricey, although not much more pricey than you would find at any other resort. The funicular that takes you from the main hotel down to the marina (its the only way to get there) was fine and again we encountered no problems despite what other reviews said. The golf course was beautiful and very well maintained, but very challenging. It was a hilly course, but keeping with the theme of the hotel - breathtaking views. I played twice, both times at 4:00 when it was only $55/round (including cart), which is inexpensive even by stateside public course standards. The fee before then is $160/round, which is about standard for resorts. The only downside to playing at 4:00 is that the course is a little slower than the morning since thats when the novices come out (because its cheaper I guess), but I was still able to get in a full round in under four hours (before sunset) both days. One advantage of the afternoon however, is that its not as hot as in the morning - I spoke to other golfers who said its very hot in the morning, and I did not find it that bad. While I golfed one day my wife went to the Golden Door Spa which was very pricey ($75 for a pedicure and $25 for a manicure, with a 20% required gratuity on top of that). She said it was fine but no better or worse than any spa state side. There is plenty of on-site shopping ranging from T-shirt and sundry shops to expensive jewelry stores. The casino was fine - it had plenty of slots and all the usual table games. Although I thought it was small at first glance, it never got crowded - even on Saturday night we easily got a seat at a $10 blackjack table and it would have only been a short wait for a $5 table. Any other time sitting at a $5 table was no problem. The restaurants were good but pricey, although again probably typical for Caribeean resorts. There were a lot of restaurants though so choice was not an issue. Definitely try to get the buffet breakfast included (which we did). The dinner portions were rather small and you never go away stuffed, except for when I had the Porterhouse at Isabella's. My wife had the salmon which was not good and although she sent it back it did not improve, and they did not take it off the bill, although they did offer to make her something else. But I bet if I pushed it they would have taken it off. Interestingly, one night in the ice cream shop they brought us chicken fingers instead of wings - they corrected the order and did not charge us for the wings. We did find the best lunch value to be at Cafe Bella Vista. All in all I highly recommend this resort to anyone looking to have a fun, relaxing, and enjoyable Caribbean vacation. If I were to go back to Puerto Rico I would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: lbcohen3
Reviews.Content: We went last week to the hotel with another couple, both of us celebrating our 10 year anniversaries. We were very nervous after having read all of the reviews, but we had a fabulous time! We did EXTENSIVELY read these reviews ahead of time, so I'm going to try to be as helpful as others were for us. Overall, the hotel is great. It is comperable to a 3 1/2-4 star hotel. Yes, it could have used paint here and there, the rooms could have been updated, and yes, it was occassionally dirty, but not enough to interfere with our enjoyment. My first bit of advice is to join Wyndham By Request. We got an upgraded room- "deluxe ocean view" in LaVista. It was a huge room with a fabulous view of Palomino Island. The bathroom was nice with a private toilet area. Our friends were in La Brista- their room was equally nice (it was almost identical to ours) with an even better view. Their advantage was that they were closer to everything, but we were quite pleased with our room. And many of the posts commented on a musty smell in the rooms- we never smelled it. The rooms weren't spotlessly clean, but they were certainly more than acceptable. Another advantage to Wyndham By Request is that 800# calls are free from your room. (they're normally $2.00/call). We bought a calling card at Costco for $20.00 for 670 minutes- we could talk to our kids easily that way! When we got there, there was water and fresh fruit (as we had requested) in the room along with extra pillows. So definitely join!! We found the service at the hotel to be quite excellent. Our room was made up every day by 1:00. They restocked shampoo, etc. every day as long as the old bottles were out of sight. There were waitresses walking around the pool areas asking if we wanted a drink. The concierce was very helpful. The pool area was beautiful- so lush and tropical!! We were there from a Tuesday-Sunday, and never had a problem finding chairs under an umbrella even! And no, we didn't get to the pool at 7:00 am- it was closer to 11 each day. By Saturday, it did get more crowded and there were a LOT more kids! (we did put our towels and books down before we had breakfast at 9:30, and they were there when we got to the pool by 11:30) But Wed-Fri. was very quiet at the pool- we found a little side area, and it almost felt like our private pool. We spent hours in the pool, not sitting in our chairs, and we never had a problem with someone taking them. Each day, we got an arm band identifing us as guests at the hotel- on the weekends, they really monitored them. I looked around, and every person I saw at the pool was wearing a band, so I can't imagine that it was open to the public (as I had read on earler posts). You have to hand in a towel card and they give you a towel. Every day, I asked for 2 towels- they always told me it was 1 towel per guest, but then they gave me 2 anyway. So ask! Drinks at the pool are expensive, but wait for 2:00-3:00 pm for Happy Hour- they're $3.00. The pool is open 24 hours- we went swimming one night- it was so fun! One day we were sitting under a roof, and by afternoon, it did smell musty. We didn't find that any other place at the pool area. The food was good. It was expensive and the portions were small, but overall we had a good experience. We ate at Isabella's-nice atmosphere- expensive but elegant. We loved our food and the quantity there was big, but our friend ordered salmon, and it wasn't cooked enough. She sent it back, and it still wasn't done, and they didn't do anything to make it right for her. We also ate at Otello's-delicious Italian food, another elegant restaurant, pricey, but smaller servings. We did the Mexican restaurant one night- it was empty. Again, decent food, ok portion size. We ate a dinner one night at the ice cream place- Cafe Caribe. Small portions but good food. This one is more reasonably priced, but it is an ice cream parlor. We tried a Puerto Rican dish- rice with chicken and spices- very good! And the ice cream was delicious!
