Another day, we spent the day on the beach and saw iguana and rabbits. The lounge chairs were very nice and beach towels are given out when you enter the island. The hotel pool was very pretty with a swim up bar and many sunning areas. We had no problem finding a lounge chair and all were free (don't know what the previous poster meant?). The food in the hotel was out of this world. Larger than life portions and very tasty. ..some of the best we have ever had antwhere! I do agree that the food is a bit pricy at the resort, though. $30 for a room service eggs, bacon, potatoes, coffee, juice and toast. $14 plus for French toast...nothing else. My husband played the golf course twice and loved the course. He said that iguanas were all over the fairways. The casino was very disappointing. Very smoky (cigars are a popular item at this resort) and crowded. The slot machines were not well maintained and had ZERO payout. We fed $40 dollars worth of quarters in different machines over a four day period and received maybe 20 quarters in return...very boring! We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, but hard to understand. All were professional and they were always cleaning somewhere in the hotel. One of our party did have pair of sunglass taken from his room. He notified the head housekeeper and a search was done of the maids cart. The RX sunglasses were found on the cart. We were very careful about keeping our valuables locked up or hidden from view. As much as we loved El Conquistador, I do not think that we would pay to come to this resort again. Because most of our trip was paid for by my husbands company, we were able to enjoy ourselves without having to worry about spending too much of our own money. There is no way that we could afford to bring our family to this resort and stay more than a couple of days because of the food and extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “not a first class operation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just got back from this resort/food was overpriced and not good/overpriced with everything since you are a captive audience/ have traveled all oiver and this is one place that is on the bottom of the list/could not even find a beach chair at the pool unless you paid for that also/my daughter rented a vcr tape in lobby but no vcr in her room/ 120.00 for bus service to and from airport/80.00 for a taxi if you make arrangements on your own/ a real ripoff/the casino was applauing you have to search for a machine that worked/read reviews before we leftand next time will read them and follow them before we book at another resort

Reviews.Title: “nice place--don't understand people's complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just back from 4 night stay at El Conquistador. We both enjoyed our stay at the resort--I don't understand peoples complaints about cost of foods, crowds, etc. I have never been to a resort where items were not somewhat overpriced--that just seems to be a part of the resort industry. All in all the hotel seems to have a little bit of everything--golf, spa (my wife said is amazing), excursions, horseback riding, etc. I will admit getting to beach is a bit cumbersome, but the island itself was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time BUT......”
Reviews.Author: southfloridamommy
Reviews.Content: Ok, my turn.I too became obsessed in reading all of the reviews before going on my trip. My husband and I both 32 wanted a calm relaxing getaway.As quick as I can here is what I thought:The shuttle which we took at night was ok. We made it there in about one hour and fifteen minutes. It had a refreshment bar which we were charged for at checkout. Had we known we would have stocked up a little more on the water! They show you a video on the resort and some footage from a Regis and Kelly show taped there. Once there, check-in was a snap and within 5 minutes we were done and off to our room.The funicular which became our daily best friend was not a bother. It was nice to look out through it during the day because the views from everywhere in the hotel are amazing! Other then the repetitive cd's playing in it it was ok. They always seemed to be playing the same songs.The biggest thing for us was that although the place is in an amazing location, the service and knowledge of the staff is NOT amazing. They all know different things and it does not seem like they are trained all together. While for the most part, everyone was nice there were some ridiculous things like not being allowed to sit in a booth that was literally 4 feet away because it was "closed", or not being able to book a cabana massage because one person said it was available first come first serve at the pool and the other said it was booked and the others had no idea what I was talking about although the sign was in front of them, expensive pi?a coladas for a little glass with no cherry, no pineapple and no coconut sprinkles! Now, I am from Miami and we have a ton of pi?a coladas here!We had massages at the spa and I would reccommend booking everything before your trip. They were booked on pretty much everything I wanted to do and I was only able to go once during my 4 day stay. The spa IS very nice and although the staff is a bit snobbish, I had a great experience.I had dinner at Blossoms which was not all that great. We had sushi for appetizer and figured we would share a meal. Big mistake. We had the Lovers Paradise Boat which was a tiny portion of lobster , shrimp and vegetables TINY. Now, at Otellos, I had the lobster entree and it was perfect. Perhaps the most delicious lobster I have ever had. My husband had the snapper which was also great. The cheesecake I ordered for dessert was not that good and when I told them (when they asked why I did not eat it) they took it off the bill no further questions asked. I suggest going to DAvid's Cookies cafe inthe morning for your cofee and breakfast. It's like a downsized/simpler version of Starbucks. Good coffee and great pastries. The buffet is 20.00 per person and just not all that worth it. Save your money for the spa! It is pricey but you cannot let that make you too upset while you are there because then you are going to be miserable just work around it!The reason I think everyone says there is a lot to do is because you walk so much to go everywhere so it takes up a lot of time. I did not think there was that much to do which was fine with us because that's what we were there to do NOTHING. But for some people that like to stay busy...not that much.There were kids in the pool but they did not bother anyone. The place is big enough. If you don't like the kids , there are 3 pools to go to. We stayed at the Marina in a deluxe ocean front room with a balcony which was really nice and it has it's own pool. We moved our chairs by the ocean on the grass and had a nice constant breeze.The ByRequest membership did nothing for me. I actually had to call and remind them that I was a member and then I got a message on our phone welcoming us and one prior to departing. Other then that, Saturday afternoon we got a fruit platter with a Merlot bottle compliments of the resort. I still don't know if it was ByRequest or my friend who knows someone at the staff.........Other then that. No perks.The club was empty the enitre time. We stayed at the bar right outside of it listening to the band (which was pretty good) and had some drinks. We did not go into the casino, it's just not our thing. It was just a simple casino and not as smoky as most.What I loved was to hear the Coqui's at night. That is the native tiny frog. At night you hear them make the sound that sounds like "coqui" over and over. IT was cute although my husband was annoyed. :)The mattress was pretty crappy but the sheets and towel service was fine. You just have to leave the towels on the floor if you want them changed and the card they give you on your bed for them to change the sheets if you want.The walls are thin and you can hear the toilets flushing at all hours and some times the conversations next door but we were not in the room too often.If I was to go back I would go to Las Casitas and to the the spa and never set foot on the resort (only to go to David's cafe)All in all we had a good relaxing time and came back with a tan!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: Janewb57
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews. I reserved the hotel through Hotwire, for which I paid $131 per night. Booking through Hotwire, I wasn?t sure if I could select a room or would be given something substandard. Upon check-in, there was no mention of this, but I was charged an $11 per day resort fee upon checkout. I had stayed the night before in San Juan, and arrived at the Wyndham at 10:30, not expecting to be able to check-in, but was able to. Note ? even if you cannot check-in they will allow you full use of the facilities. I asked for a room at the Marina level, but there was not one available at that time, but would be later in the day. They did have one available in Las Olas, which I took. I also had a partial ocean view. The room was huge, as I understand they all are. There were 2 full/queen beds, a small table and chairs, and an entertainment center. The bathroom was huge ? a large room with marble vanity and sink, and another vanity and stool. Off of that a small room with toilet and shower. There was also a large walk-in closet. Plenty of large, plush towels. It also had a ceiling fan and sliders to a balcony with a table and two chairs. As others have mentioned, the room could use some updating. The bedspreads looked kind of tired and it could use a fresh coat of paint. The room was supposed to have a refrigerator, which it didn?t. The bellman told me to use the fridge in the honor bar and to just take stuff out. I wasn?t comfortable doing that, so I called Guest Services. They said I could not use that fridge, but they would see if they could get another. They called back and said there were none available. I complained a bit, and they were able to find me one and it was at my room in a few minutes. TV received many stations, but no HBO. Also had a stereo system with cassette and CD. Could not get any radio channels to come in, but the Cable TV had some of the digital music stations. Climate control in the room was excellent ? not some noisy a/c. The grounds are beautiful everywhere on the property. The pool at Las Olas was very quiet and was never crowded. All the food we had was excellent. Some of the restaurants are very pricey ($17 omelette), but the Caf? Caribe had very good food (try the fruit plate) and was very reasonably priced. From Las Olas you can walk down to the Marina level or take an elevator from the back side of Las Olas, so you don?t have to wait for the funicular. I didn?t find it that inconvenient to be at the Las Olas level, but would make sure to plan ahead when ?going up?. Overall, I found the service to be very good, but did find whenever calling for something in the hotel, the phone rang a very long time, and one time while I was at the concierge desk, she let the phone ring a zillion times while she was helping me. There are numerous restaurants to choose from. It would be helpful to have a comprehensive directory of the restaurants and menus for each room. The concierge had a couple, but you had to look at them while at the desk. They will make photo copies for you and will make reservations for you. Make reservations as far ahead as you can for the more popular places so you?re not eating dinner at 9:00. I had a car, which I only used once to go to the Las Cabezas preserve. I thought I would use it more, but there was no reason to leave the hotel. Self-parking was $15 per day. Lot is not far from entrance, but there is a shuttle which goes back and forth and we barely had to wait for it. They offer several excursions, competively priced. Negatives: I couldn?t get the slider to the balcony to lock; it looked like the vanity in the bathroom at one time had a glass top which was never replaced; I put dirty towels in the hamper in the walk-in closet which were never picked up, but new towels were left; clean towels were not available at the Las Olas pool until about 9:30-10:00 in the morning. Overall, I loved it and would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rainforest and Catamaran trips were the highlight; Food at Otello's was great”
Reviews.Author: brenne127
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a five-day (March 12-March 17) stay at the Wyndham El Conquistador, and we had a great trip. Our room in the La Vista wing was quiet, with a lovely terrace overlooking the tennis courts and golf course. Highlights of our stay included taking the boat to Palomino Island for sunning and horseback riding; a catamaran/snorkel trip on a boat called Traveler; and hiking through the rainforest. We rented a car so we could hike the El Yunque at our leisure -- I recommend that you go over the directions with the Avis representative before you leave the hotel!! Like anything, it is simple if you know what you're doing! We had outstanding dinners at Otello's and the Stingray Cafe, but I found the teppanyaki at Blossoms to be disappointing (our chef didn't talk to us at all and wasn't yet very skilled apparently). We did find the food to be priced too high -- no one should have to pay Manhattan prices except in Manhattan! We brought juices and granola bars with us so that we could get right to our activities in the morning and not have to spend $20 per person for a uninspired Continental breakfast. I would recommend that anyone staying here check their hotel charges each day as the hotel tried to charge us for a couple of things that we hadn't used, but they fixed the problems with no questions asked. I do agree that the resort could have some musical entertainment or some kind of show for the evenings. We didn't go to the Casino at all but were content to hang out with our kids after dinner and play cards.

Reviews.Title: “Read this review!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think I should start by saying that after booking this trip in January I became obsessed with reading the reviews on this hotel. I must've checked this website daily for new reviews, and as a result I made myself absolutely crazy with the extremely mixed ratings. Well, we were there last week and I all I can tell you is that the people that wrote the bad reviews on this place are either dumb and dont know any better or are such tight-asses that they have no business travelling and should just stay home. My husband and I have been to Puerto Rico about 6 times, but this was our first time staying at the El Conquistador. We truly found it to be one of the most beautiful, breathtaking resorts we have ever seen, and we have stayed in many beautiful resorts. Our room was in the Las Vistas wing and it was huge. My husband usually books suites when we travel but at the advice of my travel agent we booked an Ocean View Delux Room and it was by far the biggest room I have ever seen, with a couch and a sitting area and a large balcony with french doors. Also, since it was on a cliff, there was a good breeze constantly so we slept with the doors open at night and never even had to use the AC. Someone had complained about needing to leave the AC on at all times because of a "musty odor in the rooms"--we experienced none of that to tell you the truth our room was exceptionally clean, and you dont know my husband he has a little OCD when it comes to cleanliness. Someone had written that they "rarely received maid service during their stay and that the towels were dirty", well here's a tip--you have to leave the room and housekeeping comes to clean. If you leave the room late and housekeeping has already been by, pick up the phone and push the little button that says HOUSEKEEPING and let me them know you are going out and need the room cleaned. The deal with the towels is that if you want clean ones (and god I hope you do) make sure you leave the used ones in a pile on the floor or in the tub or something so that the maid doesnt assume you are going to re-use your towel after it dries. I gave then a call one day and asked for extra pillows and exra towels and not only were they prompt but also called me about an hour later to make sure everything was to my satisfaction. This brings me to another point--maybe we recieved such good service because we tipped them for their effort. Its really not how much you give but it just shows that you are appreciative of their service. I think that is a good part of the reason that some people had so much to complain about. But you wanna know what, they deserve to have that kind of trip if they expect the people who work in a resort of 1000 rooms to cater to them personally without giving them something for their time. I wonder if these people have ever even been to a restaurant before. And speaking of food--the food here was by far the best (and cheapest) than on any other island we have been to. Isabellas was great. Othellos was great, Cafe Caribe/ice cream parlor was really good--the ice cream cones were so addicting; once I had 4 in one day and now I know what you are thinking but no I am actually not a fat girl) and the biggest surprise was Blossoms. Who would think you can get good chinese food in Puerto Rico. But it was awesome, and that was take-out--I can only imagine how good it must be to actually eat dinner there. The only place I was not thrilled with was Las Brisas breakfast buffet. I found eating breakfast at Cafe Carib better or ordering room service and eating on the balcony. By the way, if anyone is a fan of Dominos Pizza, you can order to your room and its just like home :) Of course wherever you get a pina colada here its going to be the best you have ever had, but I think that is anywhere in Puerto Rico. The Cafe Bella Vista also has frozen lemonade which was non-alcohalic and tasted like a margarita. The best part of these restuarants is that they dont include gratuity on anything. So we were surprised but the reasonable prices. I am shocked at the people that have complained about the "sky high prices for less-than average food". Well I don't know where she lives but I would say that the prices are comparable to NYC restaurants and the quality of the food was even better than some, but I guess that could be because we are from NY and not some trailer park in the sticks. You have no business writing a review on food unless its a 7-Eleven hot dog. Okay enough about food because I am making myself hungry. Palomino Island--I can assure you that you have never seen anything like this. Please dont listen to the pain-in the ass people complaining about the funicular and the boat ride to get there. That was so much fun. The funicular is about as much as an inconveniece as a glass elevator. That is literally how long it takes to get to you after you push the button and get you down to the marina. The boat does not take 20 minutes to get there, its more like ten and it is a beautiful ride. Plus where are you in such a hurry to go? Just some advice though--even though the weather might be like 85-90 degrees, chances are you wont really feel the hot hot sun because of the breeze there. MAKE SURE YOU WEAR SUNBLOCK. I am sitting here peeling as I tell you so dont make my mistake. Even if you are tan--I went tanning before I went so that I wasn't too white...you need spf 15 or higher and yes you will leave with a tan. We didn't stay at the pools much although I will say that the main pool with the bar is the nicest and mainly adults. Not that it matters--if it bothers you that much that there are kids in the pool (as some people complained about) then you might consider using the money you will spent on this trip on a nice lengthy therapy session. Because really, thats not normal. Okay, the casino--now its not as big as we were used to, but then again, and it is sad to say, I have seen a smaller one and THAT was gross. But this casino was nowhere near gross. In fact you will find that the slot machines are completely uncomputerized which makes it easier for them to hit. They dont have cards that count your time and they dont rate you for rewards or anything. So its really just fun. Like an old-fashioned casino. We won on a $1 slot within like 20 minutes. I mean its not vegas, its not even Atlantic city but by no means should you listen to the lady that wrote "yuck" as she described it. She needs to get a grip on reality. Also about that same woman complaining about underage kids drinking at the club or whatever. Well we didnt go to the club but I can relate because that is what underage kids do--go away and drink at the resort clubs. HELLO, werent you ever like 17 or were you just born a cranky old lady? I feel bad for your husband, Mam. Maybe you should be at Foxwoods or something instead. I had planned on going to the spa while I was there but since I had so much fun getting sunburned on my first day there (!) I ended up only going in to buy a bottle of aloe. But it is beautiful and it will definitly be my first stop next time we go. We did go on the rainforest tour, since in all the times we have been to PR we have never seen the rainforest. Our tour guide was the nicest guy and he knew absolutely everything there was to know about not only the rainforest but puerto rico in general. If you are into plant-life and insects or if you like to hike then this is a perfect tour for you. If you are like us and not really that much into nature I would say you may not have a good time because that is all there is to see really. It was kind of like the bronx zoo without the animals. But we had a great time anyway. Anyway, all in all we had a great time and the worst part of our trip was leaving. I really can't wait to go back. This is an awesome hotel altogether. Just remember you are on vacation--relax and enjoy yourself and dont be cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Huge and fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: cleats126
Reviews.Content: We just returned on March 10 from six wonderful days at the El Conquistador. From the moment we stepped into the beautiful and vast lobby, I realized this was a special resort. The setting is exceptional- three levels on a cliff overlooking the Caribbean. Whoever is in charge of the grounds deserves a special nod for they were impressive- fan palms, bougainvillea, royal palms, orchids, bird of paradise, etc. We stayed in a double room in the Las Brisas wing which overlooks the water and Palamino Island. We were treated each night to a fantastic sunset and a full moon. The Las Marinas section on the lowest level also looked very nice. Our friends were in the La Vista section which does not have as spectacular a view, but does have a Coqui frog serenade each evening which is magical. For those who can afford it, the Las Casitas village has a calm and serene perfection. For breakfast, I recommend the Cafe Caribe, especially the fruit plate or the Golf Grill. Also, you can get pastries and coffee at David's. For lunch, Ballyhoo's on the marina level has great quesadillas and Bella Vista (near pool) has good gyros and pizzas. For splashy (and expensive) dinners, I recommend Otelo's (includes a magician), the Japanese tappan yaki at Blossoms (you will love the chef), and the seafood at the atmospheric Stingray Cafe. For less pricey dinners, try pasta at Bella Vista or the Chinese at Blossoms. For drinks, try the Ballyhoo at Ballyhoo's or the Happy Hour at Las Cantina on the Middle (Las Olas) level. The Happy Hour includes free nachos. We gave a party one night in our room, and Blossoms delivered (on time) a tray of hors deouvres while Room Service provided the wine glasses. We bought the wine in town (Fajardo), but you can also get wine and rum in W.H.Smith in the lobby or through room service. For fun, we did the afternoon snorkeling cruise (special thanks to Angelie) and spent two days on Palamino Island, which we just loved. Take a right when you get off the ferry and go to the umbrella covered chairs at the turn of the island. There a nice waiter like Hector will take your food and drink orders. On Palamino, we rented floats, sunfish and hobie cats- great fun going over to Palaminito Island. My husband played golf three days. The course is dramatic, though the greens need a little work. To save money, play golf after 1:30. We also rented a car from Avis in the lobby and spent a day at the El Yunque Rain Forest. If you do not have a great time at the El Con, you are not trying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax, but here are some tips...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went for 4 days and were pleasantly surprised upon arrival to their spacious lobby area. The check-in process was quick, but the person checking us in was not very enthusiastic or helpful. No matter, we were in 85 degree weather! Our room was in the Alta Vista building with ocean view - 4th floor. The room was clean and updated, the view was breathtaking. However, after a few days, the pool noise became a little annoying -- the pool is popular with kids of course, because it's such a great area. On some nights, we were kept awake by some midnight / 3 a.m. drinkers in the pool area. The resort would do well if they had restricted pool area hours (like when most people are sleeping). I say this because the walls are paper thin. I was woken up in the middle of the night on our first night to the sound of our toilet flushing, only to realize it was the room next door. (I made note of that during my next bowel movement). The food was very expensive and I was complaining to my husband the first day until he put it into perspective for me: You had no trouble spending a couple thousand dollars on flight and hotel, and you're worrying about paying an extra $10 per plate? He was right -- and my advice to you is: you're on vacation, don't worry about the freakin' food prices! In the end were able to save some money by eating a large breakfast, skipping lunch, eating an afternoon snack (from the coffee shop), and eating dinner. We found the Mexican restaurant (take the tram down to Las Casitas Village) to be the best deal for food (quantity, quality, and price). I recommend the resort's Bio Luminescent Bay kayak tour (look in the services book in your room) -- even if you've never kayaked -- this tour is slow-paced and easy. It was also the highlight of the trip -- I won't give away the surprise of the tour, but trust me it's worth it, it's a magical experience. We also went on the resort sponsored trip to El Yunque Rainforest and that was a real letdown. The tour is mostly by bus through the forest and they let you get out and take pictures of the "touristy" stuff (which is usually never what you really want to see). They also take you on a walk through the forest. We were anticipating some neat tropical experience, yet what we got was a very slow stroll on a trail that looped around picnic pavillions - what should have only taken 15 minutes. Additionally, they charge $50 / person for this tour and "tell" you about the endangered parots and other wildlife which they have in the park's special exhibit...but they don't take you there to see it -- if you want to see the rainforest, rent your own car and do it without a tour guide. Later that day, we walked the resort golfcourse and saw more wildlife on the course than we did on the rainforest "hike". Palomino Island: I read the postings here before the trip and took some advice to bring surf/ kayak shoes because of the coral under the water near the edge of the beaches. We were sure glad we brought them. They offer any kind of water sport on the island, which we didn't take advantage of ($$) mostly because sipping pina coladas under a coconut palm tree was good enough for us! (they make really good pina coladas, too!) What we learned overall: The staff can be very nice, if you are nice to them first. They normally don't go the extra step when you communicate with them. For example, we were seated in a restaurant and I asked for an ashtray. The waiter told me there was no smoking in that part of the restaurant. Period. End of discussion. I had to take the extra step and ask where the smoking section was. Normally, service staff anywhere else would tell you there is no smoking in the section, but there was smoking in the bar area. Another example: At the David's Cookies shop, we found a pastry that they made frequently that we liked. One time we went in and there were none left. We asked if they had any more. No. Period. End of discussion. So, we asked when they might be making some more. She wasn't sure. Our advice: Never take a staff answer as the last answer. Be prepared to continue with your questions in order to get what you want -- but don't be obnoxious or rude about it. Oh yeah, we took a bunch of cash with us, but found that we didn't need it in the resort. They give you a "credit card" that you use to charge everything to your room -- food, activities, clothing, etc. We found this to be really convenient. Just be prepared when you check out so that you're not so surprised with how much you charged during your stay. One more thing that was helpful: The minibar in the room sells small bottles of water for $4. But, the canteen sells twice that size bottle of water for $3.95. Overall, we left feeling really glad we went and we both agreed we would come back -- but stay at the private condo village where it is much quieter and rent a car for at least a day to do some non-resort sponsored sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, food overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Conquistador the second week in February 2004. We did a 4 for free package which gave you the 5th night free, the breakfast buffet free, and room upgrade(if available). The ride from the airport is 45min to 1hr. long and bumpy. At check in we were upgraded to Las Casitas private portion of the resort. The check in staff was not very warm, nor did they explain anything about the resort or your package. You are on your own to ask for what is included in your package. Las Casitas is a beautiful portion of the resort and from talking to other guests the best maintained. Our room was actually a small condo with kitchen, dining room table, sitting area, large bathroom, spa tub, and balcony with partial ocean view. Las Casitas has a small village-like atmosphere with a private pool, free continential breakfast, concierge service with butlers, turn down service, etc. Our room was kept very clean and the staff was very attentive in this portion of the resort. I don't think I would feel I was getting a deal without this upgrade. The first morning we got the free bagels and fruit at Las Casitas confused with the free buffet breakfast at Las Brisas that was part of our package. We were surprised to find that the regular price of this breakfast buffet was $40 for two. We were surprised by the cost of dinner at this resort. They pretty much have you captive at their reservation suggested locales that average $30 a plate. The resort itself is beautiful spacious and relaxing. At night we were surprised by the lack of activities. They tend to want to herd you into the casino. There were also many conventions during our stay. When they had special events the resort seemed dead at night. My husband wanted to go deep sea fishing during our stay and was disappointed that the hotel could not arrange excurisons that did not require that you rent the entire boat for $700. Overall we enjoyed laying out at the resort's island, having tropical drinks at the pool and getting sun in February. I don't know that we would go back to this resort because of the average food for the price and lack of night activity other than the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Just like a Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best way to describe this place is that it is like a VEGAS hotel. It is as if they picked up the Luxor and placed it on a cliff in PR. You need a map to get to your room...and the idea is to have one of everything. Like...one Italian rest, one steakhouse, one ice cream shop, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: AnnFt_Lauderdale_FL
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews posted, we were very hesitant about the choice we had made to visit this resort - however the resort met and exceeded our expectations - the views were spectacular from our room and balcony (our room was in Las Brisas, which I think is the most convenient building) the food was wonderful, especially at Stingray Cafe and Blossoms - not inexpensive, but comparable to Florida dinner prices. Service was very, very good, rooms were very clean. Palamino Island was heavenly, the horseback riding was great fun and informative! We took my 77 yr old mother, who had no trouble at all getting around and enjoying the resort. We really did not want to leave - liked it much better than Atlantis. Perhaps some reviewers would not have been happy at any resort if they did not like this one! I cannot say one negative word about the Wyndham El Conquistador ----

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this place , very big you need a map to get around. Good food very nice rooms. We went to san juan and it took forever to get there by car. But it was well worth it . You have to go to palomina island. It is so nice, there is a ferry that picks you up at the hotel to bring you there, we spent a whole day there. This is a very nice place well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views, Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kings54
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from El Conquistador. We stayed for 6 days during February. We arrived on a late flight, and had called ahead to make sure there would be a hotel shuttle. The ride took about 45 minutes, but it was a nice ride, offering drinks and video of the hotel to get you aquainted before arriving. Upon arrival, we had a quick check in (it was about 1 AM). We had a room in Las Olas, which is the village half way down the cliff. We found the room to be average with a large vanity, bathroom & closet area, which was nice. I would have been dissappointed, but had read previous reviews and did not expect an exceptional room - it was definitely dated & could use some renovations. We had signed up as Wyndham ByRequest members, and received an upgrade on the room (although I was not told this, I do know that I booked a "mountain view" room ($390 per night) and received a partial ocean view room). This room overlooked the pool at las olas and had the ocean in the background. We had a nice patio area, too. I really appreciated the serenity of this village & noticed that when going up to the main hotel area and pool area, it was much more crowded & noisy, although the views were great & it looked to be a great area for children to play. There is a swim-up bar at the main pool level, but there are also regular pool bars at the other pools. My husband and I have no children and are in our 30's, so we enjoyed staying at the pool in our village or going down to the marina village to use their pool, which was very beautiful, right on the ocean & peaceful. Palomino island is georgeous - I did not find the beach rocky, but instead sandy with beautiful clear water. The island has plenty of room and activities - you could either join in on beach volleyball games & use water sports, or you could continue down the beach to privacy & quiet. I thought that the options at the resort were great, where you could join in the fun or find your own peaceful quiet areas. As for eating - be ready to spend your money! My husband and I have eaten at some of the best restaurants in the US, so we do not have a problem spending money on great food. However, most of the food is not great, only average or below average. You still need to be prepared to pay! Isabelas was our best dining experience. Otello's was a disaster (as much as you may like Italian food, it is not worth the many mistakes made in this restaurant). My husband & I really enjoyed Ballyhoo & La Cantina for drinks. We missed our reservations at the Japanese restaurant one night, so we ordered in take out from there (I thought that was a nice option offered). Our take out bill was $120. That included a bottle of wine, but I still think is a little pricy for nnodles, rice & dumplings! I think that if you are bringing a family, food could get quite expensive. We love casinos, but only spent about 15 minutes in this one (yuck). Also - the bar next to the casino with the dance club attached is gross & we nightly watched underaged teens drinking there! If you're looking for a nice after dinner bar for drinks, go to the cigar bar - it is much nicer and has a nicer crowd. Overall, my husband & I enjoyed our stay b/c we were there to relax & were not expecting a brand new resort. We could charge everything we did to the room, including food, drinks & shopping. We could not take in the beauty of the resort enough, as it is huge and beautiful. We most likely would not come back - I think that I would look for a resort with better restaurants and more up to date rooms, and also a more easily accessible beach. The other option would be to look into Las Casitas, as I believe that those are newer and may have nicer rooms/suites. If you have already booked a trip here - just keep in mind the 4 star resort criteria, and you should enjoy! The staff at the resort were very kind & helpful. Also - ignore the weather report on the Wyndham.com website - it forecasted rain every day for us, but we instead found blue sunny skies in the high 80's daily!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what to expect after reading reviews”
Reviews.Author: snorklemom
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from our long weekend at El Conquistador. We have been to many resorts in the Caribbean with and without our children and are pretty realistic about what to expect on vacation. This time we took our two children (ages 8 and 4) and booked an ocean view room through expedia at a decent rate (wyndham guarantees the lowest rates on the internet, but we found that not to be true). I joined wyndham by request as suggested by so many reviewers, however, received notice that effectice Nov. 1, 2003, benefits are no longer available for reservations made on 3rd party travel web sites. We considered cancelling and rebooking through wyndham website so that we could be assured a nice room. (If anyone has the answer to this mystery, I'd like to hear it!) We were really concerned about some of the comments made about the rooms. I was not expecting the royal treatment since we booked through expedia, but we asked for an upgrade anyway upon arrival. It was one in the morning after a long delay by Delta from Atlanta. We were told we had been upgraded already. Our room was facing the back side of Las Brisas, along the service road on the back of the property with the ocean and small village in the distance. It was clean, but worn. We liked being close to the funicular and main lobby and main pools. All in all, a good location for us. One tip: Since there were four of us, we chose a taxi over the resort shuttle because we did not want to wait for everyone else to load up. The cost one way is $75 and the shuttle for the four of us would have cost more. Plus, we were able to grab our bags off the carousel and jump in a taxi before the shuttle was ready.Main impression: This is a large, spread out resort. Everything you need is there, but requires a hike and it will cost you. There was at least one large conference going on during this time. I would not consider this a honeymoon destination. My kids were right at home as we expected. I can't imagine why anyone coming here would NOT expect it to be well-suited for families. It is!Activities: Palomina Island is gorgeous! There is actually room for all those people getting off the ferry (without feeling crowded). The snorkeling is perfect for children; sandy bottom, no waves or currents. Go to the farthest end to your right when you get off the ferry for the best location! And visit the rain forest. The kids loved the hike to Las Minas Falls and learned a lot about conservation along the way. Of course, we couldn't keep them out of the pool.Restaurants: The breakfast buffet was fine, just like any buffet. If you like large quantities of food and lots of variety. We ate there once. We liked the Cafe off the lobby (a la carte) for the rest of our stay. Our dinner at Stingray was fantastico! Grilled dorado and tuna with mango salsas. Our kind waiter brought hamburgers over from Bayyhoos for the kids. Lunches on Palomina Island were great (anywhere that serves chicken fingers and fries is an A+ on our list). Dinner at Las Cantina de Las Olas was disappointing. We are Tex-Mex aficionados and this ain't it. Our final lunch at Ballyhoo's wasn't meant to be. We worked out our departure so that we could run down to the marina and have a grilled dorado sandwich only to be told "we're out of dorado today"! Had to settle for jerk chicken.Service: In response to all the commentary about service, we found EVERYONE who worked at the resort that we came into contact with during our stay to be professional, and extremely courteous. We tried to remember our "buenas dias and gracias" and it is truly appreciated.Overall, we felt that the value we received at the prices was on par, but we might have felt differently if we paid higher rates. Our goal was to get to a family friendly resort in the Caribbean on a non-stop flight from Atlanta with minimal transfers. For a long weekend, this trip was perfect for the four of us. We would definitely go back under similar circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: Jamaicagirl86
Reviews.Content: We recently visited The Wyndham El Conquistador and I must say this is one of the best resorts in the Carribean! I have been to many hotels and I defintely give this one 5 stars!!! The hotel has beautiful grounds that are very well maintained. We had a room with a partial ocean view and we enjoyed sitting on our spacious balcony and gazing down. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and we were very pleased to have two king size beds. The staff is friendly and always willing to help. What is absolutely to die for is the stunning views! We very much enjoyed sitting at breakfast in the morning at Las Brisas resturant and gazing down at the cliffs.(very good buffet breakfast). The resturants are all really good...I especially recommend Stingrays and the French restuarant. I do admit the restaurants are pricey, but hey you're on vacation. We loved Palimino Island with its white sand beaches and crystal clear blue water. You can relax there all day or join in the many activities that they have available. If you want to have the vacation of a lifetime, visit this hotel! Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: El Conquistador was great! The moment we entered Fajardo, PR. I was thrilled we were staying there. The beauty of the lobby! The rooms were great! The treats inside the refrigerator were delicious! :D My mother went to the casino and won $3,000 dollars! Win and run method works best :D lol When go to PR it's to El Conquistador!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad, but Mostly Good”
Reviews.Author: gleff
Reviews.Content: Landed at SJU at about 11pm, there was an El Conquistador staff member and a Westin Rio Mar staff member waiting at US baggage claim. He walked us over to the El Conquistador desk.Airport transportation is $60 roundtrip per person. The hotel's shuttle is a van with a VCR (on the return we were shown old Hooneymooners episodes taped off television in the 1980s) and a bar (complimentary drinks). The van wasn't at the airport, so they had us wait for about 20 minutes while they gathered up some other folks coming in on AA and then stuck us in a shared cab. There was no break on price.Got to the hotel around midnight. The airport is about 30 miles from the hotel -- nearly an hour drive without traffic and far longer on the return which was midday. The hotel lobby was abuzz and several folks were in line ahead of me. The Byrequest checkin desk was unmanned, so I waited in line.The other folks on my shuttle were ahead of me and I saw they got placed in the main hotel. I saw one confirmation printed with a hotels.com logo. That person seemed to get a pretty standard room, assigned to them at checkin.I got to the front of the line and the clerk saw that I had been preblocked. He walked back into the office and came back out with a smile on his face. I was in a suite at the Marina level. It was a 10 minute walk and I returned to the entrance to retrieve my luggage and an staff member to help with it.We walked through the main hotel and to the funicular, the "elevator" on a track that takes you down from the main property (Las Vistas and Las Brisas) to the middle level (Las Olas) and down to the Marina. There are two funiculars -- one that's an express straight to the marina and one that stops at the Las Olas level.Once down at the marina we walked to the far end where we were shown a secluded room. The hotel is quite large -- about 970 rooms -- but I was at the very end of the property and it was quiet. The room was large. The bathroom was huge. There was a pool that was seldom used right next to the room. The bed was very comfortable.But the real benefit was the balcony. It was huge and had a direct ocean view, with the pool off to the right (and a mountain behind it). Absolutely stunning. My favorite part of my long weekend was just sitting out on the balcony and relaxing. There was pretty comfortable furniture out there, too.The ByRequest manager really took care of me and he called the next day to check on me. Believe me I thanked him profusely -- the room was more than I had hoped.It was nearly 1am by the time I was ready to turn in, but I was hungry. The room service menu said that service was until 1am, and I had 15 minutes left, but I called and the number just rang. I called the front desk and was told that room service at the marina level stops at midnight, and that the only food options were back in the main hotel (I later learned there was an all night option). So I snacked on the fruit left by ByRequest.In the morning I went to breakfast at the buffet restaurant. For a resort with so many food options (more than a dozen) they're really lacking at breakfast. There's the Cafe Caribe in the main hotel, the restaurant service a buffet (I forget its name) and more or less just room service as the other option. I was disappointed in breakfast, and on future days just popped up to the little bakery in the hotel first thing for a mocha and then ordered room service which I enjoyed out on the balcony.Next I went out to Palomino Island, the resort's leased private island which is the site of the beach. Plenty of chairs and shade and good bar/cafe service. The boat leaves every half hour from 9-3 and takes about 20 minutes to get there. Came back to the room and made dinner reservations at the seafood restaurant at the Marina. The menu wasn't all that exciting, and didn't live up to its billing as Carribean-influenced seafood. Everything was fairly plain and offered either with rice or truffled mashed potatos. So I made a meal of soup, two appetizers, and dessert which was excellent.The next night I had dinner at the teppan yaki restaurant, which is a bit of a factory and the whole affair was over in 45 minutes or so. That restaurant also offers sushi and chinese -- the chinese I ordered the following night as room service and enjoyed it on the balcony.The isn't a place that invests in all of the details. For instance, toilet paper is Scott tissue. Some of the furniture in the room was stained. Housekeeping never cleaned up out on the balcony, so anything I wanted taken away needed to be moved inside. Spa phone line rings off the hook... Including hold time I waited 20 minutes to schedule a massage. And the attendants at the spa were somewhat aloof.In the end, the resort had everything I wanted. The weather was perfect and I was perfectly located on the property. My balcony absolutely made the trip. The grounds are huge, and with such a large resort comes an enormous number of options. The place is really a self-contained city (there's even a sunglass hut franchise on the property, along with several other shops). It's far from anything else one would want to do or go to, but there's an Avis rent a car on property. I didn't leave the property during my stay.I would definitely go back if I could secure the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on the Carribean Sea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the El Conquistador. We got the really good last minute package deal off of Travelocity/Cheap Tickets. Wow! We have been to the Hyatt Cerromar and the Hyatt on St. John both about 15 years ago and we would say this compares quite favorably. The proporty is spectcular. We had rooms at Las Olas which were not fancy but as the other person said it was great to have such a large amount of counter and closet space particularly in the bathroom. The terrace had a view of the pool and the ocean beyond even though we did not expect a view of the ocean. There was dining in various price categories more so than at other resorts. The fancier restaurants (particularly the one down by the boat dock!) were well worth the price. My husband and I are not big eaters and the staff happily accomodated us when we decided to split an entree one night at the outdoor restaurant by the pool and also at lunch on the Island. We watched the sun set over El Junque right from the golf course! The resort is quite large but there is so much to do that we never encountered any crowds of people in one place. No waiting on lines. The only problem we had was when we landed at the airport. The young man from the El Conquistador greeted us and told us where to get our bags and he told us he would wait for us there, but, by the time we returned he had left. We had to wait for an extra half hour and finally found that there was a desk for the hotel located ouside of the terminal. There were 7 of us stranded there and the hotel guy found us a taxi for 6 to take us to the hotel. (One unfortunate husband and wife had to share a seat all the way) and we were not charged any less for the lower class of service. So if there is a guy waiting for you from the hotel, stick to him like a barnicle. This place is really romantic! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overrated is an understatement. The rooms are a major disappointment and the staff for the most part is not attentive and certainly not accomodating.If you compare to higher-end hotels like the Ritz Carlton, the El Conquistador is inferior in all respects. The rooms are musty and worn. The bathrooms need are in serious need of renovation and feels like you're in a dorm not a "luxury hotel".We paid top dollar for a "Deluxe" room with an ocean view and instead got a view of the surrounding neighborhood (very poor area) with a partial ocean view. When we tried to swtich rooms the best management could do is offer us an inferior room on a lower floor.You may get lucky and enjoy your stay here but don't risk it - it's not worth it... certainly not for the price! The golf is course is only ok and dining average. This is an honest and fair assessment of this hotel and I hope it helps visitors planning to go to Purto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently went to the El Conquistador for a 6 day vacation and it was absolutley beautiful! Even the sunset (cheap) rooms have a great view of the rain forest and the ocean which would be considered an ocean view some other hotels. The service is 4 star (not 5) but the hotel itself is nice enough that you can ignore the service and just enjoy the most perfect views. We were delayed at the airport and stayed and extra day at a 4 star hotel in San Juan and it did not compare at all with the El Conquistador. The location alone makes this one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Island Hopping in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at four different hotels in 8 days. The first being the Conquistador in Fajardo. It's very lush and beautiful. They spend all their money on the grounds and the lobby areas. They could spruce up the rooms inside a bit. If you plan to go there, join Wyndham by Request. It's free from their website and it will get you free snacks and drinks upon arrival in your room and an upgrade if available. The parking is $10 per day self park and $15 valet. The self park is a short walk away and a van drives around to pick you up if they spot you. The bathrooms are a nice size. With kids, this is a plus. The pools were nothing to write home about. just average pools. We did get to use floaties and pool toys from the towel station. But not to be missed is the private island of Palomino. There are three nice ferry boats that run every half hour. It takes 15 minutes to get there. The last to take you there is three pm while the last to bring you back is 530 pm. Go even if you don't plan on staying just to tour the first day. It has all the amenities - restaurant, bathrooms, water sports, putt putt, lounge chairs, horse back riding. It is white sandy beaches with crystal waters. Definitely worth the stay. The Hyatt Dorado was nicely appointed but we had to request a change of rooms due to the musty smell again. The closeness to the beach was great but the rooms were very humid. They have hammocks everywhere and it is rather quiet. We rode to the Cerromar which was just five minutes away and the kids had a blast in the lazy river pool. This place is totally geared for kids. They have a great 18 hole putt putt and the beach right by the pool as well. There was a changing/shower/locker room which was very handy next to the shop. Parking at the Dorado is free but like all resorts, they have a resort fee. Next we went to the Copamarina resort in Guanica. All I can say about this place is dead. If you want to do nothing. Come here. They have a couple of pools. The one had a fountain in the middle and my youngest enjoyed it. But the best part was the trip to Gilligan's Island. You catch a ferry from Copamarina there - it's four dollars per person. You have to tell the dive shop and they call the small boat. It stops somewhere nearby for the locals and then comes over to Copamarina. It ran pretty much every hour. We found crystal clear waters and so much fish to look at. The dive shop is where you get towels too. The shop here didn't seem too outrageous in prices. The other thing is they have live music every night by the outdoor restaurant. They had a guitar player who was wonderful. Also, their hamburgers were delicious. The bugs were ferocious. Bring INSECT REPELLANT. Guests were running to their rooms to avoid being bitten. The rooms were colorful and beds comfortable. It's more casual, they didn't have room service either. And the parking here is free but if you get a room in building 5 which is the last one, it's a short walk. Last but not least, the Embassy Suites in Isla Verde. It is nearby many restaurants and shops. So you can walk to places. Try Mi Casita's or Metropol nearby for reasonable authentic meals. Embassy Suites charges $10 for self park and $14 for valet. But can't beat the free breakfast and the afternoon manager's reception. But it is close to the airport and you hear the planes. But we love the suites and two tv's. They have outback steakhouse downstairs along with the hotel restaurant. The pool here is very nice too. The kids always love it. All in all we wouldn't hop again but now I know what the hotels are like. And we always pick up a copy of Que Pasa Magazine which comes in very handy. We found Ricomini Bakery in Cabo Rojo and their rolls- it comes boxed were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “nice place - though pricey and a bit pretentious”
Reviews.Author: byoder
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on an auction site - otherwise the going rates ($300-$800) seem rather steep. The food is always quite expensive. The rooms were nice - big and clean, and though we didn't have an "ocean view", we had nice big balcony that overlooked the tennis courts, and then out towards the mountain and ocean. The private beach was great. Service was fine. The rules about dress in the evening seemed a much for someone like myself on vacation. We ate out a nearby restuarants, and stocked up on snacks and drinks at the town that is walking distance from the bottom of the funicular. Again - had a great stay, but wouldn't go back if I had to pay rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “I will tell you what the others didn't”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you get to the resort you will find that the food is expensive. (Our most expensive meal was $175.00 for two adults and two childern). I want to give you a small hint. If you take small childern to the resort as we did, you will want a rent a car. This gave us the freedom that we needed to come and go as we pleased. Also, every room has a refrigerator. There are a few places 10 minutes from the hotel to buy food. We often had a late breakfast or lunch in the room and this saved us a great deal of money. The resort is very nice, The staff is trying hard to make to keep things up. If you are going to worry about some water damage in your room or if you cant stand to spend 70 dollars on lunch for four people, dont come here. If you are looking for Views to die for or fun in the sun this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful honeymoon - Long Review...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned yesterday from our honeymoon at The El Conquistador. I must say I was speechless when I walked into the main lobby; it was breathtaking. We had a club room which included continental breakfast, hordorves in the evening, private concierge, and access to the VIP lounge in the Las Brisas wing. We had a stunning view of the ocean overlooking Palomino Island, and Vieques. We took the rainforest walking tour and our guide was knowledgeable, personable and made it very interesting. ( There is also a hiking tour of El Yunque that will take you to La Mina falls.) Contrary to another review there are tours to San Juan, one guided and the other a day of shopping in Old San Juan also to El Morro castle. This is where I shop as I have been to San Juan before. There is a few shops at the resort but the really interesting finds are in San Juan and it is nice to learn from the locals as Puerto Rico is friendly place and has a rich history. The hotel and the grounds are very well maintained and the staff very accomadating and professional. I have a degree in botany and the landscaping foreman was very knowledgeable and indulged my questions about the plantings, etc. The hotel staff were always very polite and helpful we found them to be a great source of local information and ideas for excursions offsite. I also used the dry cleaning service and my clothes were back in my room within a few hours clean and nicely pressed. The restaurants are pricey, and I found that the everyday food was pricier in comparison to the Stingray Cafe and Isabela's. It is true Cafe Caribe ( although the food was great) they have an $8 hot dog on the menu. With that said I recommend the crabmeat tostones. I agree if you want to relax and enjoy the sun it is great, but they do have rental cars and guided tours if you want to explore. Palomino Island was beautiful and the only complaint I have is the horseback riding. I found the stable area to be substandard and the resort needs to allocate more space. Also the horses were saddled all day: this is not entirely humane. I have three horses myself and would never keep them in such conditions. The horses were not groomed before being saddled. Needless to say I did not ride, but spoke to the stable manager. Paso Finos are noble Spanish horses and should be treated as such. I will get down from my soap box now. The boat ride to and from Palomino is very relaxing and enjoyable. I must say it was a great week and we had a wonderful time. The hotel was recommended to us by friends and now I am passing off the same recommendation. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: micnadkel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 4 nights at the Wyndham El Conquistador in Puerto Rico (Jan 9 to 13, 2004). We opted to pay for the hotel transport to and from the airport. The price was $60 per person for round trip transportation. It was well worth it as the resort is difficult to find if you are not familiar with the area. We did not rent a car since we were planning to park ourselves on the beach for the entire trip. And what a wonderful beach is it! Palimino Island is a private island that is leased by the resort. A15 minute boat ride gets you there and the boat leaves every half hour from 9am to 3pm. After 3pm, only return trips from the island are available. The boat leaves the island every half hour from 3pm to 6pm. So, you could conceivably stay on the island from 9:30am to 6pm. The island has restrooms (flush toilets!), a restaurant/bar, a small shop, and beach rentals. There is plenty of room for everyone, lots of chairs and plenty of shade if you want it. The resort, itself, is gorgeous. We had a sunset vista room and it was as depicted on the Wyndham website. There are excellent pictures of the resort on travelocity. We were very satisfied with our accomodations. My only complaint is that there were a few small ants on the vanity when we arrived. Probably because someone had left something sweet there. Anyway, no big deal. We called the front desk and they took care of it immediately. We saw no more ants after that. The food at the resort is very good, but expensive. But of course, this is typical of secluded resorts and no big deal since we had gotten such a good deal to begin with. There are cafes and a bakery where you can get muffins, etc for breakfast. The drinks are expensive, $6 for a beer, $8 for a mixed drink. But, again, this is not atypical for this type of resort. There is a casino at the resort, it was busy. There is also a disco. No one went there. There is the funicular ride that you have to take to the marina to get the boat to Palimino. It's like one of those cable car type ski lifts, only it runs on a track on the ground. There are 2 of them. We never waited more than 5 minutes for one, well maybe 7-10 minutes when we returned from the beach late in the day. I didn't see this as a problem. The tennis courts are lovely. The golf course looked very nice (I'm not a golfer). The people who work at the resort are great. If you ask for directions, a staff member will actually walk you there! Some suggestions: Bring reef shoes. The beach, in the water, has coral. We brought ours and were glad we did! Bring your own snorkel gear, if you have it. The snorkeling is very good. You don't have to go beyond your waist to see fish. Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. I am one of those travelers who finds it difficult to sleep on the first night. I could hear doors shutting, showers running,, etc.--especially the first night when I was getting acclimated. I recently bought a travel alarm clock that has a white noise sound machine. I used it for the first time at this resort and I really liked it! Michelle

Reviews.Title: “Think twice or more about staying here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THIS hotel is taking advantage of its location. It's far too expensive and the service is awful. We were there christmas week and everyone was complaining. The food is pretty bad and the markup is 100%. A burger meal for 4 in a restaurant will cost you more than $100. It's a hassel to leave the grounds to go elsewhere so you're trapped. The staff doesn't seem to care whether you're happy or not. If you choose a room in the parts of the resort NOT in the main hotel, it'll take you 15 or 20 minutes just to get to your room from the main building. The pools are nice, but the beach is a ferry ride away. Nearly nothing is convenient. We asked for lamps and the DVD in our room to be fixed, but they never were. (We asked twice.) We live in NYC and are used to paying a lot for restaurant meals, but this was ridiculous. It made you feel like you were constantly being ripped off. STAY. AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “not getting what you are paying for!!!”
Reviews.Author: That'sMyOpinion
Reviews.Content: this resort has lots of problems....the rooms are shabby and the housekeeping was very substandard....the towels were dingy, the bedspread was filthy, there was hair in bathtub & on floor upon check-in, the rug seriously stained, the rugs & bath floor where not vacumed each day. the public areas...the floor tiles all around the resort were covered in grim and food. the music in lobby excuriatingly loud, the island looked like a shanty town with all manner of junk piled in view of the public, the chaise lounge pads around the pool were stained with all manner of food, lotion and god only knows, the chaises on the island were full of mildew.... have they ever heard of power washing? the service....was very poor, while some staff was pleasant, some never even tried to smile...they were not well trained and at times seemed oblivious....one day at las casitas one of the lunches in our party of 4 never even showed at the table, one of us left hungry. service, service should be the motto of any resort and there seemed to be no pride in doing a good job, and that is a sign of poor managment. my favorite was the one towel rule at the pool and beach island...give me a break!! they actually issued you a card to get a towel and didn't give it back unless you returned the towel to the desk. the golf course.... (troon golf company????) the greens were bare and there was no sand in the bunkers, there are no locker rooms and the rest rooms were under renovation so you had to go up three floors to the spa, the half way house was closed. the spa......the ultimate disappointment!!!we have been to two other golden door spas,,the peaks in telluride and the boulders in scottsdale, and they were exceptional, therefore, i can't believe the golden door puts their name on this one. the reception staff was not well trained, the lounges were dingy and not well decorated, there was only one hair dryer, three women waited, there were wet towels all over the place, my treatment was not golden door standard. the restaurants....overpriced for the quality, one bright light... the sting ray cafe, service and food were very, very good and the bartender at the marina bar makes an exceptional pina colada, second bright light....service and food at blosooms was very, very good. the tables at breakfast and lunch venues were dirty and greasy, the umbrellas at the cafe overlooking the pool were full of holes (just buy new ones after the last hurricane, please) we were there over the holidays for one full week and paid $600 a night per room, we booked two rooms..... if they can't get their act together during their busiest and most profitable time, they have no business being in business. it is really a shame.. this property could be the jewel of the carribean. the setting and views are spectacular. i kept looking around at the capacity crowd and wondered if they realized they were paying the ritz and four seasons resort prices for amenities and services no where near those standards......we are seasoned travelers and know you usually get what you pay for, in this case we were very, very wrong. this resort is very expensive and you will just not get what you pay for and that is not right. wyndham should be very, very ashamed of themselves. my advice is to look elsewhere until some other company comes and does justice to this most beautiful setting.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty El Conquisidor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was dirty and one day housekeeping failed to come altogether. There were no excursions to old San Juan and no rental cars to be had. We had to hire a driver for $300. The food in most of the restaurants was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with a girlfirend of mine stayed at El Conquistador from 12/19/03 to 12/23/03. We arrived to the hotel around 10:00pm, the check-in was smooth and quick. We initially booked a room with double beds (sunset view). The staff provided us an oceanview room with a king size bed and a sofabed. It works out perfect for us. The view from our room was beautiful. You wouldn't believe how calm the water is. It was really dark outside when we entered the room. We couldn't see the ocean and couldn't even hear the ocean. We thought the staff end up giving us a sunset view room instead. But we were too tired to complain. The next day morning, we woke up with this beautiful ocean view. It's totally different than when you see it at night. I have gone through all the possible reviews about this hotel before I arrived. Therefore, we only ate at the hotel a few times since it was pricy. Overall, the food was good, but again expensive!!! If you plan to eat at the hotels at all times, it's probably better to buy the meal plan. The private island is the best of all. We chose to stay on the left side which is less crowded and much quieter. If you have snorkeling tools, you don't even have to buy any snorkeling activity. Simply jump in the water and you will enjoy the experience. My husband even saw a sting ray there. You must try the fries on the island. They give you a big portion and it was really good for a price of $3.50. (That's probably the best food deal you can find in the hotel). In addition, the main pool is open 24 hours a day. You can enjoy swimming any time you want. The pool area is very nice, not crowded at all. We didn't stay in the hotel all times. In fact, we visited El Marro, Old San Juan, El Yonque and the bio bay. I would definitely suggest people to rent a car and do their own exploration. Driving in PR is not bad. It could be because I am from NY :) Last, definitely join Wyndham By Request member before you go. They give you some refreshments and free internet access. Staffs are very nice and wonderful. You can get any help from them without a problem. The only 3 things I would recommend for the hotel management to change is: 1) Update the room; it's a little bit old 2) Stores should open later than the current hour 3) The parking fee is extremely high... $10 a day for guest who stays at the hotel is very not reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving week at the El Conquistador. We have visited several luxury hotels and I was looking forward to a fabulous week of sun and fun. The accomodations are mediocre at best. The rooms needed serious upgrading and were straight out of the 80's. They have over five retaurants and they are all over priced with substandard food. The first night we were there we arrived really late and ordered room service. We were so disappointed. The chicken wings were raw on the inside and we went to bed hungary. When I called room service no one picked up the phone.The best thing about this hotel is the island and the Golden door spa. It is absolutely fabulous. If you plan on bringing your children, don't. They have absolutely no activities for the children and the adults as a matter of fact. We all went to bed early. If you plan on spending a relaxing vacation, then by all means this is the place for you. If on the other hand, you need just a little bit of excitement then you should choose some where else.

Reviews.Title: “utter disappointment”
Reviews.Author: flatironjake
Reviews.Content: Wow! I was here over Thanksgiving weekend, and this place really did not have their act together. Their entire computer system was out-of-service and it took everybody 3 hours to check in! My girlfriend and I had to settle for a room with two double beds. When I complained that I had requested a room with a king size bed five months ago, I was told that they could only guarantee the view of the room. And my room overlooked tennis courts (not the ocean!) -- go figure! The beach island was fairly shabby and was a complete hassle to get to. There was lots of debris all over the sand. Food and drink prices bordered on extortion all over the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Big letdown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! Although we reserved and had confirmation numbers for TWO rooms, one was apparently "not in the system" when we arrived. After haggling for 30 minutes, we were finally given a suite for one night and promised two rooms for the rest of our stay. The rooms we were supposed to be moved to were in the Marina Village. We checked out of the suite after one night, left our luggage with the bellmen and spent the day on Palomino Island. When we returned five hours later, sandy, sunburned and waterlogged...we were told that our rooms were still not ready. Husband "encouraged" the staff to FIND us two adjoining rooms that were clean in five minutes or less. Luckily they complied. The rooms were rundown and smelly. Our room had water damage - the sofa had large brown water stains all over it and black mold on the carpet behind it. We both came home with sinus infections. From the Marina Village you must make a couple of elevator trips and a journey on the funicular to get to most of the restaurants and activities. The funicular was dirty and more often than not, non-operational. To be fair, of the two funiculars at least one was working at all times. But by the time the crowds started arriving...there were long lines and uncomfortably crowded funicular trips. The service in any of the restaurants was abysmal. We ended up fetching our own water, tea and coffee. One night at the Mexican restaurant, we waited 50 minutes for our food. The staff is indifferent at best. I guess with the outrageous prices of the food, even tipping only 5 or 10% is still a decent amount. Room service was no improvement as it took as long as an hour to get our food which was stone cold when it arrived. On the plus side, the views are spectacular. Palomino Island is a must-see as is the sail and snorkel trip aboard the Chamonix. The Golden Door Spa was heavenly and worth every cent. We enjoyed ourselves IN SPITE of this resort, not because of it. I would never, in good conscience, recommend this or any other Wyndham resort for an extended family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very complete resort, by that I mean, they give you no reason to leave the resort. It will take you 1-2 days to see what the resort has to offer. I suggest you stay at least 4 days to fully enjoy what they have to offer. The golf is a bit pricey but the course is well kept with a cleaver design. I will stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: dhurtak
Reviews.Content: What started out as a huge disappointment turned out to be just ok. We arrived in a deluge, to find that our Wyndham By Request reservations had been completely fouled up, and that our party of three couples were in three separate buildings, far from one another. After one hour at the desk, we ended up in only two buildings, but one couple had to settle for double beds in order to get the promised ocean view. Service in the Cafe Caribe, the one place for sit down, rather than buffet breakfast, was atrocious. We invented the "coffee salute" which was one of us standing, a la Norma Rae, with a cup in the air. Even that did not work. The casino is small and the one bar that we really liked (smaller, less noisy, with a pool table that was not leveled with napkins) closed at 1:00 a.m. and they literally lock you out. Everything is expensive- the Golden Door spa is lovely and we had 2 for 1 treatments with our Wyndham By Request package, so we took advantage and used the beautiful gym, sauna, etc. The gym available to all hotel guests is ok, but just ok. All in all, the weather cleared and we had a nice time, though the service remained poor, even in Isabella's, a very upscale, expensive steak house type restaurant. The property is pretty, but go with the knowledge that service is spotty, and prices outrageous ($7 for a diet soda on Palmino Island!!)

Reviews.Title: “My daughter's wedding on the beach...”
Reviews.Author: niceblueeyedwoman
Reviews.Content: My daughter just got married at this resort on their private island. It was wonderful and stress free. The wedding planner arranged it all and did a fabulous job. I was a little nervous about arranging a wedding long distance but couldn't have been happier with the results. They offered a wedding package which included the site, minister, steel band, champagne, hot and cold or'doeurves,flowers, delicious wedding cake, water and soda. There were 11 of us. The resort is beautiful. The only thing that i was disappointed with was how expensive the food and drinks were. the photograher that the wedding planner recommended was fabulous and reasonable. He took about 147 pictures. He sent those in 5x6's in a photo album and all the negatives. We received them at home 6 days after the wedding. My daughter and her new husband were thrilled with their wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Pure paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: allprima
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely AMAZING. It is truly the MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACE i've EVER been (and i've visited cancun, bahamas, florida, italy, las vegas etc.) The views are breathtaking and the property is goregous. I loved the short boat trip to the private island and I think it added to the whole experience. The beaches are the cleanest and most pristine ive ever seen! The water is calm and perfectly clear, great for snorkeling! I must say that the food is expensive but its expected since it is an upscale resort. I recommend the El Conquistador to anyone looking for the true meaning of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “pretty great, but not the absolute best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: well, we stayed at the conquistador for 5 days and 4 nights in la marina village...the views were beautiful from the main hotel and our room down below...the food was pretty pricey, but not too outrageous (le bistro was the best especially the flaming coffee drinks)...palomino island was certainly a letdown (i like nice smooth carribean beaches) because the rocks were just unbearable to walk on...the casino was small but still fun...the funicular was a little slow but not too much of an inconvenience...the spa was awesome!...golf was the best!...the service was pretty good...overall, the hotel was pretty nice to stay at....it's just a little isolated from other attractions so rent a car and you'll have a really great time!

Reviews.Title: “A nice resort”
Reviews.Author: kranky
Reviews.Content: Located cliffside, there are 3 main levels to this resort, long walks may not be suitable to older persons, to keep humidity at bay, inside AC run at full blast.
