FACILITIES: With ocean to front and a rain forest to it's back, humidity and water are constant problems, rooms are in OK condition and probably due for an overhaul. Public areas well maintained. FOOD: Like most of Islands, expensive and not high value. Best is the Stingray fish restaurant. ACTIVITIES: Golf is resort expensive, but well maintained and nicely paced (no waiting), Beach Island is quite nice with something for everyone. SERVICE: Not polished, but friendly and caring. OVERALL: If you like resort living, you should find something to please you here.

Reviews.Title: “The place was beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a little skeptical about this resort, but out vacation turned out wonderful. Our flight arrived at night around 11pm and we were picked up in a Ford Expedition(not expected). As, we got to the resort (about 1 hour drive), we looked at this hotel in awe, it was gorgeous!! I don't know how anyone could have complained! The negative aspects, was yes, you can hear through the walls and the resturants are expensive, but what do you expect about any resort like this? We rented a car at the hotel and the girl gave us a great discount, it was awesome. I would recommended this place to anyone! One last suggestion, it you don't like the heat but want to lie out, don't lie out near the pool, it gets very hot, even if you go in the pool every 10 mins like I did. My suggestion is to go to the private island and put one of the chairs in the ocean, you'll be comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a visual treat. We had no idea that this hotel was so grand as we had booked it on line without any input from anyone. The restaurants are super expensive........my husband ordered a $20 burrito (a joke in California) but that would be my only complaint. We had a rental car and it was easy to get around. We went to the island and saw iguanas, snorkled and had a relaxing time. It was fun to check out all of the yachts parked in front of our room. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a classy experience.

Reviews.Title: “El Conquistador is a Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back a few days ago from a 4-day stay at the El Conquistador and have to admit I was a little worried. I read a lot of reviews that mentioned over an over how rude the staff is, the funincular takes too long, the boat ride to the beach is awful, the prices, etc. So needless to say, I arrived expecting to be dissapointed. I was not. The staff was very accommodating and helpful, never rude. We didn't like the view from the first room they gave us, so they quickly moved us to better room with a great ocean view. The funincular isn't inconvenient at all. No more than a few minutes wait. And the ride provided passengers with some magnificent views! The boat ride to nearby Palomino Island was just part of the experience; not something to complain about. The resort can get a bit pricey, but you don't go to a place like El Conquistador if you have a limited budget. Nothing is ever PERFECT. But if you make your desires, complaints and requests known POLITELY, you will most likely get a positive response. Overall, a stay at the El Conquistador is well worth it!!!!! A beautiful place!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A resort with a view....and then some”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: W just spent 3 nights at the hotel, 10/24-1027 and have to say it was absolutely fantastic. Why?Well...first let me say that we had beautiful weather.So that being said and with the resort being on a mountain bluff with gorgeous views of the Atlantic ocean merging with the Carribean as well as viewing their own private Palamino Island ...other islands(believe St.Thomas and Viequs)....Utterly superb with excellent weather conditions! Also, my wife and I are pool/ beach people. We stayed in the main hotel wing...(Bresas) and found that to be convenient to mostly everything...pools,cafes,casino,restaurants,and the elevators/funnoculars to the marina level at the base of the cliff.The free boat ride to the island was a real treat...as at times we caught the speedier boat which brought us there in 20 minutes.Once there...it was paradise...horseback riding ,hiking trails, water sports, volleyball, outdoor cafe,tiki bar...The water was calm,clean and beautiful. You could see your feet. There were some rocks but I found that the sand in the water was much softer directly east of the tiki bar. We set up on comfortable lounge chairs provided by the hotel on that side of the beach(facing "Little" Palamino island)For those whom do not want too much sun, little tiki huts were spread out along the sand that could provide great coverage while lounging.Waiter service was available along the beach.The main pool area was cleaned every morning....swim up bar...with happy hour every day from 2:00-3:00 PM. Perhaps, the biggest "secret" we uncovered was the happy hour from 5:00-7:00 pm at the Mexican place, La Cantina which is one stop down on the funnocular to the Olas level.We had dinner there one night and the view was fantastic and We had some pretty decent chicken and steak fajitas. We ate in Isabellla's steak house one night and although it is a bit pricey, the food was pretty good in a comfortable setting and I guess what you would expect in a fine hotel like this one. The Italian restaurant looked like a great place to eat but pricey...$26. for Chicken parm.We ate offsite one night at a place not too far from the hotel grounds entrance...the Anchor Inn.The decor was just alright(not much of a bar area) but the prices were cheaper than the hotel and the food was very good. Our waiter/proprietor Pedro was very friendly and the meals were cooked to order... we found the shrimp and snapper to be very delicious... rice, beans,plaintains on the side and it hit the spot. Try the custard for dessert.As for night time entertainment....,outside of the casino, not much to do. There is a disco and small bar outside the casino but the Saturday night that I was there....not much happening. A band played a few sets in the small bar/lobby sitting area but the dance area was a bit awkward and never really got the crowd into it and finished way too early.Finally, we are Wyndham by request members, and with that we were upgraded to ocean view rooms (clean,walkin closet,pre bathroom area with sink, and bathroom)and free Coronas and chesse and crackers were sent up to our room after we checked in. Make sure you join prior to booking your trip as you also get late 2:00 pm check out.I believe the Wyndham chain is changing their policy on this for all internet bookings( outside of their own) after 11/1/2003. I recall seeing an e-mail to that effect after I joined. Make sure you check.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Top grade - but you'll pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow. This is easily the biggest and most beautiful resort I have ever been to. My wife and I returned yesterday from a 4 night stay and were blown away. The architecture is beautiful and the place is enormous and has everything you could ask for. However, the crowning feature of this resort is the view.You can get either the Ocean View (which we did), or the Garden/Rainforest view. Both are stunningly beautiful. On a clear day you can see right over to the USVI, and sometimes the BVI. There's a beautiful private island owned by the resort and a free water taxi every 30 minutes. That was reaaalll nice. Finally, the famous Golden Door Spa on the resort is spectacular, it was my first time having a spa treatment, and I went three days in a row. I didnt play golf this trip, but the course looks very very well manicured. In a nutshell, easily the best of all the Caribbean resorts I have been to. Ok. Of course there's always a few gripes, and here are mine: 1 - Everything will cost you an arm and a leg. Try $25 for the cheapest entree, and that can go up to $45. Beers and cocktails are in the typical $5-7 range, and there's NO caribbean or spanish restaurants! 2 - Some of the staff seem a little slow and not quite trained, but all were very pleasant. 3 - Its a long way from San Juan, not in miles, but in drive-time. Puerto Rico's road are horrendously overcrowded and poorly maintained. I suggest you pay the $60 roundtrip per person and ride on El Conquistador's luxurious coach which will pick you up right outside the baggage claim. 4 - Dont bother turning up early. Check in is not until 4pm, and they'll hold you to that time.We waited for 4 hours to check-in. Having said all that, I refuse to end on a negative note. Aside from the price of things on the resort, (which can be somewhat avoided by buying your gifts etc in Fajardo or San Juan, and if you want you can eat breakfast in the nice cafes on the resort like Las Brisas and Cafe Caribe), I loved this place.Its location on a cliff-side overlooking the Caribbean sea is unforgettable, the facilities are amazing, and the private island is breath-taking (evidenced by a visit from Anna Kournikova on our last day there - she was in for a photo shoot). Go there.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, a dream vacation--but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 10th anniversary at the Conquistador from 8/12/03-8/18/03. I was nervous about taking this trip and spending the money after having read some of the reviews posted here but when we got there all my worries were put to ease. The drive to the hotel takes about an hour from the airport, through San Juan and through many small, urban towns. Expect what you would expect in any city: litter, congestion, traffic and poorly-kept homes. Puerto Rico is a third world country, regardless of its association with the U.S. I was somewhat surprised to see the level of poverty, but it is what it is and people should expect to see that. When we got to the resort it was almost as if we stepped into a different country: immaculate grounds, and breath taking views of the Caribbean Sea and Atlantic Ocean. We arrived at around 11am and were quickly checked-in, which was a definite plus. Most hotels won't do this. Our package (which we booked directly through Wyndham) included breakfast each day and a free upgrade to an ocean view room, which they honored with three different choices of rooms! We settled on one that directly faced Palomino Island, the resort's private beach (totally worth it!!). My husband and I woke to a glorious sunrise every morning. On occassion a passing shower would leave a brilliant rainbow in its wake (something every hopless romantic should witness during their "second honeymoon"!) :-). As I said, the grounds were immaculate, except for these annoying crow-like birds that harass guests (particularly at the Las Brisas restaurant, the resorts buffet breakfast spot.) The staff try to keep the birds out but it is an open air restaurant so it is almost impossible to do so. Just eat indorrs if you can't deal with the wildlife. The food is EXTREMELY EXPENSIVE so be prepared to spend anywhere from $25 to $75 a day on food per person. I didn't like that we couldn't find a single decent caribbean-fare restaurant at the resort. It caters to the average American guest (burgers, fries, buffets, etc.) Las Cantinas Mexican restaurant was probably the best restaurant, with DELICIOUS burritos, a GORGEOUS view of the marina and ocean, and great margaritas. Moderately priced too. The beach was my only real big dissapointment. You have to take a ferry to the private island (Palomino Island) which was really nice. You get to see the views of the resort from the ocean and it is a very beautiful place. But we are beach bums and were hoping to enjoy smooth, white sand like you would find in the Bahamas and Jamaica (places we've been to before). The beach was very clean, well kept and they provide guests with towels and plenty of beach chairs, but it is extremely, extremely rocky. If you plan on swimming, bring water shoes (those sock things you can swim with. YOU WILL NEED THEM!) There are sharp rocks and coral in the water and it is very painful to cross barefoot. The water was very warm and very, very calm. Absolutely a dream. We even got to see a little, tiny tornado form in the clouds over the water one day! The staff wasn't worried about it since it was nowhere near touching land or sea, so we didn't worry. It was pretty cool to see it form. There are three main hotel pools, pretty but nothing much to do there. Drinks are pretty good (try the Puerto Rican Passion) but typical NY prices ($6 for beer, $8-10 for specialty drinks) They did offer happy hour, half-priced drinks at the pool from 2 to 3 pm everyday. This was a plus. The so called casino and club weren't anything special but something fun to pass the nights with while at the resort. Well, the casino anyway. The club sucked. (Very pretty, moroccan theme but very cheesy 70's and 80's music. If that's your thing, go knock yourself out. Otherwise skip the club.) As to other activities, rent a car. Don't bother with the tours. We rented a car for two days ($160) and went to Old San Juan (definitely a treat if you are a history and architecture buff like me) and to El Yunque National rainforest. Definitely worth it if you really want to see the island for what it is and not just the fantasy islsand resort. We found the staff at the hotel to be very helpful but the locals were even friendlier. Everyone is very willing to help if you "get lost while driving" :), and people will actually smile and say hi to you. (I'm from NY, this is a plus!) Overall, as I said, this was a dream vacation but pricey. I HIGHLY recommend it but just bring extra cash. Oh, if you are planning to bring home any liquor, don't buy Bacardi 151 proof rum; they won't let you board the plane with it since it is flammable. No one told us this until after we'd spent the $55 on it and were ready to come home with it. My husband ended up having to give it away. Go, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “hard to understand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: its hard for me to understand the complaints about the El Conquistador ive read here. The most accurate was simply to consider this a 4 star hotel instead of 5- that was well said.The service was great , the people were nice and the island beach is the best Ive seen- and ive lived in the caribean.Its so nice to know everyone at a beach is a guest at an exclusive hotel- I had no thought of theft and left stuff lying all over with abandon.Try that anywhere else. The facilities were aging - the salty air really eats at any concrete- but still nice-like the older hotels at Disney. One piece of warning - if you've never been to Puerto Rico before ( i hadn't)- the island looks horrible and downright third-world outside the resorts- quiet nerve racking on the drive from the airport. (I thought-"oh god- what have I done???")

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great service”
Reviews.Author: SGY_Hoboken
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. Do not be scared by other bad reviews, we just got back and had a great time. I am an extremely critical hotel guest, and they satisfied all of out requests. When checking in, ask for a room in the main hotel or the marina village. They are the best. Restaurants are very good, but expensive. Expect to pay $30 for steak or $28 for fish. Pricing at all restaurants equals that of NY, LA, or Wash, DC. The pools are great, facility is clean and new, the island takes 20 min to get to, but is great. Snag a good room rate and go! Look for a package that includes breakfast -- otherwise it will cost $25 a person per day for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: ive
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive after reading all the bad reviews on this hotel. We could not have been happier. We stayed here Aug 3-7th after having completed a 7 day Southern Caribbean cruise. While all our cruise mates were rushing to the airport for their flights, we were aboard the shuttle to El Conquistador. It is an impressive piece of property with breathtaking views of the ocean. We loved the private beach at Palomino Island and did not mind the funicular or boat ride. In fact it was very relaxing. We stayed at La Vista Wing with a view of the golf course, El Yunque and a beautiful sunset every evening. We do agree that the rooms are a bit dated, and that is why we gave it a 4 rating instead of a 5. I think they are working on updating the rooms as the first floor was being painted and refurbished. The walls are thin, but we only noticed that in the mornings. No mistakes were made on our bill as I checked daily on the tv hotel services menu. Many restaurants were superb and well worth the money. My favorite being Isabellas-the steak house, and my husband's favorite was Bloosoms (Japanese table cooking). We even rented a car for the day at the Avis counter in the hotel lobby and went to El Yunque Rain Forest. We had some lunch at El Luquillo Beach and do not recommend it (fried foods everywhere). It was total rest and relaxation, just as we had planned. We highly recommend this hotel as we hope to come back sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, wish I stayed longer !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: July 21-23 I stayed at the Conquistador. I have been to quite a few carribean islands and stayed at very nice resorts. This is a beautiful hotel and the service was very good. I asked to have my room changed to avoid taking the trolley (clausterphobic) and was complied with immediately. I was placed in a wonderful room with a view of the golf course. The food is expensive, but what resort do you know that has 'inexpensive' food? The pools are wonderful and very clean. My only complaint was how thin the walls were. You can here the entire conversation of the room next to you or the dialog of a tv program. It makes for difficult sleeping and since I intend to return I will either try to get a room that has an empty room on the connecting side or get earplugs. I did take offense to some of the descriptions of the island. Anyone who has traveled to the islands know that the Tourism is one of the main income providers so the resorts are wonderful but the living conditions of the residents is not equal. This is not an anomaly but the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After I paid for the trip I read some of the negative reviews about this hotel and switched to the Wyndham Condado in San Juan. After some thought, I decided to take a chance and switched back to the El Conquistador. What a blessing! Heaven on Earth! The visual impact is incredible. The grounds are kept immaculate and the staff is extremely friendly. For those who complained about the high priced food...If you can't run with the BIG DOGS, stay on the porch! I recommend the Stingray Cafe. We stayed in Las Olas and had an incredible view of the Caribbean and Palomino Island which is the hotel's private island. We rented a car and it was worth the added expense. If you've got the bankroll do it! Otherwise, borrow! You won't be disappointed! MichaelD. MichaelD.

Reviews.Title: “It's Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband is from Puerto Rico and I have visited practically the whole island. My sister-in-law during the time we went (1993)worked as an executive secretary for the Condado Hotels in PR. She was able to get us visitation to the El Conquistador Hotel for the day. I have never experienced such beauty! It is truely beautiful! The entrance to the hotel is up on a cliff, it overlooks the ocean and you see Palamino Island from a distance. It's an expensive hotel, but well worth the money. It's a massive hotel also with time shares. There is shopping on the grounds, restaurants, golf, several beautiful pools with waterfalls. You can take a boat to the Palamino Island for the day and do water activities (i.e. wave runners, water ski,games, island bars, nature walks, beach). Everything you do on the island is charged to your room, you do not need money. It was like paradise! It's a must see, you are also close to the rainforest, El Junque! Also, a must see!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great food, clean facilities, super pools an incredible island but their people are the best of all. They make you feel Welcome from the moment you arrived. We are definitely going back next year. Hopefully they will keep the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Customer service is outstanding, rooms are clean, pool is clean and has breathtaking views of the ocean, the isalnd is beautiful and calm, the location is not the best because is about 40 minutes from San Juan but it is definately a relaxing experience!!! Restaurants are expensive and the food is ok.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely beautiful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two daughters just returned from this beautiful paradise this past week. I have to say that after I booked the vacatios, I found this site and read some of the awful reviews. This really scared me. I'm not sure why these people thought that it wasn't worth it, but I have to say that I personally found it to be the most beautiful place we had ever been. We had a golf course view in the La Vista wing. It was absolutely breathtaking! The staff was so friendly and helpful. We always had plenty of towels and the room was very clean. We never had any problems with getting what we needed as others had said they had. Our refrigerator wasn't working and we called down to the front desk and a new one was brought up within an hour. Palomino Island is beautiful. Who cares about the ride over there, it is worth it to see the beautiful ocean, My kids enjoyed riding on the water taxi. You have to take the funicular to get down the lower half of the resort and to catch the water taxi, and sometimes there is a wait, but what's the hurry? I enjoyed meeting new people while waiting and just relaxing. After all, that's what a vacation is all about. The food is expensive, but it is no different than other resorts. We never even left the resort because they had everything there, shops and restaurants. There was not one place of the resort that was not beautifully landscaped. Listening to the coqui frogs at night was a beautiful treat. If you don't mind shelling out a few bucks for food, I highly recommend this resort. I felt it was well worth the money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: valemart
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed our stay for the most part. Palomino island was a knockout--everyday we went we felt we were in paradise. one side of the island breezy and delightful, the other warm and golden in the afternoon. yes the prices are very high but you can go into town and buy water, snacks and booze. frequent the local rest's to save money. staff was friendly if occassionally confused or slow. the radio didn't work but was fixed the next day. the views are breathtaking. I'd go back there is a noise problem in the rooms. you can slamming doors and conversations. the room was pretty however.

Reviews.Title: “No Carribean Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a tranquile carribean paradise - this is not it. This hotel has noise pollution galore. The boat which takes you to the beach (hotel has no direct access to a beach. You must take a twenty minute boat ride to an island which the hotel owns) never shuts down it's engines. So there is no relief from the diesel engine even when you go to the farthest ends of the beach. The beach is very windy and very shallow so getting into the water is no easy feat. Bring water shoes. The island itself is pretty shoddy with loads of tin roofed structures mucking up the landscape. Want to relac on a float or take a quick kayak ride? Unlike every other resort we've stayed at - here you have to pay. And it's expensive.The noise pollution continues throughout the hotel. At the pool, they were power washing decks three of the five days we were there. At the marina the boat waiting to return to the island keeps its engines running all day as well. The piano player outside the main restaurants sings with a microphone and is so loud and so terrible that it drove us from the restaurants down the hill to the mexican restaurant. No sanctuary there though because if you want a bottle of wine you're out of luck. Tequila and beer only!All in all the "El Concretador" is worth skipping altogether. It's exposed and windy, expensive for what it delivers and noisy. The only saving grace was the spa which was truly wonderful. Too bad you really needed because of all the stress caused by the resort itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, total rip-off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful. Our marina room was right on the water, large and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The prices have no relation to reality. You feel as tho you are ripped-off every minute. Small drinks are $8, a 10oz beer $6. Use of snorkling equipment costs $16. A five minute taxi ride to town is $30 RT. If you rent a car, they charge $10 per day for parking. NOTHING is free or reasonably priced. I have stayed all over the world and have never experienced this level of anxiety about prices. We have the money, but there was something about the outrageousness of the prices that kept us from wanting to pay them. There are lovely local restaurants that are so much better. Definitely stop at the market and stock up on drinks and snacks before you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I stayed at this hotel four years ago, so things may have improved.That said, I think this hotel has great potential...but they need to change some things. First of all, we arrived on time but had to wait over four hours for a room to be cleaned for us. They didn't offer us a temporary room until we had already been waiting for two hours. I saw a lot of families with small children trying to keep the kids from climbing the walls from boredom.On our second night we ordered pizza for dinner and ate it in bed while we were watching tv. I guess there were a few crumbs left behind because we woke up to red ant invasion. Our beds were covered with them! We were never warned that leaving food out might cause this so we kind of freaked out. We called room service and it took then quite awhile to get up to our room (we ended up "cleaing up" ourselves).This might not concern some people, but the towels all had tons of hair in them. I thought it was really gross and it was like that the entire time we were there.On the up-side, the hotel is gorgeous and the pool was really nice. If you're looking for a place that has TONS of activities, you should probably stay somewhere else. It was mainly all about relaxation.

HotelInfo.Name: El Conquistador Resort, A Waldorf Astoria Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1000 El Conquistador Avenue, Fajardo 00738, Puerto Rico
